title: Unique Architecture!
reviews: Vancouver continues to grow with the building of new architecture throughout the downtown core! Love the city even during these COVID times!

title: Natures beauty
reviews: Although I live in a suburb about 25 minutes to the city, as soon as I approach the downtown area of Vancouver I appreciate natures beauty. Separated by patches of water with a back drop of snow capped  mountains I admire the architecture of the tall towers that have added to the beauty of this city. The downtown core is easily accessible by walk or bicycles. Stanley Park, Beach Avenue, Gastown, Robson, Granville Island - oh, there is so much to do especially in the summer when it's warm and bright!¬¨

title: COVID Quiet!
reviews: Sad too see downtown shops & restaurants are so quiet during COVID times! Travelling along the main streets to see the local shops & along the waterfront not very busy. Hoping 2021 will turnaround for everyone!

title: Lively vibe and so safe
reviews: On this last trip we spent 6 days in Vancouver at 2 hotels...one on Burrard near Davie and the other on Burrard near Nicola.  We must have walked 20 Km at all hours of the day/night and enjoyed every minute of it.  Robson Street in particular was always lively.  Even some sections on Hastings at Main weren't ideal, but never felt unsafe.  Vancouver is such a walkable city.  We took advantage of the excellent Compass card when necessary, but really liked walking about.

title: So easy to stroll around!
reviews: Such an easy centre to wander around, be it the new or old parts of town, e.g. Gastown and everyone so friendly and welcoming everywhere!

title: Our Favourite City in Canada
reviews: Great way to explore Downtown Vancouver is to walk around Yaletown and the Westend. Lots of places to shop and eat around Granville, Howe and Seymour Streets. We stayed in the International Village, which was reasonable, safe (despite a few homeless near the Arena) and an easy walk to Gastown, Coal Harbour and False Creek, where you can catch a Ferry to Granville Island.  We actually visited in April 2019, and only had 2 days to explore this beautiful city so on Day 1 walked form Chinatown, to Gastown, Coal Harbour and Stanley Park and then back through the central Westend back to Chinatown. Day 2 we took in Yaletown, Granville Island and Downtown and good way to explore. If we had longer a visit to the Capilano Bridge and  Butchart Gardens would be on the cards....maybe next time, if we ever get back! Although a short visit this was definitely the most beautiful and our favourite city in Canada.

title: Quiet Times During COVID!
reviews: We went downtown and met family for a lunch on the waterfront. We were very surprised to see how quiet it was on all of the main tourist areas! Love the city but COVID has taken a toll on people getting out to see the site & sounds of Vancouver! Hopefully everyone will have a "Stay Vacation" and enjoy the city!

title: Great time
reviews: Had a great time , my nephew had so much fun exploring around , very child friendly and family oriented

title: Good
reviews: Downtown was quite active in the evening, which is quite happening place with nice food and busy streets. Shopping was quite expensive.

title: Nice city
reviews: A great city - lots to do and see, easy to navigate and felt safe at all times. Only downside it is not the most colourful of places

title: The street is not busy enough
reviews: It is Crowded if you drive a car in the daytime , but it is fine if you walk in the Street, at night it is not busy at all.

title: Vibrant
reviews: Vancouver downtown is not an unusually large area and one can easily walk to Stanley Park and the aquarium (along the seawall is very pleasant and scenic) or through Yaletown (lots of restaurants) to the small ferrys to Granville Island (a great market). Walking from the wonderful Art Gallery along Robson Street (shops and restaurants) all the way to Denman and up Denman (lots more restaurants) to English Bay would take a little more than an hour. But all these walks are worth it.

title: Walk, Eat, Drink, and be Merry
reviews: Downtown is a great place to walk!  You can also find several options for food, adult beverages, shopping, and entertainment.

title: Lots to do
reviews: Make sure to check if there is an ice hockey game on! Rent a bike and ride around Stanley Park. Visit the op shops. Eat at all the waterfront restaurants. Visit gas town but I‚Äôd stay away from Chinatown Hastings street at night if you are on your own as it can be a bit dangerous.

title: The heart of life
reviews: It's like all other big cities, crowd and full of life. You can find Brands for shopping. Many events and so many happenings are taking place here. Famous theatres are in downtown. The only weak part, like all the crowd parts of the cities, is parking spaces which are a bit difficult. Especially when you are in a rush.

title: An incredible city!
reviews: Vancouver as a whole is great! Get a hotel in downtown, and if the weather cooperates, you can walk to just about anything you want to see in the vicinity! We stayed near the stadium, visited Chinatown, the gayborhood (Davie Street), Yaletown, and the waterfront by the Ferries all on foot! The one downside we found with the downtown area is the widespread illicit drug use and the debris from it being strewn about. We saw countless syringes with needles attached on the sidewalks (huge safety hazard), crack pipes, and more. Main things: watch your step (and your back) and you‚Äôll have a great time!

title: Vancouver in February
reviews: If you are trying to get away from snow and cold, Vancouver is not a bad place to be. Unfortunately, the city's charm is declining rapidly as glass and steel condos replace old historical homes and buildings.Also, the transit system does not allow your dogs on board as regular passengers and cabs will often not take them so travel around the city is difficult if you want to take your best friends with you.Grocery stores downtown are also way over priced. You will work very hard trying to find a deal here. This is not a place to come shopping.Make plans to go to the woods and suspension bridges, go rafting or kayaking to get out of the concrete jungle and into the green.

title: Diverse And Dynamic
reviews: Full of energy, diversity, possibilities, and culture. Think about what you want to do and just do it. Eat what you like , where you like, and when you like. You are in charge of all the possibilities available in the Emerald City!

title: Exquisitely beautiful architecture.
reviews: The modern architecture is exquisitely beautiful. Especially the breathtakingly  beautiful crystalline skyscrapers which would not be out of place in a sci-fi movie.

title: Clean and neat
reviews: I an from the Seattle area, and let me say going to Seattle now is scary! Street people everywhere, panhandlers and drugs. So refreshing to visit Vancouver BC where for the whole 3 day weekend I never saw anything like that! How is it that Vancouver doesn't suffer from the same decay as Seattle just a few short miles away. It was nice to feel safe to walk down a street again!

title: A guided walk around downtown Vancouver by a local Vancouver Greeters.
reviews: We were blessed with a great tour guide from Vancouver Greeters.  He met us on our first morning in Vancouver and we walk for 4 hours in the wet gloomy morning around Vancouver Downtown, we did get a few brief glimpse of sunlight breaking through.  He gave a great overview of the downtown area.  He explained the history of the different landmark, the best continental biscuit on Davies Street and what makes Vancouver ticks.  We learnt so much in the 4 hours, we walk up Davies Street, all the way to Canada Place, saw the Steam Clock in Gastown, walk briefly through Chinatown and check out the shortest building there.  Walk through the free part of Dr Sun Yat Sen Garden and on to Olympic Park and False Creek.  We did stop for cheese cake and coffee at W. Hasting St.  Lunch was at Olympic park and we then took a ferry to Granville Island.  The ferry ride provides us a good view of downtown Vancouver from the creek.If you happened to visit Vancouver, I suggest contacting Vancouver Greeters and they will put you in touch with one of the volunteer guides and it is so much better to see Vancouver with the help of a local.

title: Trip to Vancouver
reviews: Stay: This was my first time visiting Vancouver. I stayed at an AirBnb at Strathcona. This was my first time staying at an Airbnb. The house I stayed in was a heritage property. It was a unique experience. Nice and clean house. I chose this property looking at the reviews which were mostly 4+.However I think that I should have done some more research. The house had its own charm but as it was more than 100 years old, it had a different vibes and I found the interior dark and a bit smelly as it is a really old property. After travelling and experiencing various places in Vancouver downtown, I think pacific boulevard, west end, area close to Stanley park are better localities to stay. Commuting: Commuting within Vancouver is very easy and accessible. There‚Äôs a sky train and buses with a good connectivity. I flew in from Toronto to Vancouver. Took a sky train from the airport to go to downtown. Compass cards are available at the airport. It is like a ‚ÄúPresto‚Äù card in Toronto. One can load the card and use it with all kinds of transit within Vancouver. While staying at Strathcona, I discovered that East of Hastings is an area to avoid. You‚Äôll see many homeless people on this street, drugs and other things. I was told to avoid this street. Best way to discover any place is to walk around. I discovered so many places by just walking around in downtown. I feel more connected to a place by walking around. Uber service is not as good as toronto. However they do have a local taxis available.GASTOWN and YALETOWN: These two areas are very vibrant and lively. It‚Äôs the place to be for youngsters. Lot of restaurants and shopping. SHOPPING: There‚Äôs a shopping mall in downtown, CF PACIFIC CENTER. Good place to hangout if it‚Äôs raining in VancouverüòäThere‚Äôs another mall at Burnaby which is bigger than Pacific Center I think. Mc Arthur, great luxury outlet mall at Templeton, close to YVR airport. If you are looking to spend some time before your flight, this would be a great option.Food: Lot of food options, google for your choice!

title: City a pleasure to do business in
reviews: With Vancouver being such a walkable city it‚Äôs always a pleasure to conduct business downtown. Safe and easy to get around. It is however expensive when it comes to accommodations. Hate the rainy springs but love that I never have to pack an umbrella as city hotels always have you covered.

title: A bit of everything
reviews: Walk and explore. The Nordstroms is very nice.Many chain stores and a few independent stores as well.Friendly! Easy to walk

title: A walkable city
reviews: Whether you find yourself in Coal Harbour, Gastown, Granville Island, Yaletown, or (my favourite) neighbourhood the West End, you will find that there is much to see and do simply by walking around. Vancouver is a very walkable city but naturally there are other transportation options available. Unless you have the American dollar's 30% advantage be forewarned that fall, winter, and spring are the seasons to visit as accommodation prices skyrocket in summer.

title: Active, safe, and many livable aspects
reviews: The downtown is not just for businesses but for living. Vancouver is ready to support both. Restaurants, laundromats, stores, pharmacies, parks, and more. Love it.

title: Great vibrant atmosphere
reviews: Definitely recommend to take a walking tour around downtown Vancouver to grasp the young and most vibrant city in the world. Full of world‚Äôs best museums and art galleries, authentic Canadian shops and local fresh seafood restaurants as well as international cuisine offering world class dining experience. While in Vancouver, you must try BC local wine which is definitely a world class wine and craft beer from local breweries. Downtown Vancouver is especially beautiful at nighttime with pubs, bars and restaurants being crowded, and plenty of concert ms and other cultural venues to go to.

title: Vancouver was amazing!
reviews: We loved the beautiful views! So much wonderful time to enjoy and have fun! The stores are gorgeous! Definitely worth the trip! The trip was fun, fun, fun! Really great, even the guys enjoyed it! Our family loved it.

title: Nice walkable downtown
reviews: The simple grid pattern, mix of stores and overhangs to protect from the rain and modern buildings make for a vibrant downtown which is easy to get around.

title: Great area
reviews: We have visited here lots of times and love wandering around. Loads of stores and not just the branded ones, lovely little diverse boutiques, coffee shops, restaurants etc. Always find something new to look at.

title: Not as nice as it should be
reviews: Downtown is unofficially divided up into divisions. Along the seawall the view is spectacular and the areas are clean and inviting. Alberni and Robson streets are the high end shopping areas with a plethora of good restaurants. Unfortunately, the city has let Granville deteriorate dramatically in the last few years. Homeless are everywhere, the garbage seems to never be picked up. Further north, where cruise ships dock is Gastown, an interesting mix of independent shops and tourist traps. But it has interesting architecture and a good vibe. But when it ends, about 5 blocks east of the pier, the worst area of Canada appears. Although only a few blocks big, it is the center of drugs,  addiction, homelessness and despair. However, I have walked in that area many times and never been accosted or threatened. A lot of the people are in desperate straits but they are not criminals. Just be aware.

title: Good potential let down by bad management.
reviews: One of Vancouver‚Äôs main streets...supposedly a pedestrian friendly entertainment district and ‚Äúgrand avenue‚Äù.  Not so much because the City apparently doesn‚Äôt care.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: We were a little disappointed as we thought there would be more to see and do in Vancouver and the weather prevented us from doing much as it rained for 4 out of 5 days.There is a great shopping district with the Pacific Centre, Nordstrom‚Äôs and Holt Renfrew which are all connected.I think 2 to 3 days is enough to see Vancouver definitely.

title: Concrete Jungle Core Of An Otherwise Beautiful City.
reviews: Looking at a map, you will find that Vancouver Downtown is the lower portion of a peninsula (the thumb) of the main city of Vancouver (the fist), which sticks out into the Burrard Inlet. The neighborhood is bounded by the Burrard Inlet to the north, Stanley Park and West End to the west, False Creek to the south and Downtown Eastend to the east.It has the main business district of Vancouver as well as many high end residential buildings and hotels. As we walked the streets we saw a number of shops, restaurants, pubs, private offices, travel agencies and government offices, theaters and art galleries. In general the streets were clean and broad but there were a few places which were not so pleasant to walk along as there were some down at heel people and addicts to be seen. There were some parks and green spaces to relieve the monotony of the high-rises. A walk along the Waterfront Road was quite fascinating as we got to see the many activities in the harbor, near Canada Place, with the ships and boats moving in and out and a number of seaplanes taking off and landing.The main transit hub of Vancouver Downtown, the Waterfront Station, is where you can find connections to most parts of the city. There are two metro lines, The Canada Line and the Expo Line, the West Coast Express Railway, and the SeaBus passenger ferry which crosses the inlet to get you to North Vancouver.The road traffic especially during office hours can be quite slow moving, so we used the cheaper and efficient bus transit system instead of hiring expensive cabs. We enjoyed exploring the city, which is known to be one of the most beautiful cities in the world for a tourist.

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city, sorrund with mountains and the Pacific Ocean. I was there in November, the best time of the year! Fall is awesome! Just to see the leaves with different colors is wonderful! Stanley Park, Capilanno Bridge, Canada Place and Granville Island are worth a visit, don't miss it! Lost of coffee shops and restaurants! I stay at Ramada Express on Pencer street, very cheap and the staff is friendly and breakfast is free!

title: Vancouver 2019
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is fantastic, lots of very good restaurants and pubs, from downtown you can walk easily to Stanley park or Canada place where the cruise liners dock, gastown also within 15 min walk.

title: BEAUTIFUL VANCOUVER
reviews: It has been such a long time since I took long flights. The last long flight I took was to USA in 2012. This trip is a 16 hour long flight but the seats were real comfortable and nice. The meals were much more delicious too. Not knowing what to expect of Vancouver or of my staying with a muslim sister and her family but it turned out to be the BEST holiday I ever had. Vancouver is really a lovely country, nice people, clean surroundings and peaceful. My hosts were super fantastic, kind and a happy family including their beautiful cat - Kitty ‚ù§ See me hugging the tree. The trees are so healthy - no ants, no bugs etc. So clean and so soft like fine wood! ü§≠Visited 'Flyover Canada'Speechless Fantastic4D virtual flyingI really felt like a seagull - freely flying in the air Beautiful experience!Visited Capalino Suspension bridgeExcitingThrillingLots of walkingNature & Forest trackingI really have not done it for a long long timeFelt so rejuvenated after a long walk breathing so much fresh airPlus I must mentioned again my beautiful host - Sis Sadia for her kindness and generous hospitality. Always asking me what would I like to eat for breakfast, lunch and dinner because she is such a GREAT cook! I felt so touched in my heart ‚ù§Wishing Sis Sadia & her family the best of everything which is good. Amin amin ü§≤

title: So safe and clean.
reviews: Vancouver is an exciting city, well laid out, and full of exciting places to see and fun things to do. Lots of great eating establishments and great food and drinks. Walking is easy, folks are very nice and weather was fine while we were there. Great place for the holidays.

title: 2 days in Vancouver
reviews: Laid back city - few high rises and lots of interesting places to see from markets to river gorge‚Äôs at Campanillo.Easy to get around either on the hop on hop off bus or the underground. Stanley Park was particularly nice with a marina, totem poles, and a horse drawn ride around the park.

title: Christmas in Vancouver
reviews: Weather was fantastic, lots to do from Hockey games, football, casinos , shopping, ocean views , jogging, skiing

title: Boxing Day visit
reviews: We love visiting VANCOUVER, pacific center is a very nice shopping mall. Granville and Robson are full of interesting shops. There are many excellent culinary experiences to be had with a little research. Gas town has my favourite shoe shop. (John Fluvog) and a couple spectacular French restaurants. There are views of the north shore mountains and the ocean to be had. Furthermore, Vancouver has a large residential population downtown so there are usually people around and businesses open unlike many other  North American cities. The beaches are worth visiting in the summer. The sea wall is great to stroll or cycle on.

title: Relatively clean
reviews: We stayed at the wonderful Wedgewood Hotel in downtown Vancouver on our recent stay. We did a fair amount of walking in the immediate vicinity of the hotel.  Aside from frequent urine smells, the area we were in seemed to be somewhat cleaner and safer than what we experience in downtown Seattle for instance.

title: Avoid downtown Vancouver at all costs.
reviews: Avoid downtown Vancouver at all costs. Way too crowded and traffic snarls for no apparent reason. There are so many things to see in this beautiful city but NEVER Drive a car here ever. Public transportation MAY make it doable. But we have no experience with that so it may be a slow slow drag too! Traffic jams are world class and absolutely ruin any fun unless you have made zero plans that are time sensitive. The many people we have met are charming and helpful. But avoid downtown and any crowded nearby area. Take a bus or boat tour- not a ‚Äúcar friendly‚Äù city in any way whatsoever.

title: Walking Through the Raincouver City
reviews: This is their winter, raining every single day as in. But I still love walking around the city because you won‚Äôt get lost at all. So many shopping area and lots of food joint to dine of so many different cuisines from all migrants who chose this place their home. Nightlife is awesome as well

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: Beautiful city to visit on Christmas, we went to The Christmas Market, wonderful restaurants and an awesome Experience at Flying Over Canada.

title: First Trip to Vancouver
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is very clean and lots of places to eat. Lots of great shops to browse through as well as art/sculptures placed throughout. Lots of great opportunities for pictures.

title: Amazing architecture
reviews: For the photo enthusiasts this city is amazing.  So many opportunities for reflection photos in the glass walled office buildings.  Great angles for photos.  Easy walking around the downtown area.

title: A beautiful city
reviews: Any time I have gone to Vancouver, I have always been struck by its beauty. It is definitely one of the nicest cities in North America.

title: Best Place to Stay in Vancouver
reviews: If you are staying in town for a couple of days, stay downtown. You are within walking distance of GasTown,  the olympic cauldron, waterfront and easy access to Granville Island, Stanley Park and the subway...

title: Blown away with the logos, tall buildings and hum of activity!
reviews: Being in Vancouver before holiday season was perfectly seasonal.  Many walks of life are in downtown.  Explore every nook and cranny, walk in the shops, discover the foods and embrace all there is to do!  Loved it!

title: Great City but with the usual problem areas
reviews: We spent a few days in Vancouver at the end of a 3 week road trip and it was a complete contrast to the The Rockies and neighbouring Vancouver Island.Vancouver is a well planned, attractive very tourist orientated city with plenty to see and do.However, like most cities it also has it's"other side" and you only have to walk a block away from Gas town to see homeless beggars and people openly taking drugs.There was also the ever present smell of Cannabis (which is legal ).Not sure we would have walked around this area at night but nowhere in the city felt unsafe during the day.We returned our hire car as soon as we arrived in Vancouver which was definitely the right thing to do as everywhere is easily walkable.The only transport we needed to use was the small ferry to Granville island.

title: A normal concrete jungle.
reviews: Vancouver is fairly big city and Downtown is its core. The same tall buildings as of any mportant big city. It has a bustling shopping district, various eateries having menus from all over the world. Art galleries, boutiques are a plenty. Malls, shops, hotels. Nearby are Burrard Islet, False Creek and Stanley  Park. It's a vibrant place and it's easy to reach the place by bus, Skytrain, taxi or a car. Need about 2 hours to see downtown but don't have to. Having said that, Vancouver is one of best cities to live in, according to some sources.

title: expensive city
reviews: Great shopping but there are alot of very expensive stores around  which I cannot afford. Almost too many! Dont know how they survive but I guess their are people with loads of money. The real estate is too high . There is a social crisis going on. Pure income inequality right in your face. There seems to be no middle class you are either rich or poor [ i could be wrong but this it what it looks like as an outsider]

title: Easy walkable centre
reviews: Very pleasant and easily walkable area . Felt quite safe around here in most areas. Chinatown seemed a little run down and probably wouldn't go there at night unless in a large group . However, I liked the city very much ...especially Gastown and Granville Island.

title: Walking from English Bay Beach to the Vancouver Convention Centre West
reviews: so we took the bus downtown from our home in Dunbar with the intention to stroll from English Bay Beach area to the Burrard Inlet area which we knew provided many interesting experiences and perspectives.. we began our journey down Denman Street to Cardero Park , then along Coal Harbour Seawall, then proceeding to Harbour Green Park, which has several restaurants and shops along the pathway, and the view of the many marine activities and the view of the North Shore Mountains,before reaching the convention centre where the Vancouver Christmas Market was setting up and the many people going to restaurants, sightseeing the many shops along Burrard Street area and then wandering along Robson Street which we always particularly appreciate for the wide variety of stores..then on the way back to Beach Avenue we walked along Lost Lagoon at the beginning of that section of Stanley Park... many, many steps and we rested frequently as there was always much to experience and view...

title: Beautiful City!
reviews: The city of Vancouver is truly like no other! Hours can be spent in the many trendy neighborhoods, Stanley Park, the beach area and many more iconic areas! There are tons of water views and wonderful buildings! If you haven‚Äôt been, you are in for a real treat!

title: Alot to see
reviews: Glad my hotel was in the area. So much to see and do it's overwhelming in a good way. I walked most if my trip and within 30 minutes are a ton of shops, restaurants, and things to do.

title: Great city if you enjoy the outdoors and good food!
reviews: We enjoyed our two-day visit to Downtown Vancouver prior to leaving on a cruise.  We loved biking along the water, walking to various parts of the city and enjoying great food.  The only down side was the two times we visibly saw people shooting up drugs (via needles) while walking in Gas Town in the broad daylight.

title: charming
reviews: Vancouver Glass Town is charming, lot of shops, from fancy stores ro the typical junki for tourist. A nice street to see the clock and have a nice coffe.

title: I live downtown
reviews: Vancouver used to be a clean friendly city.  With all these SRO's and shelters from Georgia to Drake all you see now is garbage, people camped on in, used needles and panhandlers.  On the corner of Howe and Davie there is a late night transit stop which used to have a garbage can.  For some reason the city removed the garbage can and refuses to bring on back.  Numerous requests were made to the city and ignored.

title: Davie St hotel, right in the thick of the West End
reviews: I have only been here 3 days and I am in love with this downtown area. There are so many unique restaurants coffee shops and bakeries that it is difficult to decide where and what to eat.Lucky for me I am on a 3 month work contract so I get to enjoy this without having to spend too much of my own money as it is quite pricey here. Vancouver is an incredible city, A must see....bucket list for sure!

title: Downtown Vancouver is vibrant and lovely to wald around!
reviews: I love going downtown Vancouver to explore and find beautiful quaint boutiques and little restaurants to have a bite!

title: A great place to visit
reviews: Stayed here for 4 days We stayed in the Four Seasons right in the heart of the ciity. Amazing city, amazing shopping, transport excellent and the people very friendly and helpful

title: Great Walking City
reviews: I enjoyed explored vibrant Vancouver by foot as a wealth of restaurants, shops, and green areas cry out for exploring. Even the bridges have pedestrian crosswalks and the high speed drivers in rush hour did yield to me.  Although there were homeless about, especially on streets with bus lines, they generally weren't agressive. Even on a rainy afternoon, I was able to make my way around due to good signage. And, of course, the vastnessof Stanley Park awaits exploration by walkers, runners and tourists. I would definitely repeat staying at a downtown hotel and taking the SkyTrain from the airport.

title: Great city to walk around
reviews: In the main we thoroughly enjoyed our time walking around the city. There is a huge selection of shops, restaurants and things to do. We spent much of our time walking and managed to see most areas. One problem was trying to drive anywhere. The city seems to be in continual gridlock which made getting to attractions slightly further afield impossible. There is also a lot of homeless people dotted around, although we never felt threatened, they were always respectful. We had no concerns walking around, even at night. There were huge homeless encampments in the east of the city which we would not be so keen to venture around.

title: Great walking city with much to see and do.
reviews: Party of four and we all enjoyed our stay. I would highly recommend you take a tour bus of the city first and experience the different areas. Many places to walk and eat. I would warn others of staying away from China town which was very run down and full of beggars and homeless. Other than that area we found the city clean and safe.

title: Relaxed pedestrians in a safe, walkable and terrific city
reviews: We took the SkyTrain into downtown Vancouver from our hotel in Richmond. Loved the SkyTrain and loved Vancouver. The business section off Granville was not busy, very clean and provided super shopping. We wandered down to the harbour for a wonderful view of the city, while noting the timely architecture in Canada Place. Then came lunch in the St. Regis, one of the city's most venerated restaurants. A visit to the Cathedral proved interesting, since much of the interior was wooden. There seemed to be a powerful respect for pedestrians every where, while the pedestrians had a similar respect for traffic lights, with almost no crossing against lights, so common in other large cities. Vancouverites seemed laid-back, friendly and relaxed. Sidewalks were wide and made the downtown feel quite walkable, the mountains nearby providing stunning backdrops. A most impressive city.

title: Easy to walk around
reviews: We walked around in downtown quite a bit and ate at several restaurants in downtown.   You feel very safe although there is some homeless.  You might not want to walk around a night much.

title: Big City
reviews: We were in Vancouver during rainy weather with one cruise ship in town, so it was a little crowed in the tourist areas. We found the downtown area easy to walk around but found the "Jump On and Jump Off" bus not up to expectations as compared to other similar services in other towns.  Due to the cruise ship passengers the buses were crowded and schedule was unreliable as buses were on one hour spaces and if the bus was full you were passed up. Other complaint is it was raining and the roof leaked on the passengers. New equipment would help this service as it rains in Van couver a lot. Better to visit this city in the spring, summer and very early fall to enjoy the temperate weather.

title: Vancouver is a Dump
reviews: Visited Vancouver for the first time over the weekend. What a dump. What a let-down. Do an internet search for Vancouver and you'll notice a ton of pics of the overexposed downtown, Whistler and the gondolas there, and the snow-capped peaks. That's the hook - to get you to associate the two. If you're expecting the Canadian version of Seattle, that is, a cool, hip, vibrant, bustling, cultural, clean city nestled between the water and the mountains, you're wrong. The city has a typically Canadian metropolitan 1970's Soviet Bloc feel with it's graffiti-covered, soulless, uninspired, grey, concrete buildings. Even the public library building, which was apparently modeled after the Colosseum ruins in Rome, comes across as an anxiety-inducing MC Escher-esque claustrophobic, interminable nightmare. There are pot-smoking hippies and homeless everywhere. In many ways it's a typical Canadian metropolitan area - like Montreal. But Montreal has an amazing history and a ton of cultural outlets to keep you engaged. In Vancouver, you can piss on a statue of gassy Jack.

title: All the Shops you will ever need!
reviews: From Hudson Bay to Nostrom, every conceivable item can be purchased for your enjoyment and pleasure (yes there is even a Victoria Secrets.)Loads of places to eat, have coffee or just chill out. Even better if you get excellent weather.5*

title: The Base in Vancouver.
reviews: Everyone is soo friendly and helpful here and everything is on your doorstep. Shopping for a Canadian Sym card (4 retailers within a block) and warm base layers for the Rockies to follow and a choice of great restaurants and eateries are all there and easy to find.

title: Excitingis a literel Downtown
reviews: My wife and I spent a lot of time Downtown visiting many interesting places. Many gorgeous shops and the big Pacific Centre Mall. Another day we spent walking along Water Street through Gas Town with lots of original buildings housing gift shops and many restaurants.Many tours leave from the Waterfront and there is also the beautiful Fly Canada which gives you the impression you are flying over all different places in Canada     This is at the far end of the Convention Centre.There are so many different places to go and see that there are to many to mention here, enjoy finding them for yourself. !!

title: lovely downtown
reviews: stayed 3 days in the heart of vancouver. my daily walk within the downtown helped me familiarized the streets. one of the street was crowded with tourists using ‚Äúbus tours‚Äù, onother street is crowded with students during school days and few streets are a bit quite especially office hours. what i like the most, pub/bars, restos & cafe‚Äôs are everywhere. lovely view if you walk through canada place side going to stanley park. overall, happy tourist here and hope to visit this place again.

title: beautiful city
reviews: Vancouver is a Beautiful city in BC quiet,nice people Stanley park is a must visit Burard Inlet,Lions gate bridge,metro town are the attractions of the city..

title: Impressive
reviews: Downtown is a real mixture of gleaming towers and old style buildings from a bygone age with significant detailing and history. Wide pavements to stroll along.

title: Neat, clean & nice
reviews: Vancouver is quite inviting to live in.  On top of being neat, clean and nice, people are helpful and friendly.üòäAlmost everything is within walking distance, in particular, all the landmarks in the pictures uploaded and BC Place Stadium which I had not photographed.  Use of public transportation is convenient.  Parking is comparable to New York rates but inexpensive compared to Portland, Oregon.Food is more expensive in Vancouver than in New York City.What is geographically ideal is that water views are all around and the mountains are within short distance.  With Canada Line, there is no need for a cab from the Airport to the city center.

title: Downtown
reviews: We stood in downtown and found it to be very pleasant. There was a variety of food options and nightlife within walking distance. Also the downtown area seemed clean and safe.

title: Best City!
reviews: Great city for everyone no matter what you would like to see or do! We travel into town on Skytrain which solves any issues with traffic. Shopping & dining or just site seeing it's a "world class" city! Come & enjoy!

title: Beautiful city
reviews: I have been to Vancouver several times yet with each visit I realize there is still a lot I haven't yet seen. This is a beautiful city for walking, mostly nice and flat. Streets are laid out in such a way that it is easy to find your way around. Don't miss Stanley Park, Gastown, Granville Island, to name just a few highlights. So many nice restaurants! People here are friendly and helpful. Can't wait to come back.

title: Hi-Rise Buildings and More
reviews: Although Vancouver‚Äôs downtown is a dense, vertical city, I never felt overwhelmed with crowds of any sort. It was quite easy to walk around and virtually every street and building is clearly marked, making exploring a pleasure. Many of the downtown buildings are modern - lots of glass, steel and concrete rising hundreds of feet towards the sky - and more on the way! On the edges of the business areas of downtown are some older and more charming neighborhoods such as Gastown, Yaletown and Chinatown. Walking is the best way to explore the area, however if walking long distances is an issue, there are plenty of excellent public transport options to take you between neighborhoods.

title: Reminds me of greenbelt mall Philippines
reviews: Walking around in the city of Vancouver reminds back home when I'm still working in greenbelt mall many years agoRelaxing place to walk aroundAnd a perfect place to find all the things you need.It's a truly place where u can enjoy the city with a sea side view with a beautiful weather always.....

title: We loved Vancouver
reviews: This was our first visit to Vancouver. We stayed downtown . We loved it and can't wait to go back someday to visit what we did not have time for. We loved traveling via the two day Hop On Hop Off bus. It seems no matter which downtown hotel you stay at, there are restaurants within easily walkable routes. Great place to visit.

title: beautiful downtown, with so many homeless people
reviews: nice modern green down town ,  beautiful buildings and stores. so many restaurants. very good bus service.  the terrible and sad problem are the homeless people that are sitting in every corner and there are streets that is impossible to walk  because they are lying all over and got very dirty.  you feel not sure.

title: Mr
reviews: Such a variety of retail outlets on their own like The Bay with 6 floirs of merchandise for home or clothing plus all the retail outlets in an enclosed mall ...such a variety ...plus counters in mall for items suxh as cekks phones etc ...easy to spend an afternoon shopping and looking around and stopping for a quick bite to eat ...worth at least one stop ...enjoy

title: Nice city but..
reviews: The homeless problem is not great. The downtown area does not feel so clean and there are a lot of empty buildings. Feels a bit depressed.

title: Heart of the Vancouver
reviews: Everything happens here! There are everything that you need there. Downtown has architecture, restaurants,  stores, night clubs,  bar. Many things to do !!!

title: Clean, Busy Typical for most
reviews: The downtown area is clean and easy to get around.  It is very much like other metro markets.  There are many things to do which are typical of a nice downtown area.

title: Lots to do
reviews: From museums to shopping to just people watching. Downtown has the high end stores as well as its gritty streets. Great place to stay as downtown is central to many places in walking distance.

title: Tourists should have no trouble finding something of interest.
reviews: Whether you like ocean views, mountain views, hiking Stanley Park, or enjoying the mixture of new/old architecture, there is something here for you. Suggest you start at the tourist bureau, so you can get some ideas on how to focus on your interests. If in doubt, ask a local. I've heard it said Vancouver is not New York or San Francisco. I agree, it is MUCH safer and friendlier.

title: Could be anywhere
reviews: Downtown has some interesting areas such as Gastown but generally the level of homelessness and drug taking is a great distraction for what is a great city.q

title: Well developed township
reviews: Downton suitably developed with horizontal and vertical formed roads ... Good for visitors with well planned network

title: Touristy, but with Hidden Gems
reviews: Cool skyline, lots of typical downtown spots like clubs and touristy restaurants/bars, but there are a lot of hidden gems like Cartems Donuts. I'd also recommend Malone's if you want a good happy hour beer and a spot to chill. In general, Downtown is fun, and very convenient to stay in when you visit.

title: Interesting
reviews: Walked in downtown to appreciate the buildings and then surprisingly saw the sculpture Space Venus. Up to the Vancouver Lookout at night to see the city and enjoyed the night view of downtown from Cruise Ship Terminal, I prefer the latter.

title: There is a lost of ongoing development
reviews: We stayed in Downtown for four days at the start of our tour of British Columbia. There is lot of development work that is ongoing but I guess that is the same in most large cities.There is a range of hotels and restaurants to meet all budgets.  As a tourist you should be prepared that prices do not include taxes and if you are in a restaurant or similar you should expect to pay anything between 15% and 25% service charge.  Unfortunately, the service is generally mediocre (unless you are very lucky) but I felt an obligation to pay as it is the custom in Canada.  I felt Vancouver is expensive anyway (partly due to the poor pound exchange rate).There are enough things to do in and around Vancouver and the shops are the same as in any major city.  Downtown is well located for all the main tourist activities.  You have to be prepared to live with the very large homeless situation but Downtown is a good base for a few days in Vancouver.

title: Nothing special to see
reviews: Vancouver is cool, the landscape is wonderful and the people is so friendly. True! But Vancouver downtown is just a modern North American city, which doesn‚Äôt really have something special to show... skyscrapers and stores. You are neither in New York nor in San Francisco.

title: Nice city
reviews: We found locals to be friendly and helpful.Actually a comfortable city to get around with easy access to public transportation.Very nice to walk along the waterfront. See the cruise ships.Stanley Park is nearby.Lots of restaurants and shops.

title: Robson Street shopping
reviews: We criss-crossed downtown multiple times as we walked around the city. Lots of great neighborhoods but Robson Street shopping was a particular treat with its high end shops, Nordstrom and people watching. It‚Äôs easy to get around and safe (some homeless on corners and in doorways).

title: Polite and fit people--great Asian influence. Foodie town.
reviews: My first time in this city and it rained non-stop.  Nevertheless, I had fun.  People are chilled out, into food and cocktails and the outdoors.  Big thumbs up!

title: Great city
reviews: What is there not to like about the city. Amazing water frontage, stunning buildings, great restaurants and a lovely atmosphere. A treat to the senses.

title: Amazing city
reviews: Lots of interesting locations and impressions in walking distance; nice shops, excellent restaurants and fantastic bars

title: A very special place to visit
reviews: Wondeful place near the ocean. Buildings are most of them homes and not so many offices in this area. The colour of the buildings is the same with the colour of the ocean...amaizing...

title: A happy visit
reviews: Downtown Vancouver, is a pleasant, busy and generally interesting place to visit. Big enough and cosmopolitan enough to have a bit of everything to see, eat, drink, but small enough to get around easily and have its its own special character.

title: Great area - so much to see and do
reviews: Unfortunately we only had two days in Vancouver but fortunately we were staying in the Downtown area. I really enjoyed walking round the city centre streets and soaking up the vibrancy of the area.If you are tight on time I would recommend you do a Hop On Hop Off bus tour - but do get the right one! Our hotel concierge recommended that operated by Landsea Tours and this takes you to some of the main inner Vancouver attractions such as Stanley Park and Gastown - well worth doing.Also walk down to the waterfront - loads of eateries and bars and great views looking across the water - take your camera with you. If you have a deep pocket you can do  a water plane flight covering the immediate area.

title: I felt safe downtown
reviews: Walking anywhere from Gastown, Canada Place and along the waterfront to Stanley Park I felt safe. There were some homeless people near Gastown but seemed harmless. There were artists singing on the sidewalks. Even when traveling with suitcases we did not encounter any issues.

title: Clean, Green. and Safe...Great city.
reviews: My first trip to V-town...and it was great! Clean, well organized and safe are it's main features. They have there homeless like all cities, but they manage them well and you only see them in a small area of the city. Good transportation system and the HOHO bus does a great job of familiarizing you with the city. Many good restaurants and hotels, lots of native Indian art available, great waterfront area, and warm friendly people. You will want to move there after your first visit (and prior to finding out about the real estate costs which are out of sight). If your a city person....do not miss it.

title: Vancouver is great
reviews: Vancouver is a very cosmopolitan city. Great blend of parks, tours, and restaurants.  Enjoy a harbor tour or bus tour of the cityOnce you get an overview, pick your ethnis area for choice of great food.

title: A Lovely City
reviews: Vancouver is a friendly welcoming city, very clean, close to The wildness and wildlife, but with the best top market shopping opportunities.Our favourite City in Canada (OK perhaps the world).

title: loved Vancouver its like a little Melbourne
reviews: Vancouver is easy to get around  It has many beautiful parks Stanley is a must to see . Granville island also a must  Gastown so cute lovely coffee bars . we stayed 3 days and really enjoyed this wonderful city felt very safe as well . it has an excellent sky train from a great airport that is easy to get around. I would highly recommend a trip to Vancouver and a ferry crossing over to Victoria on Vancouver island

title: Typical major city
reviews: Lanes are a little narrow and buses and trucks can't stay completely in one lane.  Beautiful buildings, both old and new, downtown definitely caters to walking crowds.

title: Overnight stay
reviews: Only had a short time to walk around before boarding a cruise ship. Not enough for a fuller assessment

title: Visit to Vancouver Downtown
reviews: We took the bus and underground train to downtown, got off not far from the Port or Vancouver were there was two liners getting ready for a trip , walk and found the steam clock working very interesting to see it blow on the hour , very poplar area down there the real old prt of town

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Close to the water front and very clean and beautiful city. Lots of nice restaurants and shops. Don‚Äôt forget to see steam clock.

title: Good for shopping
reviews: In Vancouver city there are several shopping centra with a wide variety of shops and hence plenty of choice. I also recommend to walk to the waterfront to see the seaplanes landing and taking off.

title: Easy to get around
reviews: We stay at the Rosedale on Ronson.  Walked all around downtown Vancouver.  Heaps of shops cafe and restaurants.

title: Good Place
reviews: Almost the same as Seattle with a look-alike space needle. Nice shops and eating places. Good public transport.

title: Downtown nice except for constant drumming of striking hotel workers
reviews: We stayed at Four Seasons three times on our Rocky Mountaineer train trip and the last two times we were bothered by incessant drums of striking hotel workers. They ruuned the srea we walked in with their constant drumming.

title: Quick Visit
reviews: Only had 24hrs in Vancouver for this Visit..we have stayed in Vancouver quite a few times in the past, and have done all the touristy stuff before... But this time we just walked around the business district, around the waterfront, Canada place, and a quick trip to a couple stores on Robson st.... What I noticed on this visit was all the nice little sitting areas and sculptures in artwork in the business district... The cleanliness of this part of city was refreshing..

title: Shopping
reviews: If you like shopping or simply looking around with even expensive designers shops go and walk. Several restaurants. You won't go hungry.

title: Okay place to visit
reviews: We came here via cruise ship so went exploring. We accidentally stumbled into the worst neighbourhood we have seen since travelling. We were aiming for Gastown but right next door you don't feel safe. I felt the city overall was let down by downtown. We didn't want to stay for the days we had booked here. However going out of city to the bridge park, stanley park and grouse mountain made it worth while. If visiting I recommend staying out of main city.

title: Local feel
reviews: Downtown Vancouver doesnt feel like a city, more a town. Not the usual crowds of people I'd expect, friendly and calm atmosphere.

title: Nice city ...but
reviews: Walking around "downtown" Vancouver, which is not bad, but the smell of cannabis smoke hits you almost everywhere.  Also there are lots of junkies on the street. Some will intimidate you.In one instance, we had to stay in a shop to avoid them who were waiting to see when we leave the shop. It's a shame to encounter such unpleasant experience.

title: Beautiful & Clean Walkable City
reviews: We truly enjoyed our visit of downtown Vancouver.  It is a beautiful and clean city that is very walkable.  We easily walked from the Coal Harbour area around downtown to Canada Place, Gastown, and Chinatown.  There is a variety of styles of buildings.  A true architectural delight.

title: City streets to wander and be amazed
reviews: Vancouver is not like other major cities in that A) cars do not have priority, B) people are usually very friendly and will to help tourists get to where they want to be, C) there may be large numbers of people on the streets but they're generally polite and don't push & shove, D) there is a mix of skyscraper and low-rise buildings, making the streets more interesting and finally, E) wide walkways.

title: A lot of High Rises
reviews: It is such a walk able city. My Yale Town stay was around 15-20 mins away. Once you get your head around the grid system it is very difficult to get lost.

title: Great
reviews: Worth a visit.  Lots of shops and places to eat, easy t9 get around and no need for transport as walking easy.

title: Day in town
reviews: There is literally no free parking, the price for parking is outrageous. I ended up spending $32 for parking plus $7 tax. Traffic was horrible. I couldn‚Äôt sleep so drove through around 5am and it was heartbreaking. I‚Äôve never seen soo many homeless people and at one point passed a park that was turned into a tent city. I grew up here and maybe I was too young or the homeless population has grown. I also noticed that the cost of living has skyrocketed, this is probably why. Other than that, there were many trendy, healthy driven restaurants and overpriced retail shops.

title: Lovely Downtown
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is lovely.  The low crime rate makes one feel at ease when walking and strolling the streets.  There are plenty of places to shop and plenty of great restaurants. A beautiful city to visit.

title: Terrible...
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a good place to visit if you like any of the following:-rain-avoiding homeless people who are trying to eat your face-traffic congestion-your car being broken into and all your stuff being stolen-garbage in the streets-junkies shooting up heroin in broad daylight-ramen-apathetic and unhelpful police forceI heard Stanley Park and the aquarium are nice, but unfortunately I didn't have time to visit as I was too busy filling out insurance claims and mourning the loss of all my stuff.

title: Downtown Let Down
reviews: I was really looking forward to our 4 day visit to Vancouver but was very disappointed. In my opinion Vancouver has been over developed, too quickly. The heart and soul has been ripped out of the downtown area. Very few older buildings remain and those that do are swamped by their highrise new neighbours. Downtown Vancouver is just generic big city, with no feeling of Canada and very few Canadians. I could easily have been in Hong Kong or Beijing from what I saw.

title: Buzzing
reviews: There is plenty to see and do downtown. No shortage of places to eat, drink or just grab a coffee.Lots of shopping with a good selection of shops.

title: Wonderful city trip - small and clean town
reviews: Vancouver, many faces, wonderful and clean, friendly and open people, easy public transport, good food and great place to be!Thank you!

title: Mixed feelings in a beautiful, complicated Downtown
reviews: Of course, a rating of five is due as it‚Äôs a beautiful city with a huge downtown. We had an exceptionally nice and extended walk, just from the tourist visitor‚Äôs place, to the waterfront on the ocean coast, looking at the boats, the hydroplanes and the green grass of the gardens, just nearby. There are several pubs and restaurants of all kinds and all prices almost everywhere. Public washrooms are really scarce in downtown and parking is limited to two hours as a maximum or is excessively pricey in private parkings into our opinion. Approaching Chinatown, we met some youngsters, too may, laying on the floor or sitting on a corner, in a very bad shape, one with coagulated blood, visible on one vein on an extended arm. Homeless people are visible by taking a bus from downtown towards East, once again too many.Hotels are very expensive, on a par with the most expensive cities in Northern America.

title: Busy
reviews: Busy busy place with lots of people, shops, etc. Definitely worth a visit and a walk. Very few homeless and great traffic system.

title: Dirty, disorganized concrete jungle
reviews: I travel a lot for work and pleasure and everytime I'm back in Vancouver my heart breaks seeing how the city changes for the worst.  You can forget about using a bus, it is stressful and limited, but still better than US public transport.  Drugs and mental illness is rampant, beggars on almost every major intersection.  There is no jewel or character to the city, just bland industrial landscape.  Ironically and tragically, in an orwellian fashion, Vancouver administration touts itself as a green city, whereas any European city is far more green and pleasant to visit.

title: Dissapointing
reviews: After 2 weeks traveling alon Banff and Jasper parks, Pacific Rim and Victoria, whole Vancouver and downtown mainly are dissapointing and waste of time, of course people are very kind and polite and good restaurant as well.

title: Oh Canada!
reviews: The vibe here is tough for me to put my finger on. The people are pleasant and city clean and efficient, but...Perhaps the word I‚Äôm looking for is ‚Äòpractical‚Äô. Nothing outlandish, or over the top, which is a compliment; not exciting and not flashy, as with the architecture - completely practical for its purpose.On the other hand, the breadth  of nature and the wonderful ethnic food would certainly bring me back. This area is vast, an outdoorsman‚Äôs candy land.

title: Great city to visit - do not hesitate - Book Now
reviews: My wife and I visit cities all over the world.  We were pleasantly surprised by the walkability and the international feel of this city.  Like a European city with a big Asian influence.  Beautiful.

title: Just a city !
reviews: People are generally friendly and helpful  , lots of different flavours and varieties of cuisines to choose from . Diverse  ethnic groups of locals and visitors .There are nice areas and sad , dark areas of the homeless, just as in most cities .

title: Lots to do
reviews: So much to see and do. Spent hours going into shops and there just wasn‚Äôt enough time to see everything. Mostly reasonable prices and something for everyone. So much fun and the weather was gorgeous.

title: Lots of homeless people.
reviews: This was my first visit to Vancouver and the image that I had of it didn‚Äôt match reality. The central downtown area is new with high end shops, commercial centres, hotels and office blocks. Once you venture past Granville St and/or Helmcken St you start to notice a different side of Vancouver. The amount of homes less people/rough sleepers is surprising. As is the constant smell of weed/marijuana. In and around the local parks and the waterfront there are groups of rough sleepers. No city is perfect, but I was surprised by what I saw. If you‚Äôre planning on staying in Vancouver I‚Äôd recommend central downtown where you‚Äôll find lots of the main hotel chains. Personally, I felt safer there & more comfortable.

title: Much to see!!
reviews: We stayed in a beautiful AirBnb just a couple of blocks from the train station. Near the big stadiums. Our highlight was the Chinese Gardens was a very short walk and was fabulous!! All of Chinatown was awesome!! Lots of great food and shops. We Loved it!!

title: Great City to Visit
reviews: When we started out on our journey of discovery we both said: I could easily live in Vancouver, enough said!

title: Worth a visit
reviews: Love to discover the areas of a city, get out there and explore. Check out Gas city, it is a very interesting area

title: Glass city
reviews: We stayed in Vancouver Downtown during our visit.  The buildings a beautiful it is truly a city made of glass.  There were also great restaurants and lots of upscale shops.  I enjoyed the big city vibe that seemed to permeate the whole area.  We had a super visit!

title: The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly
reviews: The proper downtown is very beautiful,  with lots of trendy shops and restaurants. As you venture to the edges of downtown,  the facade drops and you are faced with the most pitiful vagrant/homeless/addicted problem I have ever witnessed in my life.  Not what they put in the travel brochures .

title: Avoid Chinatown
reviews: It was our first day in Vancouver and we decided to to go for a lunch in Chinatown. We are very familiar with London and San Francisco Chinatowns and were expecting something similar. We were puzzled at first at how run down the Sun Yat Sen garden was and then appalled at the scenes on the surrounding streets. I thought San Francisco‚Äôs drugs/homeless problem was terrible (tho not in its Chinatown) but this was unbelievable, especially for Canada. People, mostly men and white, were lying by the dozen per block, all over the pavements openly surrounded by drug paraphernalia and off their heads. The sheer scale of this human degradation nightmare was like something out of a horror film about some distopian future. How on earth can the city be promoting this area as a tourist attraction when instead it should be warning people to avoid it at all costs? Interestingly we saw very few actual Chinese people there - I suspect they have mostly been hard working, economically successful and moved away, leaving the vacuum to be filled by a tragic white underclass. You will find far more Chinese and excellent Chinese restaurants in downtown.

title: Mixed bag
reviews: Vancouver, I found this city oddGood and the great the seawall that's a walkway that wraps around vancouver its relaxing, pretty, and a surprise awaits around every bend a beach a good view or just a lovely enchanting spot, Stanley Park absolutely stunning, gas town touristy but fun with nice bars restaurants, canada place which is where cruise ships come in a nice spot, a pretty city, i found the architecture a bit bland  excursions around vancouver great Grouse Mountain and capilano exceptional Then the other side of vancouver the site of many many homeless people, honestly be prepared if you not used to seeing homeless everywhere it can be unnerving, East hastings St is a complete street of homeless it is very sad to see, i never got approached and didn't stop me and the wife having a thorough look around It was not my favourite city in the world but most definitely worth a visit

title: Beware the vagrants
reviews: Our first day in Vancouver we thought we'd make it to the waterfront.  But dont expect a waterfront like Cape Town.  This has one small viewing area only then you can drop down into Gas Town, an attractive street decorated with hanging baskets and a steam clock to attract tourists.  We thought we'd eat in China Town but could hardly find a restaurant open and then had to wait over an hour along with others for a table.  Walking this area was not a pleasant experience, with drunks and vagrants on the streets, and later once we left the restaurants we saw row upon row of them bedding down for the night on the streets.  What a disappointing start to our holiday in Canada.

title: Downtown is the place to be!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has almost everything that you could need. With hundreds of shops, bars, restaurants, breweries and walking distance to the seawall and Stanley Park, you are never short of something to do. The downtown area is very clean and feels safe. They are always lots of people walking in the area. You will see an occasional homeless person crashed on a street corner but it was much less than some other big cities. The east side of town is a bit scary but otherwise we had no issues in downtown whatsoever.

title: Interesting to walk around
reviews: Located right on the water, downtown Vancouver is absolutely lovely -- and a great place to walk around. Lots of wonderful architecture to admire, plenty of shops, bars and restaurants. Friendly inhabitants. Even the drivers are courteous to pedestrians.

title: Solo Tour
reviews: I was hesitant at the start as I dont know the bus routes of the city, Finally i decided to study the City map and started my city tour by walking going to the Cathedral then after that I walk further going to the Harbour, then to the Olympic Couldron, Chinatown, Granville Island, BC Place to name some. I walk through the inner city streets led me to see most if not all attractions the city an offer. One thing I enjoyed the most is how lush the vegitation of the City of Vancouver. I decided to walk because there is no Uber/Lyff in Vancouver and taxi is not easy speciqlly in rush hour.

title: Excellent Area
reviews: There is so much to do in this area. Our hotel was within walking distance of many things. It's a clean and bustling area with an abundance of shoping and local restaurants. Great place to stay

title: My Favourite Area of Vancouver
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has almost everything that you could need. With hundreds of shops, bars, restaurants, breweries, parks and aesthetic spaces, you are never short of something to do. The skyline is impressive and aesthetic and the urban park, Stanley Park offers great views at a suitable distance. The Seawall will take you past various beautiful beaches also.

title: It‚Äôs no toronto
reviews: It‚Äôs nice and beautiful to look at but most of it‚Äôs charm comes from the natural scenery and not from the activities or people

title: Flew West Jet. Stayed in a condo in downtown Vancouver West End
reviews: Everything we did in the Vancouver was amazing and people are friendly. The restaurants were great and just walking everywhere or taking the bus was a pleasure. Went out to Whiterock and thoroughly enjoyed that. A must do is drive out to Kraus farms for the day and bring back a berry pie! Go to Steveston for fresh fish. Visit Stanley Park! Beautiful!! Awesome vaca!

title: Multicultural Sizzle
reviews: Meet lots of people from everywhere in the world, check out the greatest fashion brands, lots of pubs, diversity, waterfronts, seawalls, take a bike ride through the lanes and feel the vibrant pulse of the city

title: Lots to see and do
reviews: There are plenty of attractions in downtown Vancouver ... including the fabulous steam clock (a must see) as well as some good shopping. The RCMP store is great for some different souvenirs.

title: Nice
reviews: There are some really nice views, live the history and seeing several wedding parties taking their wedding photos, while at the same time seeing others shop and enjoy themselves.

title: Beautiful and safe city
reviews: A great city to visit as it can offer the city break experience as well as the outdoors stuff 20mins away (Grouse, Capilano and more).We stayed in downtown (Hyatt Regency on Burrard) and it was a great, central place to stay with shopping, the sights and eateries all within a 5 or 10min walk. Downtown felt safe, and I'm glad we stayed here (we were due to stay nr Granville but am glad we changed our minds).The best place to stay (I think) in Vancouver unless you want to be more outdoorsy.

title: A truly world-class city
reviews: We love heading north to Vancouver. It is a true world-class city. Always feel safe, lots to do and so many great places to eat and drink. Plus, if you are American, the exchange rate works in your favor and makes everything 30% off.

title: Modern, clean city
reviews: Interesting tidbit that the various areas/districts in the city have unique lamp posts to designate the area (chinatown, gaslight, yale).  The architecture is clean and modern and the streets were also clean.  Can't wait to go back and spend more time there.

title: Great food and walking city!
reviews: Wow!  There is great food all around the downtown.  The city is very walkable with a beautiful view of the water around most of the downtown.  We enjoyed great walks / bike rides in Stanley Park.  Love this city and look to come back soon!

title: Loved it here
reviews: So much to do and see. Some really interesting buildings, a port , so many shops . Very safe to walk around at night. Plenty of bars and restaurants. Need to give yourself plenty of time here to see everything we only had two days and it wasn't enough.

title: Streets in the Streets
reviews: Downtown of Vancouver is worth visiting. The streets are so nicely planned that main streets like Robson Street and other crossing streets like Davie streets gives you a lot of opportunity to shop Canadian and American products. While travelling on the streets you have lot of Food kisoks and restaurants..The sky Scrapers mixed togather give you a wonderful view of the city. Gas town and and Coal harbour are very near. All types of Pizza and Sea food is available there.

title: Nice, walkable downtown.
reviews: The area downtown is easily accessible on foot, and there are plenty of hotels, restaurants, pubs, and shops.  Canada Place , is a nice starting point, and is very near the Visitors Center. Waterfront Station is right next to Canada Place, and the cruise ship docks, and the Olympic Flame park, as is the departure point for the ferry to North Vancouver. Steamworks Brewery is just next door, and Alexander Street, Water Street and Gas town are all within easy walking distance. Plenty to do downtown, and if you run out of things to do there, Stanley Park is not far.d

title: Loved it
reviews: Stayed at the Shangri La hotel so downtown was right on the doorstep. We loved the bars, restaurants and the shopping.

title: Effortless walking
reviews: One of the best things about downtown Vancouver is the walking. You can walk for hours, enthralled by the shops, restaurants,  and people. It's a busy city, but a lovely green walk. You will run into unexpected pretty corners and tiny squares with benches and gardens,  and water fountains. A few heritage buildings but not a lot, Vancouver is a fairly new city. The public library is lovely, with 5 floors of books and a great view of the city. Just set out and walk this city, you will love it. It is pretty safe too. Avoid the downtown Eastside, if you are alone.

title: Best views
reviews: Best views and best food in Canada .So many places to go with distinct neighborhoods, Gastown,  north van, downtown, etc. My kids loved renting bikes and exploring Stanley Park and going up Grouse mountain.  I realize grouse mountain isn't downtown but if you have kids it is a do  not miss stop   we spent all day up there.

title: The Smallest Big City in the North
reviews: A stunning city surrounded by water surrounded by snow-capped mountains.  That's Vancouver.  Big enough to have the best of culture, restaurants, and amenities, yet small enough to walk across in less than half an hour.  And it's really two cities, with a splendid twin just across the harbor, North Vancouver.  Just be careful when you cross the bridge, because the traffic can be daunting in the mornings and evenings.  And with all the benefits of city life, the wilderness of the sea and mountains awaits just minutes away.

title: Friendly and easy to explore
reviews: Australians visiting downtown Vancouver will easily view similarities with Melbourne CBD area. Plenty of shopping experiences sling Granville St, Robson St areas and even down Davie St to Denman St. Easy to walk, good shopping and plenty to eat. It is an easy day in the city. Don‚Äôt forget The malls under Granville St and even Gastown with the souvenir shops and discount. For a change take the ferry to Lonsdale wharf or visit Granville Island. Love Vancouver

title: Vancouver doesn‚Äôt disappoint. Loved the Happy Hours too
reviews: Vancouvers harbour is world famous for its beauty and it didn‚Äôt disappoint, especially considering Downtown is perched right on the harbour. Gorgeous skyscrapers, super clean tree-lined streets, flower baskets adding colour at this time of year. Marine Building at 35 Burrard St is an Arte Deco gem. Robson Street has wonderful shopping and a small pedestrian area. Photographers will love shots of the early 20th Century buildings reflected in the glass skyscrapers on Burrard Street.Happy Hour, usually 1/2 price drinks are available at many places, so after working hours Vancouver Downtown is buzzing. Downtown is easily walked. Very interesting to see that the Harbour is a working place, lots of container ships, cargo trains, silos for wheat and sulphur piles adding color on the far shore.

title: What a location
reviews: Vancouver Downtown is one of the most iconic areas in the world. Brimming with the finest real estate, shops, restaurants and commerce, it is a must see area of Vancouver. We have been delighted to stay in this area.

title: Great streets to peruse
reviews: Since I don't live in the city, I loved checking out all of the buildings, shops, restaurants around the downtown area.  The view from our hotel room of all the highrises was super cool too.  Vancouver has a great mix of old and new buildings.

title: Clean and fun!
reviews: We had a great time enjoying Vancouver before we sailed out on a cruise. It was a great city and can‚Äôt wait to visit again!

title: Bustling Downtown
reviews: This area is busy and bustling, as one would expect the downtown part of a major city to be.  There are plenty of stores and places to eat, as well as some touristy sites.I would definitely recommend that you check it out as a way to get a more complete picture of what Vancouver is "all about" but I found the parks and beaches more representative of Vancouver life and culture.

title: One of the cleanest cities in the world.
reviews: Friendly people, clean streets and freeways, great restaurants with tons of ethnic food options too, so many things to do that are sensibly priced.  That US dollar goes a very LONG way up here.

title: A lot to do
reviews: As with any city a lot to do in the downtown area. Vancouver didn‚Äôt disappoint. Particularly fun is the waterfront area by the cruise line terminal. Lots of food and restaurants along the waterfront so great place for people watching.

title: Walk about
reviews: A must to go downtown.Worthwhile walking as it is not to far to travel.Lots of tourists,really busy.Great shops and bars and food outlets.

title: Loved it
reviews: After a weeks cruise it was kind of fun to ‚Äúhit‚Äù downtown Vancouver- helped by the sunshine.     Some interesting shops and we loved the trees in the streets.  We even found a park on Robson Street.  We also enjoyed the views from the buses.

title: As Expected
reviews: Worth a look I suppose, but don‚Äôt go out of your way,  It‚Äôs pretty much like any high rise downtown area.

title: East coast trip
reviews: Nice city well set out heaps of Resturants to choose from. Has a hop on off bus but very expensive $60 is the cheapest.Easy to walk around waterfront best for atmosphere they have bike lanes everywhere which are handy as the locals seem to like to cycle everywhere

title: Something for everyone!
reviews: From nice and clean roads to walk to so many sky touching buildings to so many food options! just loved it!

title: Pretty clean and interesting
reviews: Great restaurants, Water Street is fun, lots of interesting things to see.  Very walkable city.  Didn't do the public transportation but looked to be easy to use.  Lots of people to wtch

title: A lovely city but avoid East Hastings Street
reviews: Vancouver is one of the nicest cities you could go to. You have the waterfront, the skyscrapers and the mountains. Avoid East Hastings street. Other than that, enjoy an amazing city. If you want to get out of the city for a day, two places I love which you might not know about - one is Deep Cove - you just get the bus out to it. Look up the reviews. It's such a beautiful place for a day out for the price of the bus fare. Another thing to do is to get the Seabus to Lonsdale Quay, a lovely area with shops and cafes/restaurants and a lovely pier. They are both well worth a visit.

title: A lot to see at the Vancouver Acquarium
reviews: We enjoyed the exhibits on the BC Coastal Areas along the Sunshine Coast, off of Vancouver Island, and the Arctic  coastlines of Northwestern Canada.Loved the sea lions, the penguins, dolphins, and jellies.

title: Walking
reviews: There are lots of places to visit downtown - wear good shoes and roads go on for miles - lots of designer shops as well as normal shops - seafront is beautiful with lots of places to eat and watch the sea planes taking off and landing. If you like big ships then this is the place for Cruise ships - we saw some small ships and some absolutely massive ones come in. So a good place to get right up close to them by the docks.

title: Huge range of choices
reviews: Every street is great for eateries,  shopping, or just chilling listening to the street music. Huge selection range for clothes, shoes and accessories with prices for the budget  conscious and family through to high end fashion.

title: Vancouver city stay
reviews: The negative side of Vancouver is the number of people living on the streets - far far worse than our last visit less than  3 years ago. Whilst the tour operators keep pushing ‚Äúbeautiful Chinatown‚Äù forget it! Hundreds line the streets in bags tents and makeshift homes it‚Äôs more like a third world shanty town. Openly smoking preparing and taking drugs on every street! Keep away! This is spilling into other streets. My first early morning walk (jet lag) around the finance area found almost every corner had the homeless crashed out. My suggestion until it‚Äôs sorted (no time soon) is to see it yourself from a hop on hop off bus and then know where to not hop off!Other than that Vancouver is lovely and the tourist bits are brilliant - but watch the cyclists - it is a cyclist friendly city which means cyclists think they have the right of way even when their lights are red! Cars obey the brilliant traffic lights system of giving way to pedestrians, but the cyclists do not .... people and service brilliant. Totally confident of where we were, where we were going, but holding a map meant we were often being asked by locals ‚Äúcan I help?‚Äù Nice one Vancourisns!

title: Vibrant and user-friendly
reviews: Vancouver Downtown precinct is appealing, essentially very safe, and has all the businesses and services you might require.One point to note is the high proportion of homeless persons you will see along every main street of downtown Vancouver. However, while this homeless population is extremely visible, these people are not intrusive and begging activities are not forceful, with the exception of Hastings Street (which is the most confronting and least visitor-friendly street).

title: LOVE this city!!
reviews: We planned to catch a cruise from Vancouver and unfortunately planned for only two nights and one full day.  It's a lovely city... fountains everywhere,  beautiful parks (especially Stanley Park!), great biking opportunities if you're into biking... it's a city made for bikers!  The people are friendly and delightful...sooo sorry we're not staying longer!

title: A lovely city
reviews: This was the end of our west Canada trip with 4 days here. We spent many hours over the 4 days wandering various areas of the downtown area, Gastown, The Harbour, Sunset beach, English bay beach, Stanley park and even Chinatown (avoid at all costs).It is a lovely city with a great atmosphere, and at no point did we feel anything other than totally relaxed. The people are friendly and the shops are great. There are plenty of places to hire bikes in this very bike friendly city.A place we would all like to live.

title: Excellent Delights of Downtown Tour
reviews: We were picked up @ our hotel (L'Hermitage) by our driver and spent most of the day with our group.  Stanley Park, Granville Island, Capilano Suspension Bridge were some of the highlights.

title: Downtown walk around
reviews: A nice walk around with perfect weather in August. Could reach everywhere easily with Skytrain and buses.

title: An enchanting downtown
reviews: I had the opportunity to visit Vancouver this July with my family to meet my son who is studying for his degree in Vancouver. This is one of the most interesting places you can spend while enjoying the landscape,  views and the people.

title: One area to stay away from
reviews: I am a proud, born and raised Vancouverite, but tourists need to be aware to stay away from a few disgusting strrets a few blocks away from Chinatown and Gastown...Hastings Street from about Abbott Street to Gore Street, and a block North and South of Main should be avoided. It's an embarrassment that the City allows the open drug use, drinking and people selling stuff on the streets to clog those streets. The rest of the City is breathtaking and full of culture, quaint neighborhoods, shops, parks and vibrant people. Just stay clear of Hastings Street, a few blocks East and West of Main

title: Beautiful green city
reviews: We love Vancouver!  By 2020 they are hoping to becoming the ‚Äúgreenest city‚Äù in the world and by the looks of it they may just achieve it.  The greenery (trees, shrubs, lawned footpaths) throughout Downtown Vancouver make it look so beautiful. We saw plenty of trees planted on rooves of buildings ‚Äì this is because if a Downtown business cannot plant trees or shrubs outside of their buildings, they have to plant trees on their roof.
