Even the airport had trees and streams inside their International terminal.Becoming a green city was a great idea which other cities should also follow.

title: Fun place to spend a few days
reviews: Our first trip here and we had great weather which allowed us to get out and see the downtown. We did some shopping, ate some great food and enjoyed the vibe of downtown. Bustling local music scene, 420 friendly and easy to get around on foot.

title: Very walkable and lots of buses
reviews: We stayed downtown and walked nearly everywhere. I took several historic walks and enjoyed easy access to the water and the many parks downtown. Easy bus access to Stanley Park and Sky Train access to the airport.

title: Vancouver is a Beautiful City
reviews: We really like Vancouver.  It is very walkable if you stay in the downtown area.  Many restaurants and shops

title: A distinct geographically defined neighborhood
reviews: If one was to draw a vague perimeter bordered by Yaletown and Gastown to the right and left, and from BC Place Stadium/False Creek up to the Cruise Ship Terminal bottom to top), then the area so defined is Downtown.  Dunsmuir Street and Georgia Street dissect it.  The library is inside it.  This is major territory for fun stuff.  Oh yes, it is also the primary financial district.

title: Busy metropolis
reviews: We did enjoy walking downtown and we stopped for pics in Robson square. Unfortunately we saw too many homeless people, in contrast with the luxurious buildings all arpund.

title: lots to see and do
reviews: We went through it many times going all directions. The train and bus lines were close by. Good shopping.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: We love this place!  We have traveled the world and Vancouver holds a special place for us. Great restaurants, safe and easy to walk about, and wonderful people.

title: Great city
reviews: Downtown offers pretty much everything you want from great food to tours to funky bars to easy transportation.

title: What a place?
reviews: After being there a short time , it had lots to offer to see and do , It was easy to get around the place and to find the things to see .

title: Impressive skyline
reviews: Tall tall buildings, such interesting architectural designs, almost as if one was trying to outshine the another! Modern concept, balconies galore and roof top gardens aplenty! I loved it!

title: love this city
reviews: We visited for a couple of days after a cruise. Very walkable city. Very clean and safe feeling except for a couple of streets near Chinatown. A lot of homeless there. The city center was bustling and we walked about 15 blocks to the Gas district.  Much nicer and cleaner than  Seattle.

title: Excellent Walking City
reviews: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency.  We walked everywhere from there.  Gastown, Yaletown, the Shopping District, Coal Harbor, the Convention Center, and more were all in easy walking distance from the Hotel.  Vancouver is a very clean city.

title: Some lovely areas, but some not so nice
reviews: I guess downtown Vancouver is a lot like other major cities, nice areas and some not so nice, but to us there seemed to be more homeless and down and out folk than any other city we‚Äôve been to. Stanley Park, Granville island and places like Gastown are well worth a visit, but watch you don‚Äôt stray too far. On this holiday we also visited Winnipeg and Toronto but nothing compared to the drug or alcohol fuelled rough sleeping that we witnessed in Vancouver. The last morning we took a taxi to our railway station and were shocked at the amount of people rough sleeping, there were literally dozens at various street corners south of Chinatown and Gastown. I think it will be a longtime before we return to Vancouver.

title: Nice, but...
reviews: I enjoy waking around the cities that I visit. It gives me an opportunity to view the culture. Downtown Vancouver is beautiful, and you can get around easily and cheaply by taxi, bus, or train.  I must warn you, there are a lot of homeless people sleeping on the streets of downtown Vancouver. I mention this so you are not surprised as I was. If you can overlook this fact, you will enjoy the city. (I purposely did not attach pictures)

title: Beautiful
reviews: The city is clean,easily walkable and beautiful. What more can I say! It is starting to have a Hong Kong like city view! They are doing this city right!

title: Beautiful Downtown
reviews: We were only there for one day but very impressed with how clean and walkable the downtown area was!  Would love to spend more time there!

title: Waterfront
reviews: Easy relaxing walk around Vancouver waterfront near Canada Place. Lots of float planes taking off and landing, plus yacht basin with interesting-looking houseboats. But watch out for the dedicated bike path.

title: A Lovely City
reviews: We had heard a lot about Vancouver so decided to visit.  The Downtown Area is pretty small and easily accessible by foot.  Everywhere was clean and we never felt threatened anywhere in the town.

title: Stroll Through Downtown
reviews: We spent two afternoons walking in the downtown area of the beautiful city of Vancouver.  Lots of sights and sounds in this cosmopolitan city.  Beautiful buildings, old and new, to make a stroll interesting and fun. Many places to stop and shop.

title: Vacation 2019
reviews: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency downtown. Great place to stay. Centrally located to many attractions.

title: Downtown is beautiful and very green.
reviews: The water views were lovely and it was fun to watch all the activity.  Float planes took off frequently as did helicopters.  Ferries and cruise ships and pleasure boats and cargo ships and dinner cruises, etc all plied the waterways.  On land a walkway extended around the harbour for pedestrian and bicycle traffic.  There were many parks and gardens and lawns were many people were enjoying the wonderful sunny weather.  Vancouver is working hard, and succeeding, at being a very green city.

title: Love the Vancouver vibe!!
reviews: Spent the day walking around downtown Vancouver taking in the breathtaking architecture and landmarks. I will be back for sure!!

title: Busy area!
reviews: Walked here from our hotel and found it very busy. Lots of shops here - some very expensive!!!Slightly disappointed at the lack of family friendly lunch establishments, but walked a little from the downtown area and found somewhere.

title: Vibrant city centre. It is alive
reviews: It was my first time in North America and I am glad that I picked Vamcouver to host me. The city is truly multicultural and you can feel it and live it in downtown. There is so many stuff to see and you don't need to follow routes, you can just wander around and let the city amaze you. Granville is a good place to start day or night always lively. You will see people of all ages from all over the world making the most of it. On the plus side over the weekend the roads are closed for traffic so you don't even need to bother if something gets your attention on the other side of the road.

title: My favorite city in Canada
reviews: Vancouver is breathtakingly beautiful! The waterfront with its impeccably maintained walkway is a gem. There are not many places where you can enjoy the warm sun while seeing snow-capped mountains and water planes too. Robson Street has wonderful shops and there are great restaurants everywhere. It is easy to get around and everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful. There is also a gorgeous beach with palm trees and hotels, which made me feel like I was in Italy or France. Loved it!

title: Great City.. lots to do and Sea!
reviews: Great City...So much here to see and do.we spent a few days and really enjoyed ourselves. Easy to get around. Lots to see.

title: Heavenly
reviews: A great city with an incredible, diverse range of activities. Excellent food. Memorable architecture.

title: Walkable and fun
reviews: This was our first trip to Vancouver and we found the downtown to be a fun, lively but not overly touristy area. Yeah, there are tourists just like us there. But not nearly as crowded as a lot of big cities. People were friendly. Directions are easy. Restaurants and souvenir shops plentiful. We had fun several days walking the downtown area and getting a flavor for the city.

title: Great Walking City
reviews: This is the first time we‚Äôve been to Vancouver without renting a car. We got around town by foot, bike, and bus. We loved it. The money we saved easily paid for five days of food. We stayed at the Westin Bayshore on Coal Harbor just south of Stanley Park. Each morning we would take a different route downtown, the Sea Wall route, Georgia‚Äôs St., Robson St., etc. All are interesting streets and all are about 1.3 miles to downtown. Vancouver has one of the loveliest downtowns of any major city I‚Äôve been in. Wide, flat sidewalks, beautiful landscaping and hanging flower baskets, interesting shops and a wide variety of good restaurants. And don‚Äôt forget, for American tourists the exchange rate makes this a very affordable city. We did about 4 - 6 miles a day, ate and drank well, and returned home with no vacation weight gain.

title: Expensive
reviews: 8 dollars for a short ride to downtown. Not worth it. Very crowded too, so few seats were available .

title: Downtown Van!
reviews: Recently visited downtown Vancouver! Very clean, lots of shops and some cool views especially down by the pier! You have to do the FlyOver Canada Ride!!

title: Beautiful downtown area
reviews: Fab walking downtown area. Many buskers on the streets playing a variety of styles of lovely music. Many shops, restaurants, for all types of tastes and palates

title: Lovely city, skyline not impressive for the location
reviews: Great city to explore in the area. Not impressed with its architecture or the lack of. There were so many buildings that looked alike and had to be designed and built at the same time. The locals are very nice for directions and the waterfront is well done. Great city to spend 2-3 days in.

title: Picturesque
reviews: We arrived downtown Vanvouver it was so,pretty We could see snow capped mountains. It was clean, and planter with tulips everywhere. The area was busy but it had a map of area which made it easy to find which direction we had to go. People were friendly and helpful.

title: Wow! Great City.
reviews: Went to Vancouver recently on business. Loved it. Beautiful city, and I want to go back. Has all my favorite things. Great restaurants and seafood. Walkable city with pretty views. Amazing market on Granville Island. It‚Äôs on the water, lots of it. Weather was fab in June. And great people there too.

title: Huge numbers of high-rise buildings, all new looking and in good shape
reviews: Vancouver was a super nice and friendly city.  We loved our visit there.  We ate at the Bellagio cafe, and it was excellent.

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is such a lovely downtown. There are lots of different areas, so each ares is different. there are places with lots of homeless people, and places that are clean and quiet.  All different and all worth seeing.

title: Beautiful as ever
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful and peaceful place to visit. There are plenty of restaurants and shopping. We love it!

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Nice downtown in British Columbia. Amazing Vancouver in West side and scared place in East side and China town. If you rent car, rental company does not recommend you to park any time in East side of Vancouver. Downtown is nice touristic place. Good restaurants. Very clean and friendly people on the street of downtown exclude East side

title: Expected more
reviews: I did not find Vancouver a highlight of our Northwestern trip sadly. All the buildings seemed high-rises out of the 60's like what you would see in old Japanese films. Roads were very hard to navigate, drivers always speeding and rude (don't let you over). They used electric busses, so all skylines and pictures are criss crossed with electrical spaghetti, again akin to India or other 3rd world countries. Prices were high for everything (a king room cost us 250 here, 125 w free breakfast in Seattle, same chain). Parking was terrible. I have to end on a high note though - I have never seen so many hedges and such tall ones in my life. Almost every home seemed to have a huge hedge and a compound-like plot, akin to homes in the middle East (there is a large Middle Eastern contingent here).

title: Top shelf
reviews: What an incredible city. I spent 3 days as a tourist here and was completely impressed. The city is as good as it gets

title: Vancouver
reviews: I liked Vancouver, especially Gastown and the main shopping areas. However, such extreme poverty and homelessness on every corner was upsetting

title: Big drug problems!
reviews: The drug use in this city is rampant.  I was in complete shock at the number of high people we encountered in the city-or people shooting up right there on the streets.

title: Lovely n lively place.
reviews: Vancouver downtown area is very beautiful. Gastown steam clock attarction is main. We enjoyed walking and some window shopping. Evening time street looks so beautiful. Delicious food and lively place. Many branded shops also there. Nice area. Must visit.

title: Up town to downtown
reviews: Lots of shops to stroll through, safe place, hotels galore, modern construction of buildings, enjoyed the walk.

title: You can't visit Vancouver without including Downtown
reviews: A very crowded and busy area. People rushing from one place to another and we're [Tourist] always in the way trying to figure out where we're going and how to get there....at least they're nice enough to literally take the time and show you how to navigate. Reminds me of Chicago's view from Lake Shore Drive.

title: Best of Downtown Food Tour in Vancouver
reviews: Just back from an absolutely wonderful trip, expertly led by our guide, Nadia. Nadia was extremely knowledgeable about the downtown food scene in Vancouver. She ran our tour with clockwork precision.The restaurants we went to were all fantastic. The food was amazing and the wine pairing was fantastic. All in all a wonderful trip to book and it gave us a greater insight of the restaurants recommended to us. Would thoroughly recommend this tour to any food lover.

title: Great Weekend
reviews: we live in  the Yakima Valley so went to LaConner for a day/night the weekend" After" tulip festival when it is quiet!!The  LaConner Inn and the restaurant attached is great and  right in town. Then we crossed the border and stayed right on the water in Vancouver where the cruise ships dock and  walking distance to lots of great bars ,restaurants and shopping.We use to like to go to Seattle for a gettaway but I really Vancouver better now

title: Great town
reviews: Vancouver is a fun, exciting and moving hub. The driving can be a little complicated but lots of places to park!

title: Not impressed.
reviews: Did not like the skyline in Downtown Vancouver. Skyscrapers with no style. The suburbs are much nicer.

title: Lots To See
reviews: A vibrant, bustling city. Modern and beautiful with lots of restaurants, shops, malls, harborfronts and everything that makes a beautiful city.

title: Busy!
reviews: Super busy but that‚Äôs to be expected on a Saturday in June. If you love to shop and eat hot dogs from hot dog trucks you‚Äôll love Vancouver downtown.Not super impressed with it.

title: Arrival downtown pre Cruise
reviews: We booked into the Sheraton Wall for one night pre Cruise and it is well located downtown and convenient fir all areas. A short taxi ride took us to the Vancouver Lookout and the waterfront where we had a wander and admired the vista. We wandered the shopping area around Roberts Street and had a very chilled day after a long flight from London.With an eight hour time difference it was a long but enjoyable day.

title: First time visit
reviews: My daughter lives in downtown Vancouver so everything was a walking distance. I enjoyed the weather compared to Ontario. People  are more relax and stress free. The only set back is it's really expensive. but that's Vancouver.

title: Fun fun fun
reviews: a great place to have fun, eat casual as well as fine dining foods. great bars, clubs, shopping complexes and a great night-life too. Time passes very quickly here.

title: Great sight seeing, but very busy
reviews: We enjoyed walking in Downtown Vancouver. See the Fairmont hotel and Christ Church Cathedral. Also, try the dairy-free vegan gelato

title: 2 Day Trip to Vancouver
reviews: We joined our son in Vancouver following a convention that he attended. We were very impressed with the downtown area of Vancouver. Very clean! Many food options! People were very friendly! Climate in June was perfect! The area is very eco friendly!

title: Wonderful city
reviews: Wonderful city and great people. Lots of great places to visit and a multi culture environment. Especially liked the Baghdad cafe restaurant. City was also neatly maintained and very clean too.

title: BEST ATTRACTION
reviews: Downtown is known for a buzzing nightlife with bars, clubs and live bands. By day it is a busy shopping hub, food trucks and casual lunch spots.

title: Not Impressed
reviews: Spent the last week vacationing from Calgary to Vancouver.  I found my Canadian to be very hospitable and kind. Calgary, Banff, Lake Louise, Jasper and Kamloops were beautiful cities/towns.  Vancouver on the other hand, had little to offer tourist.  Streets are filthy with rampant homelessness.  Very unfortunate to see the extent of mental health and drug related issues plague the local population.  Blocks are filled with tents/ makeshift shelters.   No different than many of the major US pacific cities plagued by social issues.....Unfortunate ending to what was, up until Vancouver, a wonderful Canadian trip

title: Easy to navigate ...........HOWEVER ............
reviews: Vancouver is easy to get around - the architecture is different on Every building. What makes Vancouver unique - as compared to the USA - every business has to allocate funds per square foot the business occupies - for art work of which a lot contains green space as well. The currency exchange rate to USD is great .....USD goes a long ways - which is good as food is expensive - even with a great exchange  rate. $50.00 USD got you $64 Canadian The down side - the hills are very step returning from the cruise port.

title: Very Happenning.. Very Resourceful..!!!
reviews: Here, you can have anything you like..!!! Literally anything Shops, cafe, weed, pubs/bars, hostels and hotels, nightclub.. what not..!!!

title: Easy city to navigate.
reviews: Nice city but they have a big problem with homeless people sleeping in the streets. Some areas were much worse than others.  Not a good thing to see when visiting a new city.

title: Lovely City
reviews: Lots to see, good food reasonably priced (with very strong dollar helping a lot!).  We enjoyed great weather (no rain during the week).  Friendly people.  Town has a great vibe!

title: Clean and easy to navigate
reviews: I spent 4 days in Vancouver - mainly in downtown. It‚Äôs clean, easy to get around and felt safe. There are areas to avoid (East Hastings St is prime example). I saw less homeless people in Vancouver than many other North American cities (eg Seattle, San Francisco)

title: Very busy
reviews: There is lots to do and see in downtown Vancouver. Make sure you check out the marina and head to Gastown. Watch out for areas where there homeless people and drug users. People are friendly and helpful to tourists.

title: Love this city
reviews: This was my first trip to Vancouver and I didn't want to come home.  I loved everything about this city!  So worth a visit.

title: Good Shopping
reviews: Lots of good fun places to shop and eat.  Clean and safe area to visit on your own or as couples. Good place to spend a couple of hours.

title: Great town to visit for a few days
reviews: Went to Stanley Park, saw the steam clock, rode the ferry. went to the lookout. We originally were there to visit some friends but really enjoyed the town overall. Better than Seattle, not as weird as Portland. American dollars go farther there.

title: Put on your walking shoes
reviews: So many places to eat, shop, drink, site see, study history. Great city for walking. In fact, look for a walking tour brochure. So helpful for  finding things.

title: Love this city
reviews: I love Vancouver.....it's clean & there's heaps of great shops & lots to see & do.Worth a trip to see all there is that Vancouver has to offer.

title: Beautiful Place
reviews: First time in this great city. The people are wonderful and polite. We took the train from the airport to city center. Didn‚Äôt seem too unusual to haul luggage to our hotel. . . Ate at Joeys for late night fare and beers.

title: Take care in Chinatown
reviews: A went for a walk this afternoon from Granville down Georgia west to Chinatown past the library and stadium. The further I got into Chinatown the more concerned I became.  There 100‚Äôs of ‚Äúdrugged out vagrants‚Äù, I eventually decided I wouldn‚Äôt go to The Sun Yat-Sen gardens. I then moved on to Gastown which was a bit better.  I liked the steam clock which I did hear ‚Äúchime‚Äù at 3 pm. Walked past the Vancouver lookout and then past the Fairmont. A pleasant walk but I wouldn‚Äôt go back to Chinatown especially at night.

title: Great city to visit
reviews: We enjoyed our few days here. Great to walk around. Lots of places to eat.The harbour and Canada Place reminded me a little of Sydney. Liked the historic areas and the atmosphere. We were fortunate to see the filming of the TV show Supergirl! Parking however is very expensive.

title: Very dirty looking city with not much to see
reviews: Town looks very old and dirty. There are some nice churches and old buildings to see and harbourfront area is nice. Wouldnt want to be here for more than 2 days

title: Shops and more shops
reviews: Downtown is not huge and basically walkable. We kept going new streets to go down. Has an indoor shopping mall called Pacific Centre and it‚Äôs main Department store is Hudson‚Äôs Bay which has some bargains.Loads of places to eat.

title: Lively area, easy to walk around
reviews: This is a great area with a lot to see and experience - on the sea front, easy walking, lots of shops and places to eat. Great atmosphere but not to hectic or busy

title: Beautiful Vancouver in June
reviews: We stayed pre cruise for a couple of days in Vancouver. A really beautiful, clean city.The weather was kind and a lovely climate. Reminds me of UK in the summer.Very friendly locals.... all the ones we spoke to.

title: We love this easily accessible city
reviews: It is always fun to comeback to Vancouver. We really enjoy the downtown area and easy access to most everything. The buildings seem to get taller and newer but you can still walk almost anywhere in town or grab a bus or subway or better yet rent a bike. The bike paths on the main streets are very nice but watch out for crazy drivers!  There is so much to see here so you may want to take a portion of the city and really get to know it or give yourself plenty of time to walk around. We especially enjoy walking Robson St and side streets and heading to Granville Island or Stanley Park. Quite the cosmopolitan city! We do find it is getting more expensive every visit.  Also check out Yaletown and Gastown. Lots of great restaurants and great shopping too.

title: a lot to see but better walk as drive
reviews: parking in downtown gets more and more expensive ...15$ an hour is ridicolus ...on the one hand the city wants and need people downtown...on the other hand they make it pricier and pricier...      best restaurants are in gastown like bauhaus

title: Glass city
reviews: I am not a city person but can appreciate the beauty of a city.   A very busy metropolis with high glass towers.  Easy to navigate and walkable.  But was glad to leave.

title: Picturesque large, clean west coast city
reviews: Vancouver is a very picturesque west coast Canadian city that is fairly easy to navigate, has a good city rail  and transit system, feels quite safe in most parts for a fairly large city. Ocean and mountain backdrops everywhere and much interesting modern architecture and buildings.  So many things to see and do in the spring, fall and summer. We have been there in the winter when it is often wet, grey and fairly cold although it seldom snows in the city. Airport is south of the city. Suggest the Skytrain into the city as its all surface streets (no highway) to downtown.  Lots of great restaurants.

title: Lovely airy city
reviews: What a lovely airy city with plenty of room and space.  Only downside was the number of rough sleepers.  Apart from that it was nice and clean and tidy.

title: Van Downtown Visit
reviews: ...lots of resto to satisfy your gastronomic craving. Busy streets and souvenir shops all over the place... was able to visit the torch üòä

title: Unbelievable down and outs
reviews: I was really surprised by the number of people sleeping rough on the streets. I didn‚Äôt appreciate being approached even when pacific food hall, for hand outs.  Not sure if the legalisation of pot and the prolific action of drug shops has anything to do with it but to me a blight on a beautiful city

title: A fabulous city
reviews: We spent 3 full days in Vancouver before our Holland America Inside Passage cruise. A lovely city, very easy to navigate with great restaurants & bars. We took a bus to the suspension bridge & mountains which was very easy. Highly recommended.

title: Nice Place to visit
reviews: Nice Compact city, I remember me and my friend went to Chinatown there and had a good meal, would go back if I could get on a plane. Not flown in over 10 years.

title: Vancouver dark side
reviews: Visited the city after a cruise to Alaska. Like most big cites around the world there is a stark contrast between the have's & have nots. We were struck by the spread of homeless & drug addicted people. There were many lying on the street clearly under the influence of drugs( l am a retired Police officer) so not easily shocked. On a bike tour we came thorough one area near to Gastown/ Chinatown which appeared to have come a ghetto area.Whilst fully understanding there is no easy solution to such a problem.It doesn't sell the city to tourists  & local people seemed to accept the situation ( on the face of it) Clearly Canadians are a friendly welcoming people & in BC embrace all aspects of diversity. But not a good image for such a lovely city.

title: So much to do
reviews: The city is always moving so many people all so busy.We came during the week so we saw the  everyday people but of course It was the first week before tourist season.So lots of people from all over. The food is amazing and the choices are endless.  Just eat any seafood and you'll be extremely satisfied.From the parks to the clubs and shops one can be overwhelmed by the variety. Just try everything you can!!

title: Beautiful Vancouver...worth another visit
reviews: Love...love everything about Vancouver. The food, the culture, the experience...none can be compared. Love the scenery as well and the fact that you can get to relax, have fun and take your time.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Walk & drove down many streets.  So many interesting sites & people watched too. Adults with teenagers.  We were in GasTown, saw the really cool steam clock.Lots of very interesting & historical buildings.  We ALL enjoyed our visit!

title: Great city
reviews: What a great spot the downtown of Vancouver is. It‚Äôs got great shopping, wonderful hotels, and excellent eating spots.

title: Easy to walk city
reviews: While it was easy to walk around and go places, the nice part of the city is along the water.  The traffic is horrible, so walking or riding a bike is best.

title: Great
reviews: The downtown has an excellent variety of stores and restaurants - many with views of the ocean and the mountains. Interesting architecture. Easy to walk it all. Parking is expensive. Download the parking app!!!

title: Nice to say ive been
reviews: Stayed at the Blue Horizon for 7 nights,lovely hotel but possibly stayed in Vancouver  too long.Vancouver i found to be very safe,walked all over and never encountered any dodgy  moments, having said that ,the extent of the homelessness is shocking,people camped out on the streets,laid out across footpaths,drugged up down and outs bawling in your face,coming from the UK ive seen homelessness but not on this scale and it just wasnt in the tourist areas either.Plenty of shops and restuarants but i just found the place a bit tame and lacking in something,British Columbia but nothing British about this place,i found the locals not rude but not particulary  friendly either,good transport system though and very clean.For me  a beautiful location but from my experience i prefer Toronto a lot more.

title: Green and congested
reviews: Took ages to navigate downtown on a busy Sunday Traffic was gridlocked by construction sites, other cars and narrow streets Would have been quicker to walk or get the subway Lots of tree lined streets and green area , lots of glass

title: Something for everyone
reviews: The transit system is amazing so you can get anywhere super easily or walk around! You can find reasonable items everywhere. It‚Äôs nice to see the history of the city but also you will see quite a bit of homelessness.

title: Lots of nice parts and some sketchy?
reviews: We loved the main area but as you push out a bit to Gastown and China Town you get some sketchy people hanging around.  Not as bad as some places but also a bit sad. YMMV

title: WOW
reviews: Downtown to me means a lesser preferred area of town in Sydney anywayIn Vancouver it means awesome eateries top end shopping storesand loads of choices in accommodation Maybe a few too many Canada stores but a great place to stay

title: Good shopping areas, coffee shops and public buildings
reviews: We liked downtown as there are lots of shopping areas and malls. There are coffee shops and restaurants. The metro system is efficient and reasonably priced. Everyone is most welcoming and friendly.

title: City walk
reviews: Beautiful city with spectacular scenery and very easy to explore. People were so helpful and courteous.

title: Come & See!
reviews: We don't come downtown very often, however every time we do come into the area we totally enjoy the sites & sounds. Lot's of shops & restaurants that everyone can enjoy for a wide variety of budgets. We normally take transit into the downtown area.

title: Clean city
reviews: Loved Vancouver but decided not to stay in the heart of town, although  a visit to the area was good: obviously some stunning looking buildings and excellent and diverse  shopping.  Good walking, well laid out city.  Need several hours to enjoy it to the full.  Multicultural, diverse and vibrant.  We were surprised to see homeless begging in the streets.  Not a lot but mostly younger people.  Did not think this happened in progressive Canada.

title: Gorgeous downtown - very eclectic and diverse!
reviews: Downtown was very clean. Eclectic and diverse group of people. Construction everywhere. Lots of nice places to eat and visit. We will be back when we have more time to visit.

title: Lots of variety shopping but
reviews: But the homeless are still everywhere...not as bad as some major cities. The shops are a variety of expensive to regularly priced goods. We were there on a Friday and it wasn‚Äôt too crowded. Nice place to walk around.

title: good place to visit
reviews: there are many things to do and see in downtown Vancouver eateries museums Canada point Stanley park the list goes on it is delightful and well worth a visit

title: Downtown Vancouver Sparkles
reviews: In September, before the October rains come, downtown Vancouver is a jewel of sparkling, glass-clad, high rise towers that attracts and holds the eyes of photographers. What a beautiful city: modern, with creative architecture, surrounded by mountains and waterways, a must see city of the world.

title: Watch out
reviews: Traffic was crazy, if you're from the states drivers don't give you any breaks. They don't seem to friendly. Cars park right in the road on major streets. I guess if I had to drive around there I wouldn't be happy either.

title: Wonderful city
reviews: Vancouver is a great sight seeing city with lots of places to visit. Take the city tour bus to help decide where to go back and see. Lots of good restaurants and a public market place to rival Seattle. Will definitely get back again soon.

title: Lovely location
reviews: Specially around Canada place there are many entertainment offers for you to plan your day truly.There are many free shuttle to transfer people to the famous places in BC.Also many bars and restaurants located to make a beautiful time with your friends.

title: Vibrant city
reviews: This is a beautiful city boasting both mountain and ocean views. There is so much to do with a great outdoors scene, as well as shopping dining and the arts.

title: Expected more
reviews: It‚Äôs a shame to see so many homeless people on the street and seems nobody cares. Hearth-breaking in our society it‚Äôs still not solved. Miss a little bit the bubbling of a city. People seems to be a little bit on themselves. Many empty buildings too. I believe Canada is a country to explore their great nature and not known of their cities.

title: Very cool city
reviews: Great city to visit, lots to do, great food, great views. The only down is the smell of pot being smoked everywhere.

title: Modern, green and clean city with majestic views
reviews: This city has a lovely walking area along the coast with great mountain views.  You can easily go into Stanley Park which is a beautiful and large city park.  There are so many fountains and flower beds and trees in this city and the Spring was lovely.

title: Busy active City
reviews: A nice midsized city however traffic is as bad as New York so be prepared to walk. The subways are limited but the buses are caught in the same traffic. A very good selection of store and a range of excellent restaurants so you can eat you way through.

title: Clean, hip city.
reviews: Beautiful city with a hip vibe. As you walk downtown the mountainview takes your breath away. The people are so friendly and well dressed.

title: Vivrant
reviews: This City is clean, modern, historic, non smelly and vibrant. Homeless can be annoying asking for money to turning trash cans looking for food.  And it is Expensive!!!  In particularly the food.  Well, will not mind to stop by again!

title: Good for a walk
reviews: Make sure you walk down robsen/ burrad and Grenville. A nice walk around central but make sure you walk to gastown as that is worth a look. Downtown is quite commercial, nice wide streets with lots of trees. Pretty views to mountains and rivers around down the end of streets.

title: Vancouver Gastown is a gas
reviews: Gastown BC in the heart of Downtown Vancouver is well worth a visit, offering History, Great Sights & Dining experiences for all interests & appetites.

title: Nice city
reviews: Its a pretty good City just downtown there was not much to do or maybe because It was a little rainy those days, but still i walked around to take few pictires and the place looks clean and busy which is nice, i went a little farter and I Saw the homeless area and even there i wasnt scare so good job.

title: Very walkable
reviews: Very walkable city. Not too busy and user friendly. Many restaurants and bars. Good access to waterways.

title: Harbor
reviews: Enjoyed downtown very much.  Many great restaurants and activities as well as shopping.  Beautiful area.

title: fun place to walk around
reviews: there is so much to see and do in downtown Vancouver BC.  we love coming here.  only problem is finding parking.  i suggest parking in the hotel and walking.

title: Wow! It's a great city.
reviews: If you are even a moderate-ability walker, you will be able to visit many interesting sections of the city on foot.  We stayed at the Georgian Court Hotel on Beatty Street, and it was 2.5 easy miles up Robson Street, a terrific shopping district, to Stanley Park with the horse-drawn carriage tours and aquarium. That's about as far as you need to go -- the Vancouver Lookout, Gastown with its steam clock and shoppes, and Chinatown and sports venues are all closer in.   There are literally hundreds of restaurants on your doorstep.  If you get tired, stop at any of the many sidewalk cafes that sell bubble tea, an oddly tasty concoction of a milk and flavor combination (your choice of flavors) that has some sort of gastronomical "bubbles" on the bottom that you drink up through a wide straw.  Or there is a Starbucks every third block.

title: The best place to live in
reviews: Been living dt (Yaletown) for a couple of months and there really is no way back. I couldn‚Äôt live anywhere else. So convenient. You can walk or bike anywhere and you don‚Äôt have to exit the neighbourhood unless you really want to. Just unbelievable. Plus, apartments are modern and nice. A delight!

title: A joy to behold
reviews: Vancouver is perfect for an overnight stay. The downtown is accessible, repleat with efficient, plentiful transport options. gawking at modern architecture is a must. Shopping is fully serviced in this town, Crowds are thin, friendly encounters all round. Loved the ambience of restaurants, coffee palaces and department stores. Walking has never been more of a joy

title: Amazing, clean and beautiful!
reviews: Had never been to a downtown by the edge of the sea. Not only that I had never been to a downtown that was like walking through Rodeo Drive. Trump Tower, Gucci, Hermes, Luis Vuitton stores. I was so amazed didn't even know where to start. I was like a child at a candy store!!!! LOOOOVE IT!!!!

title: Fun place to explore
reviews: Lots to see and do and very walkable. We had a great time poking around in shops and enjoying the beauty of the waterfront.

title: Best city on earth (in the summer)
reviews: The setting of Vancouver is so stunning with the ocean and mountains. Fabulous dinning with a wide variety of food options for all tastes. In the summer months is when Vancouver comes alive! Outdoor concerts, seawall bike rides, sunset patio action and more! Very clean, happy and friendly city! You will love it!

title: Classy & safe
reviews: Vancouver downtown is nice, beautiful  , clean, classy and full of things to do , it is safe and great for shopping, good restaurants from different cuisines around the world , easy transportation system. Robson Street , Burrard Street , English Bay , canada place, china town, Stanley Park , North Vancouver are some of the must do while you are there.

title: Downtown
reviews: All visitors to Vancouver should head downtown especially the gaslight district so much good food and drink and a great photo opportunity everywhere and the Canadians are so friendly will always help you

title: Vibrant City
reviews: A beautiful city with lots of visitor attractions and fabulous restaurants that cater to all tastes and budgets. A safe, clean, happy city. Very good public transit system. Very expensive accommodation costs here to buy or rent

title: Vancouver downtown
reviews: Downtown is a great place to explore. Restaurants theatre shopping lots of various retail stores and restaurants to eat. Great atmosphere and lots of high rises and hotels as well. Recommend to explore this area

title: Beautiful Vancouver! it never disappoints!!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver offers a whole lota fun shopping eating and beautiful sights!And on a beautiful sunny day you can walk forever enjoying the sights the City has to offer!Make SURE you visit my favorite shop Obsessions Gifts on Dunsmuir (at Howe) so many wonderful and fun gifts for everyone! Its a gem! for all.

title: Pre cruise to Alaska visit
reviews: Love this City . So much to see and do . Go to Gas Town . The original Vancouver . Easy walk from cruise ship‚Äôs . Science World is easy to get to in False Creek and is worth the visit . Heading back this July for repeat cruise and want to visit Grouse Mountain . There is a sky ride to to the top and you can overlook City and harbour . They have rescued two Grizzly bear cubs that have grown up and live in their sanctuary on mountain.

title: Lots of stuff to do!
reviews: Skytrain Canada Line from YVR, off at Vancouver City Centre, stumbled across a fried risotto ball food truck on Granville, delicious...lots of other stuff in the area, including Costco!

title: Vancouver has changed
reviews: One of my favorite places to visit. Beautiful, walkable city. However, my visit last week was not as fun. The amount of weed smokers & cigarette smokers was unbelievable. I even saw a guy try to light up his crack pipe! My husband‚Äôs asthma kicked in & he was miserable. Also, vehicles don‚Äôt yield to pedestrians in crosswalks??!! What?! Downtown Vancouver has changed. I was sad.

title: A lot of choice in a walkable area
reviews: Wonderful selection of clothing and specialty shops, choices for the average to very high end purchaser. Lots of pubs, sidewalk cafes and upscale restaurants. Fabulous place for people watching and just browsing.

title: So much to see and do and so little time to do it all!
reviews: Always a delight to walk around. Must people are polite and semi courteous. Pay close attention to cars when crossing the street though. Always a cafe, restaurant, bar to pop into for a quick drink and to relax.

title: Not friendly visit
reviews: We are very educated people and understand and follow all rules... All parking ticket officers are everywhere and we got a ticket just because we passed 2 mins of waiting for the traffic light to go back to the car...After begging and emailing them ( the officer ) to at least lessen the amount of $40 they still didnt give us chance!!! Here in toronto my friend came from Vancouver and had same issue. She got  a ticket and ask officer to waive it... they did it for her since she is visiting the place and exceed 10 mins.... they gave her warning but thats it.But in Vancouver they never give any chanceswe also paid parking for going inside flea market! And then paid entrance fee which is $1.50 each to go inside! Not a friendly place. Not a place to visit! Would never suggest friends to visit if they ask for my opinion. So be careful where you park and how long will you be gone even its 1'min late they will issue a ticket!!!

title: Expensive yes but still worth it
reviews: Perhaps my least endearing part of Vancouver is downtown.  There is a bit too much concrete and sky-rises for my liking.  Once you are up in those sky-rises however, you get a panoramic view of the mountains, ocean and forests which is what makes Vancouver one of my favorite spots on the planet.

title: So much smog you can not breath
reviews: The stench of exhaust the hordes of people all so busy to what end.  The food is not healthy but expensive.  The masses trying to get by. A rat race.

title: Great multicultural city
reviews: It's always a great experience to walk around downtown Vancouver. There are lots of great shops to visit, selling all sorts of items from food to tourist trinkets. People are generally friendly and the place caters to tourists. Very clean with green areas  scattered throughout.

title: West coast pot smoke and walk
reviews: So many people smoking pot that our walk about town was not pleasant. We are both sickened by the smell, so sought cleaner air venues like Stanley park.

title: Shen Yun a wonder to behold
reviews: Our purpose for this excursion was to attend the Queen Elizabeth Theatre. The Opus hotel was well situated for this venue and the Shen Yun experience was fantastic!

title: A beautiful, lovely, walkable city with an excellent mix of the old and new.
reviews: We enjoyed walking around this multi-cultural city.  It is incredibly well-maintained and it offers a wide variety of shopping and eating opportunities.  The people are friendly and helpful and we kept remarking how clean it was.

title: The most beautiful city in the world!
reviews: Ok, so I might be biased. But on a sunny day, Vancouver is absolutely gorgeous.  It‚Äôs the only city I can think of where you can ski on a World Cup mountain, sail on the ocean, and golf on a PGA course in the same day! Constantly ranked at the top of the worlds most liveable cities. Vancouver is the best!

title: Several places to visit
reviews: Extremely clean, beautiful, streets are a little up and down, a lot of restaurants, shopping places, near the coast, near a lot of places.

title: Beautiful skyline but...
reviews: Very beautiful skyline but all these ugly new buildings are going up. Lot's of cold, young, rich people with big egos that glare at you don't apologize if they bump into. Something must be done about downtown East Hastings...

title: Gorgeous Setting. Cold People
reviews: Unbelievable beautiful setting. Almost magical. Unfortunately so many downtown buildings, primarily the high rise condo's are empty. Foreign investors simply bought them for a Real Estate asset and not to live. The empty Condo's add nothing to the city. To this, there is the fact Vancouver is a center of foreign adventure. So many Asian kids attending paid schooling in many suspect colleges. Many foreign adventurers passing through. Hard to find the nitty gritty of those that built this city. Seems it has been turned over to outsiders lock stock and barrel. It is therefore cold as attempting to break into new circles is complicated by the ethnic mix and for others the simple fact you are an unknown. Restaurants? Fantastic. World class. Hole in the walls. Fantastic. World Class. Nothing you cannot find. Food trucks add to the variety. Simply outstanding. Better Chinese food locally than anywhere in North America. Some from Hong Kong say even better than Hong Kong. Maybe a stretch but great regardless. Traffic is a joke. Bike lanes totally mess up downtown manuverability. Stores are unattractive. The entertainment area interesting but pedestrian at best.A city looking for an identity. Trust it is found. Too beautiful to remain unsure what it is.

title: Good place to wander
reviews: Nice downtown to wander around, grab a bite to eat, and to shop. Deserted on the weekend, but it was a cold day. I always love a trip to Vancouver.

title: Love this area
reviews: Vibrant, contemporary,  with tons to see and do. With views of the mountains and water all around, this is a great downtown.

title: Practical - but without personality.
reviews: Too modern and artificial: it lacks some personality. However it's clean and well organised, with plenty of shops, restaurants and services.

title: My Vancouver trip
reviews: Nice place, food and people. I really like Stanley Park. I would love to visit again and spend more time.

title: Clean and lots to do!
reviews: Having used to downtown in America we weren‚Äôt sure about going out at night. Not to worry our concierge said and he was right! Lots of places to eat and helpful locals!

title: A beautiful city of skyscrapers surrounded by GREEN
reviews: How did this beautiful city stay off my radar for so long? We visited in January 2019 and were blessed with beautiful weather (it only rained twice in the whole week) and kindness everywhere.  Great food and wonderful experiences: Granville Island Market, the water ferry along False Creek, Capilano Suspension Bridge day trip, Biking at Stanley Park along the wall. We walked everywhere and took the train when we needed to. Everything was easily accessible and clean. The Public library is an architectural wonder. Our hotel suite at Rosedale on Robson was in a great location. This city is on your bucket list, you just don't know it yet!!

title: Buzzing city Centre
reviews: I'm not really a city person but loved Vancouver. Lively, clean, cosmopolitan and so, so friendly. If you're hungry, there's plenty of eateries.

title: Ok
reviews: Ok but not one of the cleanest citiesA few homeless on the streetsUsual skyscrapers A lot Of designers names shops

title: It's scenic and so much to see and do
reviews: I was born in Vancouver but live in Delta and I always discover something new to see and do when we venture in to the downtown core. We rented bikes for the first time and rode around the sea wall and we tried some new restaurants. We love it so much we stay downtown for a weekend every year on our anniversary.  I never tire of this city

title: Great shopping in the city
reviews: Busy city with lots of shopping and restaurants.  Blocks are easy to navigate when walking but driving was harder due to the one way streets and street parking was hard to find.

title: Magnificent Cosmopolitan City Surrounded by Nature's Beauty
reviews: I have been to Vancouver twice.  The first time (many years ago) I was on vacation for 3 days after visiting Victoria.   It is such a beautiful city against the backdrop of those mountains!  We had perfect weather, great for walking around and exp!oring.  Gastown was one of my favorite areas.  Chinatown was also impressive with great restaurants.  We took a side strip to Grouse Mountain and Capilano Suspension bridge (yes, I made it across!).  The second time we visited it rained.

title: Any regular Downtown!
reviews: There are nice stores and basically clean, but, the homeless population is really high, it is not as high as San Francisco.  NY may have higher homeless population, but it is way bigger than Vancouver and density is low. I was not walked through LA so I have no idea. In my opinion Vancouver has too many young homeless, so it is really bothering. It makes you embarrassed and ashamed to be a human. We really need to find a solution to it. Of course, it is not a fault, but it should not be like this. The city is safe, clean and there are too many things to do or see. I wish we all had help to solve this homelessness epidemic. It is our whole generation open wound. Other than that Downtown Vancouver is one of the must see town in the world.

title: Nice walk
reviews: Is nice walk around and to see all the stores and shops Also plenty of food restaurants and fast food A few souvenir stores And lots of homeless people we bought food for them. That part very sad

title: Stunning city with majestic and panoramic mountain and ocean views!
reviews: Vancouver is an amazingly beautiful city with stunning views, as well as a nice variety of activities -- Stanley Park and the waterfront  areas offer great places to walk or hike or bike, while the city has an abundance of restaurants, especially in Yale Town and Gas Town....

title: A day in Vancouver
reviews: Vancouver is a very beautiful, took an off/on sightseeing tour. So many beautiful places to see, the park route was so nice. But was there only for one day. Would love to back and stay at least a week.

title: Great Visit
reviews: Always love Downtown Vancouver, tops of shops and restaurants. I highly recommend coming here when you're in Vancouver.

title: The great pleasure of Vancouver is walking...
reviews: When you visit Vancouver there is no way to see it better than walking. And there are so many areas to explore, each with a distinctive character. Most people consider the piece of Vancouver that sticks out from Main Street to Stanley Park "downtown." It's not where City Hall or the Vancouver Gen'l Hospital or UBC sit - each has its own 'hood. Downtown is where the Vancouver Gallery (the City's main art gallery) sits. It's where you'll find Canada Place, Coal Harbor, English Bay, Stanley Park, Robson, Denman, Chinatown, Science World, Sun Yat Sen Garden and dozens of other places worth exploring. But do it by food. Or bike. Rent a bike to cruise from Coal Harbor from Canada Place around Prospect Point, and over to English Bay is to go from City to Seascape and an old growth forest all without leaving the heart of the town.Go to the lovely Sun Yat Sen Garden and then get world-class dim sum nearby.Take a walk along False Creek from Science World to English Bay - grab a water taxi & cross over to Granville Island, hoof it back to Olympic Village for a bite or a brew. Or take the Seabus scross from Canada Place to North Vancouver - one fare can take you from the heart of the City to the foot of Grouse Mountain.The options are endless: just pick a starting point, an end point, and wear some good shoes!

title: A Delightful City
reviews: We walked through downtown Vancouver several times. What a beautiful city. Of course the waterfront is spectacular. We met a very friendly lady who practically became our tour guide. She pointed us in the right direction to make sure we wouldn't miss any important parts. Absolutely love this city.

title: Bluebird Day
reviews: We walked for miles and enjoyed the sunshine and the sitelines.  Beautiful harbour - ships, helicopters, Ferries and seaplanes.

title: Love it
reviews: The Vancouver downtown area is fun and interesting. Lots of unique stores. I particularly like the Robison Street area.

title: Busy streets but fun to walk around
reviews: I spent the day just walking around, it was very enjoyable. There is a lot of traffic but you can easily cross streets when the crossing signal tells you to. Plenty of cool things to see and places to visit or grab a bite to eat.

title: We will definitely be returning
reviews: lots to see, lots to do, lots to eat, lots to buy, lots of windows to shop, beautiful stores, decorated streets

title: So much to see
reviews: Vancouver downtown is a must. So much shopping at Pacific Centre and many restaurants, spas and coffee shops. Within walking distance to many areas.

title: clean and beautiful scenery city Ê∏ÖÊΩîÊÑü„ÅÆ„ÅÇ„ÇãÁæé„Åó„ÅÑÊôØËâ≤„ÅÆ„Åæ„Å°
reviews: Although it is the heart of city, mostly clean and keeping beautiful atmosphere.Maybe be because of a lot of trees and colorful building are  throughout in the city. We could see mountain and ocean with modern city scenery.‰∏≠ÂøÉÂú∞„Åß„ÅÇ„Çä„Å™„Åå„Çâ„ÄÅÊéÉÈô§„ÅåË°å„ÅçÂ±ä„ÅÑ„ÅüÁ∂∫È∫ó„Å™Ë°ó„ÅÆÂç∞Ë±°„Å®Ëâ≤„Å®„Çä„Å©„Çä„ÅÆÂª∫Áâ©„Å®Êú®„ÄÖ„Å´Âõ≤„Åæ„Çå„Åü„Ç¢„Éº„Éê„É≥„Ç∑„ÉÜ„Ç£„ÄÇ‰Ωï„Å®Ë®Ä„Å£„Å¶„ÇÇ„Åµ„Å®Ë¶ã‰∏ä„Åí„Çã„Å®Â±±„ÄÖ„Å´Âõ≤„Åæ„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÄÅ„Åï„Çâ„Å´Êµ∑„Åæ„ÅßË¶ã„Åà„Çã„ÅÆ„ÄÇÈÉΩ‰ºöÁöÑ„Å™ÊôØË¶≥„Å®„ÅÆ„Ç≥„É≥„Éà„É©„Çπ„Éà„ÅåÈùûÂ∏∏„Å´„Çà„Åè„ÅÑ„Çã„Å†„Åë„ÅßÂøÉÂú∞„ÅÆËâØ„ÅÑË°ó„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ

title: expensive
reviews: nothing is cheap in DT vancouver. entertainmen and food is all a premium. But you won't find a better variety of food.

title: Unbelievable experience, no match to any other city of the world.
reviews: Vancouver is a great lovely and scenic city. Must visit once in lifetime. Pleasant climate & vibrant.

title: Most beautiful city in the world
reviews: Spectacular scenery from every corner of the city.  Amazing walking and biking trails along the ocean.Great Asian restaurant. Ski mountains within 20 min drive from city.  Subway from airport to city centre.  This city has it all.  Should be in everyone‚Äôs bucket list.

title: Beautiful City!
reviews: We loved walking downtown Vancouver. There is a great selection of restaurants and shops. The city is clean and beautiful with great views of the water and mountains. We visited CF Pacific Centre which a mall located partially underground. If you are from USA , Ever New is a boutique not located in the USA. I found a great mother of the bride dress for my daughter's wedding there. Friendly, helpful staff. Great sales. We walked from downtown to the Gastown district, another great area with a different vibe

title: World class
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a good distance from where we live and depending on the time of day can be a pain in the butt for traffic. However the trip is well worth it if you can spend the day park your vehicle somewhere and walk around downtown. The glass towers, boutique shopping, and unlimited variety of restaurants make it all worthwhile.

title: Perfect
reviews: If you‚Äôre the kind of person who loves to get the busy city vibe , while trying different shops and eating different cuisines, then this is it! You will find almost anything in this area, grocery stores, gift shops, cafes restaurants and spas!

title: Beautiful cosmopolitan city
reviews: Vancouver is truly the gem of the Pacific Northwest.  Surrounded by water with mountains facing you, the city surroundings are spectacular.  The city has plenty to offer between culture, sporting events, restaurants, and shopping.

title: A safe and beautiful downtown
reviews: A safe and beautiful downtown area with glass buildings ocean, mountains and on summer days a clear blue sky. The transit system is very efficient and clean. Good shopping on Robson Street and Canada Place is very cool.

title: New year's Day
reviews: Nice dry day to spend in downtown Vancouver. Lots to see while walking the streets. Would recommend to get full feel of city and its different offerings.

title: I ‚ù§Ô∏è Vancouver
reviews: Mid town, downtown or Gas Town.  I loved Vancouver.  The food, the people and the city.  Take a trip and enjoy!

title: Very walkeable city center
reviews: The highlights in downtown can be visited easily on foot. Distances are not to big so in a few hours you can visit Jack Pool Plaza, Chinatown and Gastown.

title: It has everything you want
reviews: It has everything from high end to budget. Food options are a plenty. Easy to walk and get a cab or public transport. A great place to grab everything for the snow at way less a than overseas prices.Awesome place to stay

title: Out for Dinner!
reviews: We came downtown for a night out, which turned out to be a fun time! Stopped at a casino and also had dinner at one of the local restaurants. Suggest to everyone take the SkyTrain into the downtown area.

title: Cosmopolitan and entertaining
reviews: During a recent two month stay in the West end of Vancouver I was entertained and interested in the many shopping and restaurant venues. The West End is one of the most highly populated areas in Canada and its a treat for anyone who‚Äôs a people watcher like I. Shopping venues cover  everything from high end venues to thrift stores and the choice of restaurants covers every palate and pocketbook. To top it off downtown Vancouver is surrounded by mountain and ocean vistas. Highly recommend a visit to this wonderful city.

title: Fantastic City in December!
reviews: So much to do, and experience here in December.  Great Christmas Market, sea planes, Granville island, the stream clock, and so much more!  Remember there is no Bad Weather, only Bad Clothing!  Dress for the cold and for the rain!  Then go out and have a blast. Taxi drivers are worthless here. They hardly know the city, and are very expensive!  Walk the city, or take public transportation!  I lay way to go!!

title: P!NK Concert and a shady Airbnb at 565 Smithe Street
reviews: Wonderful visit to Vancouver for the first time.   The weather was awesome, P!NK was amazing, the people were all very friendly.   We stayed in an Airbnb that was overpriced and not very clean.  (Disgusting black hairs in the shower, a smoke alarm that beeped all night long and a host that wasn‚Äôt accommodating and willing to make our stay any better or compensate for the  inconveniences.) Our first Airbnb experience.  I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôd do that again.  The Airbnb was all hush hush about the location and we were instructed not to tell anyone that the condo we stayed in at 565 Smithe Street on the 10th floor was in fact an Airbnb.  The host (Kiera) made it clear that we were not to speak to the concierge at all.      The location was awesome however, right in the heart of downtown.  The trip was fun and we really enjoyed the City and the people aside from that Airbnb.

title: Gem in the Pacific northwest
reviews: Very nice place to visit and stay, Christmas time is nice like old nyc, downtown has numerous chain hotels for stay, tram n bus, no uber/lyft services

title: An exciting Cosmopolitan City
reviews: This is a very walkable city.  Visit Chinatown, Yaletown, Gastown.  Don't miss the steam clock that chimes every 15 minutes.  Best to see and hear on the hour if your schedule permits.  Fabulous Library and waterfront along Burrard Inlet..

title: Fabulous festive fun
reviews: We are here for Xmas parties and the downtown hotels and the festive decorations are so festive !  The Hyatt hotel has an amazing ginger bread display. Most hotel lobbies are festive and decorated beautifully.

title: West Coast beauty!
reviews: Enjoyed the beautiful sea wall, all the stores and restaurants, pubs around! Locals were very warm people. A must go place when you're in Vancouver!

title: Livable downtown
reviews: Unlike some larger cities where the downtown business district shuts down, Vancouver does not.  It is home to many highrise dwellers which if you are lucky enough you can walk to work but likely live in smaller accommodations without children.  Those with children tend to try to get more space and likely end out in the suburbs.  Downtown is safe to walk day or night and fairly clean.  Durin the summer some parts of Granville or Robson street is closed to vehicles to make it more safer for the increased volume of pedestrians.  There is shopping, restaurants, movie and performance theatres, night clubs, hotels, and smaller grocery stores.  You can get away from having a vehicle and walk to all your self care services but could take the transit system to get around or rent a bicycle or vehicle. Not far is the seawall where you can walk, ride your bike or rollerblade around town, just beautiful if only you can do one thing to check out our city.

title: a sunny day on the first day of spring
reviews: While all of us tourists were bundled up walking along the beach, the natives were actually sunbathing on this rare, super sunny day on the actual first day of spring. I liked the entire downtown area, went to theatre (excellent), the university (where I had to be for a conference), and long walks with friends who know the city. It is really a lovely place. And yes, Canadians are very friendly!!!

title: Shopping and Dining
reviews: Lots of shops to explore and food for all cultures and tastes. A very walkable district with lots of sights along the way. Great for the whole family

title: Just love the diversity!
reviews: If there is a place where you can be free, it is Vancouver. You will find people from all ages, nationalities and styles walking down the street.

title: Still a great town
reviews: We stayed in Vancouver for three nights.  Downtown is great to walk around.  The shopping is amazing and everything is a short walk or a quick cab ride away.  When the sun comes out the views are amazing!!

title: Fun City
reviews: Busy downtown area with tons of shops & restaurants. Very easy to walk around. Felt safe everywhere. Cool harbor & architecture.

title: Nice place
reviews: Nice place and City to stay. Unfortunately a lot of people live on the street. They do not look very dangerous, but because you do not expect this, it is a special experience!

title: Vancouver downtown is wonderful
reviews: Spent close to a week in downtown Vancouver, hitting a lot of the tourists spots, and trying out many restaurants.  After our first day of rain, we were very lucky (for November) to have 4 days of sun, and mild temperatures.  There are quite a few homeless people with drug or alcohol problems in certain areas, but although sad to see, we certainly weren't hassled by anyone.  The downtown is so beautiful, and almost completely surrounded by water, it's amazing!  We've recently retired and are considering coming back to visit for a few weeks each year, as a break from our colder Ontario winter.  Overall, used the Hop on - Hop off transportation, the ferry to North Vancouver, and did a lot of walking to see all of the interesting spots in downtown Vancouver.  We love you Vancouver, and we'll be back!

title: A true world city
reviews: Love Vancouver, probably one of the most beautiful cities in the world.  It has a cosmopolitan feel.  World class restaurants, markets, museums, music and plays, distinct neighborhoods, efficient transportation and jaw dropping beauty.  And just down right friendly people....love Vancouver.

title: When the weather is good, this is one of the best places for a romantic weekend
reviews: I extended a business trip over a weekend, and brought my husband up with me for a romantic getaway. The city is beautiful, clean, young and vibrant, and excitingly diverse. There‚Äôs good shopping and EXCELLENT food (didn‚Äôt have a bad meal).  It feels safe, and has a lot to do both outdoor and indoor. You can walk for miles and get lost in the beauty of the city, and if the weather is good, you should.

title: Lovely area and you have free WIFI
reviews: Lovely area and you have free WIFI The city is exciting and enjoyable. There are so many activities available.

title: Must visit
reviews: If you‚Äôre travelling to Vancouver, exploring the downtown core with great museums, shops, restaurants & nearby Oceanside is an absolute must!

title: Under whelming
reviews: I really enjoyed my trip to Vancouver. However, downtown didn't greatly impress me. Its shopping was either very expensive or very cheap, with little in between. I found a pair of men's shoes in the Holt Renfrew department store for just cad $5,250! En route by taxi to the airport, I passed the shops on South Granville Street. This area seemed to be much livelier.

title: Wonderful Shopping & Restaurants
reviews: Downtown has plenty to explore. Both a traditional and trendy area. We shopped and explored restaurants day and night. Expect drizzly days and bring a light raincoat this time of the year.

title: George
reviews: Its Vancouver one of the best cities in the world. The food is great and getting around is easy. The park, granville island, the seawall all a must. Just go if u can.

title: A World Class City
reviews: Loved Vancouver from the minute I  got there. Took the train from airport to downtown stop. From there is was a short walk to my hotel. The downtown core is very well organised with wide streets and considerate people. I was very lucky to get good weather on 5 of my 8 days there (in November) - thank you Global Warming.... I think.The area around downtown - including Gastown, Yaletown, Mt. Pleasant and Kitsilano are all very nice. Gastown is very hip and busy, Yaletown an upscale mix of residential and retail while Kits has a relaxed vibe. If you like to walk, bring your running shoes. You can get to all the above places on foot and enjoy tremendous views of the city. Stanley Park is not to be missed either.  Cross Lion Gate bridge if you have no fear of heights.Very good food, the coffee is generally too bitter for my liking (but clearly the locals like it like that). Excellent shopping - I got lucky again in that more than half the shops had 30 to 40% discount while I was there. The city is very green - which I appreciate. Excellent public transport system, bike share and car share (Car2Go) programs as well as recycling bins everywhere. The air is about as clean as you can ask for in a large to medium size city. The tap water is delicious.  Plenty of healthy vegetarian food options and tons of good Asian food.Amazing views from my hotel room - I highly recommend the Blue Horizon Hotel for good location, efficient staff and those views. Ask for a room on a higher floor.I‚Äôve travelled a fair bit and my impression till now was that Rio de Janeiro is the most beautiful city. Vancouver clearly gives it a run for the money in a very clean, organised environment.It‚Äôs clear why V is deservedly ranked top 10 best city in the world for quality of life.‚Äù

title: Restaurantes and eating places
reviews: People are very friendly, very helpful and easy going. We were directed to a really good food court that was in a office building underground.  It has a full selection of different types of food.

title: Walkable, beautiful and plenty to see/do
reviews: We spent a week visiting Vancouver. It was filled with a very walkable city with friendly people, great shopping, and an incredible choice of restaurants.The tine flew by! Highlights included the small theatre's scene. We attended 4 live performances, each was well done and provided thoughtful, enjoyable entertainment. We walked an average of 5 miles a day although it did rain 4 of the 7 days. Our visit was not the best weather time in the city. The people we met and friends we visited really is what stood out the most. Great people, plenty of things to do, food that is top notch what more do you need to enjoy being alive?

title: Vancouver Stinks
reviews: Visiting the City to show friends and found the city stinks of marijuana ....god awful smell everywhere ...if visiting bring a mask you see mountains and expect a fresh clean smell .... not happening thanks to Justin T and his liberal party ....

title: Fun to Walk Around in the Lively Parts of the City
reviews: I like to walk, and walking around downtown Vancouver is enjoyable.  Aside from East Hastings St,, it feels safe and is alive.  Some of the streets in the middle of the city are mostly residential, some of which are high rise condos.  Other streets are lively with businesses, restaurants, shops and whatever.  From downtown it is not too far to walk to Stanley park, English Bay, or Canada Place.  Not too far doesn't mean a couple of blocks but rather a couple of kilometers, depending on where one is.

title: Always Exciting, Even In The Rain
reviews: Tourists who are transferring through Vancouver (say, airport to cruise ship) should seriously plan to spend a half-day, or even a day, checking out the downtown area. Typical CBD (central business district) with people rushing everywhere, a VERY helpful tourist bureau to assist with your particular interest, and some stunning views of the inlet on the north. Add in some great shops and restaurants, and I believe you will find it a great addition to your trip. As one who lives a short distance away, I must say I enjoy the sights 2-3 times a year - difficult to get tired of this place.

title: Lovely downtown
reviews: It‚Äôs so easy to walk anywhere downtown. I was working near the airport and decided to come downtown. The skyline is gorgeous. So many buildings are interesting from an architectural point of view. You feel safe. Stop someone and they‚Äôll gladly give you directions. A great city to walk.

title: 1st time in Vancouver
reviews: Wonderful place to see although lots of buses to get around and hop on hop off available we did a lot of walking had our cousin who lives in Vancouver showing us around lovely city didn't feel threatened laid back atmosphere found Canadians so polite was wonderful plenty to see down on waterfront along coal harbour watching Sea planes land and take off very nice well worth it.

title: A spectacular city!
reviews: Everyone should visit Vancouver once in their life! A wonderful city to experience Canadian culture, food & history. With incredible water views all over the city this is a great city to just walk, explore k get lost to find something fun around so many corners!

title: Residence inn Marriott
reviews: Beautiful hotel great location and very spacious!Each room has a mini full kitchen and couch or a balcony with patio table and chairs

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Vancouver is a very beautiful city, and nice nature around. It is worth a visit, and I will for sure come back.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Beautiful city.  Excellent transportation around the city.  There are areas that are heavily populated with homeless people.  they are harmless.

title: Awesome city of Many sights!
reviews: We absolutely love Vancouver; originally from New York we love a city that we can walk around and see so many sights. Downtown near the water has a bicycle and pedestrian walk way that works well! We traveled on the Hop On Hop off bus for two days, visiting so many areas. The unfortunate thing about the trip was the wildfires didnt allow us to see the beauty of the mountains however we made the best of it. There are shops and eateries in all areas of downtown. Highly recommend visiting for at least 3 days.

title: Vibrant and interesting city
reviews: I stated in downtown Vancouver and the city was alive and interesting. There is a big problem with street homeless people so it is best to have your wits about you but as a lone woman I never felt afraid or threatened.

title: Compact and fun
reviews: Lots of shops, hotels, bars, restaurants.  Varying quaities and prices though.  Small enough to walk around and well-located near the waterfront.

title: We will be back
reviews: With out a doubt Vancouver is a great city from shopping to mountain views Stanley Park and plenty of places to eat.Watch sea planes and boats close by.Easy to walk and cycle around , dedicated bike lanes.Almost as good as Melbourne .

title: Shopping
reviews: This place was busy, and also had beggars and scary people. I really did not shop much, but you can ger=t good buys.

title: Love the town
reviews: Vancouver has a very little viable downtown and there is nothing better than a few days at your favourite hotel.  The restaurants are excellent and plentiful.  You can walk most of the city easily, which is good because the cab service stinks.Safe place anywhere and the reputation for rainy weather is not right, as there are a lot of really nice days at all times of year.

title: One of the best cities ever
reviews: Downtown is riveting to say the least, u can shop from city centre malls , lot of places to eat . Public transport is one of the best, great fun.

title: The Heart of a Great City
reviews: One of the nicest Downtowns probably in the world. You are in the centre of this big city with shining towers and beautiful storefronts and yet there are not many people to jostle you or tae away your joy of looking. This Downtown with a variety of restaurants and bars representing the cuisines of the world, is never far away from the water. The views of the Rocky Mountains close by seem to beckon. The residents are warm and helpful and generally considerate of others. We lived in an apartment there for 2 weeks but never felt the pressures of a big city.

title: NO UBER/LYFT IMPOSSIBLE everything else 5 Stars. Won‚Äôt be back till Uber is online.
reviews: Had an absolutely wonderful trip to Vancouver. Awesome people, the best food I‚Äôve had in Canada and no shortage of things to do. One major problem, IMPOSSIBLE to get around. There is NO UBER and NO LYFT in this city. After every amazing experience we spent horrific amount of time messing around trying to get a taxi. On the phone waiting on hold, or navigating without mercy one of the terrible taxi apps. Absolutely unbelievable. Just another example of Canadian government ruining people‚Äôs lives. Can‚Äôt wait to try to enjoy this city again when ride sharing is online. Good luck till then, thoughts and prayers go out to all dealing with this issue.

title: Such a beautiful city
reviews: We snuck in as much as we could in our 3 full days in Vancouver. What a beautiful city. Skyline was amazing from various locations around the city. The weather was spectacular. Can‚Äôt wait to come back. Definitely do Stanley Park, Capilano Bridge, Grouse Mountain, Lonsdale Quay, Gastown, On Top of Vancouver.  Such a beautiful city

title: Something for everyone
reviews: Very walkable city with great dining choices, movie theater, shops, parks, an awesome bikeable Stanley Park, and other points of interest. My second time visiting this city and will look forward to returning.

title: Come and Visit Vancouver
reviews: Vancouver has lots of things to offer travelers and tourist.  Whether you are here to visit friends or relatives there are lots of interesting to see and do.  Vancouver is a safe place to visit.  There are lots of shopping and good restaurants.  There are lots of parks and mountains to visit.  Stanly park and Queen Elizabeth park are just one of the few you should visit when you are in town.  Gastown, Gross Mountain, China town, West Vancouver, North Vancouver etc. are just a few places to see.  For people who like to shop and dine, Vancouver is the perfect place to be.  Robson street has lots of shops and there is also the Park Royal mall in West Vancouver.  For restaurant all kinds of food are available in Vancouver.  If you like western or Chinese or Indian food, Vancouver is the place to be.  Lots of good Chinese restaurants are here in Vancouver.  Going around downtown is easy. You can take the trains or the bus or the sea bus to North Vancouver or take the Canada line to Richmond where you can fine lots of Chinese Restaurants here.  If you are looking for places to visit, Vancouver should be on your list to visit.

title: Beautiful
reviews: Took a while to adjust to the street signs.  But I loved walking around. Robson street is where a lot of great shops are.  Very clean air and the traffic are chilled.  I didn't hear one car beep.

title: Everything here!
reviews: Downtown is the hearth of Vancouver. It is clean and pretty with lots of green areas.  All stores and restaurants are located within walking distance so it is very convenient but expensive to stay in downtown for your holidays,

title: Conference and visit to the city
reviews: We came for a conference but also to enjoy the city. The city has several neighborhood within blocks of each other. People walk everywhere, ride bikes, take buses, or trains. You can take a taxi but they are expensive and driving a car get expensive to park and the congestion on the roads is crazy. It‚Äôs a beautiful city with a lot of culture. Sea plans fly in and out constantly.

title: Busy place
reviews: So many people.  Tons of shopping and endless places to eat.  There is a lot of homelessness and people smoking pot, but we never felt unsafe.  For a big city, I thought it was fairly clean.  The staff at IGA on Richards Street were so friendly.

title: Christmas and New Year with Family
reviews: We travelled to Vancouver for Christmas and New Year with our son who was working out there. what can I say but it  is a fabulous place. Prices are relatively high for Canada, but the people are fantastic. Gas Town is a must see as well as Stanley Park. We drove up to Whistler for the day, and the drive there was beautiful. The only down side was the drive back in a blizzard, but you can't criticise a place for the weather.The Sea to Sky Gondola is another place you cannot ignore, the views are out of this world. Would love to go back in the summer.

title: Downtown delight
reviews: Downtown - traditionally just away from the glitzy part of most cities. In thVancouver it is the area inside Georgia & Robson streets and the False creek. Lots of nightlife and eateries in this area with some hidden gems among too. As our Hotel was on the west side of the central shopping area, we became familiar with this part of Vancouver. Walking, with a map and good walkers,is the best way to explore this area to find your niches!! Enjoy.

title: Fun
reviews: We definitely enjoyed checking out downtown Vancouver with it's towering skyscrapers and harbor views.

title: Mixed opinions
reviews: We enjoyed our trip to Vancouver. On our first morning we went out in to the city to look for somewhere to have breakfast, but honestly the centre looks dirty and not very appealing.
