There are loads of homeless people sleeping on the streets, some, not all very high on drugs just going round in circles or shouting out at anyone passing by.  It really put us off going out in the centre. We even heard gun shots when visiting the Chinese garden and later found out someone had been killed just a few blocks away. Down by Canada Place and Stanley Park is completely different and we tended to visit places out with the city centre because of this.

title: Worth the time to stoll.
reviews: Lots of places to shop and window shop. souvenier shops aplenty. Had a couple of days to have a decent look. Only problem is the same all over Vancouver is that there a lot of homeless in the paths.

title: Lovely area to stroll around
reviews: Hubby and I had a few hours spare whilst waiting for a pick up back to Vancouver airport.  We had a lovely stroll along the embankment which is really well kept and so clean and tidy.  No smoking or vaping allowed all throughout the park land.  We walked right along and almost went into Stanley Park but we started running out of time so we turned around and came back.  Make sure you read the plaques along the route as they are very interesting.

title: Beautiful views
reviews: Beautiful views around the port.Great shopping from high end fashion like Gucci yo hidden gems like the rock shop.Where you can get well your favorite rock bands memorabilia

title: Don‚Äôt miss the walk along the waterfront
reviews: Once you have explored the hustle and bustle of Downtown, head for the walkway that starts at Canada Place and just keep walking. This walkway goes, I believe, for something like 17km. You just walk and look, it is so scenic, sea planes take off and land, ships go by - great place to walk off your lunch - or stop along the way and buy lunch.

title: Friendly city
reviews: A city where the hospitality of canadians Is most remarkable, where respect and concern for neighbors and visitors is first in line Stanley Park and Vancouver Island, with the city of Victoria, the capital of British Columbia,  are two places everyone should visit. Next to Victoria is one of the most beautiful garden you can ever see, The Butchart Gardens, with a very nice story of its origin

title: Lovely area
reviews: Lovely area with great shops and restaurants. Use Robson Street as your centre guide and explore the streets off it. Plenty of places to drink and eat.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: On recent layover in Vancouver we visited or went through Downtown Vancouver. Pleasantly surprised with the place not as busy as assumed. Great public transport system, weren't waiting long and no long queues or crammed. Clean streets not overly busy with pedestrians that couldve been because we there on a Sunday but even so there were plenty of people just out and about.

title: Great walking city with lots to explore
reviews: Love walking from the Downtown core (Burrard and Georgia) down to the waterfront/Canada Place and then head East to Gastown.   Head South out of Gastown along Cambie street and go for dinner in the Yaletown area (20 min walk away).

title: Downtown City Walk
reviews: Vancouver is a vibrant city, with many highlights and ease of transportation with abundant subways, buses, and tour offerings,.  There are restaurants that can accommodate any tastes and eclectic shops that will draw you in with their beautiful storefronts and artistic displays and unique items.  Not to be missed is a visit to the steam powered clock downtown, a replica of the Roman Coliseum near the cruise port  and unique architecture that hearkens back to the late 1800's early 1900's.   Worthy of a stop is the famous city market which is waterfront, a boat tour while your there, and a side trip to botanical gardens that offers a spectacular view of the Vancouver skyline.  For history buffs, there are tours available that take you on visits to some of the famous old bars where unsuspecting visitors would be shanghaied as crew through secret door and tunnels. Vancouver has many art  and street festivals throughout the year.  Wherever you travel, Visitors would be well advised to take a lightweight jacket or windbreaker with them at all times of year, as it can get both windy and chilly  there - even in summer..  I forgot mine, but was glad to find a nice 'Vancouver'  jacket that was fleece lined and very modestly priced.

title: Easy walking
reviews: You can see a lot just by walking around. Impressive how it doesn't feel crowded with so many people living in downtown. Lots of greenery and some lovely old architecture.

title: Summer stroll
reviews: Wonderful city that‚Äôs has grown so much since my last visit 17 years ago. The wonderful harbour and the spectrum of shops and restaurants. Robson street for the shops etc. Ample of Car parks. Worth a visit.

title: Trendy
reviews: A buzz of activity - high end shops  plenty of souvenirs and lots of restaurants and coffee shops. Great place to stroll and get the lay of the land.

title: Nothing unique but easy to get around and plenty of options to spend.
reviews: Robson street has all the major outlets plus a few local shops with plenty of restaurants and cafes in close proximity, so if you want to shop it is only a few minutes walk from the harbour and most CBD hotels.

title: Amazing views & architecture
reviews: Downtown area is quite walkable with impressive skyscrapers and older buildings all around. Fairmont Hotel is a beautiful structure. Be sure to take lift to top of Vancouver Lookout in the Harbour Centre for fantastic views. The downtown area is easy walking distance from Gastown and Canada Place where the cruise ships dock.Also not to be missed on weekdays is the art deco Marine building from 1930. You can only go in the ground floor foyer (lobby) area as the building is full of private businesses but it is well worth seeing for the beautiful artwork and decor.

title: Can always find a great view
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is easy to get around. From the centre of downtown look north and you‚Äôll find a view of the mountains, look west and you‚Äôll see Stanley Park. The streets are easy to navigate and because it‚Äôs built on a hill you are often in an elevated position to see the local scenery outside of the downtown core. You can move around on foot or by bus or Skytrian.

title: Bicyclists, Walkers, Cars, Trucks, Horn blowers, busy busy
reviews: The Downtown Vancouver area is an experience not to be missed. A growing metropolis and a rich diversity of cultures and lifestyles seems to be a magnet for folks.  We arrived one day prior to our cruise which was a good choice. This last weekend in September supplied us with many photo opportunities of the autumn leaves.  The Trump International Hotel on Georgia Street was also a great pick. Close to many restaurants and shopping.

title: Robson Road Rocks
reviews: The high end district. Many choices of food shops as well as fashion shopping. Put your walking shoes on. It‚Äôs 5 minutes from the bay so easy walk to the sea wall for a pleasant walk on the pedestrian path.

title: Never far from riches to rags
reviews: Ok..so everyone waxes lyrical about Vancouver and the setting is pure poetry..but here's the thing. Venture more than a couple of blocks  Downtown and you step from wealth to poverty. I was struck by the sheer number of rough sleepers and destitute looking people hanging around on the edge of Chinatown and Gastown ..Main Street in particular. I'm not saying others cities do t also have their problems but it seemed exaggerated in such a small city centre. Having said that this is a vibrant and diverse place where you can embrace different cultures at every step. Some impressive new buildings make this a dynamic skyline with its beautiful bay fringed by hills and no shortage of pedestrian friendly walkways including Stanley Bay. The suburban sprawl makes this appear a much bigger city than it is  . With first rate public  transport system which is clean and cheap there's no excuse for not fully exploring this booming city.

title: Plenty to see
reviews: Do the hop on hop off bus and take on all the downtown has to offer. Something for everyone and great shopping. The girls in particular enjoyed Robson Street.

title: Getting around is a breeze.
reviews: Getting around the downtown is a breeze. Well served by a network of sky train and buses. With the help of Google map and compass card one can navigate the city with ease.

title: Busy and hectic but beautiful
reviews: The downtown Vancouver is full of energy and people. There are lots of things go see and do what a beautiful waterfront.  Great restaurants. There are shops everywhere. It is a favorite spot in Canada. Lots of beautiful scenery to explore from Whistler to Olympic Village to the islands along the coast

title: Build a few shelters please!
reviews: Bustling downtown marred by homeless sleeping on almost every corner. Not belligerent but very young and most likely drugged out. Like SF, it's a depressing sight.

title: Not so great anymore
reviews: I‚Äôve been to Vancouver three times over the last 30 years.  Unfortunately, it seems to be loosing its charm.  Too much traffic, huge homeless population, and trash.

title: The busy impersonal London of the Pacific.
reviews: I suppose even a beautiful huge nature country like Canada needs to have its opposite antidote. Downtown Vancouver totally qualifies. Walls of stone,concrete and glass. People who's eyelids and thumbs have grown onto their cell phones. Bus drivers who wish their buses were empty. Starbucks where they charge even more than usual for their chemicoffee and of course plenty of shops to entice the happy spender. All in all, just another big commercial city which has totally lost touch with its roots and humane reality.

title: Historic Street
reviews: Our visit to Gastown was very enjoyable, with a good range of shops and coffee shops. Busy quaint street well worth a visit. Look out for the steam clock, it plays a tune on the quarter hour. Downside too many down and out people which we felt sorry for walking down the street or lying on the pavement not a good impression for tourists more needs to be done to help these homeless people. It is sad that they are the forgotten people of the city in this day and age.

title: Very busy but well organised city
reviews: We visited for just a couple of days and loved it.  So much to do, Granville Island, Grouse mountain (a must do), Stanley Park etc etc.  Beautiful scenery surrounding it and the weather was perfect.  It is busy but nothing like London. They have the traffic and pedestrian crossings down to a T and it all runs so smoothly. We look forward to visiting again.

title: Typical of big city.
reviews: Typical of a big city. We didn't like this area as much as the other areas, as there weren't as many retail shops.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: From Gaston to Yaletown, Vancouver has a lot to offer. Great food and pubs in the area that are priced well. Best explored by foot if you're in Gastown. Get a chance to see the Steam Clock.

title: Nice city
reviews: Felt very safe in downtown Vancouver but it's possible to get crick in neck gawping at the high-rise buildings! Be careful not to go too far off piste though as crackheads and other druggies abound in certain parts. Gastown is lovely. Pretty expensive overall for eating out but Timmy Hortons is always there!

title: So much to do
reviews: Lots to do Downttown. Shopping, restaurants etc. Driving here can be tricky if you are new here. Recommended!

title: Lovely City
reviews: You should walk Vancouver and take the hop on hop off for your Gastown although I walked that too, Stanley park etc.  You will love both walking and riding.

title: Walk around downtown Vancouver
reviews: A beautiful day after getting off our ship with Norwegian Cruise Lines.  Nice walk along the waterfront and over to Gastown.

title: A lovely city
reviews: This was my first visit to Vancouver, and I was so impressed.  Lots to see and do.   A very clean city with friendly locals.  I felt very safe walking the streets, even at evenings.  A credit to the people of Vancouver

title: passing through
reviews: while visiting gastown finding had all the usual things shops,bars,places to eat.decided to go to chinatown went a couple of blocks and found what seemed to be a block for all the down and outs and junkies.One thing i could help but notice was the strong smell of weed,proably because plenty of shops sell it.

title: Homeless people everywhere.
reviews: If you don't mind being bombarded with homeless people every 5mins it's not so bad. To come to a place where homeless people are in every nook is really heart breaking. Why do they not have a place for these individuals with substance abuse issues/mental health issues? We sat in a food court ordered our food and 3 mins later had to get up to leave as one individual shot up with some kind of drugs then pulled out a knife and started cutting scabs off his leg. Not exactly something you wanna be part of while on vacation. I think they need to look at some way to assist these unwell individuals. Very sad. For this reason alone I am not sure I will ever travel to Vancouver again.

title: Wonderful Pleasant City!
reviews: I visited Vancouver in August with my husband while he was on business.  I heard great things about Vancouver but never been, growing up on the east coast, I spent my time in Toronto.  I was really impressed by the city. I live in San Francisco now and it was great to visit a place that has their act together.  You can see some homeless like another city, but here they are well maintained.  They have police walking the streets and you always feel safe.  There is a reason this city is always ranked top "Most Livable Cities" in the world.  Everywhere you look there are trees, parks, water fountains. People are very friendly and great place for shopping and eating.  We were excited to see they have a Disney Cruise that goes to Alaska out of Vancouver.  We will be back to Vancouver regularly going forward, it is my new home away from home!

title: Beautiful city, but driving to/from downtown can be hellish! Use Google Maps!!!
reviews: We sent parts of two days in the downtown area of Vancouver. It was very clean, and the buildings were attractive to look at. Getting to the cruise terminal to board a ship using a private car was extremely tricky. I'd recommend hiring a taxi, or having someone familiar with the area drop you off.

title: super downtown
reviews: Everything is here for your eating, drinking and shopping needs. Overall a clean city but there are a lot of beggars and rough sleepers.

title: Huge bustling city
reviews: I wasn't long in Vancouver so this is just an intial snapshot view. Much like most cities it's a fairly fast paced place with lots going on. I found it expensive but maybe that's just the value of the British pound. The harbour area is pretty stunning. A busy place with the sea otter taxis flying in and out, ferries, a paddle steamer and swarms of tourists. Traffic is generally a hazard so be careful when you step off a pavement! Personally I'm a confident driver but would think twice before hiring a car for a short stay. Public transport is good.The big down side for me is that the city seemed to have a real homeless problem or issue. I can only hope that they are attempting to provide for the less fortunate.

title: Vancouver Excursions
reviews: Must see places: Victoria and Butchart GardensCapilano Bridge, Grouse MountainSea to Sky and Whistler Village Cheakamus Rafting, Sea to Sky GondolaVancouver to Victoria Tour by FerryVancouver Island Cycling Tour A vast variety of ethnic foods.Traditional indian cuisine, Christian cuisine, and Muslim cuisine. Beautiful downtown.

title: Wonderful waterfront
reviews: We loved the vibe of the Vancouver area. The streets were neatly set out and easy to navigate. The waterfront was absolutely beautiful. We ate at some of the restaurants, got icecream and enjoyed a harbour cruise. We loved the vegetable gardens growing on roofs and we also loved how much recycling was featured. It was truly magical.

title: Very friendly
reviews: Unlike many major cities, Vancouver is very friendly.  Wherever you go, locals and others smile and speak.  They also line up orderly for busses which is a surprise. The town has many stores that are fashion forward.  Our favorite store however is Roots a wonderful sports clothing store.  They have high quality that we have purchased for years.  You can always find a good restaurant and cup of coffee or tea.

title: Hard to top this city
reviews: We live not too far from downtown Vancouver. But we travel a lot and have seen many of the leading cities of the world. Compared to these cities, Vancouver ranks very high in terms of natural beauty. The downtown is surrounded by ocean, beaches, a beautiful park (Stanley Park), and a harbour. Walk along English Bay, False Creek, or Coal Harbour and you will see why Vancouver has the reputation it has.

title: So much to see and do
reviews: We loved Vancouver and the Hop on Hop off bus service was perfect for exploring this easy to get around city. We spent a week in the central area and still think there was more to see.Lots of local restaurants as well as chains for inexpensive food wether breakfast, lunch or dinner.Of course there are also many high end places to eat as well.

title: Nice place to visit, but not for more than a couple of days
reviews: Only had one day in town, but felt that we saw most of the sights and wouldn't have wanted to stay a lot longer. Had a good time in the Gaslight district, with some great little restaurants and lots of fun stuff happening on the street. Went over to Granville Island for the food market, and also over to Stanley Park with stunning views of downtown. Only thing we would have enjoyed but didn't have time for was the suspension bridge

title: It gets crazy but it‚Äôs the city life
reviews: Oh men and Oh boy :) I guess it depends on the time of the day it gets busy and crazy :) Be prepared and be patient it‚Äôs worth it :)

title: Expensive
reviews: We visited for 3 days, primarily to go whale watching (wild whales were brilliant) we explores the city using clean, well organised public transport. Lots to see and do however we found the city to be very expensive. We ate in varied places. Restaurants, markets and also visited supermarkets. 2 course in an average restaurant with average food and 2 beers approx $70..single scoop ice cream $5.50 Supermarkets French stick nearly $3 dollars, small block of average cheese $7. Lovely city with lots to see however it is expensive. Glad there was only 2 of us, don't know how people afford to live here

title: Enjoyable place to walk around
reviews: Coming from Ottawa, my family felt that downtown Vancouver was as pleasant to walk around, but with a better, bigger city vibe.

title: A bit a everything for everone
reviews: My LO and I loved exploring downtown Vancouver. You can find almost everything that you desire. Easy walking, safe, excellent customer service at most stores. Lots of lovely green spaces dotted throughout the city, so it is not completely a concrete jungle.

title: Very safe
reviews: Great area with a lot of activity going on. Large selection of places to eat. Good food at reasonable prices. All type of shops from designer to gift shops. Easy place to walk round and most of all felt very safe.

title: Enjoyable City
reviews: We intentionally came into town a day early (leaving on a cruise) just to experience Vancouver.  The city appeared clean.  This city is very walkable and bicycle friendly.  There were some homeless individuals visible here and there - none were threatening or hostile.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: This is one of the cleanest and friendliest cities I have ever visited. Expensive? Yes. It was drizzly as one would expect of the Pacific NW. I brought a light jacket and did not need it. Try a hop on hop-off tour to get oriented to the city. Vibrant city, cultural and exceptional foodie town. Many wonderful sites to see and experience. I can‚Äôt wait to return.

title: Terrible Place to Drive
reviews: It's as congested as Manhattan and worse to drive around in a car. Many streets have blinking green lights meaning the side streets only have a stop sign so those drivers can cross or turn in front of you. Parking on most residential streets is next to impossible without a resident permit. Many metered spaces require coins or pay-by-phone. Many of the side streets don't go through very far, requiring you to double-back from where you just came. If walking, you need to be extremely careful of the turning cars; drivers seem to be very agressive.

title: Extremely walkable city!
reviews: You can walk from one end of downtown Vancouver to another in 30 min. Make sure to cover the Stanley park sea wall (bike ride in summer/ fall and drive in winter), Yaletown for drinks and dinner, gastown for coffee and a look at the famous steam clock, and the new convention centre. It‚Äôs safe and you can also take skytrain around the downtown core. Have fun!

title: Amazing place loved it!
reviews: We stayed with family in the Lynn Valley area but visited downtown Vancouver a lot.What an amazingly friendly place and with a back drop of snow capped mountains.The whole experience of walking locally in the woods to having a cold beer and meal in the Steamworks brewery bar was an experience to never forget.Getting a travel card  (like oyster card London) is a must.You can use it on the Sea Bus, Sky train and local buses...all excellent  services.July was wonderfully sunny/ hot do pack the sun cream at this time of year. No need to pack the woolies.I can't fit in all we did including an amazing a visit to Whistler mountains.Just if you can sometime in your life to to Vancouver, research and explore, you won't be disappointed!

title: Plenty to do
reviews: Plenty to see and do, lots of bars and restaurants around to suit all pallets, I did find that the place was inundated with Asian people and we didn‚Äôt even go to China town. We found everyone friendly, East Hastings seems to be where the homeless, drug addicts and the drunks hang around, but most , if not all cities have an area like that?Cabs and buses are plenty.Various things to visit just pick up some leaflets

title: An open and very welcoming city!
reviews: Whenever looking for an open and very welcoming bigger city in Western Canada, don‚Äôt miss the opportunity to visit Vancouver, where you will find a great quality of living. There, you permanently are next to the mountains and always close to the sea.

title: Clean, nice walkways, plenty of restaurants and shopping
reviews: We were located a few short blocks from Canada Place. We enjoyed the waterfront, restaurants and assorted gift shops. The area is clean, safe and gave us plenty to do prior to our cruise on NCL Jewel. The area in and around Canada Place can be rather hectic on cruise day, or when assorted tourists like us where waiting on the free shuttles to Capilano or Grouse Mountain, or the other bus lines offering various excursions.

title: Not a bad place
reviews: Not one of my favourite cities in the world doesn't have the X factor but a easy city to get around and laid out

title: Great downtown for a stroll - No UBER !
reviews: So this review gets 4/5 - 1 point taken away for NO Uber in this city. What's up with that !!! ??? Thankfully, the downtown is quite compact, easy to get around without too many up/downs. Robson @ Burrard s a good point to start to exploring  ... Robson streets has plenty of nice shops and yummy eateries. After that, head to Yaletown, Gastown and finally Canada Place. One of the top international city downtown for exploring "on foot"... Did I mention there is NO UBER in this city and taxis are not easy to get !!!

title: Holiday
reviews: We went to Canada Place as this is were we left for our cruise. But also on our return we went here to get the free shuttle to most of the tourist places and also the get on get off bus.

title: Little Disappointed
reviews: Considering Vancouver is into more greener I thought the streets could have been a little cleaner. I must admit for a pretty place it was a little disappointing.

title: Friends Trip
reviews: Enjoyed eating, seeing the sights, walking,  and drinking in beautiful Vancouver!  Can‚Äôt wait for our trip next year!

title: Beautiful city that celebrates diversity!
reviews: We were only in Vancouver for a day, but were really impressed with the diverse population and the opportunities for cultural enrichment, as well as Vancouver‚Äôs plans to be the ‚Äúgreenest‚Äù city in North America by 2020. Beautiful seaport and convention center. Public transportation was plentiful.

title: Most beautiful city in Canada
reviews: There is a reason why this city is expensive - most beautiful things are.But very reasonable for visitors. It's a small city, so plan well and you will see it all.Recent affluence has also allowed for a great restaurant, culture scene.

title: The heart
reviews: Downtown is the commercial centre, with tall glitzy buildings. Still, if you move off the main roads, the streets are narrow and charming, with lots of small restaurants and shops. Of course, the uniformly friendly and helpful Canadians make this a most pleasant city to visit, whether it is Downtown or the suburbs.

title: Deadly Dull, Soulless City
reviews: I have visited Vancouver and environs more times than I care to recall and lived there for nearly a decade, so I think I am qualified to comment here. I have always been saddened by the coldness and greyness of the people who seem more intent on their phones and gadgets than each other. Huge numbers of people dressed head to toe in black - in summer !! A boring downtown core that seems to frown from every pore. I don't care much for the dull Super, Natural BC tagline endlessly trotted out. Beauty is only skin deep. Without joy and soul there's nothing to attract and hold.

title: Nice City
reviews: Pretty city with mostly contemporary architecture. Easy to get around. Lots of restaurants. People friendly.

title: Great shopping!
reviews: Ah I love downtown Vancouver! Downtown of big cities can be too busy and dirty but in Vancouver it‚Äôs very pleasant. Lots of good shops and restaurants and big roads means you don‚Äôt feel constantly surrounded by people!

title: Depressing !
reviews: Heard lot about this beautiful downtown and stayed here for 3mights right in the downtown.The downtown area offers lot of high end to low end shops, restaurants and much more. Cons: lots of homeless people all over downtown - it was sad to see homeless people sitting outside Chanel and Gucci stores; made me feel less secure walking after darkIt‚Äôs not clean compare to other major cities I ha e visitrf

title: Laid back and classy
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a mix of the modern and old. It has swanky high rise buildings as well as the older buildings in Gas Town with their old world charm. This city is not in a rush, and its dwellers like to do things in their own pace. You can spend a whole day just walking in downtown Vancouver without getting bored.

title: Had a great visit
reviews: Stayed at the Pinnacle Downtown and greatly enjoyed shopping, sightseeing and dining. Felt safe while walking around at night.

title: Unique in its modern, clean, top design profile
reviews: I would dare say that every single building in central Vancouver is absolutely unique and deserves focused full attention. Also, the town is clean, well organized and it's very easy to find your way around.We were able to gather our bearings in a moment with just a short look at the town map.

title: Very safe and friendly!
reviews: Vancouver downtown is one of the safest in the world. I was able to walk for hours with my teenage daughter this summer in Vancouver downtown without any problems In fact the best way to see downtown is to walk or bike in the trails.

title: Close to cruise ship terminal
reviews: Stayed in the downtown area twice.  We walked everywhere lovely area. Good restaurants and plenty of things to do. The train from the airport stops at downtown, cheapest way to get to the city.We were catching a cruise boat so just walked to the terminal.

title: Downtown a must see
reviews: Downtown is abuzz with people, variety of eateries, sights, friendly shop keepers, clean streets, green environment, beautiful public spaces, we thoroughly enjoyed our first visit to Vancouver. Hope to come back.

title: VISIT VANCOUVER ... DOWNTOWN IS A MUST
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is the essence of Van and all it's beauty, from seaplanes to trees, to magnificent yachts and quaint boats or paddle cruisers.  Gorgeous shopping and eateries.  Downtown is a must on your top 10 things to do if you are in this city.  I miss Van so badly and Downtown especially.  Make sure you see the Vancouver Art Gallery too

title: Downtown was great!
reviews: So much happening downtown!  Lots of cruise ships to see, street muscians, people were friendly and the weather was good (hazy but still good).

title: Downtown Vancouver visit
reviews: The atmosphere of the Gastown and the surrounding shops makes it a must visit area.The Observation Tower had a great panoramic view of the city and surrounds.The Stanley Park area and the Butchart Gardens as well as Victoria should not be missed.The only detrimental aspect is the number of tramps and homeless people that exist in the city.

title: Interesting city, with plenty to see and explore
reviews: We are staying here for a week, and, so far, we‚Äôve enjoyed the Museum and the Library, plus various eating places.The big downside, as with so many cities these days, is the problem of homelessness. We feel powerless in the face of so many people living on the streets, hopeless and disempowered.

title: Better than I expected
reviews: You hear about the regions beauty and climate, but I kept hearing, "you'll love the city"... and no one could totally say why.  I'll join in, it's a great city, I'd love to go back.  Lots of specifics when talking about North America cities like Las, Vegas, New York, Chicago, LA, San Diego, Nashville, Orlando and even Toronto.... Vancouver... is different, not a lot of high profile tourist things, just a fun city with something for everyone.  Nightlife is fun, from crazy to casual, lots of food options and things to see in a beautiful part of the world.  Lots of reasons to go there, or just one- that's it's got it's own personality and is just a fun, cool place.

title: Energy plus there
reviews: There were so many people walking, biking, and of course, driving that we were amazed. Also, the driving was not bad as unlike Dallas, the other drivers let you in our let you change lanes in a very friendly way.

title: Beautiful Place
reviews: So relaxing and beautiful place to casually walk and enjoy the view across the bay over st the mountains across the bay and look through all the interesting shops.

title: Vibrant part of town.
reviews: Very lively part of Vancouver plenty of food outlets and high end shopping,Use buses which are very frequent and cheap.

title: So kuch to se!
reviews: A lovely area with so many shops, bars, restaurants and interesting things to see. Take the hop on hop off bus and spend as long as you want to. A must see area.

title: Transport from & to the Airport ( YVR )
reviews: After leaving the Arrival hall walk your way to the Skytrain( Canada line) which will take you to Waterfront. ( end station) This is located in the city centre.Easiest way for travel is the use of a Compass card ( like the Dutch OV card)

title: City of contrasts.
reviews: There are plenty of things to see and do in the vibrant city of Vancouver without the expense. We enjoyed a picnic and stroll around Queen Elizabeth park and a wander through the city's Chinese Gardens. The Fly Over Canada down on the Waterfront will cost you $37CAD but the spectacular 20 minute experience is worth it.The public transport system is first class and at $3 for multiple journeys within 90 minutes is good value - and then there's always the Hop on Hop Off ride around the CBD.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: What a wonderful city.  So obviously a city and yet so spacious and clean feeling.  Full of interesting places to visit; too many to mention.  If we'd been 30 years younger, I should want to emigrate there!!

title: No to downtown
reviews: North Vancouver and pretty much everywhere we traveled in BC was lovely, but the downtown was a cesspool. Crime, drugs, week scent, tons of homeless, dirty, crazy people shouting. Worse than other big cities.

title: Would love to go back for an extended stay!
reviews: Vancouver is a large city, but feels like a small one...easy to get around using Hop-on Hop-off and/or train.  Gastown has restaurants and quirky shops--be sure to see the Steam Clock at the top of the hour.  Yaletown was fun, too.  Found Yaletown Brewing Co.--a great place!  Beautiful parks in Vancouver as well.

title: Lovely city
reviews: What a great city. Shopping and resteraunts abound. It's a city but seems so laid back.All in all a great place to visit . You can mix city living with great walks. I've been to lots of big cities worldwide,this rates very highly in my estimation. Would recommend a visit highly

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Vancouver is the type of city you can never tire of, there is so much to see & so much to do. For me it‚Äôs equally as good as London , Paris , New York & in some cases a lot prettier. To mention a few places worth the effort to visit . The Capilano Suspention Bridge ( fab for all ages) . Grouse mountain ( do the helicopte trip at the top it‚Äôs really wonderful) the chair lift at the top of the mountain that carries you over the Grizzly bears is fun! The Harbour Tower ( revolving restaurant ) very nice & good section of food! Robson Street the main shopping street is great.if you cannnot find what you are looking for there , you will not find it anywhere! Go see the Gastown Steam Clock , it‚Äôs dead cute! Without question Vancouver is a 10/10! don‚Äôt take my word for it , just DO IT üòÄ

title: Great Place
reviews: One of the nicest things about Downtown Vancouver is that there is seldom a rush hour of significance. This is a place made for city living - excellent supermarkets if you know where to look.Almost all areas are awash with a range of bars and restaurants to cater to all world tastes in terms of quality, quantity and price as well. Though I quickly add that I was fortunate enough to avoid the need to clothes shop during our stay !!

title: Such a great city!
reviews: Lots of restaurants, bars, upscale shopping, walking paths and sites.  Very bike friendly and plenty to do.

title: Fun place!
reviews: Lots to do in Vancouver. Granville Island and Stanley Park were highlights.the Vancouver Museum of Art was free after 530 on Tuesday.Free transportation exists for other venues like Capilano suspension bridge and can be used for downtown stops.

title: Lots to do wandering around exploring
reviews: You can walk around town shopping the many shops around town in Pacific Center Mall, along Robson street and so much more. Walk down to the water and check out the cruise ships in at Canada Place. Lots of restaurants offering a variety of technique foods. Shop, eat, or people watch, there is something for everyone down town

title: City to enjoy!
reviews: Wow! Lot of things to do and discover. Lot of places to visit, Stanley Park is a must. Clean and friendly! We'll be back for sure!

title: Clean and friendly.
reviews: Nice area to talk around or to people watch.  Clean city and everyone is friendly.  There are small parks and various things to see while walking around.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Clean, friendly, welcoming.  I like that the trash cans have a holder on the outside of them to place refundable bottles and cans so the homeless people can collect them without having to dig through the garbage!

title: Vibrant Downtown
reviews: What a vibrant city downtown with lots of high rise buildings, shops and restaurants. You may expect to see more tourists than locals.

title: Afternoon stroll
reviews: Four of us decided to walk around the downtown area after resting a bit in our hotel room. I had not been in a city this large in 25 years. Skyscrapers are everywhere and a lot of traffic. Some buildings are still of the original architecture and very ornate and beautiful. Then there are those that are very modern. Here and there are scattered small parks and we could see many buildings have trees/shrubs/grass on their rooftops and balconies. Some streets also have trees. It was nice to see greenery amongst all the cement and glass. We walked to the harbor where the cruise ships dock. Very nice seaport walkable area and park. Vancouver is definitely impressive.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: I recently took a trip to Vancouver for the weekend. It was a beautiful city. The area can quickly change from really nice, to some sketchy neighborhoods, so make sure you know where you are going. Overall, I really enjoyed walking around the city and trying different food options.

title: Overrated
reviews: Visited mid summer, and found the CBD to be dirty, lots of homeless people sleeping in doorways etc, drug addicts gathering early evening, beggars all day. Did not feel safe. Police officers in groups of four were helpful and friendly. Future visits I will be looking for accommodation outside the CBD.

title: We have the best downtown!
reviews: Most people want to live here as we are surrounded by water.  Gorgeous.  From Yaletown to the west end to STANLEY park to Coal harbour.   I love it here.  Just start walking for miles around our beautiful downtown.  Oh and we also have an indoor mall!

title: Touring downtown Vancouver
reviews: Driving throughout the City and sightseeing.  Enjoyed the various buildings, large number of trees, high hedges, numerous coff shops and restaurants, shops of all types, beaches, port of Vancouver, etc.

title: Library area/Robson St.
reviews: While the term "downtown" is sort of general and seems to encompass a large area, our experience with the area around the big (and beautiful) public library and also Robson St. has been nice.  The library is attached to a sort of mall and you can stop in and take a rest, buy a bubble tea, etc. and look at the glass walled structure.  We are told that the rooftop garden of the library is being renovated and will open sometime during the fall, so if you are in the area then, it sounds like it'd be worth a visit.We have walked up Robson St. for a bit and been to a nice restaurant and even did some shopping (shoes for me and a Canucks jacket for my husband).  In addition to all kinds of smaller stores, there are some big ones, too, like a huge glossy Nordstrom.  While there are some homeless folks on the street, we haven't experienced any issues so far and there are lots and lots of people out and about going to dinner, shopping, snacking, etc.  At night a good part of Robson St. had multicolored little lights in the trees.

title: Fabulous summer vibe
reviews: People coming and going everywhere, entertainment in Burrard St, food trucks, cruise ships, seaplanes, cyclists, walkers - you have it all - warm friendly vibe. People friendly - lady helped us find the right store - took us there - don‚Äôt have that happen often.

title: Most popular city for tourists
reviews: This is usually the most popular city for visitors to stay at. Has a variety of activities. Transportation is adequate (relatively for Canada but not comparable to large dense cities worldwide). Lots of luxury hotel choices, as well as more affordable options. Great variety of dining options. Probably more suitable for young adults & couples.

title: Mostly sad.
reviews: Beautiful natural setting and some nice areas such as Gastown, Stanley Park and the Seawall walkway.Unfortunately Vancouver is also home to one of the worst drug infested areas I‚Äôve seen anywhere. Provincial and local ‚Äúharm reduction‚Äù policies only seem to encourage more users to the City.  Other major public areas such as Granville Mall are littered with sleeping vagrants and garbage. Very sad to see such potential neglected.

title: Disappointing and sad
reviews: Having visited  so many states in North America, Vancouver  city was very dull  and disappointing.There are so many rundown/ closed shop fronts  walking through Granville  street  which is the main strip taking you you the harbour.Don't go near Hastings  street.  The homeless people, intoxicated people, drug and substance  abuse can be seen in the first  instance.  All streets are crowded  with people  tenting, begging and gives a very poor  image of a developed country.   We even see people  on stretchers and nasal tubes begging.  Absolutely  sad and  dangerous at the same time.Hope the government  can do more to alleviate  poverty and homelessness to give the city of Vancouver a visitor friendly   experience

title: So Much to Do and See
reviews: Where to begin? We spent four days in Vancouver and most of our time was spent downtown. Lots to see and due including people watching, shopping, viewing the harbors and enjoying great restaurants.

title: Love Vancouver
reviews: Easy to get around by foot. The ambience is so relaxing. Plenty of shopping and things to see. Walk down to Coal Harbour and Canada Place. The restaurants and bars are great, then walk around the Seawall.

title: Love this city!
reviews: Love Vancouver! 20 minutes to the mountains 2 minutes to the sea! What‚Äôs not to love! Clean, easy to get around, lots to do! We will be back

title: Beautiful City but costly to visit
reviews: We were in Vancouver 3 days and mostly enjoyed seeing the city.  I would not recommend renting a car and driving because of the traffic.  We took the city bus and were shocked at the homeless problem within a few blocks of downtown Vancouver.

title: Really Bland and Kind of Dirty
reviews: I was there over pride weekend. Found it bland even with all that stuff going on. Not much going on aside from patios and many people out smoking pot. Found a bunch of needles down a side street.

title: Liked the City Views
reviews: We have 12 year old twins and live in a small town so seeing the city views was interesting for us all. We walked from our hotel by Burrard and Robson to the Vancouver Lookout and saw some panhandlers but nothing too bad like others noted. Very cool to see the downtown area with the tall buildings.

title: very clean and friendly
reviews: a very walk able city and clean. Yes you still had a few homeless people around but that is the case in every city but it was just a few. Take a bike also and see more of the city. We were only there for 1 day but we will go back and spend more time soon

title: Round trip to downtown
reviews: We walked through Vancouver downtown.Don‚Äôt forget to visit Canada Place, Gastown and English bay.Have a delicious ice cream at English bay.

title: Vancouver
reviews: This was a nice, beautiful city.  Make sure you walk along the waterfront and Water Street.  Many places to eat and drink. There is a homeless problem, but it wasn't too bad.  I would definitely recommend this city to friends and family.

title: Vacation
reviews: I was very sad and stricken by he amount of homeless living here. It made em so sad. It had been 25 years since the last time I‚Äôve been and I remember it to be clean and friendly. Now it‚Äôs filthy old looking, worn down it‚Äôs hearth wrenching really.  I will not be back downtown Vancouver except to drive through heading to a venue At Rogers Arena. Other wise, No more.....

title: Good and bad
reviews: I would love to live in Vancouver and commute home through Stanley park... it would help calm down at the end of the workday.  The west end is nice, but the east end is overrun by heroin addicts and it isn‚Äôt really safe to walk around.  Such a contrast between the two sides of downtown.

title: Samey
reviews: It's a regular downtown with traffic, tramps and trash. Same stores as anywhere else. Nothing made us feel like we were in a unique downtown (compared to the US cities we've visited).

title: Clean city
reviews: Vancouver is currently rated the third most liveable city in the world (according to our guide so I hope that‚Äôs right!) and it‚Äôs rated high on the list for cleanliness. An enjoyable city to wander through, neatly laid out in a grid which makes navigating easy. A few older buildings, such as Hudson‚Äôs Bay building, add charm.

title: Great architecture and lively area
reviews: This is a wonderful downtown as the architecture of the buildings is varied to be interesting. Each building is sited with a plaza and lots of gardens and water features to make it feel human.

title: Crowded
reviews: There was alot for constriction when we went and jay walkers. It takes forever to get from point A to point B so plan ahead and don't rush.

title: Beautiful City and surrounding areas BUT
reviews: Took the lovely boat ride to Lonsdale, North Van but Unfortunate to take a # 8 Bus out towards Frazer St / King Edward. The initial start of the journey was an horrific experience with a number of smelly and wild looking tramps jumping onboard. Vancouver need to address this matter as the city centre is a disgrace with all unfortunate people living and begging on the streets.

title: Bold and Busy
reviews: Just like downtown Manhattan, Vancouver's downtown is a center of actionCommercial spaces, office buildings, restaurants, convention center, Harbour, shopping district, tourists attractions.... Every thing combined in this modern oasisI particularly love the harbour views, pubs and street foods

title: Something needs to be done
reviews: What a beautiful city but the homeless population is in need of help.everywhere you turn there are people asking for help.

title: Relax and enjoy the pleasant walk.
reviews: We exercise by walking around the city comfortably. Our accommodation is on the west side, but walking to the city within two days is enough to visit Yele town, old train station, Gas town,  and Chinatown. Best off all in May and June while Rodes bloom do not miss these beauty on Broughton and Jarvis street.

title: Post Cruise
reviews: Stayed three nights after a cruise. Great walkable downtown with lots of great restaurants. Plus easy taxi rides to china town and gas town. Or walk there if you like longer walks. We started our post cruise with Hop On Hop Off bus. Package included transportation of our luggage to our hotel. Very convenient and easy way to see city.

title: Amazing
reviews: I absolutely love dt Vancouver. SO much to do and the people! So chill and VERY fashionable. By far my fave thing to do is observe everyone here. I'm from Calgary and the difference between the two is astounding. Calgary more snobby and uppity. Vancouver more chill and accepting. Which is funny since Van is the richer city, Anyway, I LOVE it.

title: Homeless Street Problem
reviews: Downtown has a serious homeless street problem for many blocks.  People of all races smoking who-knows-what, using the street as a bathroom and brothel making passage difficult and uncomfortable.  Include me out.

title: Experience dowbtown coffee shop etc
reviews: Enjoyed a number of walks around downtown.But be aware around Main & Hastings not pleasant side of Vancouver

title: In love!
reviews: I fell in love with Vancouver and wondered that I never made any attempts to visit this city before now. I breezed through Vancouver en-route to Victoria years ago but never spent time until last July. I explored the harbor, Canada Place, Robson and Thurlow, Stanley Park, Gastown, English Bay, Chinatown. I loved the view of the mountains and the harbor as you walk down the street. I was so entertained taking pictures of Canada Place at night that I did not realize it was very late. Granville and other streets turned into a big party place at night, but police presence was strong and though I was mindful and wary, I did not feel unsafe walking the streets. I spent two nights and two days there and I could have happily spent one or two more days but hotels are very expensive, which is the only complaint I have.

title: Highs and lows
reviews: Vancouver downtown is interesting to say the least. China Town, amazing coffee shops and loads of yoga studios. Plus plenty of places to shop and eat of course. Though also a load of more dodgy areas with a seemingly high proportion of homeless people. Quite a mix! But worth experiencing.

title: Everyone should visit Vancouver
reviews: As we approached Vancouver in the taxi from the airport, my first reaction was "This reminds me of San Francisco". The only difference was that Vancouver is MUCH cleaner and user friendly. We stayed on the harbour and were able to walk almost everywhere. We did take the sightseeing tour which was great and showed us all of the city. My only regret is that we had too little time there.

title: Bit of a dump !!
reviews: Visited Vancouver on our last day of a 2 week road trip round Alberta and British Columbia.Must say what a letdown, after seeing some of the most beautiful scenery on the planet, Mountains, lakes, forests, glaciers, wildlife, rain forests, etc.The place smelled of drugs and marijhuana, homeless everywhere and was just dirty.Ive got my fridge magnet and won't be revisiting Vancouver, which is a shame because all before it was magical.

title: A Friendly Canadian City with an International Flair
reviews: This was a second visit to this beautiful city and I look forward to other opportunities. We came from Alaska via Celebrity Cruise line and spent a day visiting. You will love the cleanliness and the great number of activities.

title: What a city!
reviews: Stayed in Downtown Vancouver at Yaletown-Roundhouse.  We were two minutes walk from the station (Canada Line), and could walk to most places in the city.  If you‚Äôre staying in air conditioned accommodation, you‚Äôre lucky.  We weren‚Äôt and it was very noisy, especially when trying to sleep at night as we had to leave the windows open because it was so hot.  Overall a great part of the city to stay in, it felt very safe.

title: Good and bad...but overall a bit of a shame
reviews: Came to Vancouver for 3 days with high hopes. There are some lovely parts to the city, Stanley Park is amazing, and I recommend taking bikes out to cycle round the seawall. Also the trip to the Capilano Suspension Bridge is fantastic...if a little overpriced. Gastown and Granville Island are also nice places to visit. The main drawback about Vancouver is the homelessness you experience on every street in the downtown area. It's a real eye opener, and whilst I experience homelessness in London at home this is a different level. It's right in your face, with groups of homeless people camped out on some streets. Clearly there is a huge drug problem linked to many of the homeless people here....it is like something from The Walking Dead (seriously). One of the worst we witnesses was a lovely childrens playground with lots of kids playing.....with a homeless person laying no more than 10 feet away on the pavement with her trolley full of clothes. It really put a downer on the experience for us and due to this in the main I doubt we will be returning. Such a shame as the people are fantastic, really genuine and friendly.

title: To see and DO
reviews: There's lots to see and do in downtown Vancouver food heaven coffee paradise and shop till you drop. Or sit outside a bar and people watch it's great. Easy to get around either by bus taxi or just walk.

title: From Granville Island to the Port terminal...a must walk on Hornby street
reviews: So many coffee shops...especially Tim Horton.  Their mugs are so big that if you drink one full mug and are over 60 you need a washroom in 60 minutes. Such good quality.  Stop for drinks at Hotel George and the Wedgewood Spa.  The walk is exhilarating.  Have dinner at the Italian Kitchen.  Shop at the LuLuLemon shops and the fancy schmancy boutiques on Burrath Street.  These places are all short walks off of Hornby street.

title: Not the friendly Vancouver it was 10-15 years ago.
reviews: The material wealth is on display everywhere in Vancouver, but socially this is a very sick city equally on display and its just down right disgusting the disregard everyone has for each other in Vancouver. The pompous self entitled rich have ruined what was once a great city.

title: Vacation 2018
reviews: Stayed in the City Center at The Hyatt Regency Vancouver.   We were within walking distance of downtown, Gastown, tons of shopping, restaurants etc.  Love downtown Vancouver, it's a beautiful city with so much to offer travelers.   Took the hop on hop off tour which gave an excellent overview of Vancouver from Stanley Park to Chinatown and so much in between. Would highly recommend a visit. Make sure to stay in the city because it makes it a lot easier to get around making better use of your time while here.  We had thought about staying in a nearby town about 20 minutes away.  This is without traffic.  Trust me, after you factor in traffic you will spend at least an hour each way if you stay outside Vancouver.   We were going to stay in Surrey,  but decided that everything we wanted to do was in downtown.   Saved a bunch of time by staying in the middle of the action.  It was definitely worth spending a little bit more on the hotel and being close to everything.   Also being on a higher floor have us phenomenal city views.

title: Awesome..!!!
reviews: On this trip, we visited 3 cities-Portland, Seattle and Vancouver. Spent a lot of time in Vancouver and very glad we did so. The people and city are amazing. Will come back again. The ocean and the mountains make it very hard to beat!!

title: American beauty?
reviews: Vancouver is not our favorite city. Typical American big city, poor in cultural sites and rich in multiple lane streets and skyscrapers. If you come here, we recommend to stay 2 days max to see Stanley Park and Granville Island.

title: Easy to walk Big city shopping with broad sidewalks and pedestrian priority
reviews: From the Pacific Centre in three directions ,  up and down the main streets of Vancouver  ( Georgia, Robson, Corteone, Granville etc) there is shopping, restaurants and hotels to enjoy.  The downtown has a sense of safety while the neighborhoods to the East don't have a safe feeling.  Nothing  very flashy about this downtown but is has a city sense with tis internaitonal hotels and visitors.

title: Better than advertised
reviews: As big cities go, VC is quite pleasant. It is a foodies paradise, and there are many great attractions in and around downtown. It is a vibrant and active city with people walking everywhere.lots of cool little neighborhoods like Gastown, Yaletown, etc that have their own local personalities.

title: So to walk around
reviews: So many amazing places to go and eat. I love walking around all the little shops and walking to the harbor. They have separate pathways for cyclists and pedestrians. So happy I dont worry about getting ran over.

title: Helen ~~ Very nice environment
reviews: Downtown Vancouver Robson Street is a fashion dining shopping St, people close 9-10pm and close by beach

title: the hub of Vancouver
reviews: This is the place to start your tour of Vancouver. Vancouver downtown includes the Canada Place with its magnificent views of North Vancouver (Grouse Mountain),cruise ships, sea planes, hotels, the convention centre, plenty of Starbucks for drinking coffee/tea/,street entertainers(we saw 2 young fellows tap dancing to music). It is the pivotal location to take shuttle buses to Capilano Bridge,Grouse Mountain and Stanley Park (and more).Within a few blocks of the Canada Place, you can be walking in Gastown, at the Vancouver Art Gallery, at the Bill Reid Art Gallery, or shopping in the Pacific Mall.  Hotels may be pricey in the downtown but well worth the convenience of the location.There are many restaurants to suit everybody's taste and budget.

title: Very dingy
reviews: But if you like the smell of greasy food combined with a distinct odor from the weed shops go right ahead.

title: Fun Place to be!
reviews: There is a ton to see and do in downtown.  Its amazing how big the city is. The city is lively with people, restaurants and shops. It's easy to navigate and parking is remarkably easy to find. There is a heavy Asian influence in the city which is fun because that means that you can find really good Asian food almost anywhere! Really enjoyed our time in downtown Vancouver.

title: Great shopping
reviews: Many restaurants and retail stores to shop. All the high end brands are on Robeson. Parking is tough.

title: Nice City
reviews: Downtown is an easy train ride from the airport. It appears to be a clean city with plenty of shopping opportunities

title: Family Vacation
reviews: Beautiful City A lot of things to see. Very clean. We enjoy shopping there is no much difference between our Australian dollar to Canadian dollar. It is our second time to Vancouver and we are planning to come back again next year. We love Vancouver.

title: Simply Beautiful!
reviews: What a beautiful city! Our first time here and the city is very clean and everyone very helpful. So many cafes, bistros and restaurants to choose from! We will return for sure!

title: Utterly amazing!
reviews: We have just stayed for 3weeks in Downtown Vancouver,and were amazed that we never ran out of things to do. Staying in the centre,we were able to walk out in every compass direction from our hotel on nitrate st,to an area of outstanding beauty.In one direction,Canada Place,the waterfront draws you,with the harbour boats,float planes,North Vancouver mountain backdrop,snowballed at the height of summer. Go in the opposite direction and catch a mini ferry to quirky Granville island. Another direction,beautiful Stanley Park,wildlife full,amazing lagoons.Another direction,Hadrian and science world. False creek also walkable.beautiful beaches,sculptures and if that's not enough,free shuttles to grouse mountain,Capuano suspension,and an excellent transit system that works cheaply,simply and efficiently! Loved it x

title: Grouse mountain and north Vancouver
reviews: Free bus service to grouse mountain, the 5 Zip line was fun and a quick boat ride to north Vancouver for a relaxing evening watching the sun set, over looking city view. Free bus and the boat ride leave from Canadian Place, highly recommended if you are only visiting for a few days

title: A Great Downtown Area
reviews: I have visited Vancouver on numerous occasions, mainly for sporting events.  Vancouver has a lovely downtown area.  As a former police officer, I feel very safe in the downtown area, as well as on their very good transit system.  In saying that, ALWAYS be aware of your surroundings.  Take time, plan your visits and enjoy.

title: One of the best downtowns anywhere
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is one of the safest and most beautiful downtowns anywhere. English Bay, Stanley Park Yaletown, Gaston, Coal Harbour, Robson Street ... all close to the water with majestic mountain backdrops.  Absolutely wonderful!

title: My favorite CBD
reviews: I love everything about Vancouver.  The central business district is no exception: clean, organized, everything works.  Pretty.  Great public transportation.  Waterfront.  Easy access to the airport.  Just amazing!

title: A Tale of Two Cities
reviews: Overall, I found Vancouver to be a beautiful and vibrant city, with pockets of charm scattered here and there. The great thing about Vancouver is its accessibility to parks, mountains and waterways just minutes from the downtown core. It definitely has a laid back feel to it, and lacks the fashionista sense that imbues cities like Toronto and Montreal. People are friendly and down to earth. There is never a shortage of things to do and see. However, as world-class as Vancouver is, it also has a huge socio-economic issue with a massive population of homeless, mentally ill and drug addicted people living on the streets of the downtown eastside (East Hastings and Main being the epicentre of the 10 blocks known as Skid Row). How the city allows this problem to exist and fester is beyond my understanding, especially when one of its main drivers of growth is the tourism industry. To have so many down and out people living on the streets, doing drugs in broad daylight, and basically milling about looking for their next fix is completely heartbreaking. This is something that obviously has no quick solution. I was in Vancouver back in 1994 and even then this problem existed, although not to the extent that it does today. If it wasn't for this overwhelming issue, I would have given this review 5 stars.

title: July 2018
reviews: We took the float plane over from Victoria. I highly recommend enjoying the float plane views during your trip if you are going to Victoria or up to Whistler. We stayed at the UBC, rode bikes around Stanley Park, visited Granville by ferry, went to Gastown - there were an abundance of shopping and food experiences. Parking in Vancouver is expensive.  We.visited Chinatown and were sad to see that the East side of the City shows a neglected side of Vancouver. So many homeless people and several people using drugs (shooting up) in on the street or entryway to abandoned buildings and alleys. I certainly would not have felt safe in the evening.  Paramedics patrol the Gastown/Chinatown/East side on bikes.  The city has a ton of character, I think it needs to invest in solutions for helping some of the residents.

title: A great area to stay
reviews: We went totally "blind" in our choice of hotel and with Coast Coal Harbour Hotel in the middle of Downtown, our stay was 1st class. Just close to the waterfront, we were 5/10 minutes walk from the harbour trip boats and Stanley Park in one direction and 5 minutes walk from Canada Place in the other. Slightly longer to walk up up Robson Street for the stylish shops. All in all Downtown is lively, full of restaurants and bars, interesting with great views of the marina and mountains - and as for the seaplanes, they have to be seen and sampled to be believed. We loved this area and were so fortunate in our "blind" choice. There are of course other hotels in the area which looked just as good as ours with access to the same local amenities but as we did not use those hotels, we cannot comment - but they cannot be bad can they in such a lovely area? Check out the waterfront park for a relaxing stretch out in the sun!Hilarity1628

title: Walkable City
reviews: While Vancouver could be seen as just another big city the downtown area is quite walkable and areas like Gastown, Yaletown and China Town are reasonably accessible by walking.  The main downtown shopping street is Robson Street with big stores such as Nordstrom, Old Navy and The Hudson Bay Company as well as many other fashion and brand name stores in the general area.

title: Nice downtown - walkable and safe
reviews: Nice ambience, lots of fancy and regular shops too. Very walkable and felt safe. Easy to get to waterfront and Stanley Park with bike hire.

title: Some good points but overall disappointing.
reviews: We had high hopes for the city of Vancouver, but ultimately walked away disappointed.   While the city does have some pretty spots like Stanley Park, Canada Place, and Gastown, overall it is seedy and not well kept, with panhandling homeless everywhere.  Many areas are very sketchy and not safe at night at all.  Also the taxi situation is absolutely ridiculous.  There are no cab stop lines anywhere, and even downtown it can be very difficult to find a cab.  In places like Stanley Park they are nonexistent, and unlike most cities where major tourist attractions draw plenty of taxis, even at those locations there are none to be had.   You really must have a private driver or rent a car in Vancouver in order to get around effectively.

title: Awesome city, bike friendly and great food
reviews: This was our first time in Vancouver and we just loved this city. The city had lots of tourist, seemed busy but super chilled, not rushed or stressful at all. There is a huge diversity and that can also be seen in their restaurants options. Lots of Japanese, Korean and Asian infused foods. Loved it!

title: Amazing!!!
reviews: Everything is so close and there is such a variety of restaurants for you to try. The views are amazing and there is so much transportation for you to maneuver throughout the city. We spent a weekend here and it‚Äôs still not enough. We will be back.

title: Bring your bicycle clothing
reviews: This city is delightful , Canadians are friendly and polite .The city has the most amazing protected bike routes around and criss crossing it. Plenty of bike rental shops and tour groups

title: Diverse place
reviews: Really enjoyed the many different areas of Vancouver City. Very easy to get around and quite easy to keep your bearings by looking at the mountains behind North Vancouver.

title: Wandering the downtown area - Tower and Gaslight Village
reviews: Beautiful city with lots to see and do. Lots of great restaurants, very friendly people, and so much to see.

title: Walking Trip
reviews: We explored downtown on foot; the good parts were nice but because you don‚Äôt know the areas well you can easily take a block too far and end up in an area that feels less safe. But wear comfortable shoes and be prepared for the somewhat elevated terrain in parts üòâ

title: Nice, but so much social degradation
reviews: I went with my partner and we found the bars, restaurants and people very friendly. There‚Äôs lots to see and do and getting about by the buses is fairly cheap. A massive issue the city needs to address is the amount of people living in make shift camps on the streets, this is clearly because of the growing gulf between the rich and the poor.  More affordable housing needs to be built and more needs to be done to crack down on related social issues. We were told not to walk through downtown Vancity at night as we would more than likely be mugged, shame.

title: Fabulous city
reviews: Not surprised that this is one of the best places to live in the world. Shame about the number of vagrants in gastown.

title: Bit Overrated!
reviews: I think overall it is a bit overrated, especially given the fact there are so many homeless and broken hearted people in plain sight. It is very obvious that Vancouver is working hard on it's harm reduction programs and being a retired mental nurse..I get it and support it 100%..  That being said it is a lovely place to visit. I could never afford to live there rent and home ownership is out of control. I did find prices for groceries and places to eat comparable to that of Ontario, Canada. My home. The variety of foods, and markets is amazing and overall the experience, in my opinion nobody should pass by...just depends on your attitude.

title: Nice Downtown
reviews: We did plenty of walking through the downtown core over the 5 days we were there. It was very easy to get around, find directions and there was always plenty to do.

title: Walk on the Sea Wall
reviews: Make sure you take a walk along the Sea wall. There are many good and entertainment choices you could pick before going. Walk or take a bike ride.

title: Disappointing, didn‚Äôt live up to the hype
reviews: Expected much more from Vancouver, but the city didn‚Äôt live up to the hype, yes there are mountains and parks, but I have never seen so many homeless, drugs addicts and mental unwell in an area. The homeless and beggars are around all the main areas, giving the city an uncomfortable edge. This is very sad and should be addressed by the City through better health care and mental health provision. I won‚Äôt be in a rush back, sorry to say.

title: Very walkable city
reviews: Enjoyed just walking around downtown and popping in a few shops here and there.  Clean, modern, busy with people.

title: Beautiful Vancouver
reviews: I visited Vancouver for the first time a few weeks ago. What an amazing and gorgeous city. I attended a course downtown for a few days and I loved being down there. I enjoyed sitting at Robson Sq by the waterfalls as well as watching kids dance in the skating area.  I wandered around the stores and the streets. I took the ferry across and enjoyed it and gastown. The transit system is easy to use and affordable. I loved the food trucks and the variety of foods available. There was a jazz festival on while I was there.  Would love to visit again for longer.

title: beautiful british colombia
reviews: downtown  has many tourist attractions and very amazing place to go.its a very fantastic place to stroll down with families and friends.beautiful when you get there at night and see all places around.very culutral  as well.

title: Clean City
reviews: Vancouver is clean  bright clean city , set on the Ocean and a beautiful back drop of mountains .China town is fun to stroll thru , great eats , lots of small stores. Shopping is everywhere as in any big city .

title: Amazing city
reviews: The downtown area of Vancouver is just awesome. There are so many things to do and see. I just loved everything was nice and clean and the people are so friendly.

title: Many places of interest to visit
reviews: The downtown area covers several main Tourist attractions within following Communities:- Chinatown, Coal Harbour, Gastown, Yaletown and West EndManaged to visit several of these during 4 night stay at this locationSome amazing sightsHowever we and others were quite surprised that as one of the best cities in the world to live and visit  there is a huge Homeless population especially in main shopping areaPeople sleeping on roadside kerbs, doorways and even a central kerb on a busy road leading to Granville Island was quite shocking to see at times due to dangers imposed to these individuals from flow of trafficMyself and others were shocked nothing appears to have been done to safeguard these people whose age ranged from teenagers to quite elderlyQuite an unsettling scene to witness Coal Harbour is where Cruises Liners dock so some huge Ships and very busy area with two or three ships docking on same day while we were in Vancouver Also it is where fleet of Seaplanes are based for excursions and private travel to different areas in CanadaEasy to walk to Sea Wall from Coal Harbour as linked pathways so you can access Stanley Park, Marina, and enjoy Sunset Cruise as we did, should this be type of activity you might enjoyHad booked this excursion prior to arrival in Canada with ViatorBeautifully set dining rooms which had name cards placed on each table with lovely Staff who very kindly arranged for us to be able to sit next to others from our Tour Group by asking some fellow visitors if they would mind exchanging seats for the eveningThanks to those who did this Much appreciated Our friends had booked quite late (day before sunset cruise) after hearing we were going on Dinner Cruise and it appealed to them tooMany thanks to the Captain for her help in allowing us move from initial seats allocated to us and for a fabulous Harbour Cruise topped off by stunning sunset over Stanley ParkGot to visit Yaletown on morning of our departure Very quiet and relaxing couple of hours spent overlooking boats and enjoying Scenery and drinks from Blenz Coffee near False Creek before having to return to our Hotel to get Coach for Airport

title: Clean and welcoming
reviews: By many standards the city is small. That makes it very welkable. While the city population is large, the city itself has a welcoming city center and many outlying shopping areas. Do not b fooled into thinking the city shopping is limited. It is not. There are wonderful galleries shops and everything is a short walk to tourist sites or picnic areas that the city workers take full advantage of. A fabulous city I wish I lived there.

title: Lovely place to walk and get to know the culture
reviews: i like that place so much. vancouver is just a heaven for me. walking around make me feel like a dream. just there are many homeless people. sometimes scary at night

title: Hilly
reviews: Nice to see by bus, but by foot you can walk your butt off. Public transportation is OK, But drivers arent friendly. Ask to be told where a stopmis and they say ok, but never actually tell you.They say you can pay with crdie cards but only if you have touchless feature.

title: Lovely area for a walk.
reviews: Lovely clean area for a walk. Plenty to see and do.This area/place was very clean and well looked after.

title: The steam clock
reviews: The steam clock is a highlight of the downtown trip - situated across Starbucks on the street corner the clock was made by engineers and works like a steam engine - great engineering works

title: Take your time
reviews: If you go downtown take your time to visit the nice thing, that means about 1:30 hours for the Harbour Look Out, 3 hours for Gas town, maybe 1-2. hours for Chinatown, and more than 1hour for Canada Place.We did not make Chinatown.We tried but had to walk through an area where a lot of homeless people were ‚Äöcamping‚Äò , so we did not feel comfortable to walk there.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: We really enjoyed our visit to Vancouver. It is such a clean city. We were only there one night waiting to board a cruise ship but will definitely be back. We want to cross the Capilano Suspension Bridge since we did not have time to do it on this trip. We visited Stanley Park and loved walking along the sea wall. The people in Vancouver were so friendly and helpful when we needed directions. Cardero‚Äôs was a great place to eat, a bit on the expensive side.

title: Vancouver is a fun city.
reviews: Vancouver has so many areas with different vibes.  Davie & Denman are near the beach, many great restaurants.  An upbeat, fun place.  Commercial Drive has the feel of Europe.  Many great coffee shops - especially Cafe Calabria.  Downtown Vancouver has Canada Place, where the tour ships come in.

title: Big City Views
reviews: We loved our tour of downtown Vancouver when in Canada's beautiful British Columbia trying to get a good look at the iconic tower. Lots of beautiful architecture lining every traffic filled street. Stopped at the Hard Rock Casino despite the picket lines.It was very clean the city they are doing a good job at cleaning it up.  Parking was easy to find and free at the Hard Rock incidentally.

title: Be prepared to walk!!
reviews: We were staying with a friend and of course she doesn‚Äôt have a parking spot so we had to find one. I drove around for about 2 hours trying to find a spot. The problem with downtown Vancouver is that there are one ways & no left turns everywhere. You have to drive 5 blocks just to turn around. If you don‚Äôt have a credit card good luck finding a spot, we eventually went and bought a visa gift card and parked in the hospital parkade. We had to walk a couple blocks to my friends house, but were just happy to finally have a spot.

title: Beautiful city on the water
reviews: We had a fabulous day here. Walked all day downtown and to Stanley Park ! Great views and. Good food and friendly people. We should have stayed longer ....

title: Great place to walk around for a day!
reviews: I really enjoyed walking around this area! So many options for shopping and food, this is a must-walk! Make sure to take transit however, I could only imagine that driving around this area would be unpleasant!

title: 20 Square Blocks of shopping- need I say more? So many cultures and cuisines to choose from here in Vancouver.
reviews: So many restaurants and all walking distance from your hotel. In the summer it gets dark until 9pm and then the city lights up for many exciting social activities young and old.

title: Very pedestrian friendly treed streets. Hop On Hop Off buses. Great restaurants, bars and night life!
reviews: We went to Gastown on Blood Alley to a bar called Salt. Great concept with parings of cheese, wine and cold cuts (Charcuterie).Lively Robson, Granville St. as well. Good shopping at Pacific Centre.Clean city.

title: Only for the rich?
reviews: Enjoyed walking through the top end stores along Robson and in the downtown vicinity - and the Fleuvog shoe store in Gastown.  Not in my budget, though.

title: Dirty
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is dirty. Unfortunately. Granville street is for teenagers, clubs offer poor nightlife for 25+ people...Much better the sport side of the city, beautiful walks around the bays and close to the water.

title: Walking city
reviews: We were on a hop on hop off bus but walked through china town, gas town and our downtown hotel, also down to the waterfront. I call that a walking city. Lots of bikes and bike lanes too.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: What a beautiful city with sea on one side and mountains on the other. The is a city for walking and bike riding. People are generally friendly and helpful if you are lost for directions.Lots to see and do - shops, restaurants and cultural stuff.The diversity can be seen with the restaurants by walking the whole length of Robson Street - East meets West.

title: Culture, drugs and begging
reviews: Vancouver appears to have a lot to offer, but it is let down by an abundance of rough sleepers, drug (Zombie drug, spice or black mamba) as well as the pungent aroma of cannabis everywhere.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: It doesn't matter too much which hotel is used as this is a fairly easy town to walk. Lots of restaurants, coffee shops and shops are all within an easy walk distance.  I couldn't stop talking on the beauty of this city.  I simply didn't want to leave.

title: Easy to Navigate
reviews: The grid style system is so easy to navigate, Nice shopping area lot of bars cafes and diners, Great road crossing system,use it you'll be safe.Like anywhere some not so good areas, a few beggars but generally no hassle.

title: Hours of Exploring
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is clean, easy to navigate, and full of food and shopping. Everyone I met was kind, friendly, chatty, or having the best time being a tourist.

title: Vibrant Downtown
reviews: This is a downtown with numerous skyscrapers and a lot of crowds. We drove through several times to get back and forth between tourist areas. There was a lot of traffic but it moved well. This is a beautiful downtown.

title: Fantastic Diwtown area
reviews: The downtown of Vancouver is one of the best places to be. The city is very clean, no trash on the sidewalks or roadways. Plenty of good restaurants to visit, plus you have shopping that rivals many cities in the US. Stores from Tiffany‚Äôs, to Lululemon, to other shops and stores dot the downtown area. The air is crisp, cool, and without very much humidity. You will not be disappointed in downtown Vancouver!!

title: Hustle and bustle and construction
reviews: Same old downtown really no surprises but also not too many let downs! Tick it off the list if you‚Äôre into your shopping lots of high end

title: Downtown & Jazz fedtivsl
reviews: It was the Jazz festival so quite different I‚Äôm sure even so s lovely city really buzzing lots going on and such wonderful people very welcoming

title: Easy walking
