reviews: Spent a lot of time walking around downtown.  Walked to Gastown and Yaletown many times.  Need to be aware of your surroundings in some of the more seedy areas.   Main and Hastings is an area I would stay away from.  Never did take public transportation, no need.

title: One of the most beautiful cities in the world
reviews: Vancouver is an amazing city. It has many huge department stores along with the smaller  souvenir and gift shops. It has so many places to eat, be it a snack or coffee or a full gourmet meal. With the backdrop of  mountain peaks it is so beautiful. You can be part of all the hustle and bustle or just sit and ‚Äòpeople watch‚Äô while you enjoy a coffee. The city is very tastefully constructed with lots of the high rises with relaxing water features. Some of the architecture is astounding . A few minutes and you can be in Stanley Park or down by the harbour where you can watch the sea planes going back and forth along with the huge cruise ships which come into dock. Gaston is a must to visit with the steam clock and statue of ‚ÄòGassy Jack.‚Äô The observatory tower is a wonderful place to take in the views. No visit is complete without seeing China town or Granville Island where the markets are to die for. Like every city in the world there is a homeless problem and there  are places  it is best to avoid but this does not detract the overall beauty of Vancouver. We loved it there.

title: Brilliant atmosphere.
reviews: Lots of shops, bars, places to eat and clubs. Police shut roads off and night at weekends as it's very busy.

title: Sightseeing
reviews: Beautiful City bordering the North Pacific and place to take a cruise to Alaska. It's not very large and public transportation is easily available as our caps. Please note that there are no Uber or Lyft cars available in Vancouver.

title: Lots of fun to be had
reviews: Where to start ? Take a bike ride around and do Yale town , coal harbor , beach ave, to Denman . Stop and shop or just enjoy the multi cultural restaurants. There's lots of fun to be had in down town Vancouver .

title: Lovely place - very similar to Sydney
reviews: After a good night sleep, we properly checked in at Fairmont Hotel Reservations then off for breakfast at good ol' Starbucks again. Bought tickets for the City Hop On / Hop Off Bus - and toured around the various sights of Vancouver. Some good spots included:1.  Stanley Park - really good. About a 1000 acre park in the heart of the city.2. Granville Markets - very trendy. Good as well. 3. China town - over rated4. Gas town - trendy. Good. And lots of other sights. Managed to get Mum on a virtual reality flying ride (like the California Flight ride at Disneyland) and that was terrific. Flying all over Canada. Felt so real. We managed to wonder off the beaten track (again) and ended up amongst derelicts and druggies. Not that pleasant. Saw a strong Salvo presence in the area. Quite surprised by the number of homeless people and beggars that seem to be everywhere. Very confronting and sad. Saw a massive number of Seaplanes taking off from the harbour. The 3rd busiest sea plane marine airport in the world. Rested at the Hotel. FaceTime with family then up the road for dinner.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: One of the most liveable cities in the world.  Parking is scarce but it's a very walkable place and so much to do, see, and eat!  The streets are bustling but friendly. Great town!

title: Clean, Modern and Walkable
reviews: While Vancouver is quite expensive, it is a wonderful city to visit with a clean, modern downtown, having numerous attractions along the waterfront that is very walkable, which is a good thing as traffic is often snarled.  Other areas near Downtown that are worth visiting include Gastown just to the east and Coal Harbor just to the west and Stanley Park a bit further west.  Granville Island, another popular area to visit is to the south.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Visited Vancouver as part of an Alaska cruise.City is clean and downtown is vibrant. The annual jazz festival was on in June with many performing in various locations. Only -ve  aspect was the cost of accommodation.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: It's like other downtown of metropolitan cities. There are dense commercial areas and high end bars and restaurants. It's pleasant to walk in the downtown and especially along Waterfront road.

title: Much changed in recent years
reviews: Last visited before the property boom had fully taken hold. Now, Downtown and the Waterfront areas resemble the hotel high rises of Hong Kong - not unexpected perhaps

title: Very provincial feel in spite of all the modern and high rise buildings
reviews: Some public transport and walking is the best way to see Vancouver Downtown, worth walking around:Canada Place (..including waterfront walk, Vancouver lookout?), Gas Town (....including Steamworks Brewery), China Town (....including Dr Sun Yat Sen Classical Chinese gardens)Downtown (....including Robson Street and Robson Square)Granville Island & Public Market, Yaletown (....including Old Warehouse district)

title: Many sights to see and lots of shopping
reviews: You can spend days downtown and still find new and exciting shops. I prefer to stay around Gas Town its a blast!

title: People watch & shop
reviews: Good place to wander and enjoy the people and the shops.  A little bit for everyone - shopping, museum etc.

title: Great city to visit and experience
reviews: Vancouver is one of my favorite city to visit in Canada. It enjoys a beautiful location by the water, mountains in the distance, friendly people and a safe setting. There are lots of thinks to do whether you enjoy urbran offerings or are a nature lover. Vancouver has lots to offer everyone of every age!

title: Love downtown.
reviews: If you go to Vancouver it's definitely worth the exploration if you have the time. Some cool places to eat.

title: Love Vancouver
reviews: Simply one of the most beautiful and amazing cities we visited. Very clean and diverse architecture. Lots to see and visit. Easy to get around via taxi or walking. This place is what a lot of cities could be.

title: A day in Vancouver ,after cruise
reviews: Just another  big , busy , crowded city , with tall buildings.If that turns you on - go for it.Expensive.Noisy.

title: Walking tour of down town.
reviews: This is located in the north central part of the City of Vancouver. It is the business, commerical, cultural, and entertainment center of town.  There is the library in the center of town; lots of restaurants to choose from - from a fast food place to an elegant restaurant; lots of high end shopping stores; a liquor store, a post office and a pharmacy just to name a few.  There are plenty of down town hotels to choose from;  and public transportion and the hop on and off trolly covers this area as well. This area is well organized, beautiful and I did feel safe walking up and down Robson Street.

title: Safe and organized
reviews: Vancouver is a fantastic city. Well organized, beautiful and safe. I adore stroll down on its streets.

title: Beautiful
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city. Modern and historic with so much to offer. I didn‚Äôt have a car but didn‚Äôt need one. I felt safe walking to my chosen destinations and took a cab if needed. The skyline is amazing as are the people. This is a destination worth enjoying.

title: An Ever Changing and Evolving Skyline
reviews: This is my fourth visit to this beautiful city - previous visits being in 1990, 1998 and 2009. I feel this qualifies me to comment on the evolution of Downtown Vancouver across nearly 3 decades.Very easy to navigate if driving, pedestrian friendly and well served by Public Transportation, Downtown has something to offer for everyone - residents and tourists alike.Old neighbourhoods like Gastown are a short distance from the high rise bank offices which are gleaming examples of modern architecture. The Seawall offers a scenic walk. Plenty of dining options - ranging from old Pubs to swanky new restaurants and cafes. Multiple shopping complexes and malls, small retail outlets and kiosks all jostle for attention even to casual browsers like myself.Ethnic neighbourhoods like Chinatown are also a short distance away.One downside I note which was perhaps less obvious back in 2009 is the number of homeless individuals living on the streets with some of them politely asking for financial assistance.

title: Overall appealing, but ...
reviews: Plenty of high rise buildings, both commercial and residential. Lots of shops, restaurants and bars, banks, hotels.Very easy to get around by foot, bicycle, bus, or train. Waterfront areas are beautiful and make for great recreational opportunities. Very safe to walk around.But downtown must be the designated smoking section of Vancouver. Sometimes you can start choking walking past the office buildings and shops.There are also homeless persons and begging issues that nobody wants to talk about.

title: Pedestrian Friendly
reviews: Great place if you don‚Äôt have a car.  Buses run frequently, train station within walking distance.  Loads of restaurants, pubs and shops.  Great Downtown !

title: VA VA Vancouver.......!!!!
reviews: My husband and I did a little tour of Downtown Vancouver whilst staying with our Canadian family. We did some shopping in Gastown and saw the famous Steam Clock. We also visited beautiful Stanley Park and saw the amazing Totem Poles that are there.If its a cosmopolitan vibe that you are looking for with great shops, restaurants and bars then this is the place to be......we only had a few brief hours here but we enjoyed our experience......so much so that I'm going back again in August for a longer stay and I'm looking forward to seeing and doing lots more this time around......I'll let you know how I get on......!!!!

title: Fabulous city, so much to see
reviews: Resident were amazingly helpful, as we got lost easily. Bus service is inexpensive and easy to use. Stores are remarkable, clean and not as expensive as I thought.

title: Interesting
reviews: There's lots to see and do but unfortunately to many gift shops. Things are expensive and we've noticed, maybe it was the exchange rate, but the prices for everything is certainly higher.

title: Many tourists attraction
reviews: There are many attractions in downtown Vancouver. For example, Stanley a Park, Pan Pacific, Vancouver Convention Centre, just to name a few. Also,  very good shopping on Robson Street.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Spend a day just walking around.  The sea on one hand with the busy harbour and the snow capped mountains in the distance give this city a special wow factor.   Beautiful colourful flowers blloming all over in the spring time.  Visit Gas Town, Roberts chocolates and Stanley Park

title: City centre
reviews: Great place to eat and drink lots of pubs restaurants and views lots of things to do downtown üëçüëçüëçüëç

title: Beautiful, clean city.
reviews: Lots of attractions, shopping and restaurants.  Easy to get around.  Sky train, Hop-On-Hop-Off or simply walking.

title: Easy to use public transportation.
reviews: Great hotels, restaurants and shopping. Bus and strain transportation excellent. Easy access to airport.

title: the whole city is great
reviews: we had no idea how great this city was going to be        easy to get around     very modern    easy to get to the park     we were here 3 days   could have been here 5 days

title: Lots to do
reviews: Always something to do dt.   Between the buskers, food trucks, architecture and hustle and bustle there is always something to see or do.   Great walking and always a patio right around the corner to grab an apr√®s shopping drink.

title: Super City
reviews: I really loved Vancouver on our first visit to the City. Downtown is super and reminds me of Manhattan. Everywhere seems to be only a 20 minute walk and the people are so friendly. I was a little shocked at the amount of homeless people on the streets though. You will find some great restaurants on Mainland street and on Hamilton street. It's an easy city to fully explore.

title: Need more time to enjoy this great city
reviews: I thought one week was enough to visit Vancouver, but I need more time to enjoy this great city. Many things to do, restaurants, museums, parks, etc. all within walking distance. Looking forward to come back. The only drawbacks are the weather and the prices. Expensive city, just bring all your cards and go for it. One of every three day the weather was so you shift to indoor activities. Very beautiful city, great views, friendly people. Tourists are welcome.

title: Fabulous City - my 4th time back!
reviews: Vancouver is a cool place with fantastic Stanley Park, great food, legal THC products and beautiful summer weather most of July-Aug.Plenty to do & see and restaurant seen that is huge!

title: Amazing!
reviews: Best city I‚Äôve ever visited so far. First time in canada and it will not be the last and we will come back to Vancouver again for sure! Would love to see during summer time.

title: Gorgeous views
reviews: Beautiful views, many restaurants and bars. Just a great place to spend your day or evening! New shops/ stores. We even worked out at the new Orange Theory several times and enjoyed the walk back to our hotel.

title: Walkabout
reviews: The downtown area is like most urban city downtown areas except it is easy to access via walking, biking or taking buses. We found a great selection of great eating places. Getting over to Granville Island was easy using the aqua bus. We were a bit put off by all the people begging, with some being hostile and cursing us when we didn't give them change. We gave to plenty of people who asked but avoided those who were hateful.

title: Easily walkable
reviews: A number of skytrain stations scattered about as well as water ferries on False Creek but the downtown area is easily walkable.For the adventurous nearby Stanley Park is also within walking distance though beware of the cyclists.

title: A breath of fresh air
reviews: Vancouver Downtown wraps itself around the harbour which gives the whole area a sense of openness and space, in spite of the towering glass-clad high rise buildings interspersed with older structures.  There‚Äôs a relatively relaxed and quiet aura in Vancouver, with plenty of space and freedom to wander without  feeling that you‚Äôre about to be overwhelmed by the throng. Unusually multi-cultural until you learn how long the Chinese and Japanese have lived there.  It‚Äôs a bit like I remember Sydney being, but with fewer people.  Great place to stay in with plenty to see and do.

title: Like most other downtowns
reviews: It is mostly skyscrapers and traffic.  There are shops and some places to eat. It is close to Gastown and Chinatown.

title: Yale town and Granville street my favorite
reviews: A beautiful city and a safe city too!  My second trip here and highly recommend all to come see.   Stanley park a must see and great walk.

title: Lots to do
reviews: Vancity- has a lot of cool neighborhoods with different feels and vibes. Its not 100% business, people live here so its alive all the time. Plenty to do as a tourist looking for an all day adventure or just a quick break between meetings.

title: TYPICAL BIG CITY
reviews: The first thing we noticed was the untidy streets littered with cigarette butts. On the positive side the place is easy walking with Pacific shopping centre the main attraction. Most retailers, food court excepted, were high end and quite expensive. We did find a number of cafes and restaurants in this area as well as accommodation options. China town and Gas town wete impressive as was ghd public transport systems.

title: Wonderful City
reviews: Vancouver was recommended to us by our daughter as a Must See.   She was right ! The city buildings are good ,like any other affluent city, But, what makes this different is the ease of getting around the public transport [ bus,boats, trolleys, trains] is easy to use and the bus drivers and friendly, helpful and happy to please their customers. Excellent service. The shops and cafes have friendly and helpful staff and the prices are reasonable, value for money. The city is clean and tidy with beautiful  gardens and the people in the street are helpful and friendly. Excellent attitude,  Great to experience.  Thank you.

title: Vancouver is beautiful and the people are incredible nice
reviews: We visited Vancouver for several days before a cruise and for the majority of the time in the downtown area.  There are certainly many sites to see including many restaurants and shops. The area is very walkable with the streets easily navigable. When lost, the incredibly nice people of Vancouver are able to point you on your way without complaints.  We would like to come back another time to spend more time exploring.

title: One of the best downtown I have ever visited
reviews: Vancouver is undoubtedly a rich city.Being a fan of exotic car spotting, the least I wanted was to come across some beast and beautiful exotic cars.And, I gotta tell you, during my stay, I spotted them like they were normal to the city.Nightlife is also lively and wonderful.Highly recommend to go during weekends.

title: Big City Big Buildings
reviews: Vancouver is a city of highrise buildings, narrow streets and lots of traffic. We took the Hop On Hop Off bus after our initial drive thru so we would not have to deal with traffic and parking. There is lots of historical building to see and lots of walking.

title: One of The Best Citys in The World
reviews: One of the greatest citys in the world a must see.  Yes no Uber or Lyft but the locale bus system is great in the downtown area during the day up to 9 pm.  So many places to shop, eat, and drink and visit.  You will not be able to go to all the places.  You can walk to nearly everything in Vancouver.  If you get lost just ask very friendly safe and really clean.  Robson street is a great area to shop also Granville street for Really large stores. Just enjoy you time here.

title: Cool!
reviews: Lots of shops for all budgets, many places to eat, safe, walkable, and with free wifi in the main avenue. Cool!

title: No Uber/Lyft
reviews: Plan your transportation accordingly and note when sky train is not running during the night. There is no Uber/Lyft. Beautiful 5* city with amazing restaurants, pubs, fantastic scenery and interesting tourist areas.

title: Shopping street
reviews: Try to stay at Robson street and it can consider the main shopping street in downtown. It is walking distance to Vancouver Convention Centre Center, Canada place and etc.

title: If you love to walk...
reviews: ...Vancouver is a very walkable city!  Hotels provide maps, streets are clearly marked.  We enjoyed walking around the city, exploring, site seeing and shopping!

title: Night lights
reviews: A very safe place to walk and plenty of dinner options. Shops open till late most nights busses available bikes to hire for the fitter ones, or even not so fit, Stanley park a great place to ride as its flat all the way around the 7 kms. Lots to see and do.

title: Plenty of Shops and places to eat
reviews: Downtown has plenty of places to eat and get any items you wish. Its not well kept though which will put you off.

title: Friendly
reviews: Vancouver is fab one of my fave places Good restaurants downtown and a place one can feel safe Only negative is you need a car to go everywhere

title: Everything for Everybody
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a small area filled with everything you might want to see and do. Many area of ethnic variety. Gastown where vancouver  started is filled with many site and historical adventure. See where "Gassy Jack" started his business and the statue of him at the entrance from the east. Many little shops and well as someone said  "tourist Trap" of vancouver, I you want to find something with Vancouver on it, this is the place to go, but do be "BUYER BEWARE"  and some things are not from Vancouver . Along the way you will find many shops and many restaurants either for just a stop in or to find a cold drink. This is also the home of the famous Gastown Steam Clock  which is a great attention grabber. It goes off every 15 min and counts down the hours at the top of the hour.  You can find anything for beer to coffee and pizza to a full coarse meal in this area. Canada Place is our local Cruise ship and Convention area, many spend their time in this area.. complete with an underground shopping center. YES it does rain in vancouver  but the locals call it  "Liquid Sunshine" .. While in this area you can  see FLY OVER CANADA  which is a thrill experience  As you experience the rest of the down town there are many areas still to see. The shopping district is right in the center of downtown. Robson Street (named after one of our priemiers)  is great for finding some of the name brands stores along with that Alberni street is next street over , where you find lots of shopping and restaurants . Many many places to Eat all along both streets.. One thing you will notice in Vancouver is the Food trucks, and cornor stands  with our famous JapaDog stands . Very interesting hot dogs.  As you move a little further into the city you can take a left and head to Yaletown which was at one time the hub of our Rail and Wharehouse district, BUT now is a residental and business area.  Many shops and so many restaurants This area is a great area to check out.. In the evening check out Mainland st for the best of restaurans from easy to full upper scale dining can be found. the Bluewater comes to mind.  Just so many things to do in Yaletown,  you can see the Yaletown roundhouse which gives you an Idea of where all the trains and history of Vancouver comes from.. as you keep going you can find yourself at the Seawall, which is  a walkway that can take you almost 26 kms around the city.. Beautiful for a great walk around the whole city.. Along the way you will find the beautiful Sunset Beach area  which then flows into the English Bay area where we have a nice beach (Summer late July/August) you might be lucky enough to catch one of the International Fireworks competitions, or maybe the first Sunday in Aug you might find the LGBT2+ Parade which usually gathers about 700,000 people . This is also the entrance of Davie Street which  has the local Gay Village along with the Rainbow Crosswalks  and the many shops and eaterys of the West End. you can also follow the sea wall all the way around Stanley Park. BUT DONT STOP THERE as the whole of 1000 Acres or 470 hecters of Land await you in this world famous Stanley Park, included in your walk within Stanley Park is every thing from Lawn bowling  the mini golf to the many many trails for biking and walking (rent bikes for additional fun)  also in the park in the 9PM gun which you can hear from most of downtown.. Brockton Point where the old lighthouse is located.. Of coarse also included is the Aquarium (paid entrance) .  Also you can keep going and end up at Prospect Point which has lots of History and you can stop for a snack or a full meal .  or just simply the best ice cream in Vancouver. Also one of the best place to view the world known Lions Gate Bridge.   As you keep going around the inner park you will find the historic Hollow Tree a must stop for pictures. Keep going and you find your self coming down the hill past a couple more of the trails  to The Teahouse Restaurant with all its history and now a Restaurant. the views from there are fantastic and also a favorite for Weddings  (Reservations in summer a MUST)  as you keep going around the park you will find yourself next to Lost Lagoon and all the wild geese and ducks and a beaver or two, which you can see from the trails. Keep going around and you find yourself leaving the park and going along a pathway that take you to Coal Harbour, where you will see all the boats and glory of Burrard inlet, From here you can take a float plane tour over Vancouver or if you want to try you can fly to Victoria on beautiful Vancouver Island. .. I hope this has given you a basic peek at what VANCOUVER is . Also you can even book your own private tour either for yourself or your family.  A LUXURY PRIVATE TOUR  gives you all of the above and even more .  You can get your own personal guides and makes stops . Think China Town Gastown Granville Island public market  Queen Elizabeth park.. The Wonders of Vancouver await you . I am sure once you have seen the sites of Vancouver you will be back for more..  I live here (if you could not tell)  ENJOY MY HOME CITY..

title: So Walkable with great shopping
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is one of my favorite places. If you stay in a hotel downtown, then basically anywhere is walkable! You don't even need a vehicle. You can walk to numerous stores, and restaurants and entertainment. If you have to leave downtown, you can take the Skytrain!

title: Love it !!
reviews: Always amazing !! Lots of history and great food and deals !! Even on rainy days !! always something to do or see or enjoy !! Love it always !!!!

title: Out of this world Views of Vancouver
reviews: When in the downtown area of Vancouver, you will witness breath-taking views of the City and the mountains in the backdrop.

title: Big City
reviews: We spent quite a bit of time walking to the various parts of town.  It is a good idea to speak to your Hotel Concierge for recommendations, as the travel books seem to miss a lot, or list items that are not the best!  There are many tourist trap shops in Gastown,for example, and one must be careful!  We did witness one vendor giving out completely false information about jewelry to an overseas traveler which was...not nice!  Research anything expensive you plan to buy, as BUYER BEWARE!  Also, there are some streets that one might want to avoid (panhandlers, a few sketchy people wanting to sell you things from their pockets - AHEM! I think you understand what I mean!).  Every city has these "areas".  The Hotel Concierge should be able to guide you away from those also!

title: Lots to see and do
reviews: Great history and views of the city.  You can walk around the area in a day but I would advise a 2 day visit to see Gas town, China town, coal harbour and the main tourist areas

title: Awesome, diverse, fun, safe!
reviews: It's a unique city and one of the most diverse cities in North America (and perhaps the world). A really cool mix of cultures (Asian, Indian, European, Middle Eastern, etc) that's visible on the streets and through the many restaurants. You can be from anywhere in the world and you'll fit right in.  It's awesome.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Lots of restaurants!! It was very hard to choose where to eat. Hardly any souvenir stores though and shopping can be expensive in Canada. Lots of different transportation. Also, lots of homeless people. It can be scary. Be aware of your surroundings.

title: Beautiful city surrounded by stunning water and mountains.
reviews: Amazing food (although a little pricey, even with the US exchange rate), beautiful city and plenty of outdoorsy activities. I highly recommend driving the sea to sky highway and stopping along the way wherever the sights catch your fancy.

title: Some good, some bad
reviews: The good, a beautiful city in a lot of ways. The bad, the amount of homeless people who have been left to rot in their own filth. People who are too far gone to care anymore. Crack addicts who are either prostrate in the street or out of their heads. Not just one or two, a whole couple of blocks of what can only be described as the walking dead. While they are not on the whole threatening they should not have to live in this way. Vancouver is a beautiful city but it is a long way off of being the best city on earth to live in.

title: Robson Drive
reviews: Robson drive is a must for travelers. Full of stores and vendors for fun food. Pacific mall is great for shoppers and the restraunts are many!

title: Not open for business.
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is nothing than expensive ritzy shopping, sirens blasting 24 hours a day, homeless with mental illness and addictions everywhere and tons of restaurants and bars.  Anything else closes at 5pm so nothing else other than to eat and drink to do.

title: Wonderful downtown - safe, scenic, and serene
reviews: Safe, tranquil, brick sidewalks, mountain scenery, nice stores ‚Äì what else could anyone want? I walked and, in the morning, ran these streets for four days, and like many of my colleagues, ended up loving this city.

title: Explore the city by bike
reviews: I rented a bike to explore the city and I am impressed by all the bike routes available around Vancouver.  The architecture of each condo is also beautiful with each its own style.There were enough dedicated bike routes that I didn't feel in danger with cars driving around

title: Clean Safe City
reviews: Our hotel was in the city we stayed here for 11nights used as our base for day trips to outer suburbs, and sight seeing trips also we did a day trip to Seattle from here a very easy drive. I always felt safe walking around day and night, there is a block to avoid down East Hastings st, but you would never need to go down there anyways, all the major shops and restaurants are away form this area anyways. Vancouver has many BIG BRAND name stores and the usual well known Takeaway spots, I loved the unknown food court vendors for a quick cheap snack under most of the department stores and one down riverfront near Vancouver Square where the Famous Blue Raindrop statue is , also found a great Irish Bar and a Delish Thai restaurant, really so many to choose from . We also loved meeting a First Nation Man who did some original hand wood carvings for my partner and signed the back, he was along the main street opposite the big glass which is light up at night art sculpture looks like a snow flake.

title: Anniversary
reviews: Vancouver is a gem for a getaway. The city has great appeal with excellent hotels and restaurants to choose from. Driving distance to a wide selection of outdoor activities and camping.

title: Canada 2018
reviews: We stayed in the heart of Downtown Vancouver great spot easy walking distance for shopping wide range of stores to choose from we found a fantastic laundrette three blocks away from where we stayed(Alberni street) what a find staff were friendly and helpful place was pristine so clean and the art deco decor was incredible relax and watch the big screen TV while u wait and also enjoy the banter with attending staffHighly recommend this business Garry and Jo Harris

title: Downtown convenience
reviews: It was nice. Downtown has everything you would need from restaurants to conveniene of sending your package back home.

title: Won‚Äôt be rushing back
reviews: We‚Äôve just left Vancouver after a 3 night stay on our road trip. We had high expectations of the city but we were so disappointed. There are a few areas that are lovely to visit such as Stanley Park and Granville Island but apart from them the city is awful. The government of Vancouver should be ashamed of themselves, it‚Äôs dirty and absolutely full of homeless people. I‚Äôve never seen such large groups of homeless on street corners. 50-60 people in just one group and then streets lined with them. It was like something from a zombie movie, very scary. There are also very few true locals, Chinese people everywhere hence it‚Äôs name hongouver. Such a shame. We won‚Äôt be coming back and if you have small children I would say avoid.

title: Safe, Interesting City
reviews: Sit down on a bench and people watch ... or stroll through the many high end stores.  Never felt unsafe the three days we were there.

title: A stunning waterfront split by destitution
reviews: Those reviewers who only mention the waterfront and Stanley Park are misleading visitors.  Whilst they, and the shopping are first class, they must realise that outside a very small central area, and especially the east side, Vancouver is a large, dirty, dangerous place.  If you want an illustration of this just Google ‚Äòopioid deaths‚Äô.

title: Bicyclist running wild
reviews: Beautiful city, completed ruined by the Mayor's obsession of bike lanes. At least there are 60% unnecessary if not more. Bike riders are not always using the designated lanes, but go on the streets and pedestrian pavements. They have no insurance, and cause potential dangers to pedestrians and automobiles. They have no regards of rules and the police or bylaw enforcers can do nothing.Unnecessary traffic delays. The bike lanes are totally useless over five months of the years during wet and cold seasons. One can hardly see a rider anywhere, but the bike lane take over one vehicular lane causing unnecessary traffic jams, resulting in more exhaust smog in this beautiful clean city.

title: A city of contrasts
reviews: A great tourist destination, Vancouver Downtown has some amazing shopping or you can go down to the seafront or the old quarter of Gastown for bars and cafes.

title: A mixed bag!
reviews: In terms of beauty and surrounding scenery there a few places that can rival Vancouver. However the city really needs to do something about its homeless problem. Such a beautiful city and then turn round the corner and there any many many homeless that are not being cared for. I found this so surprising because the city gives off such a cosmopolitan vibe. We were approached more than ten times by homeless and the mentally ill asking for money or shouting/saying something weird. Some areas are worse than others, parts of east hastings street and Chinatown were particularly bad. Unfortunately it will stick in my mind over the beauty and friendliness of this city.

title: Lots to do and too much traffic!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a great place to go and walk around. The hotels and restaurant scene is a must and the water views are out of this world!

title: we had a great time
reviews: lots of options for shopping and restaurants!  easy walking everywhere.  we enjoyed staying near the water.

title: Excellent hightowers and easy to cross the roads
reviews: It is a lovely city and clean. surrounded with the beach on one side and the Port harbour on the other sideShops are more like posh ones (Gucci...) unless you go to gastown and Chinatown. Roads are based on a krisscross with pedestrian friendly crossings. The only downfall is the homeless but that seems to be in every city

title: Modern buildings an a huge cruise port
reviews: Modern buildings, a huge cruise port and some other interesting things. Worth a visit if you are in the area.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: It was pretty epic being downtown.  The best part is the incredible initiative of the city to provide access to foot traffic and bike lanes.  It was awesome to see all the people walking and the immense amount of people biking.  More cities should look at this model :)

title: Impressive City but Not Impressed
reviews: I have been in Vancouver for a number of times as a tourist.  This time I spent more time in downtown Vancouver than ever before.  I was impressed with the city as well as the shops in downtown.  The waterfront as well as Gastown was beautiful, Sunset beach was spectacular however there were a number of homeless peeps in the downtown area and some thing needs to be done to assist them.  For a city that has tax on goods and services this city needs to be step up and do much better to clean up this place.  Some of the streets in the downtown area seriously needed public toilets as well.  The stench of human urination was common in a number of streets.

title: Vibrant Downtown
reviews: Vancouver has the nicest downtown.  A walk down Robson Street or any street has lots of restaurants and shops. The waterfront and coal harbour area is stunning.  Stanley park, English bay are all walking distance from Downtown

title: Street Smarts Needed!
reviews: We stayed downtown while visiting Vancouver.  We walked to so many different parts of the downtown area.  It seems there are several shopping and eating areas.  The large mall was great.  You might be prepared to see many homeless people outside the mall area and the streets around the mall.   We never actually felt unsafe though.  So many people at all times are out walking.  During the day, the streets are very busy with lot's of people out and about.  We walked to China Town.  I didn't like that area at all as it seemed unsafe to me and the sites were too depressing as far as the homeless, etc.  Didn't seem clean at all.  The upscale shopping area was free of homeless people and was very clean it seemed.  Very busy and it seemed safe. While out walking you just need to be aware of where you are as it can change quickly.  There are certain routes you would want to take to stay safe and free of sites that aren't too pleasant.

title: Clean City
reviews: What a beautiful city and very clean!!  For being so spread out and many businesses, we just Loved it!

title: Great City
reviews: A variety of things to do in downtown Vancouver. There is some good shopping in Pacific Place mall which has some high end stores as well as the usual stores in any Canadian mall. There are many restaurants offering a variety of cuisines and reasonable prices. Stroll over to Canada Place and view a cruise ship (if one is in port). Continue to Gastown by way of the historic Waterfront Railway Station and the statue of the angel and soldier beside it. In Gastown see the steam clock and visit the souvenir shops that sell lots of Canadian themed items. The city is clean and safe to walk in although check with your hotel about a couple of areas around Hastings Street you may wish to avoid if you are going over to Chinatown. Obey the traffic lights as traffic tends to be very heavy at time. Lots of good shopping and eating opportunities downtown. Public washrooms can be tricky to find so if you find one, you might want to use it - try a restaurant if necessary.

title: Gorgeous City
reviews: We were so impressed with this clean scenic city....we walked most everywhere....loved the atmosphere...such a variety of things to see and do...

title: Weekend away
reviews: Always love the hustle and bustle of this downtown. So much to see and do. Walk Robson and Grandville to shop. Make sure to check out the museum. Great places to eat and drink.

title: Spring Flowers - Spetacular Views
reviews: Vancouver Harbour offers a beautiful mix of walk-able paths / bike path / parks and of course an extensive marina.  Flowers were in full bloom in early May

title: Best in Canada
reviews: Amazing views of water and mountains. Great vibe. Seawall. People. Cruise ships. Shops. Food. Drink. It‚Äôs all here. Great hub of activity!

title: City of Everyone!
reviews: The downtown area has a little something for everyone from shopping & great dining venues to some great site seeing! Easy transportation by cycling or transit!

title: Great downtown
reviews: Great place to walk, safe , pretty . Nice stores and restaurants everywhere. Good coffee houses. Connects easily to bridges and other areas such as Granville island and sea walk.Really nice downrown

title: thrills and spills in a lively city
reviews: always a pleasure to be in Vancouver. Plenty to do and see like so many cities, but Vancouver is a very welcoming place and i felt completely safe

title: Shopping Time
reviews: Interesting walking the streets of downtown, but did not like seeing so many out of sorts people, vagrants, drug-users and crazies.  Really opened my eyes that this city certainly has more problems than I thought.  Some parts I did not feel safe and I would suggest to have a little street sense.  In saying that, it is well worth looking!

title: Not a good one
reviews: The transportation is good. The facilities is superb. The shop is also high end. But what is not good we see so many homeless almost every corner of the block. May the government can handle the sitaution or the tourist will have bad experience in here.

title: Nice city
reviews: Fairly clean. Nice city. People friendly. Easy to navigate with city maps. Walkable city. East side is rough.

title: Relaxed Downtown
reviews: No hustle and bustle as compared to Toronto. Nice people, lots of travel options, $10 day pass is best to reach all the attractions, works on skytrain/buses. many food trucks with halal food too. small and medium markets offer many type of food takeout or sit-in. many tims :) an umbrella or rain jacket is a must.

title: Start at Canada place
reviews: You can buy passes to attraction among maps. The upper high end shopping starts around the Hyatt Recency. Pay for a hop on hop off tour , that was really good for location. Beware of Chinatown,  a lot of addicts and homeless.  Not safe by no means. Right of the city is great.

title: Nice downtown
reviews: We made the nice stroll from the parq casino to the international shopping mall, nice and clean and safe with lots of police presence but the homeless encampments were just blocks away.

title: Great to explore day and night
reviews: Loved wandering around Vancouver. Felt a very safe place to be and were not hassled at any point. All the shops, markets and cafes we went to were super friendly. Look forward to spending more time in Vancouver in the future.

title: Very Beautiful and Charming
reviews: l loved this city which is very beautiful and charming. Vancouver has many kindness people, meaningful history, beautiful nature, good restaurants and hotels.l think that it is enough for a city(downtown)

title: Great trip to Vancouver
reviews: My husband and I travelled to Vancouver in September 2017 and loved the city. We did a road trip to the Canadian Rockies that started and ended in Vancouver. When we arrived we stayed in a Airbnb in Yaletown. It was a beautiful high rise condo. There was a lot to do in walking distance. On the return we stayed at Blue Horizon on Robson St. We did a seaplane tour through Harbour Air and a Whale watching tour through Steveston Seabreeze Adventures and saw 25-30 orcas! Vancouver is a very clean and friendly city with so much to do and see. We will definitely go back one day.

title: An exciting city
reviews: Vancouver is an interesting, ethnically diverse city that is full of wonderful food and areas representative of the communities. It has beautiful views of the mountains, oceans, and forests. There are parks and trees everywhere. The public transportation makes it easy to negotiate the vast distances. Driving is difficult due to heavy traffic and many one way streets. There are many amenities, activities and events to enjoy. It is also a shoppers paradise.

title: Find anything
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is really diverse. You will find everything you could be looking for. Or, iff you are a people watcher, you could spend all day at a coffee bar, in your heaven.

title: Love Vancouver
reviews: Lots of great shops and places to eat.  Great for people watching and everyone is very friendly which is what Canada is all about.  Lots of places to go and do different things.  Two waterfronts surround the downtown so you are always close to water

title: Vancouver
reviews: Chose a great week weather was great. Plenty of places to see and a lot to do. Recommend hop on hop off as this gives you a great insight to the City. Subway to Downtown easy to use and very cheap. Recommend the Seabus to the Northshore and take the bus back to Downtown see some great scenery along the way

title: Beautiful..
reviews: Yes I will be honest most towns are beautiful but the whole idea is the weather, I know residents don‚Äôt like the weather but since I‚Äôm a hot person anywhere with cold is great, the coldest the better, the town has everything a big city has and more, what I liked the most was the people, everybody I and my friend encountered were great and always happy to talk to us. Over all go to Vancouver!!!

title: best downtown
reviews: This was the cleanest downtown I have visited. Lots of great food spots and asian stores. All walking distances. Towards gaslamp can get a little sketch but besides that, great.

title: Vibrant area
reviews: So much to see and do in this area. Many top quality pubs and restaurants line the streets. Heaps of quirky tourist shops to buy that souvenir for someone back home. This place also is famous for its steam operated clock. Well worth a visit and allow some time to walk around and explore.

title: A Beautiful Downtown
reviews: Between the flowers (in spring anyway) and the architecture, downtown Vancouver is gorgeous. It's also lively, interesting, and easy to explore. There are tons of coffee shops, restaurants, shopping, hotels, and a number of attractions. Transit seems decent, but it's easily walkable if you're in reasonable shape (it is hilly). Photographers will find plenty of subject matter. It was also clean and felt safe even at night. And people are really friendly here. I hope I can go back soon.

title: Great downtown!
reviews: We had not been to Vancouver before, and after a bit of research decided to stay in the downtown area.  It was a good choice!  Very clean, very friendly folks, good restaurants, and very walkable to and from various sites to visit (Granville Island, Air Tours, Gas Light District, ...).   The Canadian people were all very friendly and helpful.  Really enjoyed our first visit to Vancouver BC!

title: fun fun fun
reviews: spent a couple of days wandering around downtown. of course a ladies dream with all the different department stores mainly the bay.. shoppers paradise but what i loved was if weather inclement they have a underground tunnel linking the department stores.. i wish this was in every country,, fantastic

title: Vibrant City
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a vibrant city. It's a multi-cultural city with cuisine from all over the world.

title: Vancouver downtown
reviews: Recent stay in Downtown Vancouver. Like most north American cities, on a grid system, easy to find your way around. Huge array of shops, malls and restaurants. Most shops don't open until 10, but then are open to late. Staff are helpful and friendly without being over pushy. Be aware that like most big cities, Vancouver has a big homeless problem, and you may well be approached and asked for money.

title: Clean, safe and easy to get around.
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has history, great people watching and great food and beer. Friendly city, will be coming back for a longer stay.

title: Even more beautiful at night
reviews: This city will not disappoint. Make sure to visit all the recommended places, they are so worth it. Finally a sunny day in Vancouver everyone is out and about!!!

title: Concrete & Glass Buildings with lovely Views (but a lot of Homeless People)
reviews: The downtown is pretty with the backdrop of the bay, harbor and the snow capped mountains in the distance. Somehow all the buildings look the same - there is a homogeny in the architecture that unless the names at the ground level were not there, you wouldn‚Äôt know which one stood for what... they‚Äôre all glass & steel with balconies. I felt individual Character was missing.The Downtown is laid out in a grid fashion with blocks (pretty much like NYC).But the best area is to go to the waiter front , the Canada place and look at the views from there.One of the things that were a damper for me were the overwhelmingly large number of homeless that seemed to all be in the downtown area ... almost every 3 minute you came across one.... it was quite a dramatic paradox to the tall structures of wealth & abundance

title: Lots to see and do!
reviews: Downtown especially Robson street had a lot to see and do. Shopping was great and food choices were endless.

title: Great stay
reviews: Stayed at the Vancouver Hotel in the top floor. Had an amazing time. Our room was huge. Had 2 doors. loved the view of the city. Wish we had stayed longer.

title: Awesome, great walk
reviews: Discover downtown Vancouver walking through its streets. Nice and easy to walk around. Leave the car in the garage and Walk!

title: Most beautiful views
reviews: Vancouver is beautiful and with all cherry trees blooming ,flowers everywhere is even more beautiful

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Consistently ranked one of the most liveable cities in the world, Vancouver is celebrated for its striking natural beauty, ready access to beaches and the outdoors, mild year-round climate and steadfast commitment to public transit and other active transportation modes, including walking and cycling. Yet, that‚Äôs just the beginning. Beyond ocean, mountains and the outdoors, Vancouver offers so much more: namely, a business climate that‚Äôs innovative, progressive, green and approachable.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: You will fall in love with Vancouver. Shopping, restaurants, views, skylines, waterfront, Staley Park

title: Plenty to see / do
reviews: Fun downtown area - plenty to see / doThere are quite a number of homeless who will come and ask you for money etc - unsure what the city is doing about this. Downtown is easy to walk.

title: FABULOUS CITY
reviews: Lots of things to see, and you can walk round most of them. I used the buses and it was easy. Stanley Park is a must along with the beach front. The horse drawn coaches are lovely and a very leisurely way to see the Park.

title: Everything one could want!!
reviews: Such an exciting place to visit!! From the adorable boutiques to luxury hotels, Movie theatres and more.

title: Riding bike around seawall, soaking the beauty of waterfront
reviews: Vancouver is just beautiful. It's all about waterfront, beautiful mountains, iconic Lions Gate Bridge, walking and bike friendly Stanley park... I just feel jealous with people who live here. They have kept their city nice and clean and very tourist friendly. Mt Whitney, suspension bridge, walk in the cliffs keeps tourist busy doing some thing around here. All varieties of delicious food offers some thing for every ethnic background.. just amazing to be around. I will keep coming back just to stroll around the Stanley park.. if nothing else.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Always nice to visit Vancouver, so much too see and do. We were downtown for a Canucks game, and enjoyed our trip.

title: Scenic & Fresh Air
reviews: Westcoast air is fantastic.Awesome mountain views fr all directions.Shopping though trails behind every major city.  No deals to be had but all legitimate in that regards.Nor is the nightlife worth mentioning.

title: Vibrant and uninhibited
reviews: This is one fantastic city perfect in every way, well may be it rains a bit too much, but that is why it is so green and you do get used to it.  Swim, play golf and ski all in 1 day within 50 km.  Yes, it is pricy, but hotels are a bargain in the winter.

title: Pristee, Modern, Walkable
reviews: Vancouver is a city of varied architecture and there is a lot of contemporary architecture and expensive real estate. Doesn't have a lot of old buildings as it was really founded in the 1880s. The city doesn't impress too much from close up, but it is the views of it from the outer portions that make one understand its beauties. While one can have more fun with the quaintness, geography, and uniqueness of a place like San Francisco from right in front of the houses, hills, cablecars, or buildings, it is the uniqueness of the natural environs of Vancouver that make it much the more beautiful a place from afar. The combination of mountains and water that surrounds the place are quite unique and eye-catching. For the most part, downtown is eminently compact, flat, and walkable. There is a great variety of ethnic foods, many offering unique takes on the natural food sources here--which includes great sea food.

title: Amazing!!!
reviews: Vancouver has no doubt one of the prettiest skylines and with the bay, the mountains and all the green areas

title: shopping mecca of North America
reviews: Vancouver is truly a great destination. The shopping and restaurant scene is simply world-class with great public transportation so that the traffic gridlock is tolerable. There just wasn't enough time for everything we wanted to see and do so are already planning a return trip. Would love to visit the Chinatown with its Chinese garden, for example. Oh, Canada, you've got it going on!

title: Lots to see!
reviews: Jam packed with things to see and activities to do.If you're in Canada get out and explore.Downtown Van is best seen on foot.Grab a map, put on your comfy shoes and start walking

title: Beautiful naturalistic
reviews: This city is muito linda cuidade ! It's very clean , the only con about this city is the taxes so it can be expensive. Check out the Vancouver Lookout at the Harbour center it have a 360¬∞view of the city. Also the city it's safe to visit

title: BEAUTIFUL
reviews: Very friendly people and safe. Great walking city. So much to see and do. We stayed seven days and could have stayed seven more.

title: Enjoy The Experience!
reviews: Proper walking shoes required if you plan to do a bit of sight seeing.  Everything very accessible. Lots of restaurants to choose from! If you can, pick up a map of downtown to use.

title: Must see
reviews: It is kind of a centre of a big city... big department stores, nice and cheap places to eat. Has a vancouver charm

title: üíãüçªüéÇüçö
reviews: Everything, all in one place! Can satisfy the needs of all ages. Science world & Vancouver aquarium for the kids, shopping centres like pacific Center for the shoppers and so much more ( spas, bars, restaurants, hotels... etc. )

title: Busy
reviews: Sad to say that I found W. Georgia by the Bay to be a bit disgusting with the smell of urine in all the vestibules where people were waiting for the bus. Avoided that street the rest of my visit.

title: Beautiful city with great park
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is enchanting. Go to the waterfront for a stroll. Shop and dine in Gas Town. Head over to large Stanley park for all kinds of activities.

title: Skyscrapers
reviews: Big bunch of skyscrapers housing the banks and offices, plus a lot of hotels.  Big department stores.  Well-served by transit.  Next door to the convention center.

title: Best area to stay in Vancouver
reviews: We were recommended to stay in downtown Vancouver and it did not disappoint! So many places to eat, we stayed on the main strip so transport was right outside our hotel and the stadiums were walking distance so easy to go to the ice hockey games! Definitely worth staying in this area

title: Find yourself in Hollywood movies!
reviews: Very nice place. It has the charm of New York, similar sightseeing but the traffic is way better. If you pay close attention, you'll realize that lots of New York motion pictures are actually shot in Downtown Vancouver.

title: Beautiful
reviews: Love this place. so diversified. But where are the garbage bin? The traffic is manageable considering the size of the city, the local drivers and polite. But the price of parking is just plane a scam.....it's a serious problem

title: We do sleep at night, daytime great
reviews: There are things to see and do here.  However bars do close early mornings.  Tim Horton's some are open 24 per day, 7 days per week except maybe on Christmas day.  Love the parks and Seawall

title: Vancouver's heart of the city
reviews: The core of the city is in what is called the Downtown.  Its boundaries are wide and found within Robson, Burrard, Granville & Georgia streets.  Visiting this area means an opportunity to shop, dine & walk around taking in the sights.  The steps of the main Art Gallery are a gathering place for people voicing their opinion.  It can be an interesting place to hang out.  Downtown offers something for everyone.

title: Wonderful City to walk through
reviews: I had a wonderful time walking through Downtown Vancouver. Being from NYC and living in the SF Bay Area for 8 years, it was felt like a wonderful mixture of both. Downtown Vancouver looked very much like Upper East/West Side of Manhattan in most parts, think 5th Ave or Madison Ave. While the shopping district reminded me of Times Square. Given that Vancouver is enveloped in a Bay and has mountains across them, that was very reminiscent of being in San Francisco and looking north to view Marin Headlands and the East Bay. Very walkable and public transportation is cheap, fast and timely.

title: A wonderful city!
reviews: Truly enjoyed my stay in Vancouver! Lots of places to visit in and around and different ethnic cuisines to try!

title: Beautiful
reviews: Not much to say but VERY nice place to visit, VIEWS were Amazing and there was nothing bad about it.

title: Downtown
reviews: Loved downtown. So many restaurants to choose from. Go on Zomato to get real reviews.People here pretty friendly considering it‚Äôs a city.Lots of vagrants around though, some pretty scary. The people need to stop feeding them and giving them money, it‚Äôs making this city look bad.

title: One of my favorite big cities
reviews: If you're into big cities Vancouver is for you. It has the shops that you see everywhere else, but then there is so much more! We came across two really cute dessert shops: L'eclair and Laduree. Great for a snack or for gifts to take home. There are a ton of wonderful restaurants. Two Roots Canadian clothing stores. Pick up items for yourself or for gifts. There also appeared to be a lot of bars to hand out in.

title: Upbeat
reviews: An upbeat city with friendly locals, lots of restaurants and attractions, and is easily navigable. Had a tonne of fun wandering downtown with teammates.

title: A fabulous first experience
reviews: Visiting downtown Vancouver was a first travel experience. I drove from Washington to Canada and although a large city, I found Vancouver to be an easy city to navigate alone. The downtown was a wonderful place to explore with wonderful museums, galleries, high end shops, boutiques, posh hotels and restaurants. Walking was enjoyable. Beautiful antique and contemporary architecture. Be sure to look up!

title: Great!
reviews: I love Vancouver for, amongst other things, how easy it is to walk around. I was working downtown and staying downtown. It was so nice to be able to walk to work. And, in the evening, you can walk pretty well everywhere. The skyline is lovely.

title: beautiful city
reviews: was on our way back from a cruise, and was flying home from vancouver, beautiful city, wish we had more time to see more, the trees are amazing

title: Love Vancouver
reviews: Have visited a few times in past 4 years. Love the shopping, the scenery, how easy public transit is and the tourist attractions.

title: Business or Pleasure- Forget About a Car use Public Transit
reviews: On this business trip I decided to try every sort of transportation- Skytrain, city transit, taxi, harbour ferry and sea bus.  All modes were very easy to navigate even for a country bumpkin. I feel quite cosmopolitan now.

title: Not sure why this has it's own page...
reviews: As a local in Vancouver, I don't know why this has it's own page. If you travel to Vancouver and don't go downtown I have no idea what you did. Almost every hotel is downtown, most of the attractions, shopping and restaurants too. It's great, but it's surely where you'll be.

title: One of the Best in the World!
reviews: I have traveled / stayed in numerous cities within Europe /China /USA! Need to say that this is one of the Best Cities to stay & see in the world! Nice variety of things to see & do! You will find something for everyone, young or mature!

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Visit Gas Town. This is the old section of Vancouver. Nice place to walk around and have a bite to eat. Many shops and restaurants here.  Also visit Canada Place and do experience Fly Over Canada! It is amazing.

title: Love Vancouver!!
reviews: We were in Vancouver in August 2017 for a conference and found it was one of our favorite cities that we have visited.  Extremely walkable city and we never felt nervous or hesitant while walking around.  We probably walked at least 5-10 miles a day as we love to walk.  Vancouver has so many areas to check out, restaurants to try, etc. we were never bored.  The city offered many shuttles that brought us to other sites to see so that was very handy.  Highly recommend Vancouver!!

title: Good Shopping Downtown
reviews: We stayed for a few days at an airbnb near to Robson Street before taking a cruise to Alaska. Great location. Everything (stores, grocery, port) was within walking distance. We felt safe in that area, although at night you could hear the street noise - cars, sirens, people.

title: Nice City On The Water/Excellent Convention Facilities/But a Serious Cab Problem
reviews: We‚Äôve been to Vancouver a half dozen times now on business conferences/conventions, and really like the city; nice clean downtown, a lot of nice restaurants and shopping areas, and a lot of nice hotels.  Here‚Äôs our one gripe:  No Uber, No Lyft, and if you ask a restaurant to call a cab for you, they tell you the obvious:  don‚Äôt waste your time because it will take forever to get here, if they come at all.  What?  How do you expect convention business with that situation.  We were told to ‚Äúaggressively‚Äù hail cabs.  All well and good, but if you go to one of Gastown‚Äôs restaurants, good luck getting a cab....after waiting 15 minutes to hail one, the cabbie said he doesn‚Äôt go there very often during the day since there‚Äôs not much a demand; and at night it‚Äôs crazy with the bar scene so he prefers to avoid it.  Go to Yaletown restaurants, same thing.  So Vancouver Tourist Authority:  here‚Äôs the message:  WE WANT UBER/LYFT ride services where we go so we can get transportation to and from where we want to go; and we like paying by app since it doesn‚Äôt involve cash, and we don‚Äôt use credit cards with cabbies since we have had problems.  So get real if you want tourists/business conference people.  You have a serious problem here with that.  Nice city; time to join today‚Äôs tech world.

title: Spitting distance
reviews: ...from trendy restaurants in Gastown, authentic Chinatown, and many homeless in between.  You‚Äôll definitely want to visit two outa three and spend a few Canabucks on all.

title: Fun downtown
reviews: Lots to do and wonderful places to eat. Shopping, the charming gaslight district .  Walking  around Canada place .

title: Clean, safe, walkable Downtown
reviews: We decided not to rent a car on our vacation and I‚Äôm glad we didn‚Äôt. The city is very walkable and if there is a location that is too far to walk, it‚Äôs very easy to catch a cab. Never felt unsafe walking and we walked all over the place. As with all cities I‚Äôm sure there are some unsafe areas but on the mostly beaten track I never felt worried.

title: Lots to explore and enjoy
reviews: Very walkable and safe area of town. Lots of shops and restaurants/bars (many of which were open late, ranged from casual to high-end).

title: cool down
reviews: this was a good place when you like crowd and many options of food in the area i visited it in dec. it was cold wave all along but life is fast here everyone is in hurry and there are many areas you can walk along or rent a cycle outside skytrain station

title: Awesome shopping
reviews: Love walking up and down Robson, beautiful shops and some nice building to enjoy, the library is beautiful. Nice to stroll and look for the food trucks they are easy to find and have really good snacks or lunch. Down at the harbour walk around the pan pacific and you get the best views of the city. The is so much to see and watch the seaplanes it take ride over to the North shore in the seabus. So much to do in this beautiful city and super easy to walk or get a rental bike available at many spots downtown.

title: Just a normal Downtown... like every other city.
reviews: Vancouver downtown is just like every other city. They have a huge mall, lots of Food and that is about it. What I have seen here is there were more homeless people or mentally challenged folks wandering around compared to other downtowns of other cities. Nothing special.

title: I can‚Äôt wait to go back
reviews: This is a fantastic city to visit. It is easy to get around. The people are friendly and the food is delicious. I plan on making it back to this wonderful city at least once a year.

title: Lots to see and do
reviews: There is something for virtually everyone in the core of this large metropolitan area. DO go by the tourist bureau, if you like to be organized, or have limited time available. OR, wander serendipitously, starting along the waterfront.

title: I love this city
reviews: Beautiful downtown, lots of wonderful shops and restaurants. Robson is a great ( expensive ) Street, Vancouver Art Gallery is well worth throwing visit.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Definitely go for a walk downtown but be prepared for anything and everything. A cosmopolitan place.

title: Love this city!
reviews: We were lucky enough to enjoy beautiful weather, great walkway along the waterline with plenty of Restaurants with open air seating. We loved the overall "groove" of the city and the friendliness of everyone strolling the walkways.

title: I love Vancouver!
reviews: Definitely take the tour of Vancouver that goes through Stanley Park & Downtown Vancouver !  It gives you the opportunity to get on & off all day long!  So many wonderful Architecturally beautiful buildings to explore!  Stanley Park is huge - bigger than Central Park in New York City!  So many different areas to explore- trees that grow through other trees'. Trees that are over 100 years old!  The Indian totem Pole collections are amazing.  Beautiful views from their lookouts too!  In the Park they also have an Aquarium which is amazing!  Also a horse-drawn trolley ride through part of Stanley Park is very enjoyable!

title: Concert city, lots to see and do
reviews: I went to a Shane Koyckan concert at the Vogue Theatre.  A great venue.  I took the bus to and from home and I felt safe downtown.

title: Great for the walk around ‚Ä¶
reviews: But take transit into the downtown core unless you want to mortgage your house for parking.  From the trendy (see $$$) stores on Robson to the walk along the waterfront - Vancouver has it all!

title: Traffic is horrible but..
reviews: So much to see and do downtown. No way to do it all, see it all or taste it all in just s few days. Vancouver as s tourist destination?  Why not. This is s beautiful city with so much to offer.

title: Modern skyline
reviews: Downtown is very modern with a bustling atmosphere; sleek high rise buildings; some nice older building cradled next to gleaming spires; a myriad of shops; many, many caf√©s & coffee shops.

title: Easy city to walk around
reviews: I like cities you can walk around easily, as  it‚Äôs usually nicer than public transport (which Vancouver also has plenty of). I‚Äôd say driving and parking would be the least appealing option as there‚Äôs a fair bit of traffic and parking isn‚Äôt cheap. There are also a few one way streets and some you can‚Äôt turn into (and they aren‚Äôt always signed to indicate that). Every neighbourhood has something to stop and do or view. Lots of cafes and restaurants and shops, as well as museums and galleries. There was no point at which I felt unsafe walking around, even later at night. This is a very visually appealing city and one I‚Äôll certainly be coming back to see again!

title: upscale!
reviews: Many food options! Upscale, beautiful and easy to get around with the electric trains. Definitely need to a couple nights to explore everything.

title: Beautiful old world charm and Modern city.
reviews: Vancouver has the warmth of small neighborhoods and "old world charm", but also has beautiful modern skyline and high end couture.  A lovely city to visit...gardens, mountains, ocean, rivers..beautiful area.

title: Very clean and easy to walk around
reviews: I‚Äôve been to plenty of large cities. This one is one of the best in my book.  It has it all.  Shopping from boutiques to luxury.  Plenty of bars and restaurants will suit anyone‚Äôs needs

title: Urban and accessible
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a great place to visit.  Located on a peninsula, it is surrounded by waterfront trails, parks, and entertainment venues.  Buying a transit day-pass is a great way to get around, it lets you ride the buses, the subway, as well as the SeaBus which takes you to a public market in North Vancouver.   Stanley Park dominates the end of the peninsula and is almost as large as downtown; it houses the Aquarium and hiking trails through the woods, bike paths along the water, as well as gardens and play fields.  Downtown is densely packed with residential towers, so the pedestrian action is busy all day long.   And there are plenty of good restaurants and shops to explore as well as small parks and plazas.

title: Fantastic
reviews: Vancouver is a very pleasant city, in a island with lots of buildings and nice view. Lots of shops, pubs and restaurants.

title: Very Busy and Lots of Shops
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is full of shops and crowds. There are some nice buildings and spots there but the majority of it is dirty and dark. We also saw some weird stuff happening like a man vomiting into the bins and a coffee cup. There are heaps of shops, including some Canadian ones such as Roots. It is very busy on the streets with all the big shops so I would recommend to avoid those unless you want to do some shopping. We didn't see a lot of Vancouver but I hope that it is nicer than Downtown Vancouver.

title: Great experience
reviews: It's easy to find your way around downtown Vancouver with lots of various shops to have something to interest everyone. Quaint little bars for those who don't want to shop and even a bar within one of the larger shopping centres which is a unique experience I have not seen before.

title: Time for shopping
reviews: If you love shopping this place is the best for you at Vancouver.Pacific center is very good and many other shops over there.

title: After 48 years of looking at the Skyline. . . I am STILL in Awe....
reviews: Moved here in 1970 . . . didn't realize how BEAUTIFUL Vancouver is until I moved to other places... (Toronto, Chicago, San Francisco,  and others) . . . Returned in 1984 and WILL NEVER Leave again!

title: Closed early
reviews: We cruised around town on a Sunday afternoon and we found a lot of stuff closed early. I was not used to this but good for them. There is a lot it hills to walk but it was fun to look around. Not like LA  or New York.

title: Interesting
reviews: GreT to stroll around. Lots of shops and restaurants. The place to begin and end every day. The centre of Vancouver.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Friendly people and beautiful city.  Getting around the city was easy.  Lots of great shops and places to eat.

title: Seriously crazy drivers
reviews: Vancouver was a neat city as long as we were walking.  As soon as we got in the car it was absolute chaos. My husband is a really calm driver but even he was like "what's wrong with these people."

title: Cold in Dec but beautiful & clean!
reviews: Wonderful assortment of beautiful stores running for several blocks. The streetlamps for decorated for the holidays and despite the cold many people just bundled up to stroll and shop.

title: Love this City
reviews: We love Downtown Vancouver. There is so much shopping, many restaurants and a lot of attractions. Wear comfortable shoes. You will be doing a lot of walking.

title: Tour of the shops
reviews: Good range of shops, probably mostly higher end, but similar to most cities in that respect.  Plenty of room to walk, and easy to cross roads.

title: Picturesque
reviews: I have travelled to many Cities in the world but the Vancouver area is definitely my favorite.  The downtown area is surpassed by many other downtown areas but the surroundings in the Vancouver area are by far the best anyone can imagine. Great place for a Holiday !

title: Very busy downtown
reviews: The downtown district of Vancouver was very busy and crowded.  Tourists mixed with residents made for crowded sidewalks and heavy traffic.  We walked down Robson St. and enjoyed some window shopping  we also made it to the big mall under Nordstrom but it was crazy busy so we didn‚Äôt stay long.

title: Gorgeous downtown! Be prepared for bumper-to-bumper traffic.
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is gorgeous. Lots of beautiful buildings and history. The architecture is stunning and of course the view to the water is impressive. Even though the expanse of downtown is not really that long in miles (kilometers if you're Canadian), be prepared to sit in bumper-to-bumper traffic if you're trying to get from place to place. There is no easy way to get through downtown. So, if you're staying in a downtown Vancouver hotel, and want to get somewhere outside of the downtown area, make sure you allow yourself extra time to get to your destination. I've had great success using the app Waze. Other than that, it's a fantastic place to explore and should be a must see on your trip to Vancouver!

title: Vibrant and cool City
reviews: We spent four days in the city, everything was close enough with big attractions only a short cab ride or tour bus away! If you‚Äôre smart with hotel choices you can get to just about most places downtown with a 10-20minute Walk. Like all major city‚Äôs some dodgy places to avoid but mostly a really friendly multicultural and easy going city with lots to do and lots going on.

title: Really Liked Downtown Vancouver with the Mountain View
reviews: Unlike Toronto, downtown Vancouver has a great view of Mountains right from the Downtown. Very neat view that I never got tired of. Everyone here was also super friendly.

title: Easy to get around
reviews: Downtown area so easy to walk around, lots of distractions in food, bars and shops plus feels incredibly safe.

title: Very walkable and lots to see and eat
reviews: Took family to Vancouver to see the city during the Christmas season.  Downtown is very walkable, easy to navigate and the lights around the downtown core were beautiful.  Don't let the cold deter you!

title: Most Picturesque in The World
reviews: It is a really beautiful city to be in, you have the mountains, the ocean and the parks.  Really nice skyline.

title: Decorated for the holidays
reviews: There were all kinds of holiday events going on and the city was all lit up. Very clean with places to go to the restroom. It is very easy to walk even with all the people. You cannot get lost and there are plenty of fun shops and people to ask if you need some help. Everyone is very friendly.

title: Vibrant city
reviews: This is a safe, bustling, interesting mixture of cultures. People tend to dress more professionally than in the U.S., which is appreciated by those who grew up in that world. What one sees here is a mix of now and then. There's a lot of street interest, including an entrepreneur who had a golden Labrador lying on the sidewalk available for stress relieve, i.e. free petting. With excellent transit, one can go from one part of town to the next. Even without transit, one can see a lot merely by walking several blocks in any direction.

title: Great shopping and restaurants
reviews: Every type of cuisine you could possibly imagine, you‚Äôll find in Downtown Vancouver.Every type of clothing and footwear store is also available in the Downtown area.It‚Äôs all within walking distance and it‚Äôs a great city.

title: Cosy Town
reviews: Unlike other similar size cities in US and Europe. This city is more spacious and refreshingly clean. My wife, niece were here in 2014 doing shopping and gourmetting. There weren't many large malls but the merchandise were stocked in individual shoplots. Tough in summer walking along the streets is cool and cosy..

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: I stayed in Downtown and it's very walkable.  The Sky Train stations are easy to get to. City busses are plentiful. I got to visit during December and was lucky to be there when it was dry. No rain. Lots of coffee shops and restaurants to choose from. It's nice walking around at night. The buildings are all different and unique. The Christmas lights and holiday events were all easy to get to. A lot going on in Downtown you won't get bored. Lots of people are still out and about 10:30 PM so you feel safe.

title: Fun D/T to hang around.
reviews: We always love Vancouver. Overall it is a pretty city w/a lively downtown. Robson, Burrard, W. George and many more r really fun streets to walk around. There r lots of shops, all kinds, expensive n mid range. Many coffee shops and tons of restaurants. However, avword of caution, some of those restaurants may be below average such as Sala Thai that will put u in the bathroom half a day but some may be spectacular such as Mott 32.Walking towards the ocean, strolling in Stanley park or taking the short boat trip to Granvilke Island, going to China town or Gastown r all the things u can do in Vancouver D/T most of them on foot. Sunny days r rare but if ur lucky to hit one of those then everything looks even better.Vancouver n vicinity us a place to visit at least once in life time.

title: Easy to get around, and lots of shops and history
reviews: One of the safest feeling cities I've been to. Easy to get around on the public transport and plenty to see and do. Places to eat and shop. Not as attractive as the tourist slogans lead you to believe though.

title: History and places of interest
reviews: Our Hotel was located in downtown and not far from the Harbour. So but simply walking around and taking our time we discovered some of Vancouver's history and all its interesting buildings, parkes and places of interest.

title: Good Shopping
reviews: Vancouver downtown is not big you can complete this area in a day or less.There is one main street where most of the shops are located, we walked through the entire strip and they have all the standard popular stores like Zara, top shop etc...There is also a lively atmosphere with street buskers along the strip, plenty of cafes to choose from to have lunch along the way.

title: Take a stroll and enjoy the sights!
reviews: Vancouver's downtown is very picturesque. Beautiful mountains in the background, water in the for ground and lots of unique  buildings to look at. So many different areas to explore. We love to wander downtown during the summer months. Gastown steam clock, observation tower, Canada place and so much more! You can easily take the Sky train Canada line direct to downtown from the airport for a day trip. The bus system is really easy to use too. Just google your destination and click directions, then transit. It will show you what bus and where to catch it.

title: beautiful downtown for walking and shopping
reviews: This is one of the best downtown for walking, shopping and enjoying food. It is lively till late at night.

title: Worth a visit at least once
reviews: Always happy to go for a bit of a wander from Gastown, up to Granville and over to the business district.

title: one of our favorite cities round the world
reviews: Veven if Vancouver is a really bif City, it is not that busy, crowded and noisy as others. Located wonderfully sourrounded by the Rockies and the Pacific Ocean, you find lot of things to see there and also really good Food.

title: Mixed feelings
