reviews: With  the glorious mountains and the ocean, both surrounding this city, Vancouver is a pleasant place to spend a weekend.  Great variety of restaurants and coffee shops, all at reasonable prices.  Neat areas in the downtown core, Gastown, Stanley Park, Yaletown and the Westend.  The negatives are the very noticeable number of homeless people, many of them with obvious mental health issues and whom are intimidating and the high cost of hotels, much like San Francisco.  Note also that Vancouver has a significant amount of rain in the fall months, which curtails many outdoor activities, highly recommend you visit in the Spring or Summer.

title: A Very Nice City to Visit
reviews: Overall, this is a beautiful city, with nice parks, architecture, art galleries, shops, gardens, restaurants, and great views of the surrounding mountains and water (especially from the Vancouver Lookout)! It was fun to walk along the river, as well as to get a good idea of the city by taking the "hop-on hop-off bus." We got off to shop and eat, and just walk around, in Gastown (an old section of Vancouver), and take the short walk to the Vancouver Lookout. We were driven through Stanley Park, Chinatown, and other areas.Later, we took a boat taxi to Granville Island‚Äîacross from the downtown‚Äîwith its good shops, marketplace, and eateries. The only caveat is that a few blocks from a nice section there might be a seedy one in the downtown. So stay aware of your walking routes and surroundings. And there are no Uber taxis in Vancouver, so you will have to drive or phone for a cab (since it is difficult to flag an empty one down on the streets).

title: LOVE-LOVE-LOVE
reviews: LOVE Vancouver.  It feels to me like a large town rather than a city.  People are courtesy and friendly. Lots to see, do and eat! We only had 2 days before and after a cruise and that just isn't enough time to thoroughly enjoy this city.  I would never miss a chance to visit Vancouver.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: We had a great visit for a few days and took in all of the sights. Many different restaurants and interesting little shops throughout the city. More traffic and congestion than expected, but overall a fun place to explore.

title: Changing all the time ...
reviews: I have been visiting Vancouver for over 40 years and have seen it develop into a beautiful cosmopolitan city. From the obvious natural beauty of the mountains, English Bay and Stanley Park to the new high rise construction and the waterfront developments, this is a city perfect for sightseeing. Foodies will have an almost unlimited selection of restaurants and ethnic choices. Just walk the streets and enjoy the feel of Vancouver.

title: Great walkable city!
reviews: We stayed here before our Alaska cruise and loved the vibe of the city. So many cultures coming together to offer many dining options. We walked an average of 18 miles a day over two days. From the waterfront and Stanley park to Granville Island the next day. The walk over the bridges offered wonderful views.

title: Friendly city
reviews: Vancouver has gotten a little crowded over the last couple of years, but I still enjoy my time there. Good food, intersting sights, the water, gardens shopping, all good

title: best hotel ever pan pacific
reviews: great food service views location value will stay there again itwas great worth every dollar what more can i say

title: Wow is it beautiful!
reviews: The west end ,English bay area is like Waikiki in the rainforest.Good restaurants with reasonable prices abound.Great walking,hiking,and cycling with views that never quite.It's not 5 star because it's not Scottsdale.

title: Downtown vancouver
reviews: My brother came from qu√©bec to visite me in vancouver. He like it so much that he had hard time to go back home. The city is besutiful, the people are nice and very multicultural. It is surround by hudge montains and the pacific ocean bay. Food is good, sjopping is good.

title: Lovely Place
reviews: One of the best neighborhoods in the whole cities of Canada; life area full of bars, restaurants, different ranges of shops. You may spend 3-4hours wandering in the beautiful and well-planned streets of the downtown.

title: Great place to walk around
reviews: We stayed at the Shangrila Hotel. So we would go around and walk downtown a lot. It is very scenic and also very safe.

title: weekend getaway
reviews: Downtown has a lot to offer but parking is a huge concern and its expensive.  Use transit if you can so you dont have to worry about your car and so you can relax as you take in the shops and restaurants. If you dont like crowds, enjoy the downtown on a long weekend when its not so busy as the locals like to get away.  Lots of different restaurants to chose from and some boutique shopping if youre looking for something a little different or a special something for someone special or a treat for yourself.

title: Close to everything
reviews: The hotel was spotlessly clean rooms are large and well appointed.   The hotel has it's own restaurant which was expensive.  Located right next door to the Plaza shopping centre which is handy.

title: quite a lot of people begging for money
reviews: as a tourist seems a bit scary and annoying when you walk along downtown and see almost every street with people begging for money or drunk ones sleeping on the floor or making trouble...

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: This is one of the most livable cities in North America.  Care has been paid to give pedestrians, cyclists and residents priority in this bustling city.  There are countless places to walk, sip coffee, bike or  sit on a bench and read and all are within view of a beautiful port.

title: Vancouver still has it.
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a vibrant, exciting, and safe place to visit. There are many restaurants and bars to satisfy any taste, and boutique and specialty shops abound. The relatively compact central core allows for easy walking to and from the various sports and cultural venues, and various forms of public transportation are readily available.

title: Ho hum
reviews: Not bad not great. If you‚Äôve seen a number of other cities there‚Äôs not much of note here beyond a gorgeous waterfront and natural resources. But cultural resource....meh

title: A great place year round
reviews: We live in Vancouver and love staying downtown.  So many hotels, with good rates in the slower months.  Walk around the streets, the harbour, play tourists in your own city.  Excellent choices of restaurants, bars, coffee shops.

title: Sea an Sky Meet
reviews: There are numerous attractions available... Stanley Park for a walk along the seawall with the mountain range available for stunning views, the vast number of beaches, sports events, Granville Island for theatre and food, and then a wander through Gas Town and its shops and restaurants... and that is just a beginning

title: Nice
reviews: Enjoyed going around but avoid East Hastings St as this is where there are a lot of homeless/drug users definitely don't go here at night. Went to Chinatown really disappointing we were really looking forward to authentic food everywhere looked really dirty.

title: Crazy expensive city
reviews: This city is badly managed with construction everywhere n traffic run by construction co flag people. On top its a super expensive city with little to offer in terms of cultural events   Stay away unless u like spending $$$ n getting stuck in traffic

title: Beautiful Walj Anytime
reviews: When you find yourself in Vancouver, downtown is a great place to walk. You can do a loop starting at English Bay, north to Gastown, east to Chinatown and south to Yaletown and then west, back to English Bay. Vancouver is a small‚Äôish city and this loop will take you through some beautiful scenery with plenty of coffee shops and restaurants for you to enjoy.

title: Fun, Fashionable, Vibrant Downtown!
reviews: Vancouver sits in a beautiful setting amidst mountains and ocean.  It is a prized restaurant town with something for everyone.  You can walk everywhere, Uber or Taxi for a nominal fee.  There are lots of amazing night clubs, restaurants, outdoor activities, strolls, food and dining culture, live theatre and it's all contained within the downtown area.  Everything is at your fingertips.Enjoy this fabulous city!

title: a pleasure : so different at each corner: old town, chinese district...
reviews: A pleasant town, with areas with totally different atmospheres. It is lively, animated. Enter the chemist's in Chinatown : amazing experience . I have each time a very pleasant time walking or riding through the town.Pay a visit to MacLeod‚Äôs Books: i adore to go there each time.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: My buddy and I walked around downtown Vancouver for a day. You never know what‚Äôs going to happen. We were able to see a part of the Flash TV show being filmed.  Great walking city tons to see and do. One day doesn‚Äôt do it justice.

title: CONDO JUNGLE
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has become a breeding ground for high rise condominiums.  The concrete jungle is alive and well.  Getting around via car is a nightmare during the rush hours but once you are here, dump the car and wander around on foot.  Comfortable shoes are a must and you'll be up and down lots of hills.  The good news is there are tons of cafes, restaurants and snack places to take a break

title: Beautiful time of year, less busy
reviews: We have been to Vancouver many times, this visit was really nice as we were able to walk all over downtown and there was way less people than summer months.There was a bit of snow, nothing major but the city was ready with salt on the sidewalks and the locals were cold. We are from the north though so a light winter coat is all you need, very refreshing outside. Once again it was very clean everywhere which adds to the beauty of the city.

title: World-class city with endless sights and activities
reviews: Okay, so I am very biased with this being my hometown. However, after travels to many cities I can say that this is the one of the most beautiful, clean and safe places on the planet. Activities are too numerous to list in a review but indoor or outdoor, active or leisurely, Vancouver has it all. There's easy access to the heart of downtown via public transit.There is something to be said for some people's assessment of the downtown buildings as a concrete jungle but that is slowly changing. While there are some areas that offer late night activities as a whole the city shuts down relatively early. Walking most streets is quite safe.Everybody's tastes are different but if need a Top 3 of things to do/visit I suggest Stanley Park, Gastown and Yaletown. Being in the Pacific Northwest it does rain but contrary to what most think it's not always wet. You will usually avoid a lot of rain from May through mid-October. I always tell peole that if weather and crowds are a factor in your decision then visit in September. It can still be quite warm, there's less people relatively low humidity and it's surprisingly dry most years.

title: What a fantastic city.
reviews: This is a fantastic city with something for everyone.and the sight of the city from over the harbour is stunning. There is so much to see and do and very geared up on clean city living.

title: Beautiful and clean!
reviews: Amazing city with great sites. It is very clean and a must see. I loved just walking arounf the downtown.

title: A city's a city's a city
reviews: Having said that we did arrive on a Friday evening when there were 3 different concerts in town - so it was very busy. Finding somewhere to sit down and eat proved quite challenging.Vancouver has everything you'd expect a city to have, lots of shops, independent and chains, lots of take away eateries for any type of food you could possibly want. There are some lovely old buildings nestled next to some really modern buildings - always makes the cityscape interesting

title: Gastown
reviews: This place is surrounded by souvenir stores, restaurants and coffee shops.   Accessible via public transportation or by taking the Hop Off Hop On tour bus.

title: Beautiful
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is so pretty with the scenic harbour and Stanley park! Great restaurants and lots of unique streets

title: great place
reviews: I love Vancouver beautiful Place, nice Acuarium from Stanley Park nice city and great people too I trully recomended you won't regreted I wish they have more Galleries to visitI love to hang arrond on the bay and see nature great forest, Have a nice day:D

title: A vibrant and youthful city
reviews: The first thing that struck us was that people were walking. Having experienced big cities in the USA, where everyone drives everywhere, people walking jogging cycling and even roller blading around the centre was a real change. The good transit infrastructure helps, and the fact that buses have bike racks shows a real commitment to alternatives to the car. Walking from our hotel to the waterfront we passed any number of coffee shops, and people carrying cups of the stuff. The actual waterfront has information posted at regular intervals explaining the history of the city and the people who helped to settle the land as well as the role of the first nations. The Information centre overlooks the harbour and was staffed with knowledgeable and helpful people who were determined to helpAbove all, it felt safe walking around.

title: Beautiful Metro Area
reviews: A must explore of your BC trip. Plenty to see and eat; don't forget to go to the Gastown and find your favorite Poutine!

title: Beautiful City
reviews: We visited Vancouver for 3 days in Sept/Oct. We were pleasantly surprised by the beauty of the city. The people were very friendly and always willing to help a visitor who looked lost. There is an abundance of places to visit, shopping is wonderful and the array of restaurants is outstanding. Something for everyone.

title: Great City
reviews: There is just so much to see and do downtown. It's very very cross culture. From asian to homeless to high end design and fashion. Tourist knickknacks and world class architecture. Historical and contemporary. Galleries and great food for Anyone. Love it when it rains. So Spectacular in the sun. Hard to leave every time.

title: Worlds Collide
reviews: This city is the strangest place for me. It offers some of the most breathtaking views of a country that I am the most proud to be from. It can also send a jolt of reality through your system if your are touring around all the must see spots the downtown offers. Nestled among the coffee shops, boutiques, art galleries and 5 star restaurants, are some of Canada's most addicted drug users. This can be quite a shock for first time visitors but please make sure you do not misunderstand me in anyway, this is not a statement to deter you from going, it is only to provide you with assurance that safety is not at all a concern even though you may feel it is. The people of Vancouver including the community of individuals who reside on the streets of downtown are all very friendly and should not influence your decision to visit specific areas. Many of the best shops and restaurants can be found in the east side of the downtown core. Wear comfortable shoes so that you can really walk all around to each unique part of the city center.

title: World Class City!
reviews: This is a world class city with all that comes with day to day events. Recommend to anyone come and enjoy the fantastic town with all of the activities that are available for every families. Plus there are nice variety of interesting landmark to see, so it's well worth your time.

title: Enjoy Your City Life
reviews: If you are shopping high quality things,  that is the right place - Holt Renfrew.  Robson Street and Granville Street are the busiest streets is Downtown Vancouver. Many nice hotels and restaurants  in downtown Vancouver. Night city life..........

title: BEAUTIFUL
reviews: What a beautiful city.  There is so much to do and see. We loved walking all around and especially the tower.

title: Easy to get around
reviews: Stayed downtown - to attend a concert at Rogers Arena.  Loved it!!  So much to do so close.  Amazing transportation - went to Grouse Mountain took the seabus then a bus to grouse mountain.  Super easy!!!  Did not need a car.

title: Downtown is the place to be
reviews: This was our fist trip to Vancouver - we loved it and want to return. It feels safe and clean, although we were disappointed to see a few homeless in the squares.

title: Great restaurants
reviews: Tons of great restaurants in a very nice area to walk.  Lots of options for ethnic food, poutine, Tim Hortons and many more.  Some nice Taiwanese shave ice and a number of shops to stop in and check out the merchandise from small items to some fancy stores.

title: Shopping
reviews: Lots of nice stores and unique shops downtown.  Fashionable clothes, shoes and accessories for all ages

title: Nice area and lots of shops
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has plenty of shops and great places to eat. Nice west-coast atmosphere and easy to navigate. Skytrain stations all around the place so its easy to get where you need to go. Vancouver is great!

title: Love downtown area!
reviews: I came to Vancouver after visiting Toronto. I heard nothing but good things about Vancouver and it did not disappoint. It is a huge city with an beautiful skyline. I went on an scenic cruise around Vancouver and learned history about the city. I highly recommend doing this. Downtown is also close to plenty other several tourist attractions. I highly recommend after exploring downtown to take the scenic drive up to whistler! It is iconic and only about an 1 1/2 hr. Drive.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Explore, explore and explore more. You won't be disappointed! Even rain should not stop you as there are many places to duck in and out of.

title: Clean, picturesque downtown
reviews: Vancouver is a very nice city -- at least the parts of it I've seen (I understand it has its "seedier" neighbourhoods as well...). The city is very clean, and picturesque, with a mix of modern- and traditional-style buildings. There are plenty of restaurants, stores and attractions to keep you busy. Pleasant place to walk around for a few minutes or hours...

title: Visiting...
reviews: Great town 2 visit...downtown was expensive but good to be there...lots to do and see!!! Plenty of places to see and avenues available offered to get there...

title: Walkable- lots of life even on a weekend
reviews: We loved how downtown Vancouver was walkable and there was a lot of residential mixed with the business areas.  Seemed to be a large business oriented street but then the next block over is more residential, even with single family homes. A nice mix. Felt comfortable walking both at night and in the day.

title: Average except for the views
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has some very positive qualities as it is one of the most urban liveable cities in North America. There is lots of action at all times of the day and night as tens of thousands of people live in the core. Some hipster neighbourhoods offering great westcoast and ethnic restaurants/experiences. Lots of good bus service and the ability to get to other parts of the lower mainland via public transit. Also, very easy to walk around the downtown area. The most disappointing aspect of downtown is the mediocre architecture. Very uninspiring. The best feature of downtown is the views of the mountains and ocean. Easy walk to Stanley Park and a number of beaches.

title: Loved Vancouver
reviews: We had never been to Canada, let alone Vancouver, and were thoroughly looking forward to our trip. We were not disappointed. Vancouver is friendly, the downtown area is compact enough to walk everywhere, there are good shops, bars and restaurants and there is a really great vibe. The only downside for us was that 2 out of 3 days were very wet but that was not Vancouver‚Äôs fault

title: New and stylish downtown
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is new, clean and modernist, as many of the skyscrapers are built after the 1980s. Walking along the major thoroughfares is a pleasurable experience.

title: Excellent way to and from the airport
reviews: The Skytrain is a brilliant - and affordable- way to get to and from the airport. It's fast and easy to navigate. There is an additional charge leaving the airport but it will still save you $25.

title: Nice town
reviews: Nice town with atmosfere, robson street nice shops and restaurants side street of robson have high end shops. Robson square has ice rink

title: A very exciting area
reviews: Like other cities Vancouver has its buisness area, its shopping area - both cheap and expensive and many hotels in the downtown area.  We stayed at a wonderful place called the Empire Landmark - though that is being demolished to build high rise expensive condos which the native Vancouverites do not want as they will be very highly priced.  A downside to downtown is the number of homeless people on the streets, though most of them are very polite.  Also you could begin to think you are in Tokyo as there are so many Japanese people around as well as a very strong Asian culture

title: Great city!
reviews: This was our 2nd visit to Vancouver!  This is a beautiful city with very nice hotels and lots of great restaurants to choose from.  We always enjoy walking around town and stopping by the steam clock at Gastown.  This trip we went to Vancouver Lookout and enjoyed the views of the city and beyond.  There is always plenty of places to shop!

title: A vibrant city for a walk around downtown
reviews: We spent some time walking around the downtown core and enjoyed the busy and vibrant activity that the third largest city in Canada had to offer. People watched from a cafe and that was amazing
Vancouver has many lovely areas but also some questionable areas as well. Great restaurants and cafes.

title: Great for walking and tons to see!
reviews: The downtown area is easy to access! We used the sky train and buses to get around while there. GPS on our phones helped us from getting lost but you do start to familiarize yourself. Chinatown was a really cool area to go through with some amazing architecture and cool little gift shops. Plenty of places to eat all over downtown.

title: A beautiful city
reviews: We stayed on Comox street and just walked to the downtown area and our first surprise was the amount of homeless people on the streets and this was also the case right in the city centre. This beautiful city has a great atmosphere and buzz about it and the variety of restaurants and cafes is remarkable, we walked about for hours just mesmerised by the hustle and bustle and we walked so far we ended up in the port and saw some huge cruise ships berthed there, one was heading for Hawaii that very afternoon, this is a truly cosmopolitan city, this is a wealthy city with high end cars parked on every street corner this is a beautiful city which deserves a visit at least one time.

title: Great place to be
reviews: Great place to be with the hustle and bustle of city life and a quieter persona at night.  Main shopping streets of Robson and Burrard intersect with world famous shops throughout.  Sadly now the large HMV shop at Robson/Burrard has gone being replaced by a lingerie store (well known chain).  Big underground shopping mall by the art gallery and street artists most of the day doing something or another.  Great at night and felt totally safe there.  We stayed downtown so knew where to go in a matter of a day or so.The downtown location is simple for Gastown, Canada Place, Granville Market and the Maritime museum all of which are no more than a 25 minute walk.Plenty of foodie places and places to eat or drink day or night as well as the souvenir shops for those final gifts home.  Tip for maple syrup - get it from a supermarket as it is much cheaper for the same thing and often better selections.  In Granville St above Best Buys (an electrical and camera store) there is a shop called Winners.  Like a UK TK MAXX and sells loads of things very cheap and a lot are the same as you can buy in better stores but at a knockdown price.Downside are the professional beggars who are sleeping rough at a lot of the large intersections but they do no harm so just move on.

title: Fun
reviews: Clean city offers a lot of shopping, eating options , biking , easy transportation once you figure out the system.  View from rotating restaurant added.

title: Great City with great Views
reviews: Good holiday place with good views , They say it is one of the top five cities in the world to live in, Good food joints and festive ambiance at downtown in the evenings, good night life as well

title: Nice city with lots of nature
reviews: Beautiful city except for the traffic. Lots of food, nice parks and nature adventure.  Great place!  You also gets to find many good Japanese and Vietnam food there. Nice to spend weekend there

title: Beautiful city
reviews: We really loved exploring Vancouver city. It is beautiful and lovely to walk around. It is a well thought out city with lots of bike paths and walking paths.

title: TOO MUCH TRAFFIC!!!!
reviews: We loved Vancouver, but the traffic was horrible and we must have spent hours in traffic going  in and out of the city over our 3-day visit. We did love North Vancouver and summer is a great time to visit there with free Friday night outdoor music and vendors!

title: downtown
reviews: lots of homeless and dirty streets with lots of trash. People helpful. lots of places to visit. Expensive rentals

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Nice clean city.  Lots of parks and shops.  Very busy with lots of bicycles.  (be careful or they will run you down).  Very expensive town compared to the U.S.

title: Tour trip
reviews: We took a trip.  It was very good  very nice.  Enjoyed our tour interesting city.  A lot of interesting places to see.

title: Beautiful!
reviews: Many high risers but many more trees, fountains and greenery! Really beautiful! We visited by hop-on hop-off and it was a great way. Clean and neat downtown!

title: Some streets are nice
reviews: Some stretets are nice, with shops, cafes and restaurants. Other streets are wide and mainly meant for traffic.

title: Great experience
reviews: You can fly into Vancouver, take a bus to downtown. Walk, ride the free bikes or bus/trollley. Everything is within walking distance. Many different neighborhoods to visit.

title: Neat city
reviews: Vancouver is a nice town, and the downtown area has plenty to do, as you would expect.  Just avoid the skid row on West Hastings Street. It is appalling. Gastown is cool, and the Pacific Center is really nice if you like malls.

title: Modern city but friendly
reviews: We love Vancouver, we're just sorry we limited ourselves to 2 days. Unfortunately it was raining all day which makes it less enjoyable but we still loved it in the rain, imagine if it had been sunny!Attractive shops, plenty of normal shops as well as designer shops! Spend a couple of days here if you can!

title: You'll be pleasantly Surprised!
reviews: Great shopping, great food and very helpful locals. Love Downtown, second time in Vancouver, won't be my last. So many ways to get around, hop on hop off bus, shuttle, walk or train or sea bus.

title: First trip ... to Vancouver ... awesome
reviews: Loved this trip ... so much to walk and see ...  walking tour ... bring your track shoes ... lots vertical ... but great ... Canada wonderful adventure ...

title: Bustling heart of city
reviews: High-rise glass's buildings, restaurants with various cuisines, bars ,theatres and dance clubs.. not to forget large malls and  classic hotels (rosewood Georgia and four seasons,)..Downtown area has everything for a tourist. Though I have learnt from a local that the actual downtown was gastown and this is new downtown area!

title: Modern Multi-Cultural Extravaganza
reviews: Traveled to Vancouver at end of a cruise, spent an extra day and a half to see the sights. Wonderful city, tons of tours and activities available. Enjoyed the sights, selected some specific things to check out. Had a nice dinner overlooking a bay, art museum, could have spent more time for sure.

title: Amazing city !
reviews: Our first visit - city amazing !  Lots of bridges traffic and up and down hillsides. Very clean city with plenty to see and do !            Getting around in a vehicle is a challenge if your not familiar with driving in the city - loved downtown - Stanley Park and waterfront area !

title: Lovely City
reviews: Nice buildings , road layouts , shops , restaurants, enjoyed walk around must look at steam clock , what a antique piece

title: A lovely city surrounded by natural beauty
reviews: This city is a very interesting, progressive and lovely city. It has everything. You can fine great shopping, eateries and vistas. Stanley park is a must see. The downtown Art Gallery is very modern and beautiful. Gas town is a unique place to see with shops and eateries. Avoid East Hasting Street due to a lot of drug addicts and homes. China town is rustic and old.. Very different from San Francisco China Town. Less places to shop and eat. Granville Island Market is a must see.  Great for shopping, eating and sight seeing. Public transportation is great. The Skyline is exceptional. The Hop On Hop Off Bus is interesting but uncomfortable. Sometime there are so many participants that you can't get on. The horse drawn carriage in stanley park is great. The River cruise and Sunset cruises are a great experience with lovely vistas and sea scapes.

title: Every Guide Recommended It!
reviews: Vancouver is one-off the world's cleanest cities, and this is the case throughout most of the place, including downtown. Bright lights, an abundance of shops and stores, and places of entertainment. Our guides for various excursions all recommended 'downtown Vancouver'. And we agree with them.

title: Beggars everywher
reviews: I've traveled far and wide but my experience here was awful with beggars everywhere. I felt threatened at times

title: Vancouver
reviews: Canada place is the place that you should park you vehicle everything is with walking distance 1 mile from Stanley park ,Gastown bars ,Robson street a lot of food places to go real great view of Vancouver bay ,Mariana hydro puert etc

title: Nice city, but massive amounts of homeless
reviews: After leaving San Francisco, I didn't think I could see that many homeless people in a major city of a first world country until I came here. Outside most convinience stores and anywhere where there was the ability to stay there were an unusually large amount of homeless people on the streets here. It's such a nice city, and Canada is usually a very well managed country so I don't understand why it is that bad and why better social and mental health services haven't been provided to help these people. Luckily it was summer, but in winter I'd be very concerned for these people if this was also the case considering how many people were in the streets.

title: Downtown Vancouver is vibrant and everything accessible and most things within walking distance.
reviews: The nice areas of Downtown Vancouver are great however the authorities need to do something sooner rather than later in regard to the homelessness - we saw sights that we wished we had never seen and everyone that we talked to including locals, business owners etc are frustrated by the inaction of the authorities. You want your city remembered for the right reasons.

title: Nice to wander, plenty to see
reviews: Nice area and plenty to wander about looking at. Some lovely small houses off the main streets. Lots of shops & cafes

title: Swanky
reviews: The waterfront, restaurants and shopping options makes downtown an attractive option to spend the day. There are lots to do at the waterfront and the view of sea planes taking off is amazing. Stanley Park is not far off. There are many restaurants and cafes to cater to different palate and budget. Take your pick on the options for dining and feasting your eyes on the options offered.

title: Wide range of shops, pubs and people!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has a wide range of shops, pubs and people. Of course the average price is dearer, but it is worth it to sit and people watch. There is many homeless in the area, who are usually quite friendly and offer interesting conversations regarding how they get there etc.

title: Lots of shopping in clean, lovely streets!
reviews: I enjoyed walking in downtown because it was clean and organized. Lots of shopping in a bit over my liking shops and tons of places to eat with an amazing variety of food! At night very pleasant to see the lights, live musicians etc! Very lovely city... it is no wonder why it has some people living on the streets... it's a very comfortable and beautiful place to be and live at! #planforamiracle

title: An energetic city that thrives on its highs to lows
reviews: We had wanted a weekend getaway and our choice was either 20 miles south to Seattle or 130 miles north to Vancouver‚ÄîVancouver won.  Walking and crisscrossing the downtown streets took us on an unintentional architectural tour of a city that spans contemporary architecture to midcentury to the old classic, the latter being either well maintained or run down with trash strewn about.  We found four-star restaurants alongside hole-in-the wall joints as well as a population of savvy shoppers and a professional workforce juxtaposed alongside the free souls enjoying the moment to the homeless trying to fill their tin.  We left this wonderfully vibrant city with the commitment to return in the near future.

title: Canada Road Trip.
reviews: Spent a pleasant four days in downtown Vancouver and along the waterfront. Gastown is not what is was, a bit run down and Chinatown is even worse almost a no go area.

title: Interesting but not amazing
reviews: Vancouver is an interesting city but not one of the amazing must see cities like Barcelona or Lisbon or NY. Very easy to walk around as it is quite compact. Grid system simple to followNever EVER seen as many coffee shops in any city.

title: Beautiful walkable city
reviews: I live in the downtown core. Never get tired of the views. Safe for walking. Can be hilly in spots. Lots to see and do. Every district offers something different. Allow time for English bay and west end and Stanley park, Granville island, yaletown, Gastown and coal harbour. Check out float planes leaving from coal harbour.

title: Interesting place
reviews: Very busy with lots of eateries and interesting place to see. Lots of homeless people on the streets and in parks

title: Launch point if our Alaska cruise
reviews: Lively bright friendly town but avoid China town - it is mostly abandoned. Beautiful weather in July / August. Lovely gardens and sea views.

title: Beautiful area of Vancouver
reviews: We spent time in this area both in the day and the night. It is worth a visit going back at night if you have the time, just to see the lighting up of the streets, very impressive. Many shops and souvenir places for the tourist to check out.

title: Fun Place to visit
reviews: If you are cruising from or to Vancouver, think of spending an extra day.  City is fun and has great food, especially seafood and Chinese.

title: Big and beautiful
reviews: All kinds of shops, expensive ones and the cheaper ones... nice to walk around, big buildings, tons of restaurant and bars to visit.Recommend ... go walk around, grab some food, then walk more :)

title: Walked Down The Front .
reviews: Walked down the front found it to be very loud and full of tourists . The view out in the bay was nice , but didn't like the busy area down there .

title: Worth taking some time to look around
reviews: We were on the hop on hop off bus and decided to get off and look around. We were not disappointed. We walked around for an hour, taking in the sites and soaking up the atmosphere, then jumped back on the bus.

title: The city of Glass
reviews: Most of the large buldings in downtown Vancouver are covered completly with glass. This shining view is spectacular. All shops, restaurants, theaters and cafe shops are within walking distance.

title: Shopping done!
reviews: Lovely shops and restaurants to enjoy and wander around.  The Cathedral was amazing, even for a Brit who has Cathedrals of over 1,000 years to visit.

title: Hop On, Hop Off See Vancouver
reviews: The best way to start to see a new location is a tour around town and the "Hop On, Hop off"  bus is the best way to prepare what to visit is to turn the town and  you can get on and off any place you want and they stop at the major sights to see.  Clean town, friendly people.  Don't miss the 2012 Olympic "Fire and Ice" Torch.

title: Vivid area!
reviews: We went to Vancouver downtown to grab the shuttle to visit Capilano suspension bridge and we're surprise by it. Full of shops and restaurants it reminded us of the big apple.

title: A Beautiful City
reviews: Easy to get around, clean, lovely gardens. More restaurants and shops than you can imagine. Well done, Vancouver!

title: Take the Hop On Hop Off buses and see the city!
reviews: Easily done by the Hop On Hop Off bus system which have on-board recordings.  Vancouver has a number of culturally different 'districts' which the HoHo system included.  Very informative and so easy to hop off and then back on.  But they stop running around 7 p.m. So make dang sure you aren't too far from your accommodations if you miss the last bus as it can be a climb and a hike back to accommodations!

title: Gorgeous skyline!
reviews: We spent 2 full days walking around downtown... along the shore, through the parks, EATING, taking pics, etc.  We found it to be easy, friendly, clean, safe and gorgeous.

title: Industrial.
reviews: Not a very lovely place.  A large sprawling industrial city, diverse population.  Fine for business travel but not necessarily accommodating to pleasure travelers.

title: One of the best city in the world
reviews: Nothing to complaint as this is a well planned city. However Downtown is known for costly properties probably the highest in Canada. Basically the city has every thing. Malls, Restaurants, Supermarkets and etc except for a gas station.

title: Our new favorite city
reviews: We've been 4 times in the past year and each visit just keeps getting better. The city is so clean, filled with friendly people, great architecture, shopping and restaurants. Even the drivers are so kind! I am from the U.S. but this is my go to place.

title: Vancouver, BC - Loveliest City in Canada
reviews: Such a green, clean city. Loved walking around the city, and enjoying all the may sights of boats, buildings, parks, etc. Very bike friendly with many riding trails and lots of places along the way to stop in for a bite or a cold drink. City embraces music and the arts. We thoroughly enjoyed the piano players around the city that just sat down on the bench and started showing off their skills. What a great idea and so very entertaining. One of the nicest cities we have seen in years!

title: Very beautiful
reviews: I was very fortunate to visit Vancouver in September when it was warm and fry. Staying near the bay and walking around downtown was very beautiful.

title: Beautiful and walkable city
reviews: I stayed in a great location in Davie Village. I was traveling alone for a conference and always felt safe walkin as the streets were crowded and lively. Theread are a large number of homeless people which is sad to see. As a result I did not do much walking at night. Overall it was a wonderful experience. Great shopping on Robson, wonderful restaurants all over, and lovely people.

title: DOWNTOWN...THINGS R ALL GREAT WHEN UR DOWNTOWN
reviews: A compact city that is easy to traverse by foot or various public transport options. It is truly walkable and by bicycle when the weather is nice and everything you would want to do and see is accessible. The landscape varies with area and terrain which makes exploring the city center, that is graced by both modern and "interesting older architectural styles."  An exciting and vibrant modern city which is pristine and safe (but that does not mean throwing everything to the wind) to enjoy. It is in a way no different from any other modern major cities of the world but it definitely possess its own identity, character, pizazz and charm which only Vancouver can offer; SO, DON'T WAIT, JUST GO and HAVE A VANCOUVER DAMN GOOD TIME!!!

title: Vancouver a mixed bag
reviews: First impressions good atmosphere and impressive port area, but when you get under the skin the city has major drug, homeless, and begging problems that the authorities seem unable to get on top of. China town was very poor with plenty of dealers openly at work and from some of the sights seen, dealing some pretty dodgey stuff. People openly shooting up even though the screaming, ranting, sometimes collapsed and sometimes unconscious fellow addicts should shown them that the drugs are going to kill them. On a lighter note Stanley park was beautiful and the marina walks were excellent but watch out for bikers they don't care.

title: Walkable Vancouver City
reviews: Vancouver has such an accessible downtown for walking.  You can literally walk a circle around this city centre and see so much beauty.  There are definitely many stops that you must take in.  It has an attraction or view for any tourists taste. Simply talk to your concierge and plot your interests on a city map. You will find so many interesting and beautiful sights that you didn't plan for. Riding a tour bus is fine if you have mobility issues but if not, walk this great city. You won't be sorry.

title: Solo wandering of DT Vancouver
reviews: There is a lot to see and do in downtown Vancouver. I chose to take the sea bus from North Van to DT, walked to Robson street towards Stanley Park. There were a lot of really fun and nice shops and restaurants along the way. At the end of Robson, I turned right and found some bike rental shops. I got a bike and went all the way around Stanley Park in 2 hours while taking some great photos! Definitely worth doing! The next day I walked through beautiful Yaletown. There's a recreation centre there with drop in art classes called the roundhouse. I kept walking until I got to a little sea bus that took me to Granville island. I spent about 1.5 hours exploring the market and shops on Granville before taking the sea bus back and walking straight across downtown, back to my sea bus to North Van. Really fun two days!

title: Skyscrapers!
reviews: I never was in a city with all of this skyscrapers. I loved the see them. I noticed that all of them are similar in colours and construction but every one of this is different and special. The city centre, also, is clean and people are good and kind. I love this city!

title: Great day out
reviews: We went down town with friends. Did some good shopping and had a few drinks. I enjoyed walking about checking out all the shops and pubs.

title: Nice city
reviews: Vancouver is an easy city to get around. It feels safe to walk around although there are a number of homeless people begging for money.  The city is clean and offers a wide choice of  restaurants and gift shops.

title: The Manhattan of Western Canada
reviews: Downtown Vancouver made me feel home immediately. Being a native NYer, and traveling to Van City for the first time, I felt welcomed by the walkable streets, cool bars and restaurants, and tall buildings. There's lots to do, explore, and keep you entertained for a day or nights activity. A personal favorite spot is the Shark Club which is not only a great spot to watch sports on any given night, but a fun place to meet others, grab great food and just enjoy yourself.

title: Beautiful Walking City
reviews: My 1st trip and I loved VanCouver! it is a remarkable city and very easy to walk and navigate in.  There are so many things to see and do that I am sure no matter what your interest are you will be able to find things to do.

title: Beautiful city shame about the beggars
reviews: Plenty to see and do, but walking around we were approached several times by men wanting money, yes they were polite but it is not appropriate in broad daylight.  We even saw some sleeping in doorways as well.  Surely there are some provisions to take care of this type of nuisance?, hostels or temporary catering perhaps.

title: I would live to live here
reviews: One of the best downtowns I've ever seen. Of course, I am judging as a tourist. We cycled around the town, witnessed a movie shooting (Deadpool 2). It was fun!

title: City of glass
reviews: The best way to learn about this city is by guided tour.  It is a very clean, extremely low crime type of city.

title: Much to see.
reviews: We stayed here for 2 nights before catching a Hawaiian cruise and wish we did a 3 night stay instead. Many things to do and see. I did imagine that they would have had more restrooms and more little stores to get things like water and such. Make sure to use there public transportation (and get the day pass ) as it is excellent. Very clean and safe.

title: Charming, historic place with great atmosphere
reviews: This part of the city we have loved the most. It is nice to see and to walk through. The shops are nothing special, but you find some nice restaurants, cafes and can enjoy the atmosphere. Try to be at the steam watch when she starts to whistle.

title: Spent the night downtown
reviews: We stayed downtown and we found the city to be very clean, and very safe.  Lots of good restaurant choices.

title: As cities go
reviews: A summer visit done and Vancouver Downtown is super easy to get around on foot.    As a walker, the cars to let you cross the road as long as you are not jaywalking - where you will get a toot.

title: Great shopping and plenty of film crews.
reviews: The shopping is great and allied to this is the number of film crews using the city centre to shoot pictures,DEAD POOL was being filmed and the streets were jammed with tourists watching the action--special mention of the police dept for being so friendly towards everyone.The Sutton hotel was also being used the day we left for another picture.Plenty of great shops and eateries to cater for all tastes.

title: Summer Vacation
reviews: Love this city! The people of Canada are so nice and welcoming! This was our first time in Canada and we will be back for sure!

title: Excited
reviews: It is big city. I went there with my daughter. So I couldn't go around at night.... wanna go to drink next time.

title: Lots of attractions
reviews: Beautiful city, secure, clean, lots of restaurants, bars, shoppings center, stores and attractions. I recommend Vancouver.

title: Walk or talk a bus tour....
reviews: So much to see and admire. Some incredible buildings. A very compact downtown that can be walked from one end to the other.

title: Love this amazing city!!!
reviews: We returned to this city after our Alaskan cruise.  We were only able to stay for one day and night, but I would definitely love to return some day.  This city is filled with history, shopping opportunities, great restaurants and lots of fun things to do.

title: Downtown Vancover
reviews: Great place to visit, very pretty also down around the water frontA must see & do the Flyover, good shopping, great food, beer and the people are so friendly

title: A place to finally rest my hat
reviews: I love Paris and London and my favourite city to visit is Rome, so a very high bar.Vancouver is the place I would choose to live. It wins the best place to live all the time for a reason and I can now understand why - it blew me away.It's vibratant, its exciting, compact (so you can walk everywhere), its high quality, clean, unique and new.  Everybody seems in shape.They must have the most Sushi joints in the world as they are absolutey everywhere - like fish and chip shops in the UK.You can walk the beach in the sunshine, then within 30 minutes be standing at the summit of up a breath taking, snow covered mountain, then of course you can be on the water within minutes. Within a few minutes you can be in the absolute wilderness amongst the bears, eagles and mountain lions (cougars)It would seem the whole of China agrees as it feels they have now purchased most of the city.

title: Hiking Vaca
reviews: Visiting Vancouver from WV.  Return trip, for sure.  Great city.  Great hospitality.  Great experience.  Loads of hiking and biking. Scenic enjoyment around every bend.  Need plenty of time to soak it all in.

title: Clean city
reviews: Vancouver is a young and vibrant city.  It is very clean and the people are very friendly.  You feel very safe here.  Amazing shops and sights to see.  Good transport.

title: The best city in Canada
reviews: I have lived in Vancouver for 8 months. In general, I believe Vancouver is the best city in Canada. There are towns of different restaurants, bars, places to visit and the amazing nature. It's rainy pretty much all year, that makes the city different. If anyone wants to go to Canada once, Vancouver should absolutely be on list.

title: Sketchy & Dirty
reviews: The downtown area is okay during the day, although would recommend going to one of the beaches or a park if you want scenery as there isn't much to see. Just a classic City.I noticed there are a lot of homeless people in Vancouver compared to some other cities I have been to, so prepare to be harassed. Especially if you are a smoker and watch your back during the night time.

title: Such a Beautiful & Alive City
reviews: Downtown Vancouver & more surrounding areas are always beautiful from the mild 'greenish 'winters to magnificent cherry blossoms of the spring, wonderful huge trees in Stanley Park, and cool but comfortable autumns. If you are fortunate enough to fly into Vancouver on a sunny or at least clear day then you will be treated to a stunning vista of coastline, city scape rolling out to the water, and the magnificent Rockies in the back ground.  Downtown Vancouver is gorgeous; take an early day tour and pick your areas to then spend time perusing. You can do it all but you will need more than one day!

title: Fun to walk around
reviews: Lots of different places to visit. Interesting shops, lots of outdoor cafes and interesting restaurants. Make sure to visit the steam clock!

title: Love this City!
reviews: We enjoyed our stay downtown Vancouver.  It is a very walk able city and we felt very safe walking around.  We were surprised to see bike lanes along side the streets!  The people were extremely friendly.  We stayed on Barrard Street about 10 blocks from the cruise terminal and there was even an IGA grocery store nearby!  We discovered Tim Horton's as well which we saw all over Canada.  We also saw numerous coffee shops.  Overall a GREAT, convenient place to stay in Vancouver.

title: Walk this way
reviews: We came to walk as much of downtown as we could in four days without bus or train and we covered alot of ground. Thjs us such a fantastic walking city.  Just step out your hotel and go.  There is so much to see and do you will not be bored for a minute.  All shop personnel are helpful and friendly and the prices are reasonable when converted to US dollars.  We loved the seabus ride to north vancouver but it was one of our only rides we took and enjoyed. the seaplanes are fun to watch take off and land and we saw some cruise ships up close on the weekend. I recommend this city to anyone who loves to walk.

title: The diverse downtown character!!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is characterised by surprises!!  There are many interesting buildings, the amazing Stanley Park and the very beautiful waterfront areas... as well as an area that is frequented by/houses "homeless people".  What strikes me is that this area is to be enjoyed and frequented by all!!

title: Heart of the City
reviews: The main tourist area of Vancouver is easily seen on foot, without the need for a taxi or public transport. All the major hotels are here, and many restaurants. There are also countless fast food outlets, unfortunately the plastic cups and polystyrene food containers tend to litter the streets. There are smart shopping centres as well as individual outlets. The grid system of street makes navigation on foot fairly easy.

title: Nice....
reviews: There are a lot of different downtown areas.....most seemed walkable or  quick cab ride.  We stayed in the sports area.  Good location.

title: Bustling City with Some Problems
reviews: It's a lovely city, full of people from all over.  I know the tourists don't get the real view of Vancouver which, like many cities, is in the midst of a drug crisis.  The Chinese are buying up the city and people are sellling!  It is incredibly expensive to stay here -- we found a place in the outskirts of town ( East Surrey).  I wish I had spent a few more days here to really get a feel for the place.  There is no more beautiful setting -- and I know there were many beautiful places we didn't explore.

title: Beautiful cosmopolitan city
reviews: I hadn't been to Vancouver in more than 20 years and it was just as beautiful as I remembered. It is such a clean and wonderful city. It's very walkable and appears very safe.

title: So Interesting
reviews: Spend the day exploring downtown Vancouver and found it to be very interesting. So many different cultures with their shops and restaurants. Great walking city.

title: Picturesque with History
reviews: We spent 3 days in Vancouver starting with a 15 mile bike ride throughout downtown including, Stanley Park, English Bay, China Town, Grainville Island, Amazing sights and so much history. When we opened the drapes of our hotel room I was spellbound by the picturesque view of the City. I didn't want to close the drapes at night because the lights of the City were so beautiful. We rode the hop on hop off trolley and revisited the spots we saw on our bide ride. We did the sunset dinner cruise in the harbor. No matter what we did, the city of Vancouver was appealing to the eye. I would highly recommend visiting Vancouver.

title: Open top bus
reviews: Some past were excellent unfortunately one area suffers from drug problem which was very sad to see but was contained within two blocks

title: Sad place
reviews: Dirty and Full of homeless people, we had one come to our restaurant table begging for food or money,

title: Nice place to spend time
reviews: Eat at Good restaurants...go cycling in stanley park which is home for more than 3000 trees. Shop in pacific centre. Go to flyover canada in canada place. Enjoy sea plane experience...lots to do...

title: Wow !
reviews: Newer saw the perfect combination of waterfronts & downtown like Vancouver has !!Marines, bike paths, clean pavements, clever organized traffic....I bow for their  city hall !

title: Lots to do, plan your time
reviews: There is so much to see and do in this area, we should have planned it out a lot better. As we didn't have much time we were wandering around and likely missed a bunch of stuff but the places we did mange to see were all wonderful. Vancouver has a great downtown and if you like some walking plan to spend a day or two going around, seeing everything, and stop at the places that interest you. Plenty of choice for any type of food or drink you wish.

title: You will be amazed!!
reviews: Walking is the best way to explore downtown Vancouver, the maps are so easy to read as all the roads are set in a grid pattern.  Also as most intersections there is a large map that shows you where you are.  We had great fun going one way to the harbour and choosing a different street to get back to our hotel Rosedale on Robson.  It is a beautiful city with amazing buildings and water features outside some buildings. The architecture is so different and the city is so clean.

title: we have been to down town with my family.
reviews: Everythigs are good. But our hotel is little bit far from center. So there are a lot of Homeless. and it made some smellic weired things.

title: Great city but wish there were more historical tour options
reviews: Beautiful city but honestly you can see what you need to see in a couple of days.  I wish there'd been more tour options for historical homes, buildings but there were none.  I was astonished with this and very disappointed. Loved the bike options and the Free Tour Tours available.  We did two of the ones offered the first two days.  We were very pleased.

title: Unforgettable
reviews: I love downtown Vancouver. It has everything a big city needs to have in its own way. It's multicultural, it has many parcs and of course there's a lot of good food.

title: Reminds me of Europe
reviews: We got to spend a few days in downtown Vancouver.  It reminded me very much of being in an older European city.

title: Love at first sight!?
reviews: Love, love, love....I am so in love with Vancouver downtown. It is so lively, clean and tourist friendly. Every corner has something to admire about, specially the gardens and the flowers all around the City. Can't wait to go back.

title: views over vancouver city
reviews: we enjoyed walking along the coastline and admiring the views, we stopped at few bars along the way to enjoy the sun and a drink

title: Very modern and yet sublime
reviews: Its no wonder that Vancouver is constantly ranked amongst the top 5 most livable cities of the world. The downtown atmosphere is modern and chic and at the same time quite refreshing for tourists as well. Stanley park and the Canada place waterfront are well connected and offer some amazing views and walks alongwith good cafes and restaurants to hang out.

title: One of The World's Truly Beautiful Cities
reviews: There are few cities in the world that can compare with Vancouver. It is a multi-cultural and extremely friendly city. There is a young population here, so a great city to people watch. The city is stunning, well laid out and very clean. All the buses are gas (not petrol) or overhead electric powered and almost all the taxis are hybrid models, which helps to keep emissions low. The air is clean and so are the streets. People here care about their city. Littering is rare, but there are always many people employed to clean up.There are some great places to see, such as the old city and steam clock; Stanley Park; Capilano Suspension Bridge in North Vancouver and the waterfront area with its vibrant social scene - caf√©s, bars, restaurants, etc. IUt is lovely to sit in Stanley Park with a coffee, watching the wildlife and the seaplanes coming and going. The only cities I believe can compare with Vancouver are Singapore and Sydney. This is a must see city that most people want to return to.

title: Clean, quaint and safe
reviews: Loved walking all over this area this week. So much to see and do. Waterfront, restaurants, bars and music. Never felt unsafe and mostly clean. Construction was minimal and care of safety.

title: Nice city with a pretty waterfront area.
reviews: We only enjoyed one night here before leaving on an Alaskan cruise but the city is clean and inviting with easy walking.  Lots of shopping as well as sights to see down along the waterfront near the cruise port.  Don't miss the Olympic caldron site from the 2010 Winter Games held in this area.

title: White Spot restaurant-Homer Ave
reviews: Went with large group of friends to White Spot. Part of a chain in Western Canada and extensive menu and I had Manhattan clam chowder and chicken  and mushroom fettuccine. It's very rare to find Manhattan clam chowder anywhere and this was very good, noticeable chunks of clam in the soup .The price was reasonable, $5.95 for a bowl of fresh clam chowder soup and $14 for a large pasta dish

title: Touring downtown Vancouver
reviews: I can not rate this any higher. I would like to give it a excellent rating except for all the homeless people in the streets.  No they never bothered us but there sure were a lot of them sleeping on the sidewalks.  Other wise Vancouver is a great town to visit.  So much to see and do. Do not let my review scare you we still had a great time.

title: Two day visit
reviews: After our Alaskan cruise we spent two days there. Very clean and lively town lots to see and do great restaurants. They have their own China Town. Very expensive to live there. They've run out of real estate and they are building high rises all over town. With business leasing in the first 10 floors residentials on top of that. The dollar is much stronger than theirs.

title: Great Walkaround City
reviews: Whether walking around the city on the harbor path or strolling the shopping streets, Vancouver is a great walking city.  For those born to shop people, Robson and Thurlow Streets are the places to be.  Canada Place is the start of the harbor activities.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Lovely city to visit at this time of year. Temperature is pleasant as is weather. City not overcrowded and people generally friendly. Lots of shopping and so many trees along the sidewalk. Beautiful area down by waterfront.

title: Great City
reviews: So much to see and do in this lively city.  Lots of fun neighborhoods with plenty of shopping and dining options.  There's something for everyone to eat, see, or do here.  Very clean too. I wish we had more then one day to explore!

title: Worthwhile to visit !
reviews: We spent 4 days in Vancouver and I could have done with an extra one.There are many places to explore: the Bill Reid Gallery was a number one visit ! Just as Stanley Park, Gass town, the Chinese garden...

title: killing time while awaiting a night and morning to board Cruise ship
reviews: What a nice city to visit. Very clean, orderly traffic, good pedestrian town, plenty of walking and bike trails, prices very reasonable for Canada.  Will come back when the forest fire smokes are gone and you can see the great vistas again. Looked like L.A. on a bad smog day the two days we were there. What can you do?

title: Love this town
reviews: Our second visit in 2 years. This has to be my favourite city in the world.  So pretty - mountains, sea and shops - what's not to like? Love the Canadians so kind and helpful. There is so much to see and do.  Always busy and bustling.  Sadly blanketed from the smoke from the forest fires when we first arrived but following a weeks Alaskan cruise and a week in Whistler, this had then cleared. Sympathies to all those who lost their homes from these forest fires.

title: Friendly and fun
reviews: Love downtown Vancouver. We are from rural England - this city feels so friendly and open, and is clean and fun!

title: 4 days to explore after Alaska Cruise
reviews: Went w another couple. Stayed at L'Hermitage Hotel. Excellent place to stay and worth the price! Very easy to walk around downtown and felt safe despite some homeless people sleeping on the sidewalks üôÅ also another big negative for me was how dirty the city was. Just so sad that they don't pick up the trash and empty the trash receptacles that are overflowing everywhere. And this was before the Gay Pride Parade and activities over the weekend. Sidewalks and streets need to be cleaned! That part was very disappointing. We went to Miku Japanese place and highly recommend it! Sushi melts in your mouth (the hot sushi - not kidding). Guys got the Wagyu steak and just loved it. Also got shrimp and Brussels sprouts for 2 appetizers. They were awesomely tasty!Enjoyed fantastic live music EVERY night at Fairmont Hotel in the bar. Good choice of bar munchies (a little pricey) and guitar musicians were just awesome!!Went up to the Vancouver Lookout tower. Price would have been worth it but with fire smoke couldn't see the beautiful mountains in distance. For lunch one day we ended up at this place called One Under. It's golf, beer and more. Great menu (healthy and not so) plus you get to swing golf clubs! You know when you try out clubs and hit into a screen? It's like that but set up like a bowling alley w about 8 diff screens. Can play a whole game but can't use your own clubs. It was an unexpected fun afternoon!Starbucks on every corner practically and nice shopping options you can walk to. The locals are very health conscious with a strong Asian influence on restaurants and food selection which I loved! But Americanized food available too. Locals are very friendly and I thought it was interesting that you don't hear horns honking like in most cities! üòäüëçAlso went to high end steakhouse - Gotham. It was good but not excellent. 3 stars as one steak was over cooked and our food took a really long time. Longer than others that arrived after us. But my filet was tasty and drink choices excellent. Had onion rings and another appetizer. They were good but nothing extra special. On your way back to US be sure to leave EXTRA time to get thru security and customs esp if you have am flight. It took us 1 hour and 30 min to get luggage checked and security, and customs. I was selected for extra screening but they were picking more to screen than not. Even staff member said OMG about the numbers! I really wanted to do the hop on hop off but our group wasn't up to do a lot of walking üôÅ. Cabs very easy to get and reasonably priced. Overall I'm glad we stayed to explore Vancouver since we were all the way out there. I wouldn't make a trip out to see Vancouver specifically though. Wish they would spend some $$ to clean up their city because it is nice with so much to offer!

title: Stay a Few Days Before/After Cruise
reviews: We only stayed one night before our cruise. Vancouver is a lively city. Very eco friendly. It is impressive to see so many trees everywhere, especially on building rooftops.We walked several miles.Tips- *There is a Costco downtown! Get only take MC NOT VISA like in the states. The don't  sell alcohol.*Buy wine at BC Liquors for your cruise. It is controlled sales. Must buy from a liquor store or your hotel.*Walking is easy, but sometimes hilly.There is some homelessness but mostly people are very friendly. We will visit again. I wish we planned on staying longer before our cruise. Canadian exchange rate for YS dollars is great right now. Best bet is to use your credit card. We didn't bother with Canadian money.

title: Beautiful city!
reviews: Working on a cruiseline and got a chance to visit Vancouver downtown once a week. All i can say is, this city is very very tourist friendly. I love the food court in downtown, offers great selections of food and beverage, especially a sushi kiosk.. What not to love? 30cad for 2 sets of assorted nigiri and rolls, a box of blueberries and cherries, a box of chuka wakame. That's definitely a great deal! Do buy the famous inniskillin riesling, canadian mapple ice wine bonbon, and postcards!! I love how the city has everything in walking distance, from ecco shoes, Victoria secrets, all the good clothing brands, sephora, lots of beautiful caf√©s and restaurants.  I wish I can live there! üòÇ

title: What ever it is-it's here
reviews: We are fortunate to be able to stay in a condo on the block around the Library Square, so we are in walking distance to Yaletown, stadium area, shopping-everything (Stanley Park is a hike, but there is a great bus system).We have been in Vancouver on four different occasions, and there is mo better place to stay than in downtown (taxis are quite reasonable if you feel challenged by mass transit)

title: Beautiful City
reviews: It is a great place to visit.  The air is fresh and clean.  Being surrounded by lots of water certainly provides a great ambiance to the City.  The skyline is spectacular as it is framed by the water and the mountains.  If you take an effort to learn how to use public transit, it would be a plus, with the Skytrain system (convenient as it goes to the airport) and the bus system.  Driving can be a little trying, especially in the downtown area as there are lots of one-way streets and lane closures due to many construction projects.  Parking is also a challenge and can be very expensive if you can find it.  Vancouver is a great food city.  Lots of thing to do, or just to relax by the water which is not hard to find.

title: So many things to see downtown
reviews: I visited Vancouver for 4 days awhile back and the downtown is one of the best walking cities I have done yet. Sidewalks, lights, pedestrian courtesy and just the sights one can see. So many different things like Gastown, the false creek area, the downtown itself, Stanley Park, and all the roads, trails, and paths that intersect. The city is just meant for wandering and photo taking. Street photography, urban photography, nature photography is all at its best. Combine that with the weather in August and its a perfect storm for those that want to walk the city. I would advise all to simply get out of the tour bus or cab and use those feet to explore the city. Your rewards will be sore feet but also an appreciation of a wonderful city. I won't even mention the wonderful public houses, the brewpubs, and the great food that all contributed to a wonderful week's stay. Get over to Granville Island using an aquabus. Its all reachable and fun.

title: Its just a city, with terrible ideas about traffic patterns
reviews: We stayed just outside of the downtown for 5 days. All 5 days were torturous to get around. They close some lanes, reroute traffic in opposite directions, and cause huge traffic pile ups. It was just terrible. Every where we went by car, or by public transit, there was traffic. You need to learn which roads will be closed or have its lanes reduced to get around. I have never been in a city with a worse traffic situation.

title: City centre
reviews: Nice big city centre. European style. Many shops. Many restaurants. Good walking roads. Safe but many people sleep at the walking streets unfortunatly. Nice to visit.

title: Breathtaking City
reviews: Vancouver is truly one of the most beautiful cities. Stunning mountain backdrop, easy to navigate and plenty of great waterfront restaurants.

title: Vacation to BC
reviews: My YWCA Hotel was on Beatty at Georgia across from the BC Place Stadium.  Robson Street and Yaletown walking distance.  Chinatown station close to take train to the waterfront and walk the beautiful area. Lots of restaurants, tour buses and shopping.  Loved location , staff and hotel.

title: Nice, modern downtown.
reviews: Lots of high fashion places to shop. Nice view of the water. Convenient to the cruise terminal. Clean City. Easy to get downtown from the airport on the train.

title: Amazing feel
reviews: Moved here last year and have not regreted it. Love the city, the vibe, the people. The area is so clean and green. One thing I will say, bring your walking shoes.

title: vaycay in May
reviews: Vancouver is a great city .. you can walk for miles and see so many things .. beach , ports , statues .. take you time and enjoy the city ..

title: Drive through
reviews: Busy city area but traffic moves easily. Not too many impatient drivers. City is pleasant and not congested.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Had a fabulous time in Vancouver, love to go back one day, very easy to get around, wonderful places to see. Loved it

title: Walk everywhere!
reviews: We had a terrific time walking this city! We'd plan a destination and walk there from a downtown hotel. We explored Gastown, Yaletown, Canada Place, Stanley Park, and Kitalano Beach on foot and got a good feel for the core.

title: Great shops and restaurants
reviews: Good metro centre. Easy to find your way around.  Lots of great shops and restaurants.  The only off putting thing is the number of homeless and ill looking people around on every road crossing - quite distressing.

title: Wonderful Vancouver
reviews: Easy to reach downtown on Foot or you can gen on Hop on Hop off coach! All the best shops in The area,  I suggest Roots,  New Balance Shoe Shop etc

title: Great Place to visit.
reviews: One of the cleanest large cities I have visited throughout my many travelling years !! Well Done Vancouver. A pleasure to visit this place

title: helpful guides
reviews: We liked the fact that there were helpful guides around Vancouver to direct us if we were looking for something in particular. It was all clean.

title: Clean, Fun, A Green City with Many Attractions
reviews: Strolling in Vancouver City gives you a feel of changing atmosphere from place to place. For instant, in the center of the city where shopping malls are located, you see shoppers busily doing their errands; and when walk through the Red Light area, it gives a reflection of how night life would be. Down at both edge of the city, the sea front, you are like walking in the park or beach. Plenty to do with your leg muscle.

title: Wonderful part of the city
reviews: This is just one area of Vancouver.  Lots of high end shops and restaurants bordered by nightclubs and souvenir shops.  Bustling by day it takes on a whole different look at night especially on weekends.

title: A Different Kind of City
reviews: Downtown Vancouver may surprise you with the simple fact it is a neighbourhood where more than 100,000 people live. Due to city planning there is a lot of apartment blocks and towers and hence more people living in the downtown core. This also means there is a lot of services open till all hours and people on the streets and in the bars, restaurants, and coffee houses until all hours. This is truly a people area and there is no rolling up the sidewalks when the commuters go home.With the downtown bounded on three sides by water and being long and narrow driving down here is the crazy and the tourists. Use the Skytrain and the buses to get around when you travel a long distance but otherwise just walk. This is a walking city and enjoy being away from the cars. The sea wall runs from the port area on the northeast of the downtown around the entire peninsula and continues around False Creek towards Point Grey. Walk part or all of it and enjoy the views, the people, the restaurants and just relax. Pretty soon you'll be moving at Vancouver speed.......

title: Downtown city on the coast with the great Stanley Park
reviews: I have tried to rate Vancouver Downtown as Very Good but the prompt is stuck on excellent as an automatic result.We enjoyed our 24 hours downtown enjoying the views, the coast line and harbour and a four hour walk around Stanley Park. Prices are expensive but you would expect this for the principle westerly Canadian city.Real estate is popping up on every block and many overseas investors own all the best areas.  Our favourite spot was down on the harbour and at the Sailing Club watching the sea planes taking off.There is a long tidal reach and the shoreline changes quite markedly after 6 hours there.  the buses out to the ferry port at Horseshoe bay are impressively quick and very cheap but do take change to pay on board.Even if you haven't booked a cruise do visit Canada Place and watch the cruise liners arrive and depart for Alaska. It is a city of dreams.

title: Very scenic on the waterfront
reviews: Vancouver has a very pretty Waterfront overlooking Vancouver North and Vancouver West. Vancouver itis out of space to build so the only housing are high-rises so if you like a lot of concrete then this city is for you.

title: CHARMING & UPLIFTING
reviews: Great for window-shopping and people-watching. This downtown has 'ethnic diversity' in a wonderful symphony of experiences!

title: Great city; the San Francisco of Canada
reviews: The views, food, the people and he whole vibe of the place is cool. It is a big city but it does not feel that way. It's a gateway to a myriad of outdoor activities as well (i.e. whistler) which are very close by. Loved it

title: Dangerous, Dirty and Disappointing
reviews: Walking back from dinner in Chinatown,  we decided to take Hastings St.  We faced 3 blocks loaded with every type of addict, homeless, prostitute and panhandler. We crossed the street which was less crowded, but we were nevertheless more uncomfortable than in any of the dozens of cities we have visited in the US or abroad. The city administration should be ashamed. The rest of downtown was dirty, unkempt, with urine smell emanating from almost every store entrance, thanks to the dozens of homeless we observed sleeping there.   Panhandlers on almost every block.  The beauty of the waterfront doesn't overcome the mess we saw.  Don't believe the hype as we did.  Don't go there if you expect a good urban vacation.

title: Very cool!
reviews: Busy, all walks of life & ethnicity. Never had a problem w/ credit card, super friendly city. Air train takes you anywhere, security incredibly helpful w/ us tourists. Very clean city, mindful of trash bin seperators: paper/plastic/glass/compost. So much to see! Upscale to simple stores, something for everyone. Incredible Italian gelato!

title: I dont want to comment on downtown as we found it very expensive and only went to look at the shops and to spend some
reviews: I cant share any experience sorry as mentioned we were just putting down  spare time , and we did some windo shopping and just commented on the lack of value

title: Great downtown to visit !
reviews: We walked around downtown after our cruise and before our flight left. It is clean, safe, and has a lot of variety. Lots of public transportation too. Stay away from the fringes of downtown as it will get a little scary there.

title: Downtown is the Best Place to Be!
reviews: Staying in Downtown Vancouver is the only way to go, everything from Canada Square to great restaurants and bars is all within walking distance from your hotel.  There are free shuttles running from Canada Square to Capilano Suspension Bridge and Grouse Mountain as well as the Port for cruise ships.  You can also catch a ferries not far from the sqare and they run on a regular basis and are very cheap and clean to ride  in.

title: Avery large & clean city
reviews: Overwhelmed how large Vancouver has become. It is a major west coast city, very modern and very clean with lots to do and see

title: Enjoyable stroll
reviews: After coming off a cruise ship after 7 days in Alaska dropping our bags at the hotel and waiting for our room we decided to walk around Vancouver. Around 8 hours later we got back to the room. Great parks, restaurants, bars and harbour. Enjoyed the surroundings and the people. Would strongly warn about going into Gastown. It's full of homeless and junkies. It's filthy with used capped and uncapped syringes everywhere. Dangerous.

title: wandering around downtown
reviews: We enjoyed wandering around down town Vanouver. Lots to look at, you feel quite safe, i like the people here, very friendly and like to have a chat.

title: I love Vancouver
reviews: Vancouver is an international destination for good reason. The city is diverse and the architecture is beautiful. The old and new meld with foresight of good planning. Green glass is the dominant unity of old and new. There are fabulous restaurants and fun shops. The art galleries bring interesting exhibits.

title: A beautiful place during the day, but not at night
reviews: We stayed near Tellus Science Museum, and we found downtown to be simply stunning during the day, but shady at night. Twice we walked back from Canada Place and Robson street at night, and at times it was plain scary. We encountered crazy screaming people running across the street, digging in the trash with only feet hanging out, and a crazy lady touching us.
