We are used to downtown in LA, but it was just such a sharp contrast between day and night, that it was a little weird.

title: A nice stroll!
reviews: Whether you want to people-watch, shop, or visit museums, this is the place to be. Robson Street has many restaurants and bars. And, it is a short walk to Gastown to see the first clock run by steam.

title: Best city in the world
reviews: Vancouver is my favorite city in the world. Downtown has everything a traveler wants. Lots of sight seeing attractions, lots of different activities, many places to chill or party. Lots of restaurants with many different options of world cuisines. Negative side is the homeless people occupying the downtown , good thing is they are not aggressive, if you say "no" they walk away quietly. Seaplane ride and waterfront is must to do. Shopping; you have robson street that you can spend hours. If you want a cheaper shopping experience there is outlet mall near airport.

title: Private City Tour Viator by Peral
reviews: Our guide, Gail took us to Stanley Park we arrived just before the tour busses. Beautiful view of the city and Totem poles and shop. Before arriving drove by the seaport for cruise ships. Then we went to Granville Market another great fresh foods, all types of food to eat.  We walked around and sampled some of the things. They have Agua Boat to take you there. We went to China Town, Gas Town and several other places. We enjoyed Stanley Park and the Food Market the most.

title: Probably a beautiful city, but traffic is horrendous
reviews: The forest fires prevented us from seeing any mountains through the smoke. I'm guessing it's a beautiful view, however. The city is amazingly clean with very little litter. Reminds me a lot of the midwest US. Traffic is, well, horrid. There is only one major highway running through the area, and it backs up most hours of the day until early evening. At least, that was our experience. It took an hour to get from Richmond to North Vancouver via back streets. Negotiating the bridges, tolls, and streets is a challenge given they loop over and around each other to cover the waterways. Tough city to navigate when you don't have landmarks due to forest fire smoke blocking the mountains/hills.  People were very friendly.

title: A walkable and pleasant city
reviews: As a local resident, i find Vancouver downtown to be a safe, clean and pleasant area to live in. It is a young city with a lot of newer towers mixed in with some older buildings. The city centre is compact with everything you might need within easy walking distance. If you are visiting, I would recommend staying somewhere near a Skytrain station so you can travel around the area easily, The Canada Line is safe, convenient and inexpensive if you need to travel to or from the airport. Vancouver cannot pretend to compete with cities like London, Paris or New York as a tourist destination but the city has its charms that the vast majority of visitors appreciate. It is especially blessed with its setting near the mountains and sea, and the downtown has been designed to take advantage  of this. Vancouver does have its share of homeless people but they are rarely threatening or dangerous. I am a senior and I have lived downtown for decades and I have never been mugged or threatened, nor do I know someone who has been. There are not homeless people begging on every corner as some reviewers would have you believe. If one should ask you for "spare change" just say "sorry, no" and move on.There is one area located east of Gastown that tourists should avoid. It is called the downtown east side. It is an area where there area lot of drug users and down and out people. It is not a dangerous area, but it is unpleasant.  Vancouver is consistently rated as one of the best cities in the world to live in. There are good reasons for this. It is multicultural,vibrant and bustling, day and night. The presence of people on the streets at almost all hours is one of the reasons why it is so safe. My European relatives have always enjoyed downtown Vancouver very much when they visit.

title: Bustling city
reviews: Great city to spend the day with the family. So much to see and to do. Went to the harbor and shopped on the first afternoon. Love it!

title: City of down and outs
reviews: What a dreadful city. Stunning location and welcoming and helpful visitor guides completely spollt by the litany of drunks, drug abusers and vagrants on every street corneriThe city is a trash heaven with more butts and abandoned needl s I have ever seenWhat a civic shambles and a disgusting cesspitThe Chinese gardens overwhelmed under a bunch of homeless drunks scrabbling through litter bins or picking up dog ends or simply urinating in the path Tourists abused or threatened .......this is not a safe cityThe pi√®ce de r√©sistance was a druggie hurling a plastic bag of food and other debris against the wall outside our hotel and then screaming abuse at us and nearby peopleNever again. This makes the third world cities look Avoid at all costs

title: Once in a Lifetime, a City like Vancouver!
reviews: Having lived overseas for 16 years, I was always pleased & proud to be able to call Vancouver my "hometown".  It really has it all!  And now that we've returned to home base we can enjoy the sights, foods, cultural richness and geography that is Vancouver.  If you haven't been yet I encourage you to put it high on your travel list.

title: Nice
reviews: It is a very nice and compact city.  Very easy to walk, full of stores and restaurants, very clean and full of flowers...also very safe

title: The City of Glass
reviews: So alive, so vibrant, just an extremely beautiful city.  Whether you are walking among the skyscrapers, or viewing them from across the Harbour, they are a sight to behold. Condominiums, hotels, and apartment complexes rule the view.

title: Get your walking shoes!
reviews: A group of us walked all throughout downtown and outlying neighborhoods of Vancouver for a day. So many pretty homes and lots of shaded tree lined streets.Downtown was full of people and lots of great shops and restaurants from which to choose. Make sure you have good walking shoes, but if not, there is a transport bus you can hop on and off. Loved the city!

title: Allthe best shops
reviews: All the best shops along Robson St. All walkable assuming the weather holds out. We didn't need to use the public transport that often

title: the best place on earth in the summer
reviews: a bit smoggy b/c of the fires in BC. I would not go this week if you have the option.  go for the hike to Lynn Canyon or Grouse mountain if you want to experience the outdoors. Central park if you want a light hike in the forest

title: One of my favorite cities! Go if you haven't been.
reviews: Vancouver has something for everyone: food, shopping, fun, family activities, nightlife. It is especially suitable for a summer vacation (late spring and fall qualify) when the weather is idyllic.

title: Magnificent stay at the Vancouver downtown
reviews: We stayed here during last weekend, one of the busiest of the year. It was great to have so many people walking from one event to another, enjoying the attractions and the atmosphere. We enjoyed the city and the great restaurants, the nice and helpful people and the great Fireworks nearby the river for the 150 years celebrations of Canada.

title: Enjoyed
reviews: We walked the town and enjoyed all the downtown atmosphere. It has plenty of room for renovation as most downtowns do.

title: Nice city centre
reviews: A nice city centre, with some interesting buildings to visit.  Easy to get to on the skytrain or bus.  The skytrain terminal is in a lovely building housing some eating places,  It is easy to get to the waterfront also if you want to get away from the buildings.  From the waterfront it is quite a nice walk to Stanley park which is a must for visitors to Vancouver.

title: Awesome city!
reviews: I like this city. It has its fair share of high buildings and greens. Driving here is okay to think it's a big city. As with other cities, the only downside is paid parking and fills up fast.

title: Celebration of lights 2017
reviews: Vancouver is amazing! It is prepared for big events for the thousands of people that come out .Everything is thought of for everyone to have a great time enjoying the festivities in the city.Annual event-usually 3 nights to attend within 2 weeks. It's a great experience and worth the efforts for a great seat at English Bay!

title: Typical city
reviews: Vancouver offers a lovely mix between city and mountain. The down town area was good with lots of to look at while walking around. Parking can be what you expect expensive. However you would be able to ride the transit downtown which was a good way to get there.

title: Absolutely Beautiful
reviews: As I have family in Vancouver I visit 1-2 times a year. Vancouver's downtown is easily visited by transit and on foot. I recommend starting in gas-town, wandering around Granville street/ Robson square, and heading to Stanley park from Georgia and Denman Street. You can take the bus, walk, or rent bikes/rollerblades. From waterfront station you can take the seabus to North Vancouver. There you can visit mountains- ski/ snowboard/ hike, mountain bike

title: Easy way to spend a few hours
reviews: Been to Vancouver a few times now and love walking around downtown with the water on one side and streets of great shops.  Clean and easy to get around.

title: Something is missing
reviews: As far as cities go, it seemed like something was missing. We found ourselves bored for a lot of our time in the city and much preferred our time out in the provincial parks. Food also tended to be overpriced and underwhelming.

title: Excellent
reviews: A really good place; excellent sushis and sashimis. The taste was perfect and the place, although discreet, can only be recommended.

title: Great place perfect location. Close to many restaurants
reviews: Very pleased with the location comfort and safety of this hotel. Staff told you about things that were happening in Vancouver. Prices were excellent and Vancouver is amazing

title: Coal harbour
reviews: Wandered the water front.  Scenic!!!!!!!!!!!! Had to pee.  Washrooms were dirty.  Nothing exciting to see at Canada place as it was closed in the evening

title: Pleasant
reviews: Similar to most Downtowns - shops of all sorts, people, traffic, food vendors etc.  Pleasant enough for a stroll / window shopping.

title: Nice small city
reviews: Vancouver downtown is walkable to all of the areas and they have great public transportation if you don't want to walk or you want to go further than your feet will carry you.  For the most part it is clean and has lots going on.  Do ask what areas you should not wander into - like any city - there are places that is better not to push the envelope of exploring.

title: Vancouver Touring
reviews: Vancouver downtown area is nice place to walk around and self tour, as well as take a broader bus tour of several hours. Lots of shops and restaurants. View from Canada Place surrounding areas are very nice.

title: Vancouver's great, but beware...
reviews: On a holiday visit to Vancouver, one evening we thought we'd explore the Gastown district and then walk to Chinatown for a bite to eat. An obvious route is down Columbia, but within 100m we found ourselves somewhere we didn't want to be. The street and alleyways were populated by those poor unfortunates whose lives depend on a ready supply of narcotics, and one such alley seemed home to scores of such people, in various states of disarray, none of whom wouldn't be there without the need. On Columbia there was a pharmacy whose sole purpose was betrayed by a barren exterior and tiny serving hatch. How can the city and its charities allow this, let alone so close to a tourist centre?  I have never seen anything like this in London or any other European city, and places Vancouver firmly in the same category as many US cities. We hurried on to Chinatown, only to find it closed and dead, so returned to Gastown by a different route. To be fair, Vancouver is worth a higher score, but to draw attention to this issue I must score badly. No one reads the good reviews!

title: Amazing views
reviews: As part of our hop on hop off tour we visited. Amazing views, quite breath taking really. Very clean and lots of interesting places to see. Sad to see so many homeless people on the streets if I'm honest. One street appeared to have Huge wealth and yet you turn a corner and it's like a different world. A real mixture of old and new buildings. But the views over the waters edge seeing the mountains were beautiful. Well worth a visit.

title: Vibrant - Alive - Easy Walking
reviews: I went to downtown Vancouver on a Tuesday afternoon and was headed to the Vancouver Art Gallery - I took the SkyTrain from Richmond and go off in the heart of downtown. It was very easy to find my way around and easy to walk all over. I went to the Fairmont Vancouver and went inside to look at the Luis Vuitton Shop - everyone was friendly! It was very easy to find everything that I needed and the buildings were great to look at. The Shopping was amazing!

title: Love it!
reviews: Vancouver is modern with a New York type skyline, yet it is compact and you are never far away from the sea or a park. Good shopping too, fabulous range of good restaurants for all budgets, art gallery, theatres - everything you expect in a major city but with a relaxed airy atmosphere.

title: Love Vancouver!
reviews: Love downtown Vancouver. Very safe and clean and a must do for any trip. Plus there are great restaurants to grab a bite.  Vancouver is a beautiful city filled with wonderful people and great food and entertainment.  Love it each time I visit and will keep coming back.

title: So much to see
reviews: A fabulous and vibrant city that is really clean and well kept, there's a real sense of civic pride.

title: 3 nights stau
reviews: We stayed 3 nights As part of a 3 week holiday in Canada & Alaska.Many people recommended Vancouver but from our initial experience in downtown area we were not impressed. Found it full of homeless people & beggars which made us feel very uncomfortable towards end of day. On a couple of occasions we saw drugs being exchanged. Gastown & English bay areas v v nice. Chinatown was a disappointment & we felt very unsafe.Not planning to go back to main down town area

title: Vancouver quickie
reviews: We stayed  7 nights here in downtown Vancouver and 3 nights in Whistler.  While in Vancouver we took a tour that picks you up at your specific hotels (not the free ride bus) to the Hatchery, Capilano Bridge and  Grouse Mountain, where we saw the bears, watched the comedic loggers presentation and ate beaver tail. Had a great first nation guide/driver named Jeff.    We road the 2 day hop on hop off bus for transportation to and from our attraction destinations and some restaurants near their stops. Our tickets included a one way destination on the False Creek Ferry. We shopped a little in the Granville boutiques and especially enjoyed the farmers market and food court of Granville Island. We took a tour on one of the zodiak boats around the city and out among the moored tankers in the bay. We did the fly over Vancouver attraction at the Port of Canada  building.We caught the new movie, Valariun. We oohed and awhed at the Japanese Fireworks display enjoying a picnic dinner with friends. We had dinner twice at the Yaletown Brewery, also enjoyed the Italian Gelato a couple blocks up from there both nights as well (thank you Ron and Jim). We ate lunch twice at Mom's Grilled Cheese food truck....OMG yummy!  Had lamb pita near there one afternoon from one of the food trailers, sooo good.  Had Doner Lamb Pitas  from a brick and mortar another day but the before mentioned were superior.  Had 1 dollar large drinks and $1.50 Ice cream cones at McDonald's 4 nights cause we could and they were cheap!

title: Great Place to Walk and Watch
reviews: Our hotel was on Robson St.,  and we love to walk, so we got tosee a lot of downtown Vancouver. We walked to th Vancouver Art Gallery that had a Monet exhibit, to the waterfront, to Gastown, and to restaurants. All the wonderful people, of so many different backgrounds were also a treat to experience.

title: Clean and Safe
reviews: Walking around the downtown area was very easy to navigate, clean and safe.  Whenever we needed help finding a location, everyone was extremely helpful.

title: Loved
reviews: Loved the vibe of the area and all it offered. Never felt unsafe with the kids. Amazing restraunt choices. Beautiful views.

title: I love Vancouver
reviews: Vancouver is so special because of all the different things you can enjoy. From great food, to nature, sea, city, mountains, ... And Canadians are the most lovely people! Great to be there, every time...

title: Clean area but expensive
reviews: There is a lot to see and to do in this city. It is very clean and has a lot of nice views. Everything is in good shape, and everybody seems to be happy. Traffic is busy, but not really difficult nor aggressive. If you want to stay here for a longer time, you'll need a lot of money as this area is very expensive.

title: Downtown Vancouver includes galleries, museums, fine dining, theatres, music and more
reviews: I love my city! Downtown Vancouver has spectacular waterfront views of the North Shore mountains and Burrard Inlet. The city centre is walkable, and offers the Vancouver Art Gallery, Bill Reid Gallery, numerous theatre venues for concerts, dance performances, films and more. The downtown area includes parks and the residential area of the West End, and at the far west side, our spectacular Stanley Park, the site of over 5,000 years of First Nations history. No matter what your interest is, you can find a special location that feeds your spirit!

title: People rave about Vancouver, but it is nothing compared with European cities
reviews: People rave about Vancouver, but it is nothing compared with the best US or European cities. For sure, if you compare it to Detroit or LA, it is marvellous, but it isn't in the same league as NY, Washington or Chicago, and it certainly isn't London, Paris, Rome etc. The skyscrapers are mundane, and the shopping, while outstanding for Western Canada, really isn't that good. The setting is great, of course, with mountains and coast, but a day or two should be sufficient - then head to the Rockies. They really are special

title: Clean, safe and friendly
reviews: Such a clean and friendly city.  Lots of things to walk around and see.   Can be a bit expensive but there are great places to eat and shop that don't break the budget.

title: A green city open onto the ocean and paradise for cycling
reviews: A real pleasure to discover the city by bike and especially along the waterfront for miles. The contrast between downtown, the numerous verdant parks and welcoming beaches make us forget we are in a city of such size.

title: Stepping Over The Homeless Was Not Fun
reviews: I'll keep this short and to the point. Vancouver is a beautiful city and  we had a great time both before our cruise and after. The food was great, the scenery was awesome, the shopping was good, but having to walk over the tons of homeless people and the pets was very depressing and left a unhappy image in our minds. Everyone else that we spoke to at the hotel and on the cruise ship had the same conclusions, so you need to clean up your act Vancouver!

title: so clean
reviews: Vancouver as a city surprised me, it was both clean, the people so friendly and easy to walk around safely. in fact after two days I found myself thinking I could quite happily live here. definitely try all the walks near the sea, restaurants galore, cake and coffee shops and you wont be disappointed

title: New favourite city in Canada!!
reviews: In love with this city. The ocean and mountains are spectacular. We are staying at the Four Seasons on West Georgia St. Fantastic central location. Go to Robson St for great food and nice little shops. Clean, fun city with a healthy feel to it.

title: Wonderfully Diverse
reviews: My wife and I spent a week in Vancouver and spent about half of it exploring downtown. It is not a large downtown area, but one that is amazingly diverse, both ethnically and culturally. It is easily walkable, and those who want to bike will be pleased with the large number of bike lanes (as well as the numerous places where one can rent a bike).

title: What a wonderful city
reviews: Three days in Vancouver and a fair bit of it was spent shopping and eating in the downtown area. There are shops for everyone from high end like Prado, Tiffany and Versace just to name a few. To great shopping malls and budget stores. There are many food outlets and gourmet restaurants. Vancouver has it all. We have had lovely weather and will happily comeback to this wonderful city anytime.

title: A local's perspective
reviews: Believe me, I love downtown Vancouver. So much so that we live there. I do however have a couple of issues that prevent me from rating it as a five. The first is the vacancy rates on Robson Street. So many stores and businesses have closed. I am embarrassed by the number of empty venues. My second concern is the number of panhandlers in the downtown core. Some of them sit quietly however some of them are verbally aggressive and have unpleasant things to say to people who do not give them money. This gives our city a bad name. Other than these two issues, downtown Vancouver is spectacular. Surrounded by mountains and ocean with lots to do.

title: A real eye opener
reviews: I have never had time to just wander through the downtown streets of a major city with no real agenda. This was a real life - world experience.

title: Just Gorgeous
reviews: Vancouver has been a really nice city to visit, people are mostly nice, streets are clean and it's a really modern city. Nice to walk around and do shopping at Pacific Center.

title: So congested!
reviews: It's absolutely beautiful. This can't be denied! I hate to be a grump (because all the locals probably feel this pain every single day) but the traffic was so congested that it took away from our enjoyment of the scenery and culture. It took us 2.5 hours to get to the Massey Tunnel from Stanley Park. Just crazy. And it would be nice if the drivers were even a little bit more courteous.

title: Great downtown core
reviews: Love the downtown core of Vancouver.   Very safe and clean and a must do for any trip.  Plus there are great restaurants to grab a bite.

title: Visiting with my daughter
reviews: A great place to visit and have a meal and a brink. Its good for a lot of shopping. And good for souviner shopping and great views of North Vancouver and the mountains

title: What a beautiful city!!
reviews: We had always heard so much about Vancouver but you can't believe everything until you actually see it.  What a beautiful city filled with wonderful people and great food and entertainment.  We would visit Vancouver again and again.

title: Love downtown Vancouver
reviews: We always stay downtown and have never been disappointed.   You can walk to so many restaurants and shopping.   Downtown is just a fun exciting place to stay when in Vancouver

title: Always something to look at down town Vancouver.
reviews: Hard to get bored. Between the buildings, the people, the weirdos, the cars, the little shops, big shops, etc. Pretty safe too if you mind your own business etc.

title: Great walk
reviews: Fantastic architecture, a very nice walk. You can spend hours on waterfront, walk by, have a nice lunch or dinner in many resturants around. Great sushi and the local japandog!

title: Great
reviews: This city is very vast and great to get around. Sight seeing is great and a wonderful city . Great shopping and restaurants and lots to see- you must spend 5 days to see so many things . Go to the harbour and the parks

title: We love walking in Vancouver!
reviews: It's a beautiful and friendly city!!! It was our second trip and we hope to return again!  (The first time was in November 2015.)

title: Clean & Safe
reviews: There was a lot going on downtown- we loved the markets, the festivals and all the people. Everyone we came in contact with was helpful and friendly. There was never a time that we felt unsafe. We walked all over downtown being mindful but never had issues.

title: Love Downtown
reviews: We love downtown. There is so much to see and do. We like to just walk around looking at the buildings head over to B.C. Place take the water taxi to Granville island. It never gets old being downtown

title: Laidback Vancouver
reviews: I was struck by how peace loving, friendly, accepting and helpful Canadians are.  Even the beggars and drug users were left alone and accepted as part of the street scene.  The beautiful parts of the city were Gastown, Canada Place, Stanley Park and Granville Island areas.  I loved the laid-backness of the city and Canada as a whole.  People were polite and happy.  No wonder Canada made the top 10 list as one of the happiest countries in North America.  The only drawback that I have for not giving this city a 5 star rating is the homeless people on the streets and the smell of urine in some parts.  We were lucky to have sunny days and blue skies during the week of July.  It made the marina a picturesque scene for photos and not to mention the colours from the potted plants alongside the street.  I am tempted to immigrate to lovely Vancouver, Canada....

title: vibrant
reviews: Vibrant, young downtown with plenty of options. If we weren't with our senior parents, we would've spent more time enjoying the night life.

title: Something for everybody
reviews: There is a Marina and waterfront, Hotels to stay in, restaurants to eat in, offices and shopping galore. In short there is something for everyone.

title: Great City - lovely people
reviews: Stayed for a week in July - have been traveling to Canada for years but not to this part of the country - was a great first time experience!Lots to do and live the foodie and dining vibe of the city!

title: So many homeless people but a great city
reviews: I thought NYC, San Francisco had a lot of homeless, but Vancouver takes 1st place in this category. The city is wonderful but the homeless here is just bad.

title: Suffers with beggars and drug users.
reviews: If they got a grip of the beggars it would make a massive difference to what is a nice city. There were so many and seemingly accepted as part of the city, spoilt it for me.

title: West End and Marina outstanding!
reviews: Vibrant, youthful, public transit friendly and people-friendly place to visit.  Twice we had native Vancouverites ask if we needed help when they saw us struggling with maps and locations.

title: Nice Friendly City
reviews: We were a group of ten staying at a downtown Hotel near Robson Street. Great location and nice places to shop and eat nearby. Plenty of choices for breakfast and dinner. The people are so friendly and helpful. The taxis are readily available and efficient even if one has to travel short distances. Although we could not see the whole area we would love to visit again maybe in winter.

title: Clean and Green
reviews: I guess you've got to be into cities to really appreciate somewhere like this.  I would say it is clean, with a lot of greenery.  There's lots of different areas, such as Chinatown to name but one.  Lots of homeless people, predominately young males who undoubtly are in the main drug addicts.  Never felt unsafe, never pestered but the contrast of very rich and very poor is ever present throughout the whole area.

title: Easy Walking, Easy Navigation...Lots of Hills
reviews: This place is really easy to get around, lots of signage and GPS works well. Lots of shopping and eateries. Hills can be hard to walk up from the harbour side.

title: Shopping, eating and limited parking.
reviews: Take the bus or walk to get around downtown. Very crowded place. Be prepared. There is plenty of shopping and great eating places. Enjoy.

title: Busy during rush hour
reviews: Like your average big city it's busy during rush hour but it seemed manageable. The street signs are a little small but everyone is friendly and helpful with directions. Quite a bit of things to do here.

title: Good selection of shops, safe and well maintained
reviews: Vancouver city center offers a good selection of shops including all the large brands. The large department stores like Nordstrom and Hudson Bay are located close together.If you are looking for a shopping experience a la Rodeo drive then you will be disappointed but otherwise you will find everything you will need.

title: 1st Canadian Trip
reviews: Easy walking to explore city centre, Canada Place and other key sights, enjoyed cafes and shopping, views from Skytower, views from accommodation and talking to the locals.

title: Gorgeous Vancouver
reviews: So much to do here, I sat watching the seaplanes everyday...with the mountainous backdrop...just breath taking. Convinced me to take a plane ride. There's a Turkish restaurant I enjoyed food right at the visitor center...perfect weather as well. Canada Place was beautiful and right across to it. You can watch the cruise ships come in and enjoy food on the patio at one of the restaurants facing the water.

title: Nice place to walk
reviews: We stayed here before boarding a cruise ship to Alaska.  It was very easy to navigate and has a lot of nice restaurants and shops.  Easy walk to the waterfront, although it is downhill, so walking back was a little more taxing.

title: Great start to our holiday
reviews: We have visited here before but with so much going on you can easily fill your day with any and very type of activity...whether you just want to chill out or go cycling around the city or Stanley park. Definitely recommend choosing downtown as a base for a holiday.

title: Nice downtown but....
reviews: Vancouver downtown is lovely with shops, cafes, and malls but....lack of cleanliness on the street, and one guy ask for water to anyone he pass and the other guy open/close shop door expect for coins in a mug. We spent most of the time inside Pacific Centre, Nordstorm and Holt Renfrew, it was nice inside.

title: Beautiful clean city
reviews: No shortage of activities or things to do. All kinds of shopping, restaurants of all ranges. International flare. Easy walk all over downtown area, or rent bikes or catch a cab ride. All easy ways of getting around. Hop on off busses with all day passes to hit all the major landmarks.More homeless around than I anticipated, but never felt unsafe. Four day stay but could have used another couple days.

title: Lovely place to stay
reviews: We stayed in Vancouver Downtown on the 1st stop of our Canadian adventure. The Marriott was an excellent hotel to stay. The surrounding area was very easy to walk around and to find the shops and eating places.

title: Lovely City
reviews: We spent 3 days are part of our holiday in Vancouver, a lovely city, plenty of tall glass building and plenty to see.From the dragon boat event close to the sports stadium, to the town, Robson Street, the conference and cruise ship area, the tower and Gastown with its steam clock.Also visited china town area and Chinese gardens, a lovely city.There are however plenty of down and outs and homeless people in the area, especially in the Gastown and Chinatown areas, a little unsettling, especially when on several occasions we were approached and asked for money and I would avoid these areas after dark.

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: If staying for a short visit in Vancouver stay at the West End. Many food outlets, bars, hotels eetc. Sort walk to the beach and downtown.  Downtown has many interesting building and is easy to get around. Vancouverites are very proud of their city with justification. take  free walking tour to get to know all the intersingsites

title: 5-Day trip
reviews: Wow, and amazing city! Our family of 5 visited in July and we loved it. We did not have a bad meal, so many restaurants to choose from; the city is very walkable and has a nice public transit system; open garden spaces are beautiful; lots of history; day trips are easy to execute; green and sustainable; hip vibe and welcoming; pet friendly; bike friendly. We wished we could have stayed longer

title: Stunning
reviews: I am so proud to be Vancouver resident!Take a transit, walk, bike to the waterfront and enjoy the stunning views of the sea, mountains, architecture, people, admire the cleanest, friendliest people, enjoy, relax, walk.....Watch the seaplanes take off, boats, ships of all sizes ply the waters of the inlet, have lunch, create memories of a lifetime.....

title: One of the best cities not to miss
reviews: One word sums Vancouver up: Awesome. Location, weather, people, friendly, happy, and mostly clean ... If you have not visited, make plans to do so on your next vacation.

title: A staple of vancouver
reviews: We stayed in downtown as there are many great hotels here. It is also the place where most things happen. Tons of shops, restaurants and attractions. The only downside to it is the amount of homeless people on the streets, can't the governmemt do anything to help them? Most smell of cannabis, just asking for more money to buy it, probably how they became homeless. Overall it does look amazing and if you can ignore the tramps then it is a spectacular city!

title: What a neat city!
reviews: I like big cities and Vancouver is no exception. There is PLENTY to do in the downtown area for several days. Lots of shopping and incredible amounts and diversity of food and restaurants. We were within walking distance of most everything. The busses and sky train are also readily available if you need to get off your feet. Great buildings and interesting architecture all around.

title: Eat off the sidewalk!
reviews: Instead of talking about the activities, shops and food, I want to call out the Vancouver DPW.  This is probably the cleanest city I've ever been too.  I've been to many places in Germany, and even still, Vancouver is just immaculate.  Bravo to the Vancouver DPW and their vigilance!

title: Lovely city..!!mix of sun, mountains and water
reviews: Visit Vancouver..in my opinion the best place in Canada. We have mild weather..well, rainy winter but at least not too often to snow unlike Winnipeg, Toronto and Calgary. We offer great highways, lovely muli cultural mix of people and downtown offers shopping while smell the fresh air coming from the Coal Harbour? And the restaurants? Everything you can ask for..! Try Miku for Japanese food and Hys Steakhouse..go to Yaletown for more choices. You will love downtown Vancouver.

title: Second Visit to Vancouver
reviews: Our family has been lucky enough to visit Vancouver from Ireland twice in the last four years. It is a beautiful, busy, safe city. Lots of shops on Burrard and Robson, plenty of skyscrapers but never any feeling of hassle. Canada Place is a great area to spend free time, and enjoy the spectacular sights.

title: clean...
reviews: one of the cleanest downtown's I have been to, whether it's the rain/snow they have but the roads, walkways, seem scrubbed clean, hardly any graffiti but a lot of homeless evident, which I found odd for a city that is normally wet or frozen for 7 months of the year...Shopping on Robson Street was good, with a lot of big and small shops but sadly no Macy's in Vancouver or in fact any of Canada and their equivalent, Hudson Bay, just didn't cut it for my wife.....great restaurants though, all within a small walking distance, rare in any city.

title: Girls trip
reviews: Beautiful clean city. Lots of shopping, restaurants, gorgeous architecture and waterfront. You can watch the sea planes coming in and taking off. Can't wait to return.

title: Site's & Sounds!
reviews: The downtown area has lot's to see & do, from shopping to dining or just people watching! Take a stroll along the board walk along the waters edge or head into downtown arae to take in the numerous shops or restaurants. If needed take a form of transit (bus / skytrain or taxi).

title: Walking from Coal Harbor to bus depot...
reviews: Seen lots of fun things along the way... Old A&W restaurant, lots of shopping, enjoyed a hot dog from a street vender, saw some art in the nearby park and enjoyed the afternoon.

title: Great feeling walking in Vancouver downtown
reviews: We were lucky with pleasant weather in July to walk in Vancouver downtown, not having particular route or place to see, just walk around, feel the great vibe of the city.

title: Good Downtown
reviews: Easy to walk, close to attractions, near to cruise port and having restaurants offering Indian, Thai, Chinesr, Corean, Vietnamese, etc food.

title: Lots to Do
reviews: There is a ton to do in downtown Vancouver to fit all flavors.   Great food, shopping, walking, biking, parks, sea walls... Worst class city.

title: Prettiest Place on Earth!
reviews: I live here so I'm biased, but Vancouver is the prettiest place on earth. Mountains, ocean, parks and plenty of outdoor activities. So much to do you'll never get to everything.  Awesome restaurants and clubs and theater.

title: Much to See and Enjoy
reviews: This is a world class city that begs you to go out on the town and eat and drink to your hearts content.The restaurants and bars meet the needs of any tatse.  Allow yourself time to get out and walk around and enjoy the many interesting sites.

title: Lots to do
reviews: There is a lot going on in Vancouver. Great mountain views. There are so many different neighborhoods: Gastown, Yaletown, Granville Island, Chinatown, Olympic Park, Stanley Park... Lots to see and do.

title: Skyscrapers, Shopping streets, Lots of food options!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is truly a north American experience. Tall skyscrapers fill the downtown area. Robson street has amazing shops lined up on both sides of the road. Lots of food options with food courts, fast food and restaurants. Clean and wide streets. Hang around Canada Place, amazing views of Stanley park and North Vancouver.

title: A Must Visit City!
reviews: This is one of the most fun multicultural cities one will find. Being on the coast and next to the mountains it offers plenty of sports and exercise opportunities. The views are spectacular!!!There are so many different parts of the downtown, e.g. Stanley Park, Gastown, Chinatown, Yaletown, Granville Island, etc., that offer entertainment, food, and awesome sites that you could half a day in each. This is definitely a City for foodies, especially those who love asian cuisine or seafood. This is a wonderful city for walking and you'll find few, if any, boring moments. This is absolutely a "must see" burg!!!

title: Sightseeing & Shopping
reviews: This is "ground zero" for shipping  and sightseeing.Hotels and restaurants and bars are top notch Take it easy in your feet and use the hop on, hop off bus

title: Loved the skyscrapers
reviews: Looks like an Asian city. Many vibes of theEast.. clean, bustling, loved t he waterfront. Very peaceful in the early mornings.

title: Lot's to do and see
reviews: Vancouver is one of the friendly city. Everyone goes out of the way to make you feel welcome. There are plenty of sights and attractions to see and do. It is an easy city to walk in as well. Very safe and clean! Look forward to returning soon.

title: Hotel Vancourver Bar/Restaurant
reviews: Had lunch at the Hotel Vancouver Bar/Restaurant with my daughter-in-law and two granddaughters aged 6 & 4.The restaurant area was very spacious with semi-booths( booth like against the wall with chairs on opposite side of the table). Sound was absorbed with the use of carpeting. The atmosphere was very relaxing.  The food was delicious with an expansive menu which included a separate child's menu. Crayons and pictures for colouring were supplied for the girls.Service was friendly and helpful. We were not rushed. Price was moderate.A great place for lunch in the heart of Downtown Vancouver

title: Pleasant and great city
reviews: I recommend to visit Vancouver 100% it is a modern city with amazing open public spaces; just wander around is a great experience; using bicycle is an excellent option. Don't forget to include Canada Place.

title: Great area to walk before the cruise
reviews: Departed on a week long cruise and walked / visited downtown Vancouver before sailing.  There was a lot of people traffic, lots of activities and very clean and safe.  Fun times.

title: A Thriving and Pedestrian Friendly Downtown
reviews: We took the Millennium Line (LRT) from our hotel at Richmond's River Rock Casino Resort straight downtown to the Waterfront Station and exited right at the convention center downtown.  From there we strolled around the convention center (see other review), Gas Town (see other review), Robson Street (see other reiview).  We met friends for drinks at the Tap and Barrel outdoors (see other review) and then dinner at Nightingale's (see other review).  If you've never been to Vancouver, the downtown core is fabulous and best experienced on foot.  It is very safe and clean.  Beautiful skyline, views of the mountains  (esp. when snow capped), ocean, seaplanes, skyscrapers, shops, restaurants, etc.  It is my old home town!

title: Not bad
reviews: We saw Robson Street, Yaletown, Granville Island and area around Canada Place. Overall seemed clean and safe. Some homeless people on street per usual city. Did not get to Chinatown or Gastown lije we wanted. Very diverse community, but seemed reasonably friendly. Lots of food and shopping. Rosedale on Robson conveniently located here.

title: Awsome City
reviews: We enjoyed everything! Architecture of the city. Canada Place and waterfrontOne can't describe it, you've got to see it!

title: So much to see
reviews: So much to see.  We walked all over the place. Pretty much ate our way around the downtown area.  Very easy to get around.

title: Fantastic first trip to Canada
reviews: Started off in Vancouver for a 12 night stay from there to Rockies finishing in Calgary - absolutely  loved Vancouver downtown - information centre was fabulous so helpful and saved us lots of dollars by booking through them ! Canadians so polite and helpful throughout

title: Downtown is not what it used to be
reviews: The downtown core, most specifically Robson Street, used to be a lot more vibrant and interesting than it is now. There are many empty shops that now line the street. Greedy landlords that charge exorbitant rents have pushed many of the unique "mom and pop" shops from the area. Downtown Vancouver has become a city that caters to the √ºber wealthy tourists. Shops like Prada and Tiffany now have a strong presence.  Unique businesses have been driven from the downtown core to make room for yet another condo complete with a coffee shop and nail salon.Walk through the area in the early morning and you can literally trip over one of the countless homeless people that sleep and beg in the street. If none of this turns you off, grab one of the plentiful Mobi bikes for hire, and take a spin through the Main Street area  where you can grab a beer form one of the local micro-breweries. Here you can witness even greater oppression and destitution. Don‚Äôt wait too long to do so, as this area is also quickly making way for the ‚Äúhaves‚Äù and pushing out the ‚Äúhave nots‚Äù.

title: Good view
reviews: If you want a good view of the waterfront then visit this place. Plenty of eateries and cafes around. Canada place is here too.

title: Beautiful! Love this City!
reviews: We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Vancouver! We walked every section, and the downtown, was the busiest, and found some great little spots! Walking Vancouver is the best to see the beauty, from the streets, old cobblestone, shops, restaurants, buses to hop on and off and great spots to take photos! Every part of Vancouver is a five! Loved it and would love to visit again!

title: How I miss the Vancouver of the 70s!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver was once a spacious, charming, and wonderful city. Unfortunately that charm has now been buried under so many layers of nouveau-riche pretension that you'll think you're strolling down Rodeo Drive but with a lot more rain. Pradas face off against Guccis across double-parked Ferraris as far as the eye can see. It's nothing less than capitalistic excess to the point of disgust. You can't turn back the clock but in cases like Downtown Vancouver you'll wish you could.

title: A Wonderful Three Day Stay.
reviews: We were in town for three days. The weather was warm and sunny. The city is easy to get around on foot/bike, if you're mobile enough, you don't need a car. The Sky Train is a good option to get you around on a day pass. We took our time to get around, as we were in no rush(on vacation). Day and night, there's plenty to keep you occupied. The big sky scrappers make you feel so small when looking up at them. Plenty of shops, bars, restaurants to go at in lot's of different districts. The waterfront area is a must place with all the cruise ships, along with watching the seaplanes, come and go. Take a stroll to English Bay, where you can chill on the beach. A little further on takes you to Stanley Park( great for families). We took so much in, with wonderful memories to take home with us. Thanks Vancouver, you're a GEM.

title: Best option-the Greenways
reviews: Water front and park greenways are excellent.  It is a lifeline of the city for casual strolling, running, or bicycling.

title: Walkable & Clean Cidy
reviews: Spent three days in Vancouver. Warm and friendly locals. Walked the city, visited Stanley Park, Vancouver Aquarium, and went bike riding and hiking just north of the city.

title: Amazing and should be part of your trip to Vancouver.
reviews: No visit to Vancouver is complete without a trip downtown. Allow at least 2 hours for a run through or 3 to 4 hours for a decent visit to restaurants, souvenir shops, galleries, Gastown and Chinatown. There are mobi bikes for hire and tiny little cars to hire and hop around in. If you are waiting for a flight and have time, hop onto the sky train. It is a 25 minute ride to the Waterfront and the trains run every 5 minutes or so.

title: Lovely City
reviews: Suggest to visit with ample time for walking in and around the water-front experiencing this lovely city with a clean and nourishing atmosphere. Its lovely to be able to breath the clean crisp and cool evening air whilst enjoying the scenery Vancouver has to offer.Many lovely restaurants bordering the waterfront with lovely parks.Its not a rushed city, which lets you relax and enjoy your holiday to this corner of the world. A definite place to visit!

title: Lovely, lovely city
reviews: The happy, friendly atmosphere of Vancouver hits you straight away. The city offers everything you could need. There is the essential bustle of a busy city but it retains that relaxed feel. All gastronomic tastes are well provided with a  leaning towards seafood and Oriental quisine. There is a great hop on, hop off bus service, and enough shopping, culture and entertainment to satisfy everyone. All in all, one of our most favourite places.

title: Summer in Vancouver - a great place to visit
reviews: Vancouver is amazing. Everything from International metropol with most high end brand flagstores represented to a summer holiday coastal city with beaches, restaurants and all summer activities. Easy to get around in and the surrounding mountains deliver a variation of great experiences.

title: Great Mobi stations and Asian food
reviews: Love the Mobi bikes! Put on 90 km over a 24-hour period with two people. Best way to see the city--under $20 USD.

title: Beautiful place!
reviews: One day trip for us and we enjoyed it! Fly over and souvenir shopping was great! Go there if you can!

title: The most livable city in the world?
reviews: Every year, Vancouver is rated amoung the top 5 most livable cities in the world. No wonder, with a beautiful setting like this, great restaurants and culture. Vancouver is also one of the greenest cities in the world.

title: Wander round
reviews: There's a lot of interesting people roaming the streets and a load of great places to grab a bite! As a tourist it gave a good idea about the general vibe of Vancouver - made even better by the fact we had awesome weather

title: Beautiful Green City
reviews: Very green city with numerous small parks dotted throughout, amazed that pedestrians have the right of way at light controlled junctions, was surprised at the amount of homeless people especially noticed it on early Sunday morning when waiting for our hotel room to become available. Shopping prices comparable with the UK if not a little more expensive.

title: Super City
reviews: Very cosmopolitan and commercial but with beautiful harbor views everywhere you turn.  Lot's of restaurants and stores, including large malls that are easily accessible by foot.

title: Canada Day
reviews: Celebrated Canada Day in Vancouver by Canada Place.  There are lots to see and do while there.  You have to see probably the only working steam clock!!!

title: Safe place to walk around even at night
reviews: Walked around downtown until almost midnight and feels like to be at home. Pedestrains has the right so you feel free to walk around without sny problem.

title: Wow and WOW!
reviews: Vancouver downtown was mostly beautiful and we had a good time. The steam clock was cool. HOWEVER,  we had never seen so many homeless and druggies before.  Honestly, it was shocking.  Every other corner had people begging or sleeping.  I went into a public  restroom and there was a needle disposal receptacle in the stall.  The gift shops were plentiful but prices were high.  I asked a shop keeper about it and he said it's because they have so many druggies shoplifting so they have to increase their prices.  We were at the waterfront, gaslight  district.  I wouldn't go there at night.

title: Very nice
reviews: Decided to stay here for our first visit to Canada so wasn't sure what to expect but very nice! Very clean, plenty of shops and restaurants. We arrived for Canada day so was very busy but as we were jet lagged we got up early the next morning and went down to the harbour and took some beautiful photos, hardly anyone was down there so if you're an early riser definitely head down there! Or if you fancy a run or cycle there's some good tracks! There were also plenty of boat rentals and sea plane tours available for those interested!

title: Great Front desk staff. Extremely helpful and considerate.
reviews: Decent location, convenient walk to downtown locations. We stayed for 4 nights and were extremely satisfied.

title: Highly Livable City
reviews: Vancouver long ago took off and it is easy to see why. A stunning Harbour, lively CBD, easily navigated and highly scenic, there is a lot to like and love. Downtown has commerce, shopping, Harbour views, great eating places, craft brew bars, and a good sprinkling of art and culture.

title: Cool place to visit
reviews: We were only here for one day but got to walk around the area. It's very clean for a busy city and the architecture is really interesting and many of the buildings. We really enjoyed walking near the harbor where the cruise ships come and go. Plenty of places to eat around. As in most cities there are a few beggars but the musicians busking on the streets is fun. I'd like to come back and see more of the city but enjoyed what I saw.

title: Best downtown to visit
reviews: Vancouver downtown is right near the water and also interesting for a visit.  There are the steam clock and walking street.  Restaurant, waterfront and a lot of thing to see

title: Many great shops and restaurants
reviews: If you like to explore the culinary delights and shopping, downtown Vancouver is a great place.  Don't miss Robson Street for shops, and many restaurants in the nearby streets also.

title: Modern, safe, lots to do.
reviews: We felt very comfortable the entire time we were there. Fairly clean, friendly, and plenty  of things to enjoy and do. Very modern city.

title: Ideal city for retirees
reviews: Parks and beautiful bike trains along the waterfront leading to Stanley Park. Great city to enjoy walking tours. Safe and clean and easy access to restaurants and bars as well as shopping. Canada Place also provide a convenient docking port for large cruise ships. You can almost shake hands with the Captain. Subway trains simple and easy to use. The city skyline extends across to the outlying islands. Great place for strolling and enjoying crisp clean air.

title: Shopping or dining
reviews: There is a variety of things to do, shopping is good, the Chinese gardens are lovely as well as the tower, not to mention the lovely restaurants

title: Alaska Cruise
reviews: Vancouver downtownFantastic place to walk around. Very nice, clean and absolutely safe. Canadians by and large are very humble and jolly people but Vancouvarians are one notch better in all these aspects. Robson street and Canada Place is where we mostly walked. Good bars, restaurants, shopping and entertainment areas within this belt. Even cruise ship terminal is located at Canada Place. Beautiful Ships, just a hand shake distance away. Highly recommended to take a leisurely walk or morning exercise walk.

title: Marvelous city
reviews: The city was lush, bright, clean and folks were very friendly. The weather was warm for May but very lovely. The city has tons of green areas interspersed with the different neighborhoods or locals. Diverse populace whi embrace the outdoorsvand diversity.

title: Beautiful Canadian Vacation
reviews: First time visit to Vancouver.  Great city for a 3 day visit.  Went to most of the tourist locations, and some that were not.City is very clean compared to many large cities in the USA.  But it does have many homeless individuals living on the streets.Recommend that you stay at any of the Vancouver downtown hotel locations.  Great safe hotels, in central Vancouver and accessible to almost everything you would like to see.  Bring your camera or phone device.Bring the wife and kids, they will enjoy themselves and the time in the city.If you are single, well Vancouver seems to have many beautiful. young and available Asian ladies working in the city.  Good luck!

title: Vancouver, B.C. Jazz Festival & Art Gallery
reviews: We stayed near the Vancouver Art Gallery where the Jazz Festival was performed.  Great event and free.  We also found the Art Gallery was hosting an exhibit featuring 36 works by Monet titled "The Secret Garden"  This was so special and inexpensive.  The selection feature works throughout his life with historical guides. I can't say enough about how well this exhibit was curated. Two thumbs up...three or four if I had more hands.

title: must sea
reviews: our hotel in downtown make us visit all around  it very crowded  there because  of malls restaurants  .sightseeing. Theaters.but after 9 o'clock  due to closing  shops  and darkness  only many homeless  are there

title: Nice city
reviews: People are nice, and public transportation is amazing.The scale of big name department stores are huge, compare to other locations such as Toronto's. We wouldn't recommend to walk some part of East Hasting St near China Town...

title: Beautiful!
reviews: we went on Canada Day and it was very crowded but it was nice to see downtown on that day. beautiful views. Kid fun event was awesome. There is little sprinkler and kids were having so much. Take swim trunk and extra clothes. we could spend the whole day here.

title: Impressive city by any yardstick you might use
reviews: Great city with much history and great attractions to visit. We stayed downtown where that are hundreds of restaurant and eateries. Don't miss Stanley Park, Granville Place and Grouse Mountain.

title: A must visit
reviews: There are a lot of nice buildings and sites in downturn vancouver which is reachable by sky train as well. A good way for a quick visit and introduction will be taking those hop and off buses. There are viewpoints where one can overlook the vancouver skyline as well. Lots of shops and eateries too.

title: Disappointed.....many homeless people.
reviews: I was really excited to visit Vancouver, yes it is beautiful and surrounded by mountains. There are many parks and greenery, especially enjoyed Stanley Park. BUT, left our hotel early morning to walk Gastown in search of breakfast. Was so turned off by the amount of homeless people clearly drugged and intoxicated. People living out of cars washing themselves. Felt unsafe as a woman walking there. The streets are dirty and littered. This really out me off.

title: Great City for a Walk
reviews: We stayed three nights in the West End, not far from Coal Harbor.  Although cycling was very tempting (and reasonably priced) we chose instead to walk because the weather was quite nice.Over two days, we walked all the way around the island and Stanley Park. Delightful! Lunch at Hamburger Mary's on Davie, dinner once and lunch once at the Daily Catch on Denman, a great dinner at Cafe Luxy on Davie, unique and delicious breakfast at De Dutch.Lots to ogle in the GasTown district and Chinatown.Put on your sneakers and get out on the streets - great people, great food.

title: Most beautiful city in the world and bike friendly
reviews: Having travelled to more than 60 countries in the world and hundreds of cities, I have to say that I think Vancouver is the most beautiful city in the world....on a clear dayüòä.  Nestled between the coastal mountains and the Pacific Ocean the city is nothing short of breathtaking.  Vancouver is a bike friendly city so, rain or shine, one of my favorite things to do is to get on a bike and go see the sights.  From downtown it's an easy 10k bike ride (make sure to go counter clockwise since the bike trail is one way) around Stanley Park with it's spectacular view of Canada Place, Coal Harbor and the float planes, the Totem Park, mermaid on the rock statue, Lions Gate bridge and English Bay beaches.  You can also do another 15 k bike ride all the way around False Creek and back to see Granville Island and Kitsilano Beach.  The trails are fairly flat and well marked.  Between Granville Island and Kits make sure to stop at Go Fish for the best fish and chips in the city and at the Boathouse Restaurant in Kits for an amazing view and a great Happy Hour.  If you are an intermediate or better biker you can do the 22km round trip trail from Kits up the Cypress Street trail to the Arbutus Trail and then turn right and take the Arbutus Trail across town towards the airport.  The Arbutus trail is built on an old railway line so the incline is not too steep.  The trail takes you past Kerrisdale and the shops and Cafe's on 41St.  If you follow the trail to the end make sure to take a right down the hill and then your first left to stop at the Milltown Pub and Marina for drinks and food.  The pub is on a strip of land between the marina on one side and the river on the other.  Here you can watch the planes landing at Vancouver International airport. If you are and experienced biker you can do these three rides together for approx 55km and it takes me 3-3.5 hrs depending on how crowded the traits are.

title: Awesome place to be
reviews: A very diverse city .. you will see many different cultures and will see all kinds of people .. We had a lot of fun downtown walking and trying different things and tasting a lot of food :)

title: VIBRANT!
reviews: Great opportunity for engaging people participation. Varietypacked with parks, retail, brand name accommodation, fabulous bars, patios, restaurants, clubs and great ocean/harborviews. Impressive!

title: Lots to do
reviews: What a great city, it is so clean, no rubbish and very safe to walk around. The waterfront is a great place to sit and people watch, lots of lovely restaurants and cafe's. There is so much to do in this fabulous place you need to spend as much time as possible

title: I want to live here!
reviews: No doubt that Vancouver is one of the most beautiful cities in the world.Walking by the water front with the view of the sea and the mountains is stunning.

title: Clean, Bright & Interesting Skyline
reviews: A great area to walk around and meander through shops and stopping to look at the sculptors. Lots of resturans and coffee shops as well.I'm impressed with the cleanliness and love how friendly everyone is.

title: Great city
reviews: Small compact city, on the harbour, with the stopback oh the gorgeous mountains. Many interesting shops and restaurants, to please tourists.

title: One of the best cities I've visited
reviews: I'm not usually a city person but Vancouver is great. Small and friendly,  it is a great place. There is an amazing variety of buildings. There is a great integrated transport system. A day pass can be used on bus's, trams and harbour ferry. Plenty of places to eat and drink and tourist shops.

title: What amazing Views.
reviews: Has great restaurants and bars set on the waterfront so can sit and watch the world go by. And the boat planes, cruise liners. An always changing canvas unfolds in front of you. Top spot to sit and chill. At night has lively bars and food eateries.

title: Beautiful, bustling area
reviews: Was here pre cruise and the entire area was crowded and busy.  Lots of energy, beautiful buildings and terrific architecture.  Lots to walk around and see, including the spectacular waterfront.

title: Great to see while on a tour
reviews: We took a great tour and that gave us some context, without it it wouldn't be nearly as interesting. Lots of old historic buildings and new art installations that are amazing and worth seeing.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Don't bring a car...and that's a good thing.  Mass transit is great, city is ver walkable, and you can rent bicycles everywhere.  This city really caters to safe cycling with dedicated and PROTECTED bike lanes.

title: Stayed
reviews: How hotel was in this area ,easy to get any where, nices cake shops around and few places to gat cup off British tea

title: an exciting area
reviews: the downtown area is always hustling, bustling with people activity.  the core area hosts many, many excellent pubs, eating establishments, shopping stores, etc.  take your time and enjoy

title: one great city, Vancouver is
reviews: One of the great and beautiful cities in the world, great shopping and phenominal water front. Take in great name shopping in areas like Yaletown, Gas Town and Robson street. Visit Stanley Park, one of the great parks in North America, many fine hotels in and around the city proper and a great view of the North Shore Mountains makes this the complete package.

title: Lively and friendly.
reviews: Vancouver Downtown is a very pleasant, interesting place. One can find just about anything here: lots of eating places, shops, supermarkets, expensive department stores, etc. The streets are busy, there are lots of people everywhere and they are friendly and polite. Surprisingly there are lots of Asian-looking people here and I presume many of them are First Nation folks.We stayed in a downtown hotel (Georgian Court) and it was a good choice because just about everything we needed was in a short, walking distance.

title: Nice town
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city, easy to walk and people are so nice. Take a tour with The Tour Guys!!

title: Night tour
reviews: Had a walk around, stopped by the steam clock, which was nice to see.  Nice meal and drinks reasonably priced.  Purchased a few things. Only being there at night limited what we could see but tour guide showed us a few places.

title: 3 days Vancouver is not enough
reviews: We booked 3 days in Vancouver as part of a cruise vacation. Pleasantly surprised with the diversity of shops and ease of shopping. Top brands. High quality stores. Very clean and well maintained city center. Feeling perfectly safe in the streets.A good mix of excellent restaurants. In one word: World class!

title: Disappointed
reviews: The view from afar was beautiful and surrounding areas such as west Vancouver were nice however the city itself was so congested and REALLY  high density of population.Instead of buildings being architectural it was many more just high rise living spaces which were not attractive with a ton more being built. The traffic was horrid. Suggestion would be see the city on a tour as buses have their own lanes.

title: Walk and explore
reviews: Every street and every corner seems to hold new adventure. The way to experience Vancouver is walk around. From Robson St to English Bay to Stanley Park... all close

title: Accessible
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has a variety of restaurants and shops you could visit. Everything is close by and you can walk to most places. Parking is expensive so walk or take the bus.

title: The views are amazing
reviews: Downtown is very clean, beware that in the weekends some parts are not so busy because it is mainly a business district. We ended up in some empty restaurants. The views at the waterfront are absolutely amazing.

title: Vibrant and always exciting!
reviews: We stayed in lovely downtown Vancouver when we were there.  Any time of day or night you can walk around, feel safe and enjoy the ambiance!

title: Lots to see and do downtown
reviews: Lots of shops and eateries in busy downtown. Easy to get around on buses, trains or hop-on hop-off bus.

title: Exploring Downtown Vancour
reviews: Wonderful array of designer shops, houses many arts, entertainment, and sports venues, and is close to several vibrant residential communities.  There were so many different types restaurants . Downtown is developing so quickly & is the hub of many business . I found it was clean & easy to get around .

title: Great city
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a awesome place. Fantastic shopping, really good restaurants and bars and the views around you are stunning. I love a full day wondering around.

title: Been to 40 countries and never seen so many bums
reviews: Vancouver - best place to live in the world? Pure propaganda, i have never seen so many homeless people and drug takers downtown, in Yaletown and Gas Town as in any other city. What makes it worse is that they are all quite agressive and constantly bothering you. It made us cancel an evening out as although they left us alone when ignored it just was not pleasant.It also isnt multi-cultural as there is purely either a caucausion or asian influence. A huge let down.

title: A City worth a Visit
reviews: Spend a few nights here before our Alaska Cruise.  A lovely city and really enjoyed our stay - Stanley Park, walking along the foreshore, the Granville Island public markets - all highlights.  For such a manicured pleasant city, I did find the large number of homeless people quite confronting as not used to this at home in regional Australia.  Close daytrips possible on excellent public transport - we enjoyed a visit to Lynn Canyon on the ferry/bus.

title: Very Beautiful City !
reviews: We spent 3 days in Vancouver prior to leaving on a 7 day cruise to Alaska.  This is a very beautiful city and very very clean.  People are very friendly and helpful when asking for directions or recommendations on places to eat.

title: Lovely city
reviews: Vancouver really is a beautiful city with many interesting streets, nice buildings and friendly people. Once can do some good shopping, eat some great food and see many other attractions. It's pedestrian friendly and you can also easily ride a bike around. However the city does have a homeless problem with many drug addicts on some streets, however they seemed pretty docile.

title: Downtown
reviews: Amazing view of the water and skyscraper buildings , friendly people and I am a vegan so going out of town is hard to find good food places. Lucky Vancouver had a lot of vegan vegetarian restaurants

title: Not inpressed
reviews: Went to Vancouver 6/6/17 for 5 days it was the longest 5 days people quite friendly lots of people living on the streets taking drugs visually see these people putting needles into their bodies and getting high manic ,cannabis is legal you can smell it everywhere. Going for a meal or a drink if you don't give the right money they don't give you back the change ,alcoholic drinks cost anything from 11-18 dollars which is quite expensive, public transport is cheap.Best thing about Vancouver is the steam clock in gas town.

title: Gorgeous city!
reviews: This city is one of the prettiest, it's a buzz of activity right in downtown especially near the waterfront and gas town. You can walk all day and not get bored with all the happenings. The best view of downtown is on the north shore or Stanley park if you don't want to cross the bridge. I've taken some amazing city skyline photo shots from here, you want be disappointed. Best places to stay are close to Canada place area if you can, everything then is practically at your doorstep.

title: Lots of weirdos!!
reviews: I visited many big cities, but I never encountered so many homeless, drug addicts and lunatics as I did in Vancouver. Even had 2 minor incidents when someone just started insulting me when I was walking in the city and on another occasion someone banged on my car when driving in the centre. Traffic is also the worst I experienced anywhere, with traffic jams everywhere. It took at least 30 to 40 minutes to get out of the city encountering numerous traffic lights and dodging overheated drivers honking at you. Not much to do either and very expensive. The only positive thing is that the city is nicely situated near the water with the mountains in the background. Will not come back here!

title: Hop on Hop Off Greyline
reviews: Bus was open and it was cold.  I thought bus would have open air seating as well as closed seating.  At many stops there was no room for people to get on bus so they had to wait for next bus.  It was a waste of our time as we had a car. We decided to get off and walk back to our hotel to our car.  A lot of the stops were at hotels which took a lot of time.   Most of sites it is better to drive than be on cold Hop on bus.

title: Beautiful city‚Ä¶.but changing fast!
reviews: This is the second visit for us to Vancouver.  We enjoy this city very much.  The people are very friendly and we were happy to find "street hosts" walking around on the street offering to help you find places if you are having trouble finding anything (they wear badges).  Lots of construction and we understand from the locals there is a lot of foreign investment in the area, so whole neighborhoods are being bought out, single family homes being torn down and condos being build‚Ä¶row after row of them!  Only down side is the number of homeless people on the streets!  Most large cities have a homeless issue, it seems but it was very obvious in Vancouver.  Folks sleeping on the street, trash everywhere the homeless people were, dirty old guys peeing on the side of buildings, etc.  Folks begging were on each corner.  On a happier note, most of the city has a lot of gardens, flowers and most shop owners try to keep their part of the street clean.  It is an expensive city to visit, but, all major cities are anymore.  International place with folks from all walks of life.  This is a city you need to walk in to see, so take some walking shoes and an umbrella and get out and see things!  Gasstown was fun, Stanley Park is massive and very nice.  Nice, big upscale shops all over, too if you like to shop.

title: Lovely, fun place
reviews: Gorgeous views of the harbor, nice walking, coffee, shopping. City tour bus available. Taxis everyplace.

title: Good Tourist area
reviews: Great shopping, good access to transport, an easy walk around the streets and many cafes and close to harbour.

title: nice walk
reviews: My wife and I parked on the street, very expensive, about $6 Can. per hour, The further from downtown the cheaper. Very clean and felt very safe. Many little shops and places to eat. The eats are not real cheap but reasonable. Cruise ships park here to load and unload so it can get crowed.

title: Very beautiful city..
reviews: We stayed in downtown hotel.Area is so beautiful & vibrant.I love Robson street. U can have best time there,in lovely Vancouver downtown. Its my most favourite city.

title: My favorite city on the west coast, unfortunately it is slowly decaying from the intrusion of people immigrating in.
reviews: Vancouver of old was jaw dropping and very British in feel.  The amount of class and sophistication oozed from every corner of the place.  Now?   No, it has gone downhill and the people living there now have lost all care and concern for this city.  Here is an interesting sentence I hear from many of my Sikh Indian and Hong Kong Chinese friends..   "It isn't bad, it is much nicer than any city from where I am from.."   Yeah, famous last words.  My only reply and the complete look of not being able to comprehend it..   "If you saw it 20 or 30 years ago you would look at what it has turned into and be shocked.  A once beautiful city has now been slowly turned into the garbage that is where the people immigrating in are from.  While it is still better than what is in Asia, it isn't going to take long before it is more like an Asian city than the Grand Lady she used to be.  It is interesting to talk with Canadians about it.  Years ago there was this blindness to it and that everything was just fine.  Now, I hear more and more discord from Canadians as they see the essence of their city being taken over and changed into something that they now feel powerless stop or change it back to what they once knew.    They sold their soul for an easy solution to their economic woes and there is no looking back now. What the future holds? More decay and what was once grand and proper fades, to be taken over with the greed and social decay that follows.

title: Shops and more shops
reviews: Down town is very big place lots of shops not cheap ones either you can catch the bus from there and experience what's out and about

title: Beautiful Scenery
reviews: We loved walking along the water in the morning with our coffee, looking at the huge cruise ships, mountains and the marina.

title: Nice downtown but...
reviews: Vancouver downtown is really nice! It offers perfect shopping places, restaurants and bars. Everything is in walking distance.Many other positive things could be mentioned but there is one big issue:There are tons of beggars, homeless people, vagabonds... many of them are boozed or on drugs.It's obviously a big issue, people are lying around everywhere.Sad... the city really should do something!

title: Nice and clean city
reviews: Stayed here one night after our Alaskan cruise ended. Very clean and nice city from what I saw. Plenty of stuff to do and definitely a place I'd come back to when I could stay longer.

title: Not too crowded not too much traffic
reviews: Relatively easy to get around either by walking or bus.There is also an underground train system.Some bus tickets allow you to transfer to another bus within 90 minutes .you can buy a day pass for all modes of transportation for about$10.There is also a hop on hop off service that takes you to many places in the city.The train also goes from the airport to downtown for less than $8.There is no Uber in Vancouver.

title: A perfect place to visit
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city with everything you'll need close at hand. We found there were great public transit options for everything that wasn't walkable, and there are numerous beautiful and interesting neighbourhoods with great restaurants, shopping, or outdoor activities. It's also a very safe and clean city, and we found people friendly and helpful everywhere we went.

title: Clean city with lots to do
reviews: Transportation options are decent and there's lots to see and do. The city is reasonably clean and people are generally friendly. Some nice hotels and good food options.

title: GREAT SHOPPING AND RESTURANTS
reviews: We were staying right down on Robson Street. Lots of stores and restaurants to choose from. Lots of opportunities for people watching. Two blocks over are well to do neighborhoods all with lots of foot traffic. We only had a bit less than a day to explore. I would like to spend more time, if we ever get back I would alot a couple of days to Vancouver

title: Great place but.........
reviews: There is a lot to see in BC's largest city. There is great shopping, views of the mountains and waterfront. The city is relatively clean, but they need to do something about the panhandlers and peoples sleeping in the street. Sorry Vancouver but it's out of hand.

title: What a city
reviews: Vancouver is vibrant and young at heart. It is situated in a fabulous setting with the ocean and the mountains as friends! Plenty to see and do. It's one of the great city's of the world. Come.

title: Great place to walk
reviews: If you enjoy walking Vancouver is scenic you can enjoy the views along the sea wall, also take in the heritage of Gastown

title: Beautiful city needs to help homeless
reviews: Stayed at hotel on Granville right downtown and while I felt safe in the day, probably not so much late at night. Granville is a party hub and part of the street is closed down on weekend nights which is kind of cool. A lot of homeless people sleeping in doorways, people with mental health issues wandering around and panhandlers outside coffee shops. Dirty sidewalks, cigarette butts everywhere. Buses and skytrain stops are plentiful making it easy to commute. Friendly people for the most part, lots of great pubs and restaurants. Yaletown is a must, very dog friendly. Robson street always fun. A small part of Robson was closed and people could walk in the street, there were vendors selling marijuana and paraphernalia one day, but gone the next. Food trucks are great. Love Vanvouver, I would like to see people needing help get it, also like to see the streets kept cleaner.

title: beautiful city
reviews: Vancouver was recommended to us to spend an extra day in.  It was worth it--so much to see and do and such a wonderfully friendly city.  Many things to do in the downtown area.

title: Vancouver traffic
reviews: If you are driving plan a lot of extra time to get in and out of the city.  Vancouver is very behind on updating their transportation infrastructure. The city is beautiful but the moments are spoiled dealing with the heavy traffic.

title: Come prepared
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is not the best organised/prepared for tourists - street maps/information is sparse unless you go to the visitors information at Canada PLace first and frankly theres not so much of interest to see.

title: So much to see, in a friendly and inviting city
reviews: Great dining, fine hotels, unbeatable sunset views, galleries, historical buildings along with brand new glass towers, distinct and vibrant neighborhoods, and the wonderful walkway along the seawall leading toward Stanley Park.

title: Lots to do and see.
reviews: Vancouver is beautiful.  There is plenty of shopping on Robson Street.  Stanley Park and English Bay are perfect to walk around and enjoy.   Granville Island is also nice to see.

title: Downtown Van is my home!
reviews: I've lived and enjoyed Downtown Vancouver for over 10 years now.
