It's an amazing place to live and visit, most especially during the summer months but there is always something interesting to do and delicious to eat in this great part of the city! Really easy access to entertainment, outdoor fitness, foods of different varieties and lots of places to hangout and just people watch!

title: Loved this vibrant city
reviews: We had a great stop at Vancouver. Nice clean city and many places are walking distance or short bus ride. Waterfront is great, and Granville Island and Stanley Park are outstanding day trips.

title: WOW! Vancouver is wow:)
reviews: Go there,book a tour with the Plane,see How modern arhitecture make a gorgeus view,if you  Missed it european restaurants there is a lot of options

title: Skyscrapers!
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city with a wonderful mix of old and new architecture.  The city is clean and very easy to get around in.  We walked and took public transportation for our whole visit.

title: Week long Vancouver fun
reviews: I've had a week here with a friend & we have filled every day.... so much to see & do & age / physical capacity is no problems..... thus place suits everyone whether you want adventure or laid back!

title: You can walk it in a few hours
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a peninsula, small enough to walk around in a few hours. It‚Äôs attached to another peninsula called Stanley park you could add to your walk if you so desired. I would really recommend walking this city, as you will see so much more of this beautiful area. I feel safe, although I know every city has its limits, but I feel the risk is too low to worry about. You‚Äôll love the fresh air.

title: Very walkable city.
reviews: This is a beautiiful, walkable   The buiildings and neighborhoods are diverse and interesting.  There are many shops and food places.  The city's negative side is the number of homeless sleeping on every street.  Mostly they do not bother but they do beg.

title: Short stop
reviews: Seemed like several places to see downtown. There is a lot of history and interesting buildings. We didn't have enough time to explore this area very well. I would suggest staying downtown and taking in all the area has to offer

title: Modern and trendy city
reviews: Stayed few nights in Vancouver before going on the cruise Lots to do and see. An Excellent transportation system,  easy to use and cheap.Enjoyed visiting few different places using seabus and sky train.Would been nice to stay at least a week.

title: Better than a concrete jungle
reviews: This city is beautiful with amazing scenery everywhere you look. It is always busy but the pedestrians do move so it flows. the stores are great and are open quite late and people are out walking equally as late. We loved Canada Place, Gastown  and many other places you can stop at on the Hop on Hop off bus.A very easy city to get around and see everything.

title: Whilst staying in Vancouver
reviews: We stayed in Vancouver downtown area twice whilst on holiday and found it to be ok, but will say area to north towards the port had less homeless people as its more business area

title: Expect to walk!
reviews: Getting a taxi in Vancouver is nearly impossible and √ºber isn't there- downtown is quite small and easily walkable - Gastown, Stanley park, Robson St and Yaletown are the main areas I'd suggest. Stores are open quite late, everywhere you look is well manicured - watch for cyclists though - they rarely use the bike lanes and whiz past fast! You'll also notice a lot of pedestrians jay walking - and apparently there are a lot of pedestrians hit doing so  - be careful! The city is stunning - mountains, trees , very green... ocean views and lots of reflective glass towers.

title: one of the most beautiful cities in the world
reviews: Take the hop on hop off trolleyWe had a very knowledgeable guide and gave us a gret tour of the city

title: You Will Find Something to Do Downtown
reviews: Vancouver is the City that can fell more like a Town.  Most everything you would want to do is easily reachable by foot, or short train or cab ride, or rent a bike.  The downtown area is fully of retail stores and you will find upscale stores on Robson Street, you'll have many choices for food and entertainment is just around the corner.

title: Wonderful area to walk or ride through
reviews: This is an unusual downtown  Many terrific sculptures, lots of green space with vast array of buildings, some modern some 100 years old, lots of personality.

title: White spot restaurant Vancouver central - top class
reviews: Great restaurant excellent for breakfast and very reasonable on price. walked in and saw 4 Vancouver cops eating so thought this must be ok and it was.Recommended. Just a couple of blocks from the Four Seasons Hotel Vancouver and Canada Wharfe

title: Lovely city
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has plenty to keep you entertained for at least a couple of days. Use the trolley bus to get around and hop off wherever you fancy. Try one of the street vendors for lunch. Japadogs is one of the best down  near Canada Place. Gas town is a great place to stroll through and don't miss the steam clock

title: Vibrant Streets
reviews: Walked around the Downtown area, a lot of places to stop and eat, drink and watch the world go by, Robson street was my pick

title: This City has it All!
reviews: Our first trip to Vancouver will certainly not be our last. We loved everything about the city. It is clean, the people are friendly and nice, the restaurants great, shopping wonderful and varied and the scenery just sensational. Tons of wonderful upscale hotels with lovely service. We have been bragging about Vancouver to everyone since our return.

title: Plain Jane
reviews: Plenty of places to spend money, from high end to the basics. Very busy and the buses are easy to use with helpful drivers

title: Amazing city
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has lots of places to visit and see. Lots of history and interesting places found here.

title: beautiful city
reviews: There's loads to do in Vancouver. Most tourist attractions have a free bus to get there and the hop on hop off bus is a good way to get round.

title: Even a rainy day in Vancouver is beautiful
reviews: Yes, it was pouring, but we walked all over downtown Vancouver and it is a beautiful city.  Since it was raining, we decided to do the indoor "Flight over Canada" ride.  It was really very good.  I'd do it even if it wasn't raining.  Good shopping, lots of places for food & drink.  We only had one day in Vancouver, but I would like to go back someday and explore some more.

title: A shoppers paradise.....if you like that kind of thing!
reviews: I'm probably writing this on behalf of my wife who loves to shop and finds everything within a few blocks.  Lots of well known stores but a few very appealing and different stores to add to the mix.

title: Stunning city
reviews: Vancouver is a stunning city with great vistas wherever you walk. Be sure to visit Yaletown, Gastown, Chinatown and the West End as well.

title: Awesome City!!!
reviews: Vancouver is an awesome city. It's got a very cool vibe. It's a great Please to work,play and live. I will return next year and I am looking forward to it already.

title: vibrant downtown. Lots of eateries and shopping.
reviews: Vancouver is gastronomically up to par. Great service and great food, Hadn't had a disappointment. Coming from a quiet town, Vancouver downtown is very colorful. With so many people on the streets Police is present but surprisingly not in your face.

title: Fabulous
reviews: Excellent walked, train, bus, lots of wonderful shopping and exercise.   Shore is beautiful Sutton hotel highly recommend stay there!   Joe fortes for brunch  or dinner!   See Geoff!

title: Bright, open and fun to visit
reviews: Vancouver is a great city to visit. Easy to get around, especially by bike. Good public transport and plenty to see, do, eat and drink.

title: Lovely
reviews: A very fun place. Very easy to get around. Lots to see. Diverse food. Spectacular mountain scenery in the distance.

title: beautiful city still
reviews: I used to live in the lower mainland and always came to the downtown a lot,the transit system (skytrain) is second to none,the downtown core is still wonderful even with all the construction still going on and vancouver is a very clean well maintained large city.

title: great buzz
reviews: buskers outside the main station, great atmosphere, great service in the bars and restaurants. The quickest service in all the restaurants.

title: A changing canyons of skyscrapers
reviews: Construction has to be one of major industries of Vancouver. their is  a mass of high rise construction. The unique and varied architecture is amazing, however I was disappointed in the lack of historic buildings.

title: A hole !!
reviews: A thousand bums; addicts and criminals l8je hastings stret 24/7/365 its the worst street in canada. The tower is the only highlight you get a good view. Go to Victoria you will love it forever !!

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Very easy to get lost, but once around and you will never get lost again.SWhatever you can buy in Vancouver you can buy in Sydney and not much difference in the dollar at all. Still fun to walk around.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: We took a downtown tour while in Vancouver. It is a beautiful city. It is very clean and has flowers in much of the landscapes. There are many trees, some blooming. It is a very pleasant city to visit.

title: Beautiful downtown
reviews: Lots of shopping and restaurants to choose from.  Very posh and high end.  Part of downtown is right by the water.  Beautiful scenery.

title: Lovely city..... but some aspects not so pleasing
reviews: The downtown area has a variety of restaurants that will cater for most tastes and pockets. Some parts of downtown seem to have a lot of homeless people and medicinal cannabis shops. Consequently the smell of weed is all over the place which is not pleasing to those who do not enjoy it.The walks along the sea wall are nice and there is lots of greenery around. This review focuses on a small area of the city and is not representative of the whole city.

title: One of the best cities for walking.
reviews: We really enjoyed our walks in the city, the traffic isn't that heavy so the air is clean. The roads are on a grid system so it is easy to navigate especially as the vertical stands with maps showing where you are and a 5 minute walk circle, are every few blocks. The car drivers are polite and paitent with pedestrians and the system of countining down the seconds left still to get safely accross the road, takes out any last second dash to get over the junctions before the lights change. I was facinated by the different lamp posts in the different districts, there are distinct atmosphers (all good), as you walk or drive throughout the area.

title: Vancouver and beyond
reviews: We found the local transit system was great.  Head for Canada Place, which is a great place to start exploring.  There is an information centre and Free shuttles to Grousse Mountain and Capilano leave from here.  You are basically just paying the entrance prices and get the bus for free or near enough.Dont miss Fly Over Canada, it is fabulous and ends with a view of the Northern lights. Worth every cent.Instead of choosing the 24 hour Hop on Hop off bus for $47 each or using normal transit bus and bikes, we made a mistake and hired a car to see Stanley Park. In Stanley park, in your own car, you do get to travel at your own pace and dont have to wait for buses, but parking is difficult if you go on a weekend, so you waste a lot of time.  I think the Hop on Hop off would have been a better, cheaper option for 2 people after all.We hired the car for 2 days and it ended up costing us $252 CAN, plus petrol.  The car hire itself was advertised as $42 a day in $US. The hire price did not include any insurance cover, that had to be added at $18 a day for basic car cover, or $45 a day if you wanted full collision cover, 3rd party and roadside assistance.  So much for travel insurance being sufficient here, its not.  So by the time you convert everything to $CAN and add the insurance it cost $126 a day.  Ouch!!  They do have 'Cars2Go' supposedly for $50 a day, but I dont know if that includes insurance.Driving up to Whistler was beautiful for the passenger.  As the driver you dont get to see as much, as the road is quite bendy.  We stopped at Shannon Falls and were blown away, it was so impressive.  We then took the pedestrian walk to the Sea to Sky gondola.  It proved to be a 7000+ steps walk through the forest and that included equivalent of 8 flights of stairs!  Beautiful, but exhausting.  I recommend you drive there instead. It is only just over 1km by road.Sea To Sky is a beautiful experience.  The scenery is lovely.  If you dont have all day, you could stop with this sight and not go on to Whistler, but while it is approx 850m high, Whistler is more than double in height.Whistler Village is a walking town and quite confusing to navigate by car.  Google was completely confused and sent us to the wrong place twice before we finally got directions from a local to the gondola station.The first gondola takes 30 minutes and goes straight up the mountain.  It is very, very high.When you get to the top, you can then travel on the Peak to Peak gondola which travels 4.4km between the peak of Whistler to Blackcomb mountains.  Unbelievable experience.You literally feel like you are standing on top of the world.Again, we were sorry we drove instead of taking a tour. We got so lost using Google maps we wasted well over an hour and had no time to explore the town of Whistler or visit Brandywine Falls. It was very frustrating.  On a tour you could relax and not have to worry about this.  However, I dont know of a tour that does Sea to Sky and Whistler.  They all seem to include Shannon falls and some include Brandywine fall.If I had to choose a gondola ride and had all day (12hours) I recommend Whistler tour.  Shorter tour just goes to Squarmish, which is where Shannon Falls and Sea to Sky are located.  You would not be disappointed.If you do drive to Whistler, there are 4 car parks called Lot 1 to 4 in Whistler Village.  Lots 3 and 4 are free parking, but a walk to the town.  Once you find these car parks head into town and you will find the gondola station.  Dont do as we did and go in the wrong direction again and end up at the closed chairlift to the Peak.  More frustration.If you enjoy Craft Beer, you will be spoiled for choice in Vancouver.  Easiest is to head to Gastown, which is an easy stroll from Canada Place.  Several venues there that serve a huge range of local beers and some great food.  Dont miss the Steam Clock, it is gorgeous.Dont miss Sky Tower.  Go during the day, go and have dinner, then go back to see the sun set, all on a single day ticket. I recommend the free guided tour too.Loved this city.

title: vancouver water adventures
reviews: I took my friend to take this 1 hr 1/2  cruise boat Wow what a beautiful city and the tour guide Faith was very informatic I definitly recommend this tour Especially on a sunny day

title: Awesome ...but!
reviews: Vancouver downtown is an amazing city however they are full of homeless people who are really polite, respectful and make a 'nice' show in order to make money by tips or tourists donations. You will see them consuming drugs on streets with no problem.

title: Lovely night at Vancouver downtown
reviews: Vancouver downtown is the most happening place in the city and the night life brings life to you. Enjoyed dinner at Vancouver downtown with only concern is parking on any weekday or weekend.

title: Great city with the friendliest of welcomes
reviews: Wandered around Downtown for a couple of days, as well as wonderful boardwalk strolls around the water's edge.  Great assortment of big and small shops, and a variety of civfee shops, bars and restaurants.  The bird cheaping noise at the traffic lights is cute and the city seems so clean, fruendly and welcoming.

title: Very cool place!
reviews: What a great area! Talk about a city filled with vibrant people. From the park, to the streets, to the bike trails, to the beach. Would definitely recommend renting bicycles if you can. Bike around the park, then bike around the city!

title: Sheraton Wall Centre best place to stay at Downtown
reviews: If you want to stay right downtown in Vancouver then the Sheraton Wall Centre is the place to stay!  Beautiful rooms with an amazing view thru your floor to ceiling windows!   Treat yourself!

title: I Could Live Here
reviews: We spent a week in an apartment downtown and loved it. Everything is close to hand -- shops, recreation, good coffee, restaurants of all kinds -- and the city is so clean and efficient. This is a sharp contrast to where we live in Morocco. Vancouver downtown is young and hip but even as a retiree I fit in just fine. Unfortunately the real estate is priced out of my league.

title: Attractive modern with a little old
reviews: The many excellent modern buildings are well set out and the few old buildings add a contrast. The waterfront buildings look great across the water from Stanley Park. Food is varied and good value.

title: Safe and beautiful city
reviews: I have been working in downtown for two years now. I came to Canda 2014. The city is beautiful and safe but I would avoid East Hastings side where a lot of homeless people live. There were few incidents in that area over the last few years. There is easy access to the city from buses and trains. There are a lot of good resturants and food trucks around the city with good quality food.

title: Nice visit
reviews: We stayed here the night before we did our Alaskan cruise and on the way  back. The hotel was fine as well.i didnt find some of the people were nice and friendly as we usually find in America. Area was nice. There were a good few homeless people wandering around Found it to be a bit pricey. Nice for walking

title: Clean, entertaining, walkable
reviews: Walkable area. Granville st with good souvenir shops and inexpensive reataurants by day and trendy nightclubs at night. Nearby theatre district also full of diverse reataurants. Hotels in area very reasonably priced. Plenty of cabs and easily accessible bus and subway system.

title: We loved Vancouver, like a country town feel but a beautiful city
reviews: We arrived here to start our Alaskan cruise. We really wish we had more time. We loved the feel of Vancouver, everyone we met was so relaxed and friendly. We walked for miles from one side of the island to the other side of the island. Snow capped mountains and such a spectacular harbour. Would love to visit here again.

title: Crowded
reviews: Lots of shops, lots of restaurants.But lots of ill-mannered people and traffic.  Not particularly clean.It's concrete, stores, and rude people - mostly tourists (people working are friendly and kind for the most part).Concrete jungle in an over-priced city.  Very sad BC has allowed things to go this way.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: We travelled to Vancouver to embark on an Alaskan cruise.  Never visiting the city before we were amazed at it's beauty.  The skyline is gorgeous for a city as in comparison, we have visited New York which has it own grandeur, but Vancouver is like a city of glass.  It was easy to drive in the city, not the congestion as in New York or Los Angeles for example.  During our 2 night stay we found we needed more time to visit all there is to do and see in this spectacular city.  So many restaurants and bars.  Stanley Park was amazing with all there is to do there.  We will be back.

title: Lovely walking city
reviews: Downtown is a great place to walk day or night.   The buildings are a mixture of old and modern architecture and the juxtaposition is eye catching.   There's plenty of shopping,  eating options and lots of photo ops.

title: Lots to see; bring good walking shoes!
reviews: Toured downtown Vancouver on foot and there is lots to see.  Many great restaurants and coffee shops and lots of shopping.  The street people are unforgettable!  Take your time and enjoy the fast pace.

title: Beautiful but expensive!
reviews: There's a lot to do in downtown Vancouver: Stanley Park for walking and biking; lots of bike rental places; the Aquarium; interesting old buildings; and world-class shops and restaurants. And of course, the beautiful view across the harbour to the North Shore mountains. There's something for everyone here, but it is expensive.

title: Great city
reviews: Bustling city with lots to do. Ocean breeze, walks on English Bay,take a wonder along Davie St, stroll down Robson for some great shopping, explore commercial drive for some amazing eats. Stanley Park. Seawall. Go.

title: Great setting and a lot to see
reviews: Surrounded by water on three sides, the downtown area has great things to see from Canada place to art galleries and more. Clean, safe and subway availability add to the mix.

title: Walking Downtown of Vancouver
reviews: We have been very surprised about mixed of the population. Lot of Chinese. It looks like being in Hong Kong. Also we saw lot of homeless people and junkies. Especially when we walked in Gastown and Chinatown. This is the part of the city you should avoid. Other parts of the city are nice.

title: it's my city
reviews: I love going downtown. It has it's flaws, but the over all look of the city nestled against the beauty of the mountains and surrounded by the ocean makes it special. Lots of good restaurants. So pretty in the spring when the dutch bulbs come up and the cherry trees and magnolias are in bloom.

title: Lived there for 23 years better
reviews: 6 months year rain better from May till November 1st then no good everything you need obviously over priced housing condos homes all around 1 million at least good restaurants lots of walking hiking odd homeless person asking for money accessible by skytrain from airport about 20 min around 8$ from airport going to airport around 4$ I get day pass at London drugs or Safeway or or grocery or drug stores for around 8$ one zone pass 2.75 only good on either bus or skytrain but not transferable little confusing 10km 1,000 acres downtown park walking biking rentals etc convention centres tram up grouse mountain is nice on sunny day bear thing bird show in summertime skiing in winter as long as good winter whistler about 1.5 hours away very beatiful vancouver island 1.5 ferry ride person 20$ car something like 60$ not sure very busy in summertime every where only good in summertime I think

title: Great to walk around
reviews: Very easy to walk around downtown area with interesting stops along the way.  We walked for blocks just for the heck of it.

title: Clean and safe
reviews: Clean and very safe for a large city. Diversified shopping opportunities. Recommend using public transit.

title: Many Transit Options
reviews: Plenty to see along the waterfront in particular.  Public transit options are pretty good.  I used Google Map to get the right combination of bus/train.

title: Everything from a big city in a small, clean setting
reviews: Cosmopolitan shopping, lots of green and water, well thought out city centre - lots of hotels and malls.  Very clean, wide pavements, lovely people

title: City of glass
reviews: This was my first trip to Vancouver and always thought it was a large city. I was quite surprised to find it was much smaller. Not disappointingly so though. It is a very clean city on th whole and very friendly. It has a multitude of visitors from many parts of the world but especially South Korea and China. The views at the waterfront are lovely and if you find a bench to sit on , you can spend an hour easily just watching life on the water and people passing by. I was very disappointed in the historic district of Gastown. Although small and quaint if you venture just a little off here you will come across many homeless people and also drug addicts congregating together. On two occasions we witnessed young men 'shooting up'. I know this happens in every city and I am a frequent visitor to my own capital city, but this seemed excessive. One of our bus drivers mentioned that the city had cut its spending on this problem. I am sure this will have a detrimental effect on visitors to this area eventually.I would suggest that 2-3 days is enough to see most of what Vancouver has to offer.

title: Pretty city with lots of harbour areas
reviews: Go downtown and see the seaplanes landing, watch the ships set sail loaded with passengers. Have a drink or meal by the water in the many cafes and restaurants. Walk along the paved area or the designated bicycle path. Walk uphill to the shopping areas.

title: A vibrant, young city.
reviews: We had a few days to get around Vancoover so explored places like Grouse Mountain and the Capilano Bridge, both worth seeing, but owntown is more of a working place.  Plenty of good hotels and terrific places to eat, but like most towns having poorer areas with homeless prople and beggars.  Don't let that put you off however, the waterfront of the island is full of fascinating places to visit.

title: Clean and exciting
reviews: We drove through to go to places. Normal city very busy. Had dinner near Canada place. Plenty to see around there. Lovely walk along the seafront and the new Convention Centre

title: Stunning architecture
reviews: Vancouver is a clean and beautifully maintained international city. The street signs are easy to read and bicycling is encouraged. Yahoo! Other large cities should follow your example.

title: A beautiful, modern city
reviews: On a recent visit to Vancouver, we spent hours walking downtown.  We also took the Hop-on, Hop-off Trolley bus city tour.  Vancouver is a vibrant city with fabulous water and mountain views.  Great for walking to check out all the downtown highlights.

title: Very walkable vibrant downtown
reviews: Lots of shopping including indoor if weather doesn't cooperate Beautiful mountains and harbour views never far awayEasy walk to the beaches Good transitGreat hotels and restaurants Interesting diversions like the Olympic village, Stanley Park, Gastown, China town,Granville Island and English Bay Beach a short stroll awayOnly downside is the number of street people especially present on Granville Street - poverty and drug use is sadly omnipresent

title: Vancouver - A Very Modern, Clean City
reviews: We were surprised at how modern the city was.  But also it was very clean.  Had excellent food at a restaurant in China Town.  Wondered around Canada Place.  The harbour is pretty.

title: Awesome!
reviews: The downtown setting is quite awesome! The undulations in the roads and the road vistas ending up in bay views are a camera's delight. The area is best explored on foot or on a cycle. The streets as adequately lined up with coffee shops and cafes hence a quick break is never far away. Shoppers 'have' to go to the Robson street! The cycle and the walking track along the bay provides one with quite amazing views!

title: Great!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a vibrant and modern metropolis. It is clear that most of the stunning areas and high-rise buildings have been erected in the past 20 years. The city is clean, filled with shops, parks and restaurants and it's an absolute joy to stroll around. The background created by the sea and mountains around Vancouver downtown makes it truly a world-class downtown.

title: Great way to get to and from YVR
reviews: I am not a big public transit guy. That being said, if you are in Vanovuver this is the way to travel to and from the airport.

title: Downtown Vancouver, BCBSO Worth Seeing
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a typical downtown scene of busy crowds, late-night shenanigans, and many sirens! There are however a lot of restaurants shops and fun things to do in downtown Vancouver. Many of the businesses are open late at night. The cityscape offers a scene of many tall buildings of businesses as well as dwellings.

title: Great eateries and micro brewery pubs/bars
reviews: I have to just list the places we went too during our very short stay definitely want to return . Scoliosis absolutely the place to go for breakfast eggs Benedict to die for and our sons didn't do too badly with French toast bacon and maple syrup and there cinnamon bun. Then there was the black frog just by the  clock. And also DreamWorks just a little way up the road. Also Olympia on Denver street. And last but it least  The tap and bottle at the harbour all really nice Canadian pub rub and at least 30 different beers to choose from.

title: Something on every corner
reviews: We loved the streets of downtown and thought there was a lot to see and do. However, the traffic is very frustrating.

title: Don't arrive here tired....
reviews: ....and from the blissful countryside as the city will strike you as a dump!The streets are filthy, full of debris and cigarette butts despite various signs in all the streets that smoking is forbidden.The city "suffers" the same as most others from a large pitiful amount of homeless guys (didn't see any ladies) of which are attempting to make the most of a bad situation, with almost comedic comments on scraps of cardboard asking for food, money etc.Robson Street, apparently the main area for shopping, is naturally busy and full of people going about their day to day existence, if this is "your bag" (no pun intended) then come here and enjoy. It certainly isn't mine....!

title: cool place
reviews: i was in down town for 2 weeks and stray was very good .. you get all the stuff needed if you are a traveller and well connected by metro to explore the city

title: A day visit
reviews: The downtown Vancouver is great even in night or day. Lots of different foods / restaurant to offer. All types of especial foods and culture you will see and taste. The best is Sushi and Vancouver is Cheap and so good! I love the Pho as well as the food truck all around! If you want to shop well lots of signature outlets from the long walk to Robson going to Stanley area ended your night to watch the sunset at the bay of Denman. Its great to take a walk or bike where in lots of area to rent the bike in the Robson downtown area. Good place to roam around!

title: The best way to recover from jet lag is walk
reviews: Checked into the Four Seasons then wandered through Downtown to the foreshore, walked along, saw the sites, Vancouver you are a fabulous city

title: Not as nice as it seems
reviews: A beautiful city with lovely harbour and beach. Main Street is great- plenty of shops to busy yourself for a day or two and nice seafood if you like that. However, as soon as you leave the mentioned areas it's like something from the walking dead. Certainly not clean or safe, seen three different people on one day injecting on the footpath, one right outside a police station. Homelessness is out of hand and people literally run around screaming and shouting, vomiting, fighting etc from the heroine tics and the police don't do anything. Whatever you do stay away from anywhere east of downtown, especially east Hastings.

title: Loved it
reviews: Great City... almost like my home city Melbourne, Australia. Good choice of food, restaurants, variety of hotels. Safe. Good street signs... 5/5.

title: Great city to walk around
reviews: There are many neighborhoods in the downtown area, each with a different vibe.  My favorite discovery on this visit was a new walk/bike trail along the bay in Coal Harbor.  Definitely worth a walk!

title: Amazing
reviews: Very well planned & developed. Beautiful tall residential towers facing water front all around. Stanley park is close by. Good restaurants & shops. Lively place.

title: Flyover Canada
reviews: A fantastic experience! I enjoyed tremendously! This virtual 4D ride takes you to a surreal 8-minute flight above the best places in Canada. The beautiful orchestral music makes the experience more exciting.

title: Downtown
reviews: The city center is an easy walk to good restaurants and the port. Easy to communicate on bus, train or boat. Its a city waiting to be discovered. People are friendly and always willing to help you if you need it. The only problem I saw was the groups of homeless or drug addicts that you see a bit all over town.   They do not bother, but  its a sad thing to see them  among all this wealth and beauty of the city.

title: Very cool to hangout in downtown vancouver
reviews: Super clean, super safe and super fun. If you love food - especially Asian food then you will love eating downtown. Best Asian food ever. Plus really trendy pubs and nice places to shop. Easy to get around and everyone is friendly. Plus really pretty girls!!!

title: Lots of shops, but no parking (on street)
reviews: We walked the entire downtown area and found lots of shops.  However, street parking is almost non-existent so look for a parking garage and be prepared to pay.  We are from Washington and even with the 36% exchange rate found the prices in the shops to be very high.  It looked like a lot of stores are going bankrupt as many had closing signs and liquidations ongoing.  Even the liquidations prices were higher than we normally pay in the US.

title: Close to what the downtown of future should look like
reviews: This city is a great city DESPITE the mismanagement of Vancouver City Hall.  Important lanes have been turned into bicycle lanes.  For example Comox Street now has no parking spot (pretty bad given that it is adjacent to the City's main hospital).  Each day maybe 3 bicycles use that road.  What of there is a major emergency and we need 100 ambulances to park around the hospital?

title: Fun city
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a fun place to explore.  It's is easy to get from place to place. There are several shops and eateries.

title: Spacious downtown area in a beautiful city.
reviews: Despite my wife's hopes I did not spend nine hours on a flight to Vancouver just to visit shopping malls. But I have to concede the downtown area in this city that appears to have everything, is irresistible. Our short stay wasn't long enough to visit everything but we found Burrand Street, Robson Street and the Gaston area safe, attractive and full of eateries & shops. Traffic, for a city of this size, was less than busy and the driving was responsible, i.e. slow, and respectful of pedestrians. And the Sutton Place Hotel was off the scale for cleanliness, comfort, style & service. Brilliant!The Strudwicks of Worcester

title: Gorgeous City
reviews: Always love visiting Vancouver, lots to explore, diverse, fun, great restaurants, mountains, beaches, forest, everything in one place.

title: Good and easy to walk and See.
reviews: The stores are all over people walk and lots of good architecture. Enjoyed just strolling the streets. Robson is a great street to walk down to see a lot.

title: Gotta love Van
reviews: If you like cities, you'll love Vancouver.  You have to get used to the driving a little.  But it's a great cosmopolitan city for food, culture, and fun. Take the kids to the science museum.  Ride the sky train out of the city and back.  Spend the whole day at Stanley Park!  Do the sea walk.  Shop Robson. Americans - find the hidden Costco (near Rogers Arena) and check out the cool stuff they have that we don't have on the Stars and Stripes side. (Amazing desserts, different packaged foods, and fries at their food court!). There's something in Van for everyone!

title: Walking downtown
reviews: We recently spent two days in downtown Vancouver before our Alaska cruise.As a point of reference,we are a 70+ year old couple who stayed at the Metropolitan  Hotel and decided to walk as much as we could.Vancouver is an emminently easy city to explore and we were able to visit the cruiseport,Gastown,Chinatown,and back to the city center mall.Later we went to Robson street and dined at a ramen restaurant and later at the cafe Breka for Coffee and apple dumplings.Not bad for two old geezers.I guess what we are saying is Vancouver is extremely walkable and fun to sample.Can't wait to do it all again!

title: been cleaned up a bit...
reviews: Downtown used to be a bustling night event, full of topless bars open to everyone, legal prostitution, and street teens accosting you for $5 bills or cigarettes.It has since been cleaned up and seems to have lost its vibrancy in exchange for a more wholesome feel albeit dead as a morgue.  I guess it's more of a daytime trip now, and if that's your scene, then go for it.  I'll be elsewhere in the city hitting some of the finest dining on the west coast of North America

title: A lovely city
reviews: Vancouver is truly an 'emerald city' with the glass buildings and a backdrop of dramatic mountains. The downtown is gentile, very pedestrian and stylish.

title: Exciting downtown area!
reviews: There are some fantastic stores and food places downtown! We love that the water area is just a short walk away!

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: We spent 5 days in Vancouver.  We stayed at the Executive Vintage Hotel, located in downtown Vancouver, which is in a location close to everything (easy walking distance to most in the downtown area). Enjoyed most of downtown, but was disappointed  in China Town and Gasworks neighborhood.  It seems like China Town has moved to Richmond, just south of Vancouver.  We enjoyed Richmond and some good Chinese food there.  Also visited Steveston south of Vancouver on the water.

title: Walking
reviews: We loved walking downtown Vancouver.  There are enough sites to see, shops and restaurants to visit, that you'll never lack for something to do!  Everyone we encountered was friendly and polite!

title: Beautiful City - Great To Experience - Plenty To See & Do
reviews: We spent 6 days of our BC Road Trip in Downtown Vancouver and found it to be truly amazing. The area is home to many different neighbourhoods including Gastown, Yaletown and Chinatown all of which offer very different vibes and things to see.So a comparison... Having visited plenty of other major cities including New York, Paris, London - Downtown Vancouver really is unique in its own way. It isn't a 24 hour city like New York is but it does have Stanley Park, as intriguing as Central Park but on a bigger scale. The city centre is similar to London wherein you can walk 500ft and see something you weren't expecting, except Downtown Vancouver is much cleaner and the people are quite a bit friendlier.There are plenty of great little places to grab food, see things you wouldn't elsewhere and buy souvenirs unique to BC.We used Harbour Air Seaplanes to get a birds eye view of Downtown and the surrounding area and couldn't have been happier that we did. This amazing city just seems to keep getting better.

title: Lacks the appeal of bigger cities
reviews: In transit for a day so didn't have a lot of time to explore the best of the city - wandered around downtown for a while and didn't have the appeal of say a New York or San Francisco. Easy to get around , distances are not great so walking around is easy although the train system also makes it easy.

title: Beautiful City, easy to navigate
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is extremely accessible for everybody. The city is on a grid system and once you locate the main streets (i.e. Granville St) you are able to navigate without getting lost. There is plenty to see, the Library, art galleries, etc. Areas are also zoned out, i.e. China Town, the West End, Kitsilano, Yaletown, Gastown, etc. All have interesting sculptures and things to see in them. Vancouver is the city that keeps on giving, each day we found something else to look at.

title: Shopping!
reviews: Waste away the day walking around town, underground shopping, food... if you get lost just look for the mountains and head in that direction.  You can easily find things to do at Canada Place too

title: A lot of wanderers on the street
reviews: People from HK feel Canada is a good place for retirement life. But after my visit to Vancouver, I wouldn't agree to it. Many wanderers on the street. They slept by the roadsides all through the day. Full of the strange smell, I am not sure whether it came from the weeds. I felt a bit scared when I travel alone.

title: Centralized location for walking and exploring!
reviews: Great walking locations for dining, shopping, and attractions!There's also a Hop On Hop Off Trolley that helps to see more and visit places.

title: Many changes good and bad
reviews: The city is growing at a fast pace.While there are many new condos springing up, the amount of homeless people and panhandlers visible is awful. There is a lot to do and see, so pick your areas of interest and enjoy them. Walking around is always the best way to see anything and the city has many interesting places to walk to. Enjoy.

title: A great place to walk around
reviews: Down town Vancouver has so much going on , shops, restaurants, street entertainers. It's simply a great city to put on comfy shoes and walk around to discover a variety of treasures .

title: Great place to walk
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a great place to take a walk, although some streets have steep hills. Lots of high end stores, great places to eat, and plenty of nice cars to see. The trees are beautifully lit up at night.

title: Fun town
reviews: This was a girls trip to celebrate a retirement. The city was full of fun and interesting things to do. The people were so nice and welcoming. It was pretty easy to get around town. We didn't  mind walking a bit but there was plenty of transportation available. There were lots of restaurants to choose from to make any palate happy. I recommend signing up for a tour to orient yourself and then decide what you might want to explore more throughly.

title: Sad
reviews: People seem to love Vancouver, and it does have some redeeming features but the downtown is on the whole a depressing place. You can't walk with your family down the main shopping street at 10am without being confronted by addicts, people just smoking pot, homeless etc. All major cities have these elements in contained parts, but in Vancouver you just can't escape it no matter what neighbourhood you're in. Stanley Park is obviously impressive but it seems that all the open space was taken and put in one location rather than distributed across the city, leaving very little relief from the urban areas. I liked Yaletown best with great restaurants. Gastown was good as well, with trendy shops and restaurants but is darker and rougher. The main downtown is absent of historic buildings or nice contemporary ones. The overall retail offering is very poor. All in all I felt there was little going for Vancouver downtown other than its walkability and ease of getting around.

title: unquie area
reviews: Beautiful waterfront. Lot of nice restaurant and unique shops around the Yale down and Gas town. But there is also some scenes that is not so nice, I see people sleeping on the ground and some asked for money.

title: Sunny and friendly
reviews: Beautiful spring day with plenty of flowers everywhere. A walking city but you could rent a bike in several locations. Lots of shopping and restaurants . View of harbour is great from Canada place. But be aware of drug addicted people in back alleys and near gas town. Went there during the day. Not sure if I would want to be there at night.

title: Walk, eat, shop...repeat
reviews: This area has a wide variety of shops, restaurants and entertainment. We went during the day but saw a lot of nightlife potential. You can spend easily two hours just walking around so carve out more time if you're an avid shopper!

title: Vancouver (Gas Town)
reviews: Short weekend getaway in mid April1. Stayed at an Airbnb - Gastown part of Vancouver.   Low price and very accommodating.2. YVR airport to downtown Vancouver.  Buy a compass card at the transit machine.  You can't miss it, right before boarding the train.  Runs pretty frequently as we arrived around 10pm. Map it out ahead of time so you know when to get off.3. Gastown - I would compare it to part of a city. i.e. (Old city Philadelphia,  Lower East Side NYC.).Morning- has a tourist/local mix atmosphere.  Family and mix of age groups.  Evening- more young adults out and about heading to bars/restaurants. Lots of homeless people around and more noticeable because of less foot traffic compared to the busier cities mentioned above.Great eatery spots - definitely yelp the area.  Lots of great spots. 4. Public transportation - the compass card is great and handy to use on bus or train.  Definitely load it up if you plan to travel around the city often in a day. The bus comes very frequently as well and gets you to any spot you need to go.  Didn't rent a car but driving looks easy too.5. Sightseeing - we picked the most obvious spots. Stanley Park,  Capilano suspension bridge, VanDusen Botanical Garden and Granville Island Market.  All spots were worth the trip.Stanley Park - do the bike ride around the park.Capilano bridge - great views but try to go in the morning to avoid crowds.Granville Market - like a Reading terminal in Philadelphia or Chelsea markets in NyC. Still great choices of food stalls.

title: Great City with amazing views and easy to explore
reviews: We stayed in downtown Vancouver for 3 days during Spring break.  It is a beautiful city with great restaurants, amazing views and wonderful parks and attractions. You are a 10 minute cab ride from most attractions.  People were extremely friendly.  Being from Miami, we live in our cars to get around.  Vancouver is definitely a walking city.  We walked everywhere and always felt safe.  We had a fabulous time exploring the city.  Highly recommend for families since their are so many outdoor activities which the kids will love.  My 12 year old daughter really enjoyed all of the parks.

title: So metropolitan downtown
reviews: The downtown is amazing, a lot of restaurants and stores, mall and train station, many entertainment and parades! Every weekend they have amazing events!!

title: Love Downtown Vancouver!!!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is one of the most beautiful places to visit. So clean and well planned.  Love walking along the seawall and the dedicated paths for walkers and cyclists. The waterfront is amazing, we never get tired of the views-beautiful water, spectacular mountains, amazing Stanley Park, Coal Harbour. And when the sun shines, it's outstanding!

title: Nice
reviews: I am not big fan of city centers with sky scrapers, but I must say that Vancouver architecture is nice.You can walk around all over the place to use the public transport with the Compass Day Pass.If you like people and shops, visit Yaletown and Robson Street, but also push a bit further and go to Commercial Drive.Stop by the tourism center by the Waterfont as they have many useful information.

title: On Spring Break Adventure
reviews: Overall interesting city architecturally but sadly very dirty and large homeless population.  Enjoyed the waterfront and maybe if we had to time to explore more than just a few hours we would have found our experience different.  Just too many rude and uncooperative service folks

title: Lots to Do
reviews: Downtown is beautiful with a lot of dining choices as well as shopping that ranges from touristy spots to high end designer stores.  Yaletown and Gastown are fun spots.   Chinatown isn't really worth the time.

title: The Emerald City
reviews: Vancouver is the jewel of the West. I believe Vancouver is one of the top five cities in the world.The first thing you notice is her stunning beauty.The city looms large with a background surround by mountains and sea.If you are a foodie, a shopper or love nature, it has it all.You are close to world class skiing in Whistler and only minutes from Stunning North and West Vancouver.Spend a week and enjoy all this city has to offer.I would suggest going from May to September to really enjoy the outdoors. Vancouver has one draw back, rain for six months but in the spring to fall she shines.

title: Worrying place
reviews: My son and I were on a Canada trip and have been staying in cheaper hostels. The one we stayed was in this part of town. I have never seen so many drug deals and ice smashed people in a city. There are homeless everywhere and people begging for money. Unless you can handle being a little uneasy around these people don't stay in east Vancouver or gastown.

title: Had it to my own
reviews: It was in December last year and although it was pouring and cold, seeing the city and getting the chance to cool off was good enough. What impressed me the most is the concept of vancouverism and the urban design. Definitely a nice city to call home although prices are soaring. Lovely city and glad to make the trip.

title: Nice place
reviews: Nice place to visit. You should go to the downtown because it makes part of your experience like vancouverite. Sometimes you can see antique buildings that shows how was the architecture in the past. We have a lake, beach and mountains at the background.  However, the downtown not differs to much of the most of cities around the world. See by yourself and take your conclusions.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Everything is close and lots of variety with shops restaurants and activities.  Always a pleasure, only issue is the prevalence of panhandlers.  Not a place I would have my daughter go out alone at night

title: From business to pleasure, what not to like about DT Vancouver?
reviews: Despite being relatively 'new' compared to other major Canadian cities, DT Vancouver is unique, has a laid back west coast vibrancy, offers tons of shopping and food offers, and has a boom of condos in the past 10 years. It might be a bit 'dry', but plenty of rain to balance it back. Soon will be a DT without a single gas station, and that is a good think: bike lanes are everywhere!!

title: Unique atmosphere
reviews: The uniqueness of Vancouver's nature is surrounding you when you walk downtown. You can find the combination of city-water-mountain in many places in the world but it is nothing like Vancouver Downtown. It feels like something is hidden under the area :/

title: Loved it!!
reviews: As small town people, this city would definitely one we could live in.The shops, atmosphere, people and attractions were awesome!

title: The skyline is best viewed from afar
reviews: If you go to Granville Island you can appreciate the view. The water taxis and bridge make it special to view the Downtown area.

title: Everywhere things change
reviews: Energy everywhere. Even when it's cold a drizzly. Lots to see and do but I love walking the harbour best

title: It's been a while since I last visited but still has everything
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has changed a little bit but mostly it's the same. I see a lot more traffic these days and some car sharing services. Shopping is very convenient because they have everything here.

title: Stunning
reviews: The view of the mountains behind the city of Vancouver is breathtaking.  A bratiful city with lots to keep you entertained.  A walk along the seawall at Stanley Park is a must-do.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: This city has so much to offer, beauty in every detail.  Fantastic experience, so modern as well as historical. Fantastic blend of poverty and wealth. Extremely high taxes.

title: Downtown itself is Okay
reviews: The oceanside walk and attractions are well worth the effort. Downtown itself was very congested with very little to do.

title: Great sights
reviews: I had fun walking and driving around downtown.  However, the traffic and construction made the drive all to long.

title: Nice but be cautious
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is really pretty surrounded by water and commercial hi rises. It is also easily accessible by sky train from the airport. However, Vancouver downtown is more like an American city rather than Canadian whereby there are areas that are considered dangerous. Do your homework online and don't just rely on travel guides as most will not explicitly say where the bad areas are. Take Chinatown for example which is walking distance to downtown. Travel guides will highlight the restaurants, culture, etc. but will hardly mention that it is one street parallel to The downtown east side, considered to be the crack capital of Canada. It is a city of contrasts.

title: Shops, shops and more shops
reviews: The shopping was absolutely fantastic. So many different shops to see and visit. There are also many pubs and resturants and activities to do. A hive of activity.

title: It reminds me of San Francisco, but more beautiful!
reviews: We really enjoyed our visit here.  This city has so much to offer from great restaurants to gardens to museums to entertainment venues.  We had a wonderful vacation here!

title: Great for both kids and adults
reviews: Excellent place to visit when going to Vancouver.  My wife and I went with our two kids 14 and 12, and we all had a great time.  Learned a lot about the nature of the BC area.

title: Nice town
reviews: Nice town, nice views when it's not raining, good for shoppers I guess, but also for just have a look around.

title: Nice town, harder with kids
reviews: Vancouver is a nice town that is rather easy to navigate if you know a few major landmarks and have a sense of direction.  Pay to park app makes parking easier also, and with free WiFi in most Starbucks, Blendz, Tim Horton's we were able to use the app even though we didn't have an international phone plan.  We did consistently have challenges finding good restaurants that were not franchises that we could bring our kids into.

title: Shopping galore
reviews: Loved this area for its vast selection of fine dining, cocktail spots and shopping.  From this area, it's walking distance to the main fun spots - Gastown, Yaletown, West End.

title: Let's go boots!
reviews: As the song says 'these boots were made for walking' and that's exactly what you can do in downtown Vancouver.  Great downtown core that rightly focuses on the beautiful seawall and harbor-front.  The area is excellent for conference travel, with a range of excellent food, drink and activities all within easy reach.  I haven't even needed to mention the cool sea planes and mountainous back drop! Tremendous!

title: Very walkable
reviews: The downtown area is a really interesting place - it has a lot going on and there are so many things you can walk to! I highly recommend just taking a stroll and enjoying what this city has to offer.

title: Good to explore but watch the rain
reviews: seems like always riansd in Vancouver so exploring the city a umbrella is a must.very little shelter on the streets but still worth walking the streets and in particular the riverfront area near Canada Place

title: Nice Downtown
reviews: Loved it and was really nice. People are really nice and city has everything you need to have fun and enjoy your stay in the city.

title: Beautiful on a sunny day
reviews: Most of the days we visited were chilly and rainy but still able to grab an umbrella and walk most any place you want to go. We felt safe on every street and in every neighborhood. Parking and one-way streets are a challenge so plan to walk or take other transportation. Most tourist attractions are museums, scenic, hiking etc. Our last day was beautiful and sunny at which time we could see why they call it the city of glass

title: Shopping, food and more
reviews: I love visiting downtown Vancouver especially on a dry day when you can really put the miles on.  If you are a foodie you will not be disappointed with the quality and quantity of pubs, restaurants, cafes, gastropubs, food trucks and more.  If you love to shop any budget will find something in the numerous shops and stores.  Want to just sit and take it in for a bit the people watching is great and you may even have the opportunity to be entertained by a street busker or two.  If museums and galleries are more your thing you will the. As well downtown. Take a walk. The sea wall and watch the ships or make your way to Gastown all easily accessible by foot or rent a bike!  Vibrant and alive is how you might describe downtown Vancouver.  I put on six hours one day all on foot and felt safe the entire time, great atmosphere.

title: So much to do!
reviews: You can walk everywhere! The have public transportation. They offer a thing called a hop on hop off bus. Which I love because it is small and I doesn't drag you all around the city to get where you need to go. We love Davies St, there are rainbows everywhere (LGBT). They're big on pride and self love! The city offers 3 mall's, countless hotel, amd wonderful eateries. I miss this place already.

title: Great shopping, Great restaurants, Beach close by and sea bus to north van.
reviews: So its easy to get around from the Canada line, the beach see Davie Street, Georgia and the hotels, my favorite Robson street, a little hard getting parking however you can walk all around downtown..from Canada Place to Burrard Bridge and from Stanley park to china town, gas town . See the Vancouver Gallery, Pacific Mall, shop at London Drugs, Everyone is helpful and you really can't get lost. Kids everywhere and there's rain so take an umbrella but wen the sun shines you"ll love it.

title: In town for convention
reviews: We were in town for a convention. Really enjoyed how easy it was to wander around, find stores, restaurants, currency exchange. Really pretty easy to get whatever you want.

title: Areal Mix of styles and cultures
reviews: If you are looking for architectural wonders then  this is not the place. There are many differing styles one can observe from classic British Colonial style to modern glass skyscrapers. There is a bustle and there are numerous little cafes and niche shops selling all sorts of stuff. Transport is abundant and reasonable and a visit to any place is easy with a transport app. Obviously one has to look at the Steam Clock which is pretty unique, and maybe for those inclined a helicopter flip over the city is an option (this from next to the Sea Bus Port)

title: Spring is in the air
reviews: For all the healthy minded people, spring is in the air and lots to do. The prices are not too high and load of attractions that cost almost nothing.Easy to walk to Stanley Park from downtown , many theaters with top quality entertainment. Seawall with excellent jogging paths.

title: Downtown is where you should stay
reviews: In the city, if you stay at downtown that's the happening place. Enjoy walking around its so lively, full of shops, architects, restaurants.

title: My favourite city
reviews: I love this city and I would recommend it to any person visiting.  Where in the world can you golf in the morning and go skiing at night or during the summer where you can spend the day at the beach and then next day go glacier skiing.  I have lived here for most of my life, and not once have I left it in the summer because why would I go anywhere when the world comes to my hometown for their vacations.

title: Great City!
reviews: Great city which is walking friendly.  Plenty of good restaurants, shopping, pubs, parks and sights.  Don't miss Granville Island.

title: Very walkable
reviews: I love Vancouver downtown!  Very clean and walkable as well as safe.  So many things to see and do.  Shopping, museums, art galleries.  You name it.

title: Nice walk in this beautiful and lively city!!
reviews: We were lucky enough to enjoy a nice partial sunny day after many of rain in Vancouver. The city is clean, looks very new and harmonic, with all the buildings matching, and it is full of shops and restaurants. The views from Coal Harbour were gorgeous! We felt safe all the time. We will visit Vancouver again in a few weeks to see more of the city and its surroundings!

title: Clean it up
reviews: Festering crackheads everywhere. Dirty. Petty crime. Used needles everywhere. Cops do nothing about it.

title: World Class City
reviews: Vancouver's urban planners get global attention for buildings and the innovation of mixed usage zoning. Here people work, dwell and play. Although there should be more, there are parks and mini-parks that break up the high rise  cliffs. Upscale shopping tends to be on Robson and Alberni Streets between Burarrd and Bute. The Vancouver Art Gallery is surrounded by coffee shops; also take in the Pendulum Gallery (a good place to pause and eat); a few blocks away is the Contemporary Art Gallery, and nearby some fun places to eat or just a sit-down in Emery Barnes Park. Daytime, everywhere is safe in downtown Vancouver, although there are panhandlers along Granville Mall between Davie and Robson. Evening, like in all urban centres, is a time to take just a bit more care, but generally Vancouver downtown is a pretty thriving downtown, relatively safe.

title: Good for shopping
reviews: Not much around downtown in terms of great sightseeing. Lots of shops and restaurants and a couple of malls.

title: Something for everyone
reviews: We walked most of the day & took local buses & are 3 types of food in 1 day. Some work class restaurants, float tanks, lots of yoga. The shopping was amazing with lots of choices also. One of our favourite cites to visit. On Sunday in one area lots of local vendors selling their goods also. Great experience

title: Good shopping and restaurants
reviews: We stayed on Robson Street, which was very central to a lot of attractions. Stanley park, Canada place,Gastown. Lots of designer shops and spoilt for choice on where to eat out. Amazing

title: Explore on foot - you will be well rewarded.
reviews: Vancouver is such an easy city to explore on foot. In doing so there is a surprise round every corner, be it amazing buildings, nice restaurants, scenic views or local history. Make the most of your stay and enjoy the exercise - you will be well rewarded.

title: Father with 11 years old son
reviews: Taking opportunity of school break we decided to visit VCR and stayed mostly in center with some escape to Kitsilano and Burnaby. We liked VCR very much, good air, very nice people, polite, careful (we live in Shanghai) good public transportation network, good restaurants. It is not by coincidence that VCR is on top for life quality in the world. Unfortunately the weather was not so good, so we will have to come back and enjoy bicycle riding.

title: Scenic, Romantic
reviews: Came back for an annual romantic weekend with hubby. Vancouver is a beautiful city, the perfect setting for a romantic escape.  The walks along the river are peaceful and serene. Grab a cup of coffee, sit, and watch the wildlife,  the sea planes, the ferrys. Just beautiful.  If you can, stay at the Fairmont Pacific Rim and enjoy the rooftop spa, with spectacular views. Also take a walk to the eclectic Gastown area. Stanley Park is within walking distance,  and this is a gorgeous place for an athletic run, heart-to-heart talk, or romantic picnic (weather permitting ).

title: Beautiful city
reviews: We had very little trouble finding taxis in downtown Vancouver and the area was really beautiful.  Nice restaurants and interesting shops all around.

title: What a wonderful city
reviews: This was my second time in downtown Vancouver, and I must say that I wish I had spent more time here while growing up.Vancouver really is a wonderful place, and downtown is easily the best in the country.There's something to do everywhere, good vibes, good food, super clean, I love it.This visit was winter, and vancouver is so mild we were still just walking everywhere. Only caveat, no Uber yet! I read it's on the way though, so kudos!

title: Stuning
reviews: Vancouver is such a clean and interesting city... Downtown is surrender by beautiful buildings, great stores and many attractions like gastown, canada place and others.

title: Downtown Adventure!
reviews: We feel that this is a great place for an adventure, maybe shopping or dining! We went for a Canuck hockey game, taking the Evergreen skytrain system.

title: Glowball Restaurant
reviews: Four mature ladies went for lunch on a Friday with a reservation..Very busy, happy buzz..Very welcoming staff we were seated at once. Beautiful decor in a large two floor restaurant.Very interesting menu..lots of choice..hard to decide.Our server was very gracious and attentive, There were a party of young men at the next table ,all enjoying Burgers and beer.( a lunch special that day) Good choice.We alldecided on a burger,2 salmon,2 beef, generous and delicious on a house made brioche type bun. The fries were crisp and savoury, we all agreed they were very,very tasty. I had a dark ale but the other ladies chose a cranberry substitute. I cannot say enough good things about our server.She was so pleasant and accommodating .It was a lovely, leisurely lunch.We all agreed to return and explore the menu further!

title: Big city, lots to do!
reviews: Recently spent a few days here Stayed at a hotel downtown, ate at 3 places downtown, shopped downtown and walked around downtown. Pretty clean, lots to see, eat and do. Quite a few pan handlers in certain areas, more so than other big cities I have been too but they were not too aggresive. Vancouver is a great place with plenty for everyone!

title: Great way to spend the day
reviews: If you are visiting Vancouver, try to get a hotel downtown as there is so much to see and do.   If you are into shopping, you can go to Robson Street. There are great restaurants on almost every block.  On the north end, you can go the convention center area and walk to Stanley Park. On the south end, you can walk over Granville Bridge to Granville island, or take the tiny sea bus across.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city and downtown has so many attractions, restaurants and shops that you can never be bored. The harbour views and North Shore mountains are a perfect backdrop

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: First thing I did when I landed in our hotel was to take a walk to downtown and explore it on foot. Walk through the city center and on to the waterfront and then along Stanley Park. Loves the views from the waterfront.

title: Great views
reviews: I only had a day in Vancouver but instantly liked the city and enjoyed wandering round the downtown area and along the north short enjoying the views to the mountains across the water. There's also a variety of restaurants to choose from to enjoy the scenery.

title: Mixed
reviews: The downtown itself is very clean. However, what the downtown also has is a ramp at population of homeless, Who are in need of addiction and mental health treatment. There are many wonderful things to see and do in downtown, but I'm not sure I want to walk around by myself at night.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Lovely place to roam around and enjoy the beat and culture of the city. Waterfront is amazing. Great place to shop and eat.

title: A cosmopolitan Mecca calling to you
reviews: Vancouver has been a second home to me. With many relatives living here and friends enjoying The Left Coast and all it has to offer, there is little bad things I can say about this city. Perhaps dirty at time but always alive and active and always welcoming.

title: Charming neighborhoods with spectacular mountain views
reviews: Im a big fan of San Francisco and New York. This city falls somewhere in between that for me. Great food, cool neighborhoods, incredible views around every corner... what's not to love?

title: Friendly, clean,good dining. Easy commuting.
reviews: Beautiful city, Stanley Park a must, plus Flyover. Visit Vancouver Island especially Butchard Gardens. Good skiing in winter in the mountains.

title: Nice seafront
reviews: Place is good ends at seafront amazing view of harbour centre. Nice place to roam around plenty shopping and food option available.

title: Lots to see and do!
reviews: Love downtown Vancouver!  There's so much to see and do and all walkable!  The parking is very expensive so try and avoid taking a car.  Great restaurants and little bars, galleries etc...

title: Stunning
reviews: Super views at night from top of tower and a very pleasant and interesting area.  Lots to do ...we had too little time to do it but well worth a visit.

title: City centre
reviews: The city centre has one main street of 'good shops' and a small shopping centre and once you veer off you soon start to see lots of homeless people in doorways and on benches and notice the strange smell of 'weed'. The harbour area is very different to the city centre.  My opinion for me, is that I would find it hard to find something to do after 2 days here.

title: Nice Downtown
reviews: Lots of shops, not as many homeless people as I expected (could partly have been the snow weather), lots of places to choose to shop and eat

title: My Favourite City
reviews: I have travelled to many city in world, Vancouver is my favourite city by far. It's clean, friendly, safe, beautiful, close to the mountains and has a variety of shopping, food and entertainment.

title: Perfect for bike ride/walk/run
reviews: Nice waterfront route all the way around StanleyPark.  It can get really busy so be alert.  Eating areas easily accessible throughout

title: Beauty Is In Vancouver
reviews: I had a privilege of visiting this city baking in 2008. Downtown  Vancouver is beautiful,  lots of mountain view, water, and surrounded  by lots of nice restaurants. The space and  things to do are limitless. You can board a monoplane to go see Victoria, you can bard a ferry to go visit North Vancouver  and get a view of Vancouver. There is Stanley  Park, Olympic torch.

title: Beautiful city!!
reviews: The waterfront is great, walking distance to all one might need in a city. Restaurants, attractions and shopping.

title: Organised , clean and nice ...
reviews: The downtown is organised , clean and nice place ...You can find different attractions very easily... It was really  clean place ...

title: beautiful skyline
reviews: The high-rises are beautiful, the surrounding mountains and water views are awesome.  Stanley Park is so close.  Shopping and restaurants are very good.  It's a very happy experience.

title: Breath taking
reviews: The scenery of downtown Vancouver is breathtaking!  You see ocean and mountain at the same time .  Bridges connecting the islands make the whole city seem intertwined together in a close knit.

title: Enjoyable & Informative!
reviews: We only had one day to visit this lovely city & as we usually use bus tours to help orientate ourselves around cities so we chose the HoponHopoff bus company. Very friendly drivers & staff specially driver Keenan who drove us most of the route & was most friendly & informative with heaps of knowledge!  The bus was warm enough & could hear Keenan quite clearly.We decided to stop off & look around Granville Island which gave us a chance to stretch our legs & use the little ferry to the island which houses the public market of fresh produce, eateries & craft stalls. Just a reminder that the service operates at 45min intervals so try & adjust your stop off visits to coincide with the bus arrival at each stop! Well worth a tour!

title: Quick Vancouver getaway!
reviews: We stayed downtown and with its many restaurants and buildings you can stay there for quite awhile.  It is quick to access gastown or yale town by foot.

title: Great Downtown Core
reviews: Vancouver has a great downtown core, with good shopping and restaurants along Robson Street.  Great on a sunny day.

title: great shopping
reviews: downtown vancouver has a beautiful architecture. shopping is great.lots of restaurants. parking is bad just like any other major city. its close to a lot of beautiful nature. night life is also great.

title: Great shopping
reviews: Lots of stores to pick from at all price ranges. Tons of restaurants and coffee shops. Great weather too

title: It's beautiful
reviews: For the most part, the area is clean. It's main draw, for me, was the big city with the water and mountains in the background. It's also so close to fun attractions like Stanley Park which make the downtown area a great place to eat after a long day at the park.

title: Vancouver Love
reviews: Vancouver downtown has a lot to offer and really close to a beautiful nature escape and Whistler, B.C.

title: Anniversary weekend
reviews: Lots of great shopping and restaurants within walking distance. No need to rent a car unless you are thinking of venturing out far. Most places are Handicap accessible. Locals are very friendly. No need to convert currency if you use a credit card. All merchants, taxis, hotel, etc that we ran into accepted credit. Hotel can arrange any tours, transportation free or paid, taxis etc.

title: The city
reviews: Although very short time spent on VA downtown, I really enjoyed the night scene and beautiful water landscapes.

title: Super City.
reviews: Our family is very biased towards the city of Vancouver. We come often from Seattle to get a good city hit. Spectacular backdrop scenery at the mountains and plenty of water views.Fun neighborhoods like Yaletown and Gastown, both of which are reasonable walking if your hotel is downtown. The downtown Vancouver Art Museum is a well curated and worth the visit.One cannot say enough about Stanley Park. Waterfront shorelines, hiking trails, beaches and play area for the family to hang out in as the kids enjoyed themselves. Take your kites too.  Vancouver is absolutely a terrific hospitality city.Wonderful dining experiences and we always have the best Chinese food in Richmond. Look for my reviews for Shanghai River in Richmond. Richmond is nicknamed little Hong Kong for a very good reason.

title: Pretty City but less than average Shopping
reviews: Being surrounded by crystal clear water in every direction, and enormous mountains in the background, Vancouver is a very pretty city.  The city is modern, clean and the streets are wide.  the airport is less than a 30 min drive from downtown, making it very convenient to get to and from.  Lots of marinas and a great skyline.  But as far as shopping is concerned, it really is a let down considering it's one of the major cities in Canada.  And everything seems to close early - the Pacific Center shopping mall closed at 7pm on Saturday which I wasn't expecting.  It's a beautiful city, so come for the scenery, but don't plan on a shopping expedition.

title: Very Nice but just a block or two from the worste BUM Area ive EVER seen . A product or socialist local government
reviews: A MUST see. Avery NICE ,although EXPENSIVE city . Adequate parking ,great eats,lots of taverns.nice Crows every where!! (I like watching Crows) Gorgeous buildings ,Great sea port,Sea planes land Right Down Town!!

title: We are Not in Kansas Toto
reviews: There is no other city quite like it. Vancouver is 120 years young bright beautiful and full of the tremendous energy of youthfulness that promises that this city shall reign supreme over the globe as one of the lovliest places on the planet. Something for every taste. With an area  population of about 2 million we last year hosted 22 million visitors. Bet you could hardly find a single bad comment among their reviews. As an added bonus visitors can park free on our streets as the city has no way if following up on parking tickets issued to out of province vehicles. Enjoy anytime of year with night skiing on the 3 mountains overlooking the city during the winter. Dirt bikers come from every corner of the globe in summer.

title: Easy to get around
reviews: I stayed on Robson and enjoyed the ease of walking to and around downtown. Buses are dependable but I did not use the buses this trip.The best shops for a wide range of prices, plus conveniently located and variety of foods.

title: Vancouver
reviews: Fantastic! Great city, much space, quiteness, nature. Kind people. Nice tours. I was there with my girlfriend in june and july 2015 while we were traveling trough the western part of Canada by car for 17 days. We have seen so many beautiful places, best holiday ever!

title: Friendly & clean
reviews: Lovely city, friendly people clean and welcoming. Stayed for 5 days, either end of a Whistler ski trip. It really felt like home, and could seriously see how we could live there (currently enjoying our life in rural England). I would recommend this place to anyone.The only But - is that it's generally quite pricey for everything. We stayed in the Lister and Sheraton was centre.

title: Love at First Visit
reviews: Being my first time to visit Vancouver, I fell in love with the city. It is nice, modern, clean, not as congested as San Francisco and other cities. Not many homeless people... maybe because it's winter? I did not notice them if there were any. It is a nice walking city. My husband and I walked in the evenings to restaurants and movie but the city did not give us any vibe of danger. You still of course have to keep your guards up and be street smart but it's just not as scary as many parts of San Francisco. I stayed on Robson Street and it's so great with so many restaurants to choose from. It's vibrant with many people walking around late in the evening. There are lots of cafes and even a 2 hour bakery (Breka) with lots of delicious desserts. The city skyline is beautiful. And there's so much to do. The Canadians are very polite and friendly. I will definitely visit again.

title: Beautiful, walkable
reviews: We only stayed one night but had a great time walking around. There are plenty of restaurants and the waterfront is well worth a visit.

title: Friendly city
reviews: You can walk all over and always find something to sea, eat or buy! It is an area not to be missed, with many atractions from outdoors to shopping centres

title: Cyclists: YAY! Motorists: Go Home!
reviews: Hope you're on two feet or two wheels because that's about the easiest way to get around the downtown core anymore.

title: To see
reviews: You have to do it if you go in Vancouver. Big buildings, interesting neighbourhoods and good restaurants! You can do almost of the Downtown by foot, if you love walking or it is well deserved by bus and skyline.

title: Great mix of both city and nature.
reviews: The views of Vancouver Bay were amazing and worth the location.   Stanley Park and walking areas along the bay are beautiful. Be prepared to be in a big city with all of the amenities (restaurants, some shopping, and public transportation) but also big city issues (some panhandling and crowds).

title: Great spot to explore
reviews: Explored downtown with the family, felt safe to walk around and enjoy the shops. We went to Fly Over Canada which was an awesome experience for all the family!

title: Great place
reviews: Friendly people, beautiful city, amazing waterfront, I recomend you rent a bike cause the trafic is horible

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Very friendly people city feels very safe and welcoming great walking city full of resturants shops and attractions

title: One of the most beautiful and friendly cities in the world!
reviews: We spent two days in YVR after a week of skiing in Whistler.  The City is gorgeous and the people are extremely friendly.  There a re a lot of activities and great shopping all over town.  The food is world-class.

title: Taste of vancouver
reviews: Movibg in downtown vancouver is nice with elwgant shops to see nice city if vancouver and  taste real Vancouver.

title: Enjoyable time in Vancouver downtown
