reviews: We enjoyed a day exploring Vancouver downtown and enjoyed the shopping, cafes and the atmosphere. The people from this area were all accomodating and friendly. Worth the time

title: Lots of neighborhoods
reviews: Our recent trip to Vancouver was so much fun exploring the many diverse neighborhoods.  We love to try different foods from many cultures and found a great variety here.  Even in Winter with the rain and snow we got along fine and loved the adventure.

title: BIGGEST DISAPPOINTMENT OF WHOLE HOLIDAY
reviews: The Downtown area and city center of Vancouver was just like any other big harbour-city, anywhere in the world.  One has to travel and stay some 15 km out of town to experience any kind of nature.  Watching the Vancouver City Skyline from afar was, however, quite something to see!!

title: Christmas 2016
reviews: Lots of fun stuff to do at Christmas-time from walking the streets for shopping to Canada Place and the Christmas Market

title: Such a sophisticated city
reviews: Loved the downtown experience. Beautiful stores offering everything you could want. The holiday lights made our night walk magical. We took the children ice skating at the rink near Nordstrom and they had such fun. The waterfront area was well lit and even though it was raining, it was worth seeing. Love Vancouver. It's a beautiful city.

title: Nice walking time
reviews: We spent the second day in Vancouver in the downtown where you can eat in very nice and delicious restaurants and do nice shopping!

title: Great place to wander and shop
reviews: Robson Street in particular is a really excellent place to wander, shop and eat.  Lots of brand name shops and local designers, interspersed with good coffee shops, bars and restaurants - a really worthwhile place to while away an afternoon in Vancouver.

title: Many shops
reviews: Most of the things to do are walking distance when downtown so don't bother using the train if you are staying there and have Internet access

title: Very beautiful, beaches nearby too
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful place to visit especially when the sun shines.  Mostly been rainy, even in summer sometimes.  Must better than Toronto as far as Canadian cities go.  Good dining, good shopping, good place to see various events too.  Enjoy walking around downtown on a beautiful sunny day.  Stopping in at Faubourg for a pastry or Starbucks for a Frapuccino whole enjoying the warmth outside.  Enjoying the rooftop at joe fortes in the summer too while eating fish and chips for lunch taking in the city skyline.  Visiting d'oro gelato after a walk English bay, to pick up a double scoop cup of gelato.  Going to le crocodile to enjoy excellent French cuisine on Burrard.  Shopping at pacific centre.

title: Modern & Hostorical All In One
reviews: It has a modern twist to it, but at the same time a lot of history on the old township. Lots of bars, cafes, restaraunts and souvenir shops. You may get hassled a little by the homeless people when dinning out, however they are harmless, if this is not for you simply sit inside rather than outside of venues. If your a real foodie and don't mind a drink or two, I would recommend doing a little progressive food tour of downtown this way you get to taste different cuisines from around the world, and meet some amazing people at the same time that enjoy what you do.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: I'm from Los Angeles and I visited Vancouver with my sister. Downtown Vancouver is beautiful. It was raining and it made it 1000x better. It's so clean and it feels so safe. I think I only saw 2 homeless people during my entire week there. Where I'm from, there's a homeless person on every street, it seems.I EVEN RAN INTO PRIME MINISTER TRUDEAU! WHAT ARE THE ODDS?! The only problem I faced was finding good food. Or a meal that would leave me satisfied. I was always hungry after every meal. I found a Five Guys on Robson Street and that was great. If you want good food, you should go to Granville Island, which is right next to downtown. Canada Place is nice. Robson Square is nice. The Capilano Suspension Bridge is only 15 minutes away. Grouse Mountain is only 30 minutes away. There's a mall in North Vancouver, it's just crossing Lion's Bridge.

title: 1 night stay. Came for the Christmas Market
reviews: My husband and I stayed in Vancouver for just 1 night as we were staying over in Seattle so could easily drive up to BC. The city is very clean and has good shopping and restaurants. We didn't find out until we were leaving, but Vancouver is known for its Indian food. Being British and from London, I know my Indian food well, so I'm sad I didn't get to try any! Sushi is also quite big in Vancouver.I would come back again for a longer stay. I'd recommend a 3 day stay max. Anything more than that and you might start to get a little bored. Plan in advance the places you want to go to, e.g. Stanley park, the flyover etc so that you can get it all done!

title: So much to do!!
reviews: Love this city. It has something for everyone. The shopping is great and especially during box week. So many great restaurants - and very easy toNavigate this city.

title: But , I like big cities , and big buildings, and people watching
reviews: Vancouver IS the worlds most beautiful city. Clean. Safe. Fun. Easy to walk around.  Lots of great places to eat. Lots of sights and sounds and views.  Take a city tour. Ride a bike. Walk Stanley park.  Do English Bay .

title: special city
reviews: Vancouver is special because of it's location,climate and surroundings. A high percentage of the population is Asian, and so most of the restaurants serve Asian food, many shops sell Asian stuff, and on the streets you see mostly Asians. It is obviously a melting pot, bus since it is the closest to Asia, it is the most Asian city in Canada. Vancouver ha nice gardens, a beautiful skyline, and an old town, the gas district. all this is relative, to us Europeans an old building is 500+ years old. Not so in Canada. Nonetheless Vancouver has a nice and peaceful vibe to it, and is a pleasant and relatively save city to visit. We used the mobi bikes, a new, cheap and fun way to get around, and also a great way to see a lot of the city.

title: Easy walkable city
reviews: Vancouver is a relatively flat easy to walk city. Lots of shops, eateries and food carts. Christmas time the streets are lit up with lovely displays. Downside to this city is the large homeless population, we never felt unsafe but the dirtiness and homelessness is everywhere.

title: Walkable City
reviews: Assuming you have stamina, Vancouver is a really walkable city -- and it's almost flat, which helps. Lots of food carts downtown, get art museum, shopping galore -- what's not to like.

title: Love downtown...but there is a big homeless/drug issue that is in your face
reviews: Make no mistake, Vancouver is a really nice city and easy to get around by foot with lots of nice bars and eateries. The big issue is the concentration of homeless and drug affected people you constantly encounter. Most are harmless in that other than begging there was no issue however a little scary when walking around with early teens in your family group.

title: Weekend getaway for Christmas lights and enchant
reviews: Vancouver never fails to be amazing. The city and people are top notch. Had reservation to attend the Enchant light maze over the Cambie street bridge. It was ok. More of a family with little ones to attend. Walked from the south end by BC Place to English bay along Davie street. Had fun looking at all the shops to destination lunch/ brunch. Ate at 3 Brits not impressed.

title: Small downtown but it's a great place to start your trip
reviews: Skytrain, Seasbus and buses will take you to anywhere you want to go. It's just a short trip to Stanley Park.And you can't beat the mountain and river views!

title: As always a busy and vibrantly active part of the country
reviews: Took the girls out for a drive on the Robson strip and the English bay drive from Stanley Park. A beautiful day with the sunshine out for all . Really enjoyed the shopping on the strip, lulu lemon, Aldo and Roots just to name a few. Had a great time and even the Starbucks was great on the strip. Good pre Christmas shopping Vancouver style

title: Beautiful Views
reviews: Beautiful views all around from downtown, up and down the harbour and mountains. Restaurants and cafes can be found here. Relax and take it all in.

title: It is great moved
reviews: The  Vancouver Christmas Market  had been moved  to a new location ,to Jack Pool Plaza , ,it is a great moved ! large area ,and more vendors ,and a panoramic view of the mountain and harbour ,very German cultural activities and entertainment  all around , and very easy accessed by sky train , Waterfront or Burrard stations , and the best rate for parking  is in  Pacific mall ,

title: A visit in time
reviews: There is so much to see and do the Steam clock, eateries, places of interest. There is something for everyone.

title: Relaxing
reviews: Caught the ferry across the harbour for a relaxing afternoon of wandering and sight seeing. Interesting shops and little Cafes. Great food and such a vibrant place to be. Just pick a spot and explore. Great time of year busy enough and also relaxing enough. Great walks if shops are not your thing. Just a great place to be.

title: LOTS to see and do
reviews: I love just walking around the downtown core! I generally pick an area to explore and then just wander around it...sometimes with my camera. Lots of neat things to see, good food stops (food trucks) and the views are always pleasing.

title: A memorable walk
reviews: A walk Downtown was a very good experience.Lot of good sights & views. The Burrard bridge would give you a nice view of the beach.Visited the Maritime museum and the Sunset beach.You will also find a few affordable snack/Drink shops in the town.

title: Beautiful Skyline
reviews: Downtown is not massive but it is still a pleasure to drive around in this city. It has some upscale fancy restaurant that offer variety of different cuisines around the world.

title: One of the best downtowns in North America
reviews: Many good restaurants, many great places to shop, and some good sites to see.  Some very unique buildings.  They keep the area pretty clean and safe.

title: Fun to just walk
reviews: Awesome to just walk around and see all levels of the city and having an adventure. Venturing into buildings is a must as there are so many indoor shopping attractions

title: Gas town
reviews: Very nice area this time of year.  All lit up and bustling.  Careful around the Hastings street area between here and China Town.  I walked through at night and it was a little sketchy.

title: A lovely walk down a busy but eclectic downtown!
reviews: Vancouver is not a massive metropolitan town that can be walked, especially the downtown in less than 30 minutes....getting lost along the Granville and Robson Streets with their wide array of shops was truly enjoyable!

title: A clean welcoming city
reviews: Vancouver is one of those cities where are you always feel safe and comfortable. The streets are kept clean the litter and the skyline is really quite something.The fact that Vancouver has ocean and mountains, forests makes it really quite unique.The city is very easy to get around in either by sky train or bus.Often voted as one of the best cities in the world, it's easy to see why.

title: a city for all to visit
reviews: Great city,great people easy to navigate and endless sites to visit. Enjoyed the Christmas market. We have plans to return this December. Loved waling downtown and shopping.

title: Downtown
reviews: Although the downtown itself is very beautiful in scenery, the types of buildings and the financial district, unfortunately, there seems to be a HUGE homeless population ranging from 18-35 years of age. They are all camped outside on the streets of downtown.

title: Great place!
reviews: Enjoy Vancouver, downtown area is perfect for shopping, looking at the views, go shopping, meeting friends!

title: Shopping with a darker side
reviews: Shopping along Robson St was great. Many varieties, from high end to everyday offerings.   While the traditional Black Friday super sale happens one month before Christmas, attracted huge crowds all over town. Some shops offer good discounts and certain brands do not offer any discount, yet attracting huge crowds, like the Canadian Goose down from Holt Renfrew. It's attracting large Asian following.However, all the glamour in Robson St is not reflected at Hastings St. Do not go there if you like glamour. Hastings St- the 'tent' city is a depressing site with tents, homeless and substance affected residents. It is the worst I have come across!! A very sad site in the city.

title: Beautiful Downtown full of character
reviews: Despite the homeless problem, the downtown core is very pretty and has lots of character. Plenty of shopping and something for everyone. I've been traveling to vancouver for years and the city is growing very fast. The city planners have done a very good job.

title: Interesting City!
reviews: This is a great city for shopping / dining or just come and see the sites & sounds! Lot's of different things to do, so we had a weekend in town at one of the local hotels. This allowed us to go with a day pass on sky train to take in the town, even had time to go on the seabus!

title: Couple get away
reviews: Vancouver has evolved into a great exciting and beautiful city. There is so much to see and do. Lots of different restaurants with tastes for everyone.You can be in the mountains in the morning and the beach in the afternoon.

title: Wonderful walking and biking city
reviews: Downtown Vancouver invites you to walk or bike to your destination whether it be Gastown, Stanley Park or a ferry ride to Granville Island.  If you're a foodie like I am, this amazing city offers an abundance of restaurants offering delicious cuisines from around the world.  Don't miss a stroll down Robson Street which has every shopping experience you can imagine.  If you get lost, there is always a kind Vancouverite to offer assistance to get you where you want to go.  I can't wait to go back!

title: Unforgettable Vancouver
reviews: We have never been to Canada before, didn't know what to expect. We had a unbelievable time here. Downtown Vancouver it's so fun! Easy to get pretty much anywhere around on foot or by train. We had a new adventure every day. Lots and lots of things to do around here. We will definitely be back again, can't wait! We love Vancouver!!!

title: Must visit
reviews: There are a lot of "neat" stores, shops and restaurants to wander through the Downtown! Great for a family tour when you visit Vancouver

title: City with a heart
reviews: Vancouver City is clean and modern yet retains an old world charm through classic buildings and obvious civic pride. Business and retail co-exist comfortably without the frenetic pace of its U.S. counterparts. Decorative buildings provide a feeling this is like a mini New York with a wonderful cultural mix from the many Nationalities living here. It seems around every corner is something interesting, not just another glass tower. Walking is easy and abundant coffee bars keep one refreshed.

title: Architecture, modern, friendly
reviews: Vancouver downtown is a beutiful area, you can find excellent and modern buildings, and another with more years, but their architecture is excellent, you can shop, walk, enjoy the look and eat different kind of foods.

title: ROBSON st.
reviews: Walked for hours around Robson St. and downtown!! had a blast, will be back, just with better shoes!!

title: A Memorable Place to Visit!
reviews: Vancouver's downtown is an eclectic blend of the typical urban downtown shopping plus ethnic attractions and cultural venues --- all underscored by a beautiful waterfront setting that includes mountain-top views. On a clear day it is gorgeous. The capper is really Stanley Park, a huge forested park that features seafront walks (called "The Sea Wall" as well as beaches, an enormous swimming pool, a lagoon full of swans and other bird life, a display of authentic totem poles, an aquarium, a zoo, plenty of refreshment stops and at least one lovely restaurant. I'd say Stanley Park is probably the world's largest urban park. Don't miss Vancouver's downtown for all it has to offer!

title: Cosmopolitan yet compact.
reviews: Great shopping district. Stores appear separated at street level but most stores are connected through an underground concourse mall and huge parking garage. You have high end stores like Canada's own Holts and Harry Rosen plus a new Nordstrom store. The Hudson Bay Company is a favorite department store. And all the many, many other stores you'd expect to see in a shopping center. At street level, the sidewalks are vibrant with visitors and locals alike. Even things like the magnificent library, theaters and sports stadiums are all within short walking distance from each other. A great downtown to enjoy.

title: Great Area to Live
reviews: As a downtown area of a major city, it's on the small side and doesn't really offer much in the way of variety. Shops and restaurants, and that's about it. But the condos are stunning...  if you live in one. Otherwise, as a tourist, you'll have to entertain yourself with a little shopping, dining, and the excellent views of the waterfront and mountains. Not at all bad, but an afternoon is plenty to discover downtown Vancouver.

title: Great to be a tourist in your own city!
reviews: Don't get "downtown" often but when I do I feel like a tourist. So much to see, so many places to have a pint and a good meal. Oh and the views ... SPECIAL!

title: Pretty pretty city...
reviews: Vancouver downtown is worth a walk around.  This is a very pretty city on the water with a backdrop of mountains.  When the sun shines - hope for sun when you visit - the city is so very beautiful.  Now - a lot of the time it is kind of grey and cloudy, but the city is still very pretty.  Please, please, please go and walk on the waterfront - Vancouver should be commended on the job they did with their waterfront trails.

title: The walkable city
reviews: Downtown vancouver is the best city to visit as a tourist? Why? You can walk the city. That is, when it is not raining cats and dogs. But that's not everyday. From your cruise ship which docks at the city centre ( the only one I think with a city this size that has cruise ships dock at city centre) you can walk the city. Yes the downtown city core. To your left is the famous gastown, the old city of vancouver which was burned. It maintains its old classic atmosphere with brick roads and quaint shops and eateries. You won't go hungry. At 12 noon you will hear the old clock. Time to eat, that is. To your right as you leave the cruise ship, you can find a huge convention centre and the further up is the Olympic cauldron. Remember Vancouver was the site of the Winter Olympics that featured its sister-city up North, Whistler, famous for its ski resorts and now, triathlon. Go strength is a combination of office and residential buildings. What makes Vancouver vibrant is that it is alive after office hours because many office people live downtown. Therefore, many restaurants are open in the evening. Unlike other cities where office people live out of town and therefore the city is like a ghost town after office. In those cities, you will be hard pressed to find a MacDonalds open at night. One can do a hop on and off tour. Or simply walk the city core for exercise and taste the food at every block. That would be fun!  Enjoy the Vancouver, voted yearly in the top 5 best city in the world.

title: Vancouver great but not because of downtown...
reviews: We spent long weekend checking out the city from New York.   Loved Stanley Park, the suspension bridge just north of city, liked Gastown,  Granville Island fun, great restaurants, but downtown isnt that great unless you like to shop or just don't live in a city.   Downtown is pretty generic with respect to architecture and just tons of same stores you see everywhere in big cities.  Sorry.

title: Easy walking all over
reviews: Great walking distances to top restaurants. Star bucks and awesome local coffee shops all over. Safe walking well lite at night. Warm rain showers cannot keep you inside - grab an umbrella get out there and explore!!

title: cool vibe
reviews: We took a long walk through downtown  Vancouver and admired  the new and old buildings along with the hubbub of activity.  This reminds me of downtown  Toronto with office  buildings  and shopping.  There are a lot of condos  and  apartments which contributes to the vibe and activity.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Growing up in New York City I appreciated the pristine downtown area of Vancouver.  Friendly people, beautiful but expensive shopping area and good restaurants. Take the get on/get off bus for an overvies and enjoy yourself.

title: Live DT
reviews: Vancouver's DT is live but I think it needs more screen to becomes more live at night.  The public transportation is very good. Besides Skytrain that works until around 1am, there are night bus which working after 12am until morning.

title: A Beautiful Downtown
reviews: In October, 2016, I attended a seminar that was held at Sutton Place, in downtown Vancouver. I visited the area a bit when I wasn't busy with the seminar. I found it to be very accessible, with lots of stores, and restaurants in the immediate vicinity. The area was quite safe for walking around. Also, it has a variety of transportation options, including very good public transportation. I hope to travel there again!

title: Lived in this beautiful city for 2 years
reviews: I had one of the best experiences and met some of the most genuine people in Vancouver. I lived in this beautiful city for 2 years why working for an online business.

title: Not what you think!
reviews: I had heard that Vancouver was one of the most beautiful cities in the world so I was very excited to finally be able to visit. It was our embarkation point on a cruise to Alaska. The taxi ride from the airport was long & boring. Nothing particularly special. When we crossed the bridge & entered the downtown area I was surprised to find the buildings not so modern nor architecturally interesting. Blah & dirty. Our hotel was located across from the sports arena & other than that, not much of anything else. Walked to Chinatown just to be disappointed. No good restaurants or shopping. No comparison to San Fran, New York, London, Philly, etc.... Next stop, Yaletown. Walking from Chinatown to this area was safe but a little unsettling. The streets are filled with homeless people, garbage & very trashy. Frankly, I just didn't expect that. Yaletown was cool but a very small section of downtown Vancouver. All in all, Vancouver didn't live up to its reputation (at least the downtown area).

title: Interesting neighbourhoods. Nice city to stay.
reviews: We stayed in Downtown Vancouver for 3 nights. We loved the city with nice shops and restaurants. We especially liked Gastown with interesting cocktailbars, pubs, shops and restaurants.

title: Downtown Vancouver - Easy to Walk and Interesting to Discover
reviews: I stayed very centrally near the Vancouver Art Gallery and the Pacific Centre - both worth seeing.  Pacific Centre is there for those seeking a Rodeo Drive type of experience.  Walking anywhere around that area is interesting.  Disappointing to accept the very high number of people living on all the streets.  That said, Vancouver is a beautiful city physically and worth seeing the parks, bridges and individuals areas such as downtown, Gastown, Kitsilano.  Prices are high, one night's dinner which included two appetizers, a glass of wine and a 4 oz serving of fish was $95.  Go to Chinatown for its restaurants, beautiful Sun Wat Garden and fun to look around.

title: Love the vibe here
reviews: The downtown is clean and easy to navigate whether walking or taking a cab.  Bring an umbrella but if you forget, the hotel may provide one.

title: Beautiful
reviews: It is a very nice and beautiful, a lots of things to do from shopping to enjoying a very good meal to walk through the neighborhoods, spend some time in front Of Vancouver public library or even enjoy a nice walk in Stanley Park

title: Lots of culture and aights
reviews: Vancouver downtown is busy and bustling with people and traffic.  Lots of great shopping and restaurant options. Has some pedestrian only streets and lots of cultural options to see. You may see the homeless on the street, but they don't bother you much - odd one is asking for money for food.

title: Vibey Downtown
reviews: Modern and bustling, Downtown Vancouver has something for everyone, young and not-so-young, local and tourist. The variety of fare is amazing, from exclusive shopping to bargains and vintage, it's a shopper's delight. Great variety of cuisine, from street food to fine dining, Downtown makes a point of catering for every need and whim. Great place; have to do it again - in the summer!

title: Very clean and safe
reviews: Stayed in downtown and was able to walk everywhere without any issues. Very clean city and everyone very nice. Respect the walk / don't walk signs and getting around is easy.

title: Lots to see and do
reviews: Very pedestrian and bike friendly. Lots of coffee bars and eateries. But can be cloudy and rainy most of the year. Bring an umbrella.

title: One of the most beautiful cities in the world
reviews: Walk around downtown Vancouver and discover streets, buidlings, a mix of modern architecture and the old constructions which will give you an idea of the aerly days in the city, do not miss Gastown, full of restaurants, galleries, and interesting shops in well restored buildings. A must see

title: Essential walk to understand and orientate oneself to vancouver
reviews: This is a very walkable city, largely flat and easily navigable with it's grid like pattern.  It has everything one would expect to find in a large city but unlike many is very compact,

title: Vancouver
reviews: Don't waste your time.  Vancouver is the most boring city I have ever had the misfortune to visit.  The so called sites are mediocre at best, not to mention it is overpriced and filled with rude, vulgar people.

title: Lovely Autumn Strolls
reviews: Downtown area is lively as well as tall. Vancouver is a beautiful city with abundant architectural marvels.

title: Easy and fun for everyone.
reviews: This was a family vacation.  Downtown was great for all of us (aged 6months to 62 yrs old).  Great shopping, food trucks, cafes, restaurants, museum, parks, farmers market... something for everyone.

title: not bad but sketchy in some areas
reviews: as far as urban down towns go, it was nice and had an awesome skyline, however walking at night there were definitely some sketchy streets and places that were unsafe.  There were a lot of addicts and panhandlers in some areas, so just be careful where you go.

title: Not What I Envisioned
reviews: Stay downtown and had a nice view of the harbor. I envisioned in my mind that that this would be a quaint Canadian city but found it to be, for the most part, very sterile. There is a great deal of glass and metal vs bricks and mortar. The views of the harbor looking at the mountains is breath taking but you then turn and stare at glass and metal. There is a huge homeless and drug issue in the area of East Hastings Street. I would not recommend venturing must passed the 400 block of West Hastings because it gets very sketchy very quickly heading east on Hastings.

title: One Of My Favorite Cities For Beautiful Views Excellent Restaurants & More
reviews: My daughter & I took  the ferry to Horseshoe Bay. Then, we took a city bus to downtown Vancouver. We literally walked right on to the bus when we got off the ferry. How wonderfully convenient! We were headed to the Playhouse Theater for a matinee performance. The last stop the bus made was right across the street from the theater! What a great transportation system. It was much more convenient than taking a car & having to deal with traffic & parking. Not to mention the cost of taking a car on the ferry. After the performance, we had enough time to walk through the downtown area before heading to the waterfront to catch a seaplane home. We loved the vibe of the downtown with its shops, department stores, restaurants, hotels, beautiful mountain & water views. It even got better when we were flying out with views of Stanley Park, the city, the Lion's Gate Bridge, the boats in the harbour & more. I never tire seeing Vancouver's beautiful setting.:)

title: What to do in Vancouver
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city...when it's not rainy and gloomy. The city itself is smaller than most major metro's around the world but there's still plenty to do. For restaurants and bars check out Yaletown; this small section of the city has great restaurants from mainstream food to chic and elegant spots including lounges. From Yaletown you can go and explore Granville St. which is the club district. It's lined by nightclubs and restaurants, the street however does get rowdy on Friday and Saturday nights. It's fairly safe with a lot of police presence but if you don't want to deal with drunks I would say away.Near Granville St. is Robson St. which lined by shops. Robson St. has lost some of it's past glory and isn't what it was 10 years ago as a lot of shops have closed down or moved to malls but it still worth checking out. Also on Robson St. is Pacific Centre mall. The mall went through a massive reno last year which included the opening of Nordstorms and other shops. If you want to buy high end luxury stuff you can check out Holt Renfrew which also went through a major reno this past summer and includes the first full Chanel store in Canada.Speaking of high end stores...you can also check out Alberni St. which is on the rear of the Shanghai-La hotel. This street has some high end retailers such as Prada, Burberry and Versace. It also have a few of the best restaurants in the city where a lot of locals and celebs. English Bay is a nice during hot summer nights, the views are amazing and you can catch yourself a nice sunset. Stanley Park and Lions Gate bridge are your typical must see places for Tourist. You can also walk the seawall from the Bayshore Hotel to Pan Pacific which is nice walk, not overly crowded and you get amazing water views. Las the but not least is Gastown. This area has gone through a lot of changes and more chic, hipster restaurants have opened up. The area is fairly safe but I would not recommend wandering around too much because it is surrounded by the Vancouver east side which littered with the homeless and drug addicts.

title: Beautiful üå∏üå∏
reviews: The high rise buildings, the restaurants on the waterfront, the stores... it's just breathtaking. I feel it comes alive at night with all the lights! A must see!

title: Northwest across afew miles or kilometers
reviews: The Northwest of the States, quick getaway to our neighbours, another culture and noone is good at directions. But loved it, spent the last trip up here with my girlfriend who was deeply impressed (even though we were supposed to be south of the border before Canada trip). Go see the city that is every right a great city.

title: Disappointing and characterless
reviews: I was so disappointed in Vancouver, arranged a five day stay but one would have been enough.  You have to pay for everything, and it's very expensive.  Hardly any old buildings left, lots of very indifferent high rise, and more being built. The waterfront was nice to walk along, and the transport is good.  Stanley park (thank goodness they can't build there) and Granville island were nice. I tried to find a concert or theatre but without luck, except for PAL which was brilliant.  The art gallery was half shut, and again expensive.  With all the money rolling in from property taxes the  city should do more for its homeless population, it was sad to see so many people living on the streets.

title: Fun town
reviews: Very unique city to visit.  Lots of activities to consider.  All sorts of food to choose from.  Just did not have enough time to see it all so will have to go back.

title: Great Downtown
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has so many things going for it that I could spend all day listing them. There are a multitude of both large and boutique hotels, shops, department stores, boutiques, theatres and restaurants as well as a large underground mall.. it is easily accessed from the rest of the city and suburbs by Skytrain, bus or Seabus.  It's a great place just to wander about and enjoy.

title: Liveable City? Hmmmm
reviews: OK this is about a Downtown area of a major City. Its not about the suburbs, nor the surrounding regions.And to be fair, we only felt unsafe once.That said Vancouver has a huge problem. Homeless people literally clog the streets. Virtually every door way, every vent from the subway system and more are filled nightly. Begging is on the rise, though it is polite and when declined they move away swiftly.Avoid Chinatown - we inadvetantly, in the middle of the day, wandered into the area - attracted by the Vancouver highlights on TV. Mistake. Absolutely clogged with homeless and we did not feel safe at all. We finally escaped to Gastown but were not happy at the experience.Homeless people are homeless for a number of reasons, however we couldn't help but feel that whatever the cause the City of Vancouver was abandoning these unfortunate people, only one local church to where we were staying appeared to be doing anything to assist.We decided that what these unfortunate people needed was not money but food and clothing. Our choice. But imagine our surprise when 'doing the right thing' via aforesaid church was almost rejected out of hand...Did this impact on our enjoyment of Vancouver as a 'destination'? Unfortunately yes. The worst aspect was the apparent lack of any effort to help the (we were told) over 70,000 homeless in the City.It's a problem - it will get worse and Vancouver City elders should be doing more. The impact on your city depicts an uncaring image which eventually will put visitors off.

title: It was overcast on weather but beautiful in all other ways!
reviews: We enjoyed our walk by the Canada Place looking and around by Mahony's. The plaques to read were very interesting. Not lengthy and wordy but to the point and pleasant to read!

title: Four week ROADTRIP 2015 from San Francisco to Vancouver
reviews: I love Vancouver especially downtown we were staying at the four seasons which is right in the Center downtown convenient for walks, shopping and restaurants.

title: Beautiful
reviews: Vancouver downtown is simply clean, beautiful, and scenic if you are at harbor front. It's a diverse city full of different culture and ethnic groups. Overall it is a safe city to walk around, explore, and have fun!

title: Nice city!!
reviews: Spent a few days in Vancouver and had a great time. Nice and clean city with friendly people. Would like to go back and discover the surroundings.

title: Bars, restaurants, shops, culture
reviews: Why wouldn't you want to go?!Vancouver has it all. A large modern city called "Hollywood North" by celebrities and film crews, you'll find famous faces mixed in naturally with local folks.The best pubs & bars, with amazing eateries and restaurants and a bubbling night life, this gem awaits you. Concerts by every famous and infamous band, artists worldwide brag they've done a concert in Vancouver.Hockey team the Vancouver Canucks have regular games in Rogers Arena, hosting all the great NHL teams from North America. Catch a game or even a practice!See a Symphony, take a guided nature hike, shop at the world's most famous stores in downtown Vancouver. Award winning restaurants and those shown on tv exclusively found here.Easy access, parking, and accommodations to suite any budget. One of the world's most beautiful cities, voted the number 1 place to live. Come see downtown Vancouver.

title: Oh Canada! Our Home and Native Land! Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
reviews: Vancouver is one of North America‚Äôs most under-rated tourist destinations. It is a modern, travel-friendly city with a unique mix of cultures. The relatively mild Pacific Northwest climate and an energetic restaurant and nightlife scene are some of the features that make this such an attractive city.

title: Easy city to navigate and get around.
reviews: We have been regular visitors to Vancouver for approximately 10 years but have never really spent time navigating around and getting to know more than the tourist areas.This occasion was different and we spent time wandering through the downtown area and enjoyed the rich diversity of shopping and stores, the friendly courteous staff and competitive pricing.Take your time and enjoy the different options of shopping and eating in downtown Vancouver, BC.

title: Big City, Big Homeless Situation
reviews: It has been many years since being in downtown Vancouver and I was shocked to see just how dirty it was and the number of homeless on every street.The downtown core offers lots to see and do no doubt - shops, waterfront, restaurants, etc.  So in that aspect it was good to walk around and explore but I doubt I'll be back.

title: A great city to visit
reviews: Spent a couple of days here which wasn't really long enough as there is so much to see - we walked and walked getting a great sense of the place

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: I love to walk around Downtown Vancouver, checking out all of the caf√©s, restaurants and shops.  A lot of it is pricey, but it doesn't have to be if you know where to look.  I feel safe in most parts of Downtown Vancouver, but you need to educate yourself if you're going to be walking around by yourself...avoid the Downtown East side i.e. the few blocks around East Hastings where the homeless people with addiction and mental health issues congregate. Adjacent Chinatown also gets it's share of these types.  Although I feel safe walking to Chinatown with a friend during the day, at night I would take a cab if I were visiting a restaurant there.  I also find the south end of Granville Street, right as you enter Downtown Vancouver from the Granville Street Bridge, to be a little seedy as well.  Again, not a problem during the day, but at night, I would think twice about walking there alone.  Otherwise, I feel that Downtown Vancouver is a safe and beautiful place to explore.  Not much to do for kids though, best to take them to areas outside of the downtown area.

title: Chic and lovely
reviews: Especially Yaletown, Vancouver is a great place to walk around, shop and dine. You will need several days just for downtown!The little markets are a delight to shop for groceries, they have everything & more!

title: Vibrant City
reviews: Vancouver is well served by public transport, with frequent Skytrains and buses. Its pleasant to explore on foot, easy to find your way around, and plenty to see and do.

title: Compact and accessible
reviews: Good for a stroll around, all feels very safe and everything is easily within walking distance. Traffic - both human and vehicular can be a bit intense in places but plenty of refuges if you need them

title: Car hire
reviews: Arrived In Vancouver airport after long tiring flight expecting to have a fight on my hands to upgrade car hire due to the fact that in U.K. Neither Holliday company nor enterprise could sort out A large SUV. we are a family of 5 and believe me when I say despite what your tour operator tells you you won't fit 5 people 5 suitcases and associated hand luggage into a standard SUV and if you like us are going to do 2000km round national parks and mountain DON'T  take a mini van you will get stuck. So we arrive at the Alamo/enterprise desk and very briefly explain our problem and WOW the young man could not have been more helpful he agreed that we would need 4wd because of the route we are taking and promptly handed us the keys to a brand new GMC Yukon. (6km on clock)Don't get me wrong this upgrade cost a lot of money do not be under the impression that this came easy we are talking an extra ¬£480 for 2 weeks on top of the ¬£650 already paid in the U.K. Ok we opted for the zero excess that was 5 Canadian dollars a day and there was a couple of other things to pay the actual cost for the car was 35 cd a day extra but for us it's worth it comfort and room the truck is beautiful I won't want to go back to my SUV at home. We have another 10 days will review each hotel and experience as we go

title: Lovely city, walk your socks off...
reviews: A lovely city and although you need to do lots of walking the walking is not difficult. Lots of museums, shops, cafes, brewery pubs. So rather than taking a taxi, do some walking and enjoy. We did see some homeless as you do in most major western cities these days.

title: Nephew's wedding
reviews: An amazing city. Clean, friendly, safe, and easy to navigate. Can't wait till we can visit again. Definitely a redo city.

title: Vancouver City Center
reviews: Great city. Wide variety of attractions. Museums, restaurants from very simple to elegant, brewpubs and bars, shopping, waterfront views. Best way to get around is public transportation and on foot. Great place to walk. Generally safe and secure, just use common sense and stay out of dark alleys and back streets.

title: Such a wide Variety
reviews: You can walk for hours just window shopping and people watching. This city is vibrant and safe and has a great transport system.

title: Get out of the car and take a walk
reviews: Downtown Vancouver traffic is congested, and difficult to navigate because of all the one-way streets. But it's easy to get  around on foot. Robson St is the place to go for mid to high end shopping. Lunch is  easy with a wide variety of food trucks at Robson & Granville.

title: A truly great area to visit.
reviews: I don't think I'm biased; I was born next door in Burnaby, but left the area 60 years ago and it's the present Vancouver I find so attractive.  First, it's one of the world's beautiful cities: Stanley Park, the waterfront, the marinas, Granville Island, Queen Elizabeth Park, The Lions' Gate Bridge, North and West Vancouver, Mt. Seymour, Horseshoe Bay, Deep Cove, Shaughnessy, and lately the East end around the foot of Main all the way south to Marine Drive.  Oh and Point Grey and Burnaby Mountain each with a university campus. Really, hard to find another city its equal. Now driving has become something of a zoo and the city is a very expensive place to visit, let alone in which to live, but it's certainly worth the trip.

title: Something for everyone
reviews: I love Vancouver and never  tire of it. It's small enough to have great charm and big enough to meet the needs of residents and travellers. The ocean attracts containers, passenger liners and fishermen and is fringed by beaches and glorious walks along the seawall. The range of restaurants spans almost every culture with a strong and impressive Canadian/Pacific rim presence and an abundance of Chinese . For fast food there is a huge selection of food trolleys. Art galleries and native crafts shops are aplenty and there is an amazing choice of stores both big and small.

title: Walkable Downtown with Many Great Restaurants
reviews: Spent 4 nights in Downtown Vancouver and highly enjoyed it.  Beautiful architecture with mix of modern and historic buildings.  Sports mecca with BC Place Stadium, Sports Hall of Fame and Rogers Arena.  Explore the areas of Granville Island and Gastown.  Vancouver Lookout and Vancouver Aqurarium are musts.  Several large shopping malls and tourist shops available.  I enjoyed several great restaurants  -- Le Petit Belge (breakfast), Lupo, Water Street Cafe and The Keg Steakhouse.Most locations are an easy walk from downtown hotels.  The bus and train systems are inexpensive and easy to navigate.  Avoid the homeless area near Chinatown -- otherwise, everything seemed very safe.

title: Great clean place.
reviews: Well as in writing this I'm still on downtown.It's great every one respect the traffic lights and don't want to run you over.A few homeless here and there but that is to expect in major cities.Even if you ignore them they will not hit you or insist in giving them money.Clean place I didn't see trash on the side walks everything is super clean! In surprise in all honesty.The reason why I don't give it a 5 out of 5 it's because the lack of police in the street.I understand this is a safe city and all but it would be nice to see a cop here and there in case you get lost you know.Overall great city very safe.By the way another reason I gave it 4/5 it's because the food is way high again it's to be expected specially in a downtown area.

title: Great city
reviews: We walked around downtown Vancouver and felt quite safe. There were an unusually high number of beggars on the sidewalks, but they did not pester us. The area around Canada Place is great to visit, and 'Fly Over Canada' is not to be missed.

title: Loved Vancouver Downtown
reviews: Arriving by cruise ship, Vancouver looks like a jewel in a beautiful setting.  We loved downtown.  We stayed right in the heart of it off Burrard and Robson.  We could easily walk everywhere we wanted to go and didn't feel unsafe or threatened - Gastown, Chinatown, (don't go to Main St.) Granville Island, easy access to Stanley Park and the beaches, water views and sunsets,  great Metro system, and Canada Place for free busses to other places.  Lots of great food places, we're not big shoppers but there was plenty of that.  The people were friendly and most helpful.   Prices are high, but after coming back from Alaska, that wasn't a culture shock.  The only thing a bit disconcerting were the number of beggars on every street - usually holding signs stating medical issues.  But we'd recommend going to Vancouver to anyone.

title: Great downtown
reviews: We come here a few times a year, especially on Canadian day and Boxing day. Lots of shopping places for all prices and lots of good restaurants, including natural and organic options. Tips: if you go here for Canadian day, they have one of the best parades and fireworks. Stay at the Hyatt to be close to the parade, but stay at the Wall Center area to watch the fireworks from your hotel. The Century Plaza Hotel and Spa across the street is cheaper and provides good views as well.

title: Look like people more relaxing then New York menhatten . People aremay living with tree and mountain and water around .
reviews: I enjoy with airplane ride 20mimit with Harbor view flight . Stop by information center buy tickets.  I could have chance to sit next pilot . It was amazing . When airplane turn , feel like earth is turning for me . next time I will try mountain ride 1 hour . I could not this time because weather was not helping me. I took a picture Giant old large tree trank Happy!

title: Nice area
reviews: Downtown is a nice area but you can easily wander in to chinatown where there are many homeless and drug users which is a bit unexpected!!

title: Interesting city district
reviews: Easy to get around and transferable from the airport. I wouldn't say it's great because it just doesn't have that spectacular feel. It's perfectly clean and people are good but it just didn't give me the eye opening I want.

title: Never enough time
reviews: It's a city that will keep calling you back. So much good shopping and good food. Lots of entertainment. This city doesn't sleep  you can hit up Granville street at night time and go for food and drinks lots of cool little pubs. This city is just so alive and vibrant. Absolutely pure joy

title: Good restaurants and beautiful water front
reviews: Vancouver water front has beautiful views of sea and the North Vancouver. Walking around there is quite entertaining.

title: Charming place to visit
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has so much to offer.  A very vibrant city that is full of energy, history and best of new and old worlds.  I highly recommend this experience to anyone who is visiting Vancouver,

title: A very English feel
reviews: Got the feeling British Columbia was more British than us. Catch the Hop on off Bus and see all the sights in your own time. We only had a few hours before we picked up our cruise so this was definitely the best way to get a taster of the city

title: Canada trip 2016.
reviews: Our hotel was downtown good base for getting around. Plenty of restaurant's, of different cuisines and price ranges. The harbour is very pretty. Lots to do and see not that time allowed us to. Lots of shops.

title: Nice to spend some time
reviews: A lot things to see, great shops and bars and restarants and all in walking distance. Easy to spend a day ... a must.

title: Lots of Green
reviews: We stayed in a condo downtown and walked everywhere.   There were lots of sculptures and green plants and trees everywhere!   We ate at Steamworks which was our favorite restaurant in downtown Vancouver.

title: Sept 16
reviews: A normal bustling city with some excellent shops all within walking distance . While away an afternoon wandering....

title: Nice and clean city
reviews: We loved downtown Vancouver with nice atmosphere, shops and attractions. Just I would recommend to avoid Hastings street... it is scary how many homeless people are there and they looked like drug addicted... this was also the most dirtiest street in Vancouver.

title: I Love My City
reviews: I recently spent a "getaway" night at the Rosedale On Robson in Yaletown. The staff were super friendly and the property was near many attractions, sports venues, shops and restaurants. It was a beautiful fall day and evening and we had a very enjoyable time just walking to everything we wanted to see. It's great being a tourist in your own city and realizing what a beautiful city Vancouver is.

title: Great vibe!
reviews: We loved the downtown area of Vancouver.  There seems to be something going on around every corner, between eateries and shopping.  The overall impression of the area is the greenery and cleanliness.

title: Amazing
reviews: Make sure to walk around and see the amazing sites like Robson Square. The library, art gallery and of course shopping at the Pacific center. Take the sea bus  across to North Van and see a view that is breathtaking. Ocean, mountains, clean air Vancouver has it all.

title: Cool Downtown Vibe!
reviews: This downtown is occupied!  All kinds of apartments and businesses appear to be thriving.  It is a fun, fun place to walk around.

title: Really awesome downtown area - very clean, a lot of cool restaurants and shops, but also a lot of apartments
reviews: actually I visited in August 2012, not August 2016 - really clean and safe downtown - a lot of shops and restaurants, but there's also a lot of hotels and apartment buildings.  Very fun place to walk, but keep an umbrella handy!

title: Definitely worth going
reviews: We had Vancouver as our first stop of our West Coast Road Trip and it was the right choice. The city welcomes guests with its charming atmosphere by the water, it's nice restaurants and lively cultural scene.

title: Outstanding City
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is safe, clean, bright, and modern. It features many shops of all sizes and varieties, and restaurants of all types abound. is quite compact, and easily walkable. So nice to not have to rent a car to visit all the city's neighborhoods and attractions!

title: Love atmosphere
reviews: I love the whole area of Downtown Vancouver. Great stores, boutiques, shops and super restaurants and coffee shops.I just love the atmosphere and it's so easy to get around. Don't forget the little mobile lunch vans with a variety of ethnic foods. Delicious.

title: Demonstrates a pleasant environment in a comparatively compact Downtown
reviews: Having visited Montreal and Toronto during our Canada holiday, we found the contrast of Vancouver interesting. Our hotel was in the Downtown area and we walked quite a lot and found especially the waterfront area very impressive. The size and layout of the main Downtown area means that it is possible to cover large areas comfortably on foot. The wide range of architecture mixes together quite well. There is an issue with the number of homeless people, although we felt safe whilst in the city.

title: The BEST number 3 City in the World!
reviews: This City has been named number 3 in the World, after Geneva and Copenhagen for many, many years. The scenery, the natural beauty of the mountains, the wild life, the friendliness of locals, the ever great economy, food and the ever best value of the visitors' currency against the Canadian Dollar will have everyone visiting perfectly happy in each and very way. This is the year to visit Vancouver, the host of the Winter Olympic Games 2010!

title: Valued Vancouver
reviews: Great city to explore. Lots of history. Lots of great shopping. Lots of good eating places. Easy to get around.

title: Great!
reviews: First time visitor, really impressed by the city. The location is gift from the nature, but organisation and the cleanness is to the locals. Great job! If you remove the homeless from the streets, it will be perfect.

title: Most beautiful
reviews: It is the most beautiful downtown in the world and universe, May be Sydney or Auckland can be close but won't enough to beat Vancouver

title: Love love this city
reviews: Vancouver BC always amazes it me with its diversity in people and cuisines. Love that you can just take naps at the park and rides your bikes around without any worries. Can't wait to come back

title: Lovely walkable city
reviews: Very interesting city.  It is also very walkable, not too large and very interesting and diverse neighborhoods. West End, Yaletown and especially Gas Town are the best.  There are some grittier areas, but overall felt very safe.  Great food and very diverse.

title: Modern and very cosmopolitan
reviews: Great downtown area, especialyy the modern and impressive sea front. Very clean and modern and all within walking distance

title: Great area to walk about
reviews: If you like to explore cities, this is one of the best options I have ever been to. I definitely recommend getting to Canada Place and exploring from there!

title: Vibrant City
reviews: Lots of high end shops with great variety. Easy to walk around and coffee shops abound. Nice public areas and sculptures

title: Lots to sea and do
reviews: We travelled from Granville island to yaletown by false creek ferries.., then walked to downtown, shops are very good, lots to see and do... very good for sightseeing.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Down town Vancouver is a fantastic city with lots to offer! If you have a chance it's a must! Terrific restaurants and great shopping. Wonderful downtown views!

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful City with very interesting architecture.  We enjoyed walking downtown and exploring the different areas. This is a very good area to walk or cycle.

title: GREAT CITY!!!
reviews: We REALLY ENJOYED our four days in Vancouver and surrounding areas before taking the Rocky Mountaineer Gold class into the Canadian Rockies for the next ten days. There's so much to see and do around Vancouver. BE SURE to experience Fly Over Canada, its a simulator "ride" and is an AMAZING experience that would be easy for all ages! We  also and a very enjoyable dinner at the Old Spaghetti Factory in the Gastown area. SO MUCH to enjoy in Vancouver!

title: Fabulous city
reviews: Terrific city with lots to see and do and very easy to navigate and get around - lots of nice restaurants

title: Easy walking
reviews: We had a walk aroung this area from our hotel as we had 1/2 a day before getting on our cruise ship for Alaska. It was very interesting with plenty to do and look at.

title: Limited attractions
reviews: It wasn't a terrible experience, but there really isn't much to see. Even my three year old niece, who loves sea animals, got bored. Their 4D theatre experience is a joke. If you're looking for a thrill, don't bother watching it. At best, you will find a moralistic tale about saving the environment. But you don't need to waste 30 minutes to learn that you should protect the environment.

title: Great area to stay
reviews: Is really good area to stay, you avoid the horrible traffic of Vancouver. Is expensive but u will have the best experience in the city. Close to all the attractions.

title: Stay Away not what it used to be.
reviews: I was very disappointed with the downhill slide of downtown Vancouver. It was dirty and homeless people camped everywhere. I didn't feel safe.

title: Poor architecture in a magnificent setting
reviews: We have to say that we were disappointed with the cityscape of Vancouver. From a distance, it seems wonderful. Close-up, it's way too many concrete-and-green-glass high-rises. Very few skyscrapers with architectural merit. The city fathers/mothers made some bad decisions when it came to modern development. Old photos show a diverse city with fascinating architecture. Only a few blocks have been preserved of the historical section. Sad to see.

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: Lots of lovely buildings, coffee places and places to eat. A lovely city which is clean and well maintained.

title: Vancouver city is nice but not buzzing.
reviews: Vancouver a big city with a good public bus service. The city is interesting for a day or two but any time after this it gets a bit boring. Some of the parks are green and inviting and contrast this with the depressing streetscapes and homeless street people.You only have to travel down East Hastings Street to see the extent of this problem From the look of the living conditions on this street it would seem the city fathers encourage this way of life.

title: Fun to window shop
reviews: Certainly one of the most beautiful downtowns and waterfronts. There's plenty to see and do and it's clean and safe.

title: Down and outs in Downtown
reviews: Not sure why people recommend here to stay. Its an area full of homeless people, weed smokers and then people queuing up to get into clubs. There are shops but you can go shopping in any city. This area of the city is very overated.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Lovely city to wander round, people watching and seeing the sights. Lots to see and do. Down at the water front is very picturesque with views over to Vancouver Island.

title: Top Summer Spot for Canada!
reviews: Have visited Vancouver several times in the pas years! Downtown offers the best of both worlds, if you are into the hustle bustle of downtown shopping malls and big city life then you can easily find that. Or you can walk a small distance to the sea wall, stanley park, take a water taxi to Granville Island or countless other things. Definitely would recommend travelling here.

title: Exciting North American city has the whole package
reviews: We had so much fun during our first three days in Vancouver that we changed our airline tickets and stayed two more days.  Love, love, love it here.  This was our sixth visit in several decades, and it's been fun to see it change and update, while retaining its old-world charm.  Ocean and mountains are the backdrop for the downtown, which has a mix of skyscrapers, upscale shops, luxury hotels and an array of eateries to rival San Francisco or New York. Clean, well lighted downtown and we felt safe even late at night after the theater or a late dinner.

title: not much to see or do
reviews: As far as big city downtowns are concerned, Vancouver has a really sleepy downtown. Really not much to do or see. Robson street has some retail store fronts, but otherwise, pretty sleepy.

title: Lots to see
reviews: Vancouver downtown has lots to look at as far as high end to purchasing gifts to take home for loved ones. The money exchange rate runs about $ 1.30 to $ 1.41. Lot's to see and do. All the streets are safe except Hastings Street come late evening. Lots of homeless hang out there. Every place else is good.

title: Bof!
reviews: We ended our trip in Vancouver.  Again I would never have thought that Vancouver was so dull and dirty.  Except for Stanley Park, we have to go a bit out of the city to find worthwhile things to see or visit.  The city is full of homeless people with their camping equipment, begging on the sidewalks.  The Gastown area has too many cheap souvenir stores and we spent, or wasted, two hours there ‚Ä¶ Chinatown is ‚Ä¶ a Chinatown.  It has nothing to offer visitors.

title: Fun city!
reviews: Vancouver is a lively vibrant city with great food scene, amazing shopping and lots to do! The city is surrounded by ocean views and trails to bike or walk almost everywhere you want to go.

title: Excellent
reviews: Plenty of stores for the professional Retail Therapeutic trip. Definitely check out the Microsoft Store and Best Buy for all your technology needs.Also, don't forget to call into Golden Age Collectibles for all your Sci-fi Collectibles, comics, t-shirts to name just a few.

title: Its a northamerican downtown
reviews: nothing glamorous. nice to see the waterfronts but the streets and city life are like any other average canadian big city. Appreciate the greenery though.

title: loved it
reviews: loved it, wish i could live there;). it is clean and spacious and seemed calmer than other cities. there's amazing modern architecture, awesome restaurants and people, nice parks &waterfront beautiful view and nature around. hope to be back someday

title: nice to walk around
reviews: there is a very good range of shops & eaterys ,very easy to walk around , if you so wish , very convenient to the city centre

title: Compact with great shopping
reviews: Downtown is a shoppers mecca with a wide variety of stores to gift every budget. Lots of great restaurants, easy to walk everywhere

title: Scary Walk
reviews: A bit scary to walk from the suburbs through Eastside Downtown so I would catch a cab through the dodgy parts.

title: Great City
reviews: Stayed in the city four times prior to and after cruises. The city is amazing with lots of places to explore. Wonderful  waterfront and spend a day in Stanley Park, Granville Island,Gas Town and for shopping try The Pacific Centre and Robson Street. Plenty of choices for dinning with various prices to suite your budget. The locals are very proud of their city and friendly.

title: Big city
reviews: Public transit- both the Sky Train and Bus were very good, clean and on time.  They sell a Day Pass for $15 or so but then nick you for $6 for the card with no instructions on how to get get it back.  Good method to pick up a few extra bucks fro tourists.

title: Stunning views and buildings
reviews: Surprisingly green among the skyscrapers with lots of waterfalls and small gardens.. Good range of shops and eating places and access to the city's activities and transport

title: Nice city centre
reviews: Down town vancouver is great it is spread out u think have seen all the city centre then u find there more of it

title: Interesting city!
reviews: We enjoyed touring the city of Vancouver-we stayed downtown and everything seems fairly walkable-we took the hop on hop off bus and enjoyed china town and lions gate etc. people are greenfly and we felt safe-as in most large cities there are a fair amount of homeless people-we contributed when we felt lead and they weren't pushy or annoying. We did the suspension bridge which you can take the free shuttle from downtown there. It was awesome and there are cliff walks and paths to to follow once there. Def recommend

title: Wonderful clean city
reviews: We spent two days post cruise to Inside Passage Alaska. Lots of places to explore and very easy walking. Traffic was very respectful allowing you to cross and feeling safe. Nice areas to walk and eat...like Canada Place. The hop On Hop Off bus was good value to get a good overview of the area.Vancouver is a lovely clean city and would love to go back again sometime.

title: Beautiful
reviews: The Vancouver downtown area and waterfront are amazing. The city is very clean and easy to navigate. I  really enjoyed the waterfront walking areas. Can't wait to return to Vancouver and enjoy this beautiful city.

title: Fantastic City!
reviews: It is a great city that is lush (gardeners must live here!) and it feels safe to move around.  It is a clean city and lots to do.  With so much of greenery surrounding the downtown core, it is a very beautiful city.  Should dedicate at least about 2-3 full days to venture into what the city has to offer -- plan ahead so you use the time wisely.  Try to make dinner reservations in the abundance of great restaurants.

title: Beautiful city,
reviews: So easy to navigate. Maps available  are easy to follow and the city is so clean. Every one uses crooswalks ant the cars respect pedestrians. Free bus shuttles at hotels to nearby attractions.

title: Amazing City
reviews: A great place to spend a few days exploring at leisure.  So many places of interest to visit and great shopping centre.  The Hop on Hop off bus provides access to most of the downtown area and is good value for money.  Buses are frequent so we did not have to wait long, although popular drop off points can get congested (i.e Granville Island, Gastown and Stanley Park).  There are lots of restaurants and food outlets, catering for all tastes. Lots of interesting things to do (museums, shopping, sea plane rides, parks).  We would visit again and give ourselves time to explore further afield (i.e Mount Seymour Provincial Park/Vancouver Island).

title: beautiful city
reviews: A beautiful city with loads of things to do & see . From the shopping streets, to the beaches & the harbour front

title: So much to see and do
reviews: What can I say?  We walked and walked and walked and still didn't see everything!  Luckily downtown vancouver is all doable by foot but there's so many interesting things to see that you easily need more time to see it all !

title: The Waterfront area of Downtown Vancouver
reviews: This area of the city is very clean and modern with some of the best hotels in the city next to the convention center.   There are many restaurants and local shops. There are excellent low cost public transport to all parts of Vancouver. A couple of blocks to the train station and the Seabus.

title: Great city!
reviews: We loved Vancouver - the atmosphere is great, everywhere that we saw was clean, the people were very friendly and helpful and the public transport is amazing!  The waterfront is something else, too!

title: The Harbour Area and Gastown
reviews: Good places for a walking tour. No guide is necessary. Wondeful view of the Bay and islands from the promenade along the sea. Hidroplanes tours depart from there.

title: Clean city with a nice waterfront and easy walking
reviews: Plenty of mass transit, and a few inexpensive hotels, make the city center an easy place to visit.  Walk around the waterfront and watch the cruise ships sail (unless you're supposed to be on it!)  We saw lots of public maps so it's easy to get around (though a little hilly) with a lot of art museums and other attractions.

title: Simply a beautiful City.
reviews: We are long term residents of Vancouver so slightly biased. However at 6:30 this morning I spoke with a lady from New York who was enjoying a morning cup of coffee. These are her comments, just breath taking, scenery is magnificent, air is fresh and clear, city streets are clean and everything is in order. She had just finished sending her husband a text requesting that he bring her back to Vancouver to celebrate her birthday.

title: We loved being Downtown
reviews: Nice and clean, friendly people, trees in the streets and the harbour is right there.  Great cafes on the harbour with sea views (we ate in two of them).  Take a walk around the water front - if you get enthusiastic you can walk to Stanley Park.

title: Fantastic city
reviews: Vancouver is a vibrant, interesting and clean city which everyone should have the opportunity of visiting. It is surrounded by mountains yet has all that a modern city has to offer.

title: Just like it much!
reviews: Everytime I have a chance visit downtown in Vancouver I really enjoy it much. foods & shopping places! it's easy to reach to everything. downtown not big i can keep walking around there and good thing I loss so much weight without workout hard haha. Even if Vancouver downtown its busy at least i think it's pretty safe

title: So much to do and see!
reviews: We stayed in the town center and were conveniently close to the metro, bus station, taxis etc. You can also walk to many shopping centers, stores, markets, restaurants and pubs. It is a safe area to walk around even after dark. Stop and have a drink or a latte and pastry and enjoy the beautiful weather!

title: Neat
reviews: We really liked Vancouver. Specially downtown area. We loved the clean streets, the shops the atmosphere and the vibe.

title: Very nice clean city
reviews: Pretty easy to get around and its not that big.  We walked less than two miles to most attractions, dining and attractions.  Taxi's were timely and reasonably priced.  Took the sky train a short distance on a rainier day.  Hamilton and Homer streets in the Yaletown section had some of the better restaurants for us.

title: Nice view
reviews: For all the travellers reaching Vancouver i can suggest this place because you have view for all city.

title: Dense big city with what you expect really
reviews: Busy city with skyscrapers making the city streets feel very closed in. Horizontal and vertical street layout makes it easy to get around. Do find the placing of street signs a bit confusing but you get used to it. Usual mix of financial area, shopping and more tourists related areas. Architecture does not really stand out. The odd building has some age and character but most are the are modern skyline buildings.  Pretty clean streets and you generally feel safe.

title: Great city full of diverse sections!
reviews: We really enjoyed roaming the streets of downtown Vancouver.  Be sure to visit Yaletown, Gastown, Robson Road, and Granville Island.

title: Great Atmosphere. Great bars on the waterfront
reviews: Great place to stroll around and take in the sights. Walk to Canada Place, then on to Gastown. Then either catch a bus or walk north up Granville street. Great shopping and lots of places to eat.

title: Love downtown Vancouver.
reviews: I am already planning my next trip to Vancouver.  I need a week there to even begin seeing some of the sights.

title: Not as clean a city as expected.
reviews: We found the streets of the central city to be dirty as we walked from Granville Station to Yaletown to get the Aquabus.  Very disappointing.  Gastown was better most probably because that's the tourist destination.

title: Great city!
reviews: I really enjoyed this city because we stayed longer and not rushed. We were here for a few times for meetings! Beautiful city, beautiful people but there were a few homeless begging and I feel sad when I see this!It reminds me of Hawaii, Rio and Hongkong, with the mountain, city and water!

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Lovely city,really relaxed and chilled out,everywhere we ate was nice and not pricey,i would of gave it 5 stars but for one reason,the homeless,i am not exaggerating when I say I have not seen so many homeless and drug  addicts in another city and i live in beside Dublin,i have been in major city's all over the world and this tops it when it comes to homeless,they really need to sort it out,we walked up a street just off Gastown heading for China town and took a corner and seen maybe 100 homeless and junkies all on 1 street,it freaked my wife out and she didn't want to go any further,do not let this turn you off visiting but just a major negative for me,love the city and the Canadians are lovely friendly people,great city but just sort it out

title: Attractive shopping.
reviews: Very focussed on providing opportunities for tourists to part with their money, some of the galleries have quality goods but what a price!

title: crowded
reviews: Vancouver is a very crowded, international city. We went in September hoping to avoid the summer tourist season. However, it still took us over an hour just to clear customs. Its a great city for young people because you can ride your bicycle everywhere. There's special lanes just for bicycles. If you want to go shopping and avoid the traffic there's miles and miles of shops under ground.

title: Beautiful setting with lots of attitude
reviews: Vancouver is breathtaking physically.  The mountains, harbour, skyline are captivating.  I find the city easy to walk and it is fairly compact downtown, Granville Island and upper Granville St.  The people have a great deal of attitude and tend to be quite impolite and stand-offish.  In many stores you aren't even acknowledged and some restaurants are barely better. It is an expensive place overall and with the cost and attitude the city just doesn't hold its own against Seattle, Portland, Toronto and other major cities. It's too bad because it has potential.

title: Loved Flying Over Canada!
reviews: Loved this ride!  Highly recommend! Just amazing! Better than Disneyland, and it's not a rollar coaster- not difficult at all. No line at 5:00 PM Sunday.

title: Great city for walking and shopping.
reviews: Downtown is very easy to maneuver.  There's tons of shopping and dining options, and it is very easy to walk to the water.

title: Lots to eee
reviews: Lots to see in the downtown area and harbor side. Go to Canada Place and Don't miss Fly Over Canada!!

title: LookOut
reviews: Glassy outside lift up to LookOut is one of nice attraction in Vancouver's Downtown. All town is bellow you. Stanley park, harbour and view to the mountains - out-of breath looks. You can also see hydro-plane which is landing near.

title: Beautiful Skyscrapers
reviews: This city is green but also vibrant with many new and sleek skyscrapers. It fun to take a walk on major streets and enjoy the view.

title: Urban Comfort Zone for the pepetually non-trendy.
reviews: Living in the suburbs there comes a time when you have to knock the stink off by spending some time in some seriously pure urban and trendy places, but those areas can seem a little scary if you are not used to them.  Vancouver is the best place to start your URBANATING, because it is all there, but in a polite and totally non-scary Canadian package.  It is the best of all worlds!!

title: Walking to the harbor
reviews: Lovely way to see this beautiful city,.  The harbor is well worth the walk.  Be sure to take a float plane trip to Victoria.

title: Make sure to explore the many neighbourhoods
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is much more than tall glass office towers and shopping.  There are some distinctive neighbourhoods including Yaletown, Gastown, Coal Harbour and Chinatown.  Each has a different flavour and history and you'll be pleasantly surprised at the number of historic buildings and streets in what is a very modern city.  It's best to explore on foot.  On the periphery is Stanley Park, English Bay and Granville Island - more than enough to see and do to occupy you for several days.

title: Disappointing
reviews: Except for the Asian food I found Vancouver a poor substitute for other harbourside cities like Sydney or even Seattle.  It just doesn't have the visula impact of other similar cities and many supposed "attractions" like Granville Island are not very attractive amd just don't measure up to other places globally.

title: Vancouver Is A Beautful City
reviews: The cloud, Gas Town, China Town are interesting historical spots to visitThere are so many fabulous water features around the city outsides commercial offices and potted colour outside buildings.The city is an easy interesting walk, or easily toured by the hop on off buses.Vancouver has a lot to offer a visitor

title: Awsome!
reviews: Vancouver is such an amazing city with so much to offer! Sightseeing, Dining, Culture, History, Adventure. It can all be found here!Visit Vancouver's Tourism website for up to date information on attractions, dining and accommodation options.There is something for everyone!

title: Lots of walking
reviews: We did a huge amount of walking, including to the outside of Canada Place to watch the sea planes. Downtown has similar shops to most American large cities, but everything felt clean and safe.

title: At DownTown VANCOUVER
reviews: Wonderful Shopping Options, Very Clean, Controlled Traffic, Reasonable Prices, Large Variety of Shops

title: Clean
reviews: I enjoyed my time downtown but there is alot of walking involved if you want to see everything it has to offer.

title: Beautiful city with beautiful people!
reviews: I love Vancouver! If you have never been there, you have to go.  I have been going since before it was cool to go there, but honestly, I always knew it was a special place to visit!

title: New and some old but all easily reached on foot.
reviews: We were staying in a downtown hotel and so the shops, lookout tower, gastown, station, Canada place, Stanley Park and all the many bars and restaurants were minutes away on foot. Apart from when we arrived at the airport we have not had to use the Sky train. The centre is essentially very modern, lots of high rise office blocks and also numerous expensive looking residential blocks which add to the generally wealthy feel of the place. Go down to the seafront and get great views across to North and West Vancouver and you also no doubt be able to watch seaplanes taking off and landing. There are very nice walks by the waters edge out toward Stanley Park and if you are reasonably fit it's a nice walk back from Granville island along the coast to English bay and Stanley Park. Everything centrally is reachable on foot. We have felt safe walking around but have seen unpleasant confrontation between a pedestrian and cyclist (there are hundreds of cyclists who have a great network of cycle paths) you have to be careful not to wander in the lanes when in the seafront / stable park area) but the confrontation came to blows over the cyclist being on a street pavement and we also saw a man trying to break into a shop opposite our hotel, but the police there in good time and arrested the man. But overall it's a fabulous place and has to be enjoyed for its situation by the sea and the mountainous back drop

title: Compact Downtown
reviews: Everything in Downtown Vancouver is easy to walk to. There are shops on Robson Street, or you can take a walk down to the water to watch the float planes. Lots of high end stores and restaurants.

title: Day visit during cruise
reviews: This was a beautiful area, something I wasn't sure I would enjoy ~ my friend and I did the hop on hop off bus tour, it was great. Saw beautiful parks, the city and this amazing village area(market) that had festivals,  home made items . Definitely would go back to see again

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Vancouver Downtown is a great place to visit. It is easy to walk the downtown but there are many ways to travel as well. We did the trolley tour where you can get off and on at the numerous stops. They go to all the interesting places to see in the city. Don't forget all the good restaurants in the Downtown area.
