title: Spectacular harbour and some interesting buildings
reviews: We spent a couple of days in the downtown area mostly walking around near the harbour.  A superb setting with informative plaques at intervals along the walkway. The downside is the number of beggars that seem to have flocked to the place.  They seem to be on every street corner and, quite literally, are stinking the place out. We had intended to go to Chinatown but gave up as the smell of urine was too much.  Sad for such a lovely location.

title: Great Walking City
reviews: Everything is within walking distance and pedestrians have priority. Vancouver is a great city with neighbourhoods of great contrasts - be sure to visit them!

title: A lot of contrast: rich and poor
reviews: Vancouver is a city of contrast. Super expensive shops and avenues but one block away you'll find the poorest neighbourhood of Canada (East Hastings). And quite a few beggars in the centre BTW. Don't forget to visit other districts such as Davie and the whole area towards Stanley Park. Amazing to have such nice neighbourhoods close to CBD. We found Chinatown and Gastown rather disappointing. Not much to see there. Other neighbourhoods are more interesting.

title: Wonderful fun place to visit.
reviews: Excellent, fun, safe. Easy to walk with lots to see. many good spots to shop. The Met hotel excellent place to stay.

title: Very pedestrian friendly downtown
reviews: The most walkable big city outside of Europe.  Everything is within a 30 minute walk from one end to the other so most destinations you can walk in less than 30 minutes.  Pedestrians have priority over motor vehicles and streets and signs are very easy to follow.

title: Very Pretty City
reviews: I was only there for 2 days... went on a cruise but it is very clean and the sea walk alone the water is very nice way to see boats,seaplanes, mountains.

title: Beautiful downtown Vancouver: a city that delights.
reviews: Welcoming West Coast vibe! So much to see and do with the bonus of mountains and ocean! Museums, galleries, great restaurants, music, parks and so much more. Excellent shopping too.

title: Easy to walk around
reviews: We stayed in an airbnb on Burrard Street. It was a fantastic base to explore downtown. The city is diverse,from the old buildings renovated into shops/ restaurants in Gas town, to the ultra modern buildings in the CBD. We loved how easy the public transport was to navigate. But walking is the way to go. Don't miss the fish taco food truck on Burrard near the underground rail station.  Cycling around Stanley park was a highlight as too was the water taxi over to Granville Island markets.The views of the water or mountains is amazing, wether you are up high in accomodation, or on street level. A clean, safe,beautiful city.

title: clean city
reviews: very clean-that is the word I choose to discribe the city. I have been warned to stay away from E.Hastings st. by several locals. Other than that I feel safe walking around by myself. But not many tourist attractions.

title: Fantastic City!
reviews: So much to do here! Stanley Park, Granville Island, Canada Place, Gastown, Chinatown, loads of shops & restaurants, interesting architecture, & of course the picture perfect views of the water & mountains.

title: Needed more time to explore!
reviews: I was unlucky in that I only had a few hours in Vancouver, but made the most of it by walking around waterfront and through Yaletown before heading into downtown. The public library is a sight to behold. Before I left, I was lucky enough to hear some music at a street soundstage. Fabulous.

title: Visit before Rockies Tour
reviews: we stayed in downtown Vancouver for 2 nights and wandered around the City downtown area, Gastown was a good tourist area, i would not recommend wandering around Chinatown late at night if you are a nervous traveler, we found some of the less traveled streets to be less secure than we liked, there is a significant amount of homeless people in this city which is concerning, overall a good experience but to be treated with caution at night.

title: Amazing City
reviews: So much to do so much to see lots of places to visit Stanley Park, Waterfront, Art Gallery, Aquarium, Gas town, etc... However, the China town in Vancouver is the worst area. The many drugged people around that place. Just avoid this area and the rest is beautiful..

title: Vancouver downtown shopping
reviews: Just spent a full day shopping downtown Vancouver with 15-year old granddaughter.  She was absolutely delighted to be able to shop at all her favourite stores.  My hesitation is the expensive parking and in hindsight we should have taken the sky train.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: This city has a lot to do. If you like views and checking out some history this may be right for you.  We used the hop on and hop off trolly to see what we were interested in and then got off from there.  The gas town is full of restaurants shops and it seem to buzz with people all the time. There are plenty of hotels downtown and night lift actives.  All the cruise ships are also close to downtown.  I feel a great city to spend some time.  If you cruise try to plan a couple of days a head or after to visit this city.

title: Fave City
reviews: Vancouver is absolutely amazing. Downtown has amazing shopping, restaurants, beaches and parks. You can spend days exploring.

title: The one of the most beautiful city in Canada
reviews: Lots of place to visit, Stanley Park, Waterfront, Art Gallery, Aquarium, Gas town, etc...However, the China town in Vancouver is the worst one in the North America. The many drugged people around that place. Please avoid it if you can.

title: Great city great view and great shopping spree
reviews: We love going to vancouver downtown We found great food we got to see the way of city life and their vibrant. The shopping mall is incredible Hugh. Took us all day to walk around. It's a beautiful city .

title: wonderful city
reviews: It was amazing to be shopping and when you look up the panorama of the mountains was breath taking. the local people were so friendly and very proud of the city. the visit to gasstown was very well worth visiting to see first hand the beginings of this lovely city.

title: What a lovely pleasant city
reviews: Vancouver is a lovely human sized city. Downtown is where you'll find stores not just the major brands but also attractive local retail outlets. It's a pleasant place to stroll. Be sure to enjoy Granville island, nice for an outdoor meal on the harbour, a foodie walking tour, gastown, a ride in their cute little ferries, go visit the excellent museum of anthropology at the university of British Columbia - take the no 4 or 14 bus. There's loads to do. Our highlight was the "quirky food walking tour". Now that was excellent.

title: Great
reviews: We visited the downtown area as our hotel was close.We went to Robson street and more.One thing really stood out was there was plenty of nice trees in the down town area.The negative side for us and this may be due to the direction we went but there seemed to be a lack of variety in types of food to eatHowever Vancouver is a nice city and so are the Canadian people

title: Vacation 2016
reviews: Wear comfortable walking shoes. This is the best way to see downtown. Driving around is fine but you may not find any parking. Lots of stores & mom & pop restaurants which are yummy. A must stop is Tom Hortons donuts, better than Dunkin Donuts all around.

title: A must see and make sure you are on foot walking.
reviews: We did the "Tour Guys" which turned out to be fantastic and a very thorough and enjoyable way to see and hear about downtown.  Here is how Tour Guys works: meet them at a pre-arranged spot for an excellent 90 minute tour and it is free.  You tip an appropriate amount when done.  We (Wife and me) gave them $40 and felt like we got an excellent deal.

title: Tourist friendly
reviews: Hats off to vancouver there are maps of the city on every corner around the city, great public train system, free shuttle bus service and tourist advisors in blue shirts all over the city to help tourists with information

title: Walk, walk, walk
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a very walkable city and you quickly get the lay of the land as it is laid  out in a simple grid. The tall glass buildings are impressive and not boring. All the expected brands are there on Robson street. There is a fabulous selection of restaurants. Transportation is excellent and taxis are reasonable.  It gives you the feel of a very livable city if you have the means !

title: Vancover Trip
reviews: I was recently in Vancouver for business and man downtown Vancouver is great. You walk in any direction and you get a whole multitude of restaurant options it's great.

title: Clean, organized, but for a New Yorker, it's a bit too quiet
reviews: The pros:  Very clean, nice walks along the water/harbour, beautiful cruise terminal, Stanley Park is great (rent a bike and cycle around there).  The cons:Caveat, I am from NYC.  Vancouver is quiet, many retail shops are closed/no business.  Chinatown downtown is dead.  For good Chinese food, have to go to suburbs/inconvenient.

title: What's not to love!
reviews: Smooth flowing traffic, clean, we'll sign posted city centre, this City is awesome.  A gorgeous harbour with a mountain back drop. Huge Under ground shopping centre. Restaurants everywhere. I love it!Hop on hop off trolley is a great way to get around but really everything is pretty central.  It doesn't feel like a really big City. Easy to walk, mostly flat and great pedestrian space.

title: Lovely
reviews: Take a walk down Granville Street, and you'll see lots of low-priced restaurants, good pubs (Lennox, Donnelli's) were you can have a decent chow.

title: Central Shopping and Dining Area - Downtown Vancouver
reviews: We enjoyed our visit to Vancouver  The Downtown Vancouver area is where restaurants and shops are. There are bars and some major and minor attractions.  It focuses on both tourists and locals who live in the downtown area.   Its a fairly compact area so its walkable. There is both public transportation and parking garages (if one has a car).  Its a high rise area for the most part.  There are also numerous hotels in this area as well.

title: Oh No! What's happened to my home town?
reviews: Downtown, West End, used to have funky art deco brick apartment buildings.. all gone! Robson Street had diversity of small Euro shops..all gone. It's become Glass City! Architectural sameness. If it wasn't for the spectacular setting of Stanley Park, the Lion's Gate, the ever present mountain backdrop, a working harbour and ships lined up in the bay, this city would be another post 70s boom town. All the same high end stores, fancy restaurants, underground malls and shops in central CBD; you could be anywhere. Same old major dept. store chains you could find anywhere..why bother? Sad to see the city I grew up in strewn with homeless, funky old Chinatown now deserted and awful. Old Vancouver had a lot of sad industrial spaces which, yes, needed an upgrade, revitalisation; but now it's an architectural sameness; boxy glass condos.. hideous!

title: Shopping and more
reviews: Shop till you drop and all this in a rather limited surface.Downtown Vancouver is very walkable and you will find something for everyone's taste.

title: The best downtown of the universe
reviews: Vancouver is truly an exceptional, and the downtown area is a fitting representation of the city. Coal Harbour and Yale town areas are a city dweller's paradise and not to mention the beauty, coffee shops, restaurants and the bike lanes. Vancouver is the city, Seattle and San Francisco wish they ever could be.

title: Restaurants, culture, history, and the mountains
reviews: Went there for a conference. Walked miles, ran the seawall, eat at many places. It was all wonderful. Would need  lots more time to explore more fully. The downtown waterfront is beautiful.

title: Big city
reviews: Certainly a big city, complete with honking cars, street food, and buskers. There is lots to see and do, and great people to chat with.

title: Great city with lots to see and do
reviews: Stayed in downtown Vancouver for a week and there's so much to see and do.  People are friendly, it seems quite safe and the transport systems are easy, cheap and user-friendly.  Hope to return one day.

title: Cosmopolitan
reviews: Cosmopolitan city, mixture of nationalities from all around the world, great places to shop, dine... Super clean city

title: Canada Holiday
reviews: We spent 4 days in Vancouver and included wandering around downtown plenty to see and do for all ages and tastes

title: best place on earth
reviews: this area has it all, world class restaurants and shopping, exciting events and activities, all kinds of people, walk, bike, transit or drive (but parking is expensive!!!)

title: Definitely the place for food
reviews: Transformation did happen this this place since my last visited in 2012 all warehouse are replaced by cafe and restaurants. But I noticed that the homeless has greatly increase in numbers too this is definitely the down side of this place

title: Very clean and interesting
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is amazing clean for a major city downtown area.  We walked around most of the downtown area from the Marriott to the Olympic flame to the Stanley Park to the Sylvia Hotel beach area to Gastown and it was clean and we felt safe everywhere.  There are restaurants of every type from Italian to Middle East to Mexican and of course seafood.  There are also several good shopping areas a walkway along the sea wall, and a beach.  Also good mountain views.  What more could there be?  They say it rains a lot but weather was beautiful when we were there.

title: Something for Everyone
reviews: My husband and I loved riding the open-air tour bus all over downtown Vancouver. It is a hop on/hop off ride, with tickets good for all day. We were able to see many sections of downtown Vancouver, visit the waterfront, stop to eat and shop for eclectic souvenirs, then hop back on the bus. Vancouver is a beautiful city, and the shopping is great! I have visited here several times. Love it. We stayed at the Four Seasons which was a very central location for exploring the city. I only spent two days here on this trip, but this was not my first visit (it was my third). I hope to come back again. Vancouver truly has something for everyone. I also love the mild weather.

title: Good location
reviews: Easy access to most venues of interest to visitors. Great variety of shops, transportation, restaurants, activities, etc.

title: Clean and quiet
reviews: As cities go, Vancouver is pretty clean and quiet.  Electric city buses mean no smelly exhaust and they are very quiet.  And people seldom honk!  And people were friendly and helpful.

title: Beautiful downtown, some areas need work
reviews: We really enjoyed walking around downtown Vancouver.  Downtown Vancouver is a beautiful mix of new glass and steel modern high rise design and stately old brick architecture.  Unlike many cities, Vancouver's downtown streets have several landscaped courtyards between buildings that allow pedestrians to move from one street through to he next one over without having to walk entire blocks .  One area near the harbor had a beautiful stepping stone walkway through a water feature stream that turned out to be (to our utter delight) the tip of an underground parking garage!  The city has done a great job of using plants and trees and dedicated pockets of green space to make the downtown pretty.  Good bike lanes coexist with wide streets in many areas.  Some places seemed a little trashed out... As if no one had picked up the trash in a while and unfortunately it seemed that people chose to just throw trash in he ground rather than find receptacles for it.  There are a lot of restaurants and coffee shops and if you don't mind being around a lot of people or tourists, this is one of the finest downtowns around.

title: Friendly vibrant city
reviews: From our arrival in Vancouver to our departure a week later we were impressed by the friendliness of the local people and the pride they have for their city. We would thoroughly recommend the hop on- hop off bus if time is limited, a good way to see the various areas of downtown and all the drivers provided informative and clear description of the areas through which they were driving. We stayed in the English Bay Area where there are numerous restaurants and, of course, lovely sunsets.

title: What a beautiful city
reviews: What a wonderful feeling to be in such a large metropolitan city.  Easy to walk and feel safe in such a large populous, so many free activities to enjoy near the waterfront.  Gas Town is a special treat just to walk and play tourist.

title: Very Very Cool
reviews: We walked and walked and walked all over downtown and loved it...the architecture, the neighborhoods, the storefronts and shops, the harbor area and visitors center, the stadium, the restaurants...all of it.  If you're able to walk, I'd definitely recommend just heading out from wherever you are, and seeing the city that way.

title: Vancouver is the place to be
reviews: This was my first trip to Vancouver and it was like the appetizer of a dining experience. It satisfied my appetite but longed for a complete entree.In 3-4 days, pre-cruise, I had a glimpse of Chinatown, Gastown, Yaletown, Grandville, Stanley Park, Vancouver Island. Most people would say, hey, you saw it all. But the key word is "glimpse". I could adventure at least a day in each area, not to mention going outside of the downtown area.The town has so much going on and the people are so friendly, that it entices you to come back for more. And that's saying a lot when you already live in paradise.

title: Disappointed
reviews: Bus tour (hop on- hop off) was great around the environs, but China town and gas town areas were very disappointing . Dirty, unkept. Many homeless and mentally ill walk the streets and parks. One and done after 2 hours in town.

title: I walked a great deal
reviews: If you are in shape and enjoy walking, this is the way to see the city. There are fun areas of downtown to visit, Davies Street, Yaletown, Coal Harbor, Stanley Park, Granville Island, China Town, the original Chinese Garden, Canada Place. I ran out of time but would like to check out Gastown when I return, I heard it has good restaurants. We also caught the free shuttle to the Capilano Bridge. Our days were filled with fun. T

title: Awesome landscape view
reviews: I deeply love the landscape. You could see from the same point of view the city, the ocean, mountains and forest. What else?? Top. Take a lot of pics

title: Jimmy Reid's visit to Vancouver Downtown
reviews: Believe me  when I  say , to a flatlander from  WINNIPEG , , MANITOBA  , Vancouver  is one of , if not the  most  vibrant  city's in the world   , tons of fun , exciting  things to experience , for everyone  !      Jimmy  Reid

title: nothing interesting in downtown any more
reviews: big shops, malls, and over priced tourist attraction is what downtown Vancouver offers. Nothing too interesting for the locals any more. Big name brands and stores such as Holt Renfrew have taken over the landscape and not affordable to local, but to the elite rich tourists. Sign of the times...

title: Beautiful views!
reviews: Downtown is great!  Good shops, restaurants and easy to get to via public bus system.  Great views of the waterfront and you can take the ferry to the north side. Friendly people at the train station to help you navigate their public transportation system.

title: Wow what a city
reviews: Very busy with lots of different places. You can get everywhere with a bus only hope it drops you off at the right place LOL But very affordable just make sure you have COINS!!

title: Easy to navigate
reviews: You'll find your typical chain shops and restaurants in downtown Vancouver; however, was great to eat some really fresh and reasonably-priced sushi.

title: Vancouver is a Beautiful Place....
reviews: The downtown core just offers so much for the traveller. You have the benefit of almost everything you could want for a holiday. If you are staying in one of the downtown hotels, you can walk to almost anywhere for a meal or shopping. You have beautiful English Bay and its eateries at your fingertips as well as gorgeous Stanley Park. Down by English Bay, feel free to rent bicycles for your family and ride the seawall or Stanley Park. All sorts of nooks and cranny eateries along Denman and Davie Streets to enjoy and explore the international ethnic palate.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Vancouver is a great city and has a lot of attractions that are suitable for families. However, it has its own issues that you might encounter. In general, it is safe and tourist worthy.

title: New city
reviews: The whole facade of downtown Vancouver is cosmopolitan and modern, we had a great time in its varied restaurants, we found that we particularly enjoyed Korean cuisine.

title: Great City
reviews: Lots to do and I wish I had more time to see everything, easy to get around the City on public transport, really enjoyed my day.

title: A relaxed buzz about the place
reviews: Vancouver is regularly placed in the top 5 cities to live in the world and I can understand why.  It has a wonderful mix of residential, commercial, shopping, restaurants and leisure areas.  The choice of restaurants is excellent and the quality is also very good.  There are excellent parks and beaches within minutes walk.  Once you are off the main roads the side street are quiet and relaxed and is very pedestrian/bike friendly. The city is very clean as is everywhere we visited in Canada.  The city has a similar vibe to it as Melbourne, another citiy voted in the top 10 most years.

title: Vancouver: Nordstrom is a Really Great Experience!
reviews: Vancouver has SO MUCH to offer: great beaches, hikes, restaurants, theatres... Truly world class.  There's so much one can do on any day; but shopping is also a delight. I realize reviewing a chain store is odd; but a trip to/through Nordstrom's is a treat. The products are standard fare for the store (top end, etc) but what made it remarkable for me were the employees. Each person I encountered was down-to-earth; fun; interesting; and seemed to really enjoy their work.  Two fellows in the Vans area were absolutely delightful; going way beyond in terms of service. The fellow (Mclean) who sold me a pair of shoes was the most knowledgeable sales clerk I've ever encountered; more so, he was friendly and helpful. All in all... the experience made my day!!

title: Vancouver -- developers gone wild
reviews: We stayed downtown for two days and nights -- first visit.  The city is going through what seems like a messy metamorphosis -- construction is everywhere with cranes and highrises popping up faster than weeds in an abandoned school yard.  Stanley Park can be beautiful, but it is oh sooo crowded and NOISY!  There are commercial planes flying overhead taking tourists on aerial tours of the city, and they seem to frequent the area over the less crowded parts of Stanley Park.  The perimeter, which is a source of great local pride, is incredibly crowded and not at all relaxing unless you get there by 8 a.m.  One of the main roads leading to a key bridge goes right through the center of the park and it sends car noise quite a distance.  I would take Central Park in NYC or numerous parks in Britain or Golden Gate Park over Stanley Park any day.Our hotel had terrific staff and lovely service -- very clean and nice rooms, but even though on the 9th floor on the street side that was "less noisy" it was quite noisy.  We kept the air conditioning on high all night to drown out the noise.Do NOT waste your time going across that bridge to the tourist trap of the Capilano suspension bridge!  They charge $40 (Canadian) per person, and it is not connected to a major park where you can hike.  You are limited to walking around with thousands of other equally clueless tourists on raised wooden walkways from one wooden view station to another.  If you absolutely MUST go, arrive at the opening bell!There are some cute areas in Vancouver, great restaurants, and fantastic people.  Loved all the Canadiens we met and interacted with. Incredibly friendly and helpful.  Tons of high end shopping as well, although it is spread all over the place helter skelter.  City needs to have some major urban planning take place -- it's a shame how little infrastructure there is (traffic is TERRIBLE -- airport in inconvenient location.  If you are returning to Vancouver from anywhere else, you pretty much have to go through a good part of Vancouver to get to the airport and the roads are small, clogged -- literally no major freeways.

title: Shoppers dream
reviews: My husband let me out and I just  shopped till I dropped!! I felt safe. Anything you needed could be found, from high prices to low prices!  Fun day

title: Fantastic City ... One of the best !!! If not the best city in the world !!!
reviews: A magical city ( I can only talk about my visits as I've not experienced rain or grey skies) . It has it all , great views , great walks ( ESP in Stanley Park ) wonderful sets and friendly people . My kinda city üòä

title: Tourist shopping
reviews: Easy city to walk or take public transport around.  Car, bus, train or electric car. Enough to see and do Canada place a must, walk all the way around the bay.

title: WOW! So much more than expected...this city never disappoints.
reviews: It's here no matter what you want, glitz,High end shops and the best restaurants in Canada. I ‚ù§ Vancouver.

title: Beautiful downtown
reviews: The shopping was just stores we have in our mall, and as our mall is west edmonton mall i found what would be amazingly big to some coming from standard malls, was just basic for me as many wem stores are massive with 2 levels.  but good shopping and interesting selection

title: What a downtown
reviews: We only spent 2 days in Vancouver but in that short time I was ready to move there!!  Such a vibrant beautiful downtown. You could live downtown and never have to go anywhere. Shopping , dining, farmers markets entertainment. It has it all. I will come back some day and will make it a much longer visit!!

title: Very cosmopolitan
reviews: Lovely environment and water features. Clean and packed with a myriad of shops! Sons loved Nordstrom for all the facilities!

title: World Class City!
reviews: What a great place to center my visit to this area.  This is a very safe city, easy walks to many attractions, great restaurants and bars.  I plan on returning very soon and I wish there was an employment opportunity here, I'd pick up and move here in an instant.  I definitely have fallen in love with the area.

title: Happily true
reviews: All the cliches I'd heard about Canadians seemed to be true. The city had a beauty that was a match for Paris in its symmetry and a youthful vibe.  New construction and sleek class skyscrapers set off 19th century two story structures that came across as warm and funky. The harbor areas were warmly lit by the sun and the city planners did a great job weaving a complex mix of travel related open spaces and polished store fronts. Shopping leaned towards luxury stores and boutique clothing. Restaurants ranged from mom and pop ethnic to upscale gourmet. As a New Yorker I was struck by how clean the city was, how polite the pedestrians were to each other and the traffic, and the fact that there seemed to large numbers of young, fit people moving around the city's streets at all hour. Bicycle lovers will adore the city. Their imaginative adaptation of standard size streets for bike use might help New York and London.

title: Vancouver
reviews: To the amazing Premier Troudeau and fathers and mothers of Vancouver.Too many 'down and outs' particularly along Granville Street and Hastings Street. Canada and Vancouver needs to sort this out - such a great place with wonderful people - but, you can do better than this? Come on Vancouver, Come on Canada where is your humanity???

title: Nice to See
reviews: Pleasantly surpised the difference in 15 years.  The mix of buildings, the one way streets and the bus lanes.  I enjoyed the drive around downtown, but the bridge is something else, boy do they need a bigger one or another one.  The traffic jams are terrible.

title: It's a City...
reviews: People are nicer here, but has it's share of city issues - the waterfront is really nice, Canada Place is nice, Gastown cool but it's a downtown area - 'nuff said

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: I would not recommend driving, being from the US.  Lots of new signs, one way streets and traffic during the day.It is walkable.  Lots and lots of restaurantsAny and every kind of foods available at the restaurants.  Beautiful city at night.Lots of construction everywhere during the day.

title: A great city - lots to do and see
reviews: We stayed right in the middle of the city, which has just a ton of stuff to do on every block. It doesn't matter whether you are looking for "sights," good food, attractions, or whatever, this city has it. You can also purchase an unlimited bus pass for $9.00/day/person, which is even less in American dollars if you are converting money. Sometimes the buses are hard to find (for us), but it is still an efficient means for getting around. Recommendation:  do find out where the parts of town are to avoid, as there are some neighborhoods to stay away from. (We found that out.) I also highly recommend the waterfront area around the convention centers. A lot going on there!

title: Excellent place to spend a day
reviews: It is a great place with almost everything you want to look for. It has different neighborhoods with their own personalities, all kind of stores, attractions and restaurants

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: After leaving the cruise ship we had 13 hours to spend touring Vancouver (we have been here 3 times before).  Nice warm day and everyone was out and about on bikes and walking.  We used the Hop and Go.  A great day being with friendly people.

title: Accessible, Easy Walking
reviews: My husband and I had no problems finding our way around downtown Vancouver by walking. Streets are well identified, maps are available and easy to read. We did find litter and cigarette butts in some places, disappointing however, this is a very busy tourist area. All in all, a welcoming city.

title: Splendid views and venues good
reviews: We had several experiences wandering Vancouver Square at different times of the day and different days. The harbour is interesting and quite lovely. Take time read the information plaques, watch the seaplanes, have a beer and I recommend eating at the Cactus Club Cafe overlooking Coal Bay- great service and food, views summed up Vancouver experience well as the final lunch venue on our trip to Canada Vancouver and BC.

title: Happening Place
reviews: Loads of things to catch up .. Shopping, brands, street fun.. Food, weather.. All happening .. Amazing themed restaurant with great food

title: A beautiful scenic place
reviews: The Vancouver downtown is well laid out, with lot of eateries, parks, and benches . t is well connected by local transport. It is compact, and  Stanley park area is not far off.Parking is difficult to get, but good for window shopping for American tourists.

title: LOVE Vancouver
reviews: First time in Vancouver and Canada itself. Amazed by how vibrant and clean it is for a large city.  It is busy but I never felt crowded.  There is lots to do and see with mountains nearby if you want a change.  Everything is easily accessible by walking or the Canada Line.  We even took the ferry from Granville Island back to the waterfront. My time here was busy but next time we will definitely do a bike tour.  Apparently it's one of the top ways to explore the city.  I can't wait to come back - and will bring the family next time!

title: Excellent
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is absolutely excellent, how could it not be?  First it is beautiful, with the water and beaches just steps away, every kind of shopping and food possible, and SUPER easy transport by bus or skytrain.  I've heard people grumble about traffic and admittedly, we saw plenty of closed roads and detours due to construction.  However, as we were visiting and taking public transport, our experience was simply stellar.  NOTE: the buses don't take bank notes ! lol... we found out the hard way they only take coins! :)

title: Vancouver is a BEAUTIFUL City
reviews: We had been on a cruisetour that included Denali National Park, and a 7-day cruise along the coast of Alaska that ended in Vancouver.  We found Vancouver to be the best part of our entire vacation.  Vancouver is conveniently laid out, so after a Tour of the City, we were able to find our way around Vancouver.  We were told, it's also a safe city with very little crime.  The city is clean and the roads are easy to follow.  There are great restaurants and many shopping districts.  We would definitely recommend that people who are on a cruise, to consider about two extra days in Vancouver.  You won't be disappointed!

title: Beggars everywhere.
reviews: Downtown Vancouver could be a beautiful place but there are people begging on every street corner as well as drug addicts. I very rarely saw any police during the week we spent there. Something should be done to get the place cleaned up.

title: Plenty to fill a few days here - free!
reviews: Easy to get around, plenty of shopping - if that's what you like, I personally didn't do this.  Many churches, statues, buildings - Marine Building is a must and you have to go inside!  Go past the Flyover for great views looking back or over to North Vancouver - many vantage points.  A pretty clean city too.

title: A bit of everything
reviews: Downtown has some fabulous shopping (Versace Prada etc) as well as department and general stores.  Whatever you were looking for would be here!  Easy to find your way around and cafes and pubs abound.  And only a block or two from the waterfront

title: Exploring our city
reviews: My Preteen Goddaughter and I go downtown usually once a month we enjoy spending time together. We shop visit hotel lobbies and sit to people watch. We love the selection of restaurant s and coffee shops. Vancouver has a great vibe for young and old.

title: Excellent :)
reviews: What a fab place Vancouver is! From all the areas and Downtown included there's not a dull section! Just wonder the streets and I promise you won't be bored! Highly recommend :)

title: I LOVE Vancouver!!!
reviews: This was my first time to Vancouver and I absolutely love it!!  It's so beautiful with the water, the mountains and the city.  There are lots of nice restaurants.  The city isn't big so it's easy to get around.  We walked everywhere.  It's not necessary to really drive anywhere so you don't need a car.  The people for the most part were friendly.

title: A great place to eat and shop!
reviews: As well as numerous tourist attractions there a some great restaurants and shopping options. It is worth investigating your options before you visit as a lot of the restaurants have happy hours to suit different tastes.

title: Vibrant
reviews: Very metropolitan with numerous things to see, do, shop for and eat.  Something for every interest and budget

title: Wow!
reviews: Downtown vancouver is amazing. Lots to see, eat, do. Fairly easy access to everything by short walks, public transport AND DON'T FORGET  you can catch a FREE shuttle to grouse mountain and the capilano suspension bridge. But DO NOT go near hastings st it's very dodge and not very safe

title: Vancouver, what a wonderful city
reviews: I travelled with family and friends ranging from 15 years to 58 years. We all loved it. We hired a house and had 2 wonderful weeks in Vancouver, which wasn't long enough. There is so much to see and do in Vancouver. It has all of the usual attractions that a big cosmopolitan city has from museums to good shopping. However, it also has sea, beaches, forest, gardens, mountains, all within a small radius. You have downtown with all the buildings, shops and restaurants and the wonderful Stanley Park with its beaches, sea wall and walks and then not too far away Grouse Mountain and Kitsilano areas. You can go further afield to Whistler or Vancouver island, take loads of different boat trips whale watching or to different destinations. In late July early August you can enjoy the Pride festivals and the fireworks festival. I would recommend Vancouver to all ages and would love to visit again.

title: Most amazing ever
reviews: We stayed in vancouver downtown. Never have I seen a million plus people in such a clean beautiful 30 block radius. Stanley park is bigger than the sowntown core. Unbelievable. The seawall walk is like 10km around and awesome views. The restaurants are so good. Lots to do and wish i could have stayed another week.

title: Halifax's big sibling!
reviews: While the city may not be my destination of choice, I am certainly glad to have experienced Vancouver. We landed and stayed for 3 nights before making our way through the mountains. Definitely a busy city. I wondered if there was ever a "non-tourist" time to visit. We were visiting from eastern Canada but there was A LOT of tourists from out of country or at least seemed that way. Visiting Vancouver was like visiting a different country, it didn't feel like Canada but it still felt safe and mostly clean.

title: Nice area to spend time
reviews: Nice shopping on Robson street.  Many name stores.  We found multiple shopping malls underground connected to hotels.   Loaded with restaurants.  We felt safe waking all over. Loved all the coffee shops.  Nice walking the Seawall by the port.

title: So much to see and completely walkable
reviews: I was blown away with how easy it is to walk around downtown. There are many areas to see like gas light district, etc. There are a lot of places to eat and shop and you don't have to walk far. Plus didn't feel like other cities that have sketchy neighborhoods - they are probably there I just didn't see them.

title: Walk it all from Stanley Park (Georgia St) to at least GasTown
reviews: Easy to stroll up one street and down the next (I prefer east-west to north-south ambling). Be sure to have your camera (phone) for photos of the buildings ... even on a semi-sunny day, the largely glass facades of architecturally diverse high-rises reflect other buildings, old and modern, to great effect. Robson has lots of places to eat as well as great shopping. High-end stores  within a couple blocks. Merchandise can be pricey, but windowshopping is free!

title: Visited Vancouver city centre
reviews: Nothing special. No history. One day is enough. When you are used to european cities like Paris, London or Amsterdam, then Vancouver is disappointing.

title: Worth an afternoon walkaround.
reviews: Gastown, Chinatown and lots of tourist gift shops. It's a nice walk to shake off jet lag but I wouldn't rate this area as a must see. There are lots of trendy restaurants around here together with cheap tourist gift shops. Nice feel to the place but we were plagued with homeless people trying to bum a couple of dollars.

title: Massive Mall stretching Downtown
reviews: Was amazed at how the mall just continues from block to block with a massive array of shops. All reasonably priced without having those over the top tourist pricing you normally get in the tourist areas. Well worth checking out yourself without a tourist guide.

title: We love Vancouver
reviews: So much to see and do. We are already planning to come back here for our next trip. Just love this city.

title: Lots of People Always
reviews: While there are always lots of people walking around, you also have lots of options with regard to food and things to do and see. It's really a great place to experience a part Vancouver.

title: Love Downtown Quirky Shops
reviews: Great way to spend the morning shopping the quirky shops. Park near Market Square. Fort Street in Antique / Vintage shopping, including a great vinyl record store. Parking is a bit limited and meters along the street are only good for 90 minutes, which kept me running back to feed the meter, not very shopping friendly.

title: Beautifull City!
reviews: One of the best cities in Canada! Great food, shopping, and scenery! Lots of things to do inside out out, plus the tourism industry is fantastic!

title: Coastal Beauty
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a beautiful part of the city! The buildings are spectacular and the views of the mountains along the shore are breathtaking. Canada Place was certainly one of my favorite areas to take in the sites.

title: Nice mix of possibilities from lookout to galleries plus restaurants too.
reviews: We started at the lookout tower which offered panoramic views of the city, took in galleries, museums, and the seabus to Lonsdale Quay.

title: easy to navigate
reviews: Vancouver's downtown is fairly compact and easy to get around (compared to Toronto, for example). We did see quite a few homeless people and seemingly drug-addicted people in the Gastown and Chinatown areas. I live in downtown Toronto, so I'm neither shocked nor frightened by this. But it does seem that Vancouver's huge wealth and exorbitant real estate prices have created problems.

title: Happy traveler
reviews: Very nice downtown to strolling around. Art museum and water edge close by, all with walking distance. Lights after dark is definitely worth to see after wonderful dinner in waterfront.

title: Easy/Beautiful Downtown
reviews: Vancouver downtown is easy to navigate and has many wonderful shopping centers including a huge Nordstrom's. In addition, it is walking distance to the water and Gastown. It is beautiful with flowers and man-made waterfalls everywhere. It is a wonderful place to visit.

title: Second time in Vancouver and will go again!
reviews: Last yard we went up the Grouse mountain and had lots of fun, so this time we went to Vancouver for 1 day only and decided to get to explore the downtown and the oceanfront better. The day was beatiful and we did not want to go shopping, etc., just walked around, taking pictures, watching the Steam clock, seeing the Olympic torch, the multitude of seaplanes landing and taking off, cruise ship leaving and so on. It was peaceful and relaxing. We left the gardens for the next year!

title: Crowded
reviews: Typical city, with a lovely skyline.  Very very crowded all the time, with skateboarders zooming around  you on the sidewalk

title: Vancouver, I love you
reviews: My favourite city in the whole world, downtown Vancouver is vibrant, lovely, exciting and alive with diversity and energy. All sorts of food, shopping, entertainment options. ..I never have enough time to visit and see everything I want in one trip.

title: Another fun visit to Vancouver
reviews: There is always so much to do and see in Vancouver.  I never get tired of visiting.  Today we went up primarily for the Gem show at Kitsilano Community Centre.  But we also got out to other parts of the city.  I love the people watching and on beautiful summer days lots of people are out.  The is a city worth visiting many times.

title: Gastown and Chinatown
reviews: Got off the sky train at Chinatown and walked around there first.  Gastown and the waterfront are within walking distance.  Make sure you stop and wait for the clock to whistle in Gastown.  Love the atmosphere of Gastown.

title: What a Beautiful City to visit!
reviews: We stayed within walking distance of Downtown.  The harbor area and downtown were very clean.  The people were extremely friendly.  For a large city it still had a comfortable small town feel.  I would recommend this city to anyone who desires to kck  back and enjoy life.

title: Stunning and very walkable
reviews: What a great city!  Great architecture, stunning views and great public transport.  Didn't have a bad meal there in 6 days.Be aware though, that Vancouver has a severe homeless problem.  A combination of high housing costs, drugs, comfortable climate and unmet mental health needs have lead to a high number of homeless people you will see everywhere in the city.  Making room for everyone seems to be this city's biggest challenge.

title: lovely
reviews: love to walk around these streets, buy, etca clean, organized, safe city center always want to come backfrom arriving in the airport up to horseshoe bay to nanaimo, everything there is perfect formeif Icould I'm gonna live there

title: Bustling metropolis!
reviews: We stayed in the downtown area and loved it. Be careful though of panhandlers and poor people sleeping in the streets.  Other than that, walking down the streets is very fun and you hear a variety of languages from all the visitors. Navigation is very easy as well, as everything is basically within walking distance or a quick ride on the bus.  We didn't walk many streets once the stores closed since we weren't familiar with the area. At most in the evening, we walked around our block to the nearest Tim Horton's.

title: Beautiful Downtown area
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city flanked by the Ocean on one side and the mountains on the other . The downtown area has the mandatory tall buildings , bustling markets and a variety of restaurants . It has a pretty waterfront area where seaplanes and speedboats are parked and plenty of green areas to sit and relax . There is the Chinatown and also the Gastown which is the old part of Vancouver .

title: Walkable, cosmopolitan, but a lot of homeless people
reviews: We stayed in Downtown Vancouver for 5 days. It is all walkable. We liked Stanley Park, Robson Street and the Waterfront area. You have the cosmopolitan city and nature all in one place and you don't get that in many cities. The one downside is the sheer number of homeless people. I frequently go to London and Paris, but in Vancouver there are very large numbers, and they are all over Downtown, at times I felt intimidated. It seems that Vancouver needs to look after its homeless better.

title: Beautiful
reviews: Really is a beautiful city to visit. Very scenic and lots of cafes. The olympic torch is displayed in the centre of town. I will come back to visit longer next time.

title: A beautiful city.
reviews: The best way to understand a city is to walk through it and this is a pleasant and convenient way of seeing Vancouver. We walked from the Sandman Hotel to Stanley Park via Gastown, Canada Place and Coal Harbour, returning via Georgia Street. Our grandson, for whom this was his first time in a North American city, was very impressed with the high-rise buildings, but also the more historic ones, such as the old railway hotel and the.Hudson's Bay store.

title: Walking Self Tours
reviews: We were in Vancouver for 6 days and walked downtown toward Gastown from Davie and Burrard. The streets between Burrard and Hamilton have plenty of places to eat, find a cup of coffee, and sit at several parks.  When you reach the waterfront you may see a tourist liner or two docked or just arriving. For the adventurous there are seaplane tours, reasonably priced also.  If you prefer to see quieter neighborhoods then stroll along tree lined walks northwestward going to the West End between Davie and West George Streets. There is lots to see, you don't have to spend any money, and the sidewalks are even pleasant for walking.

title: So Much To Do & See
reviews: I have been to Vancouver a few times now and it always has something new to offer, the places to eat, the shops, the attractions.Love being on the waterfront looking out while having a nice big coffee !

title: Great getaway
reviews: My husband and I visited Bellingham, WA and took a shirt 45 minute ride to Canada! Vancouver is a beautiful city! The skyline is magnificent. We visited Lynn Canyon park and hikes through beautiful mountains and water falls for FREE!

title: Vancover
reviews: We found most of the city to be dirty and lined, literally, with street people and homeless people. Other parts, smaller percentage, were  beautiful.

title: Bustling spot
reviews: Lots of wonderful stores both high end and others.  Cafes and restaurants abound.  The transit system is easy to use.  Even though it is supposed to be a bike friendly city I had two bad experiences with bikers who thought that they owned the bicycle paths and the sidewalk.  Yikes.

title: Very robust, modern and diverse city!
reviews: We spent a day before our cruise and a day after our cruise and we wished we had more time to explore all Vancouver has to offer.  Whistler Mountain is only an hour and a half away plus all that there is to do in the city.  Great parks, Great views, Great pubs, Great restaurants, Great everything!

title: Loads to see
reviews: A great walking town, lots to see along the waterfront, great restaurants, shops.  There are a lot of street people, but they are usually friendly and not aggressive, just a reflection of where our society is at these days.

title: Beautiful VAN
reviews: This a great walking city set on the Pacific Ocean. VAN Harbour is right there and you many explore shopping on Robson Street, or walk along the shore in Coal Harbour or visit Stanley Park.

title: It's not crowded
reviews: Everyone kept telling us that Vancouver streets are crowded. We stayed on Hamilton and Robson and walked all  down town and found the city traffic and pedestrians very light.  It made fur pleasant walking around

title: A Vibe and Pretty City
reviews: The inside story to the cities regeneration and architectural evolution is fascinating, take the time to get the insight and a lot of the art projects and buildings make sense.We loved downtown, from vibe Robson street with shops that stay open till 11pm, the shopping options are great, the triple story active sports store opposite Noordstroom was a highlight to our shopping. Great restaurants and food to choose from and a 'star bucks' on just about every corner.Urban Fare was our local shopping store for our daily supplies, best fresh fruit and baked goods with an early morning fresh breakfast.We managed to get in a football game with the BC Lions at there amazing stadium.The city is always alive and bussing with cultural activity; highlights of entertainment in the city was the Jazz festival, Picaso display always accompanied by the food trucks that followed the various festivities.( beware with getting indigestion after over indulging on the ongoing display of food.)

title: Expensive parking
reviews: Great range of shops, currently with some good sales in many of them.  There were a couple of shops on Robson street I just wanted to pop into - 25c for 3 3/4 minutes soon mounts up!!  Very colourful area, worth going to see at night.

title: Great shopping
reviews: Wonderful shopping for those from the states. Major summer discounts and great weather. There isn't much else to do in downtown Vancouver. However, the views are amazing and if you're not in a hurry this city has a lot to offer in great weather and relaxed strolls through the streets.

title: Vancouver
reviews: Prohibition and Pour Housewere two great mixed drink bars.  Gastown is a must to walk through during the day or dinner/drinks at night.  Enjoyed Lupo, Lift and the Flying Pig for food.

title: Pretty clean for a downtown city
reviews: I like how clean down town Vancouver is. The transit system is easy to get around and they have a plethora of restaurants to enjoy. Near coal bay is great for biking and jogging. The bike lanes around the city are great too. So much to do with all the little parks and recreational activities at your fingertips in this city. I can't wait to go back. Not to many places you can golf, boat, and ski in all the same day.

title: Granville
reviews: For those not accustomed to Granville area. There are a lot of homeless people and it is quitter dirty. Not as bad as Hastings street, but be aware.

title: A very comfortable downtown to walk around in
reviews: It is totally walkable on foot! Loved it so much. The streets are clean and wide. Many shopping experiences with some good offers :))))

title: Great city
reviews: Stay centrally for great hotels, restaurants, shopping.  The public transportation is great.  The city is very walkable and much cleaner than one would expect for such a large downtown.

title: Pedestrian and bike friendly.
reviews: I've been to New York three times, and I love it there. But I have to say that  Vancouver is my new favourite downtown. I have never been anywhere that caters to pedestrians and cyclists as well as this place. Everyone was friendly, and the restaurants and the street life was fantastic.

title: If you visiting for the day, renting a bike is a must
reviews: We were downtown for the day and decided to rent bikes.  It was a great way to see downtown and it was very safe due to all the bike lanes.  It was relatively easy to ride around because it was so flat.

title: Lovely
reviews: Seabus to Grouse Mountain from here; Gastown very interesting; Chinatown exciting; great connections from airport; lovely people; nice restaurants.Go there!

title: Clean and Beautiful
reviews: I was surprised how much larger downtown Vancouver was than I expected.  It's also one of the more clean cities I've been too.  The traffic totally sucks, but it's very walker friendly and worth it.

title: Marine Building, Convention Center, Canada Place
reviews: One of the best ways to discover downtown is to subscribe to a tour with the Architectural Institute of British Columbia (AIBC). The founding and development of the city is really well explained across the architectural evolution of the building constructions throughout the last 150 hears.

title: Get a good impression of Vancouver
reviews: Vancouver is a business town, expensive, some good restaurants to go, a lot of nice shops but really expensive.

title: Very Pretty
reviews: We took the trolley Bus tour around the downtown area. So many beautiful buildings. We didn't do any walking around or try any restaurants but our tour guide suggested quite a few, maybe next time.

title: Great place for exercise
reviews: Peaceful walk next to bay.  Watch out for the bicycling... but a wonderful walk or ride.  The city further in has great shopping and lots of wonderful places to eat

title: Walkable Downtown
reviews: We walked around downtown with no issues. The buses can be a bit confusing, but locals were willing to help. Shops and the business district seem to intermingle seamlessly. Would hate to drive and park though.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city with many areas to explore.  From the Harbourfront to Stanley Park and throughout the entire downtown area we felt safe and enjoyed the scenery

title: Great place to stay if you want to see the city.
reviews: We stayed in the heart of downtown and thoroughly enjoyed it.  You're just a few minutes away from almost anything to do, see, or eat.  We will definitely be going back in the future and spending a bit more time in the area, 3 days just wasn't enough.

title: Premier Shopping
reviews: Vancouver downtown has some of the best shopping & restaurants in the world!  The Downtown is very clean, friendly & safe.

title: Amazing place
reviews: Downtown area it's just an amazing place to visit or incredeable place to stay üòò. They offer a Lot of beautiful things just love this city a Lot ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Beautiful Town
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has a lot of different sections.  Granville Island, Gasslight district, ship terminal area and lots of other interesting areas.  Sky train makes downtown easy access to the airport.  Great place to visit for a few days.

title: A Beautiful Area To Enjoy By Foot
reviews: The downtown area of Vancouver is absolutely beautiful.  You can easily walk the city streets as well as walk along the bay.  The bay offers stunning views of the city and the surrounding mountains.  You can watch the sea planes land and take off and catch one of the many cruise ships that visit during the Alaska Season.

title: Between Robson Rd and Canada place ...nothing else to see
reviews: Vancouver has a huge downtown area and becareful ... do not go towards the east side ... trust me ... nothing is there to see.stick to the upper downtown around the Canada place as that is where all the action takes place. if you can afford any of the sea front hotels then you are in the best part of the city.Parking is everywhere and under almost every hotel and office buildings open to the public almost the same price as the streat parking spots.This might be an attraction for a couple or a single traveler but not much fun for family with small children.

title: A lot of shops and happenings
reviews: We like to walk downtown as all is feasible by walk...top shopping mall and good restaurants nearby. Close to harbour and sea plane and cruise liners

title: Vancouver Downtown experience
reviews: Clean city precincts with varied architecture interspersed with vegetation aiming to make Vancouver the greenest city on the planet by 2020. Public transport-bus,train, metrorail,is  punctual and a cost effective option when one is not walking in the city.

title: Nice city
reviews: I enjoyed my stay in Vancouver.  It's a nice city with lots to do.  There was a heat wave when we visited and unfortunately most places do not have air conditioning.

title: Easy to access, beautiful scenery, but some places are pricey
reviews: The scenery (without question) is beautiful.  You can get an all day pass for the mass transit system for about 10 Canadian dollars.  You can get around easily.   Some of places are pricey.  However, there is something for everyone.  You have to visit Downtown Vancouver.

title: Not so peaceful!
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city with lots to do and see.  The skyline is very impressive and it has excellent restaurants and easy to get around.  It is truly an international city.  All nations are represented   The drawback is their homeless people.  They are everywhere, sleeping on a busy street corner and very aggressive.  They would panhandle us and yell at us when we would not give them a handout.  My wife was intimidated by them and would not go to the washroom by herself.

title: Great Shopping.
reviews: Only had a day in Vancouver - great shopping and one of the largest Nordstrom's I have ever encountered.  Lots of fun little shops and most of the major stores.

title: A Good Walk down a Busy Sector
reviews: We had some time to kill, so we went walking downtown. There were many people as the pride parade was taking place. In certain sections it smells like pee, but otherwise it's a pleasant walk. Since I err on the safe side, I cluthed my purse the entire time. I felt safe enough, but for peace of mind I made sure to have one hand on my purse.There are many pedestrian walkways there, so J walking was definitely minimal.

title: Great city
reviews: Safe and cool vibe been here so many times never any hassles just stay away frim east hustings where the drug and homeless problem abounds

title: Yeah so...
reviews: I lived here many years ago, it's changed, I expected that but, I now think Vancouver is worse than Toronto and that takes some doing.More people on the streets than I have ever seen in Toronto, it's not clean, and the people have an attitude that makes the snobbery of Toronto look quaint.I get it, it's west coast, but seriously it could be much better.It'd got buildings and sun and it's ok to walk around, but, it's nothing special.

title: Wonderful City, Easy to Get Around
reviews: There is so much to do in this fun city and it's very easy to get around. I recommend getting a Compass Pass for the day ($9.75C adult, $$7.50C youth/student). It's a great deal and gives you unlimited use of public transportation. The buses/trains run everywhere. Get the Compass Pass at a Shoppers or London Drugs. There are very nice parks and outdoor spaces, beautiful walks along the waterfront, access to Stanley Park, and a wide variety of places to eat and relax.

title: Downtown Vancouver, BC, Canada
reviews: The downtown area of Vancouver is beautiful.  It is loaded with shopping, restaurants, and sits to visit.  The train/subway system is excellent and affordable.  The landscapes vary from seaport to mountain peaks.  It is a city surrounded by eye candy.  You wont get bored visiting this city.  We were on a Princess Cruise ship that departed from Canada Place.  We decided to fly in from Tampa, FL a day early to be able to enjoy the city a little more.  It was well worth it.

title: Clean and beautiful
reviews: What a wonderful city to walk around and enjoy. Very safe and streets are easy to follow. Lots of greenery and people to observe.

title: Whenever I am In Vancouver, It's A Must!
reviews: Living only a 3 hour drive away, and only a 35-40 minute flight away. Downtown Vancouver is always a must stop for me whenever I am in the city. If I am in the city for a day, a few days, or a week - there is always so much to do and so much see in downtown Vancouver. If you have the ability to travel to Vancouver in the late spring/summer, you can be treated to some very nice weather. Making touring around downtown Vancouver very enjoyable, and giving you lots of options to do different things!

title: One of the nicer down towns in Northern America.
reviews: It is a very safe , full of shops and restaurants with adequate public transportation downtown. Lots of tourists around and everything close by, it is not very clean and traffic can be a problem, but hey, its down town

title: Vacation
reviews: Busy, busy, busy is the word I would use to describe downtown Vancouver. Lots of different businesses to go to. There was a lot of hustling and bustling going on.

title: Watch out where you are when walking!
reviews: Much of the Vancouver downtown area is very nice and interesting, but if you travel by foot, be careful not to inadvertently stray into the area between Gastown and Chinatown, which appeared on the maps to be contiguous. They are NOT!. We were warned by several people when we stopped for lunch en route to Chinatown, but thought that the maps were correct, and in just one more block we would be there. WRONG, WRONG, WRONG! What we found was a very scary area, with scores of drug dealers operating and drug users openly using in full view on the street. When I decided to call for a cab to extricate ourselves from this mess, we found that few ventured through those streets. Thankfully, one arrived about 30 minutes later to extricate us from that hellhole.

title: People friendly.
reviews: Vancouver has to be one of the most friendly and cleanest cities I have ever been to, just to walk around this city and look at the amazing building is great.

title: More beautiful then expected
reviews: I always heard that vancouver was beautiful but it has a smaller city feel. Nice cheap cab drivers and very friendly. Easy to get around walking or transit. Very nice laid back people.

title: Nice downtown
reviews: Very nice downtown, with a Great Peer, Steam Clock, a lor of Shops. You can see the great Cruise Ships, waterplanes and a Little walk to China town

title: So much to do
reviews: I love downtown Vancouver. One of the best cities to visit, and just spend the day walking and shopping on hastings street. Canada place is so unique same as the waterfront. Love being there

title: Lots of homeless people
reviews: I stayed in Robson Street which is in the West End downtown near Stanley Park  the area is a very gay friendly area there are lots and lots of homeless people . The Vancouver government should get in there and do something because this is a main tourist area  bit of a shock  .They should remove the homeless and put them into special housing not doing enough to look after the homeless people . Could not buy a cold beer anywhere

title: Good variety something missing
reviews: We have a great look and shop around in Vancouver downtown. My wife especially liked the upmarket shop of Holt Renfrew where our credit card good a bit of a beating. An easy city to walk around as its in a simple grid. Would have a bit more character if there was some street food is hotdogs or similar? Just feels like there is something missing - not much activity even down by the water except for the odd extremely muscled up man or woman posing for photos in very excessive fake tan and skimpy outfits - bizarre.

title: Lots of options
reviews: Downtown Vancouver offers an almost endless variety of options. We stayed at the Burrard Hotel on Burrard Street and walked, took cabs, and used the skytrain from there to reach other parts of the central city and Steveston, south of Richmond. We walked Yaletown and enjoyed the variety of shops and eating establishments. We walked back from Stanley Park on Davie Street and it was enjoyable, with again, lots of shops and restaurants, and a gay district. The community garden on Davie and Burrard intersection was fun to see and near our hotel. We ate in Gastown twice and recommend it for strolling and shopping, as well. Walking in downtown afforded a variety of architectural sites like Robson Square and the art museum. Beautiful vistas can be found from every edge of the peninsula the city center rests on.  We enjoyed Vancouver and plan to go back!

title: Wonderful
reviews: Great city center!  Lots of shops, restaurants, and housing.  Summer is an awesome time to go.  We really enjoyed our few days here.

title: Exploring by foot
reviews: Such a beautiful city. Only here for a night but totally enjoyed our time here. Lots to see and do. Walked by the pier and loved the shops along the way. The disney cruise ship was in the day we were there so it was extra busy.

title: Go shopping see the sights
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is perfect spot  for shopping and a good meal. There are several shops in all pricing ranges! Also visit Yale Town and Gastown. Granville Island is also a must.

title: Downtown
reviews: We stayed two days in Vancouver and we're very impressed with the shuttles and busses and how friendly and helpful the staff were. It was also a pleasant surprise how clean everything was.

title: Old downtown was interesting!
reviews: Older buildings housing shops, gift shops and pubs and restaurants. Pleasant walk, safe area, lots to see and do.

title: Easy walking, shopping, and eating.
reviews: We walked everywhere and had a great time. There are so many gift shops, luxury clothing stores, and fine restaurants that you don't need to go far.

title: Great area for shops and eating!
reviews: Fabulous district in Van, well worth a visit for families, solo, couples. Lots of restaurants / cafes and shops. Quite an eclectic place.

title: Amazing!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is mostly clean (Vancouver is very well known for being a very green and very clean city). There are so many shops and restaurants to check out. My favorite places to go are near gas town (which is around the northern end of downtown, by the water). There are some great bars and restaurants. The views are also amazing! Find a nice bar near the water in the late afternoon to hang out at and enjoy the views. The only downside to downtown Vancouver is that there are a lot of homeless people and druggies. However you could say the same for just about any downtown area in the world. Vancouver is much cleaner than most downtowns.

title: Checking out Downtown
reviews: As long as I've lived/worked here it's amazing that I can always see something new and interesting every time. From the 'Food Trucks' that dot various areas, to the Buskers, and yes - the Panhandlers too...they're always changing.Its a safe City for Travellers, but as always just be aware of your surroundings. Overall, its a great place - even for a "Staycation".Enjoy!!!

title: My New Favorite City!
reviews: Love the city - surrounded by water, with friendly people and lots of different places to see.  And a great selection of restaurants, with the freshest seafood, excellent Asian food, just all-around great!!

title: Small enough to see!!
reviews: I love the food that is on Robson!  Love the food around Gasstown.  Love the beach and love everything about it.  So beautiful!

title: Attractions of Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Spent 4 days in Vancouver before and after an Alaskan Cruise.  Lovely city with lots to do including highlights for me of Grouse Mountain, Stanley Park, Gastown, the Lookout and Granville Island.  However I was distressed to witness the large numbers of rough sleepers and beggars, practically on the corner of every block in the main downtown area.  Waht is going on?

title: One visit here is enough
reviews: Vancouver is over priced and over rated.Traffic is a nightmare. Running the gauntlet down East Hastings past the filth and homeless people to get to Stanley park is frightening. That piece of the city is shameful and desperately needs to be cleaned up.I don't plan on visiting vancouver again.

title: Lots to see, do, eat, great place
reviews: Downtown is interesting, Gas Town is not to be missed, even if it's super popular. I really enjoyed being close to the local beaches along the waterfront. Great dining and drink options. Wasn't my favorite thing about Vancouver, but still really nice to enjoy after a fun day of biking and sightseeing.

title: Inspiring Setting, World Class Parks
reviews: Vancouver reminds me very much of Sydney, Australia. The setting is so lovely, with mountains, sea, river, and the great Mt. Baker volcano as backdrops, that a walk or a ride simply inspires. Not many cities can feel this good! Stanley Park, right downtown, is one of the greatest urban parks in the world with totem poles, never-ending views, ancient trees, and a world-class aquarium. The downtown area has many magnetic neighborhoods and restaurants, with glassy apartment buildings that will excite or bore you depending on your taste. Culture is not as exciting as New York, Chicago or even LA, but you can't have everything. Shoreline parks such as Jericho Beach, Kitsilano, Spanish Banks, will make you want to live here (but check your bank account). SunYat Sen garden will inspire. There used to be endless cheap ethnic restaurants in town but these, while still present, have succumbed to the urbanization and wealth. Granville Island is great fun and is fun to walk around and see the market and so many shops. This is a great town, lots of fun. Maybe losing its soul like Seattle, but filled with things to do and always that beautiful setting.

title: Compact cosmopolitan centre
reviews: It's all quite walkable the city centre. In fact we crossed it many times in a day. Shopping dining and exploring. This is a great city for tourists, so easy to get around!

title: Clean and friendly
reviews: We stayed at a hotel downtown and had access to everything we needed with a toddler. We only discovered the playground downtown on our last day but it was great!

title: Get outta downtown
reviews: Vancouver is a wonderful city and you should visit it, but downtown (where I work) is generic sterile concrete.  Head for the waterfront or Granville Island or Commercial Drive or an island. There's good food downtown though.

title: Loved downtown Vancouver
reviews: Just loved downtown Vancouver. The streets are sp beautiful with large maple tress and beautiful fresh flower baskets on ther lamp posts. Very impressed with this city. Must return.

title: Sooo much to do!
reviews: Instead of getting into a lot of detail, which a lot of reviews already do, I just want to encourage you to checkout downtown Vancouver. There is sooo much to do - too much for a quick visit. I love just wandering around, from Stanley Park to Granville Island to English Bay beach to the harbour to Robson and Gastown, there is so much to see and do. One of the most difficult things is to choose one of the many awesome places to eat! Enjoy your visit and bring some good walking shoes!

title: Dream City
reviews: Vancouver in general is simply fabulous. Period. The downtown / Coal Harbour area is heaven on earth. Walkable, clean, great public spaces, great restaurants of all types. People are pleasant and I always felt safe.

title: Walkers Rejoice
reviews: Vancouver Downtown is made for walking. And this place is walkable all year round. The streets are very well treed and the city takes pride in landscaping. The recent addition of bike lanes on streets such as Hornby has made walking around even more pleasurable. There is a great diversity of buildings with a good mix of heritage and glass. There are multiple focal points--Georgia and Granville and around Vancouver Art Gallery--where you can see people of all ages in transit. You can shop at Nordstrom, Hudson's Bay or get chocolates or other necessities at London Drugs or Shoppers Drugmart. There are many eating options catering to every budget and preferences. To take a break from the bustle, seek out hidden gardens such as the one at the BC law court complex and the one outside of Bill Reid's West Coast Art Gallery. Of course there is always the waterfront with spectacular scenery and abundance of seating for rest and people watching. And before you know it , it is time to sample the local coffee culture again.

title: Don't drive there.
reviews: Not car friendly and the bus service is just so so.  Bickcycles seem to be King, Find it very crowded during office hours. Go shopping in the evening. Lots of high end stores on Robson St. and pacific center, Expensive restaurants. Vancouver is a very expensive city. Not the place if you are on a budget. Get out of Vancouver and discover Beautiful British Columbia.

title: WALK WALK WALK
reviews: Parking can be expensive $15 to $25 (cdn) per day , if you are staying downtown put on your walking shoes and take a map, locals are helpful and  will give you directions to various landmarks. Restaurants are numerous and all well priced.

title: Well worth a visit
reviews: This region is sure great to see. Many shops and historic areas we were there for Canada day and not did they celebrate. Music food and plenty to see. The hop on hop off bus is a terrific day to see the city so many areas you wouldn't see without this service.

title: Large, bustling downtown, that provides a lot of scenery.
reviews: Let's be candid, downtowns in many cities are often skipped by tourist because of the homeless situation.  Vancouver however does not feel threatening and no one was aggressive.  The skyline was very scenic on our first day, but the clouds made for poor photos on our second.  Here are a few quick hots.

title: Vancouver is a must see destination.
reviews: So many great buildings, museums, shops and eateries. Beautiful city, easily accessible with public transit. Stanley Park, beaches and beautiful mountains right on the doorstep.

title: Trendy awesome part
reviews: Skyscrapers, fashion shops, fantastic restaurants, great views. A place where you really can enjoy of whatever you wish to do in Vancouver

title: Beautiful
reviews: We were in Vancouver for a day before our cruise and lucked out to have perfect weather.  I ended up taking 50 pictures walking the waterfront before we ever boarded our ship.  There are wonderful little mom and pop shops mixed in with franchise chains in a modern classy looking town.  The views of the mountains are wonderful and watching the seaplanes land is a fun way to kill sometime.  We are already planning a trip back to spend a few days in Vancouver because of the downtown and waterfront area.

title: Fantastic shopping
reviews: An area worth visiting day or night, we shopped during the day with odd snack then in the evening returned for meals, we stayed on the outskirts which meant we came in the day time done the major stores, some good sales my wife told me but I never got to the bottom of the prices. As with all major cities the normal Hustle and Bustle at night more calm and ease to drive to your favourite restaurant.

title: great downtown
reviews: great downtown for a stroll in Gastown and other places. Buildings are trending and nicely done. very clean environment, shopping are OK but small restos are good.

title: Has its nice areas
reviews: The city center of Vancouver isn't unlike other big cities. There's shopping in chain stores and places to eat or get coffee.It seems pretty relaxed though and you are not in the shadow of tall skyscrapers all the time plus there are a lot of food choices and specials. In one direction is beautiful parks and the waterfront. In the other direction you run into a lot of homeless people and dirty streets. It feels quite safe even at night and it's easy to get there with the skytrain.

title: Best West Coast City
reviews: As a San Diegan, it is hard to admit that another city is nicer/better . . . we have such good weather and all, BUT without a doubt Vancouver is an amazing place to visit (and probably to live).  Mild climate for the latitude, good transportation, close to many different scenic venues, and a fantastic food scene.  The blending of different cultures over the past few centuries has resulted a city that is vibrant and progressive while retaining its important historical roots.

title: Good for walking
reviews: Stayed at Pan Pacific, easy walk to shopping, restaurants, attractions.  Good, safe place to stroll in daylight.

title: Intersting city
reviews: The trees and flowers throughout the city are amazing.  It makes the city so pretty and refreshing. The city is vibrant and alive - people out all the time.  Public transportation is generally reliable - although we did wait a long time for a bus and found out a couple had broken down but we were told that this is unusual.

title: Great Downtown.
reviews: The Downtown of Vancouver has lots to offer and generally is safe and clean.  It's a nice place to shop, eat and explore!

title: Great place for walking
reviews: Downtown is lovely place to walk. Lots of people to see and the general hustle and bustle is neat. Felt very safe throughout the day and night. Great cafes and bar all over.

title: Nice city to visit
reviews: Beautiful city to visit. Lots to do and see. Robson street, Yaletown, Gastown, Pacific Center Mall, Vancouver Art Museum - you can walk to all these places while enjoying the lush greenery of trees. Lots of places to eat. One great way to see the  city is to rent a bike. You can also cycle around beautiful Stanley Park. If it isn't raining, this city is wonderful.

title: Beautiful and Modern
reviews: Beautiful city, but expensive.  Has modern appeal with some unique architecture; favorite location for movie productions.  Downtown is major access to the harbor area.  A lot of shopping downtown, and close to the other two major areas of Gas Town and China Town.

title: VANCOUVER IS THE BEST DOWNTOWN I NORTH AMERICA!!!
reviews: SAFE!  Has everything!  Is close to everything!  We stayed at the downtown Fairmont hotel (great hotel in its own right). Canada Place, Gas Town and much more is only a short walk away. It's easy to jump on and off the trolley to visit other parts of town. Taxis are close by. Many restaurants, entertainment & nightclubs, shopping, arts and the list goes on. Great city to stroll the streets or people watch. Vancouver is everything all the big cities would like to be!  If you don't have a good time in Vancouver it has to be your own fault.
