title: Easy to walk everywhere
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is like a lot of downtown modern cities.  It is clean, easy to walk around and filled with hotels and coffee shops along the way.Not too much to really look at from a visitor's point of view but  surrounded by water and the waterfront walks are really beautiful if you have the time.

title: Amazing Options!
reviews: There is so much to see and do in the downtown area! Many dining options, shopping, and the streets are clean and not crowded. One of my favorite activities was spotting rich cars.

title: Bland
reviews: Not much. A mall. Some shops. Lots closed since I last lived there, and Granville Street's lost some of the charm, given over to chain stores and restaurants and a bit buttoned up by evening.

title: Just another city
reviews: The city is mostly like other cities in the States: large buildings, many shops. In Gastown there's a nice atmosphere, but overall I was not impressed.

title: Walkable Downtown With Light & Airy Feeling Between The Tall Buildings
reviews: Although Vancouver Downtown has plenty of tall buildings, it retains a much more light and airy feeling than cities such as New York, London or Shanghai.  This makes walking the downtown a very pleasant experience.

title: Clean pleasant city to stroll
reviews: We strolled about the city when walking to restaurants and shops . Very clean pleasant safe and friendly.  Plenty of shops and restaurants nearby . Always felt safe . Seems to be a pretty relaxed atmosphere around the downtown area . Always something happening and a very trendy hip vibe about the area . Loved it

title: Traffic Chaos
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is not car friendly. All the construction, road repair, expensive parking, lots of traffic makes going downtown frustrating. I usually visit Vancouver without a car  except on this visit and take the sky train.  The sky train is great and walking downtown is easy and lots of great attraction and sights.

title: Family vacation
reviews: Great vity. Clean, beautiful and fill of fun activities for all ages. Restaurants abound and there a wide variety of hotels in various price ranges. Traffic can be a bit of a problem so you have to factor potential delays into your plans. Don't miss the park and all the activities that take place there.

title: 3 day stop
reviews: Love downtown Vancouver as great mix of shops, eating places, attractions and quiet residential streets amazingly.  Whole family loved the experience.

title: Small compact downtown area
reviews: Just loved this area especially for its architecture. The restoration works have been done very sympathetically and are a delight

title: Great City
reviews: wonderful restaurants, shops, and clean streets.  Love the quaint parks and everywhere is close in walking distance.  If you want to take a short drive out of the city only takes 10 mins to great attractions.  Lots of history and beautiful buildings.  Airport is close enough if you want to take a taxi instead of renting a car.

title: Amazing walking city
reviews: The setting doesn't get much more dramatic than this! Lots of parks and lots of great attractions, beaches, restaurants etc. It's a pity that not everyone can share in this city's glory though and the homeless and desperate on Vancouver's streets put us to shame.

title: A city with two sides
reviews: Ones view of downtown will depend on how much you have explored. When i arrived at my hotel they advised the further east you go the worse it gets. The areas from stanley park to the waterfront area are simply beautiful and the envy of any city. However once you head to areas such as gastown, chinatown and parts of yaletown the number of homeless people is difficult to ignore. It is quite staggering. They seemed harmless but its quite confronting to see such large numbers in a city like vancouver.

title: Great walking city
reviews: We started at the Tower at Harbor Center which has a great view of the city. You have to check out the Food Court down in the underground section. It has a wide array of food to choose from and some souvenir shops. Then we  walked to the Sports Museum at the Sports center. Even though you may not be Canadian you will be a Canadian sports fan by the time you leave. Great interactive things for kids and adults. If you plan on two or three hours to feel that you have seen it all. The key to the city is parking, you can park in a garage for $20 for five hours and walk around. Make sure you write the intersection of your garage. Believe me it will come in handy.

title: European in Vancouver
reviews: Well, this is one of the hardest reviews...Vancouver is full of extremes...Downtown from Canada Place to Stanley Park is awesome, very well maintained and welcoming. The other direction with little stores and restaurants is also fine. The direction to Granville Island is getting worse by every block. The direction and the area of Chinatown is a disaster. There is a whole street of homeless people living there plus a lot of rubbish everywhere. You see them sitting, sleeping, talking, just living there. They don't fight and don't bother tourists but still, it is really bothering. When we ask local people, they say that Toronto sends them from time to time with a one way ticket...Finally, the city is very rich so you see fancy people in fancy cars, great hotels and world class food. At the same time, it is at top of the list of least affordable places for local people. Very complicated and not easy to understand ...

title: Food, Shopping and Walking
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has a bit of something to do for everyone. Lots of shops of all budgets, lots of eateries, carts and overall great walk. Although some of the streets do have a lot of homeless people not harmful though but also can't be really sure.

title: A city with so much to offer
reviews: As a student some 35 years ago, I loved going into downtown Vancouver, for the food and shopping.  There are more shops now and more fine dining.  I still love this place very much.

title: SHOPPING
reviews: I simply enjoyed walking and shopping.  It reminded me a little of downtown LA or in some areas the Grove.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Stunning!  Have been many places over the years but Vancouver is by far the most beautiful city ever!  It is so clean AND green!  Trees line nearly every street downtown and anywhere else you can look.  Water features abound and the buildings are stunning!

title: 3 day visit on way to Rockies
reviews: Had a good break in the city took in soccer, bus tours and most tourist sites. As a city eating out is good value compared to other cities. Most places friendly and 3 days covered everything. But there are a lot of homeless people and several areas various guides told us not to be in at night. We have been in a lot of cities around the world and never seen so any people sleeping on the streets. It feels unfortunate when you hear how much money is spent on accommodation and how people are being pushed out by the developers. We were told of the safety and homeless before but took it with a pinch of salt as we are well travelled but in person it is true.

title: Clean
reviews: Most of down town in subsections. Take a city tour. High rises are mostly for residential not business like Toronto.  Less suits. More fitness people on bikes and jogging. Keep out at night. Not safe as with any big city. Lots to see. Do a city tour first. They take you every where. They even dropped me off after the tour so I could stay longer!

title: Not the best
reviews: Unfortunatley downtown Vancouver is not its finest point. Like a lot of big cities it isn't that clean and it also has a homeless people issue. Too many people begging and sleeping rough on major streets for our liking.

title: Holy people.
reviews: Lots and lots of trendy people walking quickly everywhere. Love downtown but unless your under 30 or very very cool, it's hard to keep up with the pace. Shopping for days - endless food choices - and the best people watching place.

title: Just a city centre with a friendly twist
reviews: Do not spend to much time in a city if you travel. See the good stores, go to the harbour and get a good meal. Off course all depends on the way you have your stay. For us it was the last stop of long great ride alone the parks and mountains.

title: Hustle and Bustle Central.
reviews: We stayed on Robson Street, talk about a wall of people from around the world.  Looking for a place to eat, they are everywhere.  London Drugs was a few doors down from our hotel, much, much more than a drug store.  The druggist on duty, Monday evening, 7-11-16, was very helpful in helping me pick out a cough suppressant at 10pm.  They have fair prices too.

title: Easy walking city wi lots to see and do
reviews: Vancouver is a lovely city set on the harbour with so many little and big shops and eating places. Everyone  very helpful and loved the different highlights that make downtown busy but in a friendly way

title: That's a good time to visit (summer).
reviews: Even on summer you can expect cold weather in the morning.  Nice temperature in the afternoons Great skyline. People is very nice to tourists.

title: Okay shopping and some good restaurants
reviews: Check out Robson street for high street fashion. Prestigious brand names are located in the nearby streets. For eccentric and steeply priced clothing and furniture, head to Gastown.

title: Nice city with terrible traffic
reviews: I really feel bad to rate this beautiful city as terrible. But the amount of time I spent to find a parking was really a lot. To make my experience worse:  I paid parking at a place and couldn't enter inside. It was 7 am in the morning on Sunday. And I kept calling the number to make a complain but no one picked up the phone!I have seen the astonishing number of homeless people in downtown Vancouver. I don't know who is responsible or what is the politics behind, but it was really sad to see. It takes a lot of time to go anywhere around and parking is a huge problem. Then there are tourist bus parking everywhere. And thousands of tourists come out of those buses and start taking selfie middle of no where. I wish there was better public transport and less traffic to see this beautiful city.

title: I love Vancouver!!
reviews: We try to spend time in Vancouver at least four or five times a year. It is a beautiful city. I love walking the streets and exploring. There is lots to see and lots to do. Stanley Park has so much to offer including walking the seawall. The waterfront is gorgeous and Granville Island is always a great experience. On a nice day taking the water taxis gives you a new way of seeing the city and getting around. If you have time, you can head up to Grouse Mountain and take in the views of the city and surrounding area. We also try to take advantage of the many types of food available in a wide range of restaurants and if you want to stay outside, you have the food trucks. Then there is the hop on hop off busses, the theatre, the concerts, the special events ... Even if you are a local, you should go and discover what the city has to offer. I think you will be pleased.

title: Built up and stunning buildings.
reviews: Downtown has some amazing buildings. Lots of restaurants and the Pacific centre to explore. Most places are close enough to walk without then need to get the sky train

title: Mayor Moonbeam Vision of a City
reviews: Unfortunately for tourists they will not meet a great cross section of Vancouverites in downtown Vancouver. Our infamous Mayor Robertson has made downtown bicycle friendly while sacrificing space for cars. Most streets you can't turn on and you need to go into your line of credit to park whether on or off the street.Vancouverites that don't live downtown, only go there if they have to. Some go to work, some go to get a passport renewed. Most don't go. There is very good shopping. Stores you won't find anywhere else. Everything downtown is geared to the tourist. i.e., You will pay more than anywhere else in town Expensive restaurants, too many panhandlers.If you want to see the city, head over the bridges to South Granville, Main Street, 4th Avenue, Pt. Grey. W. Broadway.Check out downtown for a day and head south to see the real Vancouver where people live and work.

title: Great City
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city....cosmopolitan and friendly.  The climate keeps it green and lush.  The neighborhoods are funky and filled with good restaurants.  There are art galleries and interesting churches throughout the city, as well as world-class shopping venues.  The jewel of downtown is Stanley Park, filled with history, gorgeous views, an aquarium, First Nation peoples totem poles, yacht club, and a couple of good restaurants.  The Teahouse is not to be missed.  The food and views are unexcelled.  Love Vancouver.

title: Lots of shops in easy walking
reviews: I enjoyed walking around the shops and was impressed with the large high end shops in Robson Street.

title: A most pleasant city
reviews: A lovely feel to this waterside city, with wide streets, and residences right from the heart of the city to the downtown area and the waterfront. Travel round the town was easy by the local buses and trains. Street theatre in the heart of the downtown near the university. A good selection of shops as far as I could see, though sightseeing rather than shopping was my main focus. The historic quarter, Gastown, has an interesting selection of independent shops and sit-out restaurants. Easy to walk along the waterfront to the Olympic area and the lovely Stanley Park. We heard it is considered a very liveable city, and it is easy to see why.

title: 5 Days Is Not Enough!
reviews: I've visited over 30 countries and hundreds of cities. Vancouver in definitely in the top 5! Love it there. The weather could a bit warmer at times, but the sheer beauty and energy in the city and harbor makes it unbeatable.

title: Fun afternoon of shopping
reviews: We spent the day on Robson street and had a great time with our teenagers. The Lululemon store was a big hit, friendly salespeople and a great variety of athletic wear. Lush was another big hit for natural bath and skin supplies too. Aritzia was another big hit, very unusual clothing and priced right for our budget. There was also a crepe stand to pick up sweet and savory crepes and many, many shops to catch your attention. Starbucks is on Robson as well as a great CB2 store which we spent a great deal of time just perusing. Looking forward to going back to see what we missed tomorrow!

title: Inukshuk
reviews: My daughter, grandchildren and I strolled along Vancouver's downtown waterfront taking in the many interesting sights. We came across an inukshuk ... ancient symbol of Inuit culture used as landmark and navigational aid.

title: Many interesting sites & mainly walkable
reviews: You could walk, but the best way is to buy a Hop-on Hop-off bus ticket. This goes to most of the areas worth visiting & we did most areas in a day, getting off several times (Excluding Art Galleries/Museums.

title: Dirty and uninspiring
reviews: First time we've been to Vancouver and will not be back. The buildings are all the same with ugly greenish windows and the streets are a dirty gray. Homeless are everywhere and there is a urine smell emanating from most streets. The city train is dirty and smells like urine-don't know how people tolerate it. Overall not impressed and see no reason to be back.

title: What I covered in 1 day
reviews: Tips:- Skytrain from YVR airport goes directly to downtown- Skytrain Pacific Center station is a mall, with lots of stores and a food court, a good starting point if you're not driving and thinking of shopping- Skytrain Waterfront station is a good starting point if you want to sight see (Canada place, Gas town)- Skytrain Yaletown Roundhouse is near False Creek where an aquabus can take you to Granville island (highly recommended), there are also bike rental shops here.- Gastown has the iconic Steam clock. The shops here usually sell artsy stuff. For tourists, there are cheap souvenir shops here.- Further down the road from Canada place is the Olympic torch and the Lego like whale sculpture. This place offers a great views. (Bring a sweater could get very windy)- I've seen some hop on hop off buses near Canada place and shuttles going to Whistler, don't know the prices though- There are cheap parking spaces, most impark lots have pretty reasonable rates.- Robson street and near it, is where most shopping stores are located at- East Hastings is where most of the homeless are (druggies are here, as i've been told)Pros:- Very accessible by Skytrain even from the YVR airport it all depends on what activity you want to do first- Very walkable city- Nice views especially near Canada place Waterfront area- Quiet compared to other Big city downtowns- unusually few cars but then again Skytrain gets you here rather quickly- it is common to see tourists holding cameras taking pictures, locals don't seem to mind- the sea breeze is very nice, i did a lot of deep breathing while near the waterCons:- Prices of items are more expensive if you compare them to United States- You get occassional homeless weirdos, I experienced one splashing water on my windshield then wiping it at a stoplight asking for cash.Although Vancouver downtown is great, I must say I still like Victoria more, it felt more safe and relaxed. More trees and less skyscrapers.

title: Such a beautiful city
reviews: Surrounded by gorgeous natural landscapes and covered in beautiful architecture. Amazing shopping. Endless restaurants. An impressive public transit system which is so easy to use and will take you anywhere you really want to go.

title: Intimidating
reviews: Felt extremely uncomfortable walking around Vancouver the city is overloaded with vagrants and mentaly disturbed such a shame as the city is beautiful and abundant with interesting and historrically areas to visit . Throwing money at them is not the answer and the city seems to just tolerate it. For me I won't be  visiting again because of this. Such a shame.

title: Lovely area for a stroll
reviews: Vancouver is very aware of its roots and this is reflected in the buildings and walkways. Cyclists are positively encouraged and large buildings have mature trees growing on them. Plants grow wherever possible and the streets  are kept clean at all times.

title: Beautiful
reviews: Lively modern city with many glass buildings. Best seen by walking around. Tour buses also take you around the main areas.

title: Very Modern!
reviews: Vancuver has a safe and a very modern look. Clean, safe and over all nice with many things to do and see. Very touristy! If you have a chance vist!

title: busy busy busy
reviews: compared to other downtowns , this is a much quieter one . the usual hustle bustle  with great shops cafes and offices . there is a buzz in this area .

title: Good walk around city
reviews: The city is very cosmopolitan and there is something for everyone.  The Asian influence is everywhere.  It is pedestrian friendly with plenty of shops and restaurants

title: Big , Nice and Crowd Downtown
reviews: It was my first time to visit the downtown of Vancouver , it is a nice place to visit full of lots of shopping areas gift shops , and restaurants also a lot of hotels are there so if any one wants to visit this nice city it is better for him to select a hotel in downtown so he will enjoy a lot of activities and benefits from this location .

title: be prepared for street sleepers
reviews: Vancouver is a modern city but our trip was marred by so many people sleeping on the streets. Pedestrians just seemed to walk round them. A real social problem that needs sorting out.

title: A walkable city with good public transport
reviews: Most cities today seem to look pretty much the same with the major international chains taking up the prime real estate, leaving little room for smaller enterprises.  Vancouver has managed so far to leave some space for the small interesting shops and galleries, but you need to look for them.  I'd definitely return to Vancouver

title: Modern highraise condo and buildiing everywhere! Missed the historical part of Vancouver though.
reviews: Similar to HK now day. Glass forest in Vancouver! Western Hong Kong for sure! Real Estate price are Skyhigh, convenient but lack of charm, own style and uniqueness. Love or Hate? Personally, I don't not liked.

title: Unique
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is safe, clean, interesting. There are many unique businesses and the shopping staples everyone is looking for as well. First class eateries and wonderful art galleries.

title: Very Safe
reviews: being from America I was shocked how safe I felt in such a huge city. there were barely any homeless people or druggies walking around like you always witness in major American cities. Also there was tons of parking I think most of the people there actually live downtown in the high-rises and bike everywhere.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is really beautiful! There is a lot to see and enjoy! We live here for 23 years but always enjoying trip to downtown! You can spend hours of walking around also you can take a special tour buss around the city.... You will love it! As always take your camera!!!!!!

title: Stayed 3 days in vancouver
reviews: Nice city. Hop on hop off is a good way to see the sights  compact city with a lovely harbour. Good ambience in city with lots of buzz

title: One of my Favorite Cities in the World
reviews: Fantastic in every way!  Safe, clean, and simply wonderful.Love to cruise out of Vancouver and have stayed there five of last six years.

title: Go to Victoria instead
reviews: Unless you are here for the shopping the cuisine and people are best in Victoria on Vancouver Island

title: Beautiful, civilized and clean - unlike downtowns of some major cities
reviews: Vancouver downtown is not crazy or dirty or frequented by homeless folks like some other major cities. There is something very elegant about the downtown and both traffic and people are civilized and very friendly. Few blocks from the downtown is Robson street which is lined up with variety of cuisines and open until 10:00PM on week-days and 11:00PM on week-ends.Canada place is walking distance from downtown and several shuttles for different attractions depart from here. During normal week days, it tends to be quite during after hours although the harbor and Canada place, walking distance from downtown does have usual hustle bustle to enjoy.

title: Great for window shopping!
reviews: Robson Street is the main shopping street with side streets full of stores from high-end to discount. If you need medication or makeup or just a few food staples such as milk etc you need to check out London Drug. For high-end shopping you can't go past the Pacific Centre which has just expanded to Robson St with the Nordstrom's store opening recently. You can also find a few souvenir shops on the upper part of Robson St as well as Water Street if you are looking for a few gifts. There are also the usual food outlets such as Starbucks and Tim Horton's for a quick bite and coffee as well as many local eateries.

title: Vancouver is so Beautiful!
reviews: Vancouver Downtown has many faces.  It starts with False Creek, and ends at the inner harbour.  There are so many quaint places to see.  Anything from the Expensive to the hard to find items on your shopping list.

title: Un excelente restaurante!! The flying Pig!
reviews: An excelent place !!!good food  And very cool Excelent service!!!The place os very good the food are real y good and with a very good feeling!

title: People watching central
reviews: I typically come to Vancouver for work. I love running downtown going out to eat and sitting at a cafe just watching people.

title: Lots of different ethnic neighborhoods!
reviews: Beautiful views, many shops and all kinds of dining. You needn't pay for entertainment if you are willing to just walk and look!

title: Vancouver downtown is a big city!
reviews: We stayed downtown while visiting Vancouver.  It is full of all ages of buildings and interesting architecture. It is truly a metropolitan city with people and cars everywhere! There are many different places to eat, stay, and shop. We stopped by the art museum to have lunch at their cafe... We sat outside and enjoyed the view.

title: Visit after cruise
reviews: We visited Vancouver for 3 days after on Alaskan cruise. Love the city. It is walkable and safe. The people are friendly and helpful. Gastown gas many good restaurants and shops to visit. Grandville Island is fun. Stanley Park is beautiful. We also enjoyed Capilano Suspension Bridge even though alittle scary. Would visit again.

title: A lovely city but.........
reviews: I have visited Vancouver 3 times over a number of years.  It is a great city, with plenty to do from shopping (high street to designer depending on your budget) to walking, cycling or just lazing in Stanley Park.  My husband and I spent quite a few hours just relaxing on a shaded bench, watching the world go by and the sea planes coming and going. Unfortunately, and the reason for the 'but' in my review title, is that Vancouver has a bad problem with 'drop outs'.  I have tried to find a polite way to describe them, because I am sure for some of them it isn't a life style choice.  Sadly you get the feeling that drugs are a problem.  We were approached on quite a few occasions by someone begging, preaching or just shouting abuse.  No matter what, I would say you should visit Vancouver, just be sensible and aware.  I bought a handbag that went acorss my body while I was there, as I was worried about having my normal one snatched, a problem that even gets a warning on the UK Government travel website.

title: Gorgeous city great tour
reviews: Totally worth going to sightsee around Vancouver. I see why it is so popular. Nice area, convenient public transit.

title: So much to see!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver was an excellent place to explore! So much to see and do and lots of places to stop for food and drink whilst sightseeing!

title: Fabulous Italian
reviews: High end local Vancouver Family orientated Restaurant.Welcoming with a New York feel buzz.Great food. Plentiful portions.Try and request a table on the terrace at the rear on a warm Summer evening

title: Walking around downtown for a week
reviews: Vancouver is a wonderful, clean, environmentally aware city. We were here for business and did take time to tour the shore, parks, and gas town. Many different restaurants for every pallet and price range. The city is very well set up for cyclists, and joggers. A must visit city for everyone.

title: shopping district
reviews: We stayed on Robson street in Empire Landmark Hotel. Robson street has lots of restaurants and all big stores-canadian brands as well as all multi national brands.Pacific Mall is also in downtown . Canada Place- the harbor port is also here. It is beautiful,especially in night. We  went there to watch Simulated flight . It was an excellent experience,as if you are actually flying over ocean,mountains,glaciers..Downtown is the heart of Vancouver.

title: Perfect spot to stay and play
reviews: The term 'downtown' can mean different things depending on where you're from, but for Vancouver it means THE spot to stay and play. You've got Coal Harbour on your doorstep, Stanley Park a convenient walk away, and Granville Island a 15 minute walk away. The Convention Centre boardwalk offers fun, lively bars like Mahoney & Sons, and waterfront towards the Marina, is Carderos, with live music, a brilliant bar with a delicious menu, and a stylish restaurant.  Stanley Park is a must visit with the Sea Wall walk beside the busy harbour, and rambles through deep woods. And Granville Island is an easy walk from Downtown - and very much worth the visit.

title: Vancouver architecture, mountains and the sea
reviews: Love downtown Vancouver !  There is so much interesting architecture from old heritage buildings like the grand old Vancouver Hotel and the Hudson Bay store, the Gastown area and  to new modern skyscrapers. You can see the Coast mountains as you walk along the streets and enjoy the street vendors and yummy food carts, Robson street shops and great restaurants like Joe Fortes Seafood, Cactus Club and Milestones. You can walk along the seaside of the port of Vancouver at many places in the downtown area.  It is just gorgeous.  Vancouver downtown is an amazing area with many hotels to stay in and enjoy your visit !

title: Lovely city
reviews: We visited Vancouver on our way to and from Alaska and each time we had great weather, which I'm told is not the norm. Maybe climate change is changing it's climate! We were enchanted by Vancouver. It is exceedingly picturesque, being surrounded by  snow capped mountains and having a beautiful harbour. It is a leafy, tree lined city with a fantastic, bustling atmosphere  atmosphere and countless dining venues to suit every budget and taste. I believe it is lively in the arts scene as well.

title: Lots to see and do
reviews: Whilst we had a total of 4 days in Vancouver itself we still didn't see everything.  Vancouver seems to split into various areas each with their own flavour. Just remember this city might be beside the water but it isn't flat! Take a good sturdy pair of walking shoes to get the best out the downtown area.

title: It's nice for shopping and very good view for sea
reviews: It's a great place for shopping at this location, but traffic is too busy. I will come back for certain brands. Lots of nice restaurants.

title: a Shopping Trip to Robson Street
reviews: we had a very romantic shopping trip to Robson Street! very fun and our hotel was conveniently close

title: Canada Day celebrations
reviews: The city was full of happy people. Watched music on the stage at Jack Poole Plaza and walked past Happy Cannabis Days at the Art Gallery. The sidewalks need a really good powerwash. Always feel very safe walking Vancouver streets.

title: Decent downtown.
reviews: Not a lot different than most downtowns. They have an indoor mall, but we mostly walked through the area and popped in a few shops.

title: Plenty to see and do
reviews: Our hotel was in Melville St so we were going not minutes away from the scenic waterfront with mountains in background. Great watching the float planes taking off and landing.  Short walk to Stanley park, Canada Place and Gastown.

title: A Great City
reviews: I loved downtown with its various districts. Incredibly easy to walk around as it is on a grid system. Visit Gas Town for good food bars and music. English bay is tremendous and there seems to be lots going on both day and night. Felt very safe there as well.

title: Great City. I will be back for more.
reviews: Loved this clean and modern city.  Great restaurants especially seafood, nice shopping, and great diversity - I loved it!  Biking paths are everywhere.  The businesses are very service oriented.

title: 3 days downtown
reviews: I had a little deception with downtown Vancouver . Too much resto pub like style with stool or ' high seating' . No medium-classrestos with pastas , hot chicken or club sandwich . A lot of homeless people too.

title: Great visit
reviews: It has so much to offer.  We had a great time shopping, eating and learning about Vancouver.  The gas light district was full of local charm and there were many fabulous upscale shops to choose from as well.  The harbor area was beautiful and very interesting to visit.

title: What a vibrant city
reviews: We just loved our few days in Vancouver. What a vibrant, safe city.  Lots of things to do and see.  Spoilt for choice of so many good restaurants and a bustling place to visit and/or live in.  Easy to get around either on foot or bus or even ferry.  The hop on hop off bus is fantastic to get your bearings and see so many lovely sights. Weather is great too.  Excellent city and highly recommend for so many reasons.

title: Great shops
reviews: Vancouver has the full range of shops that you would expect from a city, plus a lot more.  There is a nice mix of high end shops and everyday shops along with all types of eateries, there is something for everyone.

title: Even the best areas are filled with homeless
reviews: The safest areas by day are filled with mentally ill homeless by night, library square in Yaletown completely unsafe past midnight.   Let's not even mention areas like Chinatown and the dtes

title: Scenic, Walkable, Easy Going
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has a compact core that is easy and pleasurable to explore. Wherever you are, you are never far away from seeing the deep blue mountain backdrop which provides a beautiful and relaxing relief to your senses. There is a good mix of old and new buildings. Our favourites include the Marine Building which deserves a very close up view to truly appreciate the many intricate marine motifs. The Fairmont Hotel Vancouver has an interesting roof line. The garden in the BC Law Court complex  provides a place to relax from the crowds. Nearby Vancouver Art Gallery often serves as a focal place for gathering. For spectacular panorama, take a short walk down Hornby or Granville to the waterfront to see views that highlight the expansive beauty of Vancouver. A good way to spend a half day is to take the train into the centre to have lunch at Nosh, then window shop at Hudson's Bay, Nordstrom, Holt Renfrew, then walk to the waterfront to have coffee at one of the cafes, then walk the sea walk along Coal Harbour to English Bay.

title: Skyscrapers to dream about!
reviews: A nice downtown to walk through and around. Starting at West End, through Coal Harbor to Sea Plane Terminal, then Gastown it is a nice walk surrounding downtown, just to came back through it enjoying the view of beautiful buildings and fountains.

title: beautiful downtown
reviews: Went there at the end of May. Beautiful city with high building, road is slight narrow though. lot of trees and flowers at this season.

title: One of the cleanest cities
reviews: A very Clean exciting walk around city with so much to do and restaurants and pubs to enjoy and mingle with the locals. Robson street is enchanting with it's boutiques.

title: A wonderful city
reviews: We spent two days in Vancouver and enjoyed every moment - except when dealing with traffic and parking. It teems with great restaurants (try the Blind Sparrow - we had a terrific lobster dinner there) and the combination of water and mountain views from virtually everywhere is rivaled by few other cities (Seattle and Cape Town). Van Dusen Gardens provided a beautiful green breathing space after the bustle of downtown

title: nice to wander
reviews: nothing really special about downtown as with most towns usual array of shopping and eateries one thing we did notice however was the huge amount of homeless people on the streets in the downtown area - politely begging. Unusual for a modern city i though, other than that pleasant to wander and a feeling of being quite safe.

title: The town needs a good tidy up
reviews: We were dissapointed with the homeless people sleeping on the streets and the general cleanliness of the street in the Central City was not good .

title: So so fun !
reviews: I would move there , if it weren't for the cold in Canada !Totally the area to be living in Vancouver !Live music, eateries of all cuisines, shopping high and low....beautifully laid out area.....close to wilderness...the beach....full of interesting activities....

title: Is it worth It?
reviews: We have been traveling to Vancouver since we were old enough to drive, which would be at least 40 years. Since then we have traveled to close to 50 different countries and seen lots of the great cities of the world. Vancouver is right up at the top of the list, however during the past few years the prices have gone crazy. It used to be very affordable, now, we feel it is poor value. Sorry Vancouver, we can visit many other great cities, go to all inclusive resorts or hop on plenty of great cruises for far less money than it costs to visit you. Visiting Vancouver is getting as expensive as visiting Manhattan. We love you, but can no longer afford to visit you.

title: A very livable city in summer
reviews: The sun is shining and people are out walking! There is lots to do in Downtown Vancouver - good restaurants, lots of summer sales in the shops and a Picasso exhibition at the art gallery. A great place to visit!

title: An interesting spread of all things to see and do.
reviews: If you are in Vancouver and need some time walking and day dreaming, DownTown is the place to be. Many high class and less expensive shops and restaurants with excellent pavements and plenty of clean and safe space for your visit and no end of things to do. Canadian hospitality at its best!

title: Just anouther metropolitan downtown
reviews: Nothing too unique and lot's of construction going on.   A couple of pretty streets where you can shop at the same brand stores that you have at home.

title: So much to see
reviews: Plenty of things to do and see. Plenty of good food spots too. Walk along the water, its quite a nice view.

title: Small and beautiful
reviews: One of the best downtowns I have been to. The whole downtown is walkable, probably a couple of Miles. Great places to eat and party. Has everything for everyone.

title: Avivaruth2
reviews: Had a great time in the Vancouver Downtown. Great shopping went to the Granville Island Market more great shopping. I found it easy getting around on the local bus. Friendly people who were always ready to give me directions.

title: Full of life
reviews: Nice place to walk around and maybe do some shopping, although Vancouver is a bit expensive. Robson is the Main Street and is worth to walk it completely.

title: Walking about
reviews: Vancouver is like any other city with its pros and cons. On the plus side the harbour area / Canada Place is lovely and we watched a cruise ship depart for Alaska. Robson Street has several good shops and restaurants. Gas Town was very touristy but you have to see the steam clock! I like these cities that are built on the grid system as sometimes you feel lost but then you see a street name you recognise! We didn't visit Chinatown as our tour guide did say it was safe but not recommended. The people seemed friendly and a lovely young lady stopped to help us when we got a bit confused.

title: Downtown
reviews: Not much to see, numerous souvenir shops in Gastown.  We walked up and down the Street once and went right to our hotel.  Went to Chinatown too which was not much to see and the place we had dinner was lousy. There were huge amounts of homeless people walking around.  Many talking or singing to themselves and another guy standing on the sidewalk peeing into a bag.  We have no desire to ever return to Vancouver.  It's not very handicap accessible and clearly they don't take much care of their homeless population.  What a huge disappointment to get off of a cruise and to be there.  We could not wait to leave.  Yuck!

title: Walking through downtown
reviews: Surely I love walking through the Vancouver Downtown, love to step in n out each stores at Granville Street and Robson Street, try the food trucks, Or just stop by seeing the heritage building among it.. Go go shopping !!

title: Lots of upscale stores
reviews: Having heard what a beautiful city Vancouver is I was disappointed by the number of homeless people we saw,  the warnings about what areas to avoid due to drugs etc. That said I did feel safe walking around at night and some stores were open quite late downtown..including a very crowded 24 hour bakery.

title: Wow!
reviews: Very clean city.  Love the fact that you can walk pretty much everywhere, unless you take one of the many tours.  Plenty of restaurants to choose from.

title: clean city
reviews: I can't see enough of that sky line view, people are very friendly, helpful, Streets are very clean.

title: Vancouver visit
reviews: Got off in Chinatown and then walked to water.  Had a wonderful afternoon walking around downtown Vancouver.

title: Our guided tour downtown Vancouver
reviews: Eric was our guide. He knows many facts, details about the city that you cannot find anywhere unless you had lived and educated yourself about Vancouver history. Very engaging and articulate gentlemen.  The path he chose to bring us was very relevant.

title: Has accessibility issues
reviews: While there are curb cuts for wheelchairs some of them are really too steep to safely use. Traffic is respectful and observant to Pedestrians so that's good. Nice wide sidewalks and clean. But watch those hills!

title: Great skyline
reviews: Vancouver Downtown offers some very beautiful spots, particularly along the waterfront (North) and around the Museum of Art: modern buildings competing with old, mostly well maintained. There are however, like in many cities, rather seedy places closely adjacent to those attractive spots, and that spoil the overall picture. By clear weather, the views on the mountains in the North are quite stunning.

title: Just keep walking
reviews: Great city to walk and walk and walk.  Plenty to see and do....stop for a drink and lunch and soak up the sights.  Great shopping, great galleries, call into the 'VAG', Vancouver Art Gallery and we also walked down to Gastown, plenty of action there.

title: Great, walkable downtown
reviews: Spent a very pleasant two days in Vancouver at the end of a 7-day Alaska cruise. Stayed downtown and walked to Stanley Park, the marina (both very scenic), Robson Street (touristy, but some good shops and museum), Gastown (hipster area, bit sketchy so go during day; see the steam-powered clock!). Get gelato at Bella Gelateria on ground floor of an unusual office building with a line from a poem on the outside of each floor. Take ferry or 20-minute bus ($2.75 fare) from downtown to Granville Island, wonderful place to hang out for several hours with outdoor marketplace for foodies and unusual boutiques with textiles, art, performers. Go!

title: Old World In A Modern City
reviews: Took a Trolly Tram around Down Town as it was a wet day and so enjoyed the commentary from our driver about his personal knowledge of the area and Down Town.  Trip takes about 1.5 hours and was perfect as we had just done the Stanley Park tour just before lunch in the city as we where flying out later that evening.  Will definately return to Vancouver to explore the shops and area in the future.

title: Downtown Vancouver has much to offer
reviews: There are great cafes, juice bars, restaurants, bars, hotels, hostels, clubs, shopping malls, sports arenas, boutiques, a university campus, theaters, cinemas, an art gallery, a subway, a cruise ship terminal, an opera house, classical concerts, clubs, supermarkets, schools, yoga studios, a bowling alley, libraries, community centers, an aquatic center with a swimming pool and high diving boards, community gardens, farmer's markets, beaches, parks and playgrounds, all within close walking distance.

title: This city has it all!
reviews: My husband and I have explored downtown Vancouver from one end to other and this city has it all! The restaurants are endless, as well as food trucks, and so you won't go hungry! Yaletown & Gastown offer lots of historical significance to the area and be sure to visit the cruise ship port & in and around the Olympic Torch on the waterfront!! The Fairmont offers a fantastic "high tea" service!

title: interesting
reviews: Alot to see and do depending on your mood and all within walking distance .There are excellent restaurants , hotels , arenas , malls , movie theaters ,high and low end retail shops ,art gallery,Vancouver public library.People are friendly it is worth exploring

title: Can't Wait to Go Back
reviews: Our three day visit to Vancouver was entirely too short. I definitely plan on visiting a week at least the next time I have a chance. The city was so clean. The foliage that was seen everywhere was so refreshing to see. It just made you want to walk everywhere and snap pictures.  We were able to easily walk any direction and find a great coffee shop or an inviting restaurant.  If you wanted to shop an organic, or health food store to take something back to the hotel, they were everywhere.  If you have a chance to visit Vancouver, stretch it out.

title: Homeless =(
reviews: Loved the city in general but my goodness tons of homeless people /panhandlers everywhere. Does the city have no way of helping these poor souls? It seemed that literally every street on every block had between 2-6 homeless people on it. The city, for the most part, seems to cater to the ultra rich and/or yuppie crowd.

title: Really good place to walk
reviews: We spent three nights in Downtown Vancouver and had a really enjoyable time.  Both Yaletown and Gastown were within a half hour walk from our hotel.  There was some elevation gain from Gastown back to our hotel, but nothing like the hills in Seattle.

title: History meets modern
reviews: A must visit place if in Vancouver. It's free, vibrant and useful-indulge in some retail therapy whilst walking through historic Gas Town, relax by the waterfront at Canada Place or enjoy one of the many restaurants situated by the waterfront. Easily accessible by car or Metro.

title: A Very Walk-able City
reviews: Vancouver downtown is full of fun things to see and do, most of it within walking distance.  Shopping and eating is plentiful, especially on Robson St.  Gastown and Yaletown are also great neighborhoods within Vancouver worth exploring.  Getting around the city on the Hop-On/Hop-Off bus is very easy and convenient. It's a major city center, that's not overwhelming with high energy, but not so dense as you can't move about easily.  People are friendly and willing to help you get around, which is part of the fun in exploring.

title: Lots to Do, Plenty of Great Buildings to See
reviews: This is probably one of the best downtowns I have been in while visiting Canada. All are too new for any real history, but on a nice day there is plenty to do. I recommend walking to Canada Place, where you may find a cruise ship, and where you can have a lovely lunch or breakfast. Nice to walk and see whats going on.

title: Nice Downtown With Shops and Dining
reviews: We were here on a professional association meeting, and enjoyed Downtown.  Robson/Howe area with Pacific Center underground with Nordstroms and all the high end shops.  Clean, safe, some homeless present, though not threatening.  A lot of places to eat from fast foods through high end restaurants; all types of cuisines.  Museums.  A lot of people around, so I would call it vibrant, and a nice place to be.

title: High rise buildings all architecturally interesting
reviews: Downtown in the main is lovely with beautiful waterfront areas, underground shopping, designer shops, craft areas, large Chinatown, many buses/trolleys/skytrain. Most of the high rises have features on their roofs to make them attractive and many have greenery growing there.  There are many souvenir shops of course, many cheap and cheerful but also many featuring the very interesting west coast native american design items and art. There are very many coffee shops and bars too.  On the whole, it is a pleasant experience to walk about here and the layout makes it pretty easy for first time visitors to find their way around.  We did not experience any pickpocket activity but I am sure it is common.  The disturbing side is the number of approaches we had from people asking for money on the streets and also the number of people sleeping in doorways during the day as well as at night.

title: Fly Over Canada and Cruise Port
reviews: This venue is the place to relax and take in the fresh air and a gelato.   Try the black sesame.   Walk the Fly Over or take the virtual tour.   Pictures are breathtaking.

title: Great place to see buildings
reviews: I really liked some of the buildings designed in this area with the odd old building left in between, nice place to explore and park car to see the other areas of Vancouver

title: nice city for walking
reviews: It is a great walking city and you can enjoy the vibe strolling around the downtown...hop on te public transport whenever you feel exhausted or relax along the harbour

title: A Jewel of the North
reviews: What a great city! A city built with convenience in mind, virtually everything imaginable is within walking distance of hotels. Excellent food, treats (you have to try Bella Gelateria no matter the length of the line) sightseeing and more. Everyone who travels should see Vancouver.

title: Visiting from port alberni
reviews: I love Vancouver and always have.  I lived her some 30 years ago.  But outside of a block or so close to the water there are no benches for an older person or knee and hip problem people to rest every now and the.  Having recently spent 6 weeks in Barcelona, which is almost three times the size of Vancouver, there are benches and rest spots even in out of the way places.  I think your mayor should consider our aging population and do something about this one of few flaws in this beautiful city.

title: Easy to navigate, modern/historic, walkable, restuarants, beautiful bay and views. Love this town.
reviews: Downtown Vancouver was easy to access from the airport - we took the Skytrain.  Once downtown we walked a few blocks to our hotel.  Another three blocks down the hill was the waterfront.  We only a day and  half here - bit it is easily one of my favorite place to visit now.  There is so much more to do in and around the area. Most of this downtown is small enough to walk (if you are a mobile person) and it easy to navigate. There are several restaurants on the waterfront streets and several more at hotels. There is a small underground 'shopping mall' area that features Purdy's Chocolates (YUM), a drugstore, gem/rocks/jewelry stores and more.  There is also a small grocery downtown and a liquor store if  you want a bottle of wine or Prosecco to enjoy later at your hotel for a special celebration. Prices were comparable to U.S.  even for a downtown location - within a few dollars pending the brand. I was surprised to learn that Vancouver is the second largest port in North America. The skyline is really historic and modern at the same time. You can enjoy watching seaplanes (commuter planes) take off and land all day long from the waterfront area.  The view of the mountains and bay was breathtaking. We felt safe strolling the downtown area during the day and through the evening. It was still dusk at 9 p.m. in May. This is a beautiful city with a great deal to offer. Downtown Vancouver does have several districts and we were in the business and gaslight district when walking.  Some other areas farther away may not be as tourist friendly- not sure.  We took advantage of the Hop on Hop off Trolley to visit the sights and picked it up at hour hotel.  Travelled to Stanley Park for several hours, Granville Island, and all other downtown districts - including Chinatown. We had planned to eat dinner there - but were disappointed at the appearance of the area and decided not to get off there. We did visit Vancouver Urban Winery - that is a good stop to be sure.

title: Favourite Canadian City
reviews: I have been to almost every major city and Canada and Vancouver is hands down the BEST! I love this city and I can't wait to go back. Just walking around, getting a simple coffee and taking stroll on English Bay makes for a great day or evening in my books. Combination of big city, beaches and surrounded by mountains is just heaven. Even if you can't afford to do much the city itself will keep you company.

title: Dirty City
reviews: We didn't enjoy downtown and rarely got out. Was not a pretty city at all. Buildings looked old and run-down with a lot of panhandlers out. I will say that we are not shopping people. I'm sure there were some nice shops, but nothing that piqued our interest. Paid parking everywhere.

title: Very urban
reviews: Great dinning options, dynamic culture and sights. The area area the city center harbor was very nice. I felt safe and secure while walking around in the evening solo.

title: Lively but quiet city
reviews: I loved vancouver,  the people are so friendly,  the city is just the right size to enjoy walking aroubd, very safe. Food is Fantastic and star bucks on every other corner.  Great time to visit as not too busy and great weather. Lots to do locally

title: A city that this country living chap likes
reviews: I find the bike friendly city is great to get around, with so many bike lanes - some of which are sectioned off from traffic. Lots of interesting things to see & do.

title: Gorgeous City!
reviews: OK, I may be bias, after all it is my home town. Let's see what makes it so great: Spectacular mountain views surrounded by the Pacific. Alberni St. & 4th Ave (not right d/t, but close) for shopping. Stanley Park,  the Sea Wall and beaches a stones throw from town. Recreation minutes away, like the Grouse Grind & Cypress Bowl. Plus, Vancouver is a foodies paradise!

title: Vancouver - Canada
reviews: Loved Vancouver lots to see, people were very friendly and helpful.  Very clean city great for walking around.  We were located very close to walking distance to CBD and the warf great position.Would recommend to put on your to do list, and if on a tour stay and extra day or two.  Will go back in 2018Kristine de la Hunty

title: Fun and funky
reviews: Great place to visit - a good combination of the old and the new. A number of terrific restaurants and sites - museum had a Picasso exhibit that we loved. It is a town full of colorful characters, lively music and creativity abounds. Add the drop dead gorgeous scenery, water, mountains, and perfect weather -- what else could you ask for?

title: Wonderful downtown walking experience!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a great place to visit and walk around. Even in a small rain storm, the weak was pleasant and safe. Also, very, very clean.

title: Great views - be sure to check out the Digital Orca!
reviews: We didn't spend much time in downtown Vancouver- we're not really into the big city vibe, especially when there are so many other natural and beautiful sights to see in and around Vancouver. We travelled over via the Seabus, which was relaxing with lovely views and walked around Canada Place- great views of the ocean, mountains and North Vancouver. The public art was cool- I loved the Digital Orca and the nearby Olympic Cauldron was pretty neat to see. We wandered over to Gastown and checked out a few shops and saw the famous steam clock then headed back to the ferry. Maybe it was the crowds of people from the cruise ships in  port, but we weren't all that impressed...

title: Fun and beautiful city
reviews: The water and mountain  views from the city are amazing. Weather was good but rain for a while each day. I only gave it 4 stars because of the amount or vagrants and visual drug activity. Some of them were aggressive and in your face. Don't let that distract you though because this city has so many things to offer. People are very kind and active. Shopping and dining choices are abundant.

title: Nice and clean
reviews: We live for 5 nights in this area. Many shop and restaurant around the place. So we just need to walk for 10-20 minutes Tp reach all things we need.

title: Walk around!
reviews: It's fun to walk around downtown Vancouver. Crazy to drive though. It's busy even on a Sunday morning. Interesting buildings, shops, restaurants and the surrounding mountain and water views are incredible. Like any big city downtown, it has it's share of homeless and panhandlers.

title: Be careful where you go
reviews: Some parts of downtown are really cute and there's one street dedicated to great food. However, there are some really bad parts. Avoid Hastings Street. Drug addicts are plentiful in Vancouver and is very in your face. I wouldn't travel by myself.

title: What an amazing city to walk around
reviews: It's just such a neat area to walk around. We rarely plan anything when visiting Vancouver, rather just walk around downtown & the waterfront and enjoy all the sites.

title: A must!
reviews: Stayed downtown in a Air B&B and it‚Äôs my favorite city in the world and the best province in Canada by far. I was amazed how clean the city is. People are nice and everything is easy to access. Would recommend to walk and go visiting china town and gastown. The port in the most beautiful I saw and I saw Sydney in Australia. Downtown Vancouver is a must.

title: Upright boring and dull
reviews: If it were not from the lovely scenario and surrounding neighborhoods, I would not go back. The city center does not offer much apart from immense traffic and avantgarde shops.

title: Mixed Review
reviews: Like most cities there is good and bad. There are a lot of aged hippies who appear homeless. There are a large number is pan-handlers and mentally ill wandering the streets and approaching you. It helps to know which neighborhoods to avoid because of their unsavory character. Vancouver is a very new city mainly erected since 1986. There is a rather unimaginative, monotonous skyline dominated by green glass boxy high rises which lack character. Fortunately they have saved a few elegant early 20th century building which remain timeless. We really enjoyed Stanley Park, Flyover Canada at Canada Place, the panoramic view from Vancouver Lookout and the beautiful Marine Office Building (1930's) built back when architects had real talent! We were not impressed with Gastown. It was historical but has been so commercialized, but the Steam Clock was interesting and worth seeing and the hanging baskets  (all over the city) are just gorgeous!!

title: It just another big city shopping centre
reviews: If you spend time here you're will recognize most of the brands. Funny you would think that a town that has a high rainfall would be better set up for the conditions. You will need an umbrella.  Another thing worth noting. The shops don't open until 10.

title: A great location with differing suburbs
reviews: Lots to see and do, cool friendly people and easy to get around. The trolley tour is a good option but also great to walk around. Go to the market in Granville but give China Town a miss. The blocks take a turn for the worse as you reach them.

title: Great Sushi, too many homeless on Davie Street
reviews: I heard great things about Vancouver so I took the trip. Cute city but the weather was always gloomy and damp. I like to jog and go for coffee as the sun rises. However, I didn't feel very comfortable while homeless were in each alley looking for breakfast in dumpsters. Similar experience in the evening coming back from a nice dinner. Two Police had a homeless guy on the ground handcuffed right outside my hotel. Surprised that such an expensive city would tolerate so many homelsss people.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Beautiful city , easy to get around, lots of restaurants , the harbor activity was very cool to watch,  the sea planes, the cruise ships & barges...the mountain scenery was spectacular

title: Downtown is worth a wander!
reviews: Vancouver is a great city and definitely worthy of it's title of one of the world's most livable cities.  Downtown has great shopping along Robson street, from high end like Tiffany & Co to souvenir shops for those looking to take home some gifts and memories of their stay.There's also hundreds of restaurants to choose from.  Pubs to Italian and so much more!

title: One of my favorite cities!
reviews: I travel a ton for work and Vancouver is on my top 3 list in the world. The cleanest city in N America, it's boasts a gorgeous waterfront, mountain views, sea planes, Stanley Park, great shopping, awesome food, and very friendly locals. What more do you need? I haven't even had a chance to venture far outside of downtown but I'm sure the rest of the city is just as charming!

title: Great to walk around Downtown
reviews: Vancouver's downtown has a good energy, and a lot to do.  We walked down Robson, to the west end, and then to Stanley Park - we enjoyed it all.  Probably good to bring a rain jacket.

title: Typical large city downtown.
reviews: We felt this was no more no less than we expected of a large city downtown area.Generally the area was clean with some construction work in progress. Office buildings, restaurants and eateries together with retail shops and the massive Pacific Centre on W Georgia Street which caters for upmarket shoppers.

title: Best place n the world to live.......
reviews: ......or so they say though a friend who has lived there and in Cape Town rates Cape Town better.  He likes the heat, I prefer a colder climate!  Vancouver is a marvelously cosmopolitan city with unsurprisingly a high Asian element and, more surprisingly many from the sub-Continent (possibly because of Empire?). As a result the range of food on offer is very extensive (almost as good as Brighton!).  The old town (Gastown) is charming with many Victorian buildings and the famous steam clock and Chinatown next door has the must-see Dr Sun Yat Sen Garden.  If you are a sport type , this is the place for you.  Across the harbour there is a smallish settlement on Grouse Mountain and then the wild places start.  UCB is a world-class University.  One of my students did his PhD there - he was also a keen mountain biker - it was heaven for hi,

title: Great to see
reviews: I stayed in Downtown Vancouver and thought it was great. The lifestyle is calm yet crazy. The buildings pretty much all have rooftop patios and have plants and trees everywhere which was so calming and nice to see. The only thing that wasn't very nice was all the homeless, but we had no problem with them during the day or at night but it is definitely something to be aware of.

title: They're missing something
reviews: Vancouver's downtown is cozy.  There is no better word to describe it.  It's not going to take you a long time to walk up and down its streets.  You aren't going to find much that is unique to Vancouver because you can't see the water and you can't see the mountains; if you could it would be unique in Canada but Vancouver's downtown is not unique.  It's also not very old.  The city was only established in 1886 although it grew very fast after that.  So don't look for history.  Its art gallery in an old courthouse is desperate to display its holdings but only 3% of its collection can be viewed at any one time.  Enjoy the walking scale but don't expect to see anything exceptional or unique or cherished.

title: Large, but manageable!
reviews: Vancouver is a large, cosmopolitan city with a downtown to match.  Among its very population, downtown offers all the amenities a big city can provide.  Restaurants abound along with retail and shopping in the center city.  Transportation and parking are very accessible.  Entertainment, art, culture and museums exist throughout the area.  It's neighborhoods complement what the city as a whole and downtown have to offer.  Getting around the downtown area is manageable and for the most part and enjoyable place to be.  There is a lot to do and staying in the city is made easy with a wide range of hotel choices.  Obviously, when one visits the city it must also visit downtown first.  People are friendly and helpful.  It is one of the nicer downtown I visited in Canada.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is beautiful! It's full of life and some place I'd love to life. It is one of the most expensive cities to live in but it's amazing. Great restaurants, shops, convention center, harbor, etc.

title: A cosmopolitan city with unbeatable summer weather
reviews: I am always charmed by downtown Vancouver.  The mix of business people, street artists, people of many races and the city's cleanliness and safe, friendly feel always bring me back.  I like to hear the variety of languages spoken on the street.  I can identify The Spanish, German and French that I've heard, but there are many Asian languages spoken and some from eastern Europe.  There are lots of small restaurants - Indian, Chinese, Irish, Italian, Japanese....  The Canada train system is easy to ride to and from the airport.  The people seem friendly.

title: Ecclectic
reviews: We walked everywhere or rode hop-on/hop-off, typical downtown area, we found most areas safe for walking during the day until dusk, don't recommend walking in Chinatown or by alleyways in the dark. Interesting stores, restaurants, etc.

title: Great view, easy parking, walking-friendly city
reviews: This was my second trip to Vancouver.  The first was fantastic but the weather was very rainy, so be prepared. This trip was blessed with the most amazing weather.  We stayed near Canada Place, where all of the cruise ships come into port.  Gastown is just a few blocks away, and we enjoyed seeing the famous Steam Clock.   Terrific shopping can be found across the street and in the nearby neighborhood including many designer shops.  The waterfront is beautiful and especially breathtaking at sunset.  Those who like morning walks or jogs will enjoy the atmosphere of the seawall adjacent to the downtown area.  Terrific restaurants are in abundance but the more popular ones may require reservations to get a table.  We loved the large selection of fresh oysters at Joe Forte's Seafood and Chop House.

title: Rich in history
reviews: From it's lumbering phase to high rise development, Vancouver has a lot of rich history.  Whiskey plays a significant role, not to mention various countries trying to claim ownership.  The combination of an ongoing and thriving port for shipping (much from Asia), to today's seasonal tourism boosted by cruise lines, to the train terminus, there's a lot to take in.  Gastown's history, named for Gassy Jack, is colorful and thankfully preserved. Loads of great places to eat, hospitable locals, very walkable downtown, bike friendly layout, a relatively moderate climate (hey, I'm from Boston, just sayin'), Stanley Park and a commitment to being environmentally responsible and "green" make this a very livable place, terrific to visit.

title: Downtown Vancouver Visit
reviews: We enjoyed our time spent in the downtown area and found a really nice pub to have lunch. It was a sunny beautiful day to just wander where we wanted.

title: Amazing
reviews: The city was easily traveled by foot or public transportation.  The restaurants and shopping were abundant and the variety was endless.

title: Love this city
reviews: It's clean and the people are very friendly and it's completely walkable.  One of the best cities in North America!  I can't wait to go back!

title: Dirty...
reviews: I used to think that Vancouver was one of the cleanest place in Canada. Walking in Granville, my perception has definitely changed. It is getting so dirty, I felt very uncomfortable being there. The place is crowded with homeless and the streets are full of litters. I now try to avoid that area when I get there.

title: Downtown Vancouver - lots of walking
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a bustling place.  Lots of people which adds to the energy of the city.  Some great neighbourhoods we visited include Gastown and Yaletown.  We really like Yaletown especially; great restaurants with lots of outside patios, but they do get very busy so be prepared to wait.  You can walk almost anywhere in the downtown area.

title: A Walker and Biker's Delight
reviews: Our stay of 2 nights downtown Vancouver was spectacular. Just loved the paths along the water for walkers and bikers. Wish we had more time to explore the many restaurants and activities this city has to offer.

title: Much to do and see, a nice town.
reviews: We had a lovely time in Vancouver, before and after our Alaska Cruise.Lots of restaurants and shops on short walking distances.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Robson street, E.Hastings, Davie Street, Granville. I've only ever walked this much in New York. Amazing architecture,  super clean streets. Sensory overload!

title: Good waterfront, shopping so-so
reviews: The convention centre at the waterfront offered great shots with space for kids to round around. The Main shopping stretch was unfortunately shop, so one really has to go under ground!

title: Easy to navigate; very walking friendly
reviews: If you like things centrally located and within walking distance, you'll love downtown Vancouver. Sadly, there's no Uber, but with everything (port, restaurants, shopping, bike rentals, parks) this accessible there's little need to take a cab or even the bus. If you do need a cab, I'd recommend finding a hotel and using their cab stand as there were several times we would have liked a cab, but none were available. The city has many distinct districts and we really enjoyed Gastown's quaint European vibe.

title: Something for everybody
reviews: You can easily access downtown Vancouver by way of bus, trolley, sky train or sea bus.  The city is very pedestrian friendly.  Bikers are welcomed with their own place to ride on the street.  Shops and eateries of all kind are here.  If you can't find it, its not here

title: WHY NOT SEE
reviews: you find there everything what you need ...lot of Asia fusion, shops, it is big city but you don't feel stress of big city ..and it is nice

title: Tuesday
reviews: We wandered in downtown area on foot and relied on Skytrain for transportation back to Burnaby.  Trains quite full after 3:30 pm.

title: The wonderful Vancouver Downtown
reviews: Do you live in a small city, town or village. Were you can't explore so much. But in the   Vancouver Downtown you can explore 20 stores and still have more than 40 left to explore. So go down to the Vancouver Downtown and have fun exploring diffrent shops, malls and much more!

title: No wonder people prefer Victoria!
reviews: What a disappointment! Heard so much about it's Chinatown but apart from the Sun Yat Sen gardens, this Run-down and seedy area needs a thorough re-vamp. Shady characters, bums, homeless, druggie seem to hang out here in the evening and no shops open at 9pm.Downtown itself with its malls and cafes, coffee joints,  somewhat more welcoming but even then, no character. Worth a ferry ride to pretty Victoria to escape the drabness!

title: Not a fan
reviews: Being raised and living in New Zealand my whole life and Vancouver being my first step of my travel experience it was a huge shock to walk onto Vancouver downtown. It is disgusting there is homeless people every where, a lot of people on drugs and a lot of people that drugs have ruined their lives. Streets are filled with cigarette butts and people smoking weed. I felt a very strong sense of not being safe. Would not recommend bringing children down these streets

title: Gastown
reviews: Lots of shops, interesting clock working on gas, just don't walk down the wrong street, can get a little scary with the gathering of the homeless. They don't bother you.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Vancouver  is a beautiful city nice downtown area and harbor to walk around.  Lots of good restaurants and bars and several nice shopping areas and parks

title: Beautiful!
reviews: Did a lot of walking and came across free music in from of one of the buildings (maybe city hall or library?). The beat of the city is great and people very friendly and laid back.

title: interesting downtown
reviews: Vancouver totally lack the space for pedestrians, it does not have any pedestrian street like what you find in Europe, it is hard to escape the traffic, except for a few areas, the city is designed and build for cars, not people

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Went into Vancouver by bus and visited Gastown but was disappointed. It seems as though it is a real tourist trap. Shame really.

title: Nice downtown
reviews: There are a lot of places to eat and activities to do. The area is divided into neighborhoods with very different atmospheres. Except for some museums,I don't feel that it's particularly unique

title: Wonderful place to visit
reviews: There are so many places to visit, or just walk around. The downtown is just beautiful, I loved to see mountains with snow top of them..So green, so beautiful.. I loved the flowers, trees, friendly people..

title: beautiful city
reviews: It truly is a beautiful city if you like big cities.  The traffic is horrible and the streets are very narrow.  Not for the faint of heart.  The city is clean and well maintained.  Take your time and see the sights in a small car not a truck!

title: City of Glass
reviews: With the water surrounding the West End on 3 sides, this is one of the most beautiful cities in the World.  The buildings are primarily of glass so collectively they give the City a modern, airy look.  People are extremely receptive to visitors and the restaurants are world class.

title: So much
reviews: There is so much to do in downtown Vancouver. Walk , walk & walk some more. Great buss service as well.

title: Beautiful City in BC
reviews: What an enjoyable stay in Vancouver.  The downtown area is so much fun and so many places to visit a things to do.  You can eel safe walking everywhere.  The locals are so nice and polite.  We enjoyed ourselves so much.

title: Great shopping
reviews: There is a shop for all, from designer to Winners, a great store for a bargain! Plaenty of food options, restaurants, cafes, chains and food trucks

title: Great City and View
reviews: This is our first trip to Vancouver. We heard so much about this beautiful city from our friends. Visited many places around the city e.g Cypress Bowl lookout, Flyover Canada, Stanley Park, Whistler, Burnaby Village, Chinatown and Victoria Island. The Trolley Hop on and off is a great way to see the city. Talk about food...many lovely restaurants and cafes. Was told that Vancouver is one of the most liveable city even though house prices have gone up. Hotels and AirBNB accommodation are easily available.

title: What a great place to wander
reviews: From all the interesting eating places, the organic food market in Yaletown, the waterfront this area was truly delightful

title: Downtown Vancouver is very nice.
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a very nice and relaxed large city setting.  There is shopping for any and everyone.  The resturants are good and have a large variety.  There is safe public transportation.  We really enjoyed just walking around and people watching.  Some very nice shopping.

title: Easy Walking
reviews: Easy to cover the downtown area in a couple of hours. Not that many sites, but not hard to get around. Steam clock was interesting.

title: Take a walk around the streets.
reviews: Sick of the sight of homeless people begging alms everywhere. They take shifts to sit on a milk crate directly outside convenience shop doors so you walk straight into them on leaving. Plenty of decorative trees along footpaths.

title: Gastown is the exception to my poor rating.
reviews: We thought that downtown Vancouver was scruffy, soulless and ugly. They seem to have a policy of eradicating any buildings that are older than 30 years and then build a huge glass fronted skyscraper in it's place. Apart from Gastown, which was our favourite place, there is no character or soul left in Vancouver. Indeed, the number of beggars and homeless people on the streets was quite shocking to be honest, and if you stray up towards Chinatown or thereabouts, then leave quickly...it is very dodgy at night. The West End is apparently well known for it's restaurants but from what we saw it was predominantly fast, oriental style food on offer.

title: Ok, but not great
reviews: We combined a trip to Seattle with Vancouver, and I can't see what there is worthwhile to visit in Vancouver.This is the 4th time I have been downtown in Vancouver and I am always underwhelmed.  I don't feel comfortable walking around, there are a lot of people hanging around and you see a lot of people taking drugs or tripping out.There is a lot of shopping, but it is not unique and there is not a lot to do otherwise. Compared to Seattle it is a huge disappointment.

title: the downtown...
reviews: Everything you could imagine doing in a city, you can do within the downtown core!  Shopping, biking, walking, exploring, eating, coffee shops, gyms, parks...

title: shop till you drop
reviews: Vancouver downtown mall has everything and if you can't find it there take a walk down  ROBSON STREET INTO THE WEST END many high end stores there and some very good places to eat    -burgers -pizza- fish and chips

title: one of my favourite cities
reviews: I fell in love with downtown vancouver. You can walk absolutely anywhere and there are endless amount of things for you to do, there is always a great view to be found, down by the water of english bay or walk the trails of stanley park of the north side sewall with the breathtaking mountains.  its a very fun, friendly, healthy and active, never sleeping type of city.

title: Really friendly city
reviews: Fairly modern city and everyone I spoke to understood English. Has a village feel. Parts of the city are clean but in general the city is half empty of people, especially at night, which is good of course. Friendly local people and fantastic waterfront perfect for cycling. Beautiful skyline at dusk and dawn.

title: Clean and vibrant!
reviews: A great clean and safe city. I feel more safe here at night and day than I do in Toronto. Everyone keeps to themselves but many are helpful with directions. You get the west coast friendliness. Lots of choices to eat and do things. Nordstrom is fantastic for a bite to eat.

title: Loved Vancouver
reviews: We spent a few days hereafter an Alaskan Cruise. We were not sure what to expect, al;though everyone told us it was a great city to visit. We really enjoyed our time here and explored the main parts of the city from Gas Town to China Town. It is very easy to walk and navigation is straightforward. We were there for 3 days and felt we had been to most of the downtown areas we wanted to visit, but alas we never go to Vancouver Island. It is a whole, long day to get to Vancouver Island and we were advised the best way to visor is float plane. We were there a public holiday weekend and all the seats were booked. If you wanted to visit the Island via float plane it might be an idea to book in advance.It didn't spoil our visit, though.

title: green and peaceful
reviews: Get away from the city for a moment to walk or bike thru this beautiful green park. You can rent a bike to explore the park. But you can also walk for hours.

title: an easy stroll downtown area
reviews: Having been used to crowded downtown places, I did not realize that we were walking already in Vancouver downtown 'til we examined the map.The area is not too crowded. People were not in a rush like so many downtown areas around the world.The sidewalks are very clean and we felt very secured.

title: Attractive modern downtown- but mostly closed on Sunday
reviews: We arrived at the central Canada Place cruise port which is one part of a larger pier which includes the Pan Pacific Hotel, the Convention Center, and an Imax theatre with a Canadian tourist film. Baggage storage, taxis, bus connections and the Sky Train rail service are all nearby.
