Note that the very helpful and useful Vancouver Tourist Information office is across the street, NOT the highly visible small kiosks which only sell hop-on/ hop off bus services but know little about anything else. There is free wifi at the tourist office and the staff was very helpful. We walked a lot of downtown, but since we disembarked at 9 am there were few places open. Gastown is the old original area of Vancouver, with 1890s buildings now housing shops and restaurants. Probably interesting when everything is lively, however we were in port on a Sunday morning when nothing is open. It is walkable from Canada Place cruise port, about half a mile. This area and nearby Chinatown  were notable for what seems to be a policy of homeless men permitted to sleep in parks and on the street, which offset the charm.Robson Street is the trendy shopping center of Vancouver, with both local and international chain stores. It was full of activity on a Sunday, and the only place we could find a money exchange shop on Sunday ( at 1169 Robson).The central area of large banks and office towers would be active at other times but there is nothing to see on a Sunday.

title: Nice
reviews: It is a typical city downtown. Electric buses big buildings banks and hotels . Walking on these roads gives different experience.

title: A friendly and beautiful city with a dark side
reviews: My husband was last in Vancouver nearly forty years ago and was keen to return to what he remembers as a beautiful city. And it didn't disappoint in so many ways. We stayed in a hotel on Robson street and were able to walk easily to all the main attractions. We particularly enjoyed Granville Island market and the fantastic food available. Check out the delicious Indian cuisine and sip a beer at the brewery. We hired bikes and cycled around Stanley park and continued along the sea wall for miles. The city is very cycle friendly and it is a great way to get around. Eating out was always good and very reasonably priced. A boat trip around the many islands in search of whales was great fun. Sadly the whales didn't grace us with their presence! I would also recommend the art gallery and Chinese gardens.I don't like to put a downer on all this positivity but Vancouver has a serious problem with drugs and people sleeping on the streets. Most of the time, it was in small numbers but on one occasion we managed to venture into an area between Gas Town and China Town (East Hastings Street) which can only be described as a horror story. Large groups of drug addicts were lining the alleyways and walking vacantly around the streets and the stench of urine was overpowering. It was an intimidating experience and we had no warning that certain areas should be avoided. I have visited many cities in the world but none with such a big problem. It is almost as if the authorities are closing their eyes and hoping it will all go away. Not a good advertisement for an otherwise wonderful city.

title: Interesting Downtown
reviews: Downtown Vancouver offers many interesting areas to see.  But, it is dirty with cigarette butts.  The smokers just throw their butts on the sidewalks and it creates a mess.  Aside from this, many good restaurants, stores for shopping and historical places to enjoy.  Nice people too.

title: View the city of beauty
reviews: Vancouver can be viewed on feet, car, bus, train, and boat. We travel on bus most of the time.  It is the best and cheapest way to see the city. One bus fare ($1.75can for senior) can last you 90 minutes on skyline train, bus, seabus  between Vancouver and wherever you want to be. Vancouver has the best Food Court almost every corner within the city, you can find any type food you prefer within your budget.

title: Wonderful Area
reviews: We stayed overnight in Vancouver before leaving on a cruise.  We loved the city and walked around everywhere.  The people are friendly and it is very clean.  We stopped in at several restaurants and bars and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

title: Downtown 'on the shoulder'
reviews: Vancouver is a delightful area, clean and easy to get around.  Like most big cities, the heart is small in area relatively speaking but to know where to go, it's best to get orientated.  The first thing one needs to is take the bus tours around the city to get the geography and the history of the place.  The walk and walk.  We do it 'on the shoulder' usually at the end of winter into spring.  Weather can be problematic but there is no bad weather just badly prepared clothes !!!  The bars are great, people friendly and everything is accessible by foot.  On the shoulder traffic downtown is less congested but taxi drivers usually know the best way about if you need them.  Other than that the bus has a 'hop on hop off' ticket pricing which allows the flexibility to see most sites and areas over a couple of days.  Vancouver deserves about 3 days if it's a quick trip but equally it is a good base to get out to the whole area.

title: Amazing city
reviews: First time in Vancouver and was not disappointed. VERY clean and safe feeling. Had a wonderful time and would go back.

title: Excellent Downtown and most enjoy full
reviews: Vancouver has excellent downtown in Canada. This includes Gas town, Robson street, China town. Sky train in downtown is very good rapid transit train connecting 6 downtown stations in the core of the city. Duck into Pacific center, Sinclair center or Royal center for the latest fashions, electronics, home decor or stroll along Robertson and Alberni streets for designer wear, eateries, nightclubs and live music. I'm the gas town gas pendulum clock is the great tourist attraction.Highly recommended for every traveller visiting Vancouver

title: Exhilarating. Great city centre
reviews: Do not miss the Olympic Plaza with the Olympic Coudron, close to Canada Place.  The marina es great and very good oportunities to great pics.

title: Vibrant downtown
reviews: We enjoyed walking downtown, shopping and exploring the different areas.  Their downtown is fairly clean, with many shops and restaurants open on Saturdays. The morning is quiet, but their are many people out in the afternoon and early evening.

title: Loved East Hastings Street!!!
reviews: The gf and I wandered to East Hastings street by accident from Gastown as we searched for Chinatown. Was like being on the set of the Walking Dead. Literally dozens of junkies slowly ambling around moaning and groaning for fresh brains (or heroin). So much excitement! We had the privilege of seeing one of these fine young people injecting a syringe into his forearm vein as we walked past on the footpath.Certainly whets the appetite seeing that as a tourist to the fine city of Vancouver, let me tell you. All that was missing was seeing a baby snorting cocaine in a bus shelter. Oh well, maybe next time. Shout out to Hollywood. They could legitimately run zombie tours through the Downtown Eastside and donate 20% to the local residents. Problem and solution!

title: Decent Walk around
reviews: Spent 3 days walking around town, some part good some parts so-so. Downtown would be the so-so. Definitely worth walking around this town though!

title: Great city focus
reviews: With close access to other sections of city, Yaletown, Gastown, Granville Island, it is the perfect place to get a hotel. Vancouver Art Gallery is great, Robson street great shopping

title: End of the Cruiseüò≠
reviews: If you like west coast family cities with plenty to do outdoors, Vancouver is a must vacation spot. While staying downtown, you can get to Stanley park, Granville Island, a hockey game, a museum and fine dining. To me, Vancouver is an awesome mix of S.F., Portland and Seattle with the Canadian feel of friendship and foreign exchange! Unfortunately, Canada has its share of homeless just like the U.S.. Despite the claim that a socialist government has its advantages, it doesn't solve all.  A reminder that world wide people themselves need to help others.  Be nice to the mentally handicapped.  They are there, but harmless.

title: Lots to See and Do
reviews: Wander around the Gaslight district, see the Steam Clock and check out an area that's been around since the Gold Rush days.  Walk down Robson Street and check out shopping and various spots to grab a bite or a coffee.

title: Big City
reviews: There is a lot to see and do in downtown Vancouver. The condos are amazing and the transportation system for getting around downtown is awesome too so you can see everything. Good shopping.

title: WALK IT
reviews: Walked all over Vancouver and this town is clean and safe. Good signage for directions to points of interest and the " you are here 's" are easy to figure out. Plus when you walk you will discover places that you won't see by riding around. Great city!Already thinking about next time!

title: Dirty downtown
reviews: We stayed at a hotel in the centre of down town and first thing on a Saturday morning went out to find a breakfast place.We were disgusted with the filthy footpaths. I would have thought that Vancouver council would have a cleaning operation to keep their streets clean. Enjoyed the rest of the visit but do not like dirty streets.

title: A tourist in your own city
reviews: Just spent the weekend walking all around downtown. The normal characters at the art gallery, the new sport check, the empty stores on Robson and of course Victoria Secrets with my wife. What a great city we live in.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is amazing.  there is a lot to see and lokk at the architecture is varied and runs  from Pacific Centre which is horrendously ugly.  to the Marine building  which is amazing.  You can walk down Robson which is the high end  shopping and walk around to the gay district on Denman.

title: A good place to visit
reviews: I fell in love with this city and will definitely go back one of this days. We love how the trees are so green in the neighborhood at the center of the city.

title: great walking city
reviews: very clean, very easy to walk nearly the entire city and see the different personalities of vancouver neighborhoods. great eating, drinking and shopping

title: Beautiful City, But Noisy
reviews: Staying at our timeshare close to the Wall Centre, everything is within walking distance. This is a very clean and vibrant city, with something for everyone.

title: City for Everyone!
reviews: This city has something for everyone, no matter what you desire! The sites & sounds of downtown to the quiet times in Stanley Park or enjoy a swim / stroll at any of the local beaches. Lot's of shops & or restaurants to experience!

title: Reach this place & then be on foot
reviews: Take sky train bus taxi better then car as parking could be an issue walk all over visit Canada place  try taking a boat in later day stay after sunset lights r beautiful around

title: Helpful Canadians Beautiful City
reviews: Cannot say enough nice things about Downtown Vancouver.  If you want a beautiful city experience with helpful stranger Canadians, this is the place.  We were kind of bumbling around with the cell phone map and two random strangers stopped and gave us pointers.  Nicely dressed normal people on their way to work not homeless looking for spare change.  So nice to help us orient ourselves.  The city is awesome, very walkable, seems pretty completely daytime safe.  Nicely dressed people about that look great.  Not alot of litter, very few street people.  Lots of high end shops (Prada, Gucci, etc) and lots of other varied shops (markets and flowers).  You can walk for hours.  We really enjoy Downtown Vancouver for our city experience.

title: A very clean, tidy city with good attractions
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a bust city not unlike many other cities of the world with great attractions that mean you have plenty to do at all times Stanley Park in particular is quite beautiful in the Spring with the Rose Gardens, the displays of azaleas and rhododendrons all close to the centre of the city and in downtown both Chinatown and the gaslight areas are well worth a visit for the history of the settlement.

title: Eclectic shopping
reviews: There is a good mix of shops in downtown from high end right through the multinational chains and then the smaller boutiques

title: Nice Short Getaway....
reviews: Vancouver is one of those cities that is close to us and yet we feel like we are so far away from home which makes it a nice getaway.  Vancouver has a nice shopping district with all the brand names.  It is especially nice when the exchange rate is so good also.  Lots of things to do during the day and lots and lots of night life too.

title: A world class city with an incredible backdrop
reviews: We are consistently rated as one of the best cities in the world. A vibrant city with gorgeous mountains make this a beautiful place to be. So many unique areas to visit and enjoy with a friend.

title: Family holiday
reviews: This is a fantastic place to be right by the harbour. Olympic flag and float planes was great fun plenty of eaterys tap and barrel esp great as were float planes and fly over Canada. Mahoney and sons also great so much there to see and do would not be disappointed

title: Must-see
reviews: Vancouver (especially its downtown) is most amazing city in North America! Located between mountains with the snow on several tops (I was there in May!), on one side, and an ocean, on the other. Lots of water around, seaplanes taking off and landing on water, a Canada Place .... Good restaurant (avoid Black +Blue), lots of attractions if you have enough time to visit some of them, excellent choices in many shops. All you need is comfortable shoes and your phone/camera. Enjoy!!! Amazing emotians, good pictures and memories for your entire life are garanteed!

title: Lost its allure.
reviews: Vancouver had lost a lot of the vibrancy and attractiveness I recall from the 1990s. Yes, there is great shopping and restaurants but overall the city is quite bland and surprisingly dirty. Not worth more than a day's visit.

title: safe and walkable everywhere
reviews: I have lived all over the world, including "dangerous" third world countries, so I am seasoned to walking around downtown cores.  I can attest that Vancouver is one of the safest cities ever for walking around freely.  Of course, there are streets where all the sad druggies are hanging out.  However, they are not aggressive and don't carry weapons.  They congregate in clumps for their own safety, and are sad cases.  If you don't want to be subjected to panhandling or the evidence that drug dealers are in fact slavers,  just move over to a parallel street.  The "sad" streets are limited to a few isolated blocks in Gastown, and I won't go into the politics of the drug trade, but don't be afraid to walk anywhere at all in Vancouver.  If you are still nervous, take a cab.  Within the downtown core it will be about 12 bucks.

title: Blitzkrieg
reviews: We have been there twice at the end of our Alaskan Cruise, a nice way to finish. We stayed an extra two days before flying back home.

title: Canada place stunning
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is interesting. there are many facets to the downtown area. Canada place on the water is stunning,( We took a sea plane from there to Vancouver Island/Victoria) The Olympic cauldron is quite special, Miku the Japanese restaurant is amazing (close to Canada Place) Gas town in a nice walk, China town forget it, There are hundreds of homeless and drug affected people in and around China town, which is quite sad, All in all a cultural walk

title: Vibrant!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is alive with people, restaurants, shopping, activities and sites.  Although a busy urban center, Vancouver is also filled with locals, tourists and visitors.  Downtown is nestled along the shores of Burrard Inlet, with many restaurants offering great views of the harbor and North Shore Mountains.  The sea wall provides a nice walking/cycling venue.  There are also many bike routes/lanes in downtown to facilitate cycling.  It is easy to tour the sites on foot ... from the convention centres to Gastown with its steam clock to Chinatown.  Places to visit include the Dr. Sun Yat-Sen Gardens and the Vancouver Art Gallery.  Highly recommended.

title: Fabulous vistas
reviews: There are not that many major cites in the world where you have the views that Vancouver offers.  A beautiful bay with lots of action (cruise ships, fishing boats, ferries, trains, sail boats, sea planes, etc.).  Gorgeous mountain background - gorgeous when snow-capped in the winter.  You can easily walk most of the downtown area, or take a hop-on, hop-off bus to get thoroughly acquainted with the whole town.  Interesting, diverse neighborhoods.  Good shopping.  Lots of great restaurants for (almost) any budget.  Busy in summer, especially with cruise season going strong - ships typically are there on Saturdays.

title: So much to do here
reviews: The city is so varied with so many activities.  There is something for everyone.  The is all variations of nightlife, restaurants, and shopping.

title: A crowded but exciting place
reviews: Downtown is a great place to go shopping, biking, or even just hanging our. It is easy to get around and there is something interesting around every corner. The shops and the restaurants are not too pricey. I highly recommend this place.

title: Transportation, food and shopping!
reviews: The downtown is compact with the streets of Robson and Georgia having the most dining and shopping. Transportation is abundant in all directions and it's just ten minutes to the sea wall for exquisite views. We felt completely safe in the downtown area and it was very clean. There are ambassadors with blue tee shirts or jackets who wander around in the area and will approach you if you look like you have questions. Don't miss touring the five story public library. visit a clothing for men and women called Joe Fresh on Granville street. It has low end prices and the products are quite good. Wear good walking shoes as we walked 5-6 miles daily in and around Vancouver. The locals are very friendly.

title: Nice place to walk in
reviews: I go in the Downton every week to shop or dinner. Nice place with clean streets, lots of activities and life. And the night it will satisfy every  nightlife lover

title: Walkable, rideable, everything accessible
reviews: This is a great downtown. It's easy to get around and find whatever you might desire.  I will definitely return.  Food trucks galore. Restaurants at all levels. Museums. Parks. Trolley. Need I say more?  Highly recommend.

title: Loved it
reviews: Everything you're looking for and a downtown experience. Every food imaginable. When it comes to hotels, Between the Pan Pacific and the Fairmont Waterfront, Pan Pacific hands down!!

title: So many shops!
reviews: Downtown is a great place for shopping and there are also some great restaurants that are not too pricey. Stay at the Georgia hotel to make the experience extra special and to  be able to walk everywhere.

title: Waterfront great; some pretty rough areas too
reviews: The downtown waterfront areas are so lovely. And nowhere in Van is short of an interesting boutique store or cafe/restaurant. For some, the city might lack the buzz and dynamism of a London or New York, but there's no denying Van is lovely for a visit. That being said, while areas like Robson and Granville are great for nightlife and shopping, the gritty parts of town like Hastings really surprised me with the incredibly high concentration of mentally ill, intoxicated and homeless out on the sidewalk. It was a bit like passing through a post-apocalyptic movie set and I was left hoping these people were getting the help they deserve.

title: clean, very clean, and busy, lots of foot traffic.
reviews: walking around down town Vancouver it is hard to believe it is a busy as it is, if you looked at the cleanliness you would not think they have the volume moving around that happens, grat job city of Vancouver

title: English bay, plus...
reviews: Start at waterfront station, walk up to Robson Street. Walk down Robson to denman, and walk down denman to the beach. Next, walk up Davie three blocks and turn in the direction of waterfront again. You' ll be rewarded with a most pleasant stroll through a very nice neighborhood.

title: Very enjoyable place to stroll around
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is so small that it is easy to walk around. There are many small restaurants and small shops and cute bakeries and food trucks, etc. We suggest walking on Robson or Granville and side streets.

title: Gastown Downtown
reviews: Yes Yes you must go and visit this busy downtown area of Vancover. Lots and lots of places to see and places to dine.Just awesome to visit for about 3-5 days.

title: Van city
reviews: Downtown vancouver is beautiful with soo much to do and see... Lots of shopping. .Lots of restaurants with variety of great food... sight seeing attractions. .night clubs..pubs.. bars   parks...

title: Love Big Cities and Vancouver had it all!
reviews: Easy to walk, to find public transportation and plenty to do!  Lots of great shops and especially fun to find good food.  From traditional poutine to that with kim chi, many great restaurants to try.  Most of all the views from everywhere include mountains and water which is just perfect.  Great diversity of people and something for everyone!  Airport is convenient by public transportation.. no need for a car but if you have that seems to work well.  There are some areas where I think that people not used to big cities might find challenging but we felt safe all through the city!

title: Not bad
reviews: I hung out on Granville st the whole night and it was fun. The eastern part of the city, especially Chinatown was very run down and I didn't feel to safe walking home. Prices are not bad at all compared to food prices in Seattle. The views are great. The southern side of city is bland. The buildings all have the same architecture and look like a derivative off the building next to it. Stanley Park is a must.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Clean and exilerating, bring clothes to layer.They have great hop on hop off bus to see the entire city.  Great restaurants every where you turn!

title: Great city
reviews: Vancouver is a great and vibrant city full of great restaurants and shops.  It reminds me very much of Seattle, WA.  It was fun to walk around and stop for a drink or bite to eat when you get tired.  It also has a very nice waterfront to take a stroll.

title: Spectacular City
reviews: It's a feast or the eyes, the stomach!  Wow.  So many shops, eateries, people and such beauty.  I am so glad I went. Loved dining outdoors, the plethora of choices, the entire vibe.  Don't miss this city.

title: Good good!
reviews: Downtown the best near Vancouver, have many stores and all ! But sometimes have many homeless and peoples crazy! But it's good

title: Amazing!
reviews: A wonderful downtown area with mixture of stunning modern architecture with historic buildings and a whole range of shopping areas. Many fascinating examples of street art, lots of beautiful trees, shrubs, all in all a great downtown area

title: Reminded me of Tasmania
reviews: Interesting city, harbour and surround was excellent to see, some of the other areas seemed a bit dodgy although we weren't hassled in any way, glad we saw Vancouver however

title: LOVE this CITY!
reviews: Love Vancouver so much! I find it to be one of the most beautiful cities in the world! Not that many cities have the ocean or mountains views and Vancouver is blessed with stunning veiws of both!

title: Nice town
reviews: It is a nice town and it's easy to get around.  However, get ready for a lot of high-rise apartments without any particularly fine architectural distinction.  That part is blah, and you really can see the "blah" if you sit on Granville Island.  However, there are excellent restaurants, the people for the most part are friendly and welcoming, there are plenty of things to see and do, and if you're into fitness, lots of places to walk, swim, hike, bicycle, etc.  Being a senior, one of the things I really liked about the town was the acceptance and welcome extended to seniors.

title: All Walkable
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a plethora of experiences which are all within walking distance from Yale Town, where we had a condo for a week's holiday. If you like exploring, museums, art galleries, shopping and especially people watching this is the area. And it is bordered by Gastown, Chinatown, Coal Harbour, Stanley Park, English Bay and Yaletown. It is a location for the senses!

title: Crisp and Clean
reviews: I have travelled all over the world and have spent my fair share of time in big cities. Vancouver is one that I would definitely recommend spending some time in. The streets are clean and well maintained. Noise and air pollution are at a minimum relative to other cities in the world I have experienced. The downtown area is close to the ocean, which keeps a constant breeze blowing and the air fresh. Rapid and regular transit offers an easy way in and out of the downtown core.Shopping, restaurants and night life are everywhere. Plenty of drinking establishments to relax in and quench your thirst with  craft beer brewed locally. Foodies can enjoy a plethora of ethnic dining. There are two sports  venues as well.Stanley Park is a short walk away. As is English Bay for the beach and beautiful sunsets. Vancouver proper is not that large and neither is it's downtown core. You can cover it in a day or two.If you are in the area, spend some time downtown, You won't regret it.

title: Downtown Vancouver - the place to be
reviews: Our hotel on Robson Street was the perfect hotel location.  Walking distance to almost every tourist attraction and then  some.  There were restaurants offering all types of food in every price range.  Shopping was a breeze.

title: Great for Easy Access
reviews: Stayed in downtown hotel it was a great place to be and probably better than staying in the heart of the city as it was easy access to many attractions and easy walking.

title: Visit Stanley Park
reviews: Only a short walk to Stanley Park and a must do when visiting Vancouver. The harbour foreshore is beautiful and relaxing.

title: Amazing city
reviews: Just love the place. Vancouver is a clean, vibrant city. Yes it has problems like all places with druggies and the homeless, but still appears safe. The sights are wonderful. The people are friendly. The architecture is modern and out there.

title: My Favorite City
reviews: Vancouver downtown is my favorite city with high rises, great restaurants, great shopping and the Lookout Tower with its 360 degree view of the city.  It is a very clean city with very friendly residents. There is a good public transport system.

title: Beautiful weekend
reviews: Spent 3 days through the weekend. The weather was perfect although it's too hot for locals. They had a marathon on Sunday and downtown was full of people and most roads are closed all day. We had a excursion to North Vancouver so we avoided all the chaos and everything is down when we came back. Robson street is pack of people almost reminds me of the strip in vegas. Beautiful people, lots of shopping and places to eat.

title: good to check out
reviews: Vancouver has it all - shops, food, bike lanes, community gardens, homeless people, sculpture... we walked around a lot and always felt safe.

title: Nice to spend a day
reviews: I love walking around downtown Vancouver as there are a lot of fun spots to hangout and just relax. You can also find many open fields and parks that people hangout in on a nice day. We found down town Vancouver to be clean and well kept compared to other major cities.

title: Gorgeous sunrise in the city!
reviews: I love getting a coffee and watching the sunrise in downtown Vancouver. Not too many people around at 630 am.

title: A beautiful city, perfect for exploration.
reviews: The beauty of downtown Vancouver is that everything is within walking distance, so you really don't need a rental car. There are great restaurants, shops, galleries, and bakeries surrounding all of the hotels. We walked to Granville Island, Gastown, Robson Street, Canada Place, Kitsilano, Yaletown, and English Bay. Every time we stopped to look at a map, at least one person (and sometimes more) would stop and ask us if we needed help. The people are incredibly nice and friendly. When you walk around a city, you meet a lot of people and discover things you would probably miss if you were driving. Downtown Vancouver is packed with fun things to see and do.

title: Terrifying
reviews: We went to downtown Vancouver for a little day trip and we were going to stop while heading to the aquarium, but the drivers and traffic made us decide not to and just head to the aquarium and then home to Washington. The drivers were terrifying and didn't care about anyone else on the road. Sadly our experience downtown made our whole trip extremely stressful and we will not be heading back anytime soon if at all!

title: Feel free to wander
reviews: The Canadian people are just so friendly. Wander around downtown, grab a drink (if your an Aussie avoid the coffee!) and relax, look in the Windows, the shops are good too.

title: What IS that smell?
reviews: I don't understand what the smell was. It just seemed that as we would walk around a smell of garbage would suddenly creep up. The place wasn't as nice as I would've thought. There are a ton of homeless people walking around. One pair bombarded us as we were eating and when we told them we didn't have any physical money on us they got frustrated and left. Then we bumped into them an hour later down some blocks away. Talk about a stare down and an awkward walk through downtown. Another time, some lady kept mumbling to herself along the sidewalk as I passed (somewhat far just in case) she began to follow me and at one point got so close I thought she was going to either lean on me or take my purse. I stopped walking suddenly and she, i guess expected me to be there, almost fell against the wall, looked back at me and then walked away. It was a strange walkabout in downtown Vancouver. In the, i guess, nicer areas it was less populated by the homeless but still not as pleasant as I hoped.

title: Gorgeous!
reviews: I forgot how beautiful Vancouver is! I lived there for a brief period in the early '90s. The new buildings are very impressive.

title: Charming, friendly, multi-cultural, and more
reviews: We love VC downtown.  So much to do and so many good restaurants.  Just too much to summarize for one review.

title: Most beautiful city
reviews: We visited Vancouver during the summer. Luckily the weather was really kind to us. Blue skies every day. There cant be many more beautiful cities in the world. the whole setting is stunning. Downtown is very close to the water and with the back drop of the mountains the city has a wonderful feel.It is easy to walk around down town. We took the hop ob hop off tour to orientate ourselves.After that we walked to most places. Ir felt very safe and there was always a lot of people around.

title: Absolutely love this city!
reviews: Vancouver won me over in so many ways. I can't even sum it up in one review so I broke down all I've done in individual reviews. The food, the whole vibe, the cleanliness, the green! I can't wait for my next visit, because there will surely be one.

title: Not too dreaful of a place to hang around, but I find it overrated and overly congested.
reviews: I don't care for downtown and the less often I have to be there the happier I am. It gets too congested, it's hard to move around, and impossible to find parking here. The city screwed over a whole bunch of businesses when they installed all these bike lanes in one of the rainiest cities to live in. Valuable parking space, which served patrons of many businesses are no longer available to make room for these bike lanes.

title: Amazing City
reviews: Beautiful city with great shopping and fabulous restaurants.Everything is within walking distance. Stroll Robson Street or visit the high end stores on Alberni Street with all the top designer brands. Enjoy an exhibit at the Vancouver art gallery,located on Georgia Street. Very clean and safe city. Highly recommend.

title: Not that much to do
reviews: It was not my favorite downtown. I thought it was a little tough to navigate and not so much to see.get out of downtown and see the park!

title: Incredible views
reviews: The combination of big city life by the water and being so close to the mountains makes it a great destination. Make sure you get a hotel outside of downtown unless you have unlimited funds.

title: Convenient and full of good eats
reviews: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency while hubby had conference at the Conference Center.  Lots of wonderful restaurants in Downtown, but can be a bit pricey.  Fun things to do: the Vancouver Lookout (go both during the day and night, one ticket is good for the whole day!), Canada Place---beautiful views, though I thought Flyover Canada was a bit too expensive, Bella Gelateria (can't miss it, there is a long line ALWAYS!).  Lots of shopping options, as well.

title: A great place to visit. Be careful of crowds during weekends.
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a great place to visit as a tourist.  It has the underground Pacific Mall and tons of great shops to poke into. The main drag can get noisy at night though, and may be hard to get a bus ride home, so make sure you have alternate plans or take the skytrain.

title: Love love love
reviews: So much to say! Downtown Vancouver is fun and exciting and always alive. People watching is great. You can see movie sets from time to time and there are many different festivals throughout the year. I love the fact that you can just walk all day and end up in so many fun areas- the beach, the night club scene, Yaletown, Gastown, English Bay, Coal Harbour, concerts, hockey games, shopping on Robson, Stanley Park. It's never boring and everything is walkable if you have a good pair of shoes.

title: most beautiful city in the world
reviews: Have traveled to many cities in the world and Vancouver has everything - mountains, ocean, sports, shopping, walking.  Love Vancouver.

title: Great place to visit!
reviews: I was in Vancouver for a meeting and had just an awesome time. Such a fun and vibrant city. And safe. The convention center is incredible. And sooooo many good restaurants! And if you like fishing, great options on off days. Come here!

title: Systematic roads
reviews: The downtown infact is quite a mess to me. There are so many homeless sleeping on the streets and they really stink with smell of urine. I am so surprised to see so many of them. Also the roads are quite untidy with rubbish accummulated here and there.However, the town has good bus and metro communication and the streets are well organised. It is very easy to move around the downtown. There are many restaurants, fast food outlets, bars,  cafes. However, shopping is only mediocre and not so elaborate.

title: Sensational, Clean & Fresh, Vibey & Friendly
reviews: Browsing shops and met with a friendly smile by staff supplying us with goods etc. Reminds me that Vancouver is the 'Cape Town' of Canada.  I love this place, the people and the openness received from people living there. Just a pity, we had limited time in Vancouver as we were on route to Alaska, taking the ferry from Bellingham.

title: AAN 2016
reviews: It was a very well planned city with many natural beauties. It was possible to arrive both to a mountain and ocean from Vancouver. The harbour was nicely located. Streets were broad enough not to give rise to traffic jam.

title: Cool city to chill out ~
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a quiet attractive place to walk around and enjoy.  There are nice shops and many restaurants along Robson street and in the surrounding area. The pacific center mall has many branded shops including Abercombi Fitch, American Eagle etc

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Easy to walk around, attractive vistas of the mountains and water from many vantage points, nice shops and restaurants.

title: Honeymoon
reviews: Beautiful city! Nature at your doorstep, whilst in a concrete jungle! Mountains, ocean, many water fountains and I loved how many plants were throughout the city! Especially the hanging baskets of flowers everywhere!

title: Big city; yet friendly
reviews: Lots of green spaces; eateries; tall buildings; superb walk along the inner harbour; lots of activities happening. Great shopping...go for it!

title: Awesome City
reviews: I'm typically not much of a city person but I did really enjoy my time in this clean and friendly city. It's got a lot going for it... clean downtown, amazing Stanley Park, Granville Island, Gas Town... and so much more. Not to mention the scenery is absolutely stunning withe water and mountains and skyline as backdrops.

title: Very visitable city
reviews: New gleaming glass buildings now complement older downtown buildings along a waterfront that has a great convention center, tons of superb restaurants, very nice hotels. Many options for touring via bus, boat, sea plane. Canada Place has cruise port right in the heart of all this. Take the Seabus from near there to get to north Vancouver in 15 minutes, for ~$2, runs about every 15 min during day. Easy to walk around, generally feels safe and clean.

title: Awesome and clean
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is much more than expected, the people are helpful with directions and are actually caring, I stayed one block behind the main road, and at night the cops actually close off the road for cars so that you can walk freely and as drunk as you want haha

title: A unique and amazing city
reviews: I spent a day in Vancouver recently.  I took that scenic Amtrak Cascades train up from Seattle.Living in Seattle as I have for 50 years I have visited Vancouver several times.I have seen the city grow and change.  Used to be that if you were going to visit British Columbia...Victoria was always the first choice and Vancouver...was.... well ...a big city that didn't have the charm of the Empress Hotel,  Butchart Gardens, the parliament buildings and that statue of Queen Victoria. I have been on a couple of cruises recently where Victoria was one of the ports of call and I have to say that it was nice to be there but it was, in comparison to Vancouver, rather..how should I say this...limited..yes limited in flat out awesomeness not to mention great restaurants, places to go, stuff to see, and things to do. Vancouver reminds me an awful lot of New York City and San Francisco in that it has what I refer to as "the just being there" wow factor.  Yet NYC and San Francisco do not in any way compare with the magnificent natural sea and mountain setting for this world class city. I had spent the afternoon on the my favorite street...Robson..and was now walking down Thurlow on this April day. I could see the harbor and rising above it snow capped mountains. And the those peaks were not that far away!It's an incredibly beautiful city of many parks the  likes of English Bay and Stanley Park with seascapes, and harbor and mountains and lush greenery. At the same time it is sophisticated and cosmopolitan.I see where Vancouver has been deemed "the most liveable city in the world" by some organization.  I have no issue with that.I live in Seattle which is a lovely Pacific Northwest city. I consider my self fortunate that any time I wish I can travel 120 miles north to visit Vancouver, a unique and fascinating city.

title: Clean and Beautiful
reviews: The city of Vancouver is very clean and very beautiful! With the mountains in the background and a very hilly downtown core, the city itself is very unique! I would recommend this city in the summertime to anyone looking to travel to Canada, as there is a LOT to do there, and the weather is typically MUCH better come the summer months and is typically very dry. The winter months can be dull and gloomy for the most part.

title: Awesome Day Trip
reviews: We spent a day here with our family during the kids Spring Break. It was easy to find a parking garage and walk to a lot of different places.  It does remind me of some European cities. We started our visit in Canada Place and had lunch by the waterfront.  Its a great place to people watch and get some pictures.  We visited the trendy Gastown and tried a great coffee bar there.   Stopped by the local mall to shop for a bit and found they had shops like H&M and Bath and Body Works.  The same evening we took in a high spirited Vancouver Whitecaps soccer match that our sons thoroughly enjoyed.  What is surprising is that for a big city, we had great experiences with the wait or sales staff/baristas/sport arena staff that we encountered. They were laid back and eager to help with directions or what to order.

title: Canadian Asia / CanAsia
reviews: This is not Canada, Calagary is Canada.  Vancouver is little Asian central, the people are sweet and nice just not Canadian.  There's no reason to hang out for more than 1 day in the city, and that may be too much.  Go to squamish or Whistler, dont stay in Vancouver, especially if u have been to Seattle.

title: Great City
reviews: This is such an easy city to get around. Do not worry about transportation. Their public transportation and a bit of walking it all that is needed to see all of Vancouver.

title: A little bit of everything
reviews: My wife and I walked all through downtown, and enjoyed the many different shops and places of interest. We even enjoyed a walk along the waterfront and a Vancouver Canucks game. If you see a game the 50/50 tickets are a must, the winner took home 26,000 dollars. People are very polite.

title: Vacation
reviews: Great couple of days touring downtown Vancouver. Shopped, toured and even found a great pub The Black Frog, which was actually a Edmonton Oilers sports pub. Great transit easily got around taxi's too. Lots of business going on, disappointed with the amount of empty storefronts or vacancies. Sad to see so many homeless sleeping on the streets. Did enjoy many of the patios open for business. Wonderful trip we will be back!

title: Very friendly City
reviews: There are lots of different places to eat and shop. If you have young kids and just want to spend time in the city for few days, there are enough things to do. If your first time to Vancouver, I suggest taking a half day tour of the city to see what you like and then venture off on your own at a later day. Its better to just spend half day at each area instead of trying to cram everything into one day. It could be exhausting trying to do too much in one day. If you like stress free travel with children, then limit your target locations. You will be able to absorb the beauty of Vancouver much more.

title: Good location
reviews: We are on Hornby St. Across from the Sheraton. The location is great for walkers like me.  It was a little bit of a hill climb back from Granville Island.  A few blocks away is the PC mall complex and lots of restaurants and shops within an easy walk.

title: Fantastic cosmopolitan Experience
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a mix of old and new buildings, shops and restaurants as well as BC Place and Rogers Arena sporting and ice hockey arena's. You can visit Gastown the oldest section of Vancouver City, or beautiful English Bay for wonderful sunsets. Stanley Park will take you at least 2 days to walk or you can hire cycles and enjoy the seawall. Shopping is excellent with mix of designer and high street shops. Restaurants to suit every taste from burgers to sushi and gormet cuisine can be found throughout. Be prepared for plenty walking, trainers highly advisable as there is so much to see.

title: Walking paradise
reviews: Fabulous area to walk and enjoy the sun and the view! The perfect place to people watch as well! Lots of places to stop and have a visit.

title: Fun Spring break
reviews: We had only one day in Vancouver. It is a beautiful city which reminds me a lot of Europe. We went to the observation tower from where you have a beautiful view over the downtown area. Chinatown is quiet big, most of the stores where closed, maybe because we've been there before noon. Will come back to Vancouver to explore more of this beautiful city and area!

title: Vibrant Downtown
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is wonderful if you like cities.  It is certainly not a run down dilapidated city - quite modern and very clean.  People were all over the place and it is easy to get around in.  We were very impressed with the area.There are various neighborhoods downtown and each has its own flavor and theme.  There are plenty of places to shop, stay, and dine.  Also, there are many museums, historical locations, art galleries, theaters, etc for your entertainment and education.We enjoyed our stay there and want to go back.

title: Very spread out
reviews: This downtown is very spread out so be prepared to do a lot of walking. Typical stores with nothing special.  You will find all the high end stores also

title: Amazing city
reviews: I absolutely love Vancouver. I love how they incorporate a lot of greenery into the city, it just adds so much to it. It has that small town feel without it being a small town. There is definitely so much to do here, from city life to nature buff in just minutes. Whether you are here for the great restaurants or the nature you're bound to have a good time.

title: Very interesting and attractive city, a guided tour is advisable!
reviews: We visited Vancouver downtown, Chinatown and Gastown with three different guides from TourGuys and it was a very good decision; all tours lasted a maximum of 2 hours but gave us a remarkable amount of interesting information. The city is well equipped with infrastructure for bad weather but we were lucky enough to visit by good weather. For a touristic walk in the city centre a couple of hours are more than enough.

title: Downtown Vancouver is one of the most diverse places on Earth!
reviews: Given any day of the week, the downtown area of Vancouver has more to offer the eye and the senses than might be imagined. On top of that, the restaurants and retail businesses that are available are equally impressive.  This part of the city is definitely worth checking out!

title: Vancouver is so pretty.
reviews: Downtown is really pretty and quite clean for a city.There are beautiful spots and the skyline is really interesting.Of course there are many beautiful shops.

title: Very interesting and modern
reviews: Interesting and lively during the Day, clase to main atractions, easy to go everywhere and calm during the night.

title: Beautiful city.
reviews: Only spent a day here, but was enough to get a feel of the city. Very clean! Felt very safe.  The views from all over the city were beautiful.  My husband and son rode bikes around the seawall and loved it. Went to a hockey game at Roger Arena - easy walk from our hotel, and again, felt very safe. Would love to spend more time there exploring.

title: Cheaper, safer and great public transport
reviews: Downtown is super safe with cheaper accommodation, lots of people of various ages and frequent public transport and tourist specific transport (such as hop on/hop off tours). There's also a brilliant IGA supermarket which means you don't have to eat out for every meal!

title: Best restaurant ever
reviews: Great food btfuul vieu frendly price is chip for all you can eat i well go back again annay time the restaurant is hudg the vieu is fenominal manay flavours the music was nice verry frendly student worker the bar is chip 12.95$ for pitcher of beer loll what are you looking for.

title: simply beautiful !!
reviews: most happening area....just when u arrive at granville metro station.a lots of skycrappers like vancouver clock,TD tower,scotia bank tower,pacific mall...lots of pubs and discs for night life.waterfront and canada place just a 10 mins walk from granville.you will find everything here in downtown....lots of starbucks and tim hortons outlets !! whole lot of everything...go shop in pacific mall...great experience.

title: Vancouverites are unbelievably friendly!
reviews: Vancouver is a clean, vibrant city that obviously works at keeping their city something to be very proud of.  We walked all over downtown and always felt comfortable---never found ourselves on a sleezy street.  Maybe they exist, but we didn't run across one.  What we appreciated the most was the unbelievably friendly people!  Everyone we spoke to was incredibly helpful with instructions, directions and even tourist suggestions.  One Starbucks barista (while there were no other customers) spent at least 5 minutes explaining where we might go and how to get there.  His best tip was that we should buy a Day Pass for the public transportation, which also is good for the SeaBus (and I think the SkyTrain, though we didn't use that).  It was so nice not to have to worry about exact Canadian change for each bus we hopped on.  It also saved a ton in parking fees, had we tried to drive to the places we wanted to go.  Vancouver is such a friendly, interesting and exciting place to visit!

title: Clean vibrant fashionable city
reviews: I love to walk the city in spring as it's always so vibrant and exciting. I love to watch the women because they are always so well dressed. the visitors are ones wearing jeans and ski jackets. Their are so many places to eat, drink and shop that you can never get tired of finding something interesting to do. I love the city.

title: Loved Vancouver
reviews: Everything about Vancouver is beautiful and a wonderful place to visit.We luckily had two days of sun, but was just a bit chilly.

title: Amazing views. Fresh air
reviews: It is a place combination modern architecture with beautiful nature views. Very clean.  Fresh air. Brilliant display of international culture and wealth.

title: Rainy with a chance of a bit of sightseeing!
reviews: I was fortunate enough to spend a day in down town Vancouver recently, it is a lovely city, though down town itself is much the same as the commercial centre of any other city in the world, lots of big buildings, conference centres, lots of restaurants to suit all tastes and pockets, loads of traffic, commuters and workers bustling around with the tourists, go to any major city centre, and you've been to most of them.I am not taking away from the beauty of this city, like Stanley Park, or the bay, or English bay, Granville Island etc, but they are not down town, neither is the beautiful mountainous back drop.We are talking Down town, not the city as a whole.

title: Nice place to hang out
reviews: Lots of things to do and places to eat, or even just go for a long stroll along the sea wall. Nice shops and points of interest, highly recommended especially when it's nice and sunny

title: Excitement city
reviews: I can't think of anywhere in the world I've been where shopping is this great. Every nationality is represented. You can go from one shopping section to another in this city. Wonderful, vibrant and so full of life this city. A travellers delight.

title: Great walking town. .
reviews: I love the restaurants and activities available down town. Going back again for short weekend get away.

title: sight seeing on the West Coast. BC is beautiful, but is also means bring cash.
reviews: I have been to BC many times, as a furniture mover.  Vancouver is a beautiful city.  The mountains are magnificent.  The public transit system is easy to navigate, and there is always someone around to help you sort yourself out.  It is one of the most expensive cities in Canada.  But if you can afford it, I would put it on your bucket list.  The natural beauty is worth seeing once.

title: Wonderful part of the Vancouver experience
reviews: Take a walk along the fake creek shoreline past Yaletown and it's new parks and spectacular beautiful new apartment complexes. Walk through China Town the 3rd biggest in all of North America. Visit The Walled chineese garden. Eat in the magnificent restaurants. Continue your walk into Gas Town and see the unique steam powered clock! All in all a truly exceptional part of vancouver

title: Chinashop
reviews: Very busy since it was spring break Shops and stores had lots to offer and prices ranged from reasonable to a little high. Various food stops as well and looking at prices as I went through my walk were very good

title: Shopping and stroll
reviews: Though nothing like any-other european cities.This is your choice to shop. Find the bargain shops they have cheap souvenirs. The ones in gas-town are expensive!

title: Amazing City!
reviews: The skyline is so beautiful... All the buildings seem to fit together like glass puzzle pieces.  Really beautiful site at night!

title: Downtown Vancouver has so much to offer
reviews: Full disclosure is warranted I've been a resident of this beautiful city since 1983 many changes have occurred but I just love our awesome city. the downtown core offer so muchIt is relatively clean with virtually zero criminal activity except for the common B&E or vandalism that you seen any major city.  As a outgoing, gregarious, friendly person I find Vancouver to be a reflection of those characteristics even though I've heard many people say that it's tough to meet friends here in Vancouver.  I find there are many activities to do in the downtown core: restaurants, shopping, arts, culture, theatre, window shop, people watch, high-end fashion, beautiful hotels and luxury & highend supercars. Within five minutes of the downtown core you can rent a bike and bike 10 kms around Stanley Park to enjoy the many beautiful views of the snowcapped mountains, bridges, waterways, boats, yachts jetski's, sailboats, marine wildlife and hop on an awuabus and head over to Granville Island for a couple of hours.Many activities to see & do in Downtown Vancouver!!

title: Shopping is the Highlight
reviews: For many Australians , like us , the value of the dollar impacts greatly , we have visited Vancouver Downtown numerous times between Christmas and New Year , food is great, but shopping and value for us is the highlight , Robson Street if the weather is OK is the place to be , Pacific Centre Mall and Metrotown a must visit as well, you will not be disappointed , we have never had a bad experience in Vancouver , great spot all round

title: Typical concrete jungle but surrounded by spectacular views
reviews: I might be a bit harsh, but a city is a city to me!It is the surrounds which make it truly different.The bay and surrounding hills topped with snow make this one of the better ones I have visited.I'd certainly be happy to spend some more time here though.

title: down town Vancouver,fabulous
reviews: vancouver city is the most beautiful city in the world,wondeerfull architecture,beautiful place right on the water,you will be kept busy going to all the shopping centres,markets,entertainment place,theartres,get close to the cruise ships parked right there for you to be inspired to have a luxury cruise,

title: So walkable!
reviews: Spent the past two weekends in downtown Vancouver, first trip with a car. Crazy driving!  I'm a pretty competent driver but have never been honked at so much in my life!  Second weekend we walked every where. We were tired but a great way to see downtown Vancouver. Even in the rain!

title: Greart Harbour
reviews: The physical setting is spectacular! I loved the snow-covered peaks in the distance and the seaplanes taking off and landing on the bay. With the exception of a few churches and municipals buildings, however, downtown Vancouver lacked heritage architecture, which was a bit of a disappointment. I did, however, stumble across a historic zone of renovated old buildings (which was probably Skid Row up until a few years ago), and I totally loved it!

title: Clean, Beautifu and friendlyl city
reviews: I have traveled the world and honestly I must say, Vancouver is one of the best cites in the world. It has a great vibe! The food id great. the shopping is awesome! If you just want to walk around the sites are beautiful. It is a must stop destination.

title: Had a great time
reviews: No matter what type of vacation you are looking for there is something to see or do in downtown Vancouver

title: Must See
reviews: There is so much to see in downtown Vancouver and is always being upgraded. The locals take pride in their city and it shows.

title: World class
reviews: Multitudes of Vancouverans reside in the city enabling a vibrant and multi-facitated service sector.  From chocolate cafes to full service groceries, downtown Vancouver has as much for the tourist and office worker as it offers to residents.  Fabulous views abound from street or skyscraper, the harbor grabs the light and flickers it back at the shutterbugs.  English bay and Stanley park make sure a person never feels cement-bound.  The many city events offered year round here make sure life here never goes stagnant.  Great restaurants, bars, terrific shopping and hotels make this a great place for a staycation or visit.

title: Beautiful
reviews: This is no doubt the most beautiful city I've been in on a beautiful day.  When the sun shines on the mountain caps in the distance and the weather is nice it is an amazing place to spend time.  Wander the shops, eat in one of the amazing restaurants or just sit on the street and enjoy the sights with a coffee in hand.

title: Excellent part of city
reviews: Worth a stroll around  good shopping coffee ships and bars.  Relaxed area however don't wander too far from main areas

title: World class city
reviews: With one exception ‚Äî there needs to be more 24 hour businesses. But you can find it all here -- hiking, biking, camping, beaches, swimming, shopping, a booming metropolis, a mountain getaway an hour away, glorious suburbs 15 miles out.  The population is incredibly diverse, and as a result you will see some very interesting looking people.  Accept them and know "that's Vancouver".

title: A little over-rated, unless you like high end shopping, and parking is a bit expensive
reviews: We went here as we were told that the shopping was great. If you want high end clothes and accessories, then this is the place but for us, this is something you can get  in any major city. The area is busy for traffic, though the parking is plentiful if expensive. A quick visit is probably worth while before you go to the market at Granville Island nearby.Some places to eat here though we did not stay.

title: Downtown, Downtown.
reviews: The place where I stayed the most. It has everything you may need during the day, as shopping malls, drugstores, restaurants, and also have a pulsing nightlife with lots of nightclubs! I could stay only there during my trip in Canada and I would be happy!

title: So gorgeous
reviews: Anything you need is an easy walk.... amazing food everywhere... the views?  OH.MY.LANTA!! Simply the most naturally beautiful big city I've ever had the pleasure of visiting!

title: downtown vancouver
reviews: the shopping here is great. some stores at higher end but if you shop around you can get some great deals

title: Granville Island
reviews: If staying in Vancouver, make sure you take the time to visit Granville Island with its fabulous art and craft market and trendy restaurants.  I also highly recommend the Fly Over Candada virtual flight experience.  You literally feel like you are flying through canyons and over mountains.

title: So Beautiful!
reviews: The scenery is beautiful! All the trees and flowers were in bloom. When we couldn't find our way one night, an Ambassador was right there to help us. I love how 90% of the buildings are all windows. Worth your time if you are wanting to walk around for fun.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Beautiful Canadian city experience. The open air market has farm fresh produce and real Canadian maple syrup. Be sure to take in the sights, smells, and enjoy the Canadian culture while you are there.

title: Great place
reviews: Stayed here as part of a field trip. Lots to see/do with plenty of eating places and shops. Also easy to get around. Love this place!!

title: So this is Vancouver
reviews: We stayed near the stadium and were delighted with the downtown area. Interesting food, people and fun. We got to witness the Rugby world tour fans. It was comic con level. We loved it.

title: Easy to get around, with lots to do. Watch out you don't step on the homeless or get followed by addict, though.
reviews: Public transport makes getting about easy. While homeless and strung - out druggies seem to be just about everywhere, they all leave you mostly alone  (or are unusually polite in their begging ).  It does seem that the further east you go (Gastown ), the seedier it gets. Being a 300lbs guy, I rarely get uncomfortable around folks. I did turn back towards Granville street after ducking into a pub for lunch, however, when I noticed 2 skeevy guys following me around Gastown.

title: Fun to be here
reviews: If you are an active life lover then every downtown is your heaven Vancouver Downtown is just amazing it worth to even grap a coffee and drive around. I use to visite here just for fun there are also a number of places to visite alot malls and almost all famouse brands on Ribson Street. Gastown is a worthy place to visite specially for history liver there Words First Steam Clock is really an amazing thing to watch.

title: Great place to visit
reviews: One of my favorite cities to visit.  It's an easy drive coming from Seattle.  The city is beautiful, with both water and mountains.  Great city for walking.  Lots of great places to eat.  It has almost as many Starbucks as Seattle does.  But there are plenty of non-Starbucks cafes where you can get a nice caffe latte or mocha.

title: The most beautiful...
reviews: ...I have ever seen! honestly guys!Imagine the water, the sea at the one side and the snowy mountains at the other. This is definietely the view I would like to see from my hous windows!

title: Extremely Hip City
reviews: The city exudes hipness all of the people I saw looked as though they were under 40. It's an excellent site to walk around in and the stores look so inviting. Close by downtown is the park and the touristy  section. I highly recommend this city

title: One of a kind
reviews: Vancouver is one of the most beautiful cities on the planet with its ocean, mountains, and many different culture's. A great city to walk for shopping food or a show. You will need at least two to three days to take it all in.  Recommend getting a room in the heart of town make sure parking is included as it can be expensive. Vancouver is most beautiful in Summer and fall. Spring can be wet. Catch a show, hockey game, concert, or just hang out on the beach. Have fun be cool.

title: A wonderful getaway
reviews: Despite many homeless and mentally ill people on the streets, none were dangerous or frightening.  I was amazed that in the first 6 hours after arriving by Amtrak three different people offered to help us find where we were going.  Very helpful and kind people

title: Lots to do
reviews: You must try Downtown...so much to do and all seems very safe to wander round. Plenty of pubs and restaurants and attraction. You cant go to Vancouver without going Downtown

title: Wonderful atmosphere
reviews: I loved the Canada place building where the cruise ships dock. Such an interesting piece of architecture. Then you have the Olympic flame right beside it. You look around and have all the business buildings and hotels. Really close you can walk to gas town to get some food from unique restaurants. Worth going to visit when in Vancouver.

title: Ahhh I Love VanCity!
reviews: Absolutely love this city. The combination of ocean, mountains and city in one place, there's nowhere else like it. So many places to eat throughout the city. Events occurring constantly. nature to explore without going too far out of the city. VanCity has so much to offer.

title: Great Place to Vacation
reviews: We stay at a Hotel right Downtown, and found lots to do and explore. Great Transit, great Food, great Scenery, quick access to Stanley Park. Had a good time

title: Love Vancouver!
reviews: One of the most beautiful cities in the world.  Even when it rains Vancouver is a must see! Put it on your bucketlist! I have been coming here for work and personal and never get sick of it.  If you are young, old, and all in between there is something for you.

title: Not much to do
reviews: There isn't a lot to do, very hard to find fun things to do in winter. Not sure about the summer time

title: Beautiful, clean, safe in most areas
reviews: I can 't wait to visit downtown Vancouver each year. I am a senior and walk quickly all over downtown for hours on end, in and out so many interesting shops. I really enjoy the many choices of ethnic foods available at reasonable prices. Stay anywhere downtown and you are close to most venues. Visit Smile Thai Wellness on Robson and Cambie for a massage treat you'll long remember. One can easily spend a week or two exploring the different areas and still not see all that's available.

title: Great place to visit. Great walking city.
reviews: Spent two days in Vancover downtown for our anniversary. We had a fantastic weekend. So much to see. We walked everywhere. Downtown Vancover,, Stanley park, public market, Gastown and, Chinatown. Great weekend, walk to all places visited while in the city.

title: A nice place to stroll thru
reviews: Vancouver is a lovely place to stroll thru, lots to see and great shopping, its easy walking, but don't venture near Hastings and Main Streets - full of undesireables, so pleased we had been warned!!!! The Steam Clock in Gastown is a must see attraction too.

title: Beautiful downtown
reviews: What i do love with this downtown is you will find everything in here and lots of restaurant to choice from.

title: What a great city
reviews: Just back from 10 days in what is a fantastic city.  I'm not really a "city lover" but Vancouver has everything all in the same place that not many other cities have.  Beach, watersports, mountains, skiing, forest, parks (stanley park) and the city is clean and modern.  Particularly stunning at night with the marina areas and even the highrise buildings are stunning when lit up.  OK......it mostly rained when I was there, but it is February (business and pleasure trip)   but come the summer it will be even more vibrant and beautiful.   Lots and lots to see like the steam Big Ben clock, various statues dotted around and stanley park with it's totem poles and great waterfront walks.

title: Hip and happening
reviews: You gotta go down town for night life . Different cool bars and scenes and art. Wine bars to clubs safe not too noisy with the homeless but be aware of plenty of weed

title: What a place to enjoy
reviews: Vancouver is simply everything. Sea, mountains, snow, sun and a lot of rain. Very safe and friendly, enjoy the waterfront walk. Go a little up in the Howe St and have a coffee at Scuzzis.

title: So Beautiful!
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city, nestled as it is between safe harbour and towering mountains, everything all blue and green.  Downtown is a treat - west of Main Street the city centre is all towers and business, east of main are low-rent hotels that give way to homes and small businesses.  West of Main are fabulous high end malls and upscale Robson Street shopping, the main art gallery, convention centres on the water - lots you can explore on foot or bus.  For a small fare you can take the sea us to the North Shore and see it all from the other side or keep walking west and hit Stanley Park for free.  Go south to see hip Yaletown.  The best fusion food anywhere.

title: Love Love Vancouver
reviews: We have visited twice.   You do not need a car.   Must see would be the Parliament building, a carriage ride, the houseboat shops and tea at the Empress Hotel.   Just get out and walk.   Beautiful City.

title: Great city on the wsterfront
reviews: This is a great city with an American look but with a personal friendly feel of its own. Generally a damp maritime climate but very walkable. Dominated by its waterfront and Stanley Park is a must visit to while away a few hours. Great bars and diners and a large Chinatown worth a visit. We rented a great apartment in within in easy reach of downtown, Granville island has a great micro brewery and the university is also worth a visit.

title: Fun to see the sights!
reviews: I enjoy traveling downtown by Skytrain. It only takes 20 minutes from where I live. I usually exit at either Granville Station or Waterfont. Since the Canada Line was built, it's fun to get a cup of coffee and observe the tourists coming and going with their suitcases. I love walking down Cordova Street to Gastown, or up to Hastings or up Seymour. There are many unique book stores and interesting shops which are still left if you're not into mall shopping. It's also fun to walk along the scenic waterfront near Canada Place. A new walkway was finished recently and connects to Stanley Park. It takes 45 minutes to one hour to walk to Stanley Park. There are many coffee shops and delicious restaurants downtown. It's a great way to spend a day, and good on the budget.

title: Day trip to cover transfer time to whistler.
reviews: Vancouver Dpwntown is a interesting place with his high buildings on a small area. Nice shopping wares, worthwhile walking to Gastown with  its small shops and restaurant easy to do by foot. 30/45 minutes from the intl airport.

title: Gastown
reviews: Love walk around after brunch here and watch the horn from the Gastown ... Still a good place to walk around ... Enjoy everywhere in the street and the Pacific Center too

title: Wonderful City
reviews: Spent a few days in Vancouver and enjoyed it immensely..here are so many wonderful restaurants and the sea wall is lovely to walk on. Stanley park is teeming with wildlife and again wonderful to walk through with the lost lagoon and other lakes in the midst of tall forest. We took a seaplane ride over Vancouver and this I would highly recommend. All in all one of my favourite cities.

title: Loved it
reviews: I loved downtown Vancouver!  The roads were smaller so less traffic. Big sidewalks. Lots of opportunities for shopping, eating, and nightlife.

title: Comfortale, Friendly, and Unique
reviews: Vancouver is very interesting. I have been here many times but this was the first where I explored vs. run in, work, run out. It is a unique because you can see a lot of the city and never go out side. There are underground areas, Sky Walks for the above ground, and a great transportation system. Oh, and its beautiful.

title: Great Walking city, lots of shops, nightclubs and restaurants
reviews: Went there in February, weather was light rain but not cold.  City area is safe and clean, people are friendly, architecture was creative, lots of great non chain restaurants and bars.  Easy to walk and navigate around.  Can walk to the arena and stadium

title: Rain rain go away
reviews: Rain makes the beautiful Vancouver downtown so depressing. Never forget to take umbrella when visit Vancouver , you never know when it will rain.

title: Gorgeous City
reviews: Beautiful city from top to bottom.  Tree lined streets.  Water surrounded by mountains.  Very walkable.

title: Vibrant and friendly
reviews: We visit Vancouver as a cruise port but always try to extend our vacation by staying downtown. We find the city and surrounding area interesting.

title: Best experience
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has something for everyone. From souvenirs to high end designers. My favorite shop was Urban Tea. It truly is the best tea shop in the world. There is a coffee shop on almost every block. And if you are lucky, like we were, you can see the Chinese New Year parade. Downtown was clean and we saw very few homeless people. At night we walked along the harbor and we were amazed at how quiet it was. The places we ate at had the best food... Urban Fare And Elephant & Castle will not disappoint. We had a great trip, and it rained the whole time. Can't wait to return when the sun is shining.

title: Beautiful clean city!!
reviews: Enjoyed walking around felt very safe even at night and I was lucky the weather was great!!! Tall skyscrapers. Busy bustling city!!

title: "Dirty!
reviews: It's been a very long time since I've last been to Vancouver! And sadly the streets have become alot more dirty with garbage and junk all over the place it be nice to see more garbage cans placed around and possibly have more cleaners! The sea wall on coal harbor was disgusting, beautiful city but not well kept!

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Beautiful city, you walk around for hours and tons of shops, restaurants and bars to stop in and relax.

title: Loved or four days in Vancouver getting over the 14 hour flight f Om Oz.
reviews: We spent a great 4 days in Vancouver.  Lots of great places to eat.  We found it really easy to walk or use public transport to get around and see the city.  And there's heaps of day tour things to do within easy reach of the city.Love Vancouver?

title: Nice place to go
reviews: One of the landmarks you should see. Summer or winter it is special. Take a bus to go around . It's super

title: Love Downtown Vancouver!
reviews: Every time I visit Vancouver I am so excited to walk and window shop downtown. High end shops and a variety of ethnic food restaurant choices await you. The historic buildings add more character, and for me an extra plus to the Vancouver experience.

title: Everything in one place
reviews: You can find virtually every type of store downtown. It is also very clean, with the exception of a few areas.

title: Just walk around.
reviews: Starting from the Waterfront station, it is worth to go to the Canada Place, Convention Centre, then go to the Art Gallery, Public Library, toss a Robson St, and Granville St, ending at Stadium and Science World (we visit all these places in 6h). Except the Science World, everything else you can visit and photograph for free.

title: Down Town Shopping
reviews: Down town Vancouver is great.  Lots of shops but I will warn you that there are lots of homeless people and it can be a bit disturbing especially for children.

title: Beautiful City - People who live here are very lucky!
reviews: We enjoyed are trip to Vancouver & Whistler in December.  Although it rained everyday, we enjoyed exploring the various attractions and neighborhoods.  I would love to visit again during Summer/Spring.

title: Goregeous
reviews: The city with the mountains in the background is just beautiful. For a large city it is very clean, busy but not too noisy. Some of our highlights were Granville Island, Robson Street and Gastown. The food in the city is second to none! The only negative I would say is China Town dirty with an abundance of bums oh and did I mention dirty!

title: Great to see variety and feel safe.
reviews: We spent a few days wandering around and eating in the little cafes. The views were wonderful and the people friendly.

title: Enjoyable
reviews: Always a good time ...whether you visit during the day for shopping and lunch OR if you visit in the evening for a sit down dinner and show. Lots of beautiful shopping, a wonderful variety of shows/ concerts and lovely restaurants!!

title: Beautiful City
reviews: I had an amazing time here during the Winter Olympics and was fortunate enough to return last year, great place to wonder around and enjoy the city.

title: Amazing!
reviews: Simply amazing! I miss this city so much! Amazing People, awesome Restaurants and lots of places to Shop! Not to mention the gorgeous Stanley Park! No wonder this is one of the most liveable Cities in the World!

title: Beautiful City with Endless Opportunities
reviews: We live in the Lower Mainland and we love visiting downtown Vancouver as often as possible. We just spent three nights at a condo in the heart of downtown. There is great shopping on Robson, amazing restaurants at all price points, and tons of great entertainment. Just walking around the city is great fun!

title: Best live able downtown.
reviews: We live in the suburbs south of downtown Vancouver but take several trips a year and stay downtown at a good hotelat a downtown hotel to enjoy downtown Vancouver. There is lots of interesting shopping great restaurants and a great deal of things to see.

title: A World Away only a Short Distance from Home
reviews: When my wife and I go travel to Downtown Vancouver, we always feel it a world away from where we live in the suburbs in North Delta.  We have found it a quick away to get that 'geographical separation" when we need a break from our regular life.

title: Special city
reviews: I spent several days here and loved it. The city has a good feel to it where we went, and the people seem very friendly, nice and helpful.  The downtown area where we stayed (Pan Pacific Hotel) was very clean and seemed safe, and there was plenty to do and see. There are great stores everywhere, and lots of good restaurants for any kind of food you want.  I wouldn't mind living here. The harbor and mountains make it special.

title: AVERAGE DOWNTOWN
reviews: Average downtown with a lot of homeless. Not so clean as expected, however with nice shops, bars and restaurants.

title: This City has more heart and soul than any other City in Canada
reviews: Vancouver is trend setting urban metropolis at its finest, yet we have amazing scenery surrounding it and in view almost anywhere you go. You also have some older Heritage buildings to see such as Hotel Vancouver.You can be enjoying world class shopping at one moment, and then walking the Seawall around Stanley park in another moment.Fabulous City to explore, especially on our sunny warmer season.And Restaurants ... all types here, from trend setting and modern, to romantic and intimate ... from International Cuisine to local favorite flair ... from wine bars to MicroBrewery Pubs ... everything anyone would want is in Vancouver.And oh ... you want to go skiing ... you only have to travel around twenty minutes to hop on a gondola and look down on the place you just were ... beautiful one of kind Downtown Vancouver.

title: Enjoyed walking around
reviews: There are lots of beautiful and interesting buildings to walk by. Lots of shops, restaurants in every corner. Nice to walk around and explore. Was not too busy at this time of the year. Clean, safe.

title: Average downtown with a nice view
reviews: Average downtown for North America, it is clean and safe despite of many homeless people. If you are lucky, you can enjoy a nice view. And from Stanley Park you can take great pictures of the downtown.

title: It¬¥s nice...
reviews: It¬¥s a nice area, but I couldn¬¥t find anything in particular to love it. There are a lot of nice places to have a drink or grab a bite.

title: Wonderful cosmopolitan city.
reviews: My wife and I recently came from Utah to visit the beautiful city of Vancouver. This is our second trip in the last 10 years and it has been spectacular both times. We felt very safe and enjoyed our visit immensely. We went shopping and people watching on Robson Street and spent time as well in gas town as well as Stanley Park and other parts of this beautiful city.  If you are looking for a big city attraction don't miss out on Vancouver.
