title: A nice town, but not cheap!
reviews: There are lots of things to do in downtown Vancouver, but it's a pretty expensive place compared to other cities in North America.  It can also get quite crowded if the cruise ships are in.  Overall, it's a nice place to visit, with beautiful scenery and good restaurants.

title: I'm of two minds on this
reviews: I've been coming to Vancouver at least once a year - sometimes twice or three times - since the early 80s.  The shopping is still as good as ever if you don't mind all the American clothing stores and Asian cuisine that's moving into downtown now.  For me this is the disappointing part.  In the early 80s on Robson Street, there were a lot of individual shopkeepers who were locally based and unattached to large American chains.  There were also a lot more European restaurants.  Don't get me wrong - I have nothing against a good Chinese or Japanese meal.  There are times when I'd like a good old fashioned steak and potatoes restaurant that I can go to.  Robson Street has also lost some of its charm when the small locally owned businesses left.By the way, the visit was with family (teens), family (no kids), and friends.  We were there for a week last June and who was with us depended on the day.  Our December trip was mostly family with teens.  A three hour visit is about right, unless you decide to include lunch with your visit.  There's a lot to see downtown and you could easily spend a whole day here.

title: Roll up the streets by 8 on a Thursday?
reviews: I was visiting Vancouver for business. I went out to dinner on a Thursday and then went on a hunt for souvenirs for my family back home. Unfortunately, almost all of the stores were closed!  I couldn't believe it!  I found one souvenir store open and a cigar shop open. No clothing stores,  shoe stores, toy stores,  book stores, department stores - nothing!  Very disappointing.

title: Mixed Thoughts
reviews: On one end Granville Street you have a nice mall and at the other end you have a sex shop. In between is a bunch of stores, bars, clubs and restaurants. Seems like the homeless population prefer the south end of the street as it appears they sleep in front of vacant businesses.

title: Amazing City
reviews: This is a clean city with nice beautiful skyscraper. Take a short walk up from the Sea Wall, you‚Äôll find yourself on the shopping Mecca of Robson Street, an eclectic mix of restaurants, hip clothing retailers and lively street merchants. It‚Äôs the perfect place to take a stroll and acquaint yourself with the city.

title: Lots to see and do
reviews: Very beautiful town, most everything is within walking distance. Lots of shopping (Robson St), parks (Stanley Park), hotels, eateries, you name it, it has it. one can also cross over a couple of bridges to other interesting places (University of BC has the Museum of Anthropology), Granville Island - lots of great places to shop and dine. Overall, a beautiful town that will satisfy a myriad of individual tastes.

title: lots to do and see
reviews: Vancouver has so much to offer from shopping on Robson st to the Stanley park seawall, Gas town and Granville island with many hotels at reasonable rates in the city centre.I have visited a dozen times in the last 2 years and still find something new each time and all accessible on foot.

title: Van is one of the prettiest cities in the world in summer
reviews: Surrounded by water and mountains, often covered with snow, it is a great place. Best visited in July and August, it can be nice right through spring, summer and fall although it can be wet and drizzly as well. The waterfront is great for a walk, a jog or to hang out in a cafe/bar. The west coast laid back life is evident here, people are friendly and very outdoorsy. The city is also very clean. Electric busses, quiet and clean, are very useful. Take a ride to the ski hills around the city (Grouse, Seymour or Cyprus) or walk around the majestic Stanley Park, it is very relaxing. Denman Street is good for a feed, Pacific Drive for a beach. You can take the little taxi boats for fun, to visit Granville Island or the Science Centre. There are stacks of things to do.

title: Mesmerizing and cosmopolitan
reviews: Don't miss the change to walk around Downtown Vancouver.This is a beautiful City with heritage building and skyscraper. Plenty of shops, art galleries and things to see, to do and to eat.This is a clean city and great people.

title: Wow
reviews: I can just sit and stare, or read something, or wonder about aimlessly while catching glances about me. All would satisfy the senses equally.

title: What country is this!?
reviews: One of the lasting impressions I have of downtown Vancouver is of walking down the street (just about ANY street!) and listening to all of the languages being spoken by the passersby. Then it's walking or driving past restaurants offering cuisines from around the world - not to mention visiting them and enjoying some delicious meals. In addition to the typical commercial structures, there are a multitude of art galleries, restaurants, cafes, shops offering goods from around the world, mini-parks, fountains and so much more. And across from downtown is Stanley Park (1000 acres of bike routes, mature gardens and walking trails). It's not a small downtown by any means - but it's clean as a whistle and very safe. Go and enjoy!

title: City for Everyone!
reviews: This city has something for everyone from shopping to site seeing of unique city landmarks. This town has some of the best restaurants / eatries in the world. Enjoy the  great waterfront views or just some relaxing time at Stanely Park. Everyone needs to come / see & enjoy!

title: Great shopping area with great quality at excellent prices
reviews: As British tourists we got great value on branded goods. The premium shops are all located together and there are also a number of excellent underground malls

title: Great place!
reviews: Went for a day trip that turned into two! Great museums, people, nature, and culture. I would certainly return. Also went north and went to Capilano Suspension bridge, must go if you go to Vancouver.

title: don't drive, take the public transportation
reviews: Haven't been to Vancouver for about 4 years. I found that after the Olympics Winter Game took place in there in 2010, this city changed a lot, especially the traffic in the downtown area. It is easy to find a parking space there, but the rate is really expensive. There are also a lot of bike lanes and traffic lights, so it would not be a pleasure to drive there. I talked with some friends and relatives living in Vancouver, and they told me that they will no longer drive to download. They are getting use to take public transportation there. So I would recommend tourists to take the public transports, like skytrains to downtown Vancouver.

title: Beautiful building
reviews: Love the architecture of the buildings here. Some dated back to early 1900. Many shops and eateries within walking distance

title: Loved this city
reviews: It rained the entire duration of our trip, but it didn't dampen our experience. The downtown area is vibrant with shops and great restaurants. Everything seems within walking distance. And the people were delightful. I can't wait to take my family back in the summer.

title: Vancouver is great
reviews: This was a fun holiday. We stayed at the Four Seasons Vancouver. There is so much to do with beaches and Grandville Island very close. Canada Pace was fun to walk around and watch the flot plains take off and the cruise ships come in. We also drove to the Telus World of Science, The Vancouver Aquariams in Stanly Park.Would love to go back some day.

title: Warm and friendly
reviews: Easy to walk around. Lots to see. Weather incredible even when it is raining. Did not have a car and yet walked for hours to see the sights. Chose a hotel close to downtown and use the Canada Line of coming from the airport!

title: Very organized downtown
reviews: If it is winter do not worry, all public and private shops and places are isolated from snow, it is pretty downtown to walk and enjoy the buildings and view, it has many attractions to visit and it will help to forget your daily stress

title: Friendly
reviews: Vancouver Downtown was one of the most friendly cities I have visited.  Easy access to everything.  Lots of interesting places to see within the CBD.

title: Nice little neighborhood
reviews: Vancouver downtown is small so it's easily walkable from left to right from north to south. Some notable street r Robson, Granville and davie. It's not epic but I had a great time here

title: the barrel
reviews: a most deceptive place in its midst and in bright daylight wines from at least the last couple of decades parade gaily in plainest of clothes and prices and even in the midst of tandoori and shrimps and chicken thingies; for the most part. Latest unsuspected picks at Hyatt's bar in names I'd not heard of ("Recolte Rouge Baillie Grohman (sp?) anyone?) but they taste good. Follow such commonplaces as Jackson Triggs, Mission Hill, buts in the little known Burrowing Owl in its pinot noir version; made a note of 'Open Sociable' sparkling of Okanagan but is it a name even? Still, tasted good and same goes for the Smits &Cow and Moonstruck Organic cheeses and Pamplona Chorizo.

title: Very charming area to walk around
reviews: Vancouver is such a great city. One huge thing I noticed was how pet friendly it is here. People everyone walking around with their dogs. Some of the shops even have dog bowls set out for the dogs. There are many great shops to go in and look around. There are many parking garages all over to be able to park your vehicle and not have to worry about it on the street. Also, there is a lot of choices of restaurants to be able to go to and eat.

title: Vancouver was just beautiful!!
reviews: Standley Park was beautiful. Take the horse drawn carriage ride. It shows you the whole park and harbour.

title: It's cool!!
reviews: Vancouver downtown it's a financial area but with a lot of fun things to do, during the day you have the view of the mountains that's so beautiful and during the night you can see the lights of the city! Vancouver is awesome!!üëçüèªüá®üá¶

title: OK city but I wouldn't rate it in my top 10
reviews: Vancouver just seemed a little soul-less to me. Perhaps it was the middle of winter thing but I failed to see the beauty people speak of.  Lovely harbour filled with ugly shipping and oil industry accoutrement.

title: Great place to live
reviews: This is a wonderful city, so close to nature, that the eye is treated to a breath taking spectacle. Do not spend your money to buy clothes and shoes in Vancouver. They cost a fraction in the US or anywhere else. However, when it comes to food, you have a huge variety. I loved the iraqi falafel wrap. I also had an expensive meal at the rotating restaurant with a magnificient view of the city. The view changes slowly as the movement is slow. Vancouver must be one of the best places to visit. to Stay? A bit expensive with high taxation, I am informed by one of the local doctors!

title: So easy to get around.
reviews: Love walking in Vancouver. The sights are amazing from the water views, snow capped mountains, beautiful old buildings and the sounds of the gulls flying overhead. So easy to walk around and not get lost. Lots of great shops and cafes and points of interest.

title: Great to have a walk downtown
reviews: Vancouver is a lovely place to visit and downtown is no exception. Shops, pubs, awesome sushi joints and food galore. It's vibrant and the folk are friendly. Well done Vancouver.

title: One of the World's Most Beautiful Cities
reviews: As a frequent traveller, I have seen many of the world's most beautiful and intriguing cities. Vancouver continues to rate with the best of them. Few cities offer walkways along the Pacific and harbours, such diverse restaurants and food trucks, or incredible mountain vistas. The downtown core of Vancouver is for walking, and the city is best appreciated when walking along the water and looking north to the often snow covered peaks.

title: FIRST TRIP TO CANADA
reviews: had the most wonderful experience while I was in Canada in 2006 I am coming back again as I have a lot more to see

title: Beautiful area
reviews: My wife and I truly enjoy the wonderful downtown lifestyle of Vancouver. Perhaps the most beautiful and live-able place in the world. Parks, unique architecture and a truly multicultural environment where diversity and tolerance abound. There is always something new to see as you stroll through Vancouver's downtown. A United Nations of restaurants with anything from every part of the world and ranging from street food stands to the most elegant dining possible. A great place to visit or live

title: Lived-in downtown!
reviews: I really liked that Vancouver downtown is not a ghost town on weekends when office towers are closed. In fact, I was surprised with how many locals live downtown. The effect of that is that there's many cafes, restaurants and stores open late even on weekends when it's raining outside!

title: Uwalking and exploring
reviews: My dgtr works in downtown as well as she lives there. It is a lovely city to just wander anlook at the buildings. Walk the dog twice a day so go to different areas.

title: We love our Skytrain
reviews: When everyone else is hustling trying to find expensive parking we just hop on the Skytrain from Surrey and we're downtown in 35 minutes. No parking required. For shopping, dining or concerts, meeting friends, we find the convenience of the Skytrain awesome

title: So much to see & do!
reviews: I love the different neighbourhoods in Vancouver which all have a different feel. It's amazing that there are beaches right downtown as well. Stanley Park is connected to downtown too. There is just so much to see and do in this area.

title: WORLD-CLASS URBAN CENTRE
reviews: Whatever commodity or service you desire, you'll find it here, in one of the cleanest  most beautiful cities on the planet.  Ski on the surrounding mountains in the morning, 30 mins. later, sail in the afternoon.  That night dine in one of the most ethnically diverse cities in the world.  Per capita, Vancouver has more restaurants than New York City and the second-largest Chinatown in North America (only S. Francisco is bigger).......note,  I've lived in Vanc. for 70 years.

title: Enjoyed Robson street experienxe
reviews: We stayed in downtown Vancouver and enjoyed the proximity of lots of things to do. Shopping on Robson, BC Place, Rogers Centre, Granville Island, Starbucks everywhere, many good restaurants etc. It was great to be part of the downtown experience.

title: Morning, evening, or night, it's magic!
reviews: We loved walking around downtown, admired the skaters on ice, walked to Canada Place, and along Robson is great shopping.  Just window-shopping is fun, too.  Stop for coffee along the way!

title: There's so much to see
reviews: Take a conducted tour, is my best suggestion-as then you do get a general aspect of Vancouver, You will need 2-3 days to take in most of the attractions but it all depends on how long your stay will be, This city never fails to disappoint

title: Big, busy, boring
reviews: I have been to Vancouver quite a few times. Unless your'e going for something specific (like a Canucks game) it's pretty boring. There are lots of restaurants & bars. It's a large city, but besides Granville Island, it's very vanilla.

title: Walking around downtown Vancouver
reviews: I loved and enjoyed just walking and window shopping in the downtown district of Vancouver.  There were also so many restaurants to chose from.  It reminded me of San Francisco but more on the upscale.

title: Great combination of town and nature
reviews: What I loved about Vancouver was the quirky city shopping experience and having the mountains and the ocean so accesible at the same time.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: This city is great full of life with beautiful people. I recomend visiting Vancouver. Great restaurants.

title: The views are breathtaking!
reviews: Wonderful city engulfed by beautiful views all around!! Went in winter and it was gorgeous! Will definitely visit again!

title: Very busy and loaded with tourists but great shops and restaurants
reviews: I loved walking the streets of Vancouver - window shopping is great.  They have some really unique stores, one is a famous shop store that has the most unique, handmade shoes that are one-of-a-kind!  Easy to walk the streets and extremely safe both day and night.

title: Beautiful relaxed city
reviews: vancouver is a joy, a wonderful city. Our favourite areas are Gastown, with the famous steam clock and superb eateries and the waterfront where you can sit and eat or just have a relaxing drink whilst watching cruise ships come into port and an endless line of seaplanes taking off....all this with views across the bay looking at Grouse Mountain. TIP...you must take a trip to Grouse Mountain, also Capilano Suspension Bridge Park. Back downtown, Robson st is the Main Street for shopping and even more restaurants. Just a short bus ride away is Stanley Park and some lovely beaches nearby too.

title: Vancouver Downtown - An Interesting, Exciting & Very Clean City
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is the business, shopping, & financial centre os this spectacularly beautiful westcoast Canadian city.  The streets are laid out in a grid pattern, making it very easy for travellers to maneuver and get around. The city core sits at the mouth of the  Burrard Inlet and looks out towards the beautiful North Shore slopes.  At night time, one sees the glittering lights of the Grouse Mountain ski slopes all year round hovering above the lights of the populated North Vancouver and West Vancouver residential areas. It's truly a beautiful sight!!  There are shopping malls in the heart of the city core --- The Pacific Centre Mall is connected to other malls in the downtown core. As well, there's the Robson Square complex which houses the University of BC Downtown Campus, the Law Courts, the Vancouver Art Gallery, and many corporate offices.  All of this is accessible on foot!!  Nearby, within walking distance, are a host of major hotels --- all 5-star!!  As well, the finest restaurants and bistros are present and, being on the Pacific westcoast, seafood restaurants galore!!!  A trip to Vancouver must include a visit through Downtown Vancouver!!!!   Highly recommended to all who are visiting Vancouver!!

title: Vibrant City
reviews: Lots to see and do in Vancouver, particularly downtown with its mix of cafe's, shopping and restaurants. We enjoyed just strolling around taking in the atmosphere and there seemed to be something different happening around every corner.

title: Love a walk in Downtown Vancouver!
reviews: Personal favorite take a stroll on Robson Street and do some window or real shopping! Also make sure to stroll through Robson Park and if in winter visit the Ice Rink. The Vancouver Art Gallery is worth the visit.

title: Lots to do, great shopping on Robson
reviews: Lots to do here. We come here often. Get to Yale town and Gas town for more trendy places. People are friendly. Lot of eating choices too.

title: Very Good
reviews: The Robson St, it's very huge and have many restaurants, store and hotels. I recommended stay in a hotel in this street.

title: place for shopping, food and natural scenes
reviews: I study in Vancoucer so I've been to downtown many times. It has many shopping malls like Pacific Center, Nordstrom and the Bay which satisfy my wish to buyyyyy. After shopping, it's time to have food. Along the Robson Street, there are galaxy of delicious Japanese and Korean restaurants! If you like natural scenes, Stanley Park and seawall, English Bay are also great place to go!

title: Quite a typical city from beautiful to run down
reviews: The Downtown area is quite easy to explore by walking around and breath the flair.It is a city which is best to explore on a sunny day.There are high class shopping areas as well as a bit run down areas.The people are amazingly open and friendly, very diverse.

title: Nice, Balanced City
reviews: Vancouver is an interesting city, offering both quaint downtown streets (Gaslight District), nice shopping areas and good/great restaurants. The people are very friendly. The city has a nice outdoorsy feel and they seem concerned about the environment. We were there during very nice weather, so made it easier to get out and about, and walk around. We were particularly entertained by the "free hugs" offered at the busy street corner. Mass transit was very efficient (you don't need a car in the city), and there is a lot to do regardless of your interest (museums, botanical gardens, boat rides, hiking, eating, people watching, etc). I can't wait to go back!

title: Great walking area.
reviews: Fun to walk and see the sights.  As already known, Canadians are very nice and helpful when directions are needed.  A fun place for family.  Cheaper now with the strong US dollar....

title: Boxing Week Sales
reviews: It seemed most of the merchants in downtown were having Boxing Week sales.  We enjoyed window shopping - it was crisp but great walking!

title: Vancouver has it all
reviews: Super friendly, lots of cafes and great food. So much beer. Lots if shops. Perhaps the quality of coffee was the only thing lacking.

title: Had a good time there, fun place.
reviews: Vancouver is in a wonderful spot and you will enjoy your visit there.  The folks are friendly and there are many interesting places to check out in the environs.

title: Holiday stop over
reviews: We decided to spend a few days in Vancouver on our way up to Whistler. A great decision on all accounts. The restaurants and shopping were much better than I expected and the locals are lovely, kind and welcoming. It is kind of funny to think of Canada as a foreign country but it is when you are coming from the US. We had a wonderful trip and are thinking of coming back next year. Boxing Day shopping worth the 9 hour drive up.

title: Clean & Easily Taversed Downtown
reviews: Vancouver without question is one of the most organized and easily traversed city.  The areas by the water front have pedestrian walkways separated from the path for bikes and roller blades that makes the worry of dodging walkers or those on bikes a non-issue.  The walkways are clean and have plenty of locations to stop and take in the sights.The waterfront area is strongly recommended especially on clear days where the mountains to the north can be seen.A final note is that captivating pictures of the city can be taken from Stanley Park looking back to the east/southeast.

title: A fantastic clean place to visit , friendly people, felt very safe.
reviews: We stayed in downtown Vancouver while visiting relatives. It was a bit of a whistle stop trip but we managed to pack a lot in and saw some amazing sights. The people are really friendly, we felt totally safe and it's very, very clean. Gastown wasn't as good as I remembered it and we strayed to a part of downtown which wasn't very salubrious but every town and city across the world has a part like this. We soon realised we didn't want to be there though and headed away from the area. I cannot a visit to Vancouver enough you certainly won't be disappointed and although I haven't visited here for approximately 30 years it is still as lovely as it was then. I certainly hope to return there in the not too distant future.

title: A place for eating and shopping
reviews: I came here because I want to look for food and look at the downtown Vancouver. It's just like downtown in other cities in the world nothing special. There are some shops and eating place.

title: Sightseeing and shopping
reviews: Worth to spend a couple of days in Vancouver and stroll around downtown. Interesting both for sightseeing and for shopping.

title: Robson street is great
reviews: Be sure to take a walk down Robson Street...such a wide variety of unique shops including some very high priced shops and clothing stores.

title: A city is a city
reviews: Cities have their own atmosphere. There's much to praise, the village atmosphere of each district, small parks and gardens, the open air playground feel to Vancouver with it's mild climate. There's nearly always a view of mountains too, currently snow covered.

title: Busy and safe
reviews: We are staying in downtown Vancouver for a week, halfway through our visit and we love the place. It's an easy walk to Stanley Park or to the bustling city centre. Lots of restaurants at on your doorstep.

title: Not really much to recommend here.
reviews: I wandered around and took my picture by the Steam clock.  Took in the art gallery.  There has to be more to Canadian paintings that forest landscapes, right?  The post office people were most helpful, but it was hard to find many things that were underground.

title: Refreshing
reviews: Its a place for shopping and enjoying the culture and eating. Its full of life you can enjoy without anything to worry in the world.

title: Sightseeing Vancouver
reviews: I visited Vancouver in summer 2015 for the first time and of course one of the first places (after Expo place) to see was the Downtown. I liked the walk from Canada Place to Stanley Park, there are a lot of caf√©s and you can go for a cruise on one of the boats there, too (even fly around). On the other hand, compared to Seattle the Downtown seemed to me a bit busier and less comfortable, but it is true that I spent in Vancouver just a weekend, so my opinion may be influenced with the rush to see as much as possible in a short time.

title: NIce Downtown
reviews: We are staying in downtown. It has a lot of places to eat and shops within walking distance to most everywhere. It is very busy and crowded so be careful when driving or crossing the street.

title: Great place
reviews: There are so many good restaurants, clubs, shops, etc., all within blocks of each other.  Anything you would want to do can be done here.

title: Walking no distance
reviews: All of a sudden,you find that part you wanted is already there. And again, and again. The distances are short and there's plenty to see - and go with a guide, makes it so much more interesting! Or at least a Lonely Planet, everyone is a tourist, anyway. These buildings often have a spectacular story.

title: Too Much going on
reviews: The core of Vancouver can be a great walking tour especially if you are coming off one of the many cruise ships that the harbpor hold. The downside right now is the amount of new construction going on on almost every street. If you are in a car the traffic can be terrible right now.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: ‚ú® I love downtown Vancouver. ‚ú®It's the only place I have been were absolutely everything is within walking distance. From tons of restaurants, clubs, shops, beach, malls and comedy shows.  There's  cafe/coffee shops on each block and they are mostly busy with fun exciting people from around the world. The only time I took a taxi was to go to kipalano.  There is also free shuttle buses. I recommend staying on Robson street and take it from there! Tons to see and do!  Enjoy your stay üòç

title: Downtown
reviews: A great location to base your stay, easy walking distance to attractions and facilities, and plenty of transport to get you around on cold and wet days

title: Vancouver Chrstmas Market "GroB " Am I back in Frankfurt ????
reviews: Marvelous ! ,it is so nice to have a great Christmas market down down ,it is so closed to sky train and  public trans  ,and it is so clean and a lot of space to move around ,the vendors and the staff so friendly and  smile !that is what you call Xmas season  !the experience is amazing ,,remain me in Frankfurt Germany all most 5 years ago , ,my three girlfriends and I ate so much ,well over $200 just in  SNACKS ! we all so happy and full ! I would recommenend  if you have a gust in town ,this market must  seen , special  the food , like the Roast Pork H,Stollen , Flamkuchen , and the Black Frost Cake , it is also great for the family and kids ! HAPPY HOLIDAYS !

title: Great Food and Shopping
reviews: If you want to experience the wonderful ethnic diversity in the Vancouver food scene, this is the place to do it.  Great coffee and dining places - high point for us was the Medina Cafe.

title: spent a lot of time
reviews: We stayed in downtown and that was the best thing about our trip. Everything was within walking distance be it the tour buses, shops , Museums , library and the coffee shops. I liked the churches and the the YMCA . Don't miss the music at the Wesley church on Sundays.

title: Perfect for walking!
reviews: Exploring the city from one attraction to another and from one restaurant to another is fun in Vancouver.

title: 2 Shopping Areas I found
reviews: On our trip to Vancouver Canada we walked all over the place. On Davie Street we found a small store called "Amy's on Davie " inside we found Craft stuff, Kitchen stuff, Wrapping Paper, Gifts, Lights, dishes and novelty stuff reasonable prices and the Owners were so nice it's not showing up on Trip Advisor but it should be. The 2nd place was Purdy's Chocolates at the Smaller Mall by our Hotel I don't remember it's name but I feel if you Love good Chocolates this is the place to go.

title: I love it
reviews: What a great, clean, safe walking city. People live in downtown Vancouver and it has great restaurants, bars, night clubs.  Stanley Park. The hockey arena and Football Stadium are right there. Two large convention centres. The cruise ship terminal. All are no more than a fifteen minute walk from one and other. World class shopping and live theatre and cultural events are always available.

title: Just Enough For All
reviews: Vancouver is not too small and not too big in many ways for travellers. If you like shopping, high end stores like Louis Vuitton, Cartier, Tiffany's, Hermes, and many more, they are all here. If you like more mid-range there are all the malls located downtown and the department stores attached to each. There are also excellent discount places like Winner's and clearence areas of department stores.Simlarly, electronics, computers, cameras, and the like are available at Best Buy and other shops. In terms of restaurants, there are numerous ethinic and regular eateries everywhere ranginging from Burger King and McDonald's to high end tasting menu establshmens. All within walking distances to all hotels located downtown.Gastown is just at the edge of downtown where across inlet seabuses and all transit modes connect. Beware that the more sketchier streets and areas are also steps away. You will know when you venture out of Gastown where the quaint shops and the historical is located. The steamclock is there. Downown is also where the more popular entertainment spots can be found. Nightclubs, late nite eateries, theaters both movie and live are just blocks from each other.Downtown Vancover is so tourist friendly that bikelanes, if you rent a bike, keeps you separated from traffic. Vancouver is by far not NYC, LA, Sydney, Paris, London and the such, but it has all that you might want to do and see that any visiter from those places would like.

title: Vibrant Downtown
reviews: I'd suggest that you look into taking the skytrain to downtown and getting off at City Center and walk around. If you plan it right you can get lunch at one of the many food trucks, visit the museum, and then look at the bay and see more sights.

title: Business Day Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Beautiful downtown Vancouver Park and walk every where I needed to go!Great day and was able to stop at a wee bistro for a great latte and write out my reports!

title: MY CITY OF BIRTH AND I STILL LOVE IT!
reviews: With the help of Trip Advisor I have found lots of excellent new places to dine, have coffee and shop.  I was born in Vancouver but now I live farther out so we don't go out for dinner as often downtown as having a drink and driving today is just a big no! no!We had some great places when I was growing up but many are now gone and new exciting ones have popped up all over the city.  It is still a thrill to go downtown and see what is new.  Try it sometime but check out Trip Advisor, they do a great job and so do the people who send it their review.  Such an easy way to find out what is out there without taking a chance and hating it. Have fun I did and still do!

title: Always nice
reviews: Another city I love to visit.  It's clean, beautiful and has good options for shopping, not mention all the winter sports ,  lots of wonderful restaurants ,  parks etc...

title: Full of Life
reviews: I love to go downtown, lots of shops, restaurants, night clubs and theatres.  Full of excitement and action that seems to me the place never sleeps.

title: Beautiful city with many outdoor options
reviews: Vancouver is beautiful, and if you like outdoor pursuits, there are many options. Hiking, biking, boating, skiing, etc..  Close to ski spots and beaches.  Stanley Park is the highlight.  Also, many great food options, especially with Asian food.

title: Used to be good before...
reviews: When the government allowed a rush of foreigners from Asia, it has gone down hill. Prices have gone up with restaurants, parking, shopping, lease, rent and living expenses. It's really too bad.

title: Vancouver: best atmosphere ever!
reviews: This is really my kind of city! The atmosphere is so good. We did 40 kms of cycling along the coast. (Better do it in 2 or more days). So many nice things to visit: the totem pales, Stanley park, take a boat taxi to Granville Island to grab a bite. Take at least 2 full days to visit. (And we saw Jesse from Breaking Bad walking in the streets!!)

title: Variety
reviews: You can buy just about anything you want from just about any retailer downtown. Plus there is every kind of restaurant and food available. It's safe and easy to walk around. And you are close to English Bay and Stanley Park. Perfect.

title: Nice to see you Vancouver
reviews: It were many years that I wanted to see with my eyes this city, now finally I can say that I've been there.  I walked trough all downtown's roads, and I like it so much!  A nice city to stay

title: Love Vancouver!
reviews: One of the best cities in the world to visit... Friendly people, extremely nice environment with lots of attractions to see. Love it and recommend to everyone to visit!

title: Lots to do
reviews: Lots of shopping and restaurants. Traffic wasn't too bad. The worst part was parking- extremely pricey and the lots are typically small. A very beautiful city even though it was either overcast or raining.

title: One of the Most Walkable Gities in the World
reviews: I've spend the better part of four days in Vancouver. My hotel is just off Robson St. Robson Street has a fabulous array of shops and restaurants. Robson Street is just one of many terrific shopping or sight seeing opportunities ( Granville, Howe, Homer, Water, Waterfront, etc..) There is just so much to do in downtown Vancouver!.

title: Nice
reviews: As part of my 1 day trip,  it was nice to walk around dt. Fairly compact,  alot of shopping and food options.  Very pretty and nice architecture.

title: Shopping and dinner
reviews: We always love to go to Downtown Vancouver for some shopping and dinner, then watch people pass by. Especially in Robson street which is nice during Christmas season with the lights around the tree and some sales in the stores.

title: Improving the experience
reviews: There are a few places that are fun to visit. The Museum the different art galleries near by.  Great shopping if that is your thing.  Use public transportation to facilitate your experience.  There is public parking available.

title: Between Pacific and the Rockies
reviews: Vancouver is likely one of the best located cities I've seen so far in North America. With a glimpse of faraway mountains and sitting by the ocean's rim, surrounded by islands and stretched over the water, linked by the Lion Gate's bridge. Downtown area id full of life and people, tourists and locals alike, shopping, taking a stroll or sightseeing. The architecture is amazing, new and old, artfully mixed together. The only eye-sore detail may be the homeless population, quite frequently present in downtown areas, attracted from all over the country by the milder weather - as I was told.

title: For Business ,everything is very close
reviews: For a short trip business,downtown Vancouver is great.Everythingis so close.Walking distance from the main HOTELS .Love to come to YVR for business everything is so close

title: beautiful
reviews: Great when its snowing, lots to do, lots of shopping and restaurants, such a beautiful city, definitely worth the visit

title: the downtown eastside
reviews: Every so often I leave Abbotsford and take a ride to vancouver just talking to people on the dtes..I happen to have had to expiereince of being homeless onec year my self ,i enjoy talking to people i knew and just chatting with them and remembering how tramatic it is to  of shared those same expieriences.A great reminder of how greatful i truly am.

title: Wonderful city, so much to explore
reviews: Loved Vancouver - there is truly something for every taste.  Fantastic restaurants, nice city for walking around and some wonderful first class hotels.  Get a hop-on-hop-off bus pass to the different sections of the town easily. The acquarium is first rate.

title: Walking distance
reviews: All you need is just walking distance.  All public transportation is well placed and excellent accessibility.

title: Fun
reviews: The downtown area of Vancouver offers great places, as well as some rather scary areas, to visit. It is advisable to inquire with a local source as to where to venture.

title: Christmas Market near Queen Elizabeth Theater was a lot of fun!
reviews: $8 admission charge let you into a compound; outside was mostly Christmas treats of several sorts, such as gluwein, roasted almonds, shortbread, and so on.  A few outdoor stalls with gifts and decorations; one fair-sized indoor vendor with many types of decorations.  Definitely worth a visit.

title: Chinatown!
reviews: Walked done the hill from The Holiday Inn on Broadway to Chinatown. Quiet sunny day. Went shopping for a bean pot. Bought two at Win Cheong on Pender Street. Thanks guys sorry you didn't know what a bean pot is. Same as Chinese soup pot.

title: $300 jeans
reviews: Stayed in hotel across from mens clothing store with big sale-50% off, tried on some jeans which fit and needed length shorten, so had committed, turns out those were not on sale, so now have some $300 jeans, of yes, the downtown is great, very good restaurants, lots of independent stores so see lots of products not seen otherwise, along the harbor side lots of interesting sites and glorious parks, also took hell tour which was worth the price before a cruise north to that oil rich state.

title: Amazing
reviews: lots of stores for shopping. Lounges & bars. You will never get bored. Pacific centre & hudson bay provides wide range of brands

title: Good and getting Better all the Time
reviews: Feels safer than when I lived there in the '90s.  More livable, more walkable, Pacific Center is great, plenty of great pubs, a HUGE downtown with lots to do for any style or taste!

title: Sensory Overload - in a Good Way
reviews: Feel like working out?  Go to one of Steve Nash's Fitness Centers.  Feel like sightseeing?  Go to China Town.  Feel like shopping?  Go to the shops on Granville or to the Pacific Centre. Feel like a snack?  Go to Tim Hortons or Take 5. Feel like a meal?  Go to many of the restaurants available.  Downtown is where it's at.

title: Spoke to my soul
reviews: My visit to downtown Vancouver is best described as a spiritual experience. I had no idea that I would love the city so much, but I am anxiously plotting my next return. Seriously, I felt Vancouver deep in my bones. Beautiful city. Very easy to walk. Visited June 2014

title: The Beauty of this city is outstanding!
reviews: We stayed at Best Western On Granville st. We were able to walk all around the area during the day and at night. We found the people on the street to be friendly...lots of hotels in the area. We enjoyed a movie at the Scotia Theatre on Burrard St. Took lots of photos at the Telus Science Center. It was a stunning day! We needed more time to take in more off the False Creek, Granville Island and more shopping. The restaurants were all good! Thankfully our hotel had parking.

title: great city !
reviews: Vancouver is a city that makes you feel good, many people around with lots of histories to tell, is a beautiful place also with skateparks and great night life the view in almost the entire city will make you feel impressed.

title: Our favourite place to be...
reviews: We lived in Vancouver for 15+ years and never thought we would move anywhere else. Well we moved to Edmonton. You can't even compare Vancouver to anywhere else in Canada, nor anywhere in the world. We miss our downtown all the time. It has everything you can think of to do and it's beautiful scenery, fantastic shops & restaurants, and people make it our favourite place to be in the world! You can spend a day just walking around the sea wall, then over to English Bay and Kitts Beach, up Denman Street and over to Robson Street and you will see so many things, people, places. It was always a great experience every time we went downtown Vancouver!

title: buildings, Green and helpful People
reviews: Vancouver Downtown is one of the most beautiful downtown in the world. The streets are very well planned and local people are so helpful. If they see you with a map in your hands and confused look on your face, they approach you and ask if you need help. You can ask them where to go and how to go there, They will answer very politely and will be very happy about it (Canadians... :) ) You can easily get lost between those tall buildings but after a while you learn to navigate throughout the city. My advise is to walk in downtown, there are a lot of malls and stores to shop in downtown. You can buy a lot of local products. Just plan your trip in downtown on one of the not rainy days...

title: Beautiful Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Lot of shopping and restaurants. Rogers Arena and BC Place Stadium in close proximity. China Town is located east of Vancouver Downtown, about 5 mins drive. Accessible to Waterfront by Skytrain, cars or buses. High end retailers like Guccy, Georgio Armani, Virgin mega store etc. Financial District with all the big banks offices located right here in downtown. Please do not drive in downtown, takes the buses or the skytrain. Very congested as always. Saturdays/Sundays activities are numerous caters to young and old. Many big name hotels are located here too.

title: Waterfront City
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a great place to shop and explore.  Walking along the waterfront or visiting the many boutiques or department stores you will find anything you are looking for.

title: What a difference with the US
reviews: Staying one week in Vancouver made us realise what a unique country this is, with Vancouver on top of our list.

title: Safe and clean.
reviews: Really shows the differences between Canada and the U.S. People are more courteous, traffic is more civilised but you will find the shopping is not that great. Plenty of choices for dining if you ask the locals.

title: Beautiful view
reviews: Love this city. Stanley Park amazing view of the mountain and easy access to get to the sites such as Capilano suspension bridge. Lots and lots of great restaurants and the Japon hotdog at the outside vendor is a must  try.

title: Stunning. What more could be said?
reviews: Every time I come to Vancouver it impresses me. With its cosmopolitan feel. To its cultural diversity, the city is full of life and the scenery is its crowning glory. Do enjoy your stay there is many things to keep one occupied.

title: A city and a half
reviews: I don't like big cities.  But I can honestly says I would go back to Vancouver any time especially Downtown with all its places to see, things to do, and loads of places to eat and drink.  What a fantastic city this is.  So easy to get around, so easy to find places to visit, so easy to explore.

title: Fabulous
reviews: Go and eat lunch at bread and meat great little stop. So many shops and so many places to eat. We enjoyed the hustle and bustle, great city

title: Water shuttle to vancouver
reviews: Visiting family in VAncouver was a wonderful trip,WE took the water shuttle to Vancouver city was $4 each person for 2hours.no one checks the tickets but if you do get stopped and didn't purchase a ticket you will be fined over $100.00 no we didn't have this experience but questioned no one checking tickets and asked my brother THe city it self is quit clean with huge building and lots of shops for shopping and coffee shops and restaurants.THere is a. Cruise port and we seen celebrity and princess leaving which was nice to seeThe scenery is lovely so have your camera ready

title: Busy, bustling, good vibe!
reviews: This was our first trip to Vancouver for a 5 day weekend get a way. We stayed downtown and had a great time. The area was very busy, lots of people, both tourists and locals alike. Lots to see and do. Great shopping and restaurants. Will visit again!

title: Spectacular city
reviews: Imagine walking through a downtown park hearing a screech and you look up to see a bald eagle just overhead...or watching water planes land and take off from the water just offshore. Beautiful high rises, water, mtns...spectacular.

title: A great Canadian City not to be overlooked.
reviews: Due to our tight schedule we only managed to spend two days in this great city, spotlessly clean to some other major cities we have visited. The people are so friendly & helpful. We were looking like typical tourists studying our local map trying to make sense of where we were, a guy stopped to asked if he could help.You would not get that in London UK. Top marks Vancouver; we will be back to spend some more time in this wonderful city.

title: SKYSCRAPERS
reviews: Downtown has a lot of high rise buildings with more being built. The view from Granville Island is breathtaking. We strolled along the streets of downtown at night but they have a lot of homeless people many of them teenagers.

title: City life
reviews: Wow, you name it, you will find it there.  First visit to Vancouver BC, we stayed in a hotel right in downtown.  All we had to do is step out of the hotel and start walking towards the shopping district, towards the water taxis to go to Granville Island.  Restaurants? you will no go hungry in Downtown Vancouver BC.

title: Friendly lively city with top shopping and eating
reviews: Downtown Vancouver, centered around Granville and Robson streets with the Pacific Center more or less at the centre of town, is very lively with shops and restaurants everywhere at the ground floor level. Very walkable, feels safe, pleasant atmosphere.

title: Very cosmopolitan city
reviews: Pedestrian-friendly, there is so much to see and do in Downtown Vancouver.  From the quaint old buildings in Gastown to the designer shops on Robson to the restaurant scene on Granville there is plenty to discover and enjoy here.  The locals were quite tolerant of us tourists, willing to lend a hand with directions when we got lost and ready with recommendations of what to see and do.  We felt like family come to visit rather than suckers come to get fleeced.  I don't regret a minute of the time we spent here.

title: Yaletown
reviews: If you are looking for lot's of choice on places to eat Yaletown has a great variety of restaurants. One good place after the other. I recently visited Milestones in Yaletown and the food was absolutely delicious and the d√©cor was also very nice.

title: 2011 Visit and conference
reviews: This city is amazing and the monorail takes you to all places, you do not need a car. I stayed at Marriott Pinnacle Hotel. The daily walk was fun especially to Stanley Island. The subway is a city by itself. Lots of fun things to do and city tour was a good way of getting to know the City.

title: Most interesting place Downtown was the drug street.
reviews: Other than the beautiful buildings, open spaces and clean streets,  downtown Vancouver has an interesting street where the speed limit drops to 40km/hr??  This is because it is the hobo area and many are drunk or drug stunned even in day time and cross the street without concern for the traffic - hence the low speed limit.

title: Several different neighborhoods
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has several different types of neighborhoods all rolled in together. Took a taxi of downtown and let the driver tell us about the different neighborhoods this way we could get out and explore as we chose.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is very nice and has a wide array of neighborhoods quite close. Some at walking distance as Gastown and some accessibe by public transportation as Granville or Yaletown. The only problem with Vancouver is the same as with London, terrible weather. Similar as Seattle. It rains 9 out of the 12 months. Other than this everything is quite nice.

title: Lovely city
reviews: We rate this on a par with Boston and San Francisco as one of our favourite cities in the world. It's compact, easy to navigate, has great views and attractions too. A 3-4 day stay was ideal for us.

title: Went in the winter
reviews: There was this one day when it wasn't raining that we got to watch the annual Santa Claus parade. This was the only time I got to appreciate the downtown area when I'm not wet and shivering in the cold.

title: Pretty good place
reviews: You have a huge choice of restaurants in the area and Stanley park and only a short walk to the harbour areas and English bay , all in all a very cosmopolitan area

title: Library a good place to do work and reading
reviews: I email the library to see if they had WiFi and they did for visitors. Go to the main desk and they will give you a pass code. Lots of choices to do "work"/computer and it's quiet if you pick the right place. Chinatown is nice for cheap foods from the big supermarket. Bring your own bag.

title: Wonderful city
reviews: Everything is close by.  There are countless places to eat and shop.  Something for everyone a couple times over.  I love the different district identities.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Lots of beauty around Vancouver with the mountains and Pacific ocean. Lots of upscale restaurants and night life if thats what your looking for. But being in one of Canada's warmer climates this seems to attract allot of trancients so be prepared to be hassled allot. It can be quite an eye opener. Also if you plan on going out in the evening know where your going and take cabs. With the drug problem in Vancouver there are allot of desperate people so just play it safe and don't let yourself get caught in a bad situation.

title: City of Glass Stunning
reviews: I am so fortunate to live in Vancouver. When I'm traveling and asked where I live, invariably the response is, "Wow, you are so lucky to live in Vancouver, I love your city." It's true. This city of glass--so many high-rises--shimmers at sunrise and sunset. And it's vibrant all the time. There are so many things to do, so many fantastic restaurants, you too will fall in love with Vancouver.

title: A city turning the other way
reviews: There is a huge number of homeless people, young and old, on the street. Probably a reflection of breakdown of policies and it is pretty annoying to see a beautiful city slowly running down.   It makes people a bit  less safe to walk on the street especially during night time. It is definitely not something I hoped to see in Canada.

title: Vancouver Trip Fall 2015
reviews: Love to walk the downtown core; in between the buildings, the shopping and little cafes.Enjoy when the sun reflects off of the high rises.

title: A Lot Has Changed in 10 Years
reviews: Its the best part of 10 years since I visited and the place has changed hugely with large towers being built on every available bit of land - hugely impressive. What was not so nice is the very large number of homeless people who seem to be everywhere - this is probably more a reflection of Government policies than something that the city can do much about but it did make the place seem less safe and made it more like an American city with huge gaps between the wealth so evident and the poverty on the streets, not something I ever hoped to see in Canada.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Home to BC Place (football/soccer stadium), Canada Place (convention center), Rogers Arena (hockey stadium), Stanley Park, Granville island (market place), False Creek, Science World (science museum), the Vancouver Aquarium and so much more. Lots of diversity in terms of restaurants and cafes. Come in late spring, summer, or early fall if you want to miss the rain and experience the best weather conditions, or come in the dead of winter to go skiing/snowboarding.

title: Great place
reviews: When you walk in downtown it is like you have part of the world ! You can see people for all world in the same place side by side , great experience. There are all kind of place to shop . I recommend

title: Disgusting place
reviews: Vancouver is a busy and pretty city.  Know that it is dirty with garbage everywhere downtown like bus passes, newspapers, gum, garbage, drink cups.  There are a lot of street people begging for money, and people sleeping on the sidewalk and people seem to spit gum everywhere.  Cigarette buts all over the place.  We visited Downtown, Gastown, Metrotown, Richmond, the only place that was clean was Granville Island.

title: An easy to enjoy city
reviews: Public transport is great and good value for money way to get around Vancouver.  I don't think this city does anything wrong, great shopping, the public spaces are amazing.  Wedged between beautiful mountains & sea

title: Tons of shops, great places to eat
reviews: Most people know about the market but there are many more places to eat and shot. Gelato, fish, and plenty of other items available within walking distance, truly something to experience.

title: Great cultural experience
reviews: We enjoy trying a variety of food when we visit a major city.  Vancouver has the most cultural variety we've seen. Korean and swarma were our favorites. Also enjoyed the Art Museum and happened to be there when Granvillle street was closed down for a street fair full of a variety of cultural activities.  Bike ride on the sea wall around Stanley Park was also a highlight.

title: Visit
reviews: There is plenty to see do and eat in Vancouver. It is a very expensive city to vacation in. As you will soon find out the prices in Vancouver are nearly double what they are in the states the American dollar is strong which helps but not very much. The Nordstrom store downtown is the flagship for the entire country there's plenty to see and do inside and there's a bar on the second floor however the prices here are expensive and you'll get much better deals in the states.One of the best things to do in Vancouver is to sample the seafood in the Chinese food some of the best you eat in the world.No trip to Vancouver is complete without a stop at Granville Island will you will be able to see eat and smell foods that you have never seen before

title: A decent and modernized city
reviews: We were there in Oct, the weather was nice. Streets are clean, as we drove on highway 1 , the road condition is good compared with those in America.    Overall this is a safe city, with polite people. The tourist information center is near the Convention Centre near the waterfront. It is a bright and comfortable place to gather all the tourist information in BC. Staff are nice too.

title: Functional large city
reviews: even though it suffers like all large cities with traffic flow and congestion, the building layout and straight access streets, make it easy to navigate yourself without a GPS.

title: A Sunday day through Vancouver downtown
reviews: We took a little drive through downtown Vancouver Sunday afternoon.  It was not to busy. We saw where the hockey and Football activities take place, the government, law and library buildings, Canada Place (beautiful), Chinatown and sadly the many homeless people on one particular street.  How can we help them?

title: Beautiful city, stunning waterfront
reviews: This place rules. What a great place to visit for sunset dining, views of the sea and mountains, shopping nearby, tons of restaurants.

title: Fairly small and nice town
reviews: A nice city centre, not too big so everything is easily reached by foot. The Gastown is a nice cosy area of the city. Between Gastown and Chinatown on the Mainstreet are a load of homeless people grouped up, haven't felt unsafe there, but it might be unsettling. Because the city is right at the water, you can easily escape the city whilst being in the city.

title: Exciting Place
reviews: What a brilliant place to visit - my first one to Vancouver and one I will remember for life.  So much t see and do.

title: Great downtown
reviews: Recently spend 4 days in downtown Vancouver, very enjoyable visit.  Ran the seawall several times, lots of people running/walking, yet never felt crowded.  Also did a bike ride around Stanley Park.  Lots to do, great city.

title: Shopping and people
reviews: Lots of fun shopping.  A vibrant city even on a rainy weekday.  Plenty of fellow shoppers and courteous sales people.

title: Great city
reviews: We last visit Vancouver 12 years ago, staying just off Robson Street. We thought this was the essence of Vancouver, which is a nice area, but not distinctive. During a recent visit we choose to stay near the waterfront and it was this visit that gave a true appreciation of how great a city Vancouver was.  In fact based on our new appreciation of the city we revised 4 weeks later.  Great sections such as Gastown and Yaletown.  Very easy city to walk with good ferry system to West Vancouver. Stanley Park a must see and tremendous selection of restaurants.

title: Clean and well laid out pedestrian zone
reviews: The center of the city is very friendly for pedestrians and affords good views of the mountains and harbor in the distance.  A great mix of eating and shopping establishments means there's plenty to do and see while not having to fight much traffic to do it.

title: Walk in Gastown
reviews: Nice walk in Gastown, interesting to see and hear the steam clock! Nice diversity of shops and places to eat.

title: the friendliest city in canada
reviews: on a gloomy lazy afternoon we decided to walk around downtown and look at how busy it is. well, it wasn't busy at all. are there people working here? haha anyway, establishments close early. streets are not full and there were roads closed for some event. there are mainstream stores which you see all across canada. nothing special in the food trucks scattered around. what is special about this place are the people in it. from people in the street, tourist, waitresses, drivers, police men and others are all so nice! it seems they are living to help your life easier and happier. everybody was so nice to each other and it is very multi-cultural. i've been to other provinces in canada and i can say this is the friendliest of them all. and so i give a perfect score for vancity since it's the people that makes the place! thank you vancity for the warm welcome!

title: Nice city to visit
reviews: First time in Vancouver,  and l find it very attractive.  Good for family vacation,  clean and safe and there is a lot of activities for the whole family. I recommend it for family vacation especially summer time.

title: Great day out
reviews: Very clean, great people and good place to go for a day trip. However, not the kind of place if you want to stay there longer than a weekend. Had my first ever experience of pulled pork and never looked back since.

title: A Lovely Waterfront with some Funky Shopping
reviews: I returned to Vancouver after many years and found the downtown to be a very friendly, pleasant experience.  In the Gastown area there is lots of shopping and access is easy with the new Canada subway line from the Vancouver airport. There is lots to offer a family as well on Granville Street which has many shops and boutiques.  You will enjoy yourself downtown.

title: Great area to stay!
reviews: I stayed in the downtown area, right opposite roger arena. It is so close to everything and walking around was my favoured method of travel however there is lot's of public transport around.

title: Good Shopping Area
reviews: I went shopping during the evenings before dinner usually.  Daytime was for the sites and pictures but it was always nice to find the nicer things downtown.  I picked up a new Tiffany ring before I left.

title: The pulsing heart of the city!
reviews: Donwtown Vancouver is the pulsing heart of this beautiful city , vibrant , full of life , wherever you're from in the world , you'll easily find yourself familiar with this city , it is very well planned , one can't lose his way in this place at all , you can just follow the endless signs or ask one of the friendly locals , downtown has everything you will ever wants , starting from hotels , restaurants , cafes , groceries , movie theatres and easy access to most attractions in Vancouver.

title: GROSS
reviews: We walked Granville street to get some breakfast after a Saturday night's revelling and there was human feces EVERYWHERE!

title: Awesome
reviews: Lovely city clean friendly pretty easy to find your way round love the waterfront felt very safe so yea all good   Beware though a lot of beggars.

title: vibrant city
reviews: Vancouver Downtown is filled with lots of great buildings, restaurants, food trucks, attractions.  Felt very safe and the people were incredibly kind.

title: Awesome. Just awesome.
reviews: What an amazing place....the business district surrounded by residential with so much shopping and food to experience, I love this place and I miss living in Vancouver. There is always something to do and see downtown,  to to mention the colourful characters. It's a must see!

title: City full of drug addicts
reviews: I have never seen so many drug addicts in one location.  The city is OK but the large quantity of drug addicts is a reason to never return.

title: Everything you need
reviews: I stayed in Downtown in Robson Street it was great for shopping, restaurants and getting to other attractions. Easy to get to public transport or down to the waterfront for coaches to attractions

title: Lots to see in a beautiful setting
reviews: On the water with great mtn views. ez access to shopping and dining and public transportation. Sit in a park or plaza and enjoy the views

title: Vancouver BC Canada
reviews: Beautiful downtown, lots of modern  skyscrapers,very clean,friendly people....you can get around in public transportation.. (Note: if you are arriving to the International airport and traveling light... take the train to downtown..  faster than car and less expensive than taxi.) For those who are interested... the word cheep or inexpensive.. Those not exist , as example.. Parking for a day could break your bank..!  Food around $50+ American ..for two ....going low .... We have couple days yet to go around.

title: Bustling city
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a pretty bustling city with heaps of tourist attractions, eateries and wonderful shopping

title: Shopping downtown
reviews: Spent a long time at the Pacific center . Lots of stores including the new Nordstroms .this is accessible by transit although we walked . There are many places to eat including the Four Seasons Hotel which has a great restaurant although fairly pricy food is excellent .

title: Where its at
reviews: By day, unassuming down town Vancouver is home to the business person and office worker - by night, its a kaleidoscope of 18+ fun:  Art galleries, dance clubs, fine dining, street irregulars. Hockey fans, sushi joints, designer shopping and hot dog stands; tattoo parlours, cruising cars, roof top parties, whiskey bars; vampires, blues clubs, professionals and coffee hubs. When this gets too much, there is a harbour of lights, a sky full of stars, a safe cab ride tonight. You have been warned.

title: Downtown shopping
reviews: Varied shops for all tastes.  Shorter hours than most Americans would expect so be prepared.  Good transportation from all parts of the city to the downtown area.

title: Great city, notable for diversity, food and things to see
reviews: We enjoyed many walks around town. Stayed near the convention center, several good choices there, fairmounts and pan pacific had good reviews. We enjoyed the shops, sights and several meals in gastown/ My wife enjoyed the museum and the parks. Harborview excellent. Fall appears to be a very nice time to visit.

title: Fab shops
reviews: Great shops, bars and restaurants luckily for us all within easy reach from our hotel.  A beautiful city; one of the nicest we've visited.

title: Gorgeous city!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is like many others with its tall buildings and busy street and pedestrian traffic. But in Canada this is the only city where you will not find snow.Walk in either direction and oyu will hit water that surrounds the entire downtown. Many bridges take you to the other parts.Lots of restaurants, stanley park, sea wall for walking, and all the things you find in a big city are all here... except for walmart. You will NOT find one of them downtown.

title: Stunning
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is rightly rated as one of the world's outstanding cities. Comprised of high rise offices and condominiums set on a grid pattern of wide tree lined boulevards, surrounded by water the fairly dense area has some quite spectacular buildings and is the shopping a, cultural and restaurant heart of greater Vancouver. By contrast the old renovated and vibrant adjacent area of Gastown is well worth a visit, although we found the Chinatown area , also adjacent somewhat rundown and a disappointment compared to other "Chinatowns" in San Francisco, Boston.and even Toronto.

title: Bit disappointing
reviews: Just to many beggars and dirty places around the area. Yaletown much nicer and cleaner. West End similar regarding people and cleaness but bit better than dowtown. Granville Street, to be avoided!

title: Beautiful !!
reviews: We stayed at Fairmont Vancouver and its an place to explore Vancouver downtown. Walk along the streets and explore the dazzling downtown.Walk up to waterfront and enjoy the serene walks. Evening downtown is all lighted and glittering . walking

title: great city, spacious, airy, modern and old all mixed together
reviews: Sometimes you visit a city and you get the feeling you could live there. Vancouver is one of those cities. Easy to cycle around, easy to walk around, easy to drive around. Lovely squares and great areas. Gastown is a must on your visit, the canada pier to. The city is lively, some great places to eat, to relax or to go out. Looking forward to go back to Vancouver

title: wow
reviews: just loved Vancouver what a place to stay, visit just perfect.  Hopefully go back one day.  If you go to Canada go to Vancouver you wont be disappointed.

title: Amazing skyline
reviews: Vancouver downtown is still great only it is more crowded and congested but still loved it. World class infrastructure, magnificent view, safe and well maintained. Public transport is very handy too. Another thing I liked about it is the skyline. Hastings park is also a good place to see Vancouver skyline. Only no go thing in Vancouver downtown is E Hastings St where lots of homeless and drug addict people. I saw them drug dealing as we pass by.

title: City with a View
reviews: I have hasd the pleasure to work and live in this beautiful city. Vancouver is easily accessible from the airport via sky train. You cannot get lost because there is only 1 train going 1 direction. It will take about 25 minutes to get to Granville Station. This is the Hearst of the downtown area. You are in waslking distance to Robson street lined with boutique shops and restaurants. You can a also take a quick 10 minute walk to the famous Gastown where you can find many souvenirs and restaurants. It is quite nice there because of the cobblestone streets and lampposts. On the way stop by the Pan Pacific for a spectacular water and mountain view. You can also ride the Seabus next door for under $3 by a short 10 minute ride across the water to a market called Lonsdale Quay. When you get back, ask for directions to either take a 15 minute walk r 5 minute taxi ride to China town. We have a very large Chinese population and you will see shops, etc all in Chinese. If you want to go to Granville Island, which is a beautiful market right on the ocean, you will need to take a taxi or a bus. It is about 5miles from downtown. It is a beautiful city that you will need about 3-5 days to see all its beauty. I haven't even touched on the Capilano Suspension bridge or our famous Vancouver Canucks sports teams! Enjoy!!!

title: My favourite holiday destination
reviews: This was our third visit to Vancouver and hopefully not our last.It just has every thing fantastic restaurants, shopping, markets and some of the nicest scenery.No matter where you are everyone is friendly and helpful and you feel very safe.

title: Depends
reviews: Depends on where you're exploring but I find it quite different per street.  Some streets were great and some we wondered if we'd hit a bad area.  We were able to  get where we needed in good time on foot so for this trip it was perfect.

title: Easy City to Maneuver
reviews: We flew in early on a Sunday morning. Went to church downtown. Had lunch. Walked parts of downtown. Friendly people. Easy getting around. Ended up at the pier for Holland America and took our Alaska Cruise in late afternoon.

title: Interesting Contrasts
reviews: The commercial core of Vancouver has some interesting structures but is not unique.  However the extent of modern and well-maintained high-rise residential structures that surrounds the core was a real surprise to us, as was the presence of a basically underground Costco near the sports stadium. Most of what we saw was clean and well maintained, serviced by a great public transit system. Exception: the area north and east of Chinatown was decrepit, with many homeless - - I even saw someone on the public sidewalk injecting himself as we drove by. Fortunately the "no go" area was relatively small and the balance of downtown felt totally comfortable.

title: A beautiful downtown
reviews: Vancouver is a city all cities should aspire to be.  It's a city with a small town feel.  Every building appears to have been planned to ensure a cohesive and pleasing street scape.  A well blended mix of old and new.  Lots of trees and wide avenues. Great restaurants and shopping.  Excellent public transit and definitely bicyclist friendly.

title: Top first class city!
reviews: World class! Multicultural, clean, safe and Magnificent Mountain, Ocean and City views! Include Vancouver in your bucket list. Well worth your time and you will absolutely love what this beautiful city has to offer.

title: Great place to walk around
reviews: I stayed near Richards and Smithe so that I could be close to downtown Vancouver.  From there I could walk to great restaurants and things to do.  Lots of great restaurants and cafes.  I can't say I picked up on a strong "feel" like you might find in Quebec City, San Francisco, or Boston - a certain character - but I didn't see the whole place, so maybe in other areas it does have a "feel".  Either way I enjoyed the restaurants I found and the things I saw.During the work day people walked with purpose and were well-dressed.  Actually, I found the city very stylish, especially their professional look.  I didn't find the city very friendly, not the people I passed or service staff at establishments or restaurants.But I did enjoy the town and walking around.  The waterfront is a nice place to linger around if you have the time.

title: Perfect vies
reviews: The best view of the downtown is from Stanley park. You Will see the convention Center and canada place as well. Downtown is fantastik.

title: Loved it
reviews: I loved this city. It has everything !!! Nature , city, sidewalk cafes, shops, pubs, great food. This city is perfection !!!

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: I enjoy Downtown for the variety of shops, people, architecture is all around. People have a definite purpose in mind for their path on sidewalks, or escalators, or crossing streets, if nothing more than to reach their coffee. I used to work downtown and quite often ate my lunch outside if weather permitted it to watch the feathered ones try and beg some of our lunch.

title: Felt safe but stayed away from the dangerous area
reviews: We were told to avoid the unsafe area between Chinatown and Gastown. On the fringe of this area we saw many people affected by drugs and some homeless lying on streets. Other than begging for money we saw nothing untoward during the daylight hours we visited. Plenty of places to eat.

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: A very organized downtown i should say. Walk is hilly tho. From uptown to the lake area is easy but challenging on the way up. Its a good place to stay to relax and do business at the same time.

title: Loved Vancouver
reviews: Nice city to visit. A metropolis, but nature is never far away with the sea, the mountains or the forest visible at the end of almost every street.

title: An amazing and sophisticated city
reviews: I was surprised at the high style and sophistication of this great city. Much to do for anyone. A great walking city. The traffic can be a bit much at times but the transportation system is great.  Ultimate in shopping and eating.

title: Dirty
reviews: At least 5 blocks of downtown is basically littered with homeless people.  Was unbelievable to see so many humans gathered in such abject misery, sickness and poverty all in one area.  One looking sicker than the next, just to find lavish luxury a few blocks up?  A real picture of a society gone wrong for sure.

title: A city that has beaches has to be perfect!
reviews: Vancouver is now my favourite city in the world! Despite its newness it's beautiful and full of lovely, friendly people.We stayed for 5 days and loved every minute. The beaches are the best bit though. I have never seen so many food places, literally about 2/3rds of all the shops are either cafes, restaurants, bakery's, grocers or bars! The weather was great too, sunny every day.

title: An eye -opener.
reviews: We stayed at the Pinaccle at the pier, North Vancouver, and visited downtown Vancouver everyday by sea bus.the first thing one would see would be the lovely skyline and Five Sails, right next to the seabus terminal, a v pretty sight. With a day pass , we were able to access the bus , train and sea bus lines, enabling us to go everywhere in Vancouver..Downtown Vancouver has a nice atmosphere about it, with its buskers here and there, and nice folks. Food was good and reasonably priced However, the Chinatown area, especially w . Hastings Rd. was abit  of a shock to me, as there were bodies sprawled everywhere on the street.Apparently, this is where a lot of homeless folks and drug addicts hang out. So sad to see this.

title: Unfriendly - typical of Vancouver
reviews: The sheer amount of people walking their toy dogs is annoying, at best. Many people in this city are unfriendly and will avoid eye contact or even answering questions (e.g., directions). The high rise condos are an eye sore.

title: Walking the streets....
reviews: You'll find downtown Vancouver lively and unique with the fresh air, and wonderful people watching...a place you should not miss is the HUDSON BAY STORE.....yes it's another department store but they have 2 departments 1 on the street floor and 1 in the lower level...it' everything Canada....in particular their famous striped blankets that we are all familiar with, handbags,sock etc.all out that wonderful stripe.  I really wanted one of their handbags....but just too heavy and $$$ so decided on a canvas bag ($10) with their very familiar stripes.  There were moose, canoes etc.  The store partners with an artist who then makes the item that they (artist) is known for using the Hudson Bay stripe motif.  Brilliant!   Many of the restaurants, coffee houses, areas that you read on the internet are in walking distance from any downtown hotel...which are always cheaper on the week-end.  Enjoy!

title: Fabulous city
reviews: This has to be one of the best cities we have ever visited.  So much to see and do.  The people were so friendly, from hotel staff to restaurant staff to shop staff, everyone we came across so pleasant. Such a vibrant city.  We live in Scotland and Vancouver is definitely on my list of places to return too, can't  wait until the day we return .

title: Beautiful modern classy and clean.
reviews: Beautiful modern classy and clean. Very energetic and lively also still has the world famous friendliness we experience in other parts of Canada

title: North America‚Äôs version of Hong Kong
reviews: With the sea on one side, towering mountains on the other, and a multitude of skyscrapers nestled between, this cosmopolitan city reminds me of Hong Kong. Stanley Park, established in 1888, is walking distance from Downtown, and can be compared to New York‚Äôs Central Park‚Äîonly there are 1,001 acres, compared to Central Park‚Äôs 843. Take a stroll along Vancouver Seawall/English Bay, comparable to San Francisco‚Äôs Embarcadero, and Gastown‚Äîthe original settlement‚Äîis like Frisco‚Äôs Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf District. A water taxi will take you to Granville Island, a shopper‚Äôs paradise. And there‚Äôs a shuttle bus to Grouse Mountain, and the infamous Grouse Grind (a tortuous hike up the rugged mountain)‚ò∫ Canada Place has iconic sail-like features reminiscent of Sydney Opera House. Robson Street is Beverly Hills‚Äô version of Rodeo Drive. There are oodles of restaurants, hotels, shops, museums. North America‚Äôs second largest Chinatown surrounds Main Street‚Äîbut beware: lack of new construction has attracted a large homeless population and drug addicts, much like areas of San Francisco. Walking along the cosmopolitan streets for hours made me relish the daily 90-minute massages I got for CAD$90 (US$68). Foodies have international selections, everything from sushi to fish ‚Äôn‚Äô chips. On Granville Street, I had Salmon Alfredo (yum!), a pleasant take on the mundane Chicken Alfredo. Anything you could possibly want is offered in vivacious Vancouver. Highly recommended!

title: We would stay here again .
reviews: Great places to shop nearby . meeting nice people as we went . we were closely located to the appointment we had set up  earlier .

title: Great City with great people
reviews: What a place.  in some ways so much like London, but in other ways nothing like it.  Great food, great places, great view, and just like the rest of Greater Vancouver, great people

title: What a great city to visit~
