reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a bonanza of fun! Lots of trendy shops, upscale restaurants, historical sites!The Gas Light area near the harbour was alot of fun, with a blend of new and old and beautiful views of the ocean. Lots of fun things to do and see!

title: a must destination
reviews: Vancouver is one of those places, if I didn't live here I would love to visit.  I do "staycations" here regularly.  This is a beautiful city with a vibrant down town area complete with great restaurants from chic to food trucks, ethnic to funky and everything in between.  We have Stanley Park which is to Vancouver what Central Park is to New York.  You can walk from the down town area to the park and still enjoy a wander around the beach at English Bay.  If you are doing an Alaska cruise make sure you spend at least a few days in Vancouver and you won't be disappointed.  A two hour drive takes you to Whistler, the site of the winter Olympic games.  A great destination in both summer and winter.

title: Home of Helpful, Friendly Canadians
reviews: Vancouver Downtown is bustling.  You can visit an expensive shopping street, have a meal, see a newly-restored church, or walk through a turn-of-the-century hotel, all within a few blocks.  Many good restaurants within walking distance of cruise ship terminal.

title: One of the most beautiful cities of the world
reviews: On my second trip to the city. Have had the privilege of staying on the Waterfront. Spectacular views of the ocean, north Vancouver and the mountains that surround this great city. Number of hotels and restaurants. The Vancouver Convention Center and Canada Place are top facilities and are among the best in the world.  Friendly people. A truly happening place.

title: I guess you are there
reviews: Mostly like any other "downtown" but the women in the group did enjoy some of the bigger shops. Lots of eat/drink places as well so that kept us blokes occupied.

title: great city
reviews: we had an apartment in the downtown area and were able to walk or skytrain everywhere ,its a busy place but welcoming

title: Wonderful & Endless Vancouver, literally!!!
reviews: Vancouver Downtown has all what it takes for your Urban Jungle pictures, it is endlessly scenic and exploring this place does not have any limits. Sky high buildings is a landmark of Vancouver in general and if you like America you'd love Vancouver and Canada too !!! :))) All sorts of weather are to be experienced in this big city and you'll just love it!!! :))))

title: Will go back
reviews: Great downtown.  Very people friendly and bikers would love this place.Lots going on all around!  We stayed across from a music festival-were able to watch and hear one of the stages....

title: Great Base
reviews: Great Base to Stay and get to all attractions. Streets are in Blocks as most of USA are but not as big. You can easily walk around

title: Laid back, friendly, tourist-accessible
reviews: How much fun can you have downtown? It's great people watching, very walkable, good public transportation.  Tons of good places to have a bite to eat and shops to poke around in.

title: Vancouver in September is Beautiful
reviews: Many types of reasonable food & drink available. Surprised and dismayed to see so many middle aged homeless even though they were not aggressive or threatening in any way.

title: See it all in Vancouver
reviews: Vancouver is very concentrated downtown.  Pre-cruise restaurants and hotels are all within walking distance of the pier.  It is a beautiful city and all of the residents are very proud of their city.

title: Wow!
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city with a fabulous ambience.  There is something about it that makes you just know that you are in Canada.  The downtown area is packed with beautiful modern architecture housing great restaurants, shops and hotels.

title: Family cit break
reviews: Vancouver is a vibrant busy city and there is plenty to do.  Downtown Vancouver is great.  We have been to Vancouver a few times and just love it

title: Beautiful city, well worth the visit
reviews: Beautiful city with lots to see. Fantastic restaurants if you're a 'foodie' and great shopping. At the risk of sounding racist though ( and I'm not!) we felt at times we were in Shanghai. Chinese definitely seemed to outnumber white Canadians and was quite shocked as had no idea before we went. All good though and well worth the visit.

title: Love the shops
reviews: Lots of shops to choose from around Robson Street. beautiful clean streets..plus lots of cafe stops  if you need a break from shopping..

title: Vibrant area with lots to see
reviews: Bustling area with lots of shops and restaurants.On the Hop on Hop off bus route.Centre for excursions to local attractions.Good variety of shops for all types of shopping.Can easily walk to other attractions.

title: Small area but packed with interest
reviews: Although a relatively small area downtown Vancouver has a lot going for it. There are plenty of interesting shops,some very good restaurants, hotels as well as places of interest such as art galleries and the harbour is just a few minutes walk away. You can catch the sky train and within 20 minutes could walk to Stanley Park.

title: Great tour of Great City
reviews: We did a tour of  Vancouver with Tours by  Locals.  Eva was our guide in her private SUV and was very friendly and knowledgeable of the entire area.  This gave us an opportunity to see the entire city and determine where we wanted to spend more time.  It was a great tour of a great city and I would highly recommend it.

title: Very Pretty
reviews: We went through there on a saturday and it was wet and rainy,but still it seemed like a weekday from the amount of people out and about,Vancouver is a big city and a city with more high rise apartment buildings than i have ever seen,roads were easy to navigate with the help of a GPS,Over all a very pretty city,make your way to Stanley park,nice casino in Richmond just south of Vancouver

title: Lots to do within a small area
reviews: I love downtown Vancouver!  And in just one short week I realized it really is a lot smaller than it appears.  You can even walk just about anywhere you want to go from Yaletown to Gastown to False Creek to Robson Street to Stanley Park and Coal Harbour!  Lots of people to watch, lots of stores to spend money in, lots of local restaurants and bars to try out.

title: Lovely city
reviews: what a beautiful city - so clean and everything works as it should!  so much to see it would take days just to walk around the main downtown bit and see everything.

title: Beautiful views from the water to the downtown area
reviews: This is a wonderful city for walking (or biking) with so much to see from the water to the historic downtown area.

title: Amazing
reviews: Must see.  Trolley tour is so convenient, Cruise Terminal is a great place to visit, walking is easy to many points of interest.

title: Very Cosmopolitan City
reviews: Vancouver is a very cosmopolitan city. The downtown has the very modern architecture and there are areas with old European architecture. The problem is much of the city has areas of old downtown "funk" and dirty streets. There was a major effort to clean up the city for the 2010 Olympics. The city was quite successful but now the "funk" has returned. I love the city but I avoid much of downtown area. Too bad, its could be a really fun place again.

title: Wonderful City!
reviews: I wondered around the city and walked several miles.  There is something to discover all over.  The City is very clean.  I loved it.  We stayed at the Opus, a chic boutique hotel.  It is a great central location.  We traveled ton the metro and it too is clean (a very significant difference from New York) and easy to get around.  In fact I loved it so much, I actually looked at real estate!

title: Canadian Adventure
reviews: Great city for a visit, plenty to see and do, coffee shops, bars and restaurants on every street corner, laid back multicultural atmosphere - I'm coming back!

title: Very Entertaining Time in a Beatiful City
reviews: Walking and wondering in downtown is a very pleasant experience, something new to see on every street and every corner. Many excellent shops and restaurants to try out, so many of them than you want to try them all.

title: Wonderful place to walk about
reviews: Stayed in the Fairmont Waterfront and toured the downtown area daily.  Nordstroms had just opened a flagship store.  The latter is dazzling and well worth a look.  Vancouver Art Gallery never fails to impress inclusive of it's second floor cafe and gift shop.  The architecture and flavour of shops has undergone a major uplift in the last number of years, for the better.  Very interesting buildings have arisen along most downtown streets.  Food trucks are the way to go for quick, tasty, affordable meals on the go while touring the downtown core.  As an old time former Vancouverite it's a pleasure to see this city come to life again.

title: A place of fond memories!
reviews: I have been to Vancouver before but this was a first for my wife. Boy, did I get "brownie points" by choosing this beautiful city. Vancouver has everything, scenery, excellent restaurants from economical to expensive, great variety of shops & very friendly people.

title: Fantastic Town
reviews: This was my first visit to Vancouver CA.  I hope it is not my last.  I loved the stores and restaurants.  It was a lot of walking but there is public transportation.  I chose to walk as I was not sure where all I wanted to go.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Spent a week in Vancouver with my wife for our anniversary. The city center is clean, eclectic, busy, and active. The only downside, is under no circumstances should you be driving. On the plus side, there are ample bike lanes, and an excellent mass transit system in place. Cabs are also plentiful but can be expensive.

title: Fabulous night life
reviews: The whole area just oozed life and we spent three great nights at the many bars and restaurants. Fabulous selection of foods and beers

title: Parts are great
reviews: Granville St. Was full of transients bedding down right on the street.  We decided to go back to the hotel.  I wish they would look at places like New York that have a vibrant and safe feeling core.  We took a city bus off Hastings St.  The driver was super friendly, but his bus reeked of pee.  Not the Vancouver I grew up in.  I used to spend much time down there.  Very disappointing to see the change.

title: Short vacation to Vancouver
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is sophisticated and urbane.  Great shopping, restaurants, bars, and sights.  Easy to walk about.  The water front is nice.

title: Downtown Vancouver - A great place to shop and eat!!!
reviews: We spent four days strolling the downtown area, along with China Town. There are lots of things to do and plenty of places to eat and shop. We really enjoyed it.

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: Easy to get around, clean.  Locals are very friendly and proud of there city (and rightfully so).  We walked from the Chinese Garden to the Coal Harbor Hotel through Old Vancouver.  Lots of restaurants, shops, and the Steam Clock.  Stopped at the Maritime Center and rode the Kite over Canada.  Recommend the Hop On Hop Off Bus and a visit to the Tea House in Stanley Park for Lunch.

title: Best shopping ever!
reviews: Victoria is an excellent vacation spot, the city is exceptionally clean, the U.S. Dollar is up and 99% of its citizens are politeness  personified. The downtown area has everything from Starbucks to Louis Vuitton to Gucci to Victoria's Secret...just in case you need a little surprise for that special man. Besides Berumda, it's the cleanest downtown I have seen...happy travels

title: Beautiful close to various tourist spots
reviews: We have enjoyed our stay in Vancouver Downtown, the transport facilities are very user friendly and it is easy to go to different islands from the harbor, taxis are not too expensive.  It is also safe to walk around although the area where the shelters are can be scary with the elements hanging around.  The restaurants, bars and scenery are very impressive and the atmosphere is great.  Must say I was disappointing how dirty certain areas were specifically where China Town is.  The flowers are perfect and make you feel welcome in this beautiful city.

title: Exciting Visit!!
reviews: I stayed on Robson Street and combed every inch. The stores and places to eat was a sight to behold. I enjoyed the ride on the Hop on, Hop Off buses. And, my favorite coffee house Tim Hortons was within walking distance. I will definitely be visiting again.

title: Lovely city with some drawbacks.
reviews: A beautifully situated city, but we found the downtown area dirty and full of beggars and homeless people.   More expensive than we thought to take tours, eat, but taxis are clean very efficient and cheap.

title: Great self contained city centre
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a great mix of shops ranging from top end stores to quirky individual shops. There is also a good range of restaurants again ranging from fine dining types to some wonderful small local food shops.There are also a number of galleries and other attractions within the area.

title: Two sides to the city
reviews: Came out of the Downtown Train Station and headed down Granville away from the harbour. What a mistake  the streets are full of litter and homeless sleeping rough. There are lots of sports bars and weed cafes. There are also a large number of run down and empty shops. We turned round and head towards the harbour, a completely different world. Designer shops, clean pavements, hotels and shopping arcades. All things you would want the tourists to see when they disembarked from the cruise ships.

title: An interesting trip
reviews: I've been to Victoria, B.C, and was surprised at how different the two cities are. Vancouver has little to no European charm like that found in Victoria. We stopped for lunch at the marina, and spent the rest of our day trip driving around. We didn't see any reason or attraction to park the car and actually get out and investigate. Lots of homelessness in Vancouver as well. I have no desire to return here. Didn't meet my expectations. But again, this is just my opinion based on one trip. I will say that the drive in from Washington was lovely. Driving down Granville was the best. The homes alone that street are gorgeous, and the shops are cute and unique. That was the best part of Vancouver, although it was not downtown.

title: buildings, culture....clean, clean,clean!
reviews: There was plenty of culture, within walking or a short cab ride...everything clean with a people proud of their city.

title: Day trip
reviews: We just had a beautiful experience, great weather, overall, it was too perfect. A lot of good restaurants nearby, don't waste your time heading out to pink elephant for thai food.

title: Downtown Vancouver is a very enjoyable place, but with a homeless problem.
reviews: I really love downtown Vancouver, and yet after heading out here for the first time in seven years, It's disappointing to see the homeless situation really hasn't improved, but maybe it hasn't gotten worse either. I think the old building are beautiful and it's always warm or cool, but never extremely hot or cold in this city. The climate is often very mild though it rains a lot all the time. The people are generally very friendly and like any modest size city you'll meet special people and weirdos, so I just suggest keeping a low profile here same as anywhere else and not stop on a busy street corner too long unless you've got spare change in your pocket that you don't want anymore. This is not just a Vancouver thing, it's everywhere. Nice place, I hope I didn't ruin it for you with my negativity.

title: Vagrantcouver
reviews: Really disappointed. 4th visit to Vancouver and won't be back. There are vagrants begging at every road junction. Behind you at Arm's and pestering you with varying degrees of aggression if you sit outside in bar or restaurant.It was bad three years ago but ten times worse now.Really of putting and at times down right scary. Police about but do nothing.

title: City Lacks Soul!
reviews: Glass. Towers. Everywhere. As a resident of Vancouver for over forty years, I avoid going downtown at all costs! Unless the store, theatre, or restaurant is in the area, it's best to avoid the driving nightmare that plagues the core. Expensive parking is your reward unless you take the Skytrain. Lack of decent customer service (read attitude) is de rigueur at many establishments.  There are still a few decent public spaces and historical buildings to see, but act fast! They are disappearing for more towers! I look at Seattle and Portland, and cannot help but wonder where and when we went so  wrong.

title: Friendly city with friendly people.
reviews: Stay downtown with a harbor view if you can.  Downtown Vancouver is compact and very walkable.  Many nice restaurants.  Walked to Granville Island.  People there were very friendly and helpful.  Walked to Canada Place for our cruise departure.

title: Great place to walk around
reviews: Friendly people,clean great places to see.  The old homes the history is great to take in for an early evening walk.  A must do after a long day in Vancouver

title: City stay at its finest!
reviews: I'm not a big city gal but this is one of the best stays ever!  Wonderful restaurants just a short walk from our hotel.  The tours pick up and drop off at your hotel and are fabulous.  Canada place is a short walk with free shuttle buses to Capillano and Grouse Mtn.  The city has maps on every corner so you can't get lost and people have a  line for the bus!  Coming from LA that was a sight in itself.  Definitely should be on your list of cities you must visit!

title: Just like any other city but very clean
reviews: I was surprised at the Number of homeless here and felt a little uncomfortable to begin with but after a day or two it was fine.  On two occasions were were asked by homeless people of we would buy them a meal.  Nearly every street we saw them and most were just teenagers.  It was very sad.  Vancouver itself is lovely and very clean.  Even though the traffic was heavy it was never backed up like it is here.  They seem to have it sorted for pedestrians and we hardly ever waited to cross the roads.  We stayed downtown so it was central to everything but book yourself onto some tours, the mountains are amazing and there is so much to do around Vancouver itself.

title: Easy to walk round.
reviews: Compact and easy to navigate, Vancouver is a safe and pleasant place to visit. Don't bother with the buses unless you really need to, as they are nowhere near as frequent as in, say, London, and you may spend a lot of time waiting at stops instead of seeing the sights.Beware of rushing to buy a day pass for the hop on/ hop off tourist buses or trolleys as they are heavily discounted on sites such as Viator. Hiring bikes is a great way to see Stanley Park and the waterfront areas as the fantastic sea wall has wide, designated, safe cycle ways all the way round. Similarly, the pedestrian lanes are flat and scenic, but it would be a long walk to see the delights of Stanley Park. Use the tiny False Creek ferries to visit Garnville Island for a few hours but for most of downtown Vancouver you'll be fine on foot. The views are all based round the water, the architecture being somewhat uninspiring, but few cities have a natural backdrop of hills and sea as Vancouver.

title: The perfect Vacation
reviews: A city with all its beauty of the ocean and the snow covered mountains, Loads of delicious restaurants, entertainment, Mild weather, Rain , take an umbrella it doesn't last long.

title: What a Great City!
reviews: This is a terrific, cosmopolitan city. Easy to walk to many of the interesting and quaint areas. Robson Street and the cross streets are great for shopping and their restaurants. The cruise ship terminals and the nearby Gaslight District are really interesting. Same for Chinatown (but be careful to avoid West Hasting Street and its environs, bit of a rough neighborhood). Stanley Park and Grouse Mountain are also great to visit. So much to do in Vancouver but so little time.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Vancouver is a must see. There is so much to do and see in this City. The buildings are almost all made of blue or green glass. Their are multiple Marinas, and a huge park. Lots of restaurants and shopping. Seafood is excellent here. Close to a Ski Resort and Alaska! You can take a Ferry to Victoria BC and that is beautiful!

title: Beautiful, but with some real shady parts
reviews: We drove through the city to check it out on the way to Stanley Park. Although there were some cool buildings, I was really put off by the amount of homeless people everywhere. I've lived in big cities, I know it's a common thing, but I just felt like parts of downtown were overrun. My friend had a young baby, and we both did not feel safe walking around, so we just kept on driving.

title: Great downtown
reviews: Its one of the better downtowns I've been to in Canada, could walk around for hours. Lots of homeless people asking for money but they seem harmless and aren't too pushy. Transit is really good.

title: Walkers delight
reviews: Lots of great streets to stroll around.  I spent an evening strolling the streets getting lost with nowhere to go.  This is my favorite thing to do in a city.  I've discovered many wonderful places this way.

title: Beautiful City, Eco friendly and quite clean for the most part!!!
reviews: We stayed here a few days before a cruise and really enjoyed walking around the city, everything was quite easy to get to. The walk through gas Town had some interesting sites as well as some (interesting street people), we enjoyed the walk along the water front as well. Our first impression of Vancouver was not real pretty because it was late at night, our cab drove down Hastings st. to get us to our accommodations. Here we noticed street people and garbage everywhere and it was not a pretty site, I could not believe that the city would allow this. We later learned that this is a normal thing and that it is only in that area. Wen we toured around we noticed that this was a completely different place in the morning as everything was cleaned up.  I would not walk in that area in the night but all seemed OK in the day.

title: Great city, lovely vibe!!
reviews: Nice to walk around, great city, great locals, easy to navigate. Steer clear of the east side of West Hastings Street out past Gastown as a large population of homeless gather there.

title: Weird that I'm reviewing downtown
reviews: What can I say about downtown. Wierd thst trip advisory suggest this as a place to review.  It's downtown.  It's busy.  Tall building.  Homeless people.  Restaurants and shopping.  Basically what any downtown core of any metropolitan city would be.

title: White Christmas 2014
reviews: Stopped in Van on way to Whistler and Lake Louise - fantastic city - friendly locals, great food options for gluten free etc. Didn't stay long enough - will be back.

title: Its nice, but i've seen better
reviews: Some parts of Vancouver downtown are really pretty, but some neighbourhoods make it a less fun experience.

title: nice to walk around specially going in the stanley park for a good walk and exercise
reviews: its a very nice place to go and specially the vancouver had everything that you need and specially if you are very athletic you can walk around or jog around the stanley park lots of restaurant and very multicultural with different country and nice food to eat

title: Light at the end of the construction...
reviews: Construction everywhere, but has a nice variety of stores and places to eat. Nordstrom is coming soon!

title: easy to walk and see things
reviews: A lovely, beautiful city with everything within either walking distance or accessible via public transport. Many sites to visit and experience. Fun!

title: Fantastic city!
reviews: Downtown area of Vancouver is full of activity and very lively. Beautiful views from hotel (Sutton Place) and everything is within walking distance.  Felt very safe and comfortable to walk alone. Plenty of shopping and restaurants galore.

title: Fun Area
reviews: "Gas Town" has an old world feel. It seemed the most picturesque region of downtown. Great little shops. We had fun looking at souvenirs.

title: Homeless galore taken over Vancouver.
reviews: SKIP this city.  Sorry to be so harsh but this place is disgusting.  We walked many miles in different areas and the sidewalks, streets, alleyways were loaded with trash, filth etc.  Plus the very large homeless population.  We were approached a few times for "spare change".  There was a small city of these people in one area plus every couple of yards was another person sitting around with a cardboard sign.  Plenty of people high on drugs trying to walk.  One lady in slow motion bent herself in half as she held onto her cart.  Another young guy was very slowly walking across the street with his eyes closed and one hand in the air.  I've seen this in other cities but this place is the worst.  WHERE are the city leaders?  They should be ashamed of themselves for not assisting these people.  There were a few WEED  retail shops that were in great condition.

title: Beautiful city but big contrasts
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a big beautiful fairly modern city (compared to europe).The shopping is amazing, chique and edgy. Value for money we found Vancouver and Canada in general very favorable compared to Europe and its major cities.The high end areas were very clean and we felt quite safe. Shopping at night is a delight as the city takes on a very different personna with areas like Robson St bedecked with thousands of fairy lights. We were lucky enough to visit the very newly oppened Nordstromm shopping centre.This is clearly a very affluent city.Then the contrast!!!!!!As you move further South though there are dozens of homeless people. While we never felt threatened it was a little unnerving. Probably the highest concentration of homeless in major city we have experienced.

title: Vancouver is beautiful, but stay away from ChinaTown
reviews: Dowtown Vancouver is very beautiful.  There are tons of food trucks, restaurants and museums.  It's an easy place to walk around, but we found the area around ChinaTown to be very sketchy and encountered a lot of homeless people to the point that we didn't feel very safe there.

title: Wonderful, walkable city
reviews: We spent a short half day in Vancouver some years ago and couldn't wait to return.  When we did, we built in extra days and brought our walking shoes.  I'm usually not a city person but there are a few I love, and Vancouver tops my list.  We divided the city up and spent each day walking to a new place.  We walked to Granville Island, to Robson Street, to Gastown, the cruise ship area, Yaletown, China Town, and on and on.  We ate every meal in a different section of the city and were not disappointed once.  The only time we didn't walk, we took a water taxi.But the absolute best part of Vancouver is its people.  If we so much as hesitated, someone would walk up to us and immediately offer help.  There is no way we could get lost and they all made sure we didn't miss a thing.  These were perfect strangers to us who are simply very proud of their city, and rightly so.  We felt totally safe in this clean, vibrant place and would return again in a heartbeat.

title: Beautiful Downtown
reviews: Walk around downtown instead of driving to enjoy the downtown.  The downtown is beautiful and you can view it from the ferries also.

title: Easy access to everything
reviews: Vancouver downtown although accommodation is more expensive it is easy walking to Canada Place where all the free shuttles leave for the attractions .So much to see Gastown,Yaletown Skytrain all walking distance .The buildings are amazing and don't forget the Vancouver Tower to see 360 degree view of the city.

title: Lots of homeless people
reviews: Looks like the welfare services in Vancouver do not function. Wherever you go you see many homeless people pushing their trolleys. Not too far from the Steam Clock we met hundreds of them who came to get their drugs from the city

title: Not Your Typical Downtown
reviews: It's one of the cleanest, easily accessible downtowns I've ever been to. It's so easy to walk or use public transportation to many places of interest and restaurants. It feels safe to walk around, even after dark. If you want a bottle of water, or forgot to pack something, I'm sure you'll find a place close by to fill all of your needs.

title: So Much to See and Do
reviews: Walking the streets of downtown Vancouver is a treat.  Easy to navigate, opt to walk or section explore by bus and/or the subway (get the Day Pass).  The city is full of neat community areas, shopping malls and individual shops....don't miss The Elbow Room for breakfast.

title: Lovely city
reviews: We toured Vancouver as an excursion after we got off the cruise ship.  The city is very beautiful.  Wished we had more time to visit.

title: While in Vancouver, the more you walk, the more you see.
reviews: So much to fit in when visiting Vancouver. Make sure you make time for Stanley park, English Bay, Kitsalano Beach, Gastown or 4th Ave for shopping. A trip up Grouse Mountain or Cypress a short drive to Horseshoe Bay. All can be done on a cheap and cheerful budget. More places of interest can be found just wandering around Robson Street and Grandville. Take a ferry and check out the Granville Island Market. Yum! Never a dull moment down by the Vancouver Convention Center and Coal harbour for a stroll along the marina sea wall. Comfortable walking attire and a city map from your hotel will guide you around the city. It's true, Vancouver BC is beautiful.

title: Holiday to Vancouver, Victoria and the Canadian Rocky Mountains.
reviews: Vanouver was a very clean city as far as cities go. Plenty to see and do. Just do your homework before you leave home. Google as well as books are a wonderful resource. The one thing I really liked about Vancouver was that there were plenty of great places to eat and the food was good & healthy without having to pay a big price. One place I would like to name is "The Urban Food Fare" in Alberni Street. Yum! Yum! There was plenty of good public transport to get you around for a really good price. It was an easy city to find your way around.Victoria was a lot quieter than Vancouver, as well as quite pretty. I found it was an easy place to just wind down and relax from all the travelling.

title: Canadian holiday
reviews: Love Vancouver. People are very friendly. Be aware there are homeless people around the place. Lots to see and the views are amazing. Such a lovely city

title: home of many tv shows
reviews: Come see where many TV shows are filmed, possibly even be part of the show (last I was in was the X-Files farewell show at BC Place for the chess match).  See the cruise ships leave at 5-6pm from May to September!

title: Very good views.
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is one of the most scenic places I have been and I am well travelled.The harbour is a wonderful place to walk about there are loads of restaurants and bars and is also very safe at night.

title: Downtown Vancouver brings a little bit of Europe the the west coast.
reviews: Vancouvers bustling downtown area is full of activity.  The city is pretty clean, and the people are very nice.  The buildings of Downtown are a sight to see.  The city is more liberal thinking and I like that.

title: Homeless Downtown!
reviews: I would expect more but other than shops and homeless people, nothing much was happening.Of course, people are generally nice. We walk along the streets looking for stuff to bring home. Not much shopping that we could not do back home.We walked from one end to Canada Place to see the waters.There were some restaurants, cafes, pubs, etc...Not very exciting for a downtown.Perhaps cos it is summer and people are out or just too hot for them. We feel the weather was good though.The number of homeless did bother us. We were surprised so many of them.Such a beautiful city, sad that people are just hanging about the streets.

title: Daytime Vancouver city
reviews: It was ok, but not as nice as I was expecting, it was clean but its a grey type of city, not a lot of colour to it, you could walk past shops and not realise they are there type of thing. The waterfront is nice and plenty to see and watch there, public transport is good.

title: Amazing City
reviews: Plenty to do in this city. Grouse mountain and hop on the trolley busses and explore the beautiful city. Having gone at Christmas time it was just amazing.

title: Not as wonderful as it used to be
reviews: We had an afternoon to kill whil we were waiting for the concert that was the purpose of our visit. Downtown Vancouver is not nearly as interesting as it used to be, unless you want to shop for clothes. We used to love having a coffee and perusing the bookstores. Bookstores are all gone and one can only drink so much coffee.

title: Intriguing city with water and mountains as a backdrop
reviews: Really the only thing I knew about Vancouver were pictures I had seen of it during the winter Olympics a few years ago.  I remember stunning shots of the city with gorgeous views as a backdrop and it did not disappoint.  The buildings all have a similar look to them but even then, it is still amazing to see it in person.  The people were very friendly and helpful.

title: Attractive City
reviews: A very attractive city with its mountainous backdrop and waterfront.   A very clean city, with a lot going for it.  I like!

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Love the city, but we happened into an area (not sure what area) with a huge amount of homeless people!  So Sad! :(

title: A beautiful place!
reviews: Something for everyone! Very impressed with the city and the history of the area. A trip worthwhile. Great shopping and restaurants.

title: Celebrating my 60th birthday
reviews: Great place to visit.  Easy to see all places walking.  Very nice city clean and organized.  People very helpful and friendly

title: So much better than a car!
reviews: I'm ready to find a job in Vancouver just so I can commute on the SeaBus. It's a 15-minute cruise from Lonsdale Quay in North Vancouver to the downtown Metro area. The view is fabulous, in both directions -- the Vancouver port and skyline on one side and green mountains on the other. On the North Van side, you can stroll through Lonsdale Market, and Gastown and Canada Place on the other. Caution: try to avoid times when cruise ships are disgorging thousands of passengers, as it can get very crowded.

title: Good to travel round
reviews: There are lots of shops around Robson Square, but Granville is a little seedy. The best way to become accustomed is to take a hop on/off bus. There are bars, cafes and restaurants, all serving a variety of cuisines.

title: Homelessness - a blight on Vancouver
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a great place to visit with interesting shops, sights and views however there are many places to avoid. It is easy to walk from one street eg admiring the Steam Clock in Gastown to find yourself standing next to someone shooting up in the street. Vancouver REALLY needs to sort out its vagrant/ homeless problems.

title: Never Far From the Next Attraction
reviews: This city is very walkable.  So much to see, do and taste.  You're never far from the next attraction.

title: busy downtown
reviews: penty of things to see at the downtown,busy with the tourist , lots of places to shop and places to eat

title: Fun big city
reviews: Vancouver is a interesting and fun big city to walk and explore.  We had super weather while there for a five day get away and enjoyed it a great deal.  We did a walking tour, plus a dinner cruise, and excellent dinners while we were there.

title: Love This City!
reviews: Vancouver is a World Class city! There is so much to see and do in Vancouver. Great restaurants too.  Vancouver is also a gateway towards the north for places like Vancouver Island.

title: Disapointing
reviews: We spent a week in downtown Vancouver. Compared to Toronto, we found that there was not as much to do and see. We enjoyed Yaletown for restaurants, but found Gastown rather commercial and touristy. Water street gives way quite quickly to a very downtrodden seedy side of the city. "The Eastside" where homelessness, mental illness, drug taking etc is very apparent. We found this very depressing, and haven't experienced it before in other Canadian cities. We have no desire to go back to Vancouver.

title: Amazing place to visit
reviews: So much to do and such a lovely place. I really enjoyed spending time here and would recommend it for all ages, couples and groups. The local beaches are great for chilling, the shops are plentiful and the restaurants and bars cover all tastes and budgets.

title: Great city.
reviews: We stayed at a superb hotel on the bay where the waterplanes landed just opposite. A great city with loads to do and see and so close to the natural beauty of the mountains.

title: Nice place
reviews: If you like nature, you will enjoy Vancouver. A lot of building, shops, restaurants and natural parks to enjoy by car, bike or walking. Nice people. Excellent public transport. Nice climate (in one week we have one rainy day). You should begin your day early because a lot of places close at 5 and restaurants at 9pm.

title: So much to see, so little time
reviews: During our visit we visited the Inuit Art Gallery & Coastal Free Peoples' Fine Art Gallery on Water Street and took a photos of the war memorial.  Next day we took in Vancouver Art Museum, and the Bill Reid Gallery.  We ate at Doolin's Irish Pub on Granville and Frankie's on Beatty.  We ran out of time to do some other things that caught our interest :(

title: The city of glass
reviews: The first time I seen Vancouver I was amazed at all the high rise building that were glass. I would have nick named Vancouver the city of glass. Downtown is a mixture of shops, restaurants, parking garages and art galleries. You'll find everybody from business people in suites to homeless sleeping on the sidewalks. I was surprised that a lot of the businesses closed up at 5:00pm. When we were there Easter Seals was raising money and people paid to rappel down the front of a glass building.

title: Downtown
reviews: Loved it. Downtown was great the people, shops and food. And it was easy to find your way. Lots of shops on Granville street and Robson street. Robson street is the most expensive place in downtown.

title: Beautiful architecture
reviews: Great vibe, weather was gorgeous. Lots of people watching and amazing buildings. Why isn't my city this cool? !

title: vibrant city
reviews: Vancouver has something for everyone!It is a vibrant city-big city-You can fing neighborhoods where you will relax with the type of visits and amenities you want. It is a liberal city so do not be too surprised at what you will find.

title: "Big City Pleasure"
reviews: We were in stanley park for a short time waiting our cruise ship to depart the next day. We simply strolled down to Canada Place. We ate there and did the Fly over Canada 3D attraction which we really enjoyed. Walking through Stanley Park was wonderful and relaxing. Very impressed with Vancouver in the short time we were there. Seems very clean, beautiful views, and low crime rate.

title: I want to move here......
reviews: With all the problems of a big city, Vancouver is so vibrant and full of energy that you will feel embraced with the sober city in the foot of the Rockies ... The gate from Asia to Canada, when you get here you want to stay here... no wonder why the Real State industry keeps prospering in the midst of a Canadian economy that seems to be in trouble.

title: Nice to walk around on robson
reviews: Robson is the street to walk around on. Starting from grandville, you can go all the way to denman and you will see lots of shops and restaurants. I recommend going in the Japanese convenience store and trying a Japanese crepe. It is something you would find in Tokyo or Kyoto. If you have time to walk around some more, try and make it down to the water to walk buy it or head in one of the bridges at least half way to get an overview of the city and the mountains in the background.

title: Very walkable city and clean
reviews: We stayed at the Pan Pacific and walked this area quite a bit.  Very clean and walkable.  Even the garbage trucks are clean.  Traffic was a little crazy and we were glad we were in cabs to get where we needed to be.

title: Nice Daytrip
reviews: We went to Vancouver on a daytrip from Seattle.We really enjoyed the city-modern,clean and friendly.It was easy to navigate through even without using GPS..

title: Nice downtown for shopping and eating
reviews: Nice downtown for shopping and eating, not as big or as interesting as Montreal center but never the less a very nice place to visits and spend some time.

title: Downtown Vancouver is a haven for homeless
reviews: I love this city but we need to have Homes for the homeless they sleep all over the city in doorways bus stops by meters etc it is unnerving to have them begging all the time. There is room at shelters but they don't want to go in at 10pm. They like to do drugs etc. I know we need to be compationate but it is time to clean up the the streets

title: I'm a city kind of guy.
reviews: Im about to make my 4th trip to Vancouver, so I definitely give it a plus. The cruise ship pier is new, open and clean; much better than most piers in cities I'v seen in the USA and Europe. If you like to walk for exercise, it is a interesting city to walk. Some upscale stores if you like to shop. NO book stores; but that is the way in much of the county (I don't want to read everything on a tablet). Ask around, there are some good "Wholefoods" type restaurants. I feel safe walking around at night.

title: Clean and fun
reviews: Lots of shops and restaurants.  We only saw a handful of homeless and panhandlers. All though we didn't use it, the public transportation looked efficient.

title: It's a big city center
reviews: We didn't stay in Vancouver for very long so I'm not sure of my opinion of the city yet. The people seem friendly and the public transportation system is great. We enjoyed walking around.

title: Extremely clean for a city this size
reviews: Many upscale shops, coffeeshops and nice attractions. Nice view of the water in the pier area and airboats, cruiseships in the area

title: It's a downtown like many other cities
reviews: I'm not a shopper kinda guy. So if I come off a bit less than enthusiastic about a shopping/business district than most I apologize. It's really not bad. The Convention Centre and Canada Place bring in conferences and Trade Shows and if you're here for one you'll find lots of eateries and shopping. If it's a short stay and your ability to tour around is limited you're gonna be fine downtown. However, be sure to walk beyond Robson Street and Granville Street. Stanley Park and the seawall aren't far and will provide you with a welcome diversion and give you a bit of Vancouver flavour to your visit.

title: great place
reviews: easy city to navigate and get around, was staying in downtown and founds loads of places to eat and drink, go to the local brewery's and taste the ales great fun

title: Like Any Other Northern American City, Nothing special
reviews: We lived one block away from Robson street, which is the shopping center of Vancouver. The street is lined with brand-name shops, same as Rodeo Drive in LA. The only thing that people from LA, like us, would feel interested in is the Roots apparel store, and Aritzia fashion store. They do have some good designs in the store. If you have to do some shopping in Vancouver, those are the 2 stores I would recommend. When in Vancouver, ice wine is their specialty, at least try one bottle. It is really sweet, not my type of wine. I heard about Vancouver's food were really good before going there, especially seafood. We didn't have the pleasure to enjoy a lot of seafood, but ordered a dozen of Oysters while in Sutton Hotel restaurant. For some reason, they are the worst oysters I've ever had. They are small and expensive, $4 a piece, OMG, I must be really in vacation mood to spend that kind of money for sub-par seafood. However, Asian food are superb and authentic, no wonder it is the heaven for Asian foodies.There is one thing I am feeling bad about the city is the bus drivers. I have never seen any bus driver that is so rude, we were crossing the street with kids on the cross walk, and we got honked by the bus driver right by our ears. Vancouver is cold, even in August, so pack for Winter, or at least Fall.

title: big city and small town
reviews: we really enjoyed our first trip to Vancouver though we were struck but the number of homeless on the streets, especially in the s.hastings area. there is an incredible amount of new construction going up though for a 'big' city Vancouver certainly has a small town feel.

title: Clean City
reviews: Clean and compact, downtown Vancouver has a good variety of shops, restaurants, theaters, and architecture. Easily walkable, you will enjoy your visit. The library is awesome!

title: Good shopping and gaybourhood
reviews: Food is good, coffee is good, wifi in most coffee    shops. Shopping is convenient and easy access, wide range of shops.

title: Best way to take in Vancouver is with a good pair of sneakers!
reviews: The great think about Vancouver is that you really can walk everywhere.  You can start at China town, walk through Gas town (which is pretty despite the multitude of souvenir shops) and then head down Robson.  Stop and mall shop if you like, or keep trekking down the lively Robson filled with clothing shops and restaurants etc.  If you still have energy left, go all the way down to Denham and rent a bike and ride into or around Stanley Park (depending on how much time you have) and make sure you take in English Bay (at other end of Denham).  If there long enough, you can sit on a log with the many others and watch the sunset.  At this point you will likely need to cab it back to wherever you started.  If you're starving by now, head back north towards the Westin on the water and try to get a table at Cardero's Restaurant, great lively atmosphere and good eats!  Next day, be sue to take in Granville Island which you can get to by either car, or if staying downtown take a water taxi.  Lovely to take your time in all the shops, galleries and great market too (and never get sick of watching the glass blower do his thing)!

title: Buzzing city
reviews: We loved downtown Vancouver...very clean, lots of good shopping, good food, things to do.....especially 'fly over Canada' experience....

title: A really happening place.
reviews: Shopping, restaurants, entertainment - you've got it all here. It is always exciting and there is much happening in downtown Vancouver. You frequently catch glimpses of the mountains or the sea. Fantastic.

title: wow wow wow
reviews: This is a beautiful beautiful city.  We were there for the FIFA Womens World Cup and enjoyed every minute visiting this city.

title: Another downtown
reviews: Vancouver downtown is... a downtown. While vivacious and apparently clean, the heart of this major Canadian city is similar to many other metropolises. In full disclosure, my analysis may not be entirely reliable, as I come from big cities and didn't spend much time in downtown Vancouver. For visitors, I would definitely recommend driving through downtown Vancouver, at minimum.

title: A city that must be seen and experienced
reviews: I visit the downtown city when I want to enjoy a walk around ,but can use the bus service to experience the city in general,there is a hop on hop off bus service for tourists that makes it  great way to see the city. There is a ferry service to get to the North Shore which gives you a wonderful view of Greater Vancouver. Not many cities have ski mountains so close giving a glorious back drop and also have adorable beaches for swimming and other water and beach sports.To make an exceptional city to visit you have to experience Stanley Park,one of the cities greatest assets. There are delightful healthy restaurants ,high end shops and normal shopping for the visitor to enjoy.You have access to light rail service to take you to the outskirts of Vancouver which a worth while as you see the city from an elevated view point.The waterfront is a very exciting area to enjoy seeing the marinas and all the expensive yachts and water craft. To conclude you have to visit Vancouver,to see why it is one of the greatest cities of the world to live and visit. Come on ,give your self and friends a treat,spend some time downtown Vancouver.

title: Downtown is best when you are outside of it
reviews: Vancouver's Downtown is good. There's Gastwon, Davie Street, Yaletown, etc. but also it's not great when you are in. The best restaurants, coffe shops, bars, boutiques, etc. are outside of downtown. But the great thing, once you are outside downtown it's a great downtown. Such a cool view from Cambie or wherever: The skyline with the mountains in the background are just stunning and beautiful. So yes, I enjoy downtown but I prefer the view on it then being there.

title: Must return!
reviews: We visited Vancouver en route to Alaska planning to stay only long enough to  recover from the long flight. Vancouver blew us away! Everything is within walking distance. And if out of town a bus ride away. Any time one stopped, some friendly local offered assistance. The public art is amazing! I even bought an inexpensive book on it at the Art Gallery! (Check out the four ships on the roof corners of the gallery). We then toured the city using this as our inspiration. It became our entre to the people of Canada. We shared  and shared. Locals even were unaware of their own cities public art. Some were showing visitors the site but were unaware of the significance. The best time was had by all. We loved the art.  We loved the people. It all worked so well, we changed our plans and returned for another three days, but even that is not enough! We will return; we must return. So much more to see and do. Oh by the way take in the Bill Reid Gallery of Native art before you do anything touristy.  It is well worth the visit, and right down town handy to the cruise ships even.

title: Afternoon walk
reviews: I have always loved walking downtown Vancouver.  Strolling up Robson or down Granville to the water and then into Gastown for some great food and entertainment.

title: A City of Contrasts
reviews: Vancouver is consistently rated as one of the most liveable cities in the world. The Hop on, hop off bus is a great way to see the main attractions. Stanley Park, with its lush forested areas, gardens and horse-drawn carriages, was our favourite stop. The Granville Island market precinct was also very nice and is a great place for a casual meal or for buying souvenirs. In contrast, the China Town precinct was quite underwhelming compared to those my wife and I have seen in other parts of the world. One locale to be avoided is W. Hastings Street. It is a hangout for druggies and down-and-outs. Expect to get asked for money. What we saw this afternoon looked like a film set for an end-of-the-world blockbuster.

title: Lovely city, beautiful waterfront
reviews: An easy town to walk. Healthy and not so healthy restaurants about; everywhere we ate was wonderful. Daytime walking on the streets feels comfortable; walk to Stanley Park for a respite.

title: Pretty sweet downtown
reviews: We stayed downtown and it's pretty small and condensed. Parking and traffic are not fun at times, but that is to be expected with any big city. Great views of the city if you go up in Cloud 9 restaurant or Harbour View.

title: A Beautiful City
reviews: Vancouver continues to grow with a surging immigrant population from other Canadian provinces, the US and Asia. Expanded hotel rooms, restaurants of diverse cultural backgrounds and new apartments and condos attest to its attractiveness as a destination. The downtown area has become notable for its new architecture with buildings almost literally "scraping the sky" in imaginative and beautiful ways. Almost every street corner provides a perch from which to look up to catch a glimpse of these towering beauties. Touring Vancouver should include some time on the street with eyes upward to appreciate architectural artistry.

title: Didn't get it ..
reviews: Seattle knocks Vancouver into a cocked hat.  To our surprise we found Vancouver a bit boring and cut our stay short after a day and a half - during which time we had walked the water front, Gas town, shops, art gallery (a joke).

title: Wonderful City
reviews: Just spent a week in Vancouver. Wonderful clean city and easy to get around. Get the hop on/hop off bus for a wonderful overview. Do the horse tour in Stanley park and the aquarium. Visit the tower in gastown and plenty of fantastic restaurants and breweries.

title: Great city with plenty to see and do
reviews: Vancouver offers a great deal to see and do.  In the downtown area you can find the shops of Robson Street, great restaurants in Gastown and Yaletown, a beautiful walk around the entire city in the seawall, and an amazing park in Stanley Park with an Aquarium, totem poles and plenty of activities for young and old alike. It is easy to see why

title: Lovely downtown area.
reviews: Lots to see and do in downtown Vancouver.  Decide what you want to do and you can do it downtown. I wanted to shop and eat and I did both.

title: Visited Downtown today...
reviews: There was some zombie event foing in cause i saw more than my fair share of bloody desd people. But still... it was a good time eating and shopping. We also LOVED the "Fly over Canada" event.

title: Worth Dragging our Tiny Tots to Explore
reviews: We had a fun time exploring mostly by foot. We watched some filming of the X-files late one night. The police officer on duty was really friendly and chatted with us for a while. We enjoyed the numerous languages we heard and were shocked at how often people greeted us...including random people in the elevator who stopped their conversation to say good morning. They use their space well and everyone seems to take care of their landscaping and exteriors. It looked like the Pacific Northwest but had a cleaner, more prideful appearance.

title: Most Unique Skyline
reviews: Walking the West End is almost otherworldly. The vista is almost all glass and looks so futuristic.  Traffic is bad though.

title: Wish I knew
reviews: I was there on a business trip and had several hours to roam with my colleague after our day at work. We reached downtown at 6:30 and more than half the businesses have closed for the night. It was disappointing.

title: Many different shops to discover
reviews: Walking around downtown Vancouver offers the possibility to have a look at many different shops and restaurants. Many bicycle lanes throughout the city invites you to use a bicycle to discover the town.

title: Seen Better
reviews: If your look you can find some really nice small restaurants and cafe's. But a general walk around down town was not a great experience. Lots of poverty and not very clean. I stayed at the university and spent a day on wreck beach. It was much better then the down town.

title: Plenty of things to see, do, shop and eat.
reviews: It is very easy to walk around the downtown area. Everything is clearly marked. For restaurants and ambience, I love Gastown. The steam clock is fascinating to everyone. I love Vancouver because of the views, water, mountains, parks, interesting areas such as Gastown and even the nearby streets where the homeless live, barter with "found" goods and ask for money or whatever! I have never seen so many people high on drugs and totally wasted. Quite the eye opener. For those who worry about such things, I felt perfectly safe wandering all over Vancouver by myself. I never felt threatened at all.

title: Great shopping
reviews: Hundreds of shops to suit all tastes, styles, ages. Beware your credit card, though, as you will want to go on shopping! Ample parking in most parking areas.

title: Vast but soulless
reviews: Vast but felt downtown lacked character and heart.Overall nice but nothing special. People are distant and food places are available in different cultures but seen better in different cities around the world

title: Wow, what a place.
reviews: This is where we stayed, in Hornby Street. I'm so missing the place. It was great to walk around, a good choice of shops and nowhere was too far away, as it was so easy to get around. If you stay downtown, you will definitely not need a car. You can walk everywhere, as everywhere is so close.

title: Vancouver my hometown
reviews: I am a local that goes downtown once a week. I love the hustle bustle of robson street, with all its trendy shops and snything you want to dine on. Joe fortes happy hour is the best!

title: Too Needy
reviews: why don't you include art museum among attractions? Anyway, you're asking for too much information.  All these questions are a waste of my time!

title: Beautiful one day, Stunning the Next!
reviews: Very liveable loveable city! Vancouver is so easy to get around using public transport system, friendly and helpful public and easy to understand streets and places of interest. I loved every minute of my stay in this amazing city!

title: wonderful place
reviews: for an European tourist like me, the modern skyline combined with plazas, parks and busy people is straight fascinating. really enjoyed being in Vancouver, since it's a lively, modern and green city

title: Home sweet home
reviews: Always a pleasure to visit the core of this city. It is alive and vibrant and eclectic in the people who are milling around the hub. Love Love Love Vancouver!

title: Beautiful vancouver
reviews: Wonderful vacation area, to see the snow trails in the middle of the city, and the beautiful, green city, just great

title: Ready to go!
reviews: If you like cities then you will love the Lower Mainland! Full of beautiful architecture and glass buildings - mixing the old with the new  it's a really nice city to walk around and very easy not to get lost!

title: Love it!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is amazing!  So much to see and do. the weather is always great or at least when I was there it was.  Love all the buildings and so much to do in the area!!  A must for anyone's bucket list.

title: Robson street Vancouver for super shopping, cafe's and more
reviews: Love the walking experience in downtown Vancouver. A safe place to take the family, spend some time on Robson for the shopping and then move to some of the cooler neighborhoods for boutique shopping.

title: Interesting and exciting city
reviews: So much to see and do here. Many shopping possibilites and the best thing is, the sea is never far away. Museums, too, and don't ignore East Hastings, it's part of Vancouver, even though it's superficially not very pretty.

title: Superb Downtown
reviews: Superb place for shopping,walking,eating in a cheap or fancy restaurant , or have a coffee with a friend .

title: Energetic and busy, this is a lively place
reviews: We didn't spend nearly enough time in Downtown Vancouver, but its many different features and attractions have certainly given us something to look forward to, when we return to the city next time.

title: Great selection of shops
reviews: Great shopping malls and shops for all ages.  Very clean downtown and lots of lovely restaurants and cafes.  People are all very friendly too

title: Top 10 in my opinion
reviews: One of the cleanest cities I have ever visited.  Everyone seems nice and friendly and always willing to point you in the right direction.  The area is always bustling with activity.

title: Stunning city
reviews: Mountains beaches city sky lines sea planes to whale watching spots all in one city with modern facilities and a relaxed vibe

title: Second best city in the world!
reviews: Love this city, easy to get around on foot, the streets are very clean and drivers are courteous. this city is very dog friendly. The precinct along the waterfront is great for walking, relaxing and enjoying food & drink, we had a great time hear.

title: Foodies and Tourists' Paradise
reviews: Vancouver Downtown has lots to offer.  We have beautiful historical architecture like Marina Building and Vancouver Hotel yet we also have new technology building like Telus, Shangri-La and the upcoming Trump.  For foodies, you can find top notch fine dining as well as yummy food trucks like Japajog.  You can find enormous authentic meals here and they are usually good both in taste and decor.  I enjoy walking here few times a week.  You can experience different vibes from different seasons.  In summertime, everywhere seems like they are celebrating with music and life shows.  In winter, malls are packed with shoppers, streets are lighted with Christmas decorations and you can even ice-skating in Robson Square for free.   Please come and enjoy the awesome city!

title: vancouver/the pne/what a wonderful place to be
reviews: we ,my girlfriend and I, were recently in Vancouver ,we  walked Stanley park ,we walked down town, and we ate all over town .every where we went we were greeted by smiles and friendly people every where. what a wonder place !! oh  ya!  the hotels and the night life are super.

title: Downtown Vancouver has beautiful architecture, is very clean, and offers lots of shopping
reviews: We spent half a day wandering around downtown Vancouver.  It is a very clean city and the people are extremely friendly and helpful.The architecture is varied and the city has grown a lot probably starting before the 2008 Olympics and continuing today.  I would call it a city of architecture similar to Chicago, IL.

title: Wonderful, walkable, world class city!
reviews: A beautiful and very walkable city center! A world class city!The people watching is great, quite safeShopping is great, and prices are nice in USD$ terms

title: The city is always beautiful.
reviews: The photo is from last fall of the city from Granville island. What can I say? A picture is worth? Great food on west end. Beautiful gardens, like Nitobe and even home owners gardens are apparent in the city. Stanley Park is great. It's one of my favorite cities!

title: Watch out for inflated taxi/van pricing!!
reviews: Six of us, along with baggage, had to hurry from the cruise docks to the airport. The cruise dock people were very helpful in getting us to the cabs. Since there were so many of us we needed 2 vans. We went three and three and both vans got there at the same time with plenty of time to spare. But ... one van (navy with red and white lettering) charged us $93 while the other one (light yellow) charged us $33. The $93 van drove off quickly before we could confront him about ripping us off. Make sure you ask ahead of time what they are charging you!!

title: Inconsistent
reviews: It's an attractive city but has its worts.  Pioneer Square is teeming with aggressive homeless and passed out drunks or druggies.

title: Very Busy!
reviews: I am glad I stayed in a hotel in the downtown.  You are in walking distant to a lot of shops, restaurants, and attractions.  in walking the downtown, I noted a of Translink stations so if you do decide to take the train, you can get off anywhere close to the attraction you want to see. There are also a lot of restaurants (often 3 of the same one within blocks of each other.  Make sure to load your Starbucks card as there is one on every other block.There is lots of meter parking which is typically in effect until 10 p.m  but the rates are not posted.

title: Stop over from cruise ship
reviews: This is one of my favorite cities to visit been there numerous times,very vibrant downtown with great food places

title: Fly Over Canada
reviews: Fabulous,its a must to visit,and right in Canada Place Downtown Vancouver,this attraction is one of the most wonderful experiences I have ever visited,so much so we went on it three times. If you book when you come off togo back another day you get it half price.

title: A nice walk
reviews: An impressive view of skyscrapers mingling with low buildings.You will find many fashion shops, restaurants or malls but no libraries at all which is  a bit shocking in such a big city.

title: A bustling city full of life!
reviews: Our hotel L'Hermitage was in Downtown so we had the choices of places to eat and drink (Starbucks on every corner!)

title: Vancouver is great, in the right places.
reviews: I work in a part of Vancouver that is less touristy, and so you should probably stick to the nicer areas of you are coming to visit the beautiful city.There's is tons of shopping, dining and sight seeing to do.  There is a vibrant night life full of clubs, tasting rooms and experiences.If you are staying over, there are great hotels, BnBs and vacation rentals.The city is gorgeous.  Just stick to the known areas.  As with any major city, there are some rougher areas.:)

title: A lot to see!
reviews: Many different restaurants, bars, clubs and shops! I highly recommend visiting Canada Place and taking a walk from there right next to the water :)

title: Unimpressed with the rampant commercialised feel and lack of civic space
reviews: Vancouver downtown was a serious disappointment- just skyscrapers with a complete lack of civic feel of civic spaces- just rampant commercialism.

title: park and walk
reviews: you can go around shopping and dinner and you will find so many choices you will be spoilt for choice unless you know what you want to eat

title: Perfect place to visit in the summer for 3-4 days
reviews: Beautiful, modern, clean and walking friendly. From the waterfront to the west end, Yaletown and Gastown, you can easily tackle the different neighborhoods easily and on foot (for the ambitious walkers).

title: VERY Walkable & diverse
reviews: What I love about Downtown - being a person who has lived in Vancouver AND come to visit lots... the city is very walkable.  just a couple of wks ago I was in town meeting friends from T.O. and a bunch of us walked ALL over, also took the little ferry rides to Granville Island for lunch :)  The downtown consists of so many areas - West end living with tree lined streets and apartments, walkable neighbourhood streets like Denman, Davie, Hornby, Yaletown area AND the upper downtown area with tons of shopping.  Downtown is surrounded by water, much like Manhattan,, it's a peninsula of walkable streets and neighbourhoods. Many streets lead to Stanley Park (7 acres w/ walkable Seawall, in heart of city not to be missed)  Ferry over to North Vancouver and as stated earlier, Granville Island ... On a Sunny Day esp. can't be  missed - otherwise - carry a small umbrella ;)   and have fun !

title: being there
reviews: exploring Gastown is a nice and friendly experience; many nice restaurants provide opportunity to relax and exercise : being there

title: Downtown soso
reviews: Canada place was interresting to walk till the end of the pier. Gastown athmosphere is unique and it was a nice time spend walking around and stand by the famous clock. But overall, downtown is dirty, full of homeless people and it was pretty scary to walk to BC stadium...

title: A nice city for a visit.
reviews: We chose to stay in Vancouver two days after a cruise and found it to be an interesting city.  First the fact there is a Starbucks on about every corner stands out in my mind.  It is a pretty city but as with all cities they do have the homeless areas to deal with.  Many restaurants and large hotels.

title: Nice place to stroll
reviews: A pretty compact city centre which you can easily explore in a couple of hours. A good mix of tourist shops and regular stores. Robson Street is particularly worth a stroll up and down with lots of cafes and restaurants and a fabulous frozen yoghurt shop.

title: A Vibrancy All Of It Own
reviews: Walk and then walk some more. Vancouver is one of those cities (assuming it is either not raining or if raining you are equipped --this summer it was dry!) where walking in the core is an absolute necessity. Granville, Georgia, Robson and even a stroll along Burrard especially overlooking the harbor, is a delightful way to spend a few hours in one of the safest and most  impressive cities in North America. True, there are a few modest inclines, but if you were on a cruise and wanted some shore time, a stroll up from the cruise ship dock is worth the effort. Besides, once you  get further up--a little higher--the view across the harbor can be even more magnificent when, of course, there is snow on the hills!

title: Loved Vancouver
reviews: Loved Downtown Vancouver.  Lovely clean and exciting city.  Loved that you could not smoke in the parks and many outdoor places.  Fantastic place to visit.

title: One of the most diverse city in Canada
reviews: On the train from airport to city you will see lot of Chinese people.  advertisings along stops are English-Chinese.  When train stop at Canada place in downtown.   8 in 10 people are Chinese.  I feel like just arrived at hong kong.    When I travel further in downtown I see people of all races and nationality, doing all kinds of things on the street. Vancouver is one of the most diverse city in CanadaSome streets are very clean and some are very messy.

title: Would return
reviews: Stayed 2 nights in Vancouver. The city is very busy and at a faster pace that I like, but pleasant. Great restaurants and friendly people for the most part.

title: Fantastic area something for everyone
reviews: fantastic vibrant downtown area easy access to walk lots of shop and restaurants clean and busy. lots to see round every corner

title: Great city to visit
reviews: It seems that the city have a very European atmosphere. Nice architecture. Great coffee places. You can walk around the city especially downtown and by the sea. However I was surprise to see so many homeless people especially on East hearings road. Good to visit but not sure about moving there!

title: What is not to love about Vancouver
reviews: Vancouver is beautifully located on the water. There is so much to see and do when walking around. So many little neighbourhoods to keep you busy. The streets are very clean. I was surprised to see how early Gastown closed up. I expected the shops to stay open past 6pm during tourist season. There are a number of homeless people and some of them, not many can be quite aggressive although not physically.

title: Vancouver is tremendous
reviews: We travelled the city on sea ferry tram and underground it's a great city to visit and plenty to see and do

title: Great shopping and restaurants
reviews: Robson St also known as the Rodeo Drive of Vancouver. A great variety of restaurants to cater for any taste. All the known retailers are close by.

title: Wonderful place to visit
reviews: This city is so pretty and so clean and such a fun place to visit. You feel so safe here and just enjoy strolls along the waterfront or shopping or food.

title: Will visit again
reviews: Great City for walking, amazing restaurants and wonderfully friendly people. Be sure to walk to Gastown and check out the steam clock (what a blast... Ha! ha!) Many fun things to see and do. The food overall in Vancouver is excellent even the "off the beaten path" places... Vancouver is worth a second look! Eight days there was not enough!

title: Great Area to Visit!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a great place to visit.  Very scenic with the bay and water taxi planes.  Fantastic restaurants - all our meals were top-notch.  Shopping is plentiful as well.  Gastown is vibrant and fun!Just do not go outside of the downtown area as there are areas that are overrun with homeless.

title: Beautiful Clean City
reviews: Ended cruise and stayed an extra night at the Day's Inn Downtown in Vancouver before flying home. Fantastic architecture in the skyline. Clean & friendly. Beautiful sunset from the port / convention ctr.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: We visited Vancouver in the month of September and the weather was outstanding. We rented a van and I was the driver for our 10 day trip. I found Vancouver an interesting city. Much like Toronto, ON. But with better weather and outstanding scenic views. It seemed that no mater where were drove the picturesque landscape was fabulous. I can't wait to go again.

title: I love the city, but I'm glad I don't live here...
reviews: I enjoy coming to visit Vancouver every now and then, but I just can't get over the smell of pee at every street corner. The city stinks and I can't even think about sitting on a public bench. I enjoy the vibrancy and the swell of people, but only for a short time. The shopping is good and the transit system is easy enough to navigate, although can be expensive if you're wanting to check out more than one neighbourhood.

title: Go on explore and enjoy.
reviews: We had 2 days to explore this vibrant city before we joined a tour of Canada/Alaska. Such an easy place to navigate and so much to see and do. A buzzing city up with the 21st century. The Visitors information Centre will help you enjoy Vancouver even more. We loved it.

title: It's busy and built for business
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a typical metropolitan business district, with the exception of its accessibility to its terrific environment.There's a lot of action here and some living space as well. Still, there are very interesting neighborhood not far away. It's more San Francisco than LA.

title: Every thing and any thing.
reviews: What ever food you like from Chinese to Peruvian this city has. Shopping is fun, however I suggest you walk around this city. Take a couple of days, because there is a lot to see, and do.

title: Spend time on the harbor!
reviews: So gorgeous during July - the weather is moderate, and (depending on where you stay) the city is wonderfully walkable.  To get outside of your hotel area, use the bus system - it's easy to learn.   We bought an unlimited pass each day for $7.5CAD - a bargain.

title: Lively
reviews: I love walking on Robson street, watching people or eating...there is entertainment, shopping, restaurants...everything you wish for is here...

title: Great location
reviews: We loved this area our hotel was here so easy to get to places - sea,harbour ,shops ,transport links ,free shuttle buses plus lots of cafes and restaurants too .Had a big Safeway for food shop nearby and shops to rent bikes .Only downside very busy traffic so watch your step in side roads when crossing .We felt safe of a nighttime walking about too with our son .

title: Nice Spots Along The Water Front
reviews: I'm not a big city fan, and prefer nature to concrete, steel, asphalt, and glass.However, the parts of downtown Vancouver that border along the water front are pretty special.On a sunny summer day, Vancouver-by-the-sea is hard to beat as far as large cities go.God Bless

title: Wow - seems to have changed so much since I last visited
reviews: A lot of building work has been done in recent years and now Downtown Vancouver has the feel of a proper modern city. It is safe to wander around and there is a good and regular public bus system.

title: Vancouver has it all
reviews: Not as clean as past visits...didn't see any street cleaning or storefront owners sweeping. It is still a great city and so much to offer...seawall walk or bike ride, ocean, beaches, Stanley Park, live theatre on the beach and in the park. Great walking city, sky train and sea bus to get around.

title: Vancouver Downtown, Vancouver, BC
reviews: Vancouver Downtown, Vancouver, BC - Vancouver is a bustling town and one of the departure sights for the cruise ships heading to Alaska. Beautiful city with lots to see and do.

title: My favorite City to visit
reviews: I've been to downtown Vancouver a few times now and it's become my favorite place to visit. Its location along the waterfront adds to its beauty. The modern architecture and all the boats going by are lovely to behold. People are out and about walking their dogs, taking a walk or run or having an ice cream. All are enjoying the beauty of downtown Vancouver.

title: Bicycle friendly, vibrant downtown
reviews: Central Vancouver is booming with lots of new construction, a zillion high-rises and a big-city look.  But it feels much friendlier than that.  We rented bicycles and rode all over the city.  It's bike friendly with several streets that have dedicated bike lanes.  My wife and I are in our 60s and not as spry as we once were, but we felt comfortable and confident on bikes in Vancouver.  Moreover, everyplace we went, we found the locals to be friendly, helpful and welcoming.  I have to believe this town has to be the crown jewel of British Columbia.  The only downside?  You have to make enough money to live here because it IS expensive.

title: Man, is this place built UP.
reviews: If you like high rise buildings, this is the place for you.  Me, I like what it was years ago when you could find automobile parking without going to visit your stock broker ahead of time.  A wonderful mixture of new and old businesses are found in down town Vancouver.  Robson Street is a fun place to visit for it's mixture of stores.

title: Maybe I'm getting old!
reviews: Much as I love the Vancouver area, my feelings for Downtown are not as good as they were. There are some lovely areas,Stanley Park,the beaches etc but I feel the city is loosing it's character and becoming just another North American metropolitan area.

title: Nothing really sticks out
reviews: This city needs more pedestrian & bikes areas (it's also the case for a lot of cities) . I was expecting more of Vancouver because of all the articles stating that it's among the top 10 cities to live in, I don't know what criteria they use to say that but in my experience the city was "meh !". The buildings were... buildings, I'm not a fan of architecture so I might have missed the knowledge to see the beauty in it. The sea harbour is noisy and stinks of kerosene thanks to the seaplanes. Some views are spoiled by the industry on the other side. The good part was the food and the social diversity that you can find, lots of people from lots of places.

title: Nice metropolitan city with nature within a short drive
reviews: Wanted a summer vacation that was somewhere people spoke our language, and where there wasn't humidity, bugs or poverty.  Vancouver did not disappoint.  Didn't hurt that our dollar bought $1.30 CAD!. Lots of great restaurants and terrific transit system.  The people were helpful and friendly.Call the tourism center before planning your trip so that you are not there when a big convention is there.  They block many of the best hotels early.  Definitely get over to the tourism center at Canada Place early on to plan out your trip.  They often offer discounts for attractions and maps and brochures.  Also, we finally figured out, after the first two days, that you don't need to buy bus and rail tickets if you have one that is less than 90 minutes old.
