A couple of things that were surprising were that whenever we asked if something was organic, it usually wasn't...even at the Granville marketplace that features all local growers. And it was odd to us that we never saw a single bathroom with seat protectors either, so if that is important, I would bring those with.  All in all, very pleasurable city.  I have separately reviewed all of the attractions we did in our four and a half days.

title: Vibrant!
reviews: This a bery vibrant city with maybe too many homeless people. However the homeless people are for most part civilized and non-agressive.

title: Downtown Vancouver, a Great Place to be!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is very walkable.  Safe, friendly, and clean.  We stayed in a central place (near Robson Street) and were able to walk to Stanley Park, English Bay, Yaletown, Coal Harbour, and Gastown in about 15 minutes per area.  Lots of new glass buildings in the city.  This type of architecture gives downtown a kind of airy, open feeling.  Definitely a great area to stay in if you're visiting.

title: We love Vancouver in the summer!
reviews: Despite the crowds on a summer weekend, one can enjoy the green spaces in between high-rises, smell the flowers bothering the sidewalks, and take in the sights and sound of a vibrant city.

title: Can't wait to go back
reviews: Lived up to all my expectations.  Great city with so much to see and do you will not be bored.  Visited for 10 days and never ran out of things to do

title: Sky train
reviews: Had a layover in Vancouver, and took the sky train to downtown Vancouver..the downtown is beautiful.

title: Typical City
reviews: Streets appeared to be very dirty, a definite lack of garbage cans on the street.  Depending on which street you take, you could be among beautiful businesses and apartments, or on a sketchy street with numerous homeless.

title: Vancouver downtown area
reviews: On a sunny day a walk around Vancouver downtown area is very enjoyable, especially around Canada Place and into the Gastown area.The transit system is quite handy to use, and you can plan your trip ahead online at http://www.translink.ca.  Inexpensive day passes are available.  We use this transportation the most often.Granville Island is an interesting place to visit with nice walks along False Creek and ferries that connect to various city locations.Also, the city is reasonably easy to navigate by car.  It's best to plan your route ahead of time and try to avoid rush hour times.

title: Beautiful
reviews: This is a truly beautiful city. The weather was nice, the people very friendly, and stunning places to visit and take pictures.  Lots of culture.  It's also a green city, and most of the buildings' roofs are covered with grass and trees.

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: The only way we transit around is on the rail system. It is inexpensive and very easy to navigate around the area. We bought a pass that was good for a couple of day versus just a 1 ride pass.

title: Attractive centre
reviews: Very nice city centre with plenty of good restaurants and lounges. We spent most of the time exploring the centre on a bike and it was not bad at all.

title: Loved the entire experience
reviews: Flew into Vancouver International Airport and rented a vehicle which was worth every dollar spent.  Downtown shopping was excellent and the entire experience has been memorable

title: Funky town
reviews: Vancouver has a funky vibe and an impressive waterfront. Walking around downtown was a pleasure during the hot summer evenings, especially on Granville str and around Robson square. Did not find much of interest in Gastown. Even the steam clock was a bit of a let down.

title: Relax & enjoy
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is one of the most laid back and relaxed cities I have ever visited.It welcomes you with open arms, it's people are friendly and charming.I'll definitely be back!

title: Not my city,..
reviews: Had too high expectation for Vancouver and left a bit disappointed. It is nice, but not very clean,...

title: Best Place
reviews: Best Place to Visit. You stand at any place and it's scenic. Well planned streets, easy to walk, drive, find places. People are cooperative.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: It's a beautiful city with lots to offer. Lovely streets filled with maple trees and a chill feeling compared to other major cities

title: Nothing Impressive
reviews: This was nothing impressive. We drove through the city to get to other destinations and in doing so we got to see much of the city but we were not intrigued enough to exit our vehicle and explore the city on foot.

title: Great place and full of shops, attractions
reviews: You can spend the whole day in that place, eat , shop ....buses and bus stops are great...it is a great walk even at the late nights...

title: Visited this fantastic city with my sister, son and daughter in law
reviews: Loved the area downtown. Lovely city. Great seafood. Wonderful weather! Rented bikes and rode everywhere.

title: Very well structured
reviews: I love the beauty of the buildings, the stores for shopping, best Chinese food I've ever tasted and you get value for your money. The stream clock was an amazing sight for me as well

title: Some glaring differences........................
reviews: Vancouver is a very nice city very green ( conifers for fences ) very quite ( hybrid cars a bound ) and some wonderful eateries particularly in the bay area.Downtown however is a bit daunting if you pick the main  street Granville /Georgia area which is home to many  homeless at all times of the day and it is not a welcome sight .Try parallel streets to cover this otherwise wonderful city.

title: Hop on Hop off
reviews: Lots of shops and eateries.  Situated between the cruise terminal and Stanley Park.  The hop on hop off City Tour bus passes through this area too.

title: Fabulous City
reviews: From the Seawall around Stanley Park, to Canada Place and the harbor this city affords a multitude of wonderful sights. We loved the Convention Center with bee keeping on its roof, the abundant food trucks with so many temptations, strolling along Robson Street with shopping galore and of course a stop at Bella Gelateria was the absolute best! Walking through Gastown, Chinatown and Granville Island on our second day completed our tour of Vancouver and left us planning a return trip.

title: Walkable town
reviews: Smaller than we thought so very walkable. Gas Town is worth a visit with some interesting sites. Take the Hop on Hop off

title: I live here!
reviews: I live downtown Vancouver and love it! For the shoppers, there is Robson Street and, on rainy days and for Mall lovers, the underground shopping Centre, Pacific Centre. For foodies,there is Yaletown and Gastown,only minutes away. Vancouver is a stunning city. I love traveling but also love coming home to this city surrounded by mountains and ocean.

title: Loved downtown Vancouver
reviews: We loved downtown Vancouver. Great place to walk around, grab some coffee or latte, food. Cant wait to come back

title: An area of contrasts
reviews: We did arrive in Downtown by driving a street where clearly the lesser blessed people of Vancouver stayed. We did see drugs, poverty, handicapped people, and a 'market' where stuff was sold - we wondered whether the merchandise was stolen. The area made us feel unsafe. In the evening the Salvation Army shelters were open and all people lined up for their place for the night. One block next to that was the downtown area with historical buildings, art galleries and coffeeshops;. That was quite nice. So it was with mixed feelings we left downtown vancouver.

title: Mixed Review, Mixed Impressions, But I Liked it!
reviews: Vancouver has to be one of the most pleasant mid-sized cities (less than 700,000) located on the Canadian West Coast province of British Columbia. SImilar to San Francisco, but less hilly and less congested, but has its fair share of homeless and addicts just like San Fran! One will find the up and coming youthful generation demanding more entertainment venues and things to do. Downtown's best side is the East Side where your will fin Gastown, Chinatown and Strathcona. You will find a variety of descent restaurants, I felt fine exploring without escort. What is interesting is that Vancouver is considered "Hollywood North" since both Canadian and American film makers like the the venues and unfettered production and filming here. By the way, same goes for Toronto which I suppose is the "Hollywood Northeast"!

title: My visit to Vancouver
reviews: A truly fabulous experience. The Canadians make this country and especially this city a real pleasure to visit. Nothing is too much trouble

title: Gotta love this town!
reviews: We are newbies to Vancouver & this town has won us over. We chose to rent a car only one of our seven days & that wasn't a problem in the slightest. They nailed public transportation & with such ease. HOT TIP: purchase a one day pass. ($10/adult). It gets you on the sea bus, sky train & buses all day long, as many times as you need. Such a huge convenience. The architecture, history & surrounding beauty will forever have our hearts.

title: Beautiful and easy to get around
reviews: lots of restaurants and food courts. efficient, clean skytrain with well placed stations. very clean VERY friendly!! excellent customer service across the board. attended large convention there...everything was very accessible and pleasant. Moderate temmperature, very comfortable waling around. Mostly half Asian and half European. And... the waterfront views!!! Absolutely stunning. Loved my business visit.

title: Amazing...you need to really experience it.
reviews: A city bordered by beautiful scenic mountains, ocean bordered parks and access to some of the most sought after views.  Experience the micro breweries, food trucks, shopping and some of the friendliest people. Start the day in the mountains and finish with a drink by the ocean. You will definitely want to go back!!

title: Vancouver, an International City that has it all!
reviews: When I first moved to Vancouver, they used to roll up the sidewalks at 9pm and Robson Street, was called Robsonstrasse and they sold dirndl skirts and you went there to eat shnitzle. Times have changed since Expo 86 and the 2010 Winter OIympics and other than for cost of living, Vancouver is consistently, a top global destination for tourism and for quality of life. If you are a good walker, there is little that you could not walk to in the downtown core, with our bike friendly paths, the reach extends around the jewel of downtown Vancouver, to go around Stanley Park and end up in Chinatown, Gastown, the seawall or even across False Creek to the Olympic Village and Granville Island. Americans think of themselves as being part of a melting pot. In Canada, we think of ourselves as a tossed salad. You would think you were in the halls of the United Nations with the amount of languages that you hear on our streets, we are very tolerant of LBGTQ and boast many many mixed racial families. Our burgeoning restaurant scene attests to that! If you don't find what you want in a restaurant, there is probably a food cart that serves it! Slowly but surely, Happy Hours are starting to reach Vancouver, which is honestly still burdened with some draconial liquor laws, but don't let that stop you from experiences a cocktail from Lauren Mote at UVA,   who was recently named top cocktail maker in Canada or one of the many distilleries that are popping up, or our burgeoning craft beer scene. Our diversity of nightlife reflects our varied age and ethnic makeup. Downtown is really a series of small neighborhoods and it feels just that way. (even the microclimates enhance that feeling). We even boast beaches right in the heart of downtown, I mean, how much better does it get than that?Normally, I would tell you to bring an umbrella, but these past few months have made those almost a relic. It does, however mean that in the Summer of 2015, that our eco consciousness also means that we are not using water to keep our city green in the traditional sense. It just means that we value our blessings of nature and want to live in harmony with Mother Nature.

title: Fun in downtown Vancouver!
reviews: I could spend days walking around downtown Vancouver.  There are tons of places to eat, lots to see and fun.

title: A most walkable city
reviews: I live just outside downtown Vancouver (West End) so tend to walk to and fro. It's safe any time of the day or evening. Browse the shops of Robson Street, visit the Art Gallery, and then stroll down to the water for lunch and more exploration (Convention Centre, Gastown, and Dr Sun Yat Sen Garden to name just three). As afternoon is drawing to a close, have a drink at the many restaurants and bars that feature Happy Hour. One of my favourites is Steamworks. Welcome to my city.

title: Foodie in Vancouver
reviews: Very wide variety of cultural cuisine and everything within walking distance from our downtown hotel!

title: Great place, on a par with Sydney.
reviews: Plenty to do from bars and restaurants to shopping and sightseeing, with everything in between. Try to get to Moose Mountain early- there's a full day of activities.

title: Not what I expected
reviews: Downtown in parts is old filthy and plenty of homeless people. Doesnt seem to be any civic pride or maintenance

title: the DTES, a challenging area to visit.
reviews: You need to know where to go if you are trying to navigate the Downtown East Side ( Gastown, Chinatown, Strathcona) All of the hippest stuff is happening in these neighbourhoods but the number of street involved folks can become overwhelming. It is not uncommon to see someone nodding out on heroin next to a shop selling $100 t-shirts, or a person sleeping on the sidewalk next to a hip popular restaurant. Vancouver tries to look after it's marginalized population in this part of town. You have to be cool about sharing the sidewalks. The rewards are worth it though. There are clever and innovative businesses, shops and restaurants dotted about these neighbourhoods.

title: charming
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a great city center. We walked and rode in, through, and around it various times, never tiring of its many charms.

title: Safe and Cheap.
reviews: Great for every day travel and tourist looking for a cheap way to see the city. Now you can take the Canada line to the outlets on the way to/from airport.

title: Portlandia
reviews: It feels like Portland to me. Bit grungy and altogether to many homeless. One day there was a guy playing some bagpipe contraption and another guy on a key board competing with him. An awful racket. BC needs to be more heavy handed.

title: Great city!
reviews: As a tourist, it was great to come to a city that values pedestrian and bike travel. Easy to get around. Clean city with good residents.

title: Love this city
reviews: Love walking downtown Vancouver.   So many nice shops to see and visit, and the views over the water and the mountains are a great back drop.

title: FUN People-Watching & Shopping
reviews: We walked all over Vancouver over our 4 days there. We were lucky to rent a centrally-located 1 BR condo for the 4 days. Did you have any idea that Vancouver is home to about 165 specialty colleges and that most are downtown? The city is loaded with young wealthy foreign students that add an incredible vibe. We really had a great time. We will do it again. We love Vancouver and maybe will invest in a condo there....it's just amazing and incredibly beautiful. BTW, the weather in May was unseasonably warm....it was mid 70's, perfectly-clear skies and never a drop of rain. It was perfect.

title: Not sure what to think. Interesting place but doesn't feel like a real city where people live.
reviews: Such an odd mixture. Some sketchy, smelly areas that we did not safe in and some amazing streets with great pedestrian vibe and shopping/food. Mix in the cruise ship area which reeked of tourism, and you had a bit of everything. Lacked the 'lived in' character of Toronto/Montreal where you felt like you were around people who were connected to and lived in the city. Again, just an odd mixture of things. But overall quite a beautiful place, especially if you consider Stanley Park and the views.

title: a mixed bag with lots of panhandlers
reviews: Vancouver down town is mixture of big business and slums. Lots to see but panhandlers can drive you crazy way too many bike lanes the mayor is obsessed with them.Kits is way nicer

title: A lovely city!
reviews: My daughter and I LOVED our visit to Vancouver! We rented bikes and rode ALL OVER the city! Olympic Village was great! Stanley Park was beautiful! Riding along the seawall and beach was such a lovely afternoon excursion!We had a GREAT 2 days in Vancouver!

title: Loved the beaches, bay views, float planes and the tree-lined avenues
reviews: Beautiful  views, wide streets, very cosmopolitan and lovely.  We took the hop-on-off bus to get a feel for the city layout and it was a great overview.

title: A must to visit..
reviews: A vibrant yet safe atmosphere with a well cared for theme - only marred by one street which seemed to "house" all the city's undesirables. Yes, it is expensive but well worth exploring. Canada Place offers superb views of the shipping buzz as you look over to Grouse Mountain.

title: Easy access to waterfront
reviews: We enjoyed visiting downtown Vancouver as it was a busy and bustling place to be. Fantastic views were on offer from the pier and water front and there are many coffee shops and bars to visit all of good quality. Reminded us of downtown LA.

title: This city is vibrant.... so alive.
reviews: So much to do and see... Gastown at night, waterfront by day. 3 days just gave us a taste of wanting more!

title: Walk everywhere
reviews: We stayed downtown in the Yaletown district and loved how walkable the area is. Restaurants and bars everywhere. Still felt safe walking at night

title: Pretty City!
reviews: We loved the city -- super clean, easy to navigate, and safe. Everyone was friendly. There were a large number of homeless and/or panhandlers but never felt threatened.

title: Nice city to have a wander around
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has a safe peaceful ambience. In 4 days we haven't heard any police sirens and only the occasional ambulance. It's a please ant place to walk around, whether  shopping or sight seeing. The people are all helpful and keen to make your stay a happy one. Several times people have asked if we need directing when we have been seen pouring over a map. The free buses to main attractions are well organised as are the kiosks to buy tickets in Canada Place. It's only down side is its so expensive... Poor hotels commanding what we in England would call top prices.....top hotels commanding ridiculous prices...food expensive as is drink..including bottled water!!!.... But then it is supposed to be one of the most expensive costs of living in the world!!!

title: I Love Seattle
reviews: Used to live on Capitol Hill in Seattle and walk everywhere. Ate out multiple times every week. That place was home and I've wanted to return for twenty years now. I actually might set my sights on Vancouver instead. Great beauty, people, architecture, food, sites, and neighborhoods - all accessible - place Vancouver in the lead. Not sure I can afford it though.

title: The great city of Vancouver!
reviews: We stayed in the down town area and we had an amazing view of the city lights.   I was so pleased to see how clean the city is and air quality was so good.  In the two days we were there I did not see one police office on foot, I did see a couple of police cars that was it.  The city seems to be such a safe city.  We enjoyed our tour of the city, strolling along the water front area and trying out different restaurants.  We also got some gelato while we were there and it was delicious.  This is one city I will recommend for people to visit!!!

title: A perfect place to wander!
reviews: It is easy to walk around in Downtown, all the streets are in grids - impossible to get lost! On every street I walked I found shops, museums, restaurants, statues, flowers and very friendly people. Then you get to the waterfront and there are boats, cruise ships, sea planes, cargo vessels - always something to sit and watch.

title: Alaska blast off
reviews: Spent the day on the hop on hop off Vancouver Trolley. We had four different drivers, all of them funny and very informative. We started with a trip thru Stanley Park a very diverse park, rose garden, totem poles,aquarium etc. the afternoonwalking the city , riding the trolley , enjoying yhe scienery. We booked four days at our hotel and I am not sure if that is enough time to see everything we would like to see. So much to see so little time!

title: A place where it's impossible to get bored!
reviews: Vancouver is one of the world's great cities and Downtown is its beating heart.  This is a place where it's impossible to get bored!

title: Nice experience
reviews: There are proper walkways for walking or jogging or cycling. The city is clean, people friendly and most importantly safe. Travelled with two teenage boys and they loved the walking around downtown.

title: a city with its own self sustaining life... so much to see and do
reviews: so much to see,, hard to keep your eyes on the road... the mountains, the sky, the unique shops... the parks and multidude of bike pathes everywhere... very impressed

title: One of our favorite cities!
reviews: Loved Vancouver, beautiful, clean city, nice restaurants.  The views are breathtaking, and the walk by the water is wonderful.  Fun watching the planes take off!

title: Nothing outstanding
reviews: For first-time visitors, it was a bit of a surprise how little the city had to offer. The transportation system is excellent - easy to use and gets you where you want to go. The views of the water and the mountains are pretty. The parks are pleasant for walking around, and lots of people were renting bicycles to take them in. The beaches were nice, if unremarkable.One problem is that the enormous number of highrise condos means there can be very little to see or do at street level. And while you can walk much of the city, you may not want to, as unpretentious shopping streets transition to homeless hangouts very quickly at times. As other reviewers have mentioned, the sheer number of down-on-their-luck or drug-addicted individuals is very sad. East Hastings was almost unbelievable. There wasn't much in the way of a downtown core - no central spot where you could soak in the city and its residents in a big public space. It also wasn't easy to see businesses where you could check out locally-produced clothing or jewelry or crafts, although you could buy Starbucks coffee just about anywhere. Granville Street and Robson Street had few options for tourists, and Granville was slightly off-putting for the number of people huddled in empty storefronts and slouched on the street, although it didn't feel especially dangerous, and nearby roads that ran parallel were much quieter options if needed. The Yaletown district had a few streets of restaurants, but again, not much reason to walk around. The Sun Yat Sen garden is worth a look, but much of the city seemed to involve knowing exactly where you wanted to go or what you wanted to see, rather than walking around and being surprised by charming finds. Other areas, like Kitsilano, delivered on charm, but downtown Vancouver had much less than you might expect for a city of its size.

title: vancouver downtown is beautiful
reviews: on  7/23 i  went on  a tour of  vancouver downtown. first  went  to vancouver lookout. then  drove  the  city. loved  every moment.

title: A few nice hours in Stanley Park
reviews: Nice small aquarium in the middle of Stsnley Park that features many marine life exhiibis and a cool Otter pond

title: One of the best cities period!
reviews: We didn't spend much time in Vancouver, but for the time we were there I wish we could have stayed longer. This is such a beautiful city that is clean, friendly, and new. We will be back!

title: Clean and safe downtown
reviews: Not much to say other than it's a metropolitan downtown area. What makes it stand out is that the area is generally clean and safe.

title: A beautiful city that is easy to sightsee without a car
reviews: A lovely modern city with skyscrapers and older historic sections that have been gentrified and hopefully will  not be demolished.  The new waterfront at Canada Place and the Coal Harbor area is a beautiful place to walk, jog, or bike. Public buses work well to get to all the major sights.

title: Clean and Friendly
reviews: Loved staying, eating and roaming this downtown area.  People actually asked if they could help us find something! The beautiful mountains surrounding the sea and the city are breathtaking!

title: Shop area
reviews: Lots of shops and restaurants, Expensive stores are all around. there are many tourists everywhere. It is possible to find the famous brands in Robson street.

title: Easy to get around
reviews: Parked at the baseball stadium early in the morning as we were going to a game that evening. 10 -15 minute walk thru a nice neighborhood to the metro.  Spent a whole day just wandering around the city. Loved the food trucks at city centre! A very nice clean well laid out city.

title: Great atmosphere
reviews: Fantastic atmosphere. With So many great restaurants and activities it's hard to decide, small, easy to explore downtown.

title: Downtown Vancouver is worth seeing
reviews: The buildings of downtown Vancouver are varied in size and design with the water visible from most of them.

title: Much to see and do
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is an exciting place. It has good shopping, fine food and plenty of things to do. You can take tours, ride the sky train and just plain walk around and take in the sites.

title: Amazing Waterfront Views and Walks
reviews: Vancouver is really a beautiful city. The water surrounds and has great views everywhere. When the sun is shinning it must be one of the best cities to visit in the world.

title: Worth staying a few days
reviews: The waterfront area really enhances the city. Wonderful for walking and cycling, and not a half bad view either. Modern and historic architecture mix seamlessly. Canada Place is quite stunning. The city is easy to navigate and the entire area walkable by those of average fitness.

title: exciting
reviews: very exciting and happening with eateries, shopping and what have you. Visited for two to three days while on the way to the Alaskan cruise- and really enjoyed the time at Vancouver.

title: Vibrant downtown
reviews: Vibrant downtown with stunning glass fronted high rises.  Like Manhattan with many more trees.  great food scene, good shopping and great food.  Attracts many young people. many good hotels.  good water access.

title: Great Food
reviews: The downtown offers tons of options for great food. I would recommend some of the best Asian  options off of 10 men which is on the fringe of the West End neighborhood.

title: Vancouver a true Canadian delight
reviews: Our first time into Vanouver after a cruise and it was delightful.  So nicely laid out and filled with parks catering to biking and pedestrians.  We'll be back for sure.

title: Great City
reviews: Second visit to Vancouver and a memorable experience. Downtown has a magnificent array of shops, restaurants, pubs and hotel.And it's near the harbour.

title: Very pleasant to walk around ...
reviews: Spent a couple of days walking around downtown - canada Place, Gas Town, Pacific Centre, etc - very clean (although we did notice an extremely high number of cigarette butts, but little garbage.  We felt safe (I was travelling with my 14 year old daughter) and it's fairly easy to find your way around - lovely city :)

title: A "Big" City in a small space.
reviews: Vancouver's downtown area is small enough to be walkable. There are bike lanes that many commuters use, as well as easy parking and readily serviced by bus. Everything you would want in a big city is here - luxury shopping, an inside mall, restaurants galore, fancy and affordable hotels, art museums, music venues, and is the hub for energy-related  corporations. Clean, neat, fun. Fantastic views and even a beach on English Bay. It is encircled by bike trails so rent a bike and get to know the very friendly little big city.

title: Best Downtown ever
reviews: I wanna live here in the future, it's an amazing place, everything is near you, I mean... you have pharmacies, stores and everything there!!

title: Great shopping at pacific mall and Winners
reviews: I stayed here. Easy to access from the airport by rail. There is a downtown station. Excellent shopping, great dining and easy directions. Good people.

title: Amazing City
reviews: We rented bikes and explored huge parts of the city. Absolutely beautiful place to explore by bike...

title: Something for everyone
reviews: Something for everyone! Hi end shopping!! Great restaurants within walking distance from any hotel, the gelato is a must!

title: Great City!
reviews: Have only been downtown Vancouver a couple of times. Most recently for the Grey Cup.  It's very clean, and nice.  It's easy to explore.  Lots of good places to eat, bars to go to , etc.  If you are around vancouver check the city out for some fun!

title: Beautiful Skid Row
reviews: While in Vancouver, BC last Saturday, the ‚Äúhop on-hop off‚Äù (HOHO) bus was not stopping for pick-up a designated on their map.  I had an old map from a previous visit.  The stop, the Quality Hotel on Howe Street was recently one of the 26+ hotels purchased in Vancouver by the Canadian government for the homeless or potentially homeless population.  Since this SRO (single room occupancy hotel) was purchased, the HOHO‚Äôs stop was moved to a close Marriott property. I have stayed at the Marriott before.  This time the rates were 350 USD a night which is why I opted to make this a day trip from Seattle.  On the tour, the HOHO operator said Vancouver is second only to Hong Kong for being the most expensive city.I like the bus tour because you can roam freely and pick back up on the tour when you are ready.  I exited the HOHO and walked through Chinatown, then I went down Hastings.  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skid_row  I walked for 8 blocks to the next HOHO stop.  There was a stench of body fluids, over 200 people sitting/ laying on the street with their belongs.  Turns out I was in the areas recognized as Vancouver‚Äôs Skid Row.  Skid Row also has the only legal drug injection site in North America.  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Insite

title: So much to se.
reviews: Me and my family spent almost a whole day in the aquarium,it is so impressing.Even the food was exelent.

title: My hometown !
reviews: Complete disclosure , Vancouver is my home but I am currently living overseas and visiting my family and friends is amazing . So so lucky to know this beautiful corner of the world .ButIt's really time the city ( and surrounding suburbs ) moved into the modern world and let Uber in !! Taxis here are a nightmare - dirty cars , rude drivers , expensive fares and unreliable . Coming from a city where Uber is just part of our lives , I know what a great bonus this is .Tourism Vancouver , uber drivers would be your best ambassadors for this clean , safe , amazing city . Get over the politics ( and the money and the drama) and let them do your job for you !!

title: Put it on your list and go in July.. great weather
reviews: There is more than enough to do for everyone, the key is to select the right hotel, I do recommend the YWCA Hotel, great for individuals for sure, and just as good for a family.  Once you are at the centre it is easy to get to almost anywhere, you are about a 5 minute walk from their transit centre which is easy to use.

title: Wonderful city
reviews: Great city to explore.  Easy to get around.  The city is clean and well laid out. Shop owners were very friendly and helpful.  Enjoyed our stay very much.

title: Fun fun fun in Vancouver's west end.
reviews: Lots to do and see. You can walk the sea wall. Eat at any kind of restaurant you want from Japanese to Mexican. From Chinese to South Asian. From French to New York style. See the latest movie. Relax on the beach or go for a swim.

title: Great city
reviews: Love this city.  Been here twice now.  Modern city which is clean and tidy.  Plenty of sea views and mountain views from around the city.  Lots of flash cars around for those interested in the luxury or modern american muscle cars.  A progressively changing green city where more and more inner city gardens are being developed.  Very dog friendly in the city.  So much to see and do and many nice restaurants and coffee shops to please any taste.  Many movies get filmed in Vancouver so there is a very good chance that you may see one on your visit.  Rogers Arena is a must to get the experience of a Ice Hockey Game (go the Canucks).  Here is tip if you need to get another bag to take all your gifts home with you.  Go to Winners which is a department store in the city.  A lot cheaper that getting one from any of the inner city bag shops.

title: Visit To Vancouver & Richmond B.C. Canada
reviews: Didn't know Vancouver had so many sky rise Buildings and so many things to see.   The Casino in Richmond even had lose Slot Machines (Smile)

title: A Friendly City, Something for Everyone, Good Value if the Exchange is Right.
reviews: We visit Vancouver BC often. We stay downtown, mostly at the West End because of all the people watching and interesting shops and vendors. Vancouver is separated into several small neighborhoods. A business district which is very clean, upscale, and full of nice eateries. A shopping district with everything from Tiffany's to Roots ( a store specializing in Canadian made clothing ). Yaletown, a yuppified, clean, upscale neighborhood that is located on False Bay, on the water with plenty of trendy stores. There is Coal Harbor, another upscale neighborhood that is nested between the Canada Center and Stanley Park, situated right on Hwy 99. The main street that most people are found eating, walking , and shopping is Robson‚Ä¶most neighborhoods downtown are well within walking distance to Robson Street. Downtown Vancouver is very bike friendly, we never drive our car, either walk or cycle. The cycle routes are well marked and directions are clearly separated . Generally a bike route will be on on side of a busy street, both directions together separated by concrete barriers‚Ä¶very controversial but excellent from a bike point of view. There is also great public transportation, the bus being the most convenient. $2.75 Can gets you a 90 minute pass, and all day passes are available for around $9. Canadian, $7. for seniors, the best place to get them are the 7-11 stores. There is a sky train and plenty of Taxi's. Sadly UBER is not in Vancouver yet. The area's on the West End and along Beach Blvd can be a little dirty, but not unlike any beach town in California...

title: Clean and well set up, great views
reviews: The weather was great and the city is clean and well set out. We stayed in the center of the city and enjoyed the restaurants and views of the harbor.

title: If you can, stay at a hotel near Canada Place
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is nice but not so much to see. It is a short 15-minute walk to the waterfront (Canada Place). So, if you have a chance to pick your hotel, i would recommend staying at one of the hotels at waterfront. It is a much better spot for activities and close to Canada Place.

title: Beautiful downtown Vancouver
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is the fastest growing city in the US/Canada region. Its growing so fast that they expect a million more people to settle there in the next 4 years. Its a very diverse area with quite a few Easterners bringing their children here to get a college education. Its not cheap to live here with the average apartment costing in excess of over $100,000 for under 1000 square feet. If you want to see luxury cars around every corner, this is the place to come. Very well kept streets and the weather is mostly very moderate temperatures. So much to do in downtown Vancouver.

title: Maybe the most beautiful Downtown in North America
reviews: Tall glass towers, wide, spacious, clean avenues, lines of green trees, bicycle lanes - this place combines the grandieur of American big cities with the humanity of Scandinavian town centers. This is all done with a distinct West Coast style: world class fusion restaurants alternate with great sushi places, edgy, high quality luxury is offered with a friendly, down-to-earth style and the people are consistently and amazingly nice. Unmissable.

title: Better when the sun shines.
reviews: Had 2 brief visits to Vancouver to join/leave a cruise ship. The first day was dull and damp and the city seemed the same. However, when we returned a week later, the sun was shining and the city seemed to come alive. Plenty of places to walk around and lots of shops. Be prepared for a LOT of beggars and people sleeping rough. It took us a bit by surprise. Try to go to Stanley park if you only have a short time like we did.

title: Downtown
reviews: Lovely city with lotsto see and do. Clean friendly and very easy to get around especially using the Vancouver on-off trolley service which is excellent.

title: So many places to eat.
reviews: I liked all the option of food choices.  Steak house, noodles, pizza, fine dining, desserts and of course cafes and coffee shops, Vancouver has them all.  Check out reviews on trip advisor when you find an interesting place.

title: Wonderful city!
reviews: Vancouver is a clean, international, safe and very walkable city! We only had one might there and the following day but we walked a ton and made the best of it. Definitely would go back!

title: Great City
reviews: Vancouver is a lovely city with plenty to do, from Stanley Park with its totem poles and miniature railway to Grouse Mountain, where we got to see a small black squirrel while waiting for the cable car to bring us back down. Finally Queen Elizabeth Gardens with it beautiful Japanese gardens is a must to visit. While we were there we saw one of the many Japanese bride and grooms that fly over for their wedding photos. Unfortunately we didn‚Äôt have time to visit China Town so I guess that means we will be returning someday.

title: a beautiful city
reviews: A busy and beautiful city with your shops, malls, restaurants, cafes, apartments, and hotels of course.  We walked many of the streets and neighborhoods of downtown, there is plenty of glass high rise apartments and some historic buildings, like Waterfront station. Just be aware of East side downtown as there are homeless, junkies and beggars. We felt ok  there in the day but wouldn't go in the night.

title: Vibrant, Exciting, Stunningly Beautiful City!
reviews: We enjoyed our stay in the West End of Downtown Vancouver.  The City offers so many attractions and restaurants that there is no need to repeat.  There are little hole-in-the-wall restaurants offering good fare for cheap prices all the way to very, very high end.  There are food trucks and major retailers for shopping.  Or go people watching along Robson, Davie and Granville Streets.  Best attractions are Stanley Park, the Aquarium and VanDusen Botanical gardens.  Also nearby beaches are a fun excursion in the Summer.

title: Really pleasant downtown.
reviews: Lovely walkable City with lots of shops & bars to visit.Felt very safe as a tourist. It helped that whilst we were there the sun never stopped shining.Avoid the East street area though that has a lot of homeless people. Not so nice to see.

title: must do
reviews: The only I have to say its there are a lot of homeless poeple that ask for money.. this is not always nice. Otherwise it is a nice place to go and do shopping

title: Totally worth the trip.
reviews: I loved my one month stay in Vancouver lot's to see and do in and around the city itself, downtown has alot of traffic but not unlike my native San Francisco. there are always lots of events going on and great places to eat and drink and dance at night I highly recommend robson St. for shopping and you must try a Japadog. They got lots of public parking for just 9 canadian dollars, like 7 or so american and its good for 12 hours.

title: The Best of the Best
reviews: coolest downtown I've ever been to... well above London or Chicago, which were 2 of my previous Favs.  Do the Seawall on a rented bike!

title: Bustling urban environment
reviews: People everywhere!  Lots of shops and restaurants within easy walking distance. The buses were also very accessible for transport to other areas of town. The stadium where World Cup was played is also nearby.

title: Loved downtown but lots of beggars
reviews: Loved Vancouver and spent a lot of our time downtown - lots of coffee bars and restaurants and the best ice creams ever! Didn't appreciate the beggars too much especially as they were very pushy and some slightly threatening and there were a lot. Looked for a high class mens outfitters but couldnt find one but did find several fabulous fish restaurants and did some great walking and people watching

title: Getting noisy ,busy,crazy and smelly...dogs urine everywhere
reviews: Biking anarchy....do not respect anybody else than themselves....To noisy..and smelly..excellent food and bakery

title: Clean, Friendly People and nice places to shop
reviews: During my recent visit to Vancouver, most of my time was spent in the downtown area.  What we noticed most  was that their downtown mall was huge and had a lot of the stores that our teen travelers like to visit.  The mall was located underground and spanned many many blocks.  We had a great time exploring the different shops.Like any big city, there were a ton of restaurants to chose from.  Vancouver is a beautiful and clean city and I look forward to a return visit.

title: a wonderful city
reviews: My favourite thing about Vancouver is how accessible it is. Literally everything is in walking distance from fine dinning to clubs it is all accessible. Vancouver has lots of festival and cultural events as well.

title: Walking distance to everywhere
reviews: Such a vibrant city.  Extremely safe to walk around at night. We worked at the Vancouver Christmas Market and walked back to our apartment past 10 every night.

title: Bring Your Walking Shoes and Enjoy
reviews: With over 2,000 restaurants to choose from; plus plenty of stores to shop in, there's always something to see and do in the downtown area. We walked to nearly every corner of town; including the cruise ship port area. However; be sure to avoid Chinatown - it seems to have become a haven for the homeless and street people.

title: Vancouver
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is the place to be, its amazing and everything is in walking distance. Id come back in a heartbeat

title: Nice city!
reviews: I loved this city!  Can't wait to go back.  While we didn't spend much time there, what I saw looked quite nice.  Not the usual trash and dirt in a large U.S. city, but not without homeless people either.  This city is a real gem; I'm looking forward to going back in a couple of years.

title: Love Vancouver
reviews: I love to visit Vancouver and the downtown never disappoints.  Good shopping, good restaurants, beautiful scenery and easy access via bus.

title: A bit of hype...
reviews: Do you like cities?  Do you like to walk (especially in bad weather)?  If so, this city is for you.  Though it is Canada's third largest, it's very compact, especially if you are coming from America.  They are trying so very hard to be 'green', and this will be very evident in all the awful traffic and parking problems should you drive here.  Lots of bike lanes - yipee - rent a bike...never mind the weather...At any rate, it's a world class downtown with decent prices for visitors using other currencies.  Lots to see and do, don't know how the locals can actually afford to live there.  If you are lucky, you may even see the mountains.

title: Wonderful
reviews: Wonderful skyline with the beautiful mountains in it. surprisingly clean. High homeless population but still welcoming.

title: Do walk along Robson Street
reviews: I walked along Robson Street and reached Stanley Park.  I think Robson Street is an interesting street because there are a lot of shops and restaurants on this street.

title: Good place to be.
reviews: Easy walkable distance for shops and all attractions.There is a free shuttle service to Capilano Suspension Bridge which will pick up and delivery every 10/15 mins ( check with Hotel for times).Everyone we meet was friendly and very helpfull.Staying in Downtown on our next visit.

title: Robson Street a must
reviews: I love this high end shopping mecca, such a mass of people rushing about, every language and culture possible.  Treat yourself for coffee and a snack at the Art Gallery Cafe on the second floor.  The classical music and setting is peacefeul for a break.  I love taking it all in.  Oh yes, and some shopping as well ;-)

title: Nice!!!
reviews: It's a nice buy for items, good downtown, varieties for food restaurants, the varieties for stores! Recommend go to downtown

title: Great Walkable City
reviews: Fun, easy to walk; great places to stop and see - friendly people along the way.  Really good eating establishments.

title: Something for everyone
reviews: World class Shopping, world class food, multicultural multilingual.  Attractions, people watching, helpful locals.Traffic at rush hours can be a bear but otherwise ok for a big city.  Great transportation links, fab views and at the edges, a world class park, beaches, Granville Island.

title: Enjoyed Old town Vancouver!
reviews: Walked all over the seaside and ended up at the old part of Vancouver. Loved that part and enjoyed watching the people as we ate outside.

title: Shopping everywhere
reviews: Back when I was on vacation in Vancouver, our hotel was right in the heart of downtown, and I gotta say, downtown was awesome. There is shopping on just about every corner, many attractions and sights to see in the downtown area, many family friendly restaurants, and lots and lots of entertainment.

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: It's easy to walk around with shops, beaches and the lovely Coal Harbour. There are lots of restaurants where you can eat yourself around the world!

title: Fabulous multicultural city. Everyone seems so friendly and helpful.
reviews: If you stop for afew seconds in the street, someone local will stop to help you find what you want. No "edge" to this engagement. They genuinely want to help and enjoy discussing your tourist experiences. Makes the day go round and cheary.  Only downside is the city seems to be struggling to support a a lot of homeless. They are not threatening but it is heartwrenching to witness their struggle. I gather that the issue is the transition phase this city is going through. Lots of fabulous new high rise blocks going up and generating new jobsand homes. I really hope this all works out to balance the lives of everyone. No-one plans to be homeless. Good luck Vancouver I love your people and your sheer energy.

title: Great walking city
reviews: We love to walk and you can walk anywhere downtown. Robson street is a great street for shopping and eating

title: Great place to shop
reviews: Just walking around Downtown and shopping was a pleasure. Unfortunately the coffee wasn't very good but the scenery made up for it.

title: Lots to see and Do
reviews: I live downtown and love it down here. So many amazing restaurants. The best clubs in the city. Stanley Park is great. English Bay Beach is beautiful. Walking the sea wall is fun. Lots of shopping. Whats not to love

title: Be ready to walk, walk, walk!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver offers everything that you would expect and want in a downtown area.  There is plenty to see, a variety of places to eat, (go to Joey's and get their crispy mash as a side dish), and tons of shopping.   You can spend the day wandering the streets and always find something interesting.  Yes, there is a high homeless population, but if you can manage to not look like a tourist, they won't bother you.  It is quite hilly, and it isn't worth the hassle to get a cab, so be prepared to walk a lot and quickly.

title: Very pleasant
reviews: Had a very pleasant meander through downtown Vancouver.  A mix of modern and historic buildings. Plenty to look at and admire.

title: Not a big deal at all.
reviews: Vancouver does not seem Canada at all, so different than what I expected. Downtown is dirty, busy, lots of homeless and drugs .. the streets smells really bad. Stanley Park? It's just OK, there are less famous parks in Mississauga or Toronto that are more beautiful and quiet. Capilanous Bridge? Waist of time and money - it's crowded, expensive and not that special. Boring and expensive city.

title: Enjoy Downtown Vancouver!
reviews: I took the train from Seattle and the Train station is beautiful.  I then rode the rail and that was clean and easy to navigate.  Downtown is clean and easy to take on with many options for eating and shopping.  Check out a Chanukahs game!

title: Nice but nothing much special.
reviews: Unfortunately most cities have destroyed their original heritage buildings and although Vancouver plugs Gastown as a great place to visit there isn't much there apart from the Steam Clock. It has bars and shops but is basically a tourist trap area.There is a Chinese Garden downtown which is probably worth a visit although we didn't have time to see it.

title: I feel at home
reviews: Very easy to live in this area.Friendly people; nice food.You could walk from the beach to the harbour , or to Stanley garden.

title: Clean and friendly city!!
reviews: Loved just walking around downtown Vancouver and soaking up the vibe of this great city. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. The city itself was so clean and inviting. Lots of great shopping and local restaurants to explore. Will be back someday soon to discover more fun and exciting things I'm sure the city will have to offer.

title: Beautiful Big City
reviews: Loved walking around downtown Van, so multicultural and cosmopolitan. So many fabulous restaurants to choose from, beautiful buildings, bright colors and friendly people. Will go back again and again, too bad it's so far from my current city.

title: Easy to get around
reviews: Vancouver has many pockets to the city.  Yaletown area, Granville Island, downtown shopping and eating.  It is all walkable or taking the Hop on Hop off busses  makes it easy to see most of the hot spots.

title: Four seasons in one day!
reviews: Beautiful Vancouver, ride your bike by the water or play in the snow up high. Browse the little shops or explore the designer. Stunning parks by day and seedy back streets by night. So much to see in Vancouver, so much food to taste.

title: Safe, friendly and easy to walk around
reviews: Vancouver...the downtown area is really nice to walk around.  It is safe and the Canadians are very friendly and helpful.   You need quite a few hours to stroll around the place.   We thought Vancouver was one of the nicest cities we have been to.  We loved it.

title: Down town is loaded with high rise buildings and the tower.
reviews: Walking five blocks from our Hotel to the Tower was a revelation. Pollution everywhere on streets and pavements.  Much building construction on the go.  I'm ashamed to say that we were tempted by Mc Donalds to a new salad mix!! - excellent and their ice cream for supper before bed.

title: A quiet place
reviews: Vancouver is good for a weekend trip.  After two days, how long can you look at a mountain?.  Very overpriced. You can go to an Inernational city for less, namely London, Paris Montreal or NYC. the pier is beautiful and a good place to takke a cruise.

title: What a great place to be!
reviews: This is one of the best downtown area I've been! Great restaurants, bars, attractions, all in a walk distance!You can stay in a downtown hotel and you won't need a car (or even a taxi) to move around.Visit the Canada Place and see the wonderful sea around Vancouver!

title: Amazing city
reviews: If I had to choose a place to live it would be Vancouver. I've visited it on summer and it was impressive! I am looking forward to visit it on winter and then have some skiing in the area.

title: Very Scenic and Beautiful
reviews: It is a very nice and clean city. Also it is very active and lively place. The water front is place to walk or ride bike.

title: Strolling
reviews: A buddy of mine gave me a tour of the city. Walked along the wall and took some awesome photos. Perfect weather = perfect trip.

title: Wonderful way to share a Day!
reviews: So much to see in any given direction. But the highlight was the steam clock. We were there on the hour and the chimes were out of this world. I wish I had known, I would have been ready to record the memory. The city transportation is wonderful and I live in Nanaimo, with a BC bus pass......it works on the Vancouver busses. So I did not have to pay for any rides on the city bus with friends from Texas as we got acquainted and enjoyed Stanley Park.

title: one of the best city to live
reviews: the down town  had a offfice, and  hotels  and place to walk  , and  eat, and  cinema,  and mall  also  if is snowing, underground mall  and street connecting,  very  very  clean, people  from  many place, is a new city   100 year found,

title: Caters to different tastes and interests
reviews: Vancouver downtown covers a wide area of different aspects.  There is the business downtown which isn't all that interesting.  There is the shopping downtown that is interesting depending on your point of view.  There is the entertainment downtown which has a lot going on in the evenings.  There is the restaurant downtown which has something for everyone and then there is the tourist downtown.  There may even be more aspects but these are the ones I can think of offhand.  I would be sure to visit Robson Street and the Pacific Centre Mall for shopping.  There are wonderful restaurants of all types but the Japanese and Chinese restaurants are particularly worthy of note.  Visiting Gas Town is a must as is the waterfront area.  Walking (funning, biking, rollerblading) the seawall all the way around Stanley Park is a fantastic way to spend a couple of hours.  Stanley Park is on the outskirts of downtown but is a must visit while in Vancouver.

title: Downtown is walkable, everyone very friendly.
reviews: We were in downtown for the Women's World Cup. The pubs and sports bars were great for viewing games that were not local and the people manning shops were very welcoming. However, the shops you find there are chains you find anywhere. If you are looking for neighborhood flavor, I recommend the West End (bordered by Drake, Denman and Robson to Burrard), and Commercial Drive. They have independent shops, organic grocers, ethnic restaurants and festivals.

title: Ski and City trip
reviews: We love downtown.  Just take an umbrella because it may rain at anytime in March.  Shopping and restaurants are great.

title: cool city
reviews: Lots of attractions, restaurants, bars,etc..Mostly clean, easy pedestrian access to most areas, subway/trains in and out of the city and semi-convenient bus system.

title: Could imagine living here!
reviews: We stayed in Vancouver for 3 nights. We stayed in the financial district which was well placed for walking round the city. We visited the Lookout Tower first which had  a great view of the city and helped us to get our bearings. We discovered some great coffee shops ( not Starbucks which is everywhere!) and a superb Mexican restaurant. Capilano suspension bridge is well worth a visit and you can discover the rain forest and other habitats there. We didn't get the chance to go to the Aquarium or museums but must go back for a longer visit one day.

title: Robson area
reviews: Shopped in Robson area. Easy to get around on the the buses. Lots to see with stadium, art gallery and port.  Great cycling paths around downtown and along seawall.

title: Clean and safe.
reviews: Wandering around downtown Vancouver was a most pleasant experience - there are many diverse shopping venues to choose from as well as an abundant choice of places to taste whatever your palette desires.The city appeared really clean and we felt safe and secure walking around, even late at night.

title: Two sides to this town
reviews: Downtown Vancouver and many of its suburbs are smart, clean and safe but beyond the glass and steel there is a shocking underbelly of deprivation that lines the main thoroughfare that is East Hastings.  Scenes that go beyond those seen in the TV drama The Wire of are on the side walk for all to see.  I've seen poverty elsewhere but nothing that is such an extreme contrast to the affluent side of Vancouver.The people are friendly and helpful but ultimately I am left with the view that the place is soulless.

title: Walk and walk
reviews: Started at the Waterfront Skytrain station and checked out the Olympic plaza where the torch is - then wandered to the de Dutch for breakfast and east to Gastown.  Would not recommend Gastown for kids later in the fay or evening as the transient elements to the area appear more prevalent.  Instead, head to Yaletown for dinner in one of the many many restaurants - some mainstream and others unique boutique places.

title: Clean clean clean
reviews: Downtown has everything you could need.  Great restaurants, shopping and easy to get around.  People are really friendly and accommodating.  It's so clean and lovely to stroll around and shop, eat and enjoy the architecture.

title: Beautiful downtown
reviews: Amazing downtown with ocean ,beach,stanly park and walking or cycling around stanly park.You could walk through coal harbour from canada place to Stanley park ,beautiful view. Walking at Robson street is fun lots of restaurants and shopping ,Denman street is full of Resturant as well.

title: A Little Bit of Nightlife
reviews: Downtown was a great place to stay since there was easy access to all the other neighborhoods of Vancouver.  There is even a free shuttle to the Capillano Suspension Bridge.  Overall, the downtown is impressive.

title: A wonderful city
reviews: Vancouver  is a wonderful city and there are lots of things to do and see. Stanley park and China town are two of their popular spots

title: Bike riding around vancouver downtown
reviews: For the first time visitors to Vancouver, BC one recommended first action, if the weather permits, is to rent a bike (comfy one) to any of the merchants available (denman, robson,...) not far from the entrance of the Stanley park (georgia street and Denman street) most preferably so that you are steps away from the bike pathYou can also start the ride by Canada place if you wishHelmet will be provided for more safetyThe bike path goes one way and dedicated lane for cyclist, so be aware of the runners or walkers and respect each other lanes ;-)Starting from Coal Harbor, just follow the flow and enjoy the easy ride along the wild pristine parkYou will pass bu the Vancouver Rowing Club, then under the Lions gate bridge and will experience such an enjoyable way of embracing the scenery of the mountains in North shores and the seaAfter few kms you will pass by beaches where people relax and playTime for a stop for a drink or a treat ;-)Follow the path until reaching other beaches area, parksKeep follpwing the sea on your right pr you will end up looping to the park itself and you will arrive in downtpwn English bay area Which is end of DenmanI encourage you to go further to see the opposite side pr the city as the path goes all the way to Olympic village and beyond through the skycrappers and bridges while remaining on the safe bike pathSo no danger for kids as you will not be on the road with vehiclesDuration:1:00 ish to english bay to more depending on your willYou will love it and have a terrific experience of what the coty has to offerBring a light back pavk with dinks and snacks if you can not wait to reach the refill station ;-)

title: Stanley Park
reviews: One of the best attractions and Parks we have ever visited. Vancouver is such a gem. The park has lots of good eating places. A shuttle bus runs on a regular basis through the park while others take in both the Park and Downtown.There is lots to do for all the family, including walks, cycle paths, an Aquarium and many eating places.The landscape and wildlife are just stunning

title: Great city but a big homeless population
reviews: This is a very nice city and if you are in the touristy areas it is pretty clean and neat.  However, there is a huge homeless population and they are everywhere asking for money.  I guess that is the burden of most large cities these days.  It dampened my enthusiasm for the city a bit.  But overall a fantastic downtown core with great things to do and see.

title: Walkable
reviews: We walked all around Vancouver.  The city is clean and had no trouble finding the places we wanted to go to.  We visited Gastown, Chinatown, Stanley Park and got a great feel for the city by just walking around.

title: Easy to explore with grid system
reviews: The only problem with Vancouver is its very hilly so if you set off on foot away from the harbour be prepared for some hard walking. The downtown area is fairly flat and a good lace to explore.

title: So beautiful.
reviews: I love Vancouver. Beautiful walk down the ocean wall past Stanley park. I love it. Great place to visit. Lots of great places to eat, shop and people watch.

title: The Steam Clock
reviews: On the tour of Vancouver we visited various parts of the city.  The area around the steam operated clock was really nice.  The clock itself whistles on the quarter hour.  There are several nice shops in the area.

title: Great Weekend Away
reviews: Spent a long weekend here and really enjoyed it.  Seeing the planes take off an land from the water was really cool!  It is a very walk-able area, and there is lots of ground to cover.  Tons of places to eat and drink, and no issues with parking.

title: Nice but really dirty
reviews: We arrived via train on a public holiday so i'm not sure if it was more bad timing but the place was really dirty and full of half drunk people. It seemed nice but wasn't a great impression for us.

title: Something for everyone
reviews: Every district in downtown Vancouver has something for everybody.  Amazing shopping and easy to get around.

title: Sophisticated urban, seaport conveniences, repeat destination
reviews: I love Vancouver.  I've had some terrific meals in various restaurants, the city has been intelligently and thoughtfully planned and developed - not without a challenge here and there, but overall, living here is definitely an option.

title: Walk around easily, downtown core is a safe area.
reviews: I like to walk along Robson and look in stores, look at window displays, people watch, etc. There are places to have snacks or meals, Lots of shoppers. I walk along Granville too which can get sketchy at times, but I'm not scared of gritty. I like to roam around and explore. Easy to walk around and find your way.

title: Great City, great Downtown.
reviews: It feels like a very safe city, has a good vibe and is very clean for the most part; but there are quite a lot of homeless people around and some begging. They really don't bother you during the daytime though and are mostly gathered in certain parts of the city.the area between GasTown and ChinaTown is very very dodgy though and there are lots of homeless there.Great shopping and the waterfront is nice.

title: Amazing City
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city and a great place to stay, with loads of things to do from shopping, gastronomy, parks, tours, mountains, great places to eat.Whatever you have in mind on a vacation stay is easily found in this city ....green and fresh....excellent architecture

title: Fun few days in Vancouver
reviews: Vancouver was a fun City to explore.  We did do a hop on hop off bus to get oriented and then we explored the different neighborhoods. The City is also very walkable. Looking at the map it seems larger than it is.

title: San Francisco with tons of greenery
reviews: Awesome city. Probably quite expensive to live but but worth it for young professionals wanting all citylife has to offer. We were there on Father's Day and attended a huge free jazz concert on the grounds of the museum. Weather was perfect for outdoor event -- probably mid 60's.

title: Diverse
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city and if o  a short stay it is advisable to stay down town. From shopping , theater, gastronomy , parks , art and entertainment the city is second to none.

title: exciting city
reviews: whatever you have in mind on a vacation stay is easily found in this city ....green and fresh....excellent architecture, shopping for all....this city abounds with well tended flower planters gardens and friendly helpful people...

title: Vancuver- A dream came true
reviews: Beatifull city, interesting sights, very appealing. Easy to get arround by feet. Hope to be back soon.

title: Fall in love
reviews: Vancouver is in may opinion the most livable town on our beautiful planet, at least when the sun is shining. It offers many attractions in and around the town center. The city is really clean and has a great public transport system. The people in Vancouver a really kind and friendly and always happy to help you out and start conversations. I love how easy it is to escape the city by either going to Stanley Park or to the beach. One down site are the many homeless, haven't seen that many in any other western town.

title: Beautiful Streets
reviews: Walking around is an experience. Malls and boutique shops, beautifully decorated tree-lined streets with never-ending hanging flower baskets. Very clean. Very busy. Just wear your walking shoes!

title: Chamaraja & Jyothi Rao
reviews: Ease of  travel with the grid system of roads, helpful maps and equally helpful & friendly citizens, China Town was a great experience - has a vintage worn out look, Dr. Sen's Chinese garden is serene, picturesque, has fine architecture, a pond filled with tortoises, large sized fish.

title: Clean
reviews: We stayed down town prior to catching a cruise. The terminal is downtown at Canada Place. The older buildings give character to this clean city. It's not the hustle and bustle that many large cities encounter but unfortunately the homeless are n the corners and outside food outlets begging for money. Plenty of fast food outlets, restaurants and a supermarket in Burrard Street and a petrol station also in Burrard Street toward Burrard bridge end ( handy to know for refuelling the hire car)

title: One of the Best Downtowns in North America
reviews: Seriously, one of the best downtowns--vibrant, clean, easy to get around, and the food is fantastic everywhere.

title: Great place to visit
reviews: You can walk or bike every where - there are paths for both. There is something for everyone - shipping & rail terminals, parks, shops for all pocketbooks, food of every ethnicity and all price ranges, sailing, rowing, 4D theater, plane rides and much more. So you can have a picnic lunch or 5 star meal overlooking the harbor. Major shopping centers available. Not particularity handicap friendly unless you have a powered wheelchair and it goes uphill from the harbor.   The weather is mellow - they no longer have snow.

title: amazing place
reviews: wow! i feel blessed that I visited vancouver and this place. I haven't seen similar place in world. So serene and so happening. Simply Beautifullllllll

title: A lot of fun
reviews: A lot of different people, great Robson street, amazing Canada place , a lot of sculpture,great restaurant, good cafeteria, great Pacific shopping mall

title: Beautiful Vancoucer
reviews: Wonderful time in Vancouver. Loy's to do and see, beaches, science buildings and just walking and enjoying the beautiful city.

title: Downtown by the ocean and the mountainside the "downtown east side"-the poorest neighborh
reviews: I've been living in Coal Harbour right at the edge of downtown near the sea wall and Stanley Park. From here I can walk to any just a few blocks away from Vancouver's financial centre is "the downtown east side"--the poorest downtown venue-what a treat. Downtown is growing rapidly, with a succession of new condo towers being built all the time. That's in the west side of downtown. Just a few blocks away from Vancouver's downtown financial centre, there is the poorest neighbourhood in Canada

title: I love the public transit
reviews: We stayed at a Marriot downtown Vancouver and fell in love with the city.  The public transit is readily available so we were able to see the jpheart of the city on foot, by bus, rail and ferry.   I enjoyed the many variety of vegan friendly restaurants.  Since there are a good Asian population in the city, authentic Chinese, Vietnamnese, Japanese, korean, Indian restaurants are just to drool for.  Juice bar, yoga studios and bike trails gives a feel of a very active and healthy community.  I would definite considering visit this beautiful city again.

title: Nice building, but small
reviews: Myself and my family has been stayed at Vancouver for one month.  Vancouver downtown has lots of awesome building, great view! But it's so small compare to other major cities.  It got not very much to see, beside nice view.  It's good for outdoor lovers, but not many activities for teens.

title: Looks good, smells like pee
reviews: Downtown Vancouver looks really great. Many nice buildings and a lot of stuff to do. However, many streets smell like pee, which is bad.Another thing to add is that the routes of many buses change at night, which is terrible if you go out at night and have to go home by bus.

title: Exhilerating
reviews: There is always something to enjoy in Vancouver.  Walking or bicycling around Stanley Park. Enjoying the walkway at Coal Harbor with the spectacular mountain and ocean views.  Some of the best dining in the world, from casual to fine dining.  Taking a sunset dinner cruise from Granville Island and listening to buskars and shopping at the Granville market before the cruise. Enjoy hanging out at the many beaches, from UBC to West Vancouver.  There are entertainment venues to enjoy and be a tourist in your own city by taking city tours.

title: Sun,Sand and Mountains - All in one place
reviews: Excellent place for eat outs. Watch out for the eat out Vans during the summer.Lovely place to visit during summers. However, prices may be high due to the demand. Best way is to take apartment rental. Works out cheap and you get the amenities just like home.

title: Exploring Vancouver, BC
reviews: We've visited downtown Vancouver several times.  It has a great city vibe and wonderful options for dining.  The shopping is not great, but there is much to do and see all over Vancouver.

title: One of the nicest downtowns in the world!
reviews: When you come to Vancouver, for sure you will visit downtown! One of the nicest and cleanest downtowns in the world I would say! Don¬¥t forget to visit Canada Place, Waterfront, Gastown,Granville street, Rbson street and of course English Bay!

title: Great fun
reviews: The mix of people, mostly nice people. The great restaurants and architecture . There are inner city gardens that are a joy to see amongst the sky scrapers

title: Decent shopping mall
reviews: We spent time walking up and down Robson Street having been told it was the best for shopping in Downtown but in truth most of the premises, certainly west of Howe Street are eating establishments. There is the Pacific Centre shopping mall which is OK but nothing special.

title: I love Vancouver, BC as a city.
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is as short walk and there is so much to see and do there. You can see the cruise ships and eat in nice cheap street Vans. I love Vancouver it is clean and you can walk every where.

title: Enjoyed the views.
reviews: Beautiful buildings and cafes/restaurants.  Small scattered parks to sit and eat in and enjoy the sunshine.

title: Such a lot to see
reviews: A wonderful City So "Enviromentally " & Green " aware very aware of recycling .Plus great to see ALL the WELL CARED  for dogs welcome in the city . Also ALL the people in VANCOUVER  were SO friendly & helpful

title: distinct neighbourhoods within the downtown
reviews: A walk-about shows the visitor the distinctness of the city - Yaletown, Granville, Denman, Robson, waterfront station, the massive convention centre. Gastown, Chinatown... - each gives the visitor a sense of the multiple faces of the city.

title: Fun in the summer
reviews: Walking down the Robson Street and vicinity in the summer is relaxing and fun!  Museum, shops, mall, restaurants...everything steps away!

title: look for the little things
reviews: what a mess, over all not terrible but way over rated just another big city nothing really special about it. suggest using all available resources to enjoy a a variety of activities, wondering about and exploring is always fun too. met lots of interesting characters well worth it.

title: Walk around to get to know the place
reviews: The best way to get to know Vancouver is walking. Take your time to walk around the city and understand why this is a beautiful place.

title: Loved This Beautiful City
reviews: My friends and I were just blown away by this city. It is just beautiful and so clean. Flowers were everywhere and so many sidewalk cafes. We were there only two days but could have stayed for weeks. There is so much to see and do in the city. We enjoyed Gastown and the market. Could have just spend days down on the water and walkway.  Love Love Love to go again.

title: So much to do
reviews: A very varied area. Gastown is the old part complete with a steam clock!! Plenty of shops, bars and restaurants. You will never get bored with the place

title: Just like downtown Toronto
reviews: Just like downtown Toronto but with the beautiful mountains that surround the city. Not as crowded as Toronto though!

title: Quite Impressed
reviews: I enjoy walking through a city to get the feeling of being there. Vancouver is actually on the smaller side population wise for a big city. It was a bit of a surprise to me how much of the city was walkable and we strolled for hours throughout Vancouver. It is very pedestrian friendly and worth visiting with a little planning.

title: Just like any big city, a downtown area is just that
reviews: So downtown Vancouver, is just like any other major city's downtown. There are neat shops, and dope spots. Stay to the shops, not the spots.Crime happens everywhere, this downtown is no exception and currently not a problem.

title: Excellent Downtown experience
reviews: Great shops and an excellent variety of places to eat or just people watch in this beautiful city - well worth a visit - highly recommended.

title: Vancouver
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is well worth a visit, it's beautiful there's a lovely marina lots of cafes, bars and restaurants, and shopping it's a very clean and environment friendly place, eating and drinking is very well priced, the hop on hop off bus is a good way to see the city but it's not cheap about $40 person we enjoyed our two days there will definitely go back for longer next time

title: CAUTION! AVOID EAST HASTINGS...
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has a variety of things to offer many of which will add value to your trip.  That being said, AVOID EAST HASTING at all costs.  This area of Vancouver is 10 or so blocks of the drug addiction.  Steer clear!

title: Clean streets, low crime, & friendly people
reviews: We stayed at a hotel on Robson st. People were very friendly when I asked for directions. The streets were very clean. No litter at all. My family never felt unsafe. The one ways can be tricky. The streets are narrow. Drivers are not aggressive.

title: good shopping area
reviews: We stayed in accommadation downtown  and were surprised at the varying differences in the area .There were all the designer shops on Robson street ,lots of different types of eating places,chinese ,malayan ,greek etc and just around the corner beautiful Stanley park with its aquarium.The harbour is also close by with the giant cruise ships and yachts , well worth a wander around.Traffic is manic on the main streets and driving is crazy , with lots of one way streets ,but turn a corner onto the side streets and it was so quiet and calm.We spent the last three days of our Canadian tour here and were very glad we had given the car back the day we arrived .

title: Exquisite
reviews: Clean, sophisticated, great shopping, site seeing, dining, with a friendly laid back vibe and perfectly beautiful weather in June

title: Traffic is nuts, but the downtown scene is fun to be in.
reviews: There is lots of cool things to do around the city and outside the city limits. Traffic can be crazy and it is something you have to get used to. Without GPS you can get lost easily around the area but thankfully we had a map with us to help us get around.

title: Vancouver
reviews: Enjoyed Capilano Suspension Bridge and Grouse Mountain which will give you a thrill and test your feelings about heights and moveable walkways.

title: beautiful city
reviews: we had fast food from a street vender which was cheap and good out side the art museum.As in most big cities in the world Vancouver as homeless but they dont bother U but its a pity as its a beautiful city

title: Awesome City
reviews: I love how alive Vancouver feels.  From all the people waking around the streets to the the different neighborhoods each with their own personality. Great city to walk or bike around. Real Dedicated Bike lanes!!

title: Familiar looking Pacific city urban space.
reviews: Good shopping, eating, transpor. Can be base for going around Vancouver due to the excellent transport links.

title: An incredible city
reviews: This is a beautiful city to visit--lots to see, great places to eat, wonderful hotels. We had the good fortune to book at a  hotel overlooking the port and from our vantage point, watched small planes take off and land on the water. The only thing I noticed negative (at least when we visited) was the seemingly high numbers of homeless individuals sleeping on the streets.

title: The view!
reviews: This review isnt about the inside of downtown but what it looks like from outside!!Being with a photographer husband I roamed in nights to get the perfect view of the downtown and of course got many. We went to Lonsdale quay around 11pm and sat there to absorb those pink yellow and green of the Canada Place. The whole lit up downtown, oh my. It was worth taking the ferry. Second day, we roamed in the Stanley park around 10-11 pm and captured some great views of the downtown and the yachts.

title: Lovely City
reviews: We enjoyed the entire city, but the Gastown area was our favorite, it was especially nice.  All was easily walkable.

title: Clean,organized place
