reviews: I like Vancouver. It is easy to visit seaside,beaches,mountains within short distance. Beautiful city. Food,restaurants are good. A lot of healthy food available. Clean water,Pacific.  Diversity. Friendly people. We will visit again.

title: Fun Stroll Downtown
reviews: Take a stroll downtown and take in the sites.  There are some cool architectural pieces to see, and plenty of shopping to enjoy.

title: Fly Over Canada a blast!
reviews: Yes, the fly over experience itself is short.  I would have loved to have had 3x the time at least!  But for the time that it was, it was was exilirating.

title: The shopping precinct
reviews: We were in the shopping area on a Sunday  & initially thought the area was dead. Fortunately we wandered into a kitchen wares shop which was the only place we found open & the husb & wife who own that shop were good enough to give directions. After a 4 block walk uphill we arrived & joined many others.  Generally the shops are the same which ever city you visit- all are out to "make a Buck" The downside to Vancouver are the many people out "begging" I don't recall a city with as many young people putting their hand or hats out for money -all with their cardboard signs pleading. This isn't a good look & once the touristshead off so do these people leaving an awful mess on the footpaths with all their rubbish

title: Much to do and see!
reviews: A lot of places to shop and eat in this bustling city!  Very expensive though, buyer beware!   Nice information center directly across from the cruise port, offers free internet service, nice and helpful staff as well.

title: Amazing City !!
reviews: We love Vancouver !! Anything you want is downtown !! So many good places to eat and so many pubs that its hard to decide where to go !! Its also home to the sports teams....Vancouver Canucks, Vancouver Whitecaps and BC Lions !! Lots of great hotels also but its not cheap to stay downtown.

title: Nice city
reviews: Vancouver is a lovely city and well worth the effort to walk around. Lovely views of surrounding mountains and the port river area,

title: Clean and Vibrant
reviews: The downtown is clean and several great areas for walking and window shopping.  The area along Grandville has great shops and perfect for people watching.

title: Shopping
reviews: Shopping was ok, we picked up some souvenirs for the family. People in the street were very helpful when we didn't know where to go, places were easy to get too.

title: Gas town and bewond
reviews: The Gas Town and down town areas are great to stroll and soak up Vancouver with a great selection of restaurants and cafes this is a great place to start exploring the great city of Vancouver

title: First Canada trip
reviews: Down town do it people are very friendly & helpful never had a problem the rest of world could learn from Canada's people. we used hop on hop off bus even though all places are walk able  allowed us to get some insight. great city to visit even for a short day trip. do not miss by just using Vancouver as transit to & from airport allow at least one day to explore this city.

title: Wonderful Downtown
reviews: Vancouver is a very walkable city.  Most of the upscale shops are on Alberni Street with the Fairmount Vancouver having several.  Others are scattered from the Four Seasons and Pacific Centre down to the waterfront.  There is also Gastown for souvenirs.

title: Mmmmmm
reviews: Downtown was well a concrete jungle lots of big buildings and wide roads didn't leave a good impression on me sorry.

title: Great fun
reviews: We are able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. The people were friendly and helpful. Great range of stores and things to do. Shopping, movies, and live shows.

title: Shopping closeby
reviews: Coming from Europe, you'll have to find you're way at first. Thereafter you'll find out that all the shops are very good situated, and  good to be reached!Pleasant

title: Great for the Family!
reviews: Kids activities, clean air, bicycle friendly, Stanley Park view and ride was excellent experience, Gas Town was clean and quint, Robson Street had excellent restaurants.

title: We felt in love suddenly !!!
reviews: We just love this City! Clean, organized, nice people, good for tourists with all the maps and paths everywhere, you can't get lost. This City offers so much, we would like to stay here forever! If you want to know more about our adventure in Vancouver go to ourstepinto.com and read about our adventure in Vancouver, Canada.

title: Lots of homeless people
reviews: Everyone had built me up for Vancouver but the number of homeless in the city was very sad, especially around Hastings Street. Most of them are on drugs and smell - you get sick of people asking for money at times. Social Services in Canada obviously have had some budget cuts.

title: Easy safe City
reviews: Vancouver is fifth in the ranking of best places to live. Despite the fact there are homeless on the streets and the air in some places does smell of dope (which is legal in BC) it is a very safe and pleasant city which good shops a good public transport system and buses. This is just a wonderful city

title: Best City in The World!!!
reviews: Everything about Vancouver is just absolutely wonderful and amazing. It is the city of my choice to live in. The climate, parks, nature, cultural diversity, international cuisine, great shopping,  excellent public transport ,  easy to find your way around, and the list keeps going on. Definitely the best city. Two thumbs up!!!

title: A very interesting city
reviews: We spent 3 days in Vancouver and one of those days we spent just walking around the downtown area. It's interesting to compare cities when you travel and this was one of my favourites. It's a little hilly but not too bad. The extensive range of shopping was great. Will definitely go back one day.

title: Gastown vancouver
reviews: Well worth a visit to Gastown to experience the Fly Canada simulator at Canada House. this gives an amazing overview of the country  . Ask for directions to the unusual steam clock but do not stray too far past the eateries and shops in this area !

title: Great City
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has everything - shopping, cafes, range of fabulous eateries and all in a walkable area.  Don't miss it!

title: totally convenient
reviews: lived in a hostel at downtown. communications were super convenient. and buying a daypass was needed for visiting various places within a day. easily to find great restaurants, shopping malls and stores.

title: Loved it!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a great international city with friendly people, great food, and a beautiful skyline.  The city is like eye candy with lots of different architecture, glass balconies, and water every where.  Don't take a car, parking is a nightmare!  I highly recommend the Sky Bus day pass for $9.99, you can ride all day and go to N. Vancouver as well  (stunning scenery over there although you will need a car in Northern Vancouver and that's a whole other review) via the Sea Buss from the Waterfront Station downtown.  there are multiple eclectic neighborhoods, every kind of food you could ever want, high end shopping, fantastic original cocktails, craft beers, and nice people!  The cost of living is a bit high, even with the favorable US - Canadian exchange rate, however, despite that it's a fantastic vacation location.  If you like mountains, water, flowers, and trees look no further than Vancouver!!!

title: Easy to get around.
reviews: I have not been to Vancouver in over 25 yrs, so this was an accasion for us. Fantastic weather great sites and lots of coffee shops.

title: My favorite city . . . so far!
reviews: Wow! Downtown Vancouver is the place to be (and live). From the tree lined streets, active nightlife, interesting people, and entertainment options galore. Downtown Vancouver is easy to tour on foot so wear good walking shoes. You will stumble upon Yaletown, Gastown, Davie Village, Granville Island, Canada Place, and Stanley Park. People actually live in this city and the public transportation is excellent (Canada Line). Don't forge the gorgeous mountain and water views. The only drawback is there are a lot of smokers, cigarette butts/trash, and homeless people (but you find this is every city). Other than  that the city is A++. It is a very laid back city so come as you are. Enjoy.

title: Fabulous City
reviews: I'm not sure what I was expecting when I got to Vancouver.  I knew they had high rise buildings, were a port city and so forth.  The tax ride from the airport to downtown, we passed by some really nice homes and neighborhoods.  The cab fare was $35.00 from the airport to our downtown hotel.  The taxi driver told us it is a great city, safe to walk day or night, even down alleys.  The driver we had for our one tour told us the exact same thing.  One thing I noticed unlike other larger cities is the lack of graffiti, which is a nice thing.  There is something for everyone in this city from small boutiques, touristy gifts to high end shopping.  There is also every kind of food imaginable here and walking down some streets the smell of curry, or charbroilers really filled the air.  Downtown is right next to Stanley Park where you can get away from the city for a while.  I really loved Vancouver, my purpose of visiting was it was the disembarking port for our Alaskan cruise so I arrived in Vancouver a few days ahead of time, just to take in the city and I am so glad I did and I will definitely go back.

title: Wonderful City
reviews: We soon found that Vancouver was full of great places to visit, great people, great food, but do not expect to find great coffee everywhere.  If there is one thing Canadians lack is the ability to make a great coffee.  Nevertheless persistence has its rewards and good coffee shops [cafes] are available.

title: A good city to wander around
reviews: Nice clean streets, plenty to see, especially at the waterfront and the small harbour area at the opposite direction.A few too many street people which is a shame for them and the City. Lots of quality hotels and restaurants.Harbour is superior view to Victoria on Vancouver Island.Gastown is a good walk and the seawall is good for exercise. Paul

title: Lots to do and plenty of place to dine
reviews: Very nice shops near the water and lots of cuisines to choose from. Make sure you stop by canada place, the very green convention center, and the different sushi places.

title: Great City
reviews: Great idea to take the city tour by bus.  You really get to see all the great parts of Vancouver.  Use the uop-on-off bus.

title: Great downtown
reviews: Very nice downtown area. The glass buildings are impressive.  Lot of restaurants and you can walk down to the harbor.  If you get there see Fly over Canada, well woth it.

title: lovely place
reviews: Downtown is great.you can find history through well preserved buildings as well as luxury boutiques and art galleries.very easy to walk around and very safe.

title: Wonderful city
reviews: We found so much to do there with a lot of good food and drink places to indulge in with pleasant views of the harbor. We had warm sunny weather so we expereinced the bst of Vancouver. I'm sure it would be quite different in winter.Being approached by hmeless people and seeing them lying in the streets was confronting as I've not seen this in Australia although Vancouver is very much like Sydney in other respects. Highly recommend the Canada Flyover, at Canada Place.

title: Great shops and restaurants
reviews: For a city, it does not feel like a city! It is very clean and easy walking (or take the link) to many locations. Great shops and restaurants on Water St, Robson St, Granville St and more!

title: Most livable city
reviews: This what makes Van a perennial world's most livable city, the British Columbia - one of the most beautiful places on Earth, and Canada - one of the happiest countries. Just imagine a city with the 3rd largest park in North America, a top 10 aquarium in the world, with one of the most expensive streets in the world (Robson) and one of the most stylish neighborhoods in the world (Gastown).

title: Great Place to get around
reviews: Vancouver CBD was so easy to get around as its on a grid - it was so easy to find everything.  We walked everywhere from Canada Place to English Bay.  We also took the hop on/off bus to go further afield.  The weather was sunny and beautiful views everywhere we went. We were on Robson Street close to everything.

title: Everything you could want
reviews: Sydney, Hong Kong, Cape Town, Auckland.....and Vancouver.....cities with amazing settings. All set on the water, framed behind by mountains and all full of fun and fabulous experiences. Wander around the. Entrap area, or Stanley Park or head out to the University of BC campus....you are sure to be impressed (as long as it isn't pouring with rain, of course). Or.....Take a trip to Vancouver Island on a 'turn up and go' ferry....book yourself a cruise up the Coast to Alaska......drive up through glorious country to The Rockies (or go on the Rocky Mountaineer).  What a place to spend a holiday!

title: Multicultural City
reviews: We were in Vancouver for Canada Day when they close off downtown and have a street party with bands and floats.  It seems like everyone was in town.  We enjoyed the waterfront which was easy to stroll along and also when up the tall building for a panoramic view of the city.

title: Get out and walk!
reviews: So many things within easy walking distance in Vancouver, with lots of shops and restaurants along the way.  A beautiful city  that invites walking (except maybe Hastings Street where a lot of homeless/druggies seem to hang out.  Unlike similar folks in Los Angeles area, however, none of the Hastings Street folks accosted us in any way--no shouts, physical aggression, or spitting--so it was far nicer than LA, but still an unpleasant part of urban life today).

title: Reminds us of Melbourne, Vic, Australia
reviews: Lovely city, easy to walk around but shopping a little expensive.  Lots of souvenir shops, good eating at Urban Fare.  Public buses easy to work out, clean and cheap.  Felt very safe.

title: Has everything
reviews: Restaurants, cycle rentals, malls, upmarket shops, it has everything. Nice area to walk or just sit by the roadside and eat. From less expensive falafal to fine dining.

title: A diverse and vibrant city
reviews: We did not expect to enjoy this city. It has a very diverse population, a wonderful range of cuisine and unmatched natural beauty surrounding it. You can have the sea and the mountains at the same time. Can do a lot of activities.

title: Great city
reviews: We spent heaps of time here. Shopping and eating. It's a great city.there are lots of food trucks selling yummy treats. We had the best toasted sandwich ever. Don't be afraid to try.a must is a simulated fly over Canada which is situated down at the boat harbour. It was so much fun. About $20 Canadian and well worth it.

title: Observations of downtown Vancouver
reviews: Vancouver's downtown is very walkable.  The wonderful Convention Centre with the cruise ship terminal attached is right there - you can walk to the shopping streets.  There are a lot of street people just lying about which detracts from the otherwise beauty of the place.

title: GREATEST MOST BEAUTIFUL CITY ON EARTH
reviews: Yes I live here and may be somewhat biased but I also travel over 200 nights per year and though I've betn to amazing places, NO city has it ALL like Vancouver. Surrounded by the glistening Pacific Ocean with spectacular snow capped mountains in the immediate background Vancouver offers so much to ALL ages, cultures, outdoors lovers and adventurers. Green all year round (maybe two or three days of snow per season in the city), you can golf, water ski, snow ski and hike any time any season! The people are friendly, the city is safe, the restaurant scene GREAT! We have amazing 5 star hotels and great shopping. Real estate unfortunately is CRAZY expensive but if you can afford it... There is NO better city to live in!

title: Great for shopping, bars and restaurants
reviews: Modern, young and vibrant city. Full range of shops from designer names to well known brands.Plenty of bars and restaurants for all tastes and cultures.Still has some beggars sleeping and asking for money on the streets.

title: We left our hearts in Vancouver!
reviews: Our first time visiting and we had a blast. Shopping, Restaurants, Stanley Park, Waterfront activities, Granville Island, the architecture and history..... I could go on. This is a beautiful city. Clean, Friendly, Safe what more could  you ask for?  We stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront and was a stones throw away from the port.  Great place to stay before heading out for a cruise but give yourself a couple of days to enjoy all that Vancouver has to offer. The transit system is fantastic.  So is the Hop on Hop off tours.

title: Visited for a few days prior to a cruise
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is an exciting place to be. There are so may shops, restaurants and bars! There are people out and about until late in the evening and it was a fun visit.  Now the negatives...the homeless are everywhere, they accost you on the street for money and won't take no for an answer. The prices of items in Vancouver are very high. The local tax on alcohol is prohibitive, especially since there are so many microbrewerys and wine bars, i'm not sure how people who live there can possibly afford to go to any of them!

title: Variety is the spice of life
reviews: Loved Gastown with its steam clock and quirky shops. There were shops to suit all budgets and fantastic eateries. Would highly recommend a visit.

title: Enjoy!! Lots to do ... lots to see ... lots to eat! Never boring.
reviews: If you are a shopper there is a wealth of shopping choices.  If you enjoy architecture ... there are beautiful buildings all around you from very old to very new.  If you enjoy funky take in the steam clock in Gastown ... want to explore ... take the seabus or train to other areas ... want to relax ... sit on the benches at Canada Place and enjoy the views.  If you are hungry there are numerous excellent restaurants to suit all budgets everywhere.  The streets are clean and many are tree lined ... in the summer there are overflowing flower pots everywhere.

title: Vancouver, I love you!
reviews: We had just 24 hours together and I feel a little cheap saying that I fell so easily for you!  What an amazing combination of concrete and sea, it felt a little cognitively confusing to be viewing the amazing waterfront and mountains between high rise buildings.  Getting on the ground and seeing the hum of people, bicycling, walking and rollerblading, really gave me a sense of seeing how the Vancouver people use every aspect of their city.  We will absolutely return to get a real sense of where we visited.  I cannot recommend, highly enough, to visit Vancouver.  It is everything I hoped for and more.  I will be back!

title: Mentally ill, drug addicted, and homeless runaways
reviews: I am a proud vancouverite who walks to work through the downtown entertainment district, during my commute I pass the byproduct of the social experiment that our mayor has taken up as a cause to house all the homeless in Canada.  It is a beautiful city, but like every big city it has huge issues with drug use and homeless people who will do what they need to do to survive.  Vancouvers relatively mild climate attracts the homeless that blend in with all the office types downtown during the day, it is far more noticeable after hours.  As a resident of the city I sometimes find it hard to look past this and see the good in Vancouver, enjoy!

title: Alaska Cruise by way of Vancouver BC and Seattle WA
reviews: I absolutely loved Vancouver and everything it offers.  Very cosmopolitan city.  Very friendly people.  The hop on hop off bus is a must.  You see people from all over the world.  You can easily walk to places if you are a walker.  Buses are plentiful.  Staying on Robson Street is a must.  Lots of different restaurants.  Vancouver is a bit expensive but you can find ways to save money.  Stanley Park is gorgeous, the waterfront is gorgeous.  I can go on and on.  I went in late September.  The weather was perfect.

title: So sad spoilt by tramps and druggies
reviews: Beautiful city spoilt by tramps etc in the streets and begging everywhere .we were so shocked the major and council need to do something it's a disgrace, rubbish and being approached for money is not what we expected in a successful city as Vancouver.

title: Clean
reviews: Walked through the city on a Sunday when most people were enjoying a beautiful early Spring day.  City is full of new beautiful buildings/skyscrapers and the streets are clean and a pleasure to walk.

title: Forget the old town, visit the new Vancouver.
reviews: Don't bother with Gastown and the sleazy East end of Vancouver. There is so much to offer on the new water-front near the cruise ship terminal. I think it's the Marine park area. Goes all the way down to Stanley park. The new convention center is fabulous. New restaurants and attractions nearby. Just don't even think about driving. Either rent a bike or walk. You won't be sorry.

title: I could live here :)!!!
reviews: Absolutely beautiful city with stunning views. Would not say it is as big as other places bit it has plenty places to shop in, dine in, walk in, and bike. Would definetely come back!

title: What A Fun City To Visit
reviews: Vancouver is a melting pot of cultures, food, clothing, art and more so you can find something for everyone to enjoy. W ith the mass influx of Chinese and money, Vancouver is getting taller, more crowded and much more expensive then just 10-15 years ago but it is still one of our favorite places to visit. So much of Downtown can be seen on foot and with a short tax or bus ride that you can leave your car at the hotel. Amazing variety and quality of foods from all over the world as well as art and culture. People are usually very friendly so do not be afraid to ask for directions or suggestions.

title: Shopping extravaganza
reviews: My wife and daughter specifically wanted to shop.  The variety of shops is almost over whelming for a male.  We spent hours upon hours Sunday afternoon and Monday morning.

title: Walk or Bike best way to see it.
reviews: This is one long walk but best way to see most of downtown Vancouver. Start at Canada Place closed to the Pan Pacific Hotel. Head towards Stanley Park on  West Cordoba, stop at Bella Gelateria for the best ice cream in town. Keep heading West  until you hit Jervis St. Keep walking towards the Marina and check out the views. Stop at Cardero's for fuel and then continue your walk around the waterfront until you arrive at Denman St. Go South on Denman towards English Bay Beach. On your way there have a couple of tapas at Espana just before Pendrell St. From English Bay, go south on Beach Ave. towards Burrard St. Bridge and continue on to Pacific St. Continue pass David Lam Park and make a left on Davie St. to Yaletown. Here you will find hip and trendy shops, restaurants, and gastropubs. After a few craft beers keep start heading East back on Pacific Blvd. Pass BC Place, Rogers Arena, and turn North on Abbot St. towards Gastown. Once on Water ST. check out all the new restaurant and shops on this historic area. Back on Water St. go West towards the Waterfront Station. and then back to your starting point. If you managed this route you are a hell of a walker or biker. KUDOS!

title: Oldest area Downtown is Gastown
reviews: Interesting area Water Street is the main street where you can see the world's first steam clock its like stepping back in time with its cobbled streets and old gas lamps.

title: Clean the streets
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is spoilt by the amount of litter on the streets. The city should employ more street cleaners or get the fast food restaurants to clean up their own mess. Granville Street was a mess. East Hastings and Chinatown should be avoided by tourists.

title: Changed in Twenty years
reviews: we were here 20 years ago, there has been a lot of change not all for the best, it has become a bit seedy, plenty of homeless people wandering the streets.

title: Easy walking
reviews: Easy walking around Downtown Vancouver with lots of bars, shops and restaurants.Easy to boats and stadium

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Started at Gas tawn and walk to Robson street is a fantastic view ,from lanes whit trees to large glas building .the contrast is wonderful.

title: Lots to see and do - especially good food!
reviews: Stayed in the downtown hotel "The Buchan" for 2 nights with easy walking to food and shops.  Great breakfast meals at "White Spot"and dinner at "Kingyo" (Japanese Bistro) restaurants. Went to attraction "Fly Over Canada" and enjoyed that family exploratory experience. Nice  gardens and walking down by the docks. Plenty of shops.

title: Big and Lively
reviews: There are literally miles of streets to walk, with all of the large shopping chains that one would expect, but also with a lot of more individualistic shops. Lots of great restaurants, particularly ethnic, and downtown borders the sea, which is amazing. Also, there are probably more luxury highrise condos downtown than any city I've seen other than maybe NYC, Chicago and Toronto.

title: Big city with lots to do....and lots of people.
reviews: Enjoyed walking around Canada Place and the harbor sights.  Didn't have a car (first 2 nights) so walked everywhere. Many places to choose from for dinner. Ended up at Steamworks Pub....a fun and delicious place!After traveling to Banff, Lake louise and Jasper, we spent one Sunday afternoon at Grouse Mountain. Had a car then to drive to hotel near airport. Thought rush hour traffic was only during the work week.....NOT....bumper to bumper traffic all the way from North Vancouver to airport (only 15 miles) but took almost an hour!  Still a wonderful place to visit!!

title: Vancouver Downtown - Robson Street
reviews: The downtown area of Vancouver is a busy busy place to hang out. The best for me is on Robson Street. Lots of Restaurants, Shops and nice spots to stop and have a glass of wine people watching which is one of my favorite things to do on a lazy day. Close to many nice hotels if you are planning an extended stay. Highly recommend all hotels in and around Robson Street. Family friendly.

title: Beautiful City, but one problem
reviews: Visited May 2015First trip to Vancouver and I was impressed. The city is located on the water and is beautiful. Apparently there is a real interest in greenery and landscape because it seemed that every building took pains to beautify itself with lovely trees, shrubs and flowers. It was quite impressive as you walked around the city.We spent most of our time in the West End and Coal Harbor areas, and one side trip to the Pacific Center area (downtown shopping mall). However, we were shocked at the (seemingly) homeless and vagrant on the street corners. There must be a valid reason but apparently the City of Vancouver looks the other way on these folks. I kid you not: some of them actually have their beds laid out on the street corners. We saw several who were obvious wasted and this was a bit disturbing because of the uncertainty it causes. It certainly detracts from the lovely city that is Vancouver.Other than that, this city is clean, the folks are very welcoming, and it is well worth a visit.

title: Awesome city!
reviews: This has to be one of the most entertaining and clean cities I've ever been in. You would be missing out if you didn't spend some time sightseeing around this gem. We enjoyed the restaurants and especially the friendly people we came across on our travels. I only regret we didn't have to much time to spend exploring Vancouver but I will be going back to spend more time there. Don't rush off especially if your getting off of a ship work it out to spend at least a day or two and enjoy :))

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: At Vancouver Downtown you will have an amazing experience. It is better to bike or walk everywhere since everything is close. The area is all flat and there are many amazing sights.

title: Great place to visit
reviews: Stayed four nights at the sutton place hotel Vancouver. Had a great time, love down town, very exciting place to visit, love the people love down town.Highly recommendedSteveuk.

title: Entertainment District
reviews: When reviewing "Downtown" I'm specifically addressing Central Downtown/Granville Entertainment District and the surrounding area (as opposed to Gastown, Canada Place, Chinatown, Yaletown, etc). I found the area clean, lively and vibrant with plenty of choices for food and drinks, from quick bites to full service restaurants. We stayed at a hotel in the middle of Downtown and found it very walkable to many entertainment options. Having said that, this IS an urban downtown area so you will encounter homeless and loitering. There were several young travelers/backpackers staying at a hostel in the area and hanging out at the eateries/pubs. Other young folks were fooling around on skateboards on the corners. But we never felt uncomfortable walking around and were never bothered by anyone. If this type of environment makes you uncomfortable, then I wouldn't suggest walking alone or after dark.  Also, some pubs and restaurants turn into nightclubs with DJs in the evening which brings out the partygoers.TIP: Stay away from the Eastside (also considered downtown), specifically Hastings Street. There are a high number of homeless and addicts in the area (canibis clubs and shelters too). There is nothing worth seeing there anyway, unless you want to witness street blocks literally packed with homeless people lined up with carts full of odds and ends, seemingly selling or bartering their wares to other homeless people.  Not kidding, I couldn't believe my eyes

title: What a mix of People & Places
reviews: downtown offers such a mix of people, restaurants, and watering holes that should satisfy everyone.  Variety from the high end to the local "dives" and all in close proximity to the waterfront and/or BC Place stadium.  There is both bus and sky train transit service readily available until 1am.  Downside for some may be the panhandlers and street people, but we had no issues with either.

title: Awesome place
reviews: Business and tourists blend well together, lots of places to eat and shoppings, beatiful landscape, modern and old buildings

title: Downtown
reviews: We were shocked to see so many homeless beggars on the streets in the Gas Town and China Town districts of Vancouver, there were literally hundreds of them lining the walkways, many stumbling around like zombies (honestly). There appeared to be some kind of street market coming to a close with the roads lined with people pushing supermarket trolleys full of their worldly goods. We couldn't access a restaurant as there were so many beggars outside each one. Very sad and harrowing visit.

title: Wonderful!
reviews: If you enjoy modern architecture you will love Vancouver. Add wide streets, lots of greenery and trees and you're on to a winner. Lovely clean city with happy, pleasant people (most carrying coffee)

title: Lots of drug addicted homeless
reviews: The atmosphere is great with all of the buildings. The streets are relatively clean and there is lots to do downtown. However there area lots of homeless. They don't seem harmful but you never know with all the drug use. Stay away from the downtown east side.

title: large walking space
reviews: Usual downtown "stuff" enough Starbucks to keep spouse happy.One must wonder of to the shore and enjoy all it has to offer.

title: A clean, tree lined, vibrant city
reviews: Vancouver is one of me favourite cities, the Hop on Hop off bus and tram cars make it easy to visit all the major attractions. The city is clean, vibrant, has a wide range of eating places for all pockets and one feels safe walking the tree lined streets

title: Great shopping
reviews: We visited downtown each day to shop, or walk to Canada Place or the fabulous Gastown with it's beautiful shops & eateries & bustling atmosphere. Also watched the ships take off bound for Alaska, which was a lot of fun and prepared us for our own trip. Yay!

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: I really love this city and you will find that downtown Vancouver is very clean. also I never saw any Graffiti. The streets are very clean and the Drivers are so courteous.

title: It ain't easy being green
reviews: Vancouver has a terrific downtown. Lots of shopping, some galleries, big city gallery (VAG), good food scene. The amount of green space and small parks is highly impressive, making it much more than a concrete jungle. Even the big downtown courthouse is beautiful. I do think they have screwed up traffic even more wight the bike lanes but hey it is the left coast after all. I love this downtown.

title: Downtown Vancouver BC is a bit different and definitely worth a look
reviews: Ive been to Vancouver BC many times but never stayed in Downtown.  This time I stayed there due to the convenience of being near the Port and it worked out great.   There are plenty of shops, restaurants and a mall to take care of your needs.   As for any downtown area there are some panhandlers. In this area they seemed a bit more aggressive and asked for you to buy them a meal or coffee but it was not bad.  I did notice that for such a nice area it could have been cleaner but nothing different than most downtown's

title: Great shopping and sightseeing
reviews: Perfect area for both shopping and sightseeing. We walk around Canada place, Gastown and Pacific Centre. Great selection again!

title: Everything right there
reviews: Lots of shops from very expensive to trendy to touristy.  All the recognizable names in shopping were very convenient. Any kind of eating establishment was also just a few steps away.

title: Shopping at its best
reviews: Great malls to begin your shopping and great places to stay at to help you enjoy your stay in be. Transit and taxis to take you to where you are going. Lots of local history places

title: More Homless than Tourists
reviews: We had just finished a cosmos tour and the last hotel was in downtown .We walket down to the Steam Clock and we could not believe the amount of homeless beginning on this road .We went out to Grandville Street for dinner and we were eating in a fenced off area in a restaurant when one Homless person walked passed seen my Qantas hat and started to yell screem abuse me we didn't fell safe after that . We moved over to the   Grandville side but this was not that much better.

title: wall around and enjoy
reviews: walk around, soak in the culture. the people are v friendly, v chilled out, will help you with directions, suggestionsthe art gallery with Cezanne's collection was great

title: World class city
reviews: One of my top 5 favorite cities in the world. When it isn't raining, you can't beat the weather, geography (mountain and water views), shopping, dining, walking around and people watching... An urban hounds' delight.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Plenty of restaurants and shopping ,only downside was the number of homeless hanging around pestering you as you walk around

title: Enjoyed the city
reviews: Great nightlife, great city and fabulous parks. Only downside is the sheer number of beggars / mentally ill people in the streets night and day, far more than any other modern city I've been to. Really sad and depressing - Gastown in particular I was surprised at, but the problem is widespread throughout downtown! Sort it out Canada

title: Walk the seawall
reviews: Too much litter around the city streets.I'd stick to the Seawall from Pan Pacific to Stanley Park for some great views.

title: Pub crawl
reviews: Enjoyed Morrison Bar in Granville St tried a lot of Bars all good this one best. Truffles on cnr Davie & Howe also makes great coffee & muffins

title: Walk, bike or take a bus
reviews: There are plenty of options to get around and see downtown Vancouver.  Stanley Park, downtown shopping, Canada Place... Get out there and see it!

title: Downtown
reviews: Very busy, we took a hopper bus around to see the place and it was great. You can get on / off  at different spots and catch another bus later. Good way to see the place.

title: A surprising number of beggars
reviews: I was surprised to see so many people begging and sleeping in shop doorways. I had expected Canada to be better than this.  Compare to the area of "Yaletown"... which is up-bear, up-market and alive!Jc

title: I love Vancouver
reviews: Vancouver is beautiful and a great city.They have a homeless problem yes but so do many large cities.This should not deter you from a visit to Canada's best metropolis.From the great people to the scenery and views, the restaurants to the art, the transportation to the nightlife, the city has always been one of my favorites.So much to do and every visit there is something new.

title: amazing when it's sunny but pretty nice when it's not
reviews: VAncouver has a right to call itself one of the best places to live and the downtown area epitomizes why.  It has historical buildings and new ultra modern architecture.  It has a building style that works well with the west coast weather and uses many natural materials and colours.  It has a street layout that makes much use of the great green spaces and the easy access to the shores.  Lots of street art allows the local and the tourist to stop and admire the surroundings.  And then there is the food - great restaurants offering everything the world has to offer and the freshest of great seafood.  And coffee - the only place in the world that had 3 Starbucks on one intersection and still has at least one coffee shop (chain or independent) on every block - but it works.  A great core to visit.

title: Great place to live, but I wouldn't want to visit there
reviews: Honestly, I was a bit underwhelmed with Vancouver I had heard it was pricey, but it was expensive beyond expectations. Everything cost a fortune from food to drinks to attractions. The weather here is one of the best kept secrets, I think. Temp is pretty moderate year round. They get more rain and clouds than I care for, but I get the draw. Lots of beautiful parks in town, so easy to see why the locals live. Couple that with gorgeous water views all around, and it is a great place to live.

title: Surprised
reviews: We decided to explore downtown by foot when we first got to Vancouver and were surprised and saddened by the homelessness and poverty in the city. In Gastown we actually felt so intimidated that we turned 180 and walk back the way we had came (this is at around 10am). If you want to see downtown use a sightseeing bus, do not walk around on you own.

title: Canada's most beautiful city
reviews: Having covered Canada from East to West , Vancouver is the most beautiful city by far.The views with the mountains always in the background and water always nearby, beautiful Parks and a very efficient transport system make this the number one city for tourists in Canada. The only problem I had was with the large number of homeless people. They should be kept out of the downtown area

title: May 2015
reviews: So much to see and do and so little time  ;-)Wonderful place to spend time with family and friends and take in the shops, little coffee shops, the harbour and travel conveniently to other parts of the city if you like to see more. Take enough time when visiting, we have to come back and see more!!

title: Great walkable city
reviews: Close proximity to waterfront and marinas.Lots of good restaurant choices. A safe and cosmopolitan city.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: I had a free afternoon after a meeting, and went for a walk. The city is beautiful, and the waterfront is long and nice to walk. Lots of places to eat, shops, and attractions, a really nice city!

title: wonderful
reviews: great place to walk around , clean and well maintained gardens lovely shops and streets, Always friendly locals and beautiful buildings and parks

title: attention! Achtung!
reviews: Do NOT stray too far off the nice parts of downtown.  When your GPS points you to a detour around E Hastings ... FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS!   If it looks like the start of a rough area of town, turn around! ... or you will regret it...

title: What a great place. One of our favorite family vacations.
reviews: Visited with my wife and teenage son. We had a wonderful time. Great food, great city, easy to get around and plenty to see and do. Loved the hiking and the all of the activity in the city until late at night. Definitely recommend visiting.

title: Relatively Safe, Relatively Dull
reviews: I was born in Vancouver, and have lived here most of my life, so to me downtown is just downtown.  There are wonderful views if you are anywhere near the harbour, there are nice beaches (English Bay, Sunset, Second and Third Beaches), and Stanley park.  The West End, Central Business District and Yaletown are all pretty safe for a walkabout.  I would exclude from this last comment much of the area east of Carrall street (at the eastern end of Gastown).  There are also many very good restaurants.  Even with all this, I would still rate Vancouver's downtown as average in and of itself.  It lacks the excitement and variety of Manhattan, Tokyo, London or Paris; other than a few buildings such as the courthouse, the architecture is rather pedestrian.  The arts scene in Vancouver has taken several hits over the years with the closure of the Queen Elizabeth Playhouse, the disappearance of decent jazz bars in the city and I think even the Yale Hotel has closed its doors (the neon sign outside still advertises "Live Blues Nightly").So while there are many good restaurants downtown, and many good attractions in the downtown area, the idea of downtown being one of them just doesn't quite work.

title: Wow
reviews: So. Nice and clean and the folks are so friendly around here. While a big city, it feels much more home town.

title: I love Vancouver
reviews: Beautiful city, downtown has it all, great views, amazing buildings, rocking nightlife, awesome transportation, the most beautiful parks, you name it!!We usually go to the beach, all inclusive resorts, with kids is hard to always be on the go walking and exploring cities, but Vancouver is something I recommend to anyone, the transportation is second to none, the city is very clean, it has amazing views everywhere you go, and there's a ton of things to do. I have been all over Vancouver and surrounding areas, also Victoria, whistler, etc. It is all worth seeing and exploring and there's always a nice pub or a nice restaurant to finish the day with a nice meal and of course, a nice beer.Use the bus, use the skytrain, timing is perfect and so is availability and coverage of the city, you can go any and everywhere using public transportation and it is safe.

title: Great city!
reviews: We thought the downtown area was easy to walk around.  We found people to be so helpful when we needed directions or couldn't find a location.  Probably the most friendly city we have visited.  We also saw 2 different tv shows filming while walking around which our kids found interesting.  One of them was the show The Flash.

title: A Great Way to Spend a Day
reviews: I toured downtown Vancouver.  I enjoyed looking around.  The tour information was very helpful.  I enjoyed touring around the city enjoying the sights.  The city is very diverse.  There are lots of shops and restaurants for tourist.  The city is easy to navigate.  I felt safe.  I enjoyed the day.

title: Excellent shopping
reviews: We liked the variety of shops and goods we cannot buy in Australia.There are great coffee shops , bars and food takeaways.Did not like the amount of homeless people, in the streets, although they do not approach you, they are very visable.

title: Nice in Summer
reviews: When the sun is out, everyrhing is beautiful in downtown, you can see the green everywhere, you can cycle and have a drink in all side walk coffee shops while enjoying the sun.If you are a fan of cheese cake, like my wife, don't forget tree cafe in Granvile St. or Water St. You can see the amazing ocean in coal harbour, english bay and so many other places in downtown.

title: Big City but the streets rolled up before 11:00 pm
reviews: Walked to a concert on Friday night and wanted to stop for food on the way back to our hotel. We were surprised to see most restaurants had closed their doors at or before 11:00 pm. The downtown area is bustling in the daytime but surprisingly quiet on week ends.

title: Fifth in a Five Horse Race
reviews: We've been to many of the other major cities in CA and while Vancouver is nice, it takes last place for us.  It just doesn't have the architectural charm of Montreal, the variety of Toronto, the rustic charm of Calgary or the history of Quebec City.  More over, Vancouver is very liberal and they promote that in the recorded tour messages and everywhere you turn.  Ever wonder where the pan-handlers and vagrants who were run out of other CA cities ended up?  One guess.  That said there are sights to see here that are worth seeing if you're going to be here anyway.  The people who serve you in hotels and restaurants are very nice and locals will help you find your way as you walk around their town.  We stayed a couple days after our cruise - one day would have been long enough.   If you plan to take the Hop-on Hop-off bus tour - look into some other options unless you don't mind the buses running as much as 50 min. behind schedule and a minimum 30 min. behind regularly. Rent a bike at "Spokes" and tour Stanley Park, the Seawall and Ferguson Point yourself.  Eat at the Tea Room @ Ferguson Point - they will take walk-ups on the outside patio so don't be discouraged if they say they're reservations are full. We got in on Mother's Day without reservations and the patio is the better view.  Granville Island is fine - not that many great shops but if you time it right - eat an early lunch in the Market. Great variety of food options.  At the end of the day - Vancouver just isn't a front-runner.

title: A GREAT WALKING CITY
reviews: You can see most of Vancouver on foot.  We kept our car parked and were able to cover the wide variety of downtown offerings on foot.  We shopped, hit a variety of restaurants, attended a concert at the Rodgers Center and people watched.  I recommend one of the bus tours to take in Stanley Park and some of the outlying areas.

title: Vancouver's Downtown....it's alive
reviews: The one thing you can say about the Downtown is that it is happening most times of the day. why? People live there, tourist there, hang out there and visit from the burbs. there is always something going on. you have amenities for the vast  amount of people that live and work downtown but you also have the touristy and entertainment district and you have so much more. The views and the vistas, the parks and the sites. what it is not... is architecturally exciting.

title: Bike Tour in Vancouver
reviews: My wife and I were looking at hiring bikes to go around Stanley Park when we bumped into Patrick. How lucky were we? We spent time with Patrick on the most amazing bike ride around Stanley Park, Granville Island and Vancouver generally. Patrick uses battery assisted bikes which makes the travel much easier and a radio system so that you can hear his commentary as we go along the route.  Using Patrick's method you are guaranteed to see all the highlights, hear the history and stories behind many points of interest on the route. Patrick escorts 5 bikes so you are guaranteed his personal attention. This was truly time well spent and a thoroughly recommended experience.Phil & Isabel from Perth Western Australia

title: Fun place to visit
reviews: Had a great time checking out downtown by foot. We walked around on a weekday evening, and it was quite busy and energetic. We felt extremely safe and comfortable. Lots of places to walk to, eat and have a drink and kick back. City is very clean and pedestrian friendly.  It is not as much a tourists driver's city if you have not driven there before;  lots of one way streets, no left turn streets , and bus only streets, that made getting to our desired location a bit of a challenge.

title: Nothing special
reviews: Not much different than any other big city's downtown area.  Close to lots of places.  Very expensive.

title: Safe and Beautiful
reviews: I have traveled many cities are around the world and never feel safety concerns in Vancouver. Downtown offers everything a Major city does and there's something for everyone. We have hockey, football and proper football, live theatre, movies, nightclubs and restaurants of every ethnicity and budget.

title: Explore!
reviews: Always love strolling around Vancouver's streets!Just pick a direction and be surprised at what you find and where you end up!

title: Too much fun
reviews: Just go. All streets connect. easy to get around. Cannot get lost. Tons of options for foods, shopping or sitting and watching.

title: A Beautiful Green City
reviews: Vancouver is one of the world's most livable cities and I am not surprised. It is green, clean and well laid out. The bus and train services are well co-ordinated and efficient, bicycle lanes are separate from the main traffic and the walking is easy. Drivers are courteous. A lovely city to spend a couple of days.

title: Beautiful Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a beautiful venueThe Convention Center is an outstanding, modern facility with spectacular views of the harbor. But, like many other cities - a lot of street people, smoking & gay community. But, uniquely - & understandably - a large Asian population. Airport security & customs can be very slow - at least at peak periods The southerly end of Granville St is a little sleepy-kind of like the old Times Square - but seems to be harmless The town/small city is basically a nice place - with a speculator surroundings A lot of good restaurants & pubs to choose from - take advantage of the access to fresh seafood

title: Beautiful and walkable
reviews: From our hotel (the YWCA) we could easily walk to China Town, Gas Town or Downtown. Downtown Vancouver is clean and beautiful. The walkway along the harbor goes all the way to Stanley Park and beyond. Beautiful vistas of the mountains, lovely little pocket parks and a sprinkling of places to get food and drink.

title: Easy to get around
reviews: Lots of high end shops sitting close to more normal everyday shops. Plenty of bars and restaurants to choose from. Easy to navigate as its built in the block system. Walking is easy and you really can't get too lost. There are a number of people sleeping rough and begging for money, but didn't really feel threatened at any point even walking through town at night. As in any busy town I wouldn't want to walk through town at night on my own but with company I enjoyed exploring the city.

title: Amazing City!!
reviews: I love Vancouver! It's probably my most favorite city. Shopping and restaurants are amazing! The city is so clean and beautiful! People are friendly and it has a real ease to get around. I get to Vancouver whenever possible!

title: gastronomic delight
reviews: truly a melting pot of various cuisines, all within a short distance...there is always something for everyone, whether a picky eater or one with a discriminating palate.

title: Too crowded
reviews: I had no idea how large Vancouver was.  I felt overwhelmed by the buildings. Everything was tall, I guess they all wanted the best view of the harbor. It is fast passed . We toured the city on a bus but our hotel was downtown. Everything seemed squashed together. Coming from a town of wide open spaces it was hard to deal with. I suppose if you were looking for excitement and plenty to do Vancouver would be the place for you.

title: Easy to get around
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city. Very easy to walk around or take the city bus, witch is very regular and only about $9 for the day.We  walked to Gastown, Canada Place & Granville Island . There are patio for drinks or food every were. Nice just to sit and people watch.  We will be back...

title: Downtown is the best!
reviews: I ¬¥ ve visited Vancouver 2 times and I love this cityüòç   Downtown - there is a life...  Young people, shops & everything! Even people are more polite as a service in Downtown....

title: so much to see
reviews: You would need days to explore all- fantastic shopping on Robson- interesting sights and shops on Granville, museums, Stanley park, china town is great and the gas steam clock at gastown is a must see! Take the trolley tour good for 2 dyas and you can hop on and off at leisure

title: Cool City Broüëçüèª
reviews: It's like my heart starts beating to the tune of the city when I'm there. From almost anywhere downtown you can see the sea, mountains and about a dozen Starbucks. There is oodles of public transportation or if you prefer you could pay half a weeks salary to park your car. The nightlife is the best with lots of shops and restaurants open late. Check out Davie St if you get the chance. It's home of the rainbow crosswalks, and Pride Parade. Watch your back in the downtown core. Safety is key. Lock your doors and be street wise. There are a lot of people in the downtown area, chances are not all of them are as honest as you.

title: European flare
reviews: Gastown reminded me of Paris, France in a small way. It's a place where you'd want to sit at a cafe with friends and just talk.

title: downtown
reviews: I spent a lot of time walking around downtown Vancouver during my stay. There is amazing shopping, and of course the waterfront nearby. It's great exercise, I felt perfectly safe walking alone, and there are wonderful restaurants and coffee shops everywhere. One of my favorite places to visit.

title: A Beautiful Place to Live
reviews: Vancouver is a great city, on of the most beautiful that I have seen, and I have seen many. I first visited about 14 years ago, and returned this year in March.  I thought that it was impressive then, in fact my wife and I briefly entertained the thought of moving there.  Upon our return, I was even more impressed.  The downtown area, surrounded on three sides by water: False Creek, English Bay, Coal Harbor and Burrard Inlet, offers so many marvelous vistas.  Yaletown offers trendy restaurants, as well as the park areas along Marinaside Crescent and Pacific Boulevard.  Gastown offers more restaurants and cafes, entertainment venues, and galleries.  West End offers parks and beaches along English Bay, and more restaurants, cafes and entertainment.  Then there's the Canada Place area with marvelous modern skyscrapers, and the Coal Harbor Seawalk, and the incomparable Stanley Park.Unfortunately, it's expensive.

title: Clean-
reviews: We loved Vancouver. Spent a lot of time walking around and we were all so impressed with how clean the streets were compared to Seattle which is near where we live. No comparison at all. People were all so friendly and helpful. Ton's of great restaurants plus a lot things to see and do. We really love downtown Vancouver and can't wait to come back for another visit!

title: So many coffee shops!
reviews: Lots of variety in coffee shops, not too many good restaurants, far too many homeless people. Shame on Vancouver.

title: A Stunning Waterfront View in Vancouver Downtown
reviews: With the lovely weather, we do enjoy pretty much for the waterfront view where there are seaplanes docked at the inner habor and the signature design nearby, especially the Canada Place and the Five Sails Hotel.

title: Wonderful 'flight' over Canada
reviews: We visited this 'ride' with friends and their young children and it was fantastic!   You are strapped into your seat in a pod of about 6 people and taken for a virtual flight (Imax) where you experience swooping down over Niagara, gliding over the plains, over the Rockies and lots of other beautiful places.  You feel the wind in your hair and the spray on your face, without actually getting wet or travelling. A brilliant experience for everyone, except perhaps those with a really serious (and completely unfounded in this case) fear or flying. cannot recommend it highly enough. Quite expensive, but worth it for such a special visit. NB it is not a real ride.

title: Perfect way to spend a few hours or all day
reviews: The park and the surroundings really help you enjoy just walking around, taking a jog or a bike ride.  The park is definitely worth the time to explore an denjoy

title: Well organized city
reviews: Vancouver is awesome. Just not think it deserves 5 star because it need more public transportation: buses and underground. And night buses option are too low, such city should have more options. Besides that, Vancouver is amazing. Great energy and you feel like countryside when people just look at you and say good morning, without knowing you. Awesome!

title: Gorgeous city and well worth a visit
reviews: Loved this city and really was surprised.Quite a bit to do and the restaurants were spot on perfect . Loved going to china town and literally we ate our way from one end to another trying every Chinese bakery we could find (there are tons)

title: So awesome to explore on foot
reviews: It's bound mostly by ocean and Main St which is about as Far East as you want to go and where china town kind of ends. So many great areas. Don't miss gas town but get off water street. Lots of homeless people but it's safe. I love Yaletown and the Asian part of Robson west of Jarvis. So many great places to eat too.

title: Beautiful City!
reviews: We loved downtown Vancouver. Everywhere is within walking distance. There in spring time and I have never seen such big blossom flowers on the trees. So many wonderful places to eat, the food was excellent every time at the different restaurants and caf√©s we dined at, not once disappointed. Wonderful walking all around the city and waterfront. And I had a great time shopping. My only down comment would be the amount of homeless people in the downtown area. They weren't threatening in any way but it was quite heartbreaking.

title: good walking
reviews: It is a great walking place. Look for the art nervous and art deco facades interspersed with modern boringly. Pop into the. hsbc building to see the enormous pendulum.

title: I love Vancouver
reviews: We had hours of walking, driving, and shopping Downtown.The tall houses amaze me, and they are, beside the high mountains with snow on, the beautiful skyline of Vancouver. We visited Stanley park, and the Aquarium (but this was closed from Saturday 17:00).Two times to Cinema, and a snack afterwards in Cactus Club Cafe.Another time a little meal in Cinema Pub. All good.Sunday traffic was a chaos, one hour to get from Stanley Park and out of town because of the SUN RUN. The main street was closed! And we had a plane to catch, oh, but made it.

title: Vancouver: Beautiful, Clean, Safe, GORGEOUS
reviews: I recently visited Vancouver for business and I'm so glad I was able to get acquainted with the city. If only I had more time! I stayed downtown at the Sheraton (which was lovely) that allowed me to run down by the water, explore Stanley Park (AMAZING if you want a beautiful city view), and discover the streets of Vancouver. I couldn't get over how culturally diverse the city was which was so refreshing coming from Boston!  Everyone seemed to keep to themselves (or so it seemed) and the city overall seemed rather laid back--nothing like NYC or LA by any means. The weather could have been better--it was a bit overcast and dreary but I hear it's like that during the "winter months." Meanwhile, the summers are supposed to be beautiful and something I am definitely putting on my bucket list to go back.

title: Lots and lots to do.
reviews: WE spent a week in Vancouver on two separate occasions and were never want for something to do or another restaurant to explore. Best of all-the locals are among the friendliest urban dwellers I have ever met. Quick to offer assistance and easy to get along with.

title: I live here and I love going downtown!
reviews: Vancouver has something for everyone, food shopping, nightlife you name it. Egnore the reviews about Hastings st. yes it's all homeless crackheads but just don't go there and you'd never know it existed.There's homeless in every city, I just got back from San Fran and saw a ton but it wouldn't deter me from going back there.  Head to Robson St for shopping, Davie St for the gay experience, English Bay to lounge on the beach, Stanley Park for the insane views of the north shore mountains. It has hotels for every budget, food for every budget you can't go wrong here! I love my city!

title: Safe fun place to walk around especially near Robson Street
reviews: On a sunny day great to watch people and see the action - some of the STREET PEOPLE are a downer and that happens in many cities

title: Like Most Other Big Cities
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is interesting. Lots of shops, lots of people, and a TON of homeless and beggars. Parking, like most big cities, is either paid, or if you're lucky you might get street parking. Easy walking, but some hills. It's pretty windy between the buildings, but it feels nice when you're out and about. Lots of places for food, and snacks while you're shopping.

title: Robust Area
reviews: There are a variety of restaurants and shops.  I enjoyed the outdoor attractions.  It was Easter weekend so there was a lot going on. The Pacific Center is a bustling place.  There are several places to eat in the Center.  I found the souvenir shop on Seymour Street near Dunsmuir St., to be very nice, offering a variety of souvenirs at reasonable prices.  I do not recommend the Flaming Wok as I found the cashier to be dishonest. I didn't have the exact amount to pay for a meal I purchased with American Dollars, the cashier would not return change due me or give me a receipt stating rudely "No change, we aren't a bank".   I shopped and ate at several places during my stay and didn't have any problems, if my purchase for example was $8 and I paid with a US $10 bill everyone returned my change in CND currency.  I can only imagine how much this woman has gained, cheating people out of their money. I would not have bought food from her if I had known. At the very least she should post a sign and let others know she doesn't return change if paid in US dollars and others like myself won't buy from her.  It was my 1st and last visit to Flaming Wok, what a horrible way to treat a patron.

title: A very walkable and friendly downtown community
reviews: We were able to walk the entire area.  I should quality this by saying, my husband and I are avid walkers and it is our preferred means of getting to know a new city.  It is such an interesting dicotomy with new modern buildings adjacent to older more historic areas.  To add further, there is an almost jarring drop off to the more improvished areas of the city (near China town as well).  Trust me, you will know it when you see it and smell it.  Excellent little bars that are serious about what they do. Non-Alcohol involved entertainment was tough for us to come by on our visit would be the only downside.

title: Spring in(to) Vancouver
reviews: I spent five fabulous days in Vancouver this April, and am looking forward to the next trip.  This was my first time to the city and I was not disappointed.  I love hearing so many different languages on the street.  I dig the diversity.  People were also so friendly and loquacious.  It is such a gift to be in a city and have people be present and engaging.  I took the metro into to downtown from the airport, and that was easy, affordable, and comfortable.  From my hotel, I walked everywhere.  There are so many terrific cafes, restaurants, clubs, and and shops in Vancouver.  The waterfront is gorgeous, and I dig the combination of modern and traditional architecture.  What a great city!

title: Wonderful city
reviews: What a wonderful city Vancouver is. It seems to offer everything from mountains to the sea, all easy to get to with public transport, free shuttle buses, the ferries or the sky train. All forms of public transport seem to be cheap in my opinion and take you right to where you want to go. As for the main downtown district everything is within walking distance and you can easily follow the roads as it it is set out in a grid system, like most North American cities. The shops are a great mix offering something for everyone, with those selling souvenirs dotted about. What I enjoyed about these is that the wares seemed varied depending on which shop you ventured into. There are also clothes shops, supermarkets and the sort of every day shops you would expect. Robson street is good for shops. Food is abundant with restaurants and take aways, coffee shops and pubs. For those on a budget some of the take away places towards the BC stadium offer some excellent deals. Granville Island is a great place for food as well as its bustling market.The city is clean and the people pleasant. There are a few homeless people around but they are no trouble. As a solo female traveller, I felt safe walking around the city even at night as everything was well lit and I was never far from a hotel or coffee place that was open should I have felt unsafe. Definitely one of the best cities I have visited.

title: Filthy, dirty, depressing - I will never go back!
reviews: This was my first trip to Vancouver.  I have been to every province in Canada except BC so I was excited to finally see this province I have heard so much about.  All was going well until we arrived in Vancouver.  Unfortunately our GPS took us to our hotel via Hastings Street.  I have never seen such abject poverty, despair, filth and degrading areas like this in my life and literally hundreds of people living on the streets there.  I felt like I was in a third world country and prayed to get through the area as quickly as possible.  For a city with such wealth and some of the highest house prices in Canada surely there is a better way to help your less fortunate citizens other than confining them to one street!!  Shame!!

title: Walk down Robson and Granville
reviews: What a wonderful way to spend the day on a bright and sunny Birthday afternoon and evening. Fun to just people watch and stoll through the stores.

title: Everything in a walking distance
reviews: Loved that everything you need is within a walking distance or a short cost effective taxi ride away. From shawarma to sushi, to cheap good food (The Famous Warehouse), shopping on Robson to a great concert at Roger's Arena, then beers at Doolin's Irish Pub.

title: get your city life fix in a european setting
reviews: Vancouver is alive 24/7 with diverse dwellers walking everywhere.  It's refreshing to see a few friends having a beer in the middle of the day, enjoying people watching.  Food is consistently good whereever you go and the prices are very achievable.

title: Beautiful
reviews: Excellent area to walk around in, check out the local stores and get some shopping done. Highly recommended.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Love this city! One of the most beautiful in the world. We'll be back - all the way from Australia. Our first time here and there is SO MUCH to do - from the mountains to the sea!

title: So different stores
reviews: Not only were the stores awesome....coming from Africa were so different.....the steam driven clock is a must to see also.....

title: Every month it gets more beautiful
reviews: When I think back to my first few years in Vancouver (back in the 70s) and compare it to today's city, it's nothing short of phenomenal how it's developed.The waterfront is so beautiful it takes your breath away every time you walk along the seawall, with all sorts of restaurants and bars to take advantage of the views.And they ain't expensive either, most offer top quality food and drinks with exceptionally friendly service.From May onwards there's the added grandeur of a magnificent cruise ship or two lying quayside.Stroll up to Robson street and get a handle on the pulse and the fashions and you'll see a more awesome parade of beautiful women than in any other city in the world. We have the world's best looking girls without a doubt.As if that's not enough, you can walk right to the bottom of Robson Street to Denman Street , left to  English Bay, and be treated to a different vista of the open ocean, multiple cargo ships lying at anchor and an incredible beach with the mountains of Vancouver Island as a backdrop.All of this in a safe , clean environment with a healthily integrated population. There's no wonder that real estate in this city is in so much demand. No warplanes flying overhead, no race riots, outdoor leisure activities all year round and  fantastic social infrastructure . If you die and wake up in heaven, you won't notice the difference.

title: The only downside is the beggars
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is cool. It's fun. There are amazing restaurants. It is surrounded by water and the skyscrapers are mostly glass so light is reflected everywhere.The only downside is the number of beggars. There must be no desire in Canada to support these people and keep them off the street. I don't understand why the problem is so bad.

title: Great place to hoiliday and enjoy
reviews: Great place to base yourself and you can walk throughout the area and easy to get to Canada place. great shopping and some good food in the area.

title: Robson Street
reviews: A great selection of top quality stores to shop till you drop and they open until 10pm. Perfect finish to a scenic tour of the city.

title: Fantastic City
reviews: So big but so compact, walk everywhere or take advantage of the public transit system, inexpensive and good. Don't drive around, parking at a premium and expensive. Loads of different eateries and shopping experiences.

title: Great downtown
reviews: i have been to most downtowns in North America and this by far is the prettiest downtown I have seen in North America. I love all the glass skyscrapers and the pretty mountain in the distance.

title: If you love beautiful buildings take you camera
reviews: I love buildings and beautiful cities, Vancouver is definitely beautiful and she has some amazing buildings to see. There is a fantastic mix of new and old, lovely churches and breathtaking city views. I loved Vancouver, we walked the city every day and always found something beautiful, you will not be disappointed!

title: ease of travel
reviews: so clean and easy to get around. full day bus pass is a smart move for ease of getting around.  loved it. great shopping and sights to see

title: Warm & Friendly City
reviews: Everywhere is easy to walk to.  We rode the Tourist Trolley Bus to get our bearings first and to see all of the sights, you can hop on and off where ever.  There are lots of nice restaurants and bars to choose from. If you are holding a map on the pavement, someone will ask if they can help you, Vancouverites are so helpful.  The city is clean and safe.  The waterfronts and parks are beautifully maintained and the spring flowers are a delight.

title: A very walkable city with great shopping and resturants.
reviews: My wife just spent two days in downtown Vancouver. We walked everywhere. This is such an easy city to get around, with safe convenent sidewalks. The shopping is amazing. I don't think we've seen so much variety in selection and price. Definitely worth the trip!

title: Nothing Spectacular
reviews: Vancouver may be one of the world's most livable cities, but its downtown area was not the reason why. It's dirty, congested, and noisy, which is expected for any downtown area, but there really isn't anything to do here for tourists. If you like shopping, go to Robson Street, and for gorgeous views, walk to the eastern end of town along W. Cordova St. to enjoy beautiful panoramics of the water draped by mountains. For a true Vancouver experience, spend your time in Stanley Park, Granville Island, or in the mountains instead of downtown; you won't regret it.

title: Beautiful.
reviews: Vancouver is a big city with a small city feel.  Despite its weather, it is a beautiful waterfront city.  A must city to visit when you're on the coast.

title: Easy to walk around clean and safe
reviews: We love walkable downtown Vancouver - very clean and safe - one the the warmest cities in Canada in winter (very rarely any snow). Shopping wonderful and streets well signed.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: We stayed in the heart of downtown Vancouver. So we were able to walk every where. Every one we spoke to for directions were so happy to help. Lots of shops and places to have a bite to eat

title: love the downtown area
reviews: I really enjoyed my experience downtown, there is so much to do and many options for dining.  Its well worth taking the time to walk a good portion of the downtown, use the public transportation and head off to the park as well!

title: Huge downtown
reviews: Very impressive buildings, new and old. Clean city. Easy access to most places. Great walking city too. Lots of restaurant choices. Lots of landmarks.

title: Come and be amazed!
reviews: Vancouver is one of the GREATEST cities anywhere in the world. It has everything.Come and be amazed. You won't be disappointed.

title: My favourite city
reviews: The best city in the world. From climate,to beauty,to parks and nature,to the CBD and the concrete jungle.Not to mention wonderful people and food!!

title: Perfect place
reviews: This is a perfect place if you're between the ages of 19 + legal age to drink is 19! Granville St is entertainment district lots of bars and clubs, Robson St has a lot of shopping,...the entire Vancouver area has a lot of great restaurants and shopping...

title: Something for Everyone
reviews: Want a boulangerie like you are in downtown Paris? How about Malyasian food? Ferragamo shoes? Banana Republic? Well downtown Vancouver BC has it all!

title: Be Careful-Your Wife Will Go Wild
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has it all. It is clean, modern, a shoppers paradise, and all the great food you'll ever want. The Cherry Blossoms just top it all off.

title: Shopping
reviews: I liked the shopping experience and the in- store customer service staff were helpful and curtiious. Some areas in the the down town needed cleaning and a lot of people were making an attempt to clean the worst areas.

title: great city
reviews: Love this city, planning on moving there asap.  I think it is one of the most beautiful cities I've visited.  Nice public transport, and everything is there, shops, restaurants, nightlife, entertainment.

title: Lots to see
reviews: Really enjoyed our stay down here.  We walked to everything as we had good weather and just enjoyed the scenery.  Walking along the waterfront is so enjoyable too!

title: Granville street run down.
reviews: Stay on Robson or Georgia street.  Some good shops actually inside hotels.  Service people were very helpful.

title: My favourite city in Canada (2nd Ottawa)
reviews: A vibrant city along the ocean - surrounded by mountains.  Lots of restaurant and accommodation choices from budget to luxury.  Public transit is available with SkyTrains, buses and taxi's.  Very active - outdoor city.  Be sure to pick up a Vancouver Entertainment book for discount coupons on all the local attractions.

title: Turn a corner and see the mountains or ocean
reviews: On a clear day, nothing beats the Vancouver skyline with north shore mountain views or ocean/water on many sides.  On a rainy day, its great to see the big trees and remember you are in a rainforest.Be sure to walk along the water's edge either in Stanley Park or False Creek.  You will see scullers on the water, runners, walkers, skaters of all shapes and sizes.  Vancouverites like to be outdoors.Vancouverites don't roll out to the suburbs at night because there is a large residential section in the downtown core.

title: Lively city center and plenty of shopping
reviews: Great place to shop and eat, little in the way of historical places to visit but a trip the the harbour and park areas does not disappoint.

title: Vancouver Downtown 10 block square around geanville and davis
reviews: The area is being gentrified but still.has elements of drug and homeless culture that was the area. Near Davis there are upteen all night quality restaurants like Dennys. During regular business hours there are many excellent restaurants and stores. The transit system starts early and goes late with many frequently nuses and streetcars including express to places like Harbourfront where ferries to Namaimo can be taken. Again near Davies there is a replacement of the substance abusing poor element by the more affluent clubbers which some people see as another type of degenerate. However I found that at early or very late hours it was safe along the well lit streets if you didn't dawdle.

title: Vibrant Community, Great Food
reviews: I love downtown Vancouver with its many shops, restaurants, and attractions. With a large population of residents living in the downtown core, there's always something happening at any time of day. Check out the Vanvouver Art a Gallery or take a walk on the sea wall, or just experience the local flavor of areas from Robson Street to Yaletown to Gastown. Parking can be difficult and also expensive so consider leaving your vehicle at home and taking transit.

title: Two halves
reviews: Downtown is a great place to visit, it's literally got two halves, in one half is all the designer shops and up market restaurants etc.. And then the other half, which is equally nice and well equipped, but you will get harangued by beggars which is the only downside to Vancouver. I loved Downtown, the place is clean, tidy, wide range of shops, bars, history.  Spent hours wandering around. Great.

title: One of the greatest cities to visit
reviews: Great city, great views, restaurant, shopping, transportation, buildings, activities,hotels, parks, what ever you desire on a vacation this city can deliver and if it can't then a bus tour  eg West Coast Sightseeing that picks you up at your hotel from the city can deliver it for you( no snow take a bus tour to Whistler mountain stop on the way to see Shannon falls etc). Hop on hop off tours around the city is also a must .

title: This place is No Funcouver or Boreville, BC
reviews: For a city centre there really isn't much there, there is no buzz like you get in Toronto and there is a constant feeling of something lacking. Vancouver without the sea and mountains might as well be any city centre in the prairies from Winnipeg to Saskatoon. It's boring, no funcouver

title: city of vancouver
reviews: A great city to be,you have mountain & water ,multinbilingual speaking people,everyone blends no matter who you are,safe,politeness can see all over the city.spring is beautiful seeing all the cherry blossom on the street all over & all the spring flowers start to bloom too,but sometime you can get sonstant rain & someday cloudy nor sunny spring,summer is great  not too hot just perfect.The falls is stunning seeing the leafs turn to a diff. colour..

title: shopping a must
