reviews: this city has everything!!!   Walking or on the hop on hop off bus...  tourist centre so helpful..  went to my first ice hockey game and was blown away....

title: The Village
reviews: It's been a few years since we were called a Village, but in many ways the downtown area really is small compared to cities like, New York, Shanghai, Hong Kong, or Los Angeles. You can get around Vancouver very easy on foot if your a walker/ or relatively fit person. With the city being wrapped in water on 3 sides, it's limited to growth in the downtown. Other than a small portion of China Town near Main and late nights on the Eastside of Gaston, the city is very safe and usually really clean. There is lots of construction currently under way so traffic is re routed and expect delays Monday to Friday for the next couple years at least. The major transit network of Skytrains, (subway) works well and is helpful especially if your going to and from the airport, Richmond, or towards New Westminister. There is also a great flight option via se planes from the convention centre area if your extending a stay over to Victoria. The flights on clear days would offer outstanding views of the Gulf Islands. When there is nice weather forecast I know of no other city in the world that offers so much beauty.

title: Mix of different neighbourhoods
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful place and the downtown area is certainly worth visiting. The different neighbourhoods offer different experiences, for example some areas are quite dirty and have a lot of homeless (Granville, Main St.). The other areas are pristine, Yaletown, Coal Harbour and the West End near English Bay are all wonderful places to visit.I suggest starting in Gastown and then circling round in an anti-clockwise fashion, going to Coal Harbour, Cycling the Sea Wall, having lunch at the Cactus Club at English Bay. After Lunch you could head over to Granville Island and explore it's many shops and stalls. Then explore the south sea wall and end the day in Yaletown.

title: Cool vibe!
reviews: Head over to Granville and take it all in. Yaletown is very cool too. Just walk, you will find something to investigate!

title: Lovely!
reviews: Vancouver is an extremely beautiful city to visit. Now, keep in mind that it does rain or drizzle lots, so be prepared to encounter this during your visit.  But on a sunny day, it is absolutely beautiful!! From the scenic Mountains, to the Pacific Ocean, to the Downtown core, just an overall great city to visit.

title: Cosy and vibrant
reviews: If you ever get to Vancouver, stroll Stanley park and Gas Town. This is truely and vibrant and interesting town, which in despite of it's size is remarable low paced even in the very centre.

title: Beautiful Spring
reviews: Lots of things to do and easy to walk to in all directions. Good restaurants and a great variety of restaurants too.

title: Walked at night & felt very safe
reviews: Shops were open at7 on Sat night on Robson St.  Lots of shoppers and a visible police presence.  Felt very safe.

title: Great city area
reviews: Nice architecture mix of old and new. Old town Gaston is great.The pub Mahoney & Sons at the waterfront is excellent and great water and west Vancouver views. Forget Chinatown area, overrun with homeless practically taking over the whole sidewalks

title: Worlds Model City
reviews: Beautiful and clean downtown. Friendly people. This is the first downtown we never had to take a taxi to go to places where we wanted to go. In Dubai where we spent most of our time this alone is unthinkable and it take ever to reach places in the traffic.

title: So Much To Do
reviews: What can I say, downtown Vancouver has just about everything to please everyone, so much to do from nightlife to shopping to events, just a great place to spend some time

title: Vancouver....one of my favorite cities!
reviews: I have to admit, I get a feeling when I visit a new place and Vancouver gave me that welcoming hometown feel.  The people were so friendly and the city was easy to navigate.  Coffee is easy to find....a coffee house on every corner...no lie!  I love love love Vancouver.  Love it so much, I could really live there.

title: Great walking town
reviews: Definitely bring your walking shoes! We walked an average of 10km a day.  The city felt safe and was easy to navigate with tonnes of stuff to see and do locally. Great variety of restaurants for all budgets and don't miss the Japadog food trucks - the shrimp dog was very good.  There are about 1 million Starbucks (fine for me as I love them) but very few Tim Hortons (no loss).

title: Very Walkable
reviews: Vancouver seems to be a very walkable city.  The downtown area includes a great shopping strip on Robson Street.  There are tons of hotels, restaurants, etc.  The transit system seems to be good for getting to other parts of the city.  My biggest complaint was that the high rise buildings block the sun!

title: I loved living in downtown Vancouver
reviews: I recently moved out of Vancouver after living there for 20 years. Many people ask why, assuming I will answer with stories of busy traffic, noisy neighborhoods or expensive housing. I am sure those things may exist but not for me. I only left for new adventures. Vancouver is a walkable city with moderate weather, friendly people and fantastic restaurants. It can be as affordable or expensive as you want it to be. If I return to Canada to live, this is the city for me.

title: disssapointed
reviews: I was raised in Vancouver and loved the city and was very sad to see what has become of Vancouver. The sky line has changed immensely to the point that while downtown is now super windy and dark. What is worse though is how dirty the streets are. Over the last year we have been in many cities across the US, Canada and France, Vancouver was the dirtiest by a large amount. Vancouverites need to unit and get the work done to get their city back to being the pretty, safe and clean place it used to be.

title: LOVE Vancouver!
reviews: I'm from Texas so am hard pressed to be totally wowed but I adore Vancouver! Fresh food everywhere, walking or biking to everything! So much culture plus the movie industry(which I also love) films any & everywhere possible! Pick a tv series & most likely they film in Vancouver!

title: Complete & Quiet Library
reviews: It is in the heart of downtown. Walking distance to most of downtown. Complete Section for New books, Newest DVD and Blue rays, from Religion to Psychology to Arts & History etc. The staff are very courteous and helpful. It opens late. Lots of Computers.

title: One of the best cities in the world
reviews: I was born in British Columbia, in the Lower Mainland, where Vancouver is situated. I moved to the downtown Vancouver area almost 3 years ago (in the West End). It is so magnificent, with English Bay 6 minutes away, Stanley Park 8 minutes, the Seawall 6 mins., and hiking on Grouse Mountain a short 15 minutes away.On top of that, it is very easy to walk everywhere, I sold my car because of that. Bicycles are everywhere with dedicated bike lanes. the climate is moderately cool in the winter, and because of the ocean, it stays below 25 Celsius most of the summer.There is so much to do and experience here! Come for a visit, you'll love it.

title: Vancouver -A City that must be seen!
reviews: Vancouver is my home town!And what a beautiful city to have grown up in!We have our majestic mountains,water all around us,Stanley Park in the middle of our City- breathtaking.You can take a stroll through Gastown, where our visitors always love to see the Gastown Steam Clock and take a walk or an On and Off bus to see all the wonderful restaurants ( Seafood,Sushi,Italian-Steak Houses-Irish Bars-etc)along the seawall in Coal Harbour and thru downtown.You can go skiing in Whistler,You can go sailing on English Bay,Cycle through Stanley Park,run along the seawall.There is so much to do and see in Vancouver that you will be impressed and will always want to return!

title: Vancouver is one of the three most beautiful cities in the world
reviews: It has some of the best restaurants in the world.  It contains the highly acclaimed Stanley Park with a seawall for walkers and bikers going around it. It has three mountains over looking it. The best climate in Canada.  Where you can go skiing and sailing on the same day. It contains Gas Town, Yale Town and China Town. Vancouver is a tourist delight.

title: Entertainment, shopping and good food.
reviews: Lots of shopping choices on Robson street, Granville street and Pacific Centre mall.  Great place to people watch sitting at a coffee shop or on the stairs at Vancouver Art Gallery.  Feel like a movie hop over to Scotiabank theatre on Burrard Street.  In the summer there are also lots of food carts scattered all over the area.  Great place to spend the day.  Beware parking can be expensive.  But the area is easily accessible by public transportation.

title: Where Modernity and Nature come togeather
reviews: You should not miss visiting Vancouver Downtown when have a trip to Metro Vancouver (Greater Vancouver), BC. You will enjoy walking in Georgia street as one of the modern street in North America with pictureasque skyscrapers. Few meters bellow Georgia, you will find in Robson street, a commercial place of Vancouver that you may find everything you looking for from Digital to Fashion. Famous Granville street is steps away from Robson and Georgia. Enjoy Kid's Market in Granville Island if you travel with your child(ren).The biggest hub for public transport of Metro Vancouver is here, Waterfront Station. Skytrain (Expo & Millennium & Canada Lines) start from Waterfront Station at this area. Seabus is convenient and fantastic ferries to reach North Vancouver when you get off Skytrain. Or you may get in West Coast at weekdays to reach Mission City, Port Haney,... at the east of Metro Vancouver. Checkout www.translink.ca for more information.Burrad inlet, Vancouver Harbor, English Bay, Sunset Beach and many other fabulous sea side of Vancouver located in Downtown. You will enjoy take off and landing propeller airplanes in Vancouver Harbor or watch huge ships move towards shipyards. Sitting on a bench beside Vancouver Convention Center or Canada Place and enjoy beautiful sky, green north mountains, blue water and birds flying over it. Weather sunny or rainy day, you will enjoy them.Now you are hungry, International fast foods, restaurant and coffee shops are very close to you where ever you are.Looking for Hotels, available for any budget and luxury. Just search in Tripadvisor.ca  Have a nice trip.

title: Great place to spend the day
reviews: There are lots to see in downtown Vancouver. You'll find Pacific Centre, Granville Street, and Robson Street being the primary locations for shopping. Lots of restaurants, bars, pubs, and easy walking distance to places like Stanley Park, Waterfront, Yaletown, Gastown, Rogers Arena and BC Place. Lots of activities in the summer with street performers, parades, and festivals galore.Downtown is best seen on foot. Traffic can be a nightmare on certain days. Hop on the skytrain - Yaletown, Burrard, Granville & Waterfront stations will take you right there.

title: Lots of things to see & do!!!!
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city, with sea on 2 sides, mountains and a gem of a Park in the middle. It's a remarkably safe city where you can pretty much walk anywhere although late night strolls should be in busy areas like Granville Street, Davie Street or Robson Street.  Lots of different cultures and everyone tends to get along, only complaining about the rain (better than snow).

title: Too many homeless people nice city when the weather is nice
reviews: Vancouver city more for rich people better in the summer winter is gross rains to much and lots of begers

title: Walking through Vancouver.
reviews: Vancouver City, Yale Town, Gas town, Robson Street is a pleasure to walk. At 12 o'clock at night, the city is always full of people,  your only concern is being approached by a hooker.

title: Absorbing visit
reviews: If you are a fan of the Natural History Museum, London you will love the Museum of Anthropology. Plenty to see with exhibits both inside and out when we visited some time ago. Our interest in first people's history and spirituality was enhanced greatly to the point of buying books to feed our new found interest. The exhibits were put into as natural a setting as possible with the sounds and smells of village life making for an interesting and stimulating experience. Highly recommended.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: I love Downtown Vancouver, yes, it as it's homeless like most cities but it as so much more, the convenience of everything within walking distance; skytrain, Seawall, Stanley Park, restaurants, shopping, theatre's, harbour cruises, sea airplanes, museums and the awesome Granville island.

title: WORLD CLASS RESTAURANTS
reviews: I now live in Los Angeles but was born and raised in Vancouver BC.You can't really go wrong in Vancouver when you go out to eat as the restaurants there are truly world class. Los Angelese' would posthumously disagree. Vancouver BC? Better than LA? Yes, and by a long shot. First of all let's look at the advertising for the LA eateries. Hollywood! Really? Kids in there 20's going to these fancy restaurants to eat and the press giving the food 4 and 5 stars because the stars say so. These celebrities would give 5 stars to Taco Bell. Please people, if you are interested in tasting the latest in food and drinks, Vancouver is the place. Chinese, Japanese, and Italian are among the best  and LA does not even come close. I went to Mr Chow's in Beverly Hills. It ranked down there with some chinese restaurants that are getting 2 stars in Vancouver and this is ranked 5 in Los Angeles. Eat drink and be merry in Vancouver, but go in the summer because it rains the rest of the time.

title: Great Place to Live
reviews: We live in Yaletown.  Most days a car is not needed.  Dining from dinner for two for under ten dollars to very upscale restaurants where the Hollywood stars dine when they are in town.  Entertainment: movies, hockey, football etc. is just blocks away.  For walkers, hikers and bikers there is the seawall that is a great place to be no matter what the weather.  Even China town and Gastown are within walking distance if you live in Downtown Vancouver.  When ever we have relatives or friends in from out of town they always remark on the life that Downtown has 24 hours a day.

title: Where people with more money than sense shop
reviews: Well, we walked from Hornby up & back & the only shop which offered something different was Sephora where we found some Japanese cosmetic preparations which we had been looking for since using them in an Onsen near Hakone. Also, in store ATMs only seem to offer a max of $200 for overseas cards.

title: shopping
reviews: very easy to get around - flat streets - lots of fascinating boutique shops and great bakeries with delicious coffee.

title: Not what it's cracked up to be
reviews: Rather dirty with large drug and homeless problem. It's the typical example of life after the Olympics for most cities - fix it up for the games and then all goes dark and empty after the fact

title: The Jewel of the Wetcoast
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has it all, it's walkable, has great urban spaces like Robson St. The waterfront on two sides, great restuarants (try Carderos or go to China town), see the steam clock in Gastown,  turn in almost any direction and fire a rock and you will hit a coffee shop.  Take a trip on the sea bus,  or just wander around go to the Art Gallery and see the Emily Carr exhibit.  There is so much to do.  Live it, love it experience it.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: It's a beautiful city to show to anyone. You can go to Stanley Park, walk the sea wall, have lunch at Gastown, grab a coffee and watch the small planes landing  in Coal  Harbour.  From downtown you can take a bus to Granville Island and wander through the public market, check out the art galleries and many stores.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: I love our downtown. the shopping on Robson, pacific center, the art gallery all the lovely restaurants and bars,,, gastown.. perfect city in my mind~

title: Well well well
reviews: I love Vancouver . but the only and I mean only thing bad I have to say about the city that I call home is that there is way too many bums. Sorry Vancouver someome had to say it :(

title: Recommend as a base for visit
reviews: Shopping, food, attractions, transportation, all are within reach in down town Vancouver. Stanley Park, North Shore and Granville Island are just a decent walk or bus/ferry ride away with plenty of routes to chose from. Managed to spend around a day doing some shopping and investigating downtown in between trips to other areas of the city.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: I have been working in downtown Vancouver for the past 18 years.  I still enjoy going there every day.  Parking is expensive in downtown, and there are lots of buses, skytrain to take you there right in downtown.  My office is near Waterfront, at lunch, I often walk along the sea front, Canada Place-lot of activities there including Flying Over Canada' which I have experienced twice, Jack Poole Plaza-the fire torches of the 2000 Olympic, Western Bay shore and Stanley Park.  You will see sea planes taking off to various places along the way, against the back drop of North and West Vancouver, beautiful view of sea, sky and mountain  From Waterfront station, you can also walk to the steam clock in Gas Town.  It takes less than 10 minutes.  Also nearby is Pacific Mall which has lots of fashion and higher ends retailers for shopping. There are lots of restaurants and coffee places if you are hungry.  The Gelateria at Hotel Vancouver Pacific Rim is becoming a tourist spot, though I have tried a few times, for $6.50 an ice-cream cone is too pricy, and am too impatience to wait on the long-lined up. Downtown is especially pretty in Spring time, around March to May, where lots of spring flowers, and blossom trees are in their full glory.

title: Shopping, Food, Waterfront
reviews: I enjoy going to downtown Vancouver.  We don't get there often but anytime of year it is an enjoyable experience.  It offers a large array of things to do from morning to night.  Many wonderful cafes, pubs and restaurants.  The shopping is excellent.  It is easy to get over to Stanley park with only a short walk from downtown or to ride a water taxi to Granville Island to get away from the busy downtown core or hussle and bustle.  My favorite is to walk to Gastown and watch listen to the steam clock and have lunch in a quiant eatery.

title: So much to do and so much to see!
reviews: What impressed me most about Vancouver's downtown area was that so much of it was easily walkable and so much of it was right by the water with incredible views.   As we were staying at the Fairmont Vancouver, which is right in the heart of Vancouver's downtown area, this made exploring the city and the whole of downtown so much easier.   I took off and walked in all directions and was never disappointed whichever direction I took.  Lovely to be able to see all the boats and yachts on the water and yet still to be in the heart of the downtown area of Vancouver!   I do hope to return very soon to continue my explorations of the city.   What a lovely city!

title: A great place to walk around
reviews: I've always enjoyed going downtown. If you like to walk it's an easy city to get around. You can easily go from the waterfront, to shopping, to great restaurants, Stanley Park, the art gallery etc..Parking can be a challenge and also be expensive. So transit is the best choice if that works for you.

title: Shopping, restaurant, beaches and so close to the mountains
reviews: With great restaurants, seawall, beaches and shopping Vancouver is beautifully situated.  All major entertainment and sports facilities are within walking distance and separated bike paths make cycling a pleasure. Of course it has Stanley Park as well with its Aquarium and forest.

title: the roxy
reviews: webt ti see a warmup band Servo - outstanding. the bar itself is ok - don't have coofee or caesars - didn't eat the food.  Drink specials are an ok price but otherwize booze is expensive or I'm old or both.

title: Vancouver Vacation
reviews: Beautiful and FUN city.  It was very easy to get around.  Lots of shopping and things to do, museums, walk along the seawall, and great restaurants and people.

title: Journey to most part of Canada
reviews: Businesses are everywhere that one can past time while walking along the many streets.  The lakes or breakwater full of speed boats and ships are part of the attraction in the city.  Basically, Vancouver is a typical city but with different land and weather condition that make it different from other cities.  Overall, the impression is good because it is not densely populated

title: Springlike Winter Weather
reviews: Vancouver Dines Out Jan 17-31! Great tasting menus for approx. $35.00 for 3 course meal st vity's finest restaurants. Metro makes Diwntown easily accessible as well as bike paths for cyclists. Great shopping, walks along harbour, and good eats. Fly Over Canada experience at Canada Place is on our to do list. Very safe and great city for walking outdoors even in Jan.!

title: Gastown
reviews: We enjoyed visiting Gastown and watching and listening to the Steam Clock on the hour toot it's time. Nice restaurants to suit every budget and the usual good service that you learn to expect but never fail to appreciate.

title: Not sure where I was
reviews: It was OK ... Good shopping but I had trouble working out where I was.    Usually I am good with finding my way around but here I struggled.   A better city map?

title: Plenty to See
reviews: Great nightlife whether you wanna pop in to a pub or go to a dance club plenty of options. Some of the best sushi I have ever had and the portions were very generous. I really enjoyed trying all the different brews from Vancouver area breweries. Very clean city but there are a lot of bums (at least they were entertaining via card tricks or playing music).

title: Very busy but also very friendly
reviews: Shops and people we found very help full towards us, Lots of Sky Scrapers... lots more of things to see and do.

title: Exciting
reviews: Busy metropolitan city - but so friendly. There are obvious pockets of deprivation but at no time did we feel frightened. The city has a really happy vibe and people make eye contact and smile. Over all we found the Canadian people fabulous. Can't wait to visit again.

title: shop till you drop
reviews: Get a bunch of your girls and just cruise through downtown. Every shop you can think of with all the great eats in between!

title: The cleanest downtown I've ever seen!
reviews: Vancouver downtown is large, urban, modern and hip. It is also the cleanest one I've ever seen and I've travelled quite a bit. You will run into a homeless person every now and then but that is expected. What also expected is a lot of tourists. Do go to Robson where all the stores are. Many of them have sales and with a current exchange of $1 US to $1.18 Canadian (as of 01/17/15), it is a good deal for us, Americans.

title: Great Shopping
reviews: Too many beggars although they are extremely polite!!! Lots of nice restaurants, bars and fantastic shopping!!! Prefer downtown to any of the shopping malls.

title: Best City
reviews: Vancouver is one of my favorite cities in the world. There is so much to do - shopping, site seeing, restaurants, It's clean and safe compared to most large cities. I love that even when it's cold it is bustling with night life. Must sees in the Vancouver area are Robson Street and Stanley Park and the Inukshuk, Be sure to wear walking shoes.

title: Lots of shopping
reviews: Easy to get around, wonderful shopping on Granville and Robson. China town was interesting to see. Driving was a breeze.

title: Nice viewing from waterfront.
reviews: I spend one night there before I go on Canadian Train. I went to waterfront and see cruise ships there. Also I went to Gastown. I stayed at hostel there. I did not go to Chinatown.

title: Made in the 80's
reviews: This downtown needs a facelift with it's 1980's blocky buildings.  While it's small and walkable, when over 45degrees, it lacks old world charm.  Food and nightlife options are everywhere but it doesn't live up to other metropolitan cities.  The mix of Asian/French/Canadian flare is pretentious and unsubstantiated .

title: Fun!
reviews: Love Robson and Denman Streets for shops and ethnic restaurants. Also the pier area!  Nice skating rink on Robson St. and on Georgia St. we love to go into the Fairmont to see the golden retrievers.  It's a fun, walkable city.  There are paths down by the water to walk along to the cruise ship docks.  Also, nice parks and activities for kids to enjoy.  Many shops align this area and you can watch the float planes coming and going too! Stanley Park is at one end of downtown so you can walk into that, too.

title: Great city
reviews: Love this city, plenty to see and do. If you are lucky you might stumble upon some filming of your favorite TV Show or the next big movie! Would recommend you venture down towards hasting street and main as it gets darker. Bit of a dodgy area for anyone really.

title: Good Food
reviews: I will walk here every morning to buy siopao, dim sum, it is cheap, I do not get these everyday in my town. I love to walk around because they thought I am Chinese and they speak to me in their language but I always apologizes because I am not. I have fun walking and checking every stores and buy souvenirs.

title: highly vivacious and lively place
reviews: This was one of the best down towns among the ones i have visited. It lives up to the standards of the NYC & Chicago. There is a string of high end stores along the street and a lovely place to take an evening stroll. There are several restaurants to have a fun dinner.

title: Robson Street is a Favorite!
reviews: So much to see and do and a great place to walk and get your daily exercise. Walk from Denman all the way up to the top and over to the water. Safe and friendly.

title: Walk an discover
reviews: Suc an easy town to navigate and there is a lot to see. On our walk we discovered beautiful churches, lovely individual shops, interesting streets, community gardens and of course Gas Town and the shopping centres. There are plenty of coffee shops and restaurants and the wonderful food trucks that park kn the road where you can try some really interesting food. We always felt very safe whatever time of day we were out and about.

title: Plenty of choice, pleasant area
reviews: Spoilt for choice of shops offfering goods at a much cheaper rate than we would pay over here. Many restaurants and big shopping mall with food court. Easy to navigate around also!

title: Safe, good sidewalks, nice shops.
reviews: It was easy to navigate. We felt safe - even at night. There was lots to do. We found good places to eat. There were lots of great hotels and good shops. Friendly people.

title: Shoppers dream!
reviews: Some of the best shopping all with in walking distance, the only problem is by the end of the day you will need a taxi just to carry all of your purchases!!!

title: great shopping!
reviews: lovely town to shop and dine.  lots of great little shops, coffee shops, and places to eat.  especially loved gas town!

title: Flying to Canada with an old UK criminal record (fine only)
reviews: I am an EU national who was given a fine by the UK police for a minor offence in 2013. I believe this constitutes a criminal record for 1 year (although not entirely certain). I pled guilty and was not required to show up in court and the fine I paid was very small, ¬£90. Will I be required to declare this upon entering Canada? If I do not declare it, is this information open to the Canadian border security or not?

title: Very good
reviews: Good shopping experience, nice coffee shops. pubs etc.Easy to get around the city, lively, Gastown and good placeto look around

title: Great city to visit!
reviews: Flew into Vancouver and had time before my next flight. Drove around town and saw a film being shot, saw the library where Night at the Museum was shot, and the most attractive Home Depot you will ever see. Wish I had time to do more! Will go back as the city intrigued me.

title: Best part of Vancouver
reviews: I stay downtown by Robson street frequently when my husband works in Vancouver. Sutton Place hotel has apartment-like rooms, and shopping and restaurants are awesome. You can walk within blocks to the movies, live theater, museums, sports and concerts at the Fox arena, and a number of distinct and wonderful neighborhoods-also Stanley park is within walking distance! Big party on Granville street on weekend nights. This is a wonderful city.

title: Great shopping in view of mountains
reviews: A beautiful place with great restaurants and shopping in view of snow covered peaks. Don't miss Stanley Park - a lovely walk along the seawall of English Bay. Rain (come prepared, it does rain alot in Vancouver) or shine it is beautiful.

title: Lots to see......
reviews: You can spend almost 2 full days here exploring. its a very good sight seeing place, lots of cuisine to try :)..I went during winter time so was pretty chilly but the beautiful views of mountains, waterfront boardwalk and Christmas decorations were totally worth.

title: Vancouver Rocks My Socks Off
reviews: Well, well, well.... There is so much too write about this very special city that I am not sure Trip Advisor would allow me to write an essay!Vancouver is a city blows my mind away, you name it from its restaurants to the fancy food carts to the shopping to the nite life, the surrounding areas such as English Bay. This city punches well above its weight. Vancouverites are among the nicest people I have ever had the privelage of meeting, so courteous, polite and ever helpful, no matter how small the problem/query you are guranteed a resolution or an answer with the utmost respect and dignity.Downtown Vancouver is a mega construction site at the moment, I cannot wait until completion day comes, the Nordstrom center is a monster, but at the same time incredibly environmentally crafted infrastructure, thus leading to attaining the highest credentials with respect to green technology.The transport system which is managed by Translink without a shadow of a doubt one of the most efficient and vastly developed transport systems in the world. The timing is excellent, not to mention the customer service is superb! Everytime I visit Vancouver there is always something new that springs up, no matter how small you can still notice. I highly recommend a visit to Granville Island, it has some of the finest micro breweries on tap in the world. Vancouver is currently going through a huge boom in micro breweries, now with the recent legal changes in relaxating the liquor laws Vancouver is about to take things to another level. Granville Island has a beautiful boat ride, it is a must do only on a sunny day!Vancouver is known for its stellar environmental credentials and it certainly lives up to its reputation.The downside to Vancouver is it is so spread out, not a friendly city for people who do not have their own means of transport. Vancouver is trying to rectify this issue however much work remains to be done in expanding the public transport system to the outerlying areas making it more accessible for people who dont drive a vehicle like myself.I fell in love with Vancouver and the people so much that I will be going back there in the middle of 2015.

title: Lively city
reviews: Too many things to mention here but this city has lots to offer. Almost any type of food you desire is available here. Don't miss Gastown and Chinatown. People seem to be in a hurry but slip into the shops along any street for a break and you'll find variety unequalled.

title: Vancouver Tour
reviews: BC Tourbus  was a perfect guide for our group. The guide showed places in the city that were not on the regular tour and he gave us more time to spend in Granville Island. Actually he almost spent an extra hour free of charge. Thank you

title: Most beautiful city on earth; don't drive.
reviews: There is no city in North America like this. Why? Because it's quiet - no freeways through the downtown area. Unfortunately, despite the huge benefit this gives, it also means that driving into and out of the core can be... stressful. Know where you're going if you're planning on driving. If you're from out of town, do NOT drive - take the train. It's the one thing the SkyTrain is useful for.

title: Cosmopolitan City
reviews: Lots of ethnic restaurants,  beautiful architect,  splendid luxury hotels,  easy flat walking on sidewalks.  Close to the ocean and Stanley Park.   You can enjoy nature, but get the highs of visiting an exciting city full of life.   A very safe and clean city, also voted as one of the best cities in the World to live

title: It raine all the time
reviews: Even though it wa raining all the time we saw wnough interesting shops and good deals. People are friendly without imposing themselves

title: One of my Favorite Cities
reviews: Downtown is a vibrant and dynamic city. Easy to get around, friendly faces and a bunch of fun and interesting sights to keep all ages entertained. As soon as I arrived in downtown I was able to walk and catch the bus all over. Beautiful buildings, shopping and nature!

title: Great area
reviews: Lots to do and see - Stanley Park, coal harbour, beautiful views of the North Shore and at English Bay, Yaletown, Gastown, etc.

title: Vibrant and Bustling Core
reviews: Great downtown area that is perfect for walking, shopping and dining. Upbeat vibe. Nice art musem too. Our hotel (robson Suites) offered shuttle service one way which was perfect.

title: Downtown is Amazing!!
reviews: after a 15 bus ride from Calgary, all you would want to do is sleep, but after arriving in Downtown Vancouver we just wanted to take a quick shower and go out to do some sightseeing, beatiful harbour views, great restaraunts, beatiful buildings and nice people!

title: Leave the car at home
reviews: We recently took a trip from Seattle to Vancouver for a 4 day stay. We had flown into Seattle from TX and rented a car to drive to Canada after a few days enjoying Seattle. If I do this trip again I would not rent the car. The drive was pleasant but not particularly scenic. There are better ways to go with less traffic concerns. I would do the train or ferry, more of an adventure and a much prettier ride. Once we were in Vancouver we parked the car in the Hotel for $35/day and didn't touch it again until we left. Downtown Vancouver was very easily walkable, there are hop on and off Trolley's that go everywhere and we used them like a cab, just get near where you want to go and walk the rest of the way, very pleasant, walkable city. Do rent bikes and ride around the Stanley Park trails, fantastic fun. Near the convention center is the worlds best gelato, just ask the Trolley driver, they where right.

title: the best city
reviews: I traveled more city of the world from the east to the west but I can say I didn't visit the city such as vancouver l think the god made Paradis from the Vancouver pictures this city is very clean, safe, nice,and has very upertunity for the imigrants and all of the people

title: Interesting
reviews: I enjoyed majority of downtown. However, I was left very disturbed/bothered when our bus drove slowly be skid row- it's actually RIGHT BY THE POLICE DEPARTMENT. We seen 2 drug addicts with needles in their arms- in plain view. Sitting on the curb. The block was unlike anything I've ever seen. I stayed up late researching Vancouver homeless and found out that there is no real programs that help the homeless but, Vancouver pays for a program to have a place for free needles and a clean environment to shoot up. I'm still disturbed by Vancouver not really helping their homeless.

title: Walk everywhere, shop, and Enjoy!
reviews: When staying in downtown Vancouver there are a few things you should definitely do.  First, if shopping is your thing, Pacific Centre at the corner of Granville and Georgia Streets has lots of shops to browse through and right across the street is The Hudsons Bay store that is a shoppers paradise.  Robson street is a fun place to stroll and window browse, but the shops are high end and can be very expensive.  If you walk north down Hornby or Howe Street towards the mountains and water, you come to Canada Place, the Pan Pacific Hotel, and Vancouver Convention Center.  Do walk around Canada Place for some great views of the mountains and city, go into and check out the shops at the Pan Pacific Hotel and stroll over to the Convention Center to see the Olympic Flame.  If you continue walking along the sidewalk that runs along the harbour, just past the Convention Center, you will get more great views and eventually will enter Stanley Park, about a 20 minute to 30 minute walk from the Convention Center.  Along the way there are several restaurants, more shops, and some funky art work.  There are many things to see and do in the Park and you can walk around the entire sea wall, but keep in mind it is a very long walk to do the whole thing.(at least two hours)  Use the sky train or buses to get to BC Place stadium and then walk the seawall from there, along False Creek.  You will eventually come to an Aquabus wharf where you can board a water taxi to take you across to Granville Island, which is a great place to spend a few hours...lots of shops, places to eat, fun things to see and do.So bring comfortable shoes, an umbrella for the rain, and walk everywhere.  It's a very easy city to get around in.

title: Fantastic
reviews: Beautiful, clean, and only a minimal number of losers and beggars. Lots of good food. Underground malls are gorgeous curiosities. Taxis are cheap.

title: strolling around
reviews: Vancouver down town,  there are many changes around and lots of shopping stores to see and explore! What I do not like, there are many homeless people sleeping on the streets!  It ruins the beauty of Vancouver!

title: Vancouver Seawall In Yaletown, Vancouver BC
reviews: Vancouver Seawall In Yaletown-a must do it is beautiful and a MUST DO. I live above the Seawall. It is a beautiful walk along the Seawall in Yaletown, where there are many Sea Bus Stops at each Marina or tourist stop, to take you on a tour of False Creek. there is a small fee to take to sea abuses.

title: Great Walk-Around
reviews: Music, Bars, Restaurants, Old-Town area called Gastown, but way too many people begging for money...some dressed nicer than you

title: Loved it
reviews: Clean, lots of restaurants and tons of exploring. You don't even need a taxi, get a few bottles of water for hydration and your on your way.

title: A breathtaking city!
reviews: The city of Vancouver is just beautiful!  I only wish I had more time to see the sights...next time I will for sure.  My first impressions of this city were that it was clean and seemed like a perfect place to live.  I arrived by cruise ship and thought it was breathtaking.  I love that everything is green and lush.  There are flowers and trees everywhere...coming from a drought stricken California this was a breath of fresh air.  Literally : )  Love it there.  Take care of your beautiful city, Vancouver!!

title: Beautiful, beautiful city
reviews: Just loved it. The people, the city, the views, the stores. Drived my own way through Canada and this was the last stop.

title: Great Place to Explore
reviews: If you like to shop....come here.  If you like to just walk and explore......come here.  If you like to eat and have lots of variety......come here.  Its a great place to hang out and kill some time

title: Outpost to the supernatural
reviews: Van is a quaintly widespread city nestled @ the cusp of endless adventure. Fact is, it would take an entire lifetime to explore everything that it, & furthermore, beautiful BC has to offer. The core of the city itself is a peninsula, & technically, before development - Stanley Park was once an island. The time has passed where, for 1000's of years, huge megalithic giants once stood tall & aboriginals stood alone - enveloping the lands that are now eradicated beneath asphalt, concrete & steel. If history is your forte', there are still many remnants of that magical period preserved all around the city, the surrounding lower mainland - & of course the entire province. But to really enjoy the past, you have to head to it - the forest & hills that is.When it comes to entertainment, BC can spell bring cash, because there is so much to enjoy there, yet like in life - it's best spots are free. The nightlife scene is adequate enough but since the hockey riots of '94 & '01, the rules are stringent & enforced during the revelry hours. So much that the mayor has gone as far as to impose early liquor store closings in some areas during large events. As well, the security is so tight in all the nightclubs along the strip that you can't leave to get fresh air or smoke once you are inside. So once you exit - there are no re-entries.Good restaurants are everywhere, Gastown is very old world unique, galleries are plentiful, but remember one thing - this is the playground of the rich & famous. So even a simple donair can cost you $9 on a good night - & they ain't no real of the East Coast variety neither. But the place rivals the rest of the country when it comes to moderate climates. As long as you don't mind a little rain in the winter, you are good to go - so dress accordingly.One final thing worth mentioning is the city's east end @ Main & Hastings. Unless you are comfortable around literally 100's of homeless, many of whom are addicts & some who have serious mental issues, stay away from there -  especially @ night! So either by skytrain, renting a car, bicycle, or 2 feet & a heart beat - there are many great attractions worth seeing in Vancouver, BC... so come 1 & come all.

title: Great food and drinks!
reviews: Visited many restaurants and lounges in downtown Vancouver area and the people we met were fun and friendly!Great time!

title: Read the various reviews and the trip will be a perfect trip.
reviews: There are so many amazing places to go in Vancouver's Downtown area that will truely be amazing. There are a couple areas to avoid, like the East end of Hastings St. Do a little homework. Other then that you will feel safe walking all areas of this beautiful, clean and modern city.

title: Stay Vacation
reviews: We often have a stay vacation in our own city.  On a Sunny day you can't beat our town, Granville Isl., Robson, Stanley Park, See Wall there is just so much to do and see.

title: any time of year
reviews: Vancouver downtown is an attraction any time of the year, thanks to pleasant temperatures and lots of things to see.

title: clean city
reviews: nice to walk about . plenty to see. a few beggers in some parts.DONT GIVE THEM ANYTHING >.most shops will help and direct you to where you want to go .plenty of places to get meals too .

title: Canada trip
reviews: Felt safe walking around , plenty of mix of high end stores and boutiques and touristy shops to spend your money.

title: bit like sydney but different
reviews: not as busy but what a great placethis is my second trip here but I still thought it was as nice and especially if you arrive or depart here on a cruiseprobably one of the easier major cities to move around in and so much can be seen without a car just by local modes of transport or foot

title: Lots of areas to explore
reviews: We spent 3 days exploring the city.  Night life on Granville Street.  Yale Town for night life.  Grandville Island. Gas Town for history and Canadian stores.  the tower has great 360 degree views of the city.  The Expo area where the Olympic torch is is worth seeing.  Stanley Park is a beautiful park.  Well worth taking the time to hike and explore.  Leave the car and walk, take the Sky Train, Aqua ferries.  Very easy to get around with out a car.

title: Lots to see and do.
reviews: I stayed in the downtown area and I really enjoyed it. There is lots to do and see. There are plenty of restaurants and shops to keep you busy. From boutiques to major department stores and you can't miss Robson street. At this time of the year Robson street has some great Christmas lights up worth seeing.

title: Lots to see!
reviews: So many stores to browse around in..and very clean city with lots of restaurants and Hotels...we felt quite safe in this city... lots of things to see and do.

title: Clean and lots of variety.
reviews: Robson street to Pacific Centre are great places to eat and shop. Found cloths and products we liked.

title: a clean city centre - a rarity
reviews: really enjoyed downtown Vancouver, good selection of shops and lots of interesting places to visit, in some places nice small parks/corner plots which break up the blocks. Importantly clean and well looked after, Canadians really are proud of their cities.Cant wait to go back.actually visited august 2013 but only just getting round to reviewing (sorry)

title: Endless shops
reviews: What an experience all the shops row after row with so many amazing things to buy.I wish I could have bought a lot more but I had to think of weight to carry home.

title: Great city, clean and organised
reviews: Vancouver is a city very much enjoyable. Despite being a big city the visitor feels secure. the city is clean, tidy and well organised. I love the lane for cars with more than 3 passengers. It's a reference for green cities.

title: So many tall buildings!
reviews: Now I have been to many major cities before, but this one seems to have much more tall and modern buildings!Even though its was pouring like hell whole day, I enjoyed walking around. I really liked the souvenir shops because when comparing them to other cities where they sell cheap crap in dirty environment, these shops seems to be clean and serious about their business!I just followed my nose and walked anywhere, I really like the architecture. Didn't notice any damaged or closed buildings, this didn't happen to me so far on my travels in other downtowns.Overall the city is very clean and well maintained.

title: Compact and easy to get around
reviews: The ocean and mountain backdrop doesn't get any better. Easy access to most attractions and most venues can be walked to. You can take the Skytrain from the airport all the way downtown to the waterfront. Gastown and the famous steam clock are 5 minutes walk.

title: A little bit of everything
reviews: Park and walk around.  Plenty of things to do and see. Plan ahead and pay attention to the parking areas.

title: Its all a short walk away
reviews: This is a great little metropolis! Sky train from airport to downtown, have high end wardrobe for fine dining, jeans and pub wear and walking clothes and thats all u need. Trade your car for walking shoes or a bike and transport out of town to whistler is abundant. I come here for a couple weeks 4x/ year and never tire of it always discovering something new. Love this town!

title: Spectacular
reviews: Just approaching the airport proofs why this is one of the most beautiful cities on earth.Downtown is well connected via the Skytrain with YVR. Do not miss the Pacific Center - great shopping - and Gastown (same reason). If you are interested in North-West Coast native art, Gastown has a lot of shops and galleries, but if you do not want to spend too much - outside the Vancouver Art Gallery you can find native artists carving and painting in their traditional way on the street. Also worth visiting Chinatown - just watch out where you go, there is a very bad neighbourhood near by. The restaurants in Chinatown serve the best Chinese food outside China. Visit Newtown Bakery on Pender, it may remind on a canteen, but the food is absolutely amazing! I am coming to Vancouver for 16 years now after studying here, and not getting tired of it!

title: shshram
reviews: I was in Vancouver three years ago and I like to visit again this is very very nice and safe has very nice beach and nice places to visit the people are very friendly

title: Nice and trendy
reviews: I really enjoyed seeing downtown vancouver. Full of trendy and luxury shops.  Lots of great restaurants and cafes.  Robson street for shopping is good and there are high end stores and unique shops. I hear there is a good view of the mountains, but didn't get to see them due to the clouds (again)...maybe next time...

title: So much to do!
reviews: We loved everything about Vancouver!  The food was fabulous and the restaurants are close to wherever you decide to stay. There are so many things to do! If you enjoy chocolate visit Koko Monk, wonderful organic chocolate with so many unique favors.

title: Great base for exploring the city
reviews: My wife and I chose to base ourselves in Vancouver's Downtown area during our recent visit and were delighted with that choice. Our hotel was on Burrard Street and if you follow it north it takes you all the way to the seafront where you will find Canada Place, GoFly Canada, the floatplane terminal, a marina and lots of restaurants, cafes and bars. Downtown features Robson Street which is the city's premier shopping location and also lots of  convenient travel stops: Burrard St station which gives you access to the rail network; bus stops for the regular city bus routes as well as the Trolley Bus tours and the complimentary tour bus to the Capilano suspension bridge in North Vancouver.Downtown is awash with great hotels, restaurants and bars but also has the advantage of only being a short distance from the West End, Gastown and Chinatown districts all of which have a real 'buzz' in the evenings. Downtown also has several interesting museums and galleries and, all things considered, I believe it is the ideal base for exploring all that the wonderful city of Vancouver has to offer. However, even if you elect to stay elsewhere then Downtown is definitely worth a visit.

title: LOVELY
reviews: A very nice downtown, great weather, great shops, good prices, good variety. The way a city downtown should be

title: Sea wall, shopping, with a mountain view.
reviews: If your coming from out of town try to hit up a festival. Film fest, comedy, folk music;  greek or Italian fest, jazz fest, fringe, food truck, or our marathons like the BMO or Scotia.   Also walk seawall, goto grouse mountian and ubc for the museum of anthropology.  Christmas I nice downtown.

title: Beautiful architecture of Vancouver from land and sea!
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful and fun city. So much to see and do. Best view was from the Revolving restaurant Top of Vancouver - you get to see Canada Place- the harbour and  BC Place. Food is decent for Sunday brunch. Good shopping everywhere from Pacific Centre to Robson St. Won't go hungry in Vancouver. My favourite area to eat- Yaletown! Good tapa bars and seafood restaurants there.

title: A great walking city!
reviews: A great city to walk around - not to large and not too small. There are tall buildings but no the intimidating skyscrapers. On nice clear day you can catch a glimpse of the breathtaking beauty of the Pacific Ocean and the mountains. Downtown is dotted with great restaurants and relaxing watering holes. A great place to unwind - beautiful city that's laid  back!

title: Love the Atmosphere of Vancouver
reviews: This was my first journey to Canada having visited the United States a few times and I was very impressed.  It has the big city energy of places like New York and London but was more picturesque and friendly.  It has all of the elements of a really big city but I found it easy to get around and with enough diversity to keep me entertained and wanting to see more after the 3 days visiting.  I would like to visit again in the summer to explore some more of the nature outside the city. I definitely want to come back again soon.

title: Very nice city
reviews: I enjoyed the short time I spent in Vancouver, if only the weather was kinder! It is a scenic city ut not a big city at all. Downtown is not particularly big and easy to work out the streets. There seems to be restaurants or eateries everywhere!Well worth. Visit.

title: Walk around downtown Vancouver, it's marvelous!
reviews: It is so easy to walk anywhere in downtown Vancouver, you never need a car and if you have to use the transit system, it's easy and fast, especially the skytrain and Canada line to the airport.The city is well laid out and the downtown core is walkable and safe at any time of the day or night.  The sidewalks are flat and all curbs and intersections wheelchair accessible.  The vehicle traffic flows smoothly along one way streets and there are designated bike lanes everywhere.  The walk signs have second count downs so you don't have to guess if you are going to make it across the intersection before the light changes.There is so much to see and do in the city you will definitely need a few days to get acquainted.  People are friendly and shopping is as good as any major global centre.  There are tons of terrific restaurants and coffee shops and of course plenty of bars and night clubs for the late night crowd.  If you are into theatre and the arts, the city has a wonderful selection of venues to entertain you.  Come on into the city, you'll be glad you did.

title: Lovely City
reviews: We spent 5 days in this beautiful city and found there to be much to do.  We took our bikes and were able to bike around the city since it is very bike friendly.  The city is clean and modern with more places to eat than you can imagine.  There is a huge park right downtown that circles the water allowing for excellent views of the city.  People were friendly.  It is true that the prices are a bit high as others have mentioned, but that is not unusual for such a cosmopolitan city.  We have yet to find a major city that does not have high priced hotels, restaurants, etc., along with the homeless.  That's all part of the experience of a city.

title: A bit disappointed
reviews: If you like big, busy towns, than this is the place for you.   I found that this was similar to visiting other big towns - similar to Montreal and/or Toronto.   Plenty of shopping spots, lots of restaurants, rained a lot when I was there, so lots of umbrellas to bang into while walking for shopping.Avoid some streets where homeless reside, they take over streets, sleep on sidewalks, and of course ask for money - very sad to see and at the same time frustrating consider the obvious riches of this town.   Huge contrasts for homeless to riches within only a few blocks from each other. Don't misunderstand, this is a lovely town, worth visiting but not sure if I would go back again.

title: Pushy Homeless and Extremely Expensive
reviews: Wow i didn't even know you could review a city but thank god i found this because people need to know!!  Don't come here unless you are rich and love homeless. A six pack of decent beer is around 12 dollars and the liquor stores close at 11..the bars and restaurants are INSANELY expensive.. There are some good shops etc but nothing I saw that sets it apart from any other mediocre city at best, and for that matter 150 miles south is Seattle-much much much nicer. Their public transportation system is a thing of beauty i must say..but the city seemed to be just burnouts who came because they can smoke weed on the street without being harassed by cops and homeless people who can live and beg on the streets and be a huge huge nuisance without being harassed by cops...speaking of, where are the cops here???

title: I was strolling along.......
reviews: Great shops, great waterfront, great restaurants and loads of homeless. A real contrast in downtown Vancouver. All part of the experience.

title: The best city I've visited yet.
reviews: I'm considering transferring there for school. And living there forever. It's that great of a city. It's child friendly for when I start to have the inklings of the idea of becoming a parent. There's. So. Much. Food. And it all tastes amazing. Public transportation is no joke. It's the best public transport I've experienced in North America yet. I love this city more than I love my own!

title: like any big city
reviews: not  much that singles downtown Vancouver out as a big city, much  better to spend time in Victoria on Vancouver Island, which is much more interesting

title: smart city
reviews: Vancouver is great city to eat, drink and shop.  Some wonderful buildings old and new and lots of landmarks to look at. Try taking the trolley bus for an informed tour. Everyone is so friendly and helpful and they certainly know their craft beers.

title: Explorers paradise.
reviews: We spent 3 nights in Vancouver at the beginning of our Canadian holiday. It is a wonderful city, very clean, people are very friendly and talkative. There are numerous restaurants, pubs, clubs etc.. but we enjoyed just walking around (especially off the beaten track) taking in the sites and talking to people.

title: A Beautiful City
reviews: I love Vancouver.  There is great shopping, beautiful parks, great restaurants, and fun people.  It is beautiful all year around, but try to avoid the rainy seasons.  I would say it's twice as enjoyable in the sun as it is in the rain, and on clear days the views of the mountains and oceans are amazing.  Robson St. and Gas Town are my favourite areas, but I also enjoy Denman St area close to the beach.

title: Multi Cultural,Urban,beautiful,fun!
reviews: If you get the chance to visit this beautiful,interesting City,DO IT! Whenever I go,I never get the time to do everything I would like to! Love walking on Robson,Granville,Gastown and Chinatown! The harbour is great,lots of places to eat,sit and sightsee! Take the Seabus to North shore! So many things to see and do. I even saw the huge April 20th crowd around the Art Gallery! Cool,for this ol gal too! I love Spring the most with all the flowers in bloom! Gorgeous!

title: Wouldn't Live Anywhere Else!
reviews: Vancouver is the best place in the world to live.  The restaurants, shops, city view, mountains, ocean, and people make it so!  So much to do and see.  Both mountain sports and ocean sports - ski and swim/play golf on the same day!  Vancouver has all 4 seasons -from mild winters to beautiful hot summers - it gets a bit more than it's fair share of rain but makes up for it with gorgeous greenery and flowers in the early spring to a warm and vivid color autumn.  Just breathtaking!

title: Very commericial as you'd expect
reviews: Very commercial as you'd expect but you can find whatever you need here. Gift shops, department stores, restaurants by the dozen. Roads are busy but most have automatic crossings. You have to go at least once and a great location to stay as it's central.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: An excellent place to visit with lots of beautiful scenery and nice restaurants. Make sure you see Stanley Park and Grouse Mt.

title: Everything in easy walking distance
reviews: Likely you will need an umbrella. This is a great city to walk around. All is maximum 20 min walk. An enjoyable city to visit.

title: The lovliest modern city I've visited
reviews: So much to experience, museums, harbor walks, nice hotels, beautiful harbor views, anchor area for cruise ships and the skyway train right in the middle.

title: Delightful Mecca
reviews: I love the play on architectural designs on towers of glass-stunning. The freshness of bay is as endless as the strolls of tourist and locals enjoying the scenery. Great destination with tons of fun things to do.

title: Awesome
reviews: This is where to be, where to go, to shop, walk around, sightsee, even to people watch. There is always something going on around here. Davie is fun and exciting. Granville is always busy. Denman has a variety of restaurants and shops. Robson is where the shops are.

title: Gastown Rocks!
reviews: You've got to go to Gastown, check out the main strip of Water Street, eat at the Water Street Cafe. The Steam Clock which plays a tune on the hour is fun. Great shops, terrific vibe!

title: shopping and dining
reviews: Liked eating in yaletown. Lots to choose from. Lots of construction. downtown.watch your footing. Shoppin gon Robson.

title: Mixed bag
reviews: Granville street south of Nelson street is run-down with a matching sidewalk crowd. North of Nelson is ok except for the odd person camping on the sidewalk. A nice walk is along Richards street south from Nelson to False Creek and then along the seawall. Robson street is good for many cafes and small shops. A walk across the Georgia viaduct offers interesting views of the city.

title: Shops and Food
reviews: You have a lot of food stalls and shops to choose from.  It is a nice place to walk around either late in the afternoon or in the evening.  The place gets busy with people from all walks of life.  Vancouver downtown is truly a beautiful magnet to stroll, shop and eat.

title: Very commericial as you'd expect
reviews: Very commercial as you'd expect but you can find whatever you need here. Gift shops, department stores, restaurants by the dozen. Roads are busy but most have automatic crossings. You have to go at least once and a great location to stay as it's central.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: An excellent place to visit with lots of beautiful scenery and nice restaurants. Make sure you see Stanley Park and Grouse Mt.

title: Everything in easy walking distance
reviews: Likely you will need an umbrella. This is a great city to walk around. All is maximum 20 min walk. An enjoyable city to visit.

title: The lovliest modern city I've visited
reviews: So much to experience, museums, harbor walks, nice hotels, beautiful harbor views, anchor area for cruise ships and the skyway train right in the middle.

title: Delightful Mecca
reviews: I love the play on architectural designs on towers of glass-stunning. The freshness of bay is as endless as the strolls of tourist and locals enjoying the scenery. Great destination with tons of fun things to do.

title: Awesome
reviews: This is where to be, where to go, to shop, walk around, sightsee, even to people watch. There is always something going on around here. Davie is fun and exciting. Granville is always busy. Denman has a variety of restaurants and shops. Robson is where the shops are.

title: Gastown Rocks!
reviews: You've got to go to Gastown, check out the main strip of Water Street, eat at the Water Street Cafe. The Steam Clock which plays a tune on the hour is fun. Great shops, terrific vibe!

title: shopping and dining
reviews: Liked eating in yaletown. Lots to choose from. Lots of construction. downtown.watch your footing. Shoppin gon Robson.

title: Mixed bag
reviews: Granville street south of Nelson street is run-down with a matching sidewalk crowd. North of Nelson is ok except for the odd person camping on the sidewalk. A nice walk is along Richards street south from Nelson to False Creek and then along the seawall. Robson street is good for many cafes and small shops. A walk across the Georgia viaduct offers interesting views of the city.

title: Shops and Food
reviews: You have a lot of food stalls and shops to choose from.  It is a nice place to walk around either late in the afternoon or in the evening.  The place gets busy with people from all walks of life.  Vancouver downtown is truly a beautiful magnet to stroll, shop and eat.

title: Very nice city!
reviews: What we did is we grabbed a Starbuck coffee and strolled along the streets! You need to bring your camera and go the marina! Absolutely beautiful scenery! It is very easy to circulate by car as well as on foot. You have to make a stop in the Chinese quarter, and do not forget to look at the historic architecture!

title: Can't be in Vancouver without my Bay fix
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a draw--for I love shopping and that means I must get in my Hudson Bay Company fix.  I love the store.  It's that simple. Can't wait for next year when Nordstrom opens!!

title: Always abuzz
reviews: Even on a rainy Vancouver Saturday there is still a wonderful feel to this city.  Lots of life.  I'm not much of a shopper, but I do love to shop here.  From chains to independents, there is lots for everyone.  And many a coffee shop to rest those weary feet.

title: Good place to walk
reviews: Vancouver's downtown is quite lively.  it is worth a walk to see many of the buildings, but didn't feel like I needed to spend much time there.

title: One of my favorite Cities in the World! Pleasant, easily walkable and loads to See and Do.
reviews: Vancouver is one of my favorite cities in the world. The reason is its amazing weather, friendly people and most importantly that this place offers great mix of modern and traditional things to see and do. The city is very easily walkable and just pick up a downtown map and you will be able to figure your way through its very well marked street signs and pathways. The downtown area offers great glimpses of architecture and every red light stop and look around, chances are you will see a great piece of architecture. The city is abuzz with food places, shopping areas and just almost anything right where you walk. Street vans and carts at strategic locations, shops selling stuff for everyone and also people who will come up to you and ask if you are lost and need directions. Although this is by far one of the biggest metropolis in Canada, there is something about Vancouver which is very peaceful.

title: Typical big city
reviews: We didn't find too much to see in Vancouver,and nothing stands out as memorable.We explored Gastown and Chinatown along with downtown,all being very citified.

title: Vancouver is one of my favorite places to visit
reviews: We go out of our way to travel from California to Vancouver 3-4 tines a year. The downtown area is easy to get around in. I especially like the concert venues here. We have been to the Orpheum, the Vougue, Queen Elizabeth, and the Commodore Ballroom tomorrow

title: Unharried and varied
reviews: Easy to find a museum, a department store, a food court, a unique boutique.  This is such an easy city to stroll about.  People are busy but don't rush and cars don't threaten to knock one over.  I am not one to vacation in cities, but I will return to Vancouver.

title: Good if you like cities
reviews: The downtown core of Vancouver is very small and to be honest there are just mid-to up scale restaurants and offices, alongside a few malls. Nothing really special. The Fairmont Hotel Vancouver is nice for a drink but there are so many nicer more interesting places outside of the city, even if you just go a bit farther east into Gastown you'll find better food and more interesting shops. Be careful though, the city has a very sharp border of gentrification. You might be walking down some yuppy craft beer and expensive high fashion stores and then turn a corner and find yourself in the middle of the Downtown east side.....

title: Great Downtown !
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a nice mix of traditional and new buildings and style. They have made civic decision to keep the downtown streets at street level and not have major highways skirting above everything. This makes the driving the crowded at times, but the city much better. Its a great walking city with a lot of great shops and restaurants.

title: Great places to see.
reviews: Great views and plenty of restaurants with various types of food choices. The couple of places we ate offered great service at reasonable prices.

title: Vancouver visit & Hawaii Cruise
reviews: all the shops and malls you could ask for, or should I say, the wife could ask for!!Gastown is also close by and worth a visit

title: Lots to see
reviews: Downtown, although busy is pretty relaxed compared to many other cities, not too crowded. Very clean, easy to walk around. Good variety of shops and eating places to cater for every taste. Very safe to walk around.

title: Lovely day of shopping
reviews: Many high end and popular retail shops to stroll in and out of within walking distance to our hotel. Clean streets, felt safe walking with family of teenagers. Lots of outdoor public seating all the better to people watch in this international city.

title: Clean and impressive
reviews: The city is clean, neat and beautiful. Lots of atmosphere but tidy. Various shops and fast food. I love it.

title: Gastown is Good but Avoid the East End
reviews: Vancouver is divided in to two downtown areas populated by the haves and have nots. East Hastings St is a stark contrast to Gastown and Georgia where there are some beautiful condominiums. While I love Vancouver, the poverty on the east side is simply a sad sight. Do not go for a walk in that area as a tourist at any time!

title: Plenty to see on foot
reviews: Downtown Vancouver can easily be seen on foot. Just pick up a map from the tourist information centre and make your own way around. Plenty of shops and restaurants to keep you entertained.

title: pleasant environment
reviews: we really felt at home here;  busy enough but not too crowded or messy;  lots of interesting stores and places to eat;  friendly people and easily navigated;  we felt safe everywhere!

title: Lively, safe, clean, vibrant city
reviews: Lots of places to shop, eat, and walk around.  Vancouver is a lovely city and I'm so happy I got to see it.

title: Wonderful Downtown
reviews: This is a great city surrounded by harbors. Downtown includes Gastown which is our favorite area of the Downtown area.  Great historical area, lots of excellent restaurants, bars, interesting shops and excellent harbor and mountain views. It's easy to navigate Downtown and Vancouver in general because most of the streets run either north/south or east/west. Once you learn the major streets, it is relatively easy to get around.  We  met people from all over the world while there and loved the international feeling of the city. Amazing number of coffee cafes. There seemed to be a lot of homeless people but they tend to be located along the East Hastings Street area. We walked thru this area and had no problems but it may be an area to avoid as a tourist.  From our hotel room at the Delta Vancouver Suites, we had a sweeping view of the Downtown area and the harbor. We especially loved the Water Street historical district.  Everyone was extremely friendly and we really look forward to our next trip to the Downtown Vancouver.

title: Great Shopping
reviews: Shopped for 4 days in downtown Vancouver.  It was great.  Shops accepted American Express readily.  Credit card system in this city is great.

title: Great place to browse and explore boutiques.
reviews: Safe and easy to navigate the downtown core area. Lots of interesting restaurants and shops to explore. Great way to spend a few hours.

title: Nice city
reviews: Vancouver was a nice city, very easy to travel around and lots of skyscrapers.  The only problem was there were far to many homeless people around.

title: The Florida of Canada.
reviews: Really huge, clean, modern city. Very expensive real estate. Tons of skyscrapers, restaurants, and plenty of things to do.Really popular with asians, middle easterns, Native Americans. The down side many, many homeless people, begging and sleeping everywhere.

title: One of the most beautiful, livable cities in the world!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a superb location from which to get to know the "heart of the city". It is very safe. Lots to do. Central to lots of great activities (including Stanley Park, the North Shore Mountains, the sea wall, Granville Island etc). There are thousands of people living downtown here so there is always a healthy "buzz" and great restaurants and cafes to choose from.

title: before the cruise
reviews: A really nice city to visit before our cruise to alaska. Great views,a very clean city. We got there two days before our cruise and we walked downtown and the gas lght district. The steam clock was something I'd never seen. The japadog hot dog stand was surprisingly good, a must do.Canada place where you board cruise ships is nicely set up to handle the passengers. We will go back to spend more time in Vancouver. Go and stay a while a really nice city.

title: Good Vibe
reviews: Great downtown with sceneric places and great restaurants! I went to this ice cream parlor (can't remember exactly where) they had 99 flavours ! That had to be the best place! Just so amazing with flavours as crazy as pizza ;)! And some awsome ones! Great transportation and easy to get to!

title: Such a great feel
reviews: It is definitely a metropolis but I love that they are committed to having green space also.  Quite an international population which I think adds to its character

title: Hanging out in downtown Vancouver
reviews: Had a great time in downtown Vancouver. Spent a lot of time in Stanley Park biking, walking, jogging, etc. We especially LOVED the aquarium that is located in the center of Stanley Park. That is a must visit kind of place. Our favorite attraction by far. All in all downtown Vancouver has a lot to offer.

title: Could be anywhere
reviews: This could have been anywhere. The famous Robson Street was just like London Oxford Street or any other major city shopping area

title: SUPER CITY
reviews: It has everything - enjoy MLS Soccer at a great stadium, watch the Ice Hockey, visit the Science Exhibitions, Granville Island and Gastown, go shopping at The Bay and on Robson Street.We even tried the Botanical Gardens, Monorail and Joe Fortes famed Fish Restaurant. The Airport arrival and departure were negotiated without hazzle. Oh yes. a round of golf at Lings Links rounded it all off. A great place to go and not too expensive !

title: vibrant city
reviews: loved this city so much we want to go back, the only downside was the homeless people sleeping on the streets, otherwise it was brilliant with lots of shops restaurants, and cafe,s etc

title: Walkable with a good street scene
reviews: Fashion shopping, chocolate selecting, people watching ... you can do it all on Robson Street in downtown Vancouver B.C.

title: Good eating, shopping, walking-great downtown!
reviews: I love cities with strong downtowns and good transit systems, and Vancouver is one of the best.  There are a huge number of top rated restaurants, hotels, and stores within a short walking distance.  Museums and the incredibly scenic waterfront are also close by.  You may never want to leave downtown, but if you do, the frequent buses and Skytrain will get you anywhere you want to go.  No wonder the condo market is booming - downtown Vancouver may be one of the best places to live in the world.

title: exciting
reviews: A beautiful exciting clean and friendly city that has something to offer everyone.  Waterfront is beautiful.

title: Best city in Canada
reviews: I visited Vancouver for the first time this last winter and was very pleasantly surprised. Vancouver is a very beautiful city. It has an amazing downtown with no shortage of things to do. I've been all over Canada and Vancouver was by far my favorite.

title: space
reviews: Depends what you like. Downtown is not that old, you cannot find a pedestrian area, old churches or anything like that. For bikers it is really nice, enough space. Lots of restaurants and bars with happy hour rates in the afternoon. It doesn't feel stressed.

title: Too Hectic
reviews: We walked in the area from Burrard St along Pender avenueto China town and back. Our visit to China town was okay, but weencountered way too many homeless people along East Hastingson our return so we detoured to Pender avenue to get away from the crowd. Many times we were approached with the person asking for money. It made our excursion in the city  a negativeexperience, and we feel that Vancouver has gone downhill since ourlast visit a couple of years ago.

title: Friendly and Safe
reviews: Lots to do in downtown Vancouver. There is some excellent shopping in Pacific Place mall. There are many restaurants offering a variety of cuisines and reasonable prices. Stroll over to Canada Place and view a cruise ship (if one is in port) and then wander over to Gastown and see the steam clock. In Gastown there are plenty of souvenir shops that sell lots of Canadian themed items. The good jade that is offered is usually real British Columbia jade. The city is safe to walk in although check with your hotel about a couple of areas around Hastings Street you may wish to avoid if you are going over to Chinatown. Lots of good shopping and eating opportunities downtown. Public washrooms can be tricky to find so if you find one, you might ant to use it - try a restaurant if necessary.

title: Love to people watch downtown
reviews: Stayed downtown in October and it was beautiful weather along Coal Harbour!  This downtown has wide sidewalks and is very pedestrian friendly!  Great place to stop and grab a coffee and do some people watching! Love downtown!

title: Love you, Vancouver city !
reviews: Just loved the city of Vancouver - the clean, wide streets so beautifully laid out; and easy flowing traffic.  Had such a good feel for this city; loved everywhere we went - from Canada Place to Gastown, restaurant,  and all the different buildings.

title: Cleaner than most cities!
reviews: Plenty of shopping opportunities for almost anything! Very diverse eating establishments. Wide sidwalks means it rarely feels too busy.

title: Return visitor
reviews: There is much to do in Vancouver.  We loved the vibe of the city and the shops.  We walked till we dropped, rather than shopped till we dropped.  It is a beautiful city to wander around in.

title: Great walking town
reviews: It was fabulous to go to Gastown and also to watch the cruise ships going in and out of the harbor.  The seafood is fantastic in Vancouver.

title: Up for a walk?
reviews: So many things were within a few short blocks. The streets mostly went N-S and E-W. The city would go up hill then downhill then up and down again with the terrain so there is a lot of walking on ground that is not flat. There are plenty of places to shop and eat in the Gastown area which is close to the waterfront with Canada Place. Go a few blocks up the street and you are at Pacific Center or  Robson Square and the Art Gallery.

title: Great!
reviews: Vancouver is very easy to walk around and also amazing restaurants and vistas. The public transit is easy to use! I am enjoying Vancouver very much!

title: Awesome city
reviews: Vancouver is a well thought out, clean and easy to get around city. I really enjoyed my time in Vancouver, and spent around a month there last year. Thoroughly enjoyed it!!

title: Good thinking City Planners
reviews: A few striking observations:Traffic lights are set for a nice pace for walkers and cars to allow for a continuing flow of movement. It is a clean and open feeling city. Their shift of Granville Street to a pedestrian area (on weekend nights at least) is a great idea for the urbanites and for visitors. It feels safe to walk downtown at night. It is open to the views where possible. It is a well designed city. Good job city planners.

title: A delightful culinary tour of Little Italy!
reviews: I love culinary and historic walking tours, but they can be hit-or-miss.
