I researched a number of options before visiting Vancouver, and chose Taste Vancouver's Little Italy/The Drive walk because it seemed so authentic and friendly, and an opportunity to get to know an area I might not have discovered, staying downtown. And it did not disappoint!First of all, The Drive is a wonderful mix of family neighborhood/Bohemian/traditional shops and establishments, with a dose of contemporary and hipster elements. But the walk: It is a leisurely stroll that includes local history, personal insights into the businesses and the families that run them, and good food. A *lot* of good food! Over 2.5 hours, we visited 10 establishments and enjoyed authentic Neapolitan pizza, old school sausage sandwiches, cheese samples, cold cuts samples, a plate of spaghetti and meatball. We sampled wine from Piemonte, had fantastic hazelnut gelato, a perfect cappuccino, delicious cannoli, and more. We also met the owners/managers and employees of the places we visited, and got their personal insights and stories on the neighborhood and their own place in it. Very warm, friendly, fun, and informative, and truly a delightful way to spend a Saturday afternoon. Highly recommended.Please note: This review speaks specifically and uniquely to the Little Italy walking tour.

title: So Beautiful
reviews: I am not sure what makes Vancouver so beautiful but I think that it is partly that all the buildings seem to be make of glass and they reflect all that water and the sky. It also felt so vibrant. We saw lots people out walking, skating or biking or on the water. It seemed to be easy to get around on shuttles, busses or taxis. We were only there for two days but I would like to go back.

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: Lots going on on the waterfront.  Cruise liners coming and going at Canada Place (to and from Alaska) and plenty of good eating places.  Well worth a visit.

title: Shopping
reviews: If you like shopping this is for you.  Great stores, resturants, coffee shops. Very good public transport system and reasonable. Easy to get to the quay from downtown.

title: Gorgeous city
reviews: We drove around the perimeter and through the middle, and there was no part of Vancouver I didn't love.  Especially loved the hedges in front of residences - amazing!  Some of them were so creative, and they gave the city such a lush, green feeling.  The downtown has a lot of one-way streets, so a GPS is helpful, but overall, it is a lovely place to visit.  (And I'd like to live there!)

title: Lots of panhandlers
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a stew of low-end and high-end stores, restaurants etc. all mixed in together.  There are more street people and panhandlers than I have seen in most cities in North America.

title: Distinct Neighborhoods
reviews: We took the Westcoast hop on/hop off bus tour of the whole area, then took in specific neighborhoods.  Each one offers a distinct and different experience: Granville Island, Stanley Park, Chinatown, Gastown, Robson and Yaletown.  Be sure to check out the restaurants, too!  We loved Chambar Restaurant (order small plates), Phnom Penh (order the chicken wings!), Edible Canada, Motomachi Shokudo (best ramen ever) and blue water cafe (fabulous sushi and cocktails).

title: Excellent City
reviews: Vancouver downtown is excellent for travellers. You have wonderful shops if that is your thing as well as a great selection of hotels and restaurants. The magnet for most is Gastown the area where Vancouver originated. It is again a wonderful area with a whole variety of eateries. Canada Place on the waterfront allows you to get up close to the cruise ships that arrive daily en route to Alaska. The Outlook tower allows you to view the city in 360 degree and on a clear day the views are amazing.Vancouver is a wonderful city to visits

title: ok in parts, dodgy in others
reviews: So many down & outs, seemed like they were on every corner and outside so many food places. One area near Gastown was the scariest place I've ever been to, almost exclusively populated by drunks or junkies, we were intending to visit the Police Museum but had to turn back.

title: Vancouver is amazing!
reviews: What an experience when you visit Vancouver.. such a fabulous place with so much to see and do. Guided bus tours are a must, you get to see so much of Vancouver, and such informative bus drivers, hilarious too..  a visit to Grenville Island the floating market is a must...

title: where to go
reviews: That is usually the problem, many choices for both food and shopping. There is something for everyone to find, nice wide variety of shopping and restaurants (coffee, ethnic, cheap or chic). Good place to people watch and be one of the people to watch. Nice that they have many perimeter parks and many pathways along the waterways so if you rather have scenery than shopping you can get away from the bustle but still achieve your destination.

title: Nice town
reviews: Arrived in Vancouver September 2014 en route for the ferry to Nanaimo BC, walked around town, gastown, and shopped for souvenirs.

title: Prepare to Walk
reviews: Best way to visit Downtown - stroll.  Start with locating LL Bean for coffee to discuss how you will tackle the many interesting and fun sights of Vancouver/Downtown

title: A Large Affluent City
reviews: We took a bus tour around the city.  The city has a huge proportion of  people living in condominiums in the center.  It looks very very affluent. We saw old town which was  old.  We also went through what used to be a huge bustling place.  Bust since there are so many Chinese immigrating the  Chinese population and their shops and homes had moved into a suburb. It was raining so we did not go outside to see much of the city.

title: A great town for walking but leave your car at home.
reviews: there are some many great places to visit in downtown Vancouver it would be hard to list. Everything is within walking distance and there is no need for a personal car. The local bus, trolly and sky train makes it easy to get around. Felt very safe walking here even at night.

title: I Love Vancouver !!!!
reviews: This is easily one of my favorite cities.  We arrived via cruise ship and left from the airport.  The port area is well maintained and was easy to maneuver, and the airport was also a breeze.  It is a beautiful city  with lots of things to do and see for people of all ages.  It has  a wonderful location with stunning views along the waterfront. Public transportation was fairly easy to maneuver (especially due to the kindness of the locals who offered guidance when we were looking a little confused in the tunnels leading to the train station), parking was not difficult and the many people we met while in  Vancouver were kind, warm and friendly - we found them very helpful  on several occasions.  Utilize the visitor's center as they have many suggestions and offer some discounted tickets for area attractions. The business district and waterfront district are very clean and safe.  There were many places to eat or grab a cup of coffee and the shopping was plentiful, if that's your thing.  Canada Place has lots to do with some fun attractions and the area near the Olympic Cauldron was a wonderful spot with wooden lounging chairs overlooking the water, access to the pathway running along the water, more restaurants etc.  I must admit we did run into a few beggars once we were on the fringe of this  waterfront area and the homelessness in the China town area was very sad and made for  a stark contrast between the haves and have nots with just a couple of blocks in between, heartbreaking for sure....  In that respect it was like any major city, anywhere. We actually avoided Chinatown for this reason. All in all, I love Vancouver and can't wait to return......

title: A shopping paradise
reviews: Browse at night on the weekend there are so many pubs and restaurants to choose from in downtown Vancouver. Buskers are everywhere on the street some are worth listening

title: many things to do
reviews: love that , we walk in every street in the downtown , shops , restaurants and many many activities , you will not get bored

title: SOMETHING for Everyone
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has something for all. Mostly, it has an intenational Feel , with variable ethnicties and backgrounds. It has a multitude of shopping experinces from the luxurious ( Hermes..etc) to the european influence ( Zara) and anything in between. This downtown is few blocks  away from the harbour area and Stanley Park which are absolute- must see. Interestingly, it has large number of coffee shops, many of which are local ( vs your Starbucks and Tim Horton's chains). Downtown is walkable, safe , and clean. Nearby Gas town is interesting to see because of its historic significance but also because of its diverse restaurants. Highly recommned

title: Typical Big City Downtown
reviews: The downtown is a nice area. Lots of parking, easy to access via public transportation and not overly crowded. The parts directly near the downtown were pretty downtrodden and sketchy which was a shame to see. There are lots of eateries and coffee places. You'll be in caffeine heaven if you visit Vancouver. Parking is reasonably priced for a big city. My friends and I walked around (in the rain) for a few hours and weren't overly impressed. The Pacific Centre is vast but way out of our budget. If you're looking for high priced, designer brands then that's the place for you. I enjoyed a lot of the architecture. I was not a fan of being constantly approached and asked for change. It was a weird contrast to have that constantly happening while surrounded by high priced stores. A good tourist area, of course, and a must stop when visiting Vancouver.

title: Wonderful Rain or Shine ..
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is simply put , a great experience, no matter the weather. Something and someplace for everyone.

title: clean and lots of shopping
reviews: Liked downtown, was alot of nice shops and we were well received overall. Few dodgy spots to avoid where skateboarders and homeless people converge though (Grandville street).

title: Beautiful City
reviews: There is so much to see and do in downtown Vancouver: restaurants, museums, parks, etc. Just don't try to drive in downtown. The traffic, both vehicular and pedestrian, is maddening. Thanfully, there are a number of tour bus/trolley options to carry you around.

title: A true fashionable city
reviews: It was our first time in Vancouver, but it won't be the last one. The city has a nice atmosphere with a wide variety of shops and cafes. A good start is the Harbour Centre Tower. It gives a nice 360 degrees view over Vancouver and the mountains to the north. Back at ground level take the time to walk among the sky crapers in a very clean environment through Burrard Street. From high fashion shops to small intimate cafes. Some homeless people, but not too distracting. Also in the evening the city is full with lights, colourful and entertaining. A city with class.

title: Nice city
reviews: Great city and easy to get around. Only downside was particularly aggressive and loud beggers. Nice shops and heaps of different ethnic cuisines to try.

title: Great City
reviews: I liked the city. It is very organized and people are very nice. The traffic is not so havy. Nice views.

title: Vancouver, BC Canada is a lot like Seattle.
reviews: We where trying to find a drug store like Wall-greens or Bartels, something like that. Well, we started walking and walked to far. The street we ended up walking on, well let's just say it was a good thing it was day time. We finally found a drug store that was near Howe Street. The store was nice and the staff very helpful and friendly. We also found Chapters Book store which is like Barns and Noble. They even had a Starbucks inside. When walking in downtown Vancouver, stay on Howe Street. And take in the view of all the awesome buildings. The buildings in Vancouver are uniquely designed.

title: Modern City
reviews: I was impressed by the number of buildings with lots of glass but also the number of historic buildings nestled among the high rise.  In my limited time there I found it to be a beautiful city.

title: Cosmopolitan
reviews: We liked the fact that there were so many different ethnic types and everyone seemed to be getting along together.  There was a nice atmosphere. There is plenty of space between the buildings and, unlike many cities, it did not feel clastrophobic.  I am not a fan of cities but would make an exception for Vancouver.

title: Welcoming
reviews: On our recent trip we quite often found ourselves in downtown, near to Canada place - great place to hop on the tour bus, people watch the cruise ships, have a cocktail in the evening.  The helpful Tourist Information office is here and we used this quite a bit and the information was always 100%.

title: Watch your surroundings
reviews: The down town area west of china town and toward the sea wall is very enjoyable. The gas lamp area is split with nice to walk, eat and sightsee. Just stay west of Homer st . Homeless and druggies have taken over the china town and part of the gas lamp area. Very sad.

title: Great walking city
reviews: There is lots to see, do, and eat. Stroll Robson or hit the mall. Walk to the waterfront and into gastown. Then head over to yaletown for drinks and dinner.

title: You can't go wrong in downtown Vancouver
reviews: We were staying on Burrard (Sutton Place Hotel) and found Vancouver to be a wonderful walking town.  Just one block off Burrard are leafy residential streets and low rise apartments - you would never know there is such metropolitan activity so close by.  You can walk about anywhere in Vancouver without worrying (there are a few places to watch for, but everyone can tell you where they are).  When the rush hour starts (looks like it is about 2:30 pm, you will be glad you are walking.

title: Stay Downtown
reviews: Much to do and see. Everything is in walking distance. Shopping, dining and sightseeing everywhere. You could spend months there just to eat at all the good restaurants.

title: Robson st
reviews: We stayed in downtown Robson st , we picked the hotel to be in the centre of the city , plenty of restaurants to choose from , great shopping , lots to look at , every evening we went walking as shops stay open till late , felt very safe

title: Lovely City
reviews: Third trip to Vancouver and we loved it. Everything is just so handy and easy to get to.The only down side was the number of people sleeping rough and begging in the street - spoils the beauty of the City.

title: Love Vancouver Downtown!
reviews: This is such a unique city. The cleanest and most environment friendly city that I have ever visited. Have never saw so many hybrid vehicles in one city. A very diverse population in this city. I loved the modern architecture of all of the high rise buildings downtown. We were told that they were mostly residential apartments and condos. I don't know where all of these people work. Very high cost of living in this city. If you can afford it, it is well worth every penny. Very walkable and an excellent public transportation system.

title: Great city!
reviews: Incredible city. Full of activities or entretainment for all ages. It has great public transport. Beautiful beaches and mountains around it! If it wasn't that expensive...

title: So much to do and see
reviews: Young vibe- hip and cool. Restaurants everywhere (was told there are over 600 sushi restaurants in Vancouver!), shopping abounds, and the people watching is amazing. Goths, hipsters, business people, tourists- just a huge melting pot to the east and west. Beauty of the mountains loom large in the background. Vancouver- my new favorite city!

title: The most fun I've ever had walking.
reviews: Walking around the city was easy and not confusing. Clean. Clean. Clean. Most pristine city I've ever visited. Hardly any trash. High priced but I can see why. It's a quality place to live. You get what you pay for.

title: Not quite what I expected...
reviews: I had high expectations, but overall it just wasn't one of my favorites. Nothing too nice here and I don't think the food is the best around here. I guess after visiting other cities, this just wasn't that great to me. Sorry :-(

title: Walk-able city
reviews: After our tour of the city, we knew where we wanted to go back to...The Lookout, a needle that rises 400' above the city and gives you 360 degree views from the center of Vancouver, with explanatory information all around (our tour only allowed a 30 min stop; we were given return tickets for that day or next). We also wanted to go to Gastown and see the Steam Clock. The greatest stop was Dr. Sun Yat-Sen's Chinese Garden. Here is where I learned that something beautiful, quiet, and peaceful can be made with rock and greenery. Take the tour to understand the ying and yang at play here. The #19 bus put us within blocks of these attractions.

title: Walking around the city
reviews: Get out there and walk around on your own in this beautiful city.  Upscale stores and restaurants within view of snow-capped mountains. Very clean city. Friendly locals. Very green.  You'll notice how quiet it is, even during heavy traffic.  No honking horns, no loud car noises.  Hybrids everywhere.  Local markets selling mouth-watering organic produce.  The residents care very much for their city and it shows.

title: beautiful city
reviews: Great downtown area. Beautiful tall buildings with views of the mountains and water areas. Great walking city. People friendly.

title: Gritty City
reviews: The trolleybuses do reduce gas emissions but leave the skyline checkered with wires.  Downtown is cement on cement, where cars park on the sidewalks!  A lot of panhandlers on Granville St.  If you can figure out the bus system, you should find it very efficient as there always seems to be a bus running on main street.

title: Beautiful
reviews: What a beautiful, vibrant downtown. Gastown is an especially nice part of town which seems to be the trendy place to be. Make an effort to eat and/or drink there.

title: Saturday night in Vancouver
reviews: We arrived in Vancouver on a Saturday night, a city bustling with a soccer game. A little disturbing to see panhandlers on the street. Must admit though, they were only around on Saturday night and did not see them during weekdays.

title: The best downtown in Canada
reviews: We've stayed downtown (in a hostel) during each of our three visits to Vancouver in the past 17 years. We love it! Toronto has a fantastic downtown, but it is doesn't have ocean and mountains surrounding it. There is so much to see and do in Vancouver's downtown, and it's urban virbrancy at its best.

title: Downtown is Downtown
reviews: We stayed on Smithe Street during our visit and it was easy walking throughout most of Yaletown. Lots of shops and restaurants. Sundays a few streets get closed to cars and small markets and art pop-ups blossom. Its easy getting around, people are friendly and the shops were not crowded. Its an interesting place to start your visit from. Better shopping is had at other malls.

title: Expensive town
reviews: Thought it was pretty expensive but the people were very nice and friendly. Don't even think about buying alcohol in Vancouver .The government taxes the heck out of it!

title: 15 minute radius
reviews: What I realized about downtown Vancouver is that nothing is too far and everything is about 15 minutes away walking distance! You can be in Yale town and 15 minutes later be in Stanley Park!

title: Get out of downtown, go to the neighbourhoods
reviews: Vancouver's actual "downtown" is a mix of boring towers full of banks and law offices and the same stores you can find in any mall in any country in the world.  Other than a second-rate art gallery in a lovely historical building, there isn't much you have to see here.  Whether you want the best restaurants, the most interesting shopping, or even just somewhere nice to walk around, get out of downtown and go to any of Yaletown, Gastown, Kits, UBC, Commercial Drive or just about anywhere!

title: The extended Skytrain system is FABULOUS
reviews: I have taken public transit from Tswassen Ferry Terminal to the Airport, and to Downtown Vancouver about 3 times. Just can't applaud enough about it! The YVR (airport) segment makes getting to and from the Ferry Terminal a "dream".

title: Downtown is a must see
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city and I had the most perfect weather. The city is diverse, clean and absolutely beautiful.

title: So much to see and do
reviews: A great town with a great atmosphere.  Everything is easily within walking distance.  Gastown is so interesting and the steam clock is a real attraction.  China town is well worth a visit and of course you must stroll down Robson Street if you enjoy shopping or just simply mixing with the in-crowd.  Canada place offers great views of the newly arrived cruise ships, has some good restaurants and just further along is the site of the Olympic Cauldron.

title: All the hype you have heard about this city... Is true..
reviews: My expectations were so high that I almost expected to be disappointed, but this city is even better... It is like a gift that keeps giving...

title: World Class
reviews: Vancouver is a world class city.  I live in California, grew up in the SF Bay Area, and found Vancouver to be heads and shoulders above SF on a tourism scale.  Vancouver is clean, walkable, cycleable, vibrant, fun, friendly, and affordable.  A lot of things that SF is not.Beautiful city.

title: Noisy and many street people.
reviews: There are many interesting shops and restaurants to go into, but there is lots of traffic and noise in the area. Some of the street people are very aggressive with their requests for money.

title: Quaint - Vancouver Downtown
reviews: Beautiful scenery at the pier and took a walk along the park by the waterway. The downtown area is easy to navigate by foot. I walked. No need for a cab. There are lots of little souvenir shops and eatery's close by the pier area. If you want to take tours, the planes, helicopters and buses are all right there. Wish that I had more time take tours of parks, etc.

title: Way too many bums
reviews: I have traveled quite a bit and understand all cities have homeless people,  but I never saw anything like this place.  They are in large crowds, blocking the sidewalks and very aggressive.  The locals say it is because Vancouver is the warmest city in Canada.  Maybe they should get some air conditioners and run them outside.  Or,  they can provide services to assist these people and keep them from doing what they currently do.

title: history...
reviews: very busy but not chaotic. went on a weekend. very interesting achitecture. lots of shopping and if u get hungry, a lot of choices

title: One on the nicest places on earth
reviews: Forget Disney, go to Vancouver.  The nicest people, the cleanest place and lots of amazing people, places to eat and things to see and do. The zoo is great to visit if the weather is ifffy.

title: Lots to see and do
reviews: I liked colourful Bute street with it's lively community gardens.   The residential areas have some interesting houses.   There is a wide variety of shops and restaurants.  Robson street has a bank and money mart which I could have done with knowing before I walked for ages looking for one further in the busy City part of downtown.FYI if you are there the Vancouver Bullion on Dender and Howe will sort your currency too.

title: dirty
reviews: Not a very nice place after dark.  Found a decent restaurant/bar for dinner.  Rather eerie.  The street became a road of litter during the evening walk to the restaurant.

title: Honeymoon
reviews: Very clean city, too many people in a BIG hurry.  Many taxi drivers (not indigenous to Canada) drove like they're back home (been there too.. yikes!)  Their crossings suck, cross with traffic, turn left on green (no arrow) and you hold up all the cars behind you wanting to go straight.  My advice, let someone else drive, take mass transit, those guys take NO prisoners so you can enjoy the trip and no stress.  :-)

title: Great waterfront, the rest just ok
reviews: We liked the waterfront area - lovely views of the harbour and modern architecture. There's plenty of shopping, which we didn't care for and a few interesting buildings such as the Maritime building (gorgeous Art Deco). In addition, Gastown was also interesting/quirky but Chinatown was depressing and unfriendly and the map was difficult to follow. The 2 blocks we walked between the latter 2 areas were absolutely the pits - there were druggies on the streets and adjacent alleys and we couldn't wait to get out of there. For a big city - just as expected...

title: Refreshing visit!
reviews: One of the best downtown areas I have ever seen.  Clean, exciting, refreshing, and with very, very low rate of empty storefronts...Vancouver really has it going on.  Just driving around the city is impressive as you see an incredibly diverse population that seems to love being in the city.  There are nice parks, cool landmarks, excellent shopping, great restaurants, and a terrific vibe all around.  People are running, walking, riding bikes, strolling, walking dogs...all with a satisfied look on their faces.  There are many streets full of shops and restaurants.  In fact, after touring around a lot of the city, there was little to not like!  Most of the buildings are new(er) and it is as if the entire city was built after the 1980's.  Compared to many cities in the USA, Vancouver blew us away!  Thanks for the memories!

title: Always a hoot!
reviews: Wife enjoyed strolling around downtown. She was quite surprised to find so many Chinese there. She was quite pleased with the food in this one noodle shop down the street from the hotel. But most of all, she was happy to enjoy a traditional Chinese treat available at a Taiwanese event vender. It was this cooked rice wrapped in thick bamboo leaves. She went crazy over it and said it was just like back home. My Singapore noodles were also delicious along with this fried bread dish...forgot the name. I couldn't get her to do any shopping however, other than just window shopping. $$$ remained in my pocket...LOL!

title: walking tour
reviews: It's fun to stroll around Robson Street, a nice commercial street full of young people and hustle and bustle. Good food and fun place to be. Get a hotel downtown when you visit Vancouver. You will be close to every location and attraction in town.

title: very friendly
reviews: We chose to spend 4days in Downtown Vancouver and throughly enjoyed the atmosphere, friendliness of the people who especially helpful if you get lost.Every type of restaurant you can think of from reasonable to expensive, hundreds of shops, highly recommend this part of Canada.

title: Amazing Sights
reviews: The downtown is just an amazing collection of buildings.  New and old - however many modern buildings.  The view from the harbor is not to be missed - like San Fran but only more dramatic.  Seeing it from above is even more breathtaking.  Not to be missed!

title: Wonderful....wonderful
reviews: Wonderful..great well maintained ...lovely city. Views breathtaking, very clean city...view of the north mountains can be seen from almost every where in the city.....grouse mountain ride and bears nature habitat visit is a must summer.. spend some hours at the city harbour, Canada place, china town, gas town, the aquarium and Stanley park are just among the endless options you can see in Vancouver... I go every year and every time its breathtaking as the first time.

title: Great City
reviews: Vancouver is a stunning City.  It's very walkable and has lots of variety shopping and places to eat.  The waterfront is fantastic.

title: Clean, vibrant, walkable
reviews: Vancouver is surprisingly walkable and clean. Downtown Vancouver has so much to offer in terms of food, shopping, culture and people watching. Of course, the experience is always weather dependent! Keep an eye out for the many festivals and events happening year-round.

title: Grouse mountain
reviews: Grouse Mountain was a wonderful experience and not to be missed. Lots to do and see.  Paragliding, zip lining, chair lifts, and the wood chopping was very entertaining.   We loved the up and close view of the Orphaned brown bears, Coola and Grinda. Views were absolutely amazing and takes your breath away. It is an attraction not to be missed.  Free shuttle leaves from Canada place starting at 9.30, returning every half hour.

title: Vancouver: unexpected city to visit
reviews: Very nice city to walk: Convention center area. Gastown. There is a original steam watch. Yes a clock that works with water steam. Don¬¥t miss Victoria the capital city of BC, you have to take a ferry. Also the Butchard gardens, etc.

title: Lots of shopping
reviews: We were so close to downtown,but away from the hustle and bustle at our great le soliel hotel,but all levels of shopping from Tiffany's to old navy in easy reach. I especially liked gastown and Chinatown,there was a Taiwanese street festival going on when we were there,I cannot wait to return to vancouver

title: So much to see
reviews: So much to see and do in Downtown Vancouver. Shopping, sightseeing, eating, strolling, relaxing. Something for everyone. Amazing city.

title: Beautiful place, good sights to see, and places to eat.
reviews: We only had a little more than 24 hours to spend there. But we enjoyed walking to Canada Place to see the ships and to see the Olympic Cauldron. There was a good variety of restaurants to choose from. I also enjoyed the buildings, and the park that had stairs, but it also was a ramp to make it handicapped accessible.

title: Walked everywhere
reviews: First visit to Vancouver.  We were there for 4 days and walked around everywhere in the city and took a bus.  The buses where clean.  We felt safe walking around the city.

title: Vancouver excursion
reviews: We saw some really nice things about Vancouver while we were there including Olympic Village, Canada Place, and Stanley Park including attractions in that area.

title: not as much
reviews: There is quite a bit to do in Vancouver but not as much as I expected.  It has a charming Chinatown area, some good food, but the shopping is not unusual unless you venture to Granville Island. Most of the shops downtown are what you will find in the malls and downtown areas anywhere.    The art museum is delightful.  This is a bustling town with a fair amount of street life and it would be fun for young people in the evenings.

title: A City of Considerable Charm & Contrast
reviews: The so-called cobbled streets (they're not really cobbled at all) of touristy Gastown, the grand brownstone, early 20th century-buildings of Yaletown, the oriental style of Chinatown and the modern, glass skyscrapers along the waterfront all combine to produce an eclectic and unique mix that is downtown Vancouver.  A hop-on, hop-off bust tour is highly recommended as a great way to see the city and to learn about it and its history.

title: Disappointed
reviews: First time in Vancouver and shocked to see so many homeless and down and outs hanging around street corners doorways and outside restaurants . Whilst looking for somewhere to eat at 7 pm in Gastown area  we saw a young man injecting his foot under a street light just yards away from people enjoying a meal. Such a shame in a beautiful city.

title: Nice downtown
reviews: Very nice place, you can feel the fresh air everywere you go, Skytrain and buses are friendly routes and schedules.

title: My favorite Metropolis in the World
reviews: Vancouver is basically like every other big North American City, BUT has this fantastic backdrop, the beached, the chance to be out of town in just minutes ... like in the total wilderness with bears an cougars and what-not. Just a wonderful place on our planet! I would NOT like to live there, since that's too busy for me. BUT I need my Vancouver fix once or twice a year!

title: Festival area
reviews: Music, drinks and a yoga festival while we were here. Olympic torch is still standing and the people were very friendly! Lots to see and do, right where the Harbour Air is so it was convenient!

title: the most beautiful city
reviews: It is a walkable and well organized city.Public transport is amazing and the views from the city are stunning!

title: Maybe a bit boring for some
reviews: Vancouver is a mid sized city, and we stayed in a boutique hotel called Hotel St Regis right in the heart near the water. We were there prior to a cruise, then again prior to going on the Rocky Mointaineer.For the period of time we were there (2days), it felt very tranquil, reasonably quiet with some sightseeing. Not an icon like NY, but more like home to me. So, the 4 stars is not for the fact that it has a huge number of activities, 'wow' factors or fantastic nightlife ( we go to bed early..), but more that it is a lovely city to be in for a bit of r and r, that still has attractions.

title: Whytecliff Park, West Vancouver, BC
reviews: The precious gem of the West, where once visited you will always want to return to experience more!!

title: Easy to Get around
reviews: Great city to walk around or use transit if need be but down town Vancouver is very easy to get around and hard to get lost as your almost surrounded by water so as long as you don't cross a bridge or go east of Main St. you'll be fine.

title: Over rated
reviews: They say how beautiful Vancouver is....yes....city of glass with all it's high-rise living and business. I found it to be very littered!!!  Public service people were not friendly or helpful. Locals we're very helpful!  Vancouver is no different than any other big city. I would not return and probably wouldn't recommend.

title: Downtown
reviews: Lots of shopping and eating places. We had poutine from Mean Poutine - it was really good. Downtown is the transport hub and its possible to get to any part of Vancouver from here.

title: Good Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Very clean, felt safe walking alone at night, lots of shops, street entertainment. Nice selection of restaurants with various kinds of food.  Outdoor dinning a plus. Busy traffic on foot and in cars, everyone was polite.

title: Amazing
reviews: This was our first visit to Vancouver ( family from Trinidad) and we stayed downtown (Burrard street and Georgia) I can easily say the people are extremely friendly, lots of directions posted and clean streets.  Information booths and the tourism center near Canada Place was  very helpful.  Buying the aquarium tickets there  was cheaper than advertised on the aquarium website! Robson street has many restaurants and stores to shop.  Transit is accessible almost every where and none complicated. I was surprised to see how eco- friendly the city is and this is testament to the numerous bikers and bike lanes. **hint hint Toronto ( I live here)**Would definitely go back in a heart beat.

title: Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
reviews: I only spent two days here but liked the area very much, Very clean city with nice hotels and shopping malls. Friendly people and good food!!

title: Clinique Product
reviews: I had my first clinique product from this granville shopping mall in down town vancouver back in 1997, the promoter there gave me a soap bar, cleanser, toner and moistourizer. All for the price of  canadian dollars less than CAD70. What a price then.

title: Vancouver is the best
reviews: No matter where you walk in Vancouver it is cool and vibrant. The Seawalk is fantastic with a jewel of a park to explore. Great food all round and the city is clean and safe. Never felt intimidated and the city is packed with great people from a diverse background. Sandy beaches, great parks, awesome restaurants and a great concert scene. Vancouver is a great place to visit.

title: beautiful city
reviews: think it is the cleanest city I have been in!! everywhere all are very friendly and shopping eating or happy hour expect super service with a smile! one of my favorite places to visit!!

title: Bustling with life
reviews: Much bigger and much livelier than the downtown of my city, that's for sure. I loved shopping here, and I loved all the attractions. Visit the Vancouver Art Gallery while you're down there, and there's a couple other art galleries worth checkout too. It's enjoyable to just walk around here, you never know what you could run into.

title: What a gem
reviews: Vancouver deserves it's awards for liveable city.  Mountains AND beaches.  Unbelievable beauty.  East to navigate by sky train and / or bus.  Many areas of interest.

title: Downtown vancouver
reviews: Robeson street!!! Ahhh the shopping....sighAnd Gastown!!! It's an absolute must to visit Gastown!! See the steam clock, have a delicious meal at The Old Spaghetti Factory...ahhhh, love, love, love downtown vancouver!!

title: Trip to Vancouver
reviews: I really don‚Äôt know where to start. For people that live in industrial town in Southern Ontario, Vancouver represents a role model city, the city you‚Äôd like to live in. We have spent seven days in Vancouver area and a couple of days in Victoria (I will have my separate review about Victoria, BC). We stayed with friends in small suburb city Port Coquitlam that is a part of Tri-Cities, Coquitlam, Port Coquitlam, and Port Moody. I was literally ‚Äúshocked‚Äù by public infrastructure composed into beautiful nature of this small city. Trails, playgrounds, tennis courts, berries, river, lakes etc. First day we spent in Port Coquitlam and drove to White Rock Beach. WRB is a small tourist crowded Riviera city but we loved it because it felt like you were somewhere at Mediterranean cost. Second day we spent on Burnaby Mountain (beautiful look to Vancouver and the sea inlet, than Grouse Mountain (what can I say, beautiful view of whole Vancouver. Third day we wanted to travel by public transport. We have purchased full day fares for all 4 of us and hit the road. 45 km to downtown took around 75 minute by buss (the buss frequently stopped). It is worth to visit a Visitor Centre in downtown to get maps, instructions, guidelines etc. A Vancouver waterfront is nice, view to ocean, Stanley Park, harbour, Olympic cauldron, Gas town, Granville Island (stores, market) and we decided to go back with Skytrain. We have heard that people complain about this public transport a lot. We were taking a Skytrain at 5pm it was crowded but not too bad. Next day we have spent in Stanley Park. Kids loved a second beach pool after long walks. A cost was $3 per person! Nice! Next two days we spent traveling to Victoria BC. Next day we have visited Capilano Suspension Bridge (what an experience ‚Äì must see), Horseshoe Bay, and having our sunset at the Whitecliff Park West Vancouver (we didn‚Äôt have a bottle of wine but it would be a perfect end of the day if we had it. Next day, Whistler Blackcomb. I was pooling my hair out when I have realized that we have spent an extra day in Victoria and we didn‚Äôt do that in Whistler. You can see a million pictures of Whistler, gondola, ski lifts, ski trails, mountains, Olympic Village but it cannot do it for you! I am 45 and so far in my life I have never seen anything beautiful as a view from the top of Whistler! Stunning! Gorgeous! I‚Äôll be back on day. I have to say many thanks to my friends Kolja, Stela, Nikola, Ned, Goga, Luka and Matej. Without you guys this trip wouldn‚Äôt be so great! We love you!

title: Great Shops
reviews: Loved the shopping in Vancouver, great shops but China town did disappoint...thought it was larger with more shops

title: A Great Run or Walk!
reviews: Either a 2 1/2 hr walk or a 1 hour run this 10k path around Stanley Park is a great way to clear your head, smell the sea and see the city.

title: Winter Olympics 2010
reviews: My mother and I went to stay with my aunt, my mother's sister, just happened to be at the time of the Winter Olympics.I did not visit in Feb 2014 but it seems i have no choice to pick a date.

title: Vancouver is a great city to visit, especially if your taking an Alaska cruise
reviews: Beautiful city with many attractions. I stayed at the Fairmount Waterfront, rooms were spacious and clean, staff was attentive and it was directly across from the cruise line terminals. The food was great and a trip to Gas Town and it's restaurants and attractions are a must. I will return to Vancouver.

title: Robson
reviews: If you like shopping this is the place to be. Everything all I one place from high end fashion to drug stores restaurants of all kinds and prices. Street performer's and lots to see and do.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: One of the nicest cities ice ever been.  Beautiful scenery,  great food and fun things to do.  Bikes every where :)

title: False Creek walk
reviews: The walk from Granville Island, around False Creek and Stanley Park to Coal Harbour may be long but the constant changing views make it worthwhile. A spectacular walk with no car traffic to deal with at all. This walk is along the seawall pedestrian walk. You may meet bicyclists and joggers, as well as other walkers, but not a single car, and there are a variety of places to stop and take in refreshments along the way.

title: So much for the shopping foodie
reviews: You name it it's here. For a quick bite go to Hubbub on Hornby St and grab a pulled pork (3 day marinated and cooked) and jalape√±o baguette - it's probably the best sandwich I've had. AIX, Burberry and a host of big name labels and restaurants coming at you fro all sides - try a Japadog, once of the best food trucks here. Dim Sum at Kirin, a long satisfying lunch at the Italian Kitchen (get the meatballs!!). Be sure to wander along into the West End - an Asian cuisine lover's heaven!

title: Walking the streets of Downtown Vancouver
reviews: We did a self guided walking tour which included Chinatown, the Japanese Garden, the Steam clock, the port area with the massive cruise ships, and various other items of interest. Easy to get around, very clean, pedestrian friendly, easy to find food and amenities. Glad we took time to see some of the city on our visit.

title: Everything you want in one place!
reviews: So much to see, great to get around. Friendly people, transport great, easy walking too. Beautiful parks, markets and sea.

title: not so much to see
reviews: there are a view museums and a lot of shops but for all the other attractions you have to drive a little. the gaslight district is really nice too, but that's about it.

title: A beautiful park - best in the world? Our return visit
reviews: After over 18 years, we returned on a blistering hot sunny day to spend our wedding anniversary with our three teenage children, walking all around the beaches, marina and central areas to the totem poles and back for lunch. We are told Stanley Park was voted 'No 1 park' worldwide. Not a surprise, it is lovely.

title: Just an average downtown
reviews: Not very impressed with downtown area or it's shopping and I didn't find it very interesting or clean but they are a lot of different restaurant as it's a diverse city with multi cultural people.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: I have never done so much walking in a city as I did here and enjoyed all the sites that were easy to get to and it was also a good workout for those that enjoy exercise to help ware off those added calories.

title: Great variety
reviews: What an easy city to get around in.  Walking to major points of interest is comfortable and quick.  And visiting Granville Island or Stanley Park is easily accessible by bus.  Or, if you choose the aqua ferries, you can see almost all the points of interest.Gastown is a must see, as it has an old steam clock that whistles every 15 minutes.  And the shops and restaurants in Gastown are not to be missed!

title: A Great City for Walking Around, Sighteeing, etc.
reviews: Vancouver has great diversity as a city, much to see and do and great restaurants and bars. To get a bird's eye view of it all, head to the Vancouver Lookout atop one of the tallest buildings in the city and walk around to get a 360 degree view of everything the city has to offer. Or, better yet, go up one from from the sight-seeing area to the restaurant and enjoy a great lunch or dinner while the restaurant revolves around the city for you.

title: Amazing city, friendly and easy to get around!
reviews: We love Vancouver, especially staying on the water. Watching the see planes arrive and take off, big cruise ships come to port, the beautiful mountains across the bay, great food, lots and lots of restaurants to choose from, and happy hours everyday, everywhere!

title: Very diversified
reviews: I loved Vancouver! I met some very friendly folks as I rode the metro and walked all over town. The metro is one of the cleanest ones I have ridden and on the weekend, there aren't any zone fares.  I purchased an all day pass and rode the buses, the sea bus, and the metro all in the same day. From Olympic Village to China town, and downtown to Gastown, I walked to my heart's content. There are some areas that I wouldn't  go at night but you have that in any big city. Each area had its own distinct flavor and smells. I thought Vancouver was very clean for such a large city. I would love to back again.

title: great city center
reviews: sunnrounded by water with many different areas, around water street, the conference center and granville. all different, close to each other and worth while visiting

title: Beautiful,easy to walk city
reviews: Great architecture, restaurants, activities, shopping.  Vancouver is a very cosmopolitan city but relaxed and fun at the same time.  There is so much to see and do if you venture out of the city, too!

title: Great place
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a great place to eat, shop and sightsee. There are lots of great restaurants to choose from to enjoy all types of foods. There are many shopping areas, Robson street, Granville Mall, etc. Plus there are many things to see; art gallery, Stanley park, Robson st. Granville street, Canada place, the harbour, etc. Most places are within walking distance. Other attraction are a short car ride or Transit trip away.

title: Wow, what to see next!
reviews: The "Hop on - Hop Off" bus was the way to see the city, then go back to areas of interest.  We do this everywhere we travel and found it to be the best thing to do.  We truly loved Gastown!

title: A fantastic city
reviews: What is there not to like about Vancouver - it's CBD is just so beautiful, situated on that beautiful water front. You can walk or bike for miles, watch the float planes come in and out, wander around the marina and see the houseboats - amazing shops, Gastown is just gorgeous ... just fantastic.

title: Good restaurants
reviews: Got ferry to Victoria on Vancouver Island and visited Butchart Gardens.  Amazing.  The most beautiful gardens we've visited.  Very comprehensive and the history was interesting.

title: See my posted review
reviews: We stayed here, Harborside Renaissance Hotel....see my detailed review posted 7/17/14,,,much details.

title: Chic
reviews: What a wonderful, clean and very young and vibrant place. We loved being in downtown the weather was sunny and there were lots of people but we never felt crowded or threatened. The "japadog"/"hotdog" stands are a delight you must try one they are very tasty for a quick snack or if you want something healthier try one of the many juice bars or nip into a "market" and chose a salad box. Variety of shops from high end designer or quirky. A lovely place.

title: Modern City
reviews: High Rise buildings everywhere, Shopping Malls, top Clubs n Bars at Granville St. Freaking nights on Friday and Saturday. Historic Sites. Hop On - Hop off Buses for city tours from Gastown.Steam Clock at Gastown.

title: Yes!
reviews: On your way by taxi / limousine / coach from airport into Vancouver you will pass Shaunessy Heights where the houses start at $5 million CAD.  The majority on the main road are a little less costly and many have a row of pretty cypress trees across the frontage to aid privacy and to absorb noise.Downtown Vancouver contains Stanley Park, lots of super hotels (including the Fairmont Waterfront; Westin Bayshore and several other five star hotels).  The architecture is pleasing on the eye (well mine anyway) and construction is mainly pale grey in colour.  There's a hotel with a tree growing on the roof to demonstrate the height of all the trees prior to the development of Downtown Vancouver.  The Sky Train is also located here.  There are several shops within the station and a restaurant.  Everything here us clearly signposted.Oh, do not leave your car engine running because after five minutes of doing so, the police will hand you a $250 on the spot fine.Vancouver actively encourages recycling with a recycling bin in your hotel room plus sets of three bins within metal frames for recycling / recycling / waste.  Wish we did this here in England.

title: Great guide & trip
reviews: We hired Viator Tours to pick us up at our hotel and they took us to the ferry & toured us through Victoria to see area and dropped us off at Buchard Gardens.  Then picked us up at a specified time and we continued our tour. He dropped us off for some shopping time & lunch and again met us at a specific time & spot. A very enjoyable day..

title: Compact and walkable
reviews: Loads of shops of all sorts, so many restaurants of all nationalities you do not need to go to Chinatown.

title: Fabulous buildings & eateries
reviews: Lovely for a mooch around and void. But be warned. Vancouver seemingly has a high ratio of homeless/meth addicts. You can be on a glorious street and turn left or right into another block & there is a total difference in people and places. I was genuinely surprised by this situation and it. An naked you feel very uncomfortable very quickly especially as taxis seem to abound the area too!

title: busy place
reviews: Full of life and people. The shopping is good the overall experience positive. On the negative side, a lot of construction works, and the streets are not always clean as you could expect. But we were there in August, summertime and high season.

title: Pretty Downtown / Waterfront
reviews: Vancouver downtown / waterfront area is quite pretty, with lots of restaurants and touristy spots. The architecture is modern and attractive and the Canada Place pier area is a hive of activity. Only ugly downside are the many beggars that are on every corner.

title: Traffic Snarled in Mid-Day?
reviews: I really wanted to see Vancouver by motorcycle after traveling across the United States from Key West, FL to Blaine, WA. I was so disappointed by the traffic, which was snarled even in the middle of the day. It took forever just to get into the city, and the traffic never let up. I wanted to go to Granville Island, etc., but I never made it. After a truly awesome lunch at Ouisi Bistro (get the Po'Boy), I rode around a little, remained frustrated with the traffic (although the drivers are exceptionally polite), and left the city...only to be caught in stop-and-go traffic for an HOUR trying leave. Ugh!

title: Loved it
reviews: The place is great. Looks clean. Green spots... The traffic is not as bad as I expected. People were very kind.

title: Seashore
reviews: Ultra modern buildings with huge stores and conglomerate headquarters, facing the Pacific and the other islands surrounding Vancouver where you can pick up a cruise to Alaska.

title: Amazing
reviews: Downtown Vancouver. There is just so much to do and see. We caught a hop on hop off bus so we could gauge what we wanted to look at further then mostly walked so as to take our time for photos. That way we could stop for a bite to eat or drink when we pleased

title: downtown vancouver, Canada
reviews: centrally located in the CBD lies downtown Vancouver in British Columbia in Canada. It has many skyscrapers with many shoppings to do with restaurants and cafes for gourmet.

title: Enjoyment
reviews: Vancouver is one of the finest cities of the world! I will rate it together with Sydney, Hong Kong, San Francisco, and Cape Town.

title: Go west!
reviews: After visiting the Vancouver Art Gallery I walked west along Robson Street and after covering several blocks headed south to Nelson to meet a friend who had invited me to dinner. I had forgotten how attractive this area is. Lots of trees, attractive housing, and an atmosphere of peace. There are many restaurants and boutigues, especially along Robson, which epitomizes the positive developments in Vancouver that began with the arrival of immigrants from Europe in the 1950s and 1960s. It's no longer the Robsonstrasse of 50 years ago, but no worse as a consequence. For lovers of urban life, Vancouver's West End is a compulsory destination. The downtown core itself is lively but more generic, and over towards Main Street the area becomes very gritty. Go west toward Stanley Park, and see the best of the downtown area.

title: Gastown
reviews: Gastown was terrific!  Slow down when walking around, some very interesting shops you have to walk downstairs to get to!  And the restaurants are great!!!!

title: Vibrant city
reviews: Truly a multinational city, each quadrant of downtown has its own charm. i really enjoy Yale town, Robson street, the beach walk and of course the convention center gas-town district. I feel safe walking around almost everywhere 24 hours a day.unfortunately, like all major cities on a good climate you will encounter some less fortunate begging on the sidewalks. overall  it is a great city to visit, i wish i could afford to live there!

title: A beautiful, vibrant downtown
reviews: Walk and enjoy, or opt for one of the hop on, hop off bus line tour options, or do both.  Bikes also are available for rent in many locations.  A growing city, with people, construction and things to do everywhere.

title: West end of downtown is best.
reviews: I agree with Paddy, I was in the same area Hastings and Main st. That is the area of at least two city missions. The lineup was a block long within two blocks of each other. It was sad and terrifying, walking dead should consider filming or casting there.  Cambie st north of Hastings has a great sandwich shop "MEAT AND BREAD" and Revolver coffee. I recommend taking a taxi to Cambie, these were two places not to miss just don't travel back towards Main St, especially if you have kids to avoid exposing them to some pretty rough whacked out characters.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Brilliant array of shops, a lot of small shops and some marts, not that many supermarkets like in the uk! but there are a couple, plenty of 7/11 shops which sell food, newspapers, travel passes, and phone cards etc.  There were a few beggars about and some parts of Granville street looked a bit seedy, you just need to look about and keep your valuables safe, Use a money belt just in case.  The area near Canada place was very nice, you can see the sea planes taking off!

title: Fantastic city!
reviews: I loved walking around downtown Vancouver. There is so much to see and do. There are loads of restaurants and shops everywhere. Many of the buildings are in themselves beautiful to look at such as the Vancouver art museum with works of art all around it. Canada Place and Gas Town are fun areas to walk around too.The streets are well laid out and easy to navigate. I walked 18 miles in the two days I spent in downtown Vancouver and enjoyed every minute of it!

title: A more relaxed New York.
reviews: So wonderful to have people on the streets all hours. So accessible and easy to walk. Great shopping and loved the Vancouver Art Museum - and easy walk to the water.

title: A big city...
reviews: Vancouver is a very big city with lots going on....lots of glass and concrete...and lots of funky little places, too. This is a very open-minded and very young city. Lots to do in the summer.

title: Scary
reviews: Lots of junkies and dope-heads hanging around downtown.  Homeless beggars are sad to see but mainly non-threatening but there were a lot more threatening individuals right downtown and towards chinatown in middle of day. I was shocked!

title: Vancouver - difference of opinions
reviews: Just returned froman excellent trip to Canada involving 5 nights in Vancouver in three different hotels; Century Plaza, Sandman and Robson on Rosedale.Hotels all great - we were upgraded to the Corporate tower at the Sandman. I would rate them on as 4* (our rooms).Stanley Park sea wall walk a mustThe aquarium is the best I've visited. Would love to hear about others which compete.Granville Island and Gas town worthy of short visitsRobson street and downtown busy but good if you enjoy lots of people, shops and restaurants - plenty of street beggars.Library - amazingly huge but could do with a facelift.The viewing tower - fantastic viewsCanada Place - good to see the other ships who went to Alaska with us.East Hastings Street - Wow! If you like resident evil then you will be fine. Not recommended......My wife thinks differently about some of the places and would not want to rush back- Stanley Park excluded.

title: Nice city
reviews: It's a very nice city.  I found it to be very clean.  I'd honestly like to go back and spend more time exploring.

title: Compact, dramatic, surrounded by ocean, parks, and walking trails.
reviews: I love downtown Vancouver.  It has everything in a small condensed area.  You can be amidst the hustle and bustle of Robson or Granville Streets, or completely lost in the forests of Stanley Park.  The accessibility to the ocean is amazing via the never-ending seawall.  I love the stretch between the Conference Centres and Stanley Park.  I find gazing at the mountains on one side of Burrard Inlet, then the busy inlet itself with massive barges, sea planes, and yachts, then the dramatic skyscrapers on the downtown side inspiring on many levels.  All the greenery adds balance to the skyscrapers, including the very cool green roof of the newest part of the Conference Centre.  I also appreciate the diverse communities in downtown Vancouver, Yaletown, the West End, Gastown, Chinatown, and even the downtown eastside (although much maligned I find it a safe and poignant place).  Not to mention the stadiums, great hotels and restaurants.  I try to get here as often as I can.

title: Start here your visit of Vancouver
reviews: Vancouver downtown offers a very nice skyline with its high buildings (however not to compare with NY skyline). Nice and clean streets, many with trees asides, full of bars, restaurants, shops. A special mention goes to the Christ Church Cathedral, with its incredible wooden ceiling.

title: Great shopping
reviews: Great shopping and dining experience however prices displayed are incorrect as they then add another 2 taxes onto the price Grrr

title: You'll fall in love with Vancouver
reviews: Vancouver has it all: Ocean, mountains, Aqua boats, Sky trains, fantastic Aquarium, and a great Zoo.  You can visit its famous Stanley park, plus it has more little parks than in any city anywhere!You'll be pleased to meet Friendly people and you'll find a million things to to see and do. Summer is packed with festivals: The Japanese festival, The Caribbean festival, The Jazz Festival, plus lots of Art and Theatre festivals(to name a few) there is Free entry to all these events including lots of free jazz at the park by the Roundhouse. Vancouver has Beautiful Native Art and crafts, and has an Aboriginal Historic museum. You'll fall in love with Vancouver the minute you land, and you'll come back again and again!

title: So much to do, so much to see!
reviews: This place is truly beautiful..  So much to do and see.  This place is clean and simple. The people are kind and considerate. Navigating the area is easy with public transportation and walking access.

title: Dirty with little to offer.
reviews: The downtown area is dirty and smelly.  Other than shopping there is very little that is appealing about the area.

title: For the young people
reviews: I'm a senior and find that this area is geared towards the young and the well-off.  I don't even attempt to buy clothes there anymore.  The small eateries are fun, though, with lots of cheap international choices.

title: Lively downtown Vancouver!
reviews: Enjoyed shopping and dining and walking around downtown.  I was surprised at how clean the downtown area is.  We felt very safe.  Had a wonderful time window shopping!

title: Vibrant and easy to walk
reviews: Decent restaurants, close to BC Place and Stanley Park. A few good coffee shops. Liked the ease of walking around.

title: Site seeing by car
reviews: We enjoyed driving in and around the old town area of Vancouver, here is an old city who has pride in their history and have made great strives to maintain the character of the area.  What a great place to visit.  The older part of town has a great neighborhood of old Victorian homes that have been restored and a lot of respect for the history for the area.

title: The hub of Vancouver Life
reviews: Our hotel was in Downtown, and the majority of restaurants are there too. Situated between attractions like Granville Island, Stanley Park, The Grouse and Capilano, you will always pass through this on your way around.Much of it was clean, and some of the buildings have amazing architecture.Davie was pretty, Granville St was fun - nightlife and shopping especially around Granville and Robson.Every city has a darker side - and we did see many homeless, especially as we drifted towards the Chinatown part. However, perhaps because we are Londoners, we never felt genuinely unsafe, just have your wits about you and don't put your wallet where it can be easily grabbed or levae a bike unchained outside.Getting around on the buses was easy, although much of downtown is walkable. If you are from the Uk, you will have to get used to the traffic system - quite different, where cars can turn right on lights, and you must only cross at intersections.Parts of downtown are regularly closed to traffic for street parties and celebrations during the summer - so there are street artists, company booths and many buskers - some great too.

title: One of the best spots in Canada
reviews: You have almost everything you want and need! Every type of food, nightlife, shopping areas and the best of all...nature just a couple of minutes away.

title: Mixed reviews
reviews: I have a difficult time summing up my feelings on the downtown area in Vancouver. On the one hand there is great shopping, food, etc. But on the other, there is a massive amount of poverty, homelessness and drug abuse. It makes me sad to think that in such a wealthy, prosperous Western city, you can have such a seedy underbelly to what is generally a very lovely place.Sigh...

title: Nice but no real centre
reviews: This is a lovely city but it lacks a central focal point.  Various areas at the edge of downtown have nice parts but there are also some areas to avoid, particularly at night.

title: A great urban experience
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has Robson Square, museums, world class shopping, and people from every corner of the globe.  I loved walking around, browsing, window shopping, and sampling many types of cuisine.  It's safe, temperate in terms of weather, and very walkable.

title: Plesantly surprised.
reviews: Lots to do and see. a nice way to end our Alaskan cruise. we  even got to see a Zumba commercial being made upon our arrival.

title: Best in Canada
reviews: A truly cosmopolitan canadian city.  Heavily influenced by asian and hipster populations the city is perpetually reinventing itself.  Get a bike - yell at cab drivers and wino's and have a good time exploring this amazing downtown.

title: Water street
reviews: Liked seeing old buildings,steam clock was charming,we had a delicious meal,easy parking,some good shops amongst the tourist shops.

title: Walk and walk!
reviews: We walked all over downtown including Chinatown, Hastings street, Yaletown, Gastown, Granville Street, Davie Street, False Creek and more. Lots of shopping opportunities, and lots of restaurants. Just wear comfortable shoes, and plan to go a few hours on two or three days. I think this would be impossible to do in one day.

title: Lots to see and do
reviews: It was a great city to walk around.Take the trolley to get an idea of where you want to go then head out on foot and bring good shoes and an appetite.There are so many places to eat and all were wonderful.

title: Worst Traffic Ever
reviews: Bad traffic, worse drivers, transportation was basically a nightmare. Even though we did enjoy Vancouver as a whole experience, the traffic was enough to make me never want to go back! We found out after that public transit is the only way to go ( and even then it can be sketchy) so be prepared. However, it is a very lovely city with tons of great shopping and has lots to do. Just avoid the roads. All of them.

title: Not Your Average Downtown
reviews: We enjoyed staying at a downtown hotel on robson st.  Restaurants and shopping were so convenient. We found a small cafe which served a $7.00 breakfast, so we became regulars for the week that we were there.

title: Downtown Vancouver's liveable city
reviews: As I was taking some house guests from Montreal on a mini walking tour of downtown Vancouver last week, I thought to myself what a unique city it has become. Over the last twenty-five years or so, the old warehouse district of Vancouver's downtown has been transformed into a liveable neighbourhood with apartments and town homes, parks, grocery stores, and community centers. Mothers with strollers wheel through streets that used to house seedy nightclubs and hookers, so this change has been so welcome. Alongside this neighbourhood, there are many attractions for tourists to enjoy including the Art Gallery and Robson Square, The Main Library with its fabulous coliseum-like architecture, the Waterfront Convention Centre and Canada Place, Robson Street upscale shopping, and the historic Gastown with its steam clock and many vintage buildings. Each one of these areas hosts interesting stores and restaurants, along with our famous food carts that sell casual food from every corner of the globe. The West End and English Bay provide more entertainment delights as well as the beautiful English Bay and Sunset beaches bordering Vancouver's harbour, the local mountains rising in the background. The rainbow gay-friendly neighbourhood around Davie Village is also packed with good eateries and a youthful trendy vibe. All these sights can be explored on foot if you're a good walker, but if your feet start to ache, there is a good bus system plus efficient rapid transit to rescue your tired limbs. Or jump on a horse drawn buggy or trolley for a fully narrated tour of all major sights plus a history lesson thrown in as well.As I showed our friends all these sights on a clear sunny day in July, I couldn't helpfeeling proud of the creative mix of people and cultures that Vancouver has become, and this makes it a stunning travel destination for anyone willing to savor its delights!

title: Good the bad and the ugly
reviews: Mostly great some good and some bad and ugly.  The lower Granville entertainment district is great for the 18-25 set. Do not go into the area on Saturday and Sunday until the urine and vomit settles a bit. This is a HUGE distraction from and otherwise great downtown area and experience.  Can have clubs etc without this.  Further north it is historic high class building as one approaches the water fron

title: Very walkable
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is really easy to get around. You can basically walk everywhere. There are lots of great restaurants and food trucks. There's also lots of shopping. And, of course, there is the Stanley Park and the seawall. A must do.

title: Vinci Park-Canada Place
reviews: Our family did an Alaska Cruise from July 7, 2014 to July 21, 2014. We paid $ 347.19 to park for the 2 weeks at Vinci Park Canada Place. They advertise that "You will enjoy one of the many cruises knowing your vehicle is in a secured location. "  While this is an EXPENSIVE, yet convenient place to park for a cruise, it is DEFINITELY NOT SECURE!! On our return on July 21 we found the rear power window of our truck had been broken (approx. cost to replace is $700.00) and a few items stolen from the truck. One of the Vinci Park staff came out and took pictures and at that time told us they were not responsible. When we returned home we again phoned Vinci Park and the lady took all the information and said she would speak to a manager. All we wanted was to be reimbursed our parking fee to help pay for the window.  We waited another week and phoned again, actually spoke to the manager this time, they were very rude, and we were told again that they will do nothing to help and do not do refunds. The bottom line here is that it ended up costing just over a $1000.00 to park at Vinci Park-Canada place, Vancouver B.C.

title: Take your time, it's an amazing city!
reviews: Vancouver is a stunningly beautiful city. The transit system is great, easy downtown from airport or to many locations. So much to see in city-center, great shops, restaurants, bars, anything you want and more. Unforgettable!

title: City Tour
reviews: We purchased a 2-day Hop On, Hop Off city tour ticket.  What an excellent way to see all the sections of the city and to mark the areas which you want to explore.  The city was clean and the Canadians were most gracious and friendly.

title: Would have been great if it wasn't for the down and outs!
reviews: Vancouver should be a gorgeous City and we did enjoy it but what really shocked and dismayed us were the down and outs. I have been to NYC and London at their worst and never seen so many down and outs in such a small space. Every block had a beggar on each corner and going from Gastown to Chinatown was so horrible that we turned around and came back, a huge crowd of street dwellers and druggies made it really unpleasant. Come on Vancouver you should do better than this, your City is wonderful but you are allowing it to be marred by your vagrants...time to do something!

title: Lots to see
reviews: We went for a walk downtown when the street entertainers festival was on, lots of food trucks and entertainment, loved it!

title: wonderful
reviews: interesting visit of downtown Vancouver, you can walk through and always feels safe. different attraction not too miss

title: Watch where you go
reviews: Avoid Chinatown-----beggars and druggies all over the place. Gastown is a few blocks away and is safe and enjoyable. You just need to watch where you go and what hours you are out. There appears to be no gun use or violence like in some US cities. Best to use a taxi if out at night.

title: So much to do and see
reviews: From the fire works Friday night to the Pride parade on Sunday, there is so much to do in Vancouver!  Easy to walk and a very bicycle friendly place to be. Granville St is a pedestrian mall. Shopping, sight seeing go down there and experience Vancouver

title: Nice sceneray
reviews: We went to Canada plaza, saw cruiseships arrive and leave. Vancouver downtown is very relaxed to walk around, lots to see, lots to shop and lost to drink and eat. All is clean and you feel welcome

title: Amazing!
reviews: We saw a flyer for this attraction and decided to go along, I'm not normally one for the mega touristy things but this really did look interesting. Before we were seated for the film we were taken to a preview area which was a brilliant presentation in it's self!The actual film was just awesome, you really feel like you are flying over Canada, and if anything it made me want to explore as much as possible of this wonderful and diverse country!The entry fee is well worth it, a must for first time visitors to Canada!

title: Interesting and full of life
reviews: There is everything you would need or want.  The shops along Robson are tremendous and varied.  Granville has a lot of restaurants to choose from.  There are a lot of homeless but they don't bother you as you make your way around.

title: A Walkers Delight
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is relatively compact with very interesting architecture, restaurants a plenty and shopping if you so desire. Neighborhoods vary from funky west end to Chinatown, the Gas Light District and a couple of waterfronts.

title: Hop on Hop off walking tour of Vancouver
reviews: Many of the stops were wonderful tourist attractions.  The highlight for us was Stanley Park.  Vancouver has many food outlets that are informal and include every kind of food under the sun.  The views of the harbor are wonderful.  The city seemed to be very safe for tourists.

title: Busy Area in Amazing Location
reviews: Downtown Vancouver offers lots of shopping, good restaurants and easy exploration on foot. Public transportation is excellent so a vehicle is unneeded and is to be avoided, if possible, because of the high cost of parking. If traveling by car, I highly recommend staying on the other side of False Creek on the West Side (I'm not referring to the West End or West Vancouver), where it is usually easy to find free parking.Then take a bus to Downtown Vancouver.The Downtown area shows off many high-rise, glass buildings, which I find to be uninspired architecture. But there are some standouts, such as the central branch of the Vancouver Public Library, which resembles the Roman Coliseum. Many homeless people are around, but they are quite harmless. Some visitors find it uncomfortable to walk from Gastown to Chinatown because there are often unsavory characters hanging out in the area between these two parts of the city. I have walked this segment many times during the day, as a lone female, and have never experienced a problem.For me, the best part of Downtown, aside from the pleasant people I always interact with there, is its spectacular location, with both mountain and water views plus magnificent Stanley Park on its western edge. Walking part of the seawall gives a good appreciation of the city's interaction with nature.

title: Easy city to explore
reviews: I went to Vancouver for 9 days this July with my two older sons. It was an incredibly easy city to explore. I walked it and drove around in it and never had any problems with either. Driving made me a little nervous because the lanes just seem so narrow but we were fine. There are a lot of homeless people everywhere and drug use is obvious but I never felt unsafe. I've been in cities all over the world and despite what we saw here, this was one of the safest feeling cities we've ever been in. We explored miles and miles of Vancouver on foot and I wouldn't hesitate to do so again (like anywhere - just use your common sense.) We saw plenty of officers in marked and unmarked cars. We sat in the parks and only twice were we approached by people begging. The first time it happened the man was so polite we did help him with a little something. The second time I couldn't understand what he was saying (it was French) and told him to move on which he did. Some people stopped and just started telling us stories out of the blue while we were on the street. They were all very entertaining and after we said something like "oh, that's nice" they went on their way. Vancouver is a very busy city. There is always something going on. I am already looking forward to going back.

title: Lovely waterfront city !
reviews: Travelled in July 2014 with 1 senior, 2 adults, 2 kids - 3 and 8 yr. Very nice waterfront based city. Easy grid of streets. We stayed at Holiday Inn in downtown. Great restaurants close to the hotel. Went to Stanley park, pier, bay area - great places for the kids to hang out (beach, sand, walking, cycling trails, multiple play areas for all age kids, tennis and basket ball courts, huge pool close to the bay). Food - Ate Malaysian, Thai, Indian Thali's. Do venture a little further to Surrey (for Indian shopping and dining)A trip to Vancouver is recommended !

title: Spend some time in the city--Downtown Vancouver, BC
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city--so compact--that needs to be explored.  There is so much to do and so many great places to eat that you can spend days in the city and never run out of things to do!  Too many people look at it as a place to "leave from" instead as a superior destination.  This was our third time in the city--we never tire if it.  It is the Paris of North America!Plan to visit the gas light district--a couple of hours at a minimum.  Very nice shops and Inuit art stores.  The hop on/off bus is an easy way to take in the city ad to see venues that are of interest to you.  There is a free boat ride to Granville Island included in it.  The Island is a real adventure--lots to do, see and eat.Stanley Park is a real highlight.  The bus makes many stops there and you can pick it up every 15 minutes.Do not miss the gardens in the city--they are a real treat!  They are well maintained and have great plants for the region.  North Vancouver has some great antique shops.  South Vancouver has some wonderful art galleries with outstanding prices and willingness to mail your purchases to you.  Cruises out of the city are as easy as any city we have ever used.  They k ow how to move people!  The airport is excellent, but entry can be a problem if you arrive at the wrong time--peak hours for arrivals.  Try to get there at med morning to early afternoon--not at the morning or evening high traffic times.This is an easy "walking city"  because it is very safe and has an easy to follow "grid" pattern to the streets.

title: Disapointed
reviews: Not impressed. We have no interest coming back except for the restaurants in the Yaletown district. We were very surprised at the number of comdominions in the area.

title: Good, but a little scary.
reviews: On one hand, I really enjoyed the downtown area because there are so many cool shops... so many cool restaurants. I kept thinking that Vancouver was an amazing city and that I'd love to move there. On the other hand, there's a lot of homeless and there's very open and obvious drug-use. It's hard to feel safe when there's three guys shooting up right beside you. (And I wasn't on East Hastings... I was outside the Vancouver Centre, downtown) I've lived overseas for many years, and it's rare that a city gives me the creeps as much as Vancouver did that day. On the other hand, walk 30 minutes to the Olympic Village and suddenly you are in Elysium.

title: vancouver before we toured on the rocky mountaineer
reviews: we flew to Vancouver from boston on july 20th. this was a two night stop before we boarded the rocky mountaineer train...we arrived at the Sheraton wall....and the next morning we rode on the on and off bus...so we really got to see the city....actually we went around twice and got a wonderful feel of the city...we loved Stanley park...and we found china town very interesting...we got off the bus in gas town and had lunch at the old spaghetti factory...it was a beautiful day so we ate outside...for dinner we ate at gotham steak house...very pretty but average steak....we found Vancouver to be beautiful and friendly and would love to go back and spend more timein this interesting city

title: Wonderful downtown
