reviews: Great downtown with great architecture. Tons of great places to eat, lots of fantastic museums, and located where you can experience the outdoors without having to go far.

title: fabulous
reviews: we were based in downtown and found the city compact and easy to negotiate. Streets are all named and once you get the hang of grid system it is so easy. Most of what we wanted to see was within walking distance but there are buses and taxis aplenty. We were slightly taken aback by the number of homeless begging on the streets but most were ok and left people alone.

title: Buzzing little city
reviews: The high density, loads of art and excellent food choices as well as the population diversity makes this city pop.  There is much to do and see on a bright lovely summers day and people are smiling. Vancouver is full of wonderful surprises in this very walkable, very liveable and amazingly clean waterfront city.

title: Week end Happenings in the summer
reviews: A lot of fun things on week ends on Granville Street.Music, food and lots of other interesting things.Even free hugs..

title: street wandering
reviews: street wandering in a charming downtown core with elegance, spectacular views of the harbour & local mountains plus lots of  eccentricities.

title: Stanley Park
reviews: Probably the best urban park I've ever experienced, in its combination of magnificent walks along the water (English Bay and Burrard Inlet) and beautiful, tree-lined roads just inside the shore line. And the proximity to the West End makes it all the better.  Great paths for bikers and walkers too (although the markings for each group could be clearer; we witnessed two biker-walker collisions on a several hour walk).  Several good restaurants, playgrounds, and playing fields inside the park make it family friendly too, and easy to spend lots of time there doing different things.  Most visitors focus on the winding northern walkways along the water, which are wonderful, but if you're in town several days the walk from the south, starting at the lower end of Denman Street, is serene and and lovely too.

title: Multicultural food, beautiful buildings and lots to see
reviews: One of the nicest cities I've been to with everything you can think of in one place:  lots of restaurants of all cuisines and budget, libraries and architectural places to see, shops. This was a great place to visit and remains one of my favorite cities.

title: Vancouver is a modern town
reviews: Vancouver is a fun town and lots to see.  Shopping & bars and sites galore.  The downtown area near the waterfront is extremely nice.  Don't miss the Steam Clock near Canada Place.

title: City of Glass is very apt sobriquet
reviews: Vancouver is a very beautiful city, full of lovely modern architecture, lots of light, young and vibrant people. Walking around downtown is great fun and a wY to get a feel for the life of the city, from the convention center, the Seawall, the sensational courthouse and the art gallery, definitely one can appreciate Vancouver by walking around as much as possible.

title: Quaint and interesting.
reviews: Wish I had more time here but the quick bus tour I did get makes me want to go back. Full of history and the geological aspects are just as interesting. My time there was too short.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: There is not much else to do but eat and shop.  It is clean and the locals are friendly.  Can't comment on the public transport because we tend to use the hire car a lot.

title: I LOVE Vancouver !
reviews: could honestly live in this city.It has everything !Beautiful harbour, shops, scenery, people ~ restaurants and a great climate when we were there ~ ( not always though I believe ~ we were lucky )

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is beautiful!   There is a lot to do!  You can walk around the bay!  There are many great restaurants in the area!   Sushi is very good!  And very under price! Many people rent bike!   It is a very pet friendly area as well!

title: Best Mix of Food, Beaches and Hotels
reviews: Huge variety of international cuisine, and hotels from budget to high end.  The most bustling 3 streets are Robson, Denman - which is closest to the beach area and Davie.  Grab a bite to eat on Denman and then you can walk on the beach at English Bay and enjoy a marvelous sunset right in front of you with the sun disappearing into the water, amazing!

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: We were only able to spend one day in Downtown Vancouver but the bed and breakfast where we stayed was in easy access to the main street. We visited shops, gift shops, cafe's restaurants, Canada Place where the cruise ships berth, Gastown and China town. Where ever we went people and shops staff were always very helpful, polite and had an interest in us.

title: Robson St, Hudsons Bay - all Canada musts
reviews: Fun to check on Canadian flavor - much like US now - excellent stores or funky - girl teens love Forever 21 (visited 5 this trip...)

title: Nice places to eat
reviews: Good for shopping and getting the gifts you need. Nice restaurants.Very easy to get to.Liked the trips on the trams.

title: Location, location, location
reviews: Downtown Vancouver (DV) is "the place" to stay when visiting (or transiting) Vancouver.Just 15-mins. away from the Rocky Mountaineer's main station and 30-mins. away from the international airport, DV is strategically located and within walking distance to most restaurants (i.e., at Hamilton Street), shopping areas (i.e., Pacific Centre and Robson Street) and major attractions (i.e., Stanley Park, Gastown, Granville Market, Science Musuem, Vancouver Art Gallery, etc.) including complimentary pick-up and drop-off points/shuttle to two of the most popular attractions in Vancouver (i.e., Capilano Bridge and Grouse Mountain).  Boarding station for whale watching by Pacific Whales is also conveniently located within DV. If required, taxi not a problem.  Visited during summer, weather pleasant.  Cooler in the mornings and warmer from mid-day onwards. A number of people begging and living rough on the streets, but overall, DV is clean, safe and ideal to walk (or cycle) to most attractions. Pack-up some good walking shoes and save those taxi fares for the expensive attraction fees instead. A multicultural city, five-days probably enough to see the city.  Gratuities appear to be the norm in most establishments or anyone providing a service and can be irritating.  GST tax no longer recoverable by tourists.

title: downtown streets blocked off for street hockey
reviews: Charity street hockey has taken up a lot of the streets on this Saturday. Great but makes this area even busier than normal.

title: Great walking but stay away from Hastings Street unless you want to buy drugs or get robbed
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a great area to walk around but I strongly recommend knowing where you are going.  Gastown is a nice area but we decided to walk towards Chinatown and realized we should have avoided that area.  We walked down a street called Hastings and it felt like we were in a completely different city, the area was full of drug addicts and street thugs and possibly a homeless shelter was located on one of the blocks, we walked about three blocks to get out of that area and back into the nice part but it was three blocks of looking over my shoulder the whole time.   Not a safe area for tourists to wander into, I didn't see anything in Chinatown either since it looked pretty shady as well so wouldn't recommend going there either.  I loved Vancouver but I had never seen so many drug addicts on one single street before in any other major city I have been to and I have travelled a lot, lived in NYC and Miami.

title: Absolutly amazing!
reviews: Vancouver is one of the most beautiful place in the world!Imagine: the ocean, the mountains and all that beautiful parks, all in downtown !A lot to see and all well maintain, and maybe if you lucky enough can meet a bear in the town as well. Everywhere you go you may find something beautiful to see, me and my family were very impressed and it will be definetly a remember for life.We had the chance to visit a lot of parks like Rocky Point, Elisabeth Park with his fantastic gardens, Stanley Park I will say the best! Beautifull beaches, unic lakes very well prepared for a bath if you wish, forest everywhere, and a lot more.If you didn't had the chance to visit Vacouver the¬¥n do something!Have been there 2013 in July with family, one children.Aquarium was a nice experience, especially for children a lot to see as well, you will need a day for that.

title: Good
reviews: The hotel was nice, but the amenities were lacking there and it was unclear as to where we could get information.  This was the Fairmont in Vancouver.

title: Great place to walk around.
reviews: The town is very accessable and easy to walk around.  There are plenty of places to eat and shop at.  We felt very safe the entire time and enjoyed eating our way around town.

title: Cutest place ever
reviews: Stayed in the Downtown are on June-July 2014. This place is THE place to be. From Davie Street you find everything you might find, and it's a short walk to Canada Place and English Bay. People are nice and kind. There are maps and info boards for tourists, too.

title: Loved the downtown area
reviews: Great place to see the sights, shop and just wander around.  Very clean city with lots to do.  They have great areas to walk that make this city very enjoyable to visit.

title: Great value shops
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has one of the best shopping areas we have visited on our travels.There are lots of shops selling everything you could be looking for.From souvenirs to designer label clothes.

title: A nice place for a walkabout
reviews: We enjoyed strolling through the downtown area and looking at the architecture.  You will find ample pay parking near Stanley Park just off West George St.  There were enough variety in the shops and restaurants to please just about everyone.  There was ample shade and places to take breaks.  Definitely recommend spending some time to walk around.

title: A village setting In a cosmopolitan way
reviews: A downtown that is not abandoned after the work day ends. Offering shopping, the most amazing restaurants in any type of food you could ever desire.  Shopping in all price ranges. Encompasses the Soho vibe in Yaletown, the eclectic Granville street, the artists and young professionals on the cobblestone streets of gastown, and many other niche vibes.  A wall along the sea offers a beautiful view for bikers, skater and walkers and surrounds the massive Stanley Park. With many live music venues, three beaches and bus stops that take you right up to the mountains vancouver truly has something for everyone!

title: Views, Food and Entertainment
reviews: Gas Town, The Harbour, Shops and Hotels.Tour pick ups, Sea Planes, Cruise Ships and Street Entertainment, all are here.

title: Granville Island
reviews: What a fun place to visit.  If you have children there is an entire area devoted to them.  The public Market - grocery and vendors - will make you wish it was in your town!  My husband loves cheese.  There were several vendors with cheeses I had never heard of and they offered free samples on everything.  A lot of shops and restaurants.  A bit of a tourist trap but the lure in irresistible

title: Great walking city
reviews: Stayed at the Coast Hotel on West Hastings so we were very close to the harbour which was very nice.  The city is great for walking to local attractions such as Gastown, Chinatown, etc.

title: Gastown, Vancouver
reviews: Lovely older part of town lots of atmosphere, very pretty.  We found 'The Coffee Bar' here and enjoyed our coffee it was great the best we had found in Vancouver - thanks to the 49th parrallel coffee roasters.

title: Restaurants galor
reviews: If you like to walk around, visit local shops, or try different types of restaurants, you will want to visit downtown Vancouver.

title: Different enough to feel exotic to a Brit!!
reviews: In the UK, USA and Canada you will find that there are familiar named shops/stores in all three places. But as a lover of both Drug stores and Department stores I thought that there was enough that was "different" to make shopping fun and very tempting! The prices are comparable to the UK ( unless you are a fan of Primark, which I am not!) and the quality very good.I must have been impressed because I had to buy 2 more suitcases to get my purchases home!

title: Beautiful city.
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has to be one of the coolest cities I've visited, not to mention one of the cleanest. I've never felt so safe walking around at night, and there are tons of impressive skyscrapers, both old and new.

title: Ugly and full of homeless
reviews: Vancouver downtown is just another downtown. Similar to any downtown colonised by England. A lot of Japanese restaurants, which I love. My observation is Vancouver is full of homeless people. Perhaps the biggest concentration of homeless in the entire Canada!!

title: Beautiful, walkable city
reviews: This is a vibrant, easy to navigate city that is clean and safe. We took a tour after our cruise and then when back to the waterfront area on the amazingly efficient Skytrain (a train every 3 minutes!). You can stay a a more reasonably priced hotel outside of downtown because you can easily get to where you want to go via there trains and buses. It would be a good idea to take a tour so that you don't miss anything that you would like to spend more time doing. One thing I particularly liked was that this seems to be a downtown that the residents use and love. It had a very comfortable, happy atmosphere. Lovely city, lovely waterfront!

title: Getting Around
reviews: We picked up the hire car when we left Vancouver to go over to Vancouver Island and returned it when we got back to Vancouver from Whistler. You do not need a car to get around Vancouver. In fact part of the pleasure for the children was to use the trolley bus, the skytrain and the sea bus. Consider buying a day pass if you intend to use public transport a lot on the day. We didn't as the places we visited had enough to last us the day bearing in mind the children's age.Taxis. Although we had one vehicle to take us to our hotel from the airport to downtown Vancouver,  there were 5 of us. We were told we needed either 2 taxis or a limo to return (apparently downtown taxis can't take more than 4 persons!) We could  have spent a week in Vancouver easily. There is so much to see,

title: Classy Downtown
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is very impressive - it exudes a real sense of excitement and architectural diversity.  There are plenty of really good restaurants and night clubs.  We have enjoyed every one of our visits to Vancouver and never feel as though we've exhausted its many attractions and sights.

title: one of the greatest citis of the world
reviews: amazing restaurants especially those inside the gaztown , yellow town , very organized and clean city but didn't like the night life , it's kinda boring , I enjoyed Montreal night life

title: Lunchtime snack...?
reviews: Try Mom's Grilled Cheese Truck on Howe at Robson/Georgia - absolutely delicious and very filling - CAD $ 10 - a bargain

title: great!
reviews: something for everyone. lovely atmosphere for wandering round. shops, museums, excellent transport. A lot to offer, but all easily accessible. Recommend a tour on hop-on-hop-off Big Bus.

title: Skyscrapers, great shopping, excellent food all within walking distance
reviews: We had to purchase a dress pair of pants for my husband.  No problem, this is a downtown used by the residents and they have everything you could possible want.  For tourist stuff, try Robeson Street.  There are fine eating places all over, especially in Gastown.  You can walk off your meals by strolling to Stanley Park.  If you feel the need for more exercise, rent a bicycle and take the 5 mile trail all around Stanley Park, with water views all the way.  Care to walk?  you can take the same trail because they have paths for bicycles and paths for walkers.

title: Pretty town to walk around
reviews: You will enjoy the waterfront area with a lot of interesting art and things to see and do.  Nice restaurants and flowers were everywhere.  Very nice bus system.

title: Nice vacation
reviews: Great place to vacation, plenty to see and do. Easy place to get around. Recommend one of the hop on hop off bus tours. Just so you don't miss anything

title: Upmarket in Downtown
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is diverse and wonderfully spacious and clean. A vast number of hotels of high quality and excellent shopping facilities backed by superb restaurants with a huge variety of cuisine. The big red bus or the pink bus systems operate throughout the area and are interchangeable giving time to stop and explore then catching another of the regular coaches.

title: Great City
reviews: This has got to be one of my favorite cities.  It's clean, it's small and so easy to walk around.  The people are very friendly and helpful.  Lots of great restaurants and live music.

title: Clean and Safe
reviews: We were there for the Jazz Festival.  The streets could not have been cleaner.  The traffic was busy, but never dangerous.  Taxi's were plentiful except on Granville Island.  Taxi's left a lot to be desired at this location.

title: Very Happening Towm
reviews: This city is filled with young very well dressed professionals. Looks like the Hollywood of Canada. The downtown is so clean and it is one of the safest feeling cities I have ever been to.

title: Awesome
reviews: Vancouver really is a world class city. During our stay, we would simply walk around the city and experience everything there is to offer. The city is also extremely bicycle friendly, and I highly recommend riding through/around Stanley Park where there is also beach access. Gastown is also a great spot to walk around as there are numerous bar and restaurant options. We went in August, and therefore it wasn't too hot. Would also recommend going to Granville Island, as it is a cool little spot to find art and small souvenirs.

title: Walk and see as much as you can
reviews: We enjoyed walking downtown and soaking in all the city has to offer.  For example, although we did not visit the Vancouver Art Museum, it was delightful to see the Thursday evening impromptu (or is this well planned?) outdoor chess games that go on in the outside garden area of the museum.Tip:  Avoid paying for hotel bottled water and grab a couple of bottled waters at London Drug.  It's also a good find for snack foods.

title: Convenient
reviews: I love downtown Vancouver as it's so easy to get around and is always bustling with people from all around the world and it's very easy to walk from one beach on one side of town to the other. Fantastic cuisine through out downtown as well, from great food carts to five star restaurants.

title: Easy city walking and biking
reviews: Great friendly downtown area with lots of shopping, dedicated bike lanes, restaurants and Vancouver Art Gallery. Very pleasant area.

title: Vancouver - City of Culture
reviews: Both my wife and myself explored several areas of the city and at no time were we hassled and never felt more safe. The parks were brilliant, busses easy to use, people put themselves out when we got lost. Works control personnel were very quick to point us down alternative roads due to road repairs. Wished I had my camera ready as down Roberts street were aoorox 300 skateborders rolling down accompanied by police. Something to do with the teachers strike out there. According to my wife lots of shops to peruse, me i went to the Hall of fame in the big football arena. Spent a lot less then the wife

title: Plenty of Tourists
reviews: We stayed in the downtown area and enjoyed walks through Yaletown, Gastown, Chinatown, and the West End. Easy walking; pedestrian friendly. Mostly clean. Several apparently homeless were sprawled out along the west end of Grantville Street.

title: Warm area
reviews: I have been at downtown every time I go to Vancouver. Granville street is very nice and children love it .

title: I want to go there one more time
reviews: The most safe Downtown area of any city in the whole world where you can walk and walk without getting bored or feel unsafe. Lot of things to do and to see, and surprinsingly clean. Granville, Cordoba st, Robson st. and many other are worthy to see. Gastown it's a gem one of a kind!

title: Downtown Vancouver.
reviews: Interesting places to visit such as Gas Town and China Town and numerous places to eat and drink.BUT the downside, and really needs to be addressed by the City Authorities, is the number of down-and-outs and beggars around the Central Station and nearby streets.  Quite intimidating and unnerving.

title: so many things to do
reviews: The place has so much to offer, with restaurants and shops and people watching. The area becoming shady quickly though. For example, lots of homeless people on granville - just a couple of blocks from the very busy burrad and robson. Walking east of cordova and china town area also didn't feel ok. Overall, loved the city.

title: Touristy Downtown
reviews: Downtown Vancouver definitely is a tourist's pleasure. Everything and everywhere caters to tourists young and old alike.  Just be patient with the traffic especially during peak hours.

title: Very pretty city
reviews: Stayed in the historic Fairmont Hotel in heart of Vancouver. Easy to get around town.   Plenty of excellent restaurants and evening music spots.

title: Touring downtown Vancouver!
reviews: There is an abundance of shops & restaurants to visit.  Lots of other tourists & locals are out and about so we always felt safe.  Excellent service with regards to the Skytrain and the local city bus service was amazing. A family member was a patient in St. Paul's Hospital, so for breaks we would walk through different areas. There are street people around.  They would ask for a handout as we walked by, but none were aggressive or hounded us. So really not a problem.  The Yaletown area made me wish I had a bike as there was lots of cyclists! I would have done some organized tours but was spreading my time between seeing the sights and hospital visiting.

title: it's quicker to just walk...
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is Beautiful but driving downtown Vancouver sucks! quicker to walk or ride a bike.Many one ways with no turning arrows and if you are unfamiliar with the area it can be easy to get turned around.

title: Dynamic
reviews: If you stay at a downtown hotel you will never need your car during your stay, as everything is close at hand if you like to walk.  Be prepared to be amazed at the selection and diversity of the stores.  And don't miss the food carts by the art gallery; they are amazing!!  Not Your Mama's Grilled Cheese is to die for!  Messy but soooo delicious!!

title: Most Beautiful City
reviews: Vancouver is by far such a beautiful city.  It is clean,  and the sidewalks are well maintained.  Public transportation is top notch.  People are friendly snd you c a n tell this is a city for the young and professional.  Oh to be young again Vancouver would be on my radar.

title: Vancouver, a beautiful city!
reviews: Vancouver downtown is a vibrant, beautiful, eminently walkable city we enjoyed greatly.  Lots of restaurants, pubs, shops, all within easy walking distance.

title: Robson st. is no longer what it used to be
reviews: Lots of vacant stores for rent, too many similar shops, korean restaurants everywhere. Vancouver is still great but Robson is not what it used to be.

title: I loved it...
reviews: Vancouver is known as one of the best cities in the world but it is not famous for history or wealth then Why has it won these prizes go there and you will find out ...

title: Gas Town
reviews: Great historical location and quite quaint, good for finding those unusual souveniers. Walking distance from the Westin or waterfront and downtown hotels. Great morning or afternoon activity.

title: Hope you have nice walking shoes.
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has it all. As a Vancouvorite I will tell you my favourite parts/recommendations. Try Cookies by George, eat at the abundance of food trucks, try Cupcakes, walk along Stanley Park's sea wall and get wet in their water park, walk through the library, get a massage at spa utopia, buy some fat burger doughnuts, go to the dirty apron cooking class, check out the canada place walk around, look at the Olympic torch and then get a Starbucks beverage from across the street, have a drink on the outside patio of cactus club, eat excellent gyoza at joeys, haves one crab cakes at joe fortes, have a steak at Gotham, take a photo of the art gallery, buffet at sutton place hotel and try out their spa, shop on robson, check out the awesome chapters and get another Starbucks drink, see a show at Rogers arena, check out an event at BC Place, laugh at the crazy prices of groceries at an iga, have a japadog, see a movie at the scotia bank theatre or the cinemas at international village with almost no one else there, buy something different at T&T, and get inspiration from Dressew.

title: Enjoyed the stores and experience
reviews: You can easily walk Downtown Vancouver and cover every corner.  I especially enjoyed Robson street and variety of stores.  Hastings St. is not far away and has some high end stores (like Versace) - going east you want to stop at Abbot St.  There are many places to eat and there is literally a Starbucks on every corner if you need to catch internet air waves.  Granville St. has interesting shops as well, but you also find more street musicians and random sketchiness.  It's easy to get to other neighborhoods like Gastown, Yaletown - however there are parts of Chinatown that you want to stay away from.

title: Hustle Bustle
reviews: Busy busy busy. Great shops and amazing food. Even though it was busy on nearly every street you didn't have that sense of "caution" while walking around.

title: Vibrant Downtown
reviews: Very nice and vibrant Downtown with a lot of shopping and neat and clean.Be careful in shopping as Sales Taxes are a lot Higher here than USA.Like all big cosmopolitan towns is not cheap.

title: Great city to go for a walk.
reviews: My wife and I were in Vancouver for three days and walked everywhere. We stayed at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia across the street from the gallery of fine arts. We walked Robson street (several times), the waterfront, the marina, Gastown and to the ferry to Granville Island. At only one point did we feel a little concerned and that was on Hastings. It was just a very dirty street with lots of homeless people and some people that seemed like they were stoned. All my wife kept saying was "get me off this street". So we did it everything was better.

title: So impressed!
reviews: Vancouver was so clean and beautiful, and seemed very safe.  We didn't see any homeless people or others who made us feel threatened in any way.  It was easy to walk from downtown to many other areas such as Gastown and Stanley Park.  We prefer to use the services of a tour bus (hop-on hop-off) to get our bearings and to listen to local stories told by the tour guide.  This way, we are able to obtain an overview of the city and decide where we want to spend some time.

title: Hastings St.
reviews: Just a heads up on Hastings Street:  That is where the "less fortunate" folks live.  That is the term one of our drivers on the Hop on Hop off bus called them. There must have been hundreds living on the street, they didn't bother us, but we kept on walking!

title: Great Walking City
reviews: We have spent the past few days walking all over Vancouver downtown.  From Gastown to Yaletown to Granville Island and the Waterfront... Every are has a unique character and culture.  A lovely twin to walk around.  Safe.  Clean.  Cosmopolitan.

title: Beautiful Vancouver, beautiful BC
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city. It's very clean, friendly and safe! Lots to see and do. Be sure to see Stanley Park, Gastown, Lyn Valley, Granville Island to name a few beautiful places. What other city let's you ski in the morning and go to the beach in the afternoon? Visit. Vancouver!

title: Worth a walk around
reviews: I used to live in Vancouver in the 1980's so it's gotten big and busy and I believe a bit shabbier. Still, it's a big city and if you are visiting the area, you need to walk around and see it. Visit different neighborhoods. I didn't like the shopping on Robson Street, I did like Yaletown for restaurants, Gastown for the touristy excess, Chinatown seems pretty authentic.

title: Great walking town!
reviews: We stayed at a condo (City Center and walk to beach on Air B&B, hosted by Valentina and Boris) and walked to a great Greek Restaurant and Persian restaurant the next night. Fabulous accommodations, great food, and easy walks to all we needed!  Enjoyed False creek, Granville Island and the huge open market, before boarding our cruise ship to Alaska.

title: Vancouver is a great city for walking
reviews: We walked and walked through downtown Vancouver the last toe days.  Great weather and a free jazz festival helped, but this is a great city for walkers.  Clean, safe, and lots of foot traffic, combined with a wide variety of restaurants and shops.  I can't wait to come back

title: Vancouver a place to be!
reviews: Wonderful city, apart the weather!! I suggest you to visit Yaletown, Gastown, Grainsville Is. Downtown is very nice, full of everything you might looking for, people are open minded, Young city, full of vibe. Stanley Park bigger than Central Park at NY.  Hasting Street is terrible: full of homeless living in the Street, lots of elderly people, and disabled as well. Commercial Street is full of small stores, and restaurant sometimes very peculiar. But its a city you must see. Citt√† magnifica, a parte il tempo! Suggerisco di visitare Yaletown, Gastown, Grainsville Is.Il centro √® molto carino, pieno di qualsiasi cosa stiate cercando, la gente √® veramente avanti, Citt√† giovane, piena di vibrazioni positive. Staney Park √® pi√π grande di Central Park in NY. Hasting √® una via che pu√≤ lasciarvi senza parole, molta gente povera.

title: Fastinating at Night
reviews: We stayed one block off of the main street.  Boy did the town come alive just one block over.  Lot's of places to eat and hang out.

title: Busy Business and Tourist area.. Clean..
reviews: Busy business and tourist area, Many gleaming new glass sky scrapers and between many beautiful old landmark buildings. The water front area has cruise ships come in for short visits. Its like a cleaner smaller NYC. Great public bus and rail system. Queen Elizabeth park was very nice. Stanley Park is beautiful  and you could spend days there exploring. We took a public bus to Horse shoe bay, and a free shuttle to beautiful Capilano suspension bridge park. After 9 days we still had not seen all the sites on our list. But we did get to take a float plane to Victoria. It cuts the travel time between Vancouver and Victoria from over 4 hours by bus and ferry to just 35 minutes by air..

title: Walking foodie tour of the city
reviews: I booked this guided tour with Viator before leaving London. Our guide was Nadia Cameron, a very nice young lady who had vast experience and knwledge of the city. There were 10 of us in the tour and we visited about 5 or 6 restaurants where we tasted foods from different national dishes with wine. It was such a pleasant experience to walk around the city and be told of the history of Vancouver. Its a pity,it rained almost all day. Take a Brolly with you. Vancouver is notorious for unpredictable weather.

title: A LOVELY CITY
reviews: Vancouver is a lovely city to view without even going shopping.  the architecture of some of the buildings are an engineering delight.  It is a City though and like all cities it is a haven for shopping if you really want to do that.

title: Downtown visit
reviews: We ate and walked around Yaletown which had great bars, and eating places.  Super atmosphere, well worth a visit.  We ate at Bistro Sakana Japanese and were not disappointed.

title: Beautiful City!!
reviews: There is so much to see in Vancouver.  We took a tour with LandSea Adventures and got to see much more in a short amount of time and learn some facts as well.  The people of Vancouver are friendly and helpful.  Enjoyed this city very much!!

title: Safe downtown
reviews: We stayed in downtown Vancouver at the Hyatt. The place is abuzz well past 10 pm. Very nice to walk around. Lots of restaurants. So many transportation modes within reach.

title: West End worked for me...
reviews: Spent some time here. Walked along Davies Street. Tons of cafes, restaurants, shops, banks, pharmacy's etc., a true local neighborhood that is clearly Gay friendly. Close to the Granville Island ferries etc., Not sure how safe it is at night but things seem to be on the up-and-up.

title: The most beautiful dead city in the world.
reviews: I fell so much in love with Vancouver after several extended visits that I actually moved to the city.Mistake.  Angry, cranky city besieged with vast disparities in income and wealth.  It looks very pretty to the itinerant observer and it truly is a beautiful place.  The city's beauty is what destroys it.  People visit Vancouver and love it so much they buy a place here. Many, many of these people are wealthy residents of other cities.  These people buy up all the most attractive real estate; driving up prices beyond the grasp of locals and creating vast waste lands of seasonally occupied houses and condos.  Retail and restaurant businesses cannot get established due to the high property costs and lack of permanent residents to support them.  The most expensive parts of the city are virtual morgues 90% of the year.  Restaurants lack diversity and are empty by 10:00 PM on a Friday night.

title: Lovely City
reviews: Stayed in the False Creek area and close to everything. Bought the Hop on Hop off 2 day bus ticket.  Very well worth purchasing as you get to see so much of Vancouver.  A very pretty city, but again the only thing that spoilt it for me were the beggars.

title: Clean, felt safe
reviews: We spent a couple of days in Vancouver either end of an Alaskan cruise.  Very clean city.  Public transport people very helpful - spent time with us explaining how best to use the transit system for our needs - getting to Granville Island and the Airport.  We were generally lucky with the weather but you do need to bring both sun protection and a good coat or umbrella!Avoid an area called East Hastings.  We wandered into this area easily from Gastown. If like us you might need a few things that you forgot there are good shops like a large Hudson Bay store and a large shopping centre (Pacific Centre) right in the middle of town.We enjoyed our visit to Vancouver and will be delighted to visit again should the opportunity present itself.  If you are coming to Vancouver for a cruise we would recommend adding an extra day or two for a more extended stay.

title: Nice place to walk around
reviews: Nice place to walk around. Explore the shops and the surroundings. Go by the bay and enjoy the views.

title: My most favourite city in the World!
reviews: I could go on about this city forever. Great eating places all over, especially in Gastown. Hop On Hop off trolley buses a great way to see the city to give you an idea what you want to see. Some great shopping to be had too if you want designer gear of if you just want tourist shops too. So much to see and do in this magnificent and spotlessly clean city.

title: close to everything
reviews: Public transport right nearby. Waterfront look out . Walk to gas town. Clean. Plenty of shops and food courts nearby.

title: Travel agent conference
reviews: I had the unique pleasure of visiting this city for a conference; and I must tell you that this is one city to visit if you have a bucket list!  The grass is definitely greener on that side!  The foliage was breathtaking!  If you rent a vehicle,  make sure you drive to the ferry to ride over to Victoria Island!   Oh my goodness!

title: GASTOWN Better in the day time.
reviews: Visited Gastown, had a nice evening meal and then walked four blocks.    The steam clock is well worth waiting to hear it sound every 15 minutes.     Unfortunately the shops were mostly closed asround 9 pm.   The street area is spoilt by all the homeless and drug addicts begging for money.  It looked quite rough and dodgy, but during the day it is a lot safer and more touristy.    There is grafitti which spoils some of the lovely old buildings.   I would love to see the Council/government  clean up the area and really make it a top tourist attrraction.    Could not find a toilet sign in the area.

title: Very clean and safe city
reviews: Nothing to dislike that I could find. People are all very friendly too. I was impressed that I did not see one police office in the whole city. Gotta see the steam clock in the gas district sound off every quarter hour.

title: Beautiful area
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is awesome. So many places to eat and shop. It is very clean and has a wonderful easy to use transportation system even though I enjoyed doing more walking.

title: Breathtaking Glass City!
reviews: The view entering the city is jaw dropping! We decided not fight traffic and to cruise around on Sunday. A great city to just drive, get lost and see where you end up. If you want to walk downtown, park at the convention center. Park close to the hotel to make it easier to locate your car later. You can pay with a credit card. Meters are cheaper if you have the coins.  Most shops and restaurants take American money. The Visitor's Information is located directly across the street form the convention center. They have free wifi, lots of info and friendly folks offering help. Plenty of places to eat. Walking is very easy. There are plenty of paces to sit. Great photo ops.  Watch the time because if you do park in the garage you pay by the the 1/2 hour, it's easy not cheap.

title: Awesome City with Lots to See
reviews: So much going on here. I recommend the Hop On Hop Off bus so you can see it all. It goes everywhere including Gastown, Chinatown, Granville Island and Stanley Park and everywhere in between.

title: Good place to tour around.
reviews: Its nice, and has a lot of unique places to visit. Loads of history, and lots of Japanese residents living there for some reason. Other then that, its a nice place to stop by, just stay away from East Hastings area though. Its dangerous.

title: One of the most beautiful cities in the world
reviews: When I first visited Vancouver back in 2006 as part of an Alaska cruise, I instantly fell in love. It's a beautiful city surrounded by great views of the mountains with one of the best parks I've been to, Stanley Park. There's plenty of places to eat and shop at and there's so many things to do. Since visiting in 2006, I've been back two times back with plans to go back a fourth time in June.

title: Walking friendly
reviews: Vancouver downtown is pretty much like any Canadian city, except it's very pedestrian friendly, and the views are great also.Enjoy the wide sidewalks and the window shopping. The food eateries along the way and tucked into little cubby holes also help to make the stroll more enjoyable

title: Lot of restaurants
reviews: So many choices of restaurants. Nice shopping on Robson Street.  If you go to Gastown go before dark as that area has a lot of panhandlers. Restaraunts are good though.

title: What a great dowtown area
reviews: I don't think I have walked so far in my life. You can walk everywhere downtown or take the trollies. There is so many stores to shop. My buddy and I went to a park and let the girls shop there all day (that may have been a mistake). There are so many areas to shop and things to see. People are friendly, town is clean and safe.

title: Great Place to visit
reviews: My wife and I had a day to spend before and after our cruise.   Stayed at a Ramada Inn  on Granville so we were somewhat centrally located, but everything downtown is accessible by bus or walking if you're up for it.  Would recommend checking out the Yaletown section (Hamilton/Mainland St and Davie) of downtown for very nice variety of dining and local pubs/clubs.  Gastown section is OK.  Granville Street between Smithe and Davie seems to have a good concentration of late night venues as well.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is absolutely beautiful!  I call it the glass city.  One building reflects another since all of them are towers of windows.  The historical buildings are lovely, and most are open to the public.  The shops and restaurants are excellent as well.

title: Downtown
reviews: We stayed at the Blue Horizon Hotel right on Robson Street, what the locals call the 'Rodeo Road' of Vancouver.  It stays open at night until there is no one on the streets.

title: Compact, Cosmoplitan and Chic
reviews: Vancouver's Downtown is located within a relatively small parcel of land bounded by water, parks and bridges.  The restaurant scene is diverse and many options are available to sample world class "fusion" cuisine which represents the ethnic diversity found in the citizens of Vancouver.  It is possible to walk from one end of downtown to another with no difficulty going from Coal harbour to False Creek in about an hour, depending on how fast you walk and how able you are to resist the window shopping options combined with coffee and chocolate, both of which are found in many locations. Designer boutiques, department stores, Art Gallery and the Main branch of the Public Library are all worth a visit as is Stanley Park, Science World and the many public beaches.

title: Lovely
reviews: Great to spend a day walking around or shopping, always a lot going on and has some excellent restaurants.

title: Love Downtown
reviews: We love downtown Vancouver for all the stores, food, and attractions.  What a great city to live and visit.  You can never get bored or enough of this amazing city.

title: Beaches are great but DT is average
reviews: "Downtown" consists mostly of either bars, restaurants or a smattering of come-and-go funky fashion outlet attempts. Parking is terrible - driving is very frustrating. Vancouver's sites-worth-visiting are usually beach-area connected. Granville Island, English Bay area or Kitsilano beaches/shopping district is a much better option.

title: Historic Old Town
reviews: We took a post cruise tour of Downtown Vancouver.  Love old town as well as China Town.  Vancouver is growing up.  There are a lot of high rise condo there and being built.

title: One of the best cities in the world
reviews: I am from Vancouver but currently reside in TN.  My professional offices were downtown Vancouver for years.  I am very well traveled and can safely say that DT Vancouver is definitely one of the most beautiful and great cities in the world.  The city is, for the most part, clean, and has many things to do.  Typically, cities (at least in North America) do not have an active residential area, but Vancouver most certainly does.  It is, in my opinion, a much more enjoyable city to explore than New York or even San Francisco, although the shopping is probably better in both.  The restaurant quality and options, however, easily rival both cities.  There is a China Town, Gas Town, druggie area (East Hastings, stay away), business area, downtown underground mall (beside the Four Seasons), a gay district (Davie Street), beaches (English bay), a massive park (Stanley Park), museums, art galleries and an impressive array of hotels.  There is something for everyone to do.  I cannot say enough things about this wonderful city.  Go now!

title: Rude
reviews: Downtown itself is a great place to be...The shops are nice but they cater to a certain clientele and that is all.  People are very rude as they walk down the sidewalks and do not care if they plow into you.  I think people from all over the world should visit Vancouver but try to remember that manners still matter.  You are in Canada read a good on manners then use them.

title: Try the Big Pink Bus!
reviews: Great way to see the city--hop on and hop off where you like, and hear about the city as you are chauffeured around.

title: AN EXCELLENT DOWNTOWN
reviews: With a metro population of jus rover 2,000,000 downtown Vancouver is dynamic in both the visual and practical sense. It is dominated over by ultra modern high rise buildings, yet has trees and green areas. It is also filled with great restaurants, boutiques, coffee houses and major stores, including the large and well stocked Hudson;s Bay Department Store. Unlike U. S. cities, downtown Vancouver is crowded, safe and exciting. If Canadians can make it work, why are U. S. downtown generally places to be avoided?

title: Beautiful City
reviews: My favourite city - easy to get around, lots of interesting shops. Brilliant transport. Friendly staff in shops. Great prices.  Souvenirs are the same shop after shop after shop but prices differ!!

title: FUN City
reviews: All different kinds of shops, food, and culture all within walking distance.  Plan to spend at least 3-4 hours.

title: Great City
reviews: We had a fantastic 6 days in the City.  There is so much to see and do.  Granville Island, the View Tower, Canada Place, Gas Town, Robson Street, Stanley Park.

title: Can be expensive
reviews: Vancouver is a great place to visit if you like busy lively cities. There is plenty of things to do as well as an abundance of shopping but beware it is expensive. Don't be put off  it is still worth a couple of days of anyone's time. Stanley park is vast and has plenty to occupy a whole day, cycle, walk, horse carriage tour.

title: A vibrant melting pot
reviews: About half  of the inhabitants in Vancouver  use  English as a second language. The downtown reflects this in its cosmopolitan dining spots , shops and street banter in different languages, and modes of dress . This is a lovely ,clean city. It is beautifully landscaped and has superb architecture

title: Easy for walkeing and using public transportation
reviews: So many interesting things to see and do by going in any direction.  Use of a city map helps a lot to explore and enjoy.

title: City of Vancouver, great place.
reviews: Not so much about downtown Vancouver, more about the whole deal. Arrived in Vancouver by cruise ship early one morning in May, tied up right in the heart of the City, what a magnificent  view and location. Checked out the place using the hop on /off trolley bus which stopped at 34 places around the City including 6 in the 1000 acre Stanley park adjoining the west end of Vancouver City. Must say we found the locals very friendly and would go out of their way to help. We stayed at the Westin Bayshore hotel right on the water on Bayshore drive, great water views and easy walking to local restaurants close by. If you like shopping, the main centre is in Robson st, 1-2 kms away. We left by train to the airport, with much help from some friendly help from the locals who even helped us with heavy suitcases right to the train. Airport ticket cost $1.75 for over 60's, go by taxi will cost around $40. Vancouver airport quite spacious with food courts at either end seperated by a considerable walk, Vancouver is a very beautiful City and easy to see why it has been rated as one of the best in the world.

title: World Class City
reviews: The architecture, the eclectic shops, the many places to view the North Shore mountains make Vancouver a world class city. It is pedestrian and bike friendly. Comparable to San Francisco, if you visit just once, you will lose your heart to this beautiful city on Burrard Inlet.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: We on on a road trip which included Seattle, Woodinville (wineries), and BTW, a exceptional place to stay "cottage lake garden b & b" and now Vancouver.What a wonderful city.  Bursting with energy, friendly people willing to give directions if needed, outdoor activities, biking, running, walking.Great coffee shops, restaurants.Most amazing are the views from the harbor, beautiful mountains, cruise ships, sea planes.I am not a city person, prefer being in the mountains but I would go to this beautiful city again.

title: Nice place.
reviews: Very cosmopolitan and a huge variety of places to explore and eat. Would help if one realised the street name placards at junctions actually run in the direction in which the street runs and that the numbers alongside refer to the building numbers around that intersection. Very useful when on West Georgia St where the numbers go up to about 900 and walking to the hotel whilst carrying baggage, from the sky train is not the best of experiences. Our fault but may be a useful tip for future visitors. Public transport good but you need to have right money in coins if you are going to travel by bus. Driver was very helpful thank you ma'am. Excellent eating experience thank you to Travelzoo took a chanc e and booked a deal on line from Manchester airport in the morning and was very pleased with the outcome. Looking forward to further exploration next week but the prospects look very good.

title: Breathtaking
reviews: Whichever way you look at the city - its breathtaking - You must view the downtown area from RStanley Park and the area around Canada Place is a buzz.

title: A great place to spend a day or two
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is easy to get around, very active, lots of good restaurants, and filled with friendly people. We felt safe walking around day or night.  We were staying in an area with more "Alternative lifestyles", which made the experience more interesting, but never uncomfortable. It reminded me of San Francisco, which I love. Don't miss Sunset Beach Park or Stanley Park

title: Mini New York
reviews: We just loved Vancouver and its not surprising it normally comes out as one of the places people would love to live. Vancouver has everything all wrapped up in an area that is walkable. If you want high end shopping its there, if its culture its there, if its great restaurants and bars they are all there.

title: Food, Bars, Parks and the Ocean
reviews: It's all within walking Distance from Robson, if it's sunny you can even see the mountains.  There are lots of great places to eat and drink nearby.

title: Every thing you need.
reviews: We recently went to Cirque du Soleil show, stayed, shopped, ate in downtown Vancouver.  There is so much to offer - The Pacific Center for shopping, wonderful restaurants for unique eating experiences, medical specialists.

title: Auto Exotica in City Streets
reviews: When it was explained that the exotic auto sightings in Vancouver B. C. were not just because of the affluent neighborhoods, but also because California has different emissions standards

title: beautiful
reviews: We loved Vancouver! It is a city but certainly didnt feel that way. So many great spots to see close by. The hop on hop offbus was a treat. The transport system easy and convenient too. It has history, beautiful parks, resturants and waterways. A pretty and clean city whos awareness of 'green' is to be noted. So glad we stopped and saw.

title: City..
reviews: Easy to find your way around the city..hop on hop off buses can be found everywhere. You can walk  most of the city without any worries. We stayed downtown and I thought there were many homeless people in that area plus there was a pro pot smoking protest happening in the city that weekend which was a little confronting when touring with a teenager who probably thought it was pretty cool!!

title: Very clean town!
reviews: Liked the cleanliness & overall CBD experience! It catered for all tastes & budgets. No dislikes. There is a very good transport system from general to hop on hop off buses.

title: What a great city.
reviews: Vancouver is one of those few cities where everything is clean. A lot of the buses are electric and even the trucks are clean - they don't blow black smoke! Vancouver downtown is well laid out and it is easy to get around. It isn't noisy and it isn't crowded. A great place!

title: A City that is Not a City
reviews: This is one of those cities that does act like a big city, as one minute you can be around tall buildings and the next you are transported back into another older section of town.  Then there is Stanley Park which is its own oasis, and the city ebbs and flows from old to new effortlessly.  I found most of the town to be very charming and someplace I would like to return to again and again.  Now in fairness to anyone reading this and saying what about the bad parts; yes this city has a few of those too, but for the most part those are not as common as you would think.  I find this city to be on my top 10 list of cities around the world.

title: Great shops and restaurants
reviews: There are great shops and restaurants here and lovely walks around the docks. Lovely Souvenir shops a plenty, so you can definitely find what you're looking for!

title: Grouse mountain
reviews: What a fabulous day out the bears were grate the views were incredible good value for money Views from cable car were tremendous

title: Expensive & Dirty
reviews: Granville was filled with young homeless people who would walk up to you three and four times. Although clean near the water area, we found the Granville area of the city to be down right filthy. The sights are gorgeous on the outskirts of the city and Victoria Island, but everything was very expensive, $18 for a burger (and everyone sells burgers).  Spent 4 days and could have done it in 3.

title: Beautiful city!
reviews: The downtown Vancouver area is very special.  Went for a funeral for a beloved aunt and ended up falling in live with the city.  Easy to walk the downtown area and great shopping.  Stay at L'Hermitage if there are rooms available.  Very special boutique hotel that is actually rated the #1 hotel in Canada.  Treat yourself to an Amtrak ride along the water from Seattle.  $80 round trip.  Magnificent!

title: So much to do!
reviews: It was fun to walk downtown Vancouver! So many little cute stores, clubs, pubs, restaurants and great shopping. I found there are a lot of homeless on Grandville...you do have to watch where you step.

title: Great Mix of Old & Modern
reviews: There are many different buildings & views from downtown.  Do the hop on hop off trolley tour to make sure to see it all then get out there & walk.

title: Awesome!
reviews: What a wonderful city to visit! Easy walking, friendly, clean, safe, no problems! We loved it and can't wait to go back!

title: Everything you need
reviews: I loved staying in Downtown. It was in walking distance to everything- great bars, restaurants, harbour, gas town! Just great!

title: As always a fun trip
reviews: We always get a hotel downtown and walk around for the 7 days we are there. We find many hole in the wall places that are so neat. I enjoy the shopping and the restaurants. You can walk around for hours and then pop into one of many coffee shops to rest your feet!

title: Very Beautiful
reviews: Vancouver Downtown is a beautiful place to visit.  With the many shopping and dinning area, it makes it a very nice place to take a stroll.  From Canada Place, you get a great view of the water and Stanley Park.  Our friend lived in North Vancouver,so on a clear day we can see a glimpse of our friend's million dollar house, amazing. We enjoyed walking through Gas Town.

title: Pedestrian-friendly and plenty to do.
reviews: The actual Downtown area is the part between Burrard St and Stanley Park. There are countless blocks of luxury type flats but Davie and Robson Streets are full of shops and eating places. It is a nicer area to walk round at night than Gastown. Plenty of good shops in Robson while Denman Street has a great choice of restaurants too. Not touristy like Gastown either.

title: Great City - Too Many Transients
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city.  We are from Pittsburgh, which is more of a medium sized city.  Vancouver is massive.  We visited Gastown, Chinatown, and the downtown area.  There are many beautiful buildings and tons of art.  Every new building built in Vancouver gets it's own art.  The layout of the streets is the typical grid, which is very easy to navigate.  Our only complaint is the number of transient street people.  They are probably easy for the locals to ignore, but it was difficult for us as we don't typically see such a large number of transients in the Pittsburgh area.  Otherwise, I highly recommend a visit to Vancouver.

title: Lot to Do
reviews: There are some great restaurants, art galleries and shopping in downtown Vancouver. We enjoyed our walk through Gas Town, there were a couple great jewelry stores with local artists, and a really cool furniture store.

title: couldn't help but like it
reviews: Set as it is on a peninsula, Vancouver is surrounded by stunning mountain vistas and expansive water views.  We were impressed with the variety and ease of public transport and how people-friendly were the multitude of shops and eateries.  The small public park areas within the city were well utilized and pretty with overflowing Spring flowers and having Stanley Park immediately adjacent was a fantastic bonus. We plan on returning.

title: Shopping is very convenience
reviews: Tons of stores on Robson Street. Downtown was crowd during afternoon. Downtown of any cities, honestly, is always not the place I like most. If you like shopping, Downtown Vancouver must be wonderful.

title: Nice walking town
reviews: Downtown large, but good for walking. Didn't see quite as many cyclists on the downtown streets as out in Stanley park, but definitely quite a few. Many pleasant smaller streets good for walking.

title: Not to miss
reviews: So much to see,great shops and restaurants from around the world. There are quite a lot of people begging they don't   Push for money just sit with cards stating their problem

title: back to the past in Gastown
reviews: I loved all the little shops, restaurants and cafe , the architecture of Gastown is worth a detour. Don't miss the steam clock and Water street kind of Nostalgia of the past, the triangular building shows some similarities with  New york's flat Iron.

title: A lot of History in Downtown Vancouver
reviews: The best way to tour downtown Vancouver is from a hop-on Hop-off bus or trolley for a fee. You are transported to different districts that down-town has to offer where you can hop off and explore and then resume your tour on the next hop-on bus that comes by. Points of interest you will want to tour are: Stanley Park including the Aquarium inside the park, English Bay Beach, Robson Street for shopping quaint boutiques, Gas Town with it's cobblestone streets, China Town, and the Vancouver Art Gallery. It is difficult to see everything that this city has to offer in just one day, but this tour is a good sampling.

title: Whistler tour
reviews: We took a day trip to Whistler from Vancouver with Land and Sea tours. Our driver, Tim, was very informative about the route and gave us lots of facts as we were driving along. We stopped at Brittania Beach copper mine for a tour, Shannon Falls for photographs of the falls and had three hours of free time in Whistler before taking the tour of the native centre where we saw a black bear just wandering around. On the way back he stopped at a viewpoint where we could see the Tantalus range still covered in snow. It was along day - 11 hours by the time we got back to Vancouver but well worth it. Z

title: our experience
reviews: loved the big city excitement and all the choices of restaurants and night life the traffic and parking were the only complaint but it was to be expected

title: Nice to walk around Gas Town.
reviews: I think they called it Gas Town.   There were people drunk walking around extra friendly.   I smelled marijuana a couple times walking past the open bars.   We ended up on a street full of drug addicts.   They were sitting selling junk on the sidewalk.   No one seemed dangerous.   On the waterfront there is Canada place.   You can walk around the board walk and read history of past olympians and see all the provinces and territories mentioned.  The olympic flames are along the board walk towards Fly over Canada plane docks.

title: Vibrant & alive
reviews: Great city to get out the walking shoes and explore the city centre.  Lots of sights, great cafes and restaurants.

title: Nice place, but ...
reviews: Arrived Saturday night. Sunday morning we walked down to the Waterfront and then along it. Due to a thick curtain of clouds right down to the horizon, we didn't even know that the beautiful snow-capped mountains were there. As we walked along, I was wondering when the relentless succession of high-rise buildings virtually hugging the the walking & cycling paths would give way to a more sympathetic waterfront with beach cafes backed by park land or similar - that is,  somewhere informal to sit and watch the sea planes take off and land. Nice enough to walk along, but gave up on the place for a drink and a snack, so we walked into town where most things seemed to be closed until we go to Gas Town.However, over the ensuing days, we grew to like Vancouver a lot. The atmosphere and people are friendly, polite and helpful.  Even the people approaching you for money are polite and not persistent.  E Hastings street with its community of drug addicts only looked threatening, but as we walked through no one approached us let alone hassled us.But there doesn't appear to be anywhere that is the heart of the city - but that's probably me expecting some kind of European thing where cities normally have a central square, small parks, an old part, etc.Good restaurants and coffee bars, but I'll review these separately - along with a few attractions but, just in case it's not listed already on TripAdvisor, just a mention of the Hendrix Shrine.  It's only open June to August. It's a lovely gesture for the person who acquired the place, but it felt a bit desolate and scrapply - eg the corrugated cardboard 'guitar-shaped' shop sign, the words 'Hendrix Shrine' painted up in a few places and some of the red-brick wall is made out of plastic.

title: Great stores
reviews: Some different than the United States stores with good merchandise and very friendly staff.  Great leather and lots of shoes. More European

title: Beautiful
reviews: Vancouver is the most beautiful city i have ever been to. Busy but not to busy, Beautiful mountains and ocean views, great food, shopping and entertainment.

title: downtown vancouver
reviews: hustling, bustling area - accessible to so many great restaurants, shops on Granville street, close walking distance to several large shopping centers, main bus lines are all over the place and a 20-min taxi ride from the airport

title: Vancouver, BC
reviews: A very clean city with many eateries.  A lot of good places to stay but crowds can be a problem.  Stayed 5 days over the Easter holiday.  Visited the city abot 20 years ago and found that a lot of changes have been made.Ed K.

title: trendy with a rough undercurrent
reviews: Snazzy buildings and trendy cafes and shops but the area is really rough - gangs of guys hanging out, loads of homelessness, panhandlers and prostitution.  Prety intimidating when traveling with kids.

title: Wonderful City
reviews: Vancouver is like a combination of Seattle and San Francisco, but cleaner and safer than either.  We stayed at our time share place right in the downtown area.  The city offers a tremendous array of restaurants and perhaps the best thing is that there are several types of food, with Asian selections among the best.  While things are more expensive than in the U.S., we had no problems finding anything we needed.  We topped our vacation off with brunch at the Fairmont Hotel, a splendid hotel with excellent food offerings at a reasonable price.  The city has very good public transport as well.  We enjoyed the Gaslight district with its old style charm and little shops.  The large mall, Metropolis I believe is the name, is large but not as spectacular as many American supermalls like Mall of America or Fashion Show Mall in Las Vegas, or even King of Prussia Mall in Pennsylvania.  Good quick eating at Tim's and they are everywhere.

title: Fantastic City
reviews: We love to visit Vancouver from time to time, we don't live far away but we love to experience the city and stay for a weekend get-away! We always seems to find new places to experience and of course could make each stay longer. This time we tried the Metropolitan Hotel, great service, friendly people and enjoyed the excellent cuisine at the Diva restaurant. We also tried the oysters at the Blackbird Public House and Oyster Bar a few blocks down, the sauces made them top notch!

title: It has almost everything you want to spend a day or evening....
reviews: Downtown is one of the best area in Vancouver where you can find everything. Name it you have it‚Ä¶. Right from snowcapped mountain view, to sunny beaches, parks and aquariums, indoor and outdoor sporting opportunities, stadiums, science centre, official buildings, hotels and night life, fine dining‚Ä¶.shopping malls and outlets. There is no chance that one can get bored here. It offers so much for all age. Different street of Downtown offers different entertainment for locals and tourist to suit their taste.I liked it more in lights. Exploring on foot is recommended as parking is very difficult to find and if you find one its exorbitantly high.

title: Great Place
reviews: There is so much to do that you can spend a week and still not do all, starting with the obvious:Day-1 Stanley Park, forget the car and walk or stroll through it staying on the waters edge, about 6k. Evening visit Yale Town have dinner at one of the hundreds of trendy restaurantsDay-2 Start in Gas Town see the steam clock have lunch on the patio at the spaghetti factory, in the afternoon cut over the China Town, you will think you are in Hong Kong, for dinner get a shuttle ferry over the Granville Island, you may even get to see a play or two.Day-3 Take your pick, we have three ski mountains within taxi distance of down town - Seymour, Cypress and Grouse which has a great gondola ride up and a fantastic restaurant overlooking all of Vancouver.Day-4 Well I have only just started so will leave the rest for you to research, do leave enough time to visit Vancouver Island but that another story.

title: Vancouver city
reviews: This is a beautiful city with its mountains and waterfront. It has lovely attractions and one can take tours around the city. There is a vast array of different types of restaurants and eating establishments. Entertainment galore! It's a fun city!

title: Walk top to bottom half hour
reviews: I live here.  The downtown area is not so big that you can't see all of it. East to West or North to South should only take about 1/2 hour of straight walking, but of course you will have stops along the way!  The beaches are lovely, Locarno, Jericho, Spanish Banks.  When the sun comes out the locals are out, but there is always a spot to park.  Take a drive to UBC and the houses around there.  You may even be able to go inside some of the buildings on campus.  There is an awesome library at UBC. (And a hospital )  Great views there.  Stop at the Chan Centre and take in the view, and the rose gardens.Knight St and 37th has a very fine long view. Main St at 30th, and north, has funky shops.  Keep going til at least 16th.Skytrain can take you in comfort loads of places, even out of town.Drive over the Lions Gate bridge, awesome view.  Then go up,up,up, and look out to Burrard Inlet and back at Stanley Park.  Traffic coming back on Lions Gate bridge can be a bit slow.  You could go on to Iron Workers (2nd Narrows) bridge and come back that way.3rd beach at Stanley Park has fabulous sunsets.  Get there before sunset!Commercial Drive is fun and always busy and happening. Lots of coffee shops. Not touristy, just the locals out enjoying life.Denman St has icecream and cupcake treats.If you can get to Belcarra Park and Buntzen Lake it is peaceful, small lakes, no powerboats, good for picnics.  Excellent covered picnic area at Belcarra, with tables. Towards Port Moody area, about 1 hr from Vancouver.

title: Best city in the world
reviews: Vancouver downtown is an ideal place to stay in Vancouver. You don't need a car when in downtown, its so easy to just walk in all the place you want to go. You cAn walk to stanley park, stroll at the beach at english bay. The food in Vancouver is priceless, you can have anything and everything that are  authentic in taste, different kinds of international food and different price range depending on your your taste of preference. You can enjoy it along Davie street, Denman, granville and of course Robson where you can eat and shop.Travelling to and from downtown is easy, you can just take the train going to metrotown or as far as surrey and on the other side to richmond.  Its so easy going to airport by taking the train from downtown.  If you are staying for not less than a month you can book for service apartment instead of hotel, its convenient and cheaper.So next time you plan to stay in Vancouver, stay down town and enjoy the city and feel why its the best city in the world.

title: Vancouver downtown has little to offer, besides many starbucks and the regular trendy stores.
reviews: Sadly downtown Vancouver has very little culture or history and little to no architectural views. There are too many starbucks everywhere sometimes kitty corner to eachother??? The stores are just regular trendy stores like a giant shopping mall. Restaurants for the majority are over rated and over hyped but lack quality, I guess hype keeps business going. Sadly Vancouver seems to be well over rated and hyped kind of like NY.

title: A fun and diverse city!
reviews: My A list rcommondations Black bird pup   Best scallop appy  EVER. Turnabout cons shop.  Drop dead clothes and bargains Walk on Denman street and find Cupcakes that are so freakin divine, I got a fork and sat down to be alone with it! What an experience. Joe fortes. Best miso sable fish !Executive hotel LeSoleil. Decadent rooms, excellent staff, especially the doormen! Fabulous value.

title: Vancouver World's Best Ocean & Mountain City
reviews: I moved here to Vancouver in 1986 from England. No other city in the world is as clean and green and has the Pacific Ocean lapping against it's shores offering surrounding mountains views and legendary Stanley Park to experience. Downtown Vancouver is a safe city. Surrounded on three side by water you will find a wonderful climate that rarely freezes and is not as rainy as everyone makes it out to be. I have lived in Vancouver for close to 39 years and every weekend feels like a vacation because there is so much to see and do here. Vancouverites are an awesome local people offering high ethnic diversity and a true West Coast laid back charm. What other downtown can boast a multitude of ocean rich beaches with rockstar supernatural views? Vancouver chose decades ago to ban the use of major highways in it's downtown core. I might take you a little longer to get around but because of this one urban planning decision Vancouver offers a true downtown experience without noisy highways cutting up the city into sections. I used to live in downtown Vancouver's West End that is wedged between downtown Vancouver and on the other side runs directly into the Pacific Ocean and Stanley Park . . . . awesome place to live when you are young or retired.

title: So much to do in Vancouver
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful coastal city with mountains as the back drop and the sea at the doorstep. Downtown Vancouver is a very walkable city with a diversity of areas to see. The West End adjacent Stanley Park has many caf√©s and small shops to browse. Robs on Street has several blocks of high end fashion stores and coffee shops. Visit Gastown for a touristy area, Yaletown for upbeat restaurants with outdoor seating and upscale boutique shops and go to Chinatown for real authentic Asia shops and restaurants. The only area to avoid is the Downtown Eastside near Hastings and Main Streets where unfortunately the homeless and some drug addicts prevail.

title: overrated
reviews: Rains way too much, crazy traffic congestion for such a small city, people are unfriendly.  Architecture is quite modern but somewhat soulless.  The natural setting and view is nice with the mountains and ocean.

title: Love it but hate the parking charges!!
reviews: Downtown is just magical it's theming with energy wherever you go! Restaurants of various cuisines, hamburger carts the Japanese hot dogs quite a rave ( I did not care for it) but everyone loved it drive down to Canada place see the beautiful mountains the ocean the costal line the ships cruise liners Enjoy the sunset drive down to Stanley Park walk cycle drive whatever your heart desires! Enjoy a drink a meal just walk down Robson st rub shoulders with the tourists or the suited booted young office guy or the polished stiletto heeled CEO of a multinational company a woman! Who prefers walking than drivingWhatever you like you can do and enjoy maybe bump into some Hollywood celebrity? They love to shop here tooGo on Explore Downtown Vancouver

title: My Hometown, almost!
reviews: I fell in love with Vancouver 55 years ago on a vacation from Edmonton to the West Coast...have NEVER LEFT.currently reside in West Vancouver, which is but a short bridge crossing over Lionsgate Bridge.A most beautiful city...Grouse Mountain 15 minutes from downtown , offers a fantastic view of the City, water, plus restaurant facilities for those inclined. One can ski Grouse, 15 minutes later be on your sailboat in English Bay, enjoying the great outdoors.Truly is GODS COUNTRY!

title: Downtown Vancouver is Dull
reviews: There is nothing worth seeing in downtown Vancouver. It doesn't hold a candle to the cosmopolitan cores of Paris, New York, or London. The Vancouver Art Gallery is sub-par. The downtown shopping is dull--the same generic shops one would find in any city. Don't waste your time in Gastown either. Get out of downtown and walk, bike, or drive around Stanley Park, go to the Museum of Anthropology and the Nitobe Japanese Garden at UBC, see Queen Elizabeth Park, hang out at Kits Beach in the summertime, walk or bike around False Creek, or drive up to Whistler along the Sea-to-Sky Highway.

title: Very walkable city
reviews: Vancouver proper is a very easy city to get around in, especially by foot, important if one is visiting by ship as the cruise terminal is part of the downtown core. The airport is a good 30-40 minutes away depending on the form of transportation. There are any number of suburban areas which are not as easy to access. One way to combat this is to buy a day pass for the transit system. This will, for one reasonable price, allow access to the bus system, skytrain (elevated rail system) and also to the harbour ferries to the North Shore.Lots of touristy attractions, tons of information available on line. Plenty of shopping opportunities, from inexpensive to very costly and a world class restaurant scene. All in all, lots to see and do, whether you are here for a day or a week. Very clean and for the most part very safe city in which to walk around and enjoy the scenery.

title: Everything within walking distance
reviews: Pacific Centre underground flagship shopping mall, Robson St, Granville St are all close together, and make downtown Vancouver the must see place to be.  The best shopping and resturants are here.

title: Great city!
reviews: Vancouver rates number 1 for places to stay/visit/live. People are nice and relaxed and very much in tune with nature. It has everything to offer to everyone and super clean.

title: Fabulous City
reviews: Everyone seemed very fit and energetic. a few things to know before you go.   Wear good walking shoes, a backpack and carry an umbrella and jacket with you.    Loved being able to walk everywhere we went.   We took a cab once to go to the Canucks game.    The city is very safe and clean, but don't be shocked when you see all the homeless, most are harmless, some can be a bit more aggressive, they tend to have dogs to help their cause.

title: Clean and modern.
reviews: Mostly the buildings are very modern and chic.  Very clean and fresh atmosphere.  There is an area where many old and traditional buildings are..  It's nice to walk around.  The steam clock tower evaporates the steam occasionally.  Feels like I was traveling the past.  Quite romantic

title: Simply Beautiful
reviews: One of the most pretty cities in the world.Many restaurants to choose from.All within walking distance.Great shopping near by.

title: Nice area but nothing very special
reviews: Gastown is nice, Chinatown a bit special., I prefer Chinatown in NY. The rest are skyscrapers with a few historical buildings.. A good place to shop.

title: Nice walking
reviews: Good walking, nice sights though there does seem to be a higher than average number of beggars but on par with San Francisco.  Great shopping and resturants.

title: Sketchy
reviews: A lot of shops and stores nice cars Road rage drivers Don't go down east Hastings Lots of tall buildings and lots of walking Not enough Tim hortons

title: Wonderfully surprised
reviews: I have been wonderfully surprised at how much i have enjoyed downtown Vancouver and its many attractions. They are really progressive and I really respect that initiative.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: We walked all around downtown Vancouver and were very comfortable in doing this.  The city is very safe, LOTS of people out on a weekday, and many places to see, shop, and eat.

title: Great place Vancouve
reviews: Downtown Vancouver have many tall buildings, a characteristic downtown traffic. But, for sure, one of the most educated town I ever know.

title: Awesome place
reviews: I am visiting Vancouver, and have been here for 2 months. I love Down town Vancouver, there's everything you could possible want in a city. Great places to eat, loads of interesting places to visit, and fab hostels and apartments to stay in. There are a lot of homeless people, but they generally are pretty harmless and some even give directions and like to have a chat with you.

title: Vancouver City
reviews: The array of shops are quite good and the city is very clean the skytrain is a very easy way to get down town

title: Lots of shops, a few spots to rest
reviews: There are many spokes to downtown Vancouver, and you could take a few days to look everywhere.  Don't miss Arthur Ericson's Court House, gardens and public Square. Lunch at the Art Gallery cafeteria is very good and moderately priced.  Tea at Griffins, or dinner with the dessert bar, is a visual and gustatory treat.

title: Great shopping!
reviews: Love Love Love Downtown Van. Terrific shopping on Robson street. Pacific Centre mall also has some great stores.

title: Perfect Gateway for Travel
reviews: Vancouver offers a good mixture of beaches for outdoor activities as well as biking, fishing, and golf and a thriving cultural scene.
