Gregorian calendar month is usually the most popular of the year. Summer conjointly options a number of fun festivals like North American nation Day celebrations, Bard on the Beach, and Pride Week.

title: Love the city!
reviews: Love the vibe in Vancouver ! I'm from Europe originally, and each time I cross the boarder from America into Canada it makes me feel a little bit more at home. Vancouver is gorgeous and the people are friendly! I could see myself living here some day!

title: Urban delight
reviews: Great energy and vibe. Shopping, dining and coffee mixed with highly friendly folks makes Vancouver such a delight to visit!

title: We walked and walked and walked
reviews: Beautiful downtown area.  Very clean streets and organized buildings and services.  We walked several miles going thru the shopping district and around to several restaurants.  Being right on coal bay really was beautiful.  We have been in several downtown cities and this place is one of the best.

title: Truly the American Cradle
reviews: Never been to such a great city with friendly people. Its a compact city. Its clean and beautiful. You will find the best Taxi drivers in the world here. Very honest. Like many other cities including the one I live cabbies here don't over charge you. Lot of shopping and dining areas to every taste.

title: I fell in love with Vancouver!
reviews: Awesome! awesome! awesome! Loved it :) Looking forward to being back soon! Spent few days with friends and we really enjoyed ourselves. Loved it!

title: Great scenery
reviews: I have always enjoyed walking around downtown Vancouver because of the great scenery - a mix of new and historic buildings and mountains and ocean.  However, they really need more trash cans because there is a lot of trash on the streets and I sometimes held on to trash or cig buts for a long time before finding a garbage can.  Also, it seems like there are more homeless people, and panhandlers, than ever although I know the city has been making efforts to ease homlessness.

title: Easy to get around.
reviews: Spent a week in Vancouver and must admit we really enjoyed ourself. Even though the weather was cold and rainy, we were amazed how easy it was to get around. If you're like me and my wife, we like to get out and walk to see the city first hand. Vancouver is a city you can put some serious miles on your walking shoes.

title: within walking distance
reviews: nice, vivid , modern, young citypart with lot off shopping possibilities, good pubs and restaurants all within walking distance

title: Gorgeous downtown
reviews: One of the most beautiful places in the city, easy to move and be a complete tourist if you happen to be new

title: Robson and Granville.
reviews: Robson st and Granville are a lot of fun to walk. Granville is a little seedy, but for the most part no one will bother you. Gastown is great... The streets and stores are incredible, BUT.... Like any major city it can get sketchy FAST! I definitely wouldn't suggest going there at night unless you are familiar with the area.

title: Gas Town
reviews: Last summer I drove through Gas Town and loved what i saw.  I returned this February Saturday morning with my daughter and convinced her we needed to explore it on foot.  Although it looked a little seedier than I remembered I still had high hopes.  Then a young woman run up to me screaming about something but I couldn't understand her.  We ducked into a restaurant and she went on. WE turned a corner and found ourselves surrounded by about 30 homeless people.  Most minded their own business but but 10-12 were behaving oddly.  We decided to get out of Gas Town.  We decided to skip China Town also and head back downtown.

title: Easy to get around and friendly too
reviews: Loved this place. People were so friendly and helpful. So much to see, so much to explore yet so easy to get around.

title: avoid china town.
reviews: we really liked the fact that you could get around Vancouver in a day and still have time to browse the shops and take in the sights.  That said  china town was depressing.  The only shops were little markets that were all the same, the rest of the area was run down or boarded up.  Also we passed through during the day and were quite intimidated by the sheer volume of homeless people and vagrants that were loitering around.

title: Stylish!!
reviews: Shops, and shops, and views of Canada place is just like no other. I met some really nice people just walking and back backing around the world.. Thanks to the community officer that helped with telling us what bus to take.. Nice people, beautiful downtown!

title: Lots to do in a small area.
reviews: Downtown Vancouver itself is very small but has tons of things to see and do. It is wise to choose a hotel in the heart of downtown as it will make it easy to get to all the attractions you might want to see. Fab eateries, museums, parks, and great shopping. For better deals go to the pacific mall rather than Robson Street. Same shops better prices.

title: Cleanest City
reviews: This is a beautiful and very clean city.  Not a piece of garbage in site, everyone drives calmly, easy to navigate.  A Lot to see here.

title: If staying in Van, stay downtown.
reviews: There is plenty to do and see, lots of shops and malls cater to any budget.  As well as most of the night life with the bars and restaurants are here. Most of it is all in easy walking distance. The main roads for shopping would be Robson and Granville. While the main nightlife being on Seymour.

title: Beautiful and pleasant
reviews: Our hotel is situated in this downtown, so we could explore it on foot. Buildings are modern and hardly any are of older architecture. But they are beautiful and streets are clean and it was a pleasant walk.

title: Strolling the Robson
reviews: Visually exciting after dark, the energy level is high and inviting. Good vibes, interesting shops, and friendly folks combine for a fun stroll block after block.

title: usa designer heaven.
reviews: norstroms coming, the bay is now american designer clothes. holt renfu. pacifice centre offers highend electronics, the body shop, purdys chocolates and a plelphora ,of shoes stores. high end mds. a food count w/ the usual cheap lunch fast food offererings. i recommend TAKE FIVE for a chai latte or cappacino  break Bose has quality electronics. pacific center is for those who are trendy and value designer wear..

title: Great place to go
reviews: Spent a week in vancouver and did a lot of working around the many streets, window shopping and people watching and still had plenty left to see in this very beautiful city.  The people are very friendly, they love their parks and gardens and is a pet friendly city.  We interacted with a few of the colourful charactors on the street corners.  A lot of fun and laughs.  Went to the Rogers Arena twice to see the Cunucks play.  Great experience to go to a NHL game and soak up the atmosphere.  Shopping, dining and the views are great.  Jump on the stop go bus and tour the city and go to Gas Town and China town.  You may even see them making a movie like we did.  Will be heading back in 2015 for another trip around the area.

title: Great Adventure
reviews: I have visited Vancouver downtown several times since 1986 so I have seen it evolvebut it has never lost its natural beauty and friendly people which makes it a great placeto be in the day or night. It is safe to walk around and there are many shops and excellentrestaurants with a wide variety of food especially my favorite which is fresh seafood. .And the architecture ranges from very old to contemporary and many of the older buildings have been restored in an authentic and classy way which makes walking around a delightful experience.

title: Beautiful to walk
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is very accessible, both for walking, and biking. It is flat and easy to get around so don't hesitate to walk out your front door and just explore...

title: A must visit !
reviews: We stayed downtown Vancouver and walked our legs off. We wanted to see as much as possible. The various neighbourhoods were so interesting ! We loved it !

title: interesting
reviews: some great old buildings and interesting shops , including some trendy restaurants , we spent a whole morning strolling around .Well worth a visit .

title: Beautiful!
reviews: Beautiful historic and modern buildings, lots of shopping and dining options. Safe and friendly. What's not to like?

title: Cabana Sidecar in Vancouver
reviews: Brilliant!Love the beautiful d√©cor!The food is amazing ( & excellent prices ) ...music, entertainment & great people make this.....Best New HOT SPOT on Granville & Davie.Cheers!

title: Love Vancouver, but...
reviews: We love Vancouver but a filthier city I have never seen. Clean up your streets Vancouver, you should be ashamed!!!!

title: Exciting big city, diverse culutural experience
reviews: In Vancouver you feel like most of the people actually live here, instead of commuting form suburbs. That makes the city feel save and comfortable. So many different kinds of people, all enjoying the culture and commerce. Food and art are impressive features of down town. If you like to walk, this is the ideal city so explore on foot.

title: Loved Vancouver downtown
reviews: We walked around the city every night with our family.  It was so beautiful with all the lights, interesting building architecture and water everywhere.

title: Really nice city
reviews: We loved our trip to Vancouver. We stopped 3 nights on our way to ski Whistler. We are really please we took time out to see the city as it has a charm all of it's own!We stayed mostly in the downtown area with Stanely Park, Gastown, Yaletown, False Creek, shopping etc. all in walking distance (for us anyway but there is also efficient bus/train and ferries services around Vancouver).We really liked Vancouver, the people are friendly, there is tons to see in 3 days and it is an interesting place. The weather in Jan is not great, it rained most days bit that's part of the Vancouver!I would definitely recommend a stay in Downtown and see the city, it is now one of my favourite places.

title: Very metropolitan
reviews: Great shopping with various world wide shops.  Great selection of restaurants and bars with wide price ranges transportation system very good

title: Lots of shopping for designer stuff
reviews: Vancouver is great for designer stuff of all kinds but with the sales tax and duties it's not a great deal.....Robson street is where you will find lots of places to eat and shop. pacific center is the main mall with Holt Renfrew wich is like a small Neiman Marcus and Harry Rosen is great high end for men.

title: Beautiful but not too much to do
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful place it ticks all the boxes for outstanding beauty, but there really isnt much to do unless you want to spend an absolute fortune getting on that crazy tour bus.  Many places close early, there isnt  much in the way of theatre or shows.It needs to step up to big city status

title: Down town area
reviews: Vancouver is a great city but not on New Year's Day! We were only there for the one day and nothing was open until the afternoon. Don't walk between Gas Town and China Town if you can avoid it. It is very run-down in that area withlots of homeless people and drunks hanging about.

title: Fabulous But Expensive
reviews: Staying a few blocks off Robson toward Stanley Park made absolutely every major downtown attraction close enough to walk.  Headed first to Canada Place through downtown and along the water to Stanley Park and the aquarium. Circled around through the West End.  The next day went the other direction to Gastown and Chinatown.  The only reason I marked the city down was because of how expensive things were.

title: Loved Vancouver
reviews: Van was amazing but a little warning about the amount of homeless people would have been nice as I wasn't prepared for them constantly coming up to me and asking me for money and food.... van reminded me a little bit of Melbourne's CBD old buildings, good shopping, great restaurants and all the people were really helpful to a lost little aussie who had no idea where she was at some points :)

title: Best downtown
reviews: Vancouver downtown is the best I have ever seen so far (besides NY) but this still beats others. Wonderful place to walk along side amazing VC skyline. In my weeklong stay I made sure I walk back from office through the downtown.  Like somebody here in the review said the city is walker friendly and safe.  One doesnt get lost in the bylanes and its worth exploring every one of them. Tons of shops and libraries eateries all along. The highlight of the downtown is the water front where you can see the top of the Grause mountains. I watched the water plans take off and land for hours together. The walk along the Canada Place is interesting too. VCs public transport systems beats US in everyway, they are well connected by frequent local buses and sky trains. This is one place i would love to come back again!

title: Park and walk
reviews: We park our car on the roadside and walk to each attractions. The parking cost is reasonable. We enjoyed roadside food called Japadog. Went to Costco and found Kinderegg that we can't find it in San Francisco.

title: Walk!!!
reviews: Even though we experienced record cold during our 7 day stay, we LOVED walking all through the downtown area!  So many great, healthy eating venues and a Whole Foods!  City is very walker friendly:) & safe.  Walking was a great way for us to eat and not gain weight!

title: Great for high end shopping
reviews: This area seems to have every high end retailer that I've ever heard of, and a few more, plus excellent restaurants, a few churches, and museums and galleries.  It's well worth wandering around, even if you don't want to buy anything.

title: busy but easy to navigate
reviews: Easy to walk around and well marked maps make this easy to navigate.  we toured one half of downtown on one day and the other half by gas town the other day.  easy to split up.  China town was a little sketchy in some areas and a lot of people came up to us and asked for money or food.  Make sure to be prepared as in any city to look like you live there.

title: Beautiful, nothing but...........
reviews: On the water, indeed the cleanest city I have ever seen.  The transportation system puts the US to shame.  Love the few tours I was able to put on my busy schedule.

title: nice
reviews: Plenty of opportunity for shopping and coffee. Take the train. It is very convenient. Several restaurant to choice from.

title: Best Massage I've ever had
reviews: Just saw Joy at Smile Thai Wellness Spa in downtown Vancouver. Fantastic blend of massage and stretching, both corrective and relaxing. Really the best massage I've ever had. I had a lot of tension and lower back pain and Joy fixed both. It was easy to get a same day appointment when I went. It is right around the corner from the Westin Grand and Japadog on Richards just past Robson. There is no easily seen sign from the street but just look for the address number 853 on the brown/dark building large door. You then walk in where there are a few other businesses and follow the signs to suite 103. Don't miss this place. Reasonably priced as well. Joy was really fantastic.

title: Beautiful and easy to shop
reviews: Downtown Vancouver was a delight on Thanksgiving weekend... Christmas decorations beginning to appear and it was great

title: Vancouver Good not Great
reviews: Visited to see the sights but disappointed with the large run down areas. Grouse Mountain was overpriced for what it offers outside the winter period although the Capillano Suspension Bridge well worth visiting. Whale watching amounted to chasing sightings as a pack of tourist charter boats and seeing the odd mammal break surface - certainly overpriced again for what was taken from the experience. Nice to see Vancouver but wouldn't rush back.

title: interesting areas
reviews: be sure to check out the gastown and yaletown areas, as well as the waterfront. we took a harbour air seaplane tour and loved it.downtown vancouver easy to walk, people are friendly, and there are plenty of shops, galleries and restaurants to visit.

title: lots to see but very busy
reviews: so much to see here, shops, homeless people, restaurants, homeless people, bars, homeless perople- get the gist? however, the poor dont hassle you or become a problem, they are just part ofthe citys make up unfortunately.make sure you give them a few dollars. other than that there is so much to take in its  amazing.make sure you visit canada place for the canada fly attraction - awesome!!!!

title: Rated worst city for traffic congestion in North America.
reviews: Normally a nice place to wander, only usual issues are based on aggressive and sometimes VERY foulmouthed panhandlers (even n my late 30's I am still learning new words). Yet this year seems to be particularly bad for road closures and construction.For anyone who knows the area, once you start heading to the heart of downtown, you need to take the sky train in. Right now there is a parking shortage as road closures due to construction and added bike lanes has highly limited access, and if you find a meter get ready to remortgage your house. I would suggest perhaps the bus, but these are also being effected by all the construction.Current roads closed (as bad as in some places 4 lanes now down to one lane, during rush hour) include Cambie, Granville, (Granville street bridge since summer), Richards, Seymour, Howe, Burrard (Burrard Street Bridge), Pender and Georgia. If you know Vancouver, it was already considered the worst city in North America for congestion (even rated worse then LA), so now that ALL major arteries going into city are at 50% or below capacity, well do the math.My opinion, come enjoy what the downtown has to offer another year when the City of Vancouver decides to start regulating road closures during peak hours.

title: Great Energy and a view at every corner
reviews: Great shop window gazing. Great people watching. Shops all lit up for Christmas. Great insdie shopping and good connections for the Skytrain that will whisk you around the city for under 6 dollars a trip.Get up at 6:00 am and have a walk along the seawall to Granville or around Stanley Park or over to West Vancouver. Great location for a week of funtimes. Book concerts ahead. Be ready for fast but polite traffic. Bikes are avaliable to rent for rides around Stanley Park. Great Library, great book shops, LOTS of Restaurants in Yale town.Miss Gastown if you have kids under 15. Lots of beggars and druggies.

title: Some superb places to see and great walks.
reviews: We walked round the shops. We went to the port and the station. We visited the church in the centre - beautiful. We visited Gastown which is long street full of tourist shops and old buildings. A must see is the Steam Clock!! We walked from Gastown to the Chinese Quarter which was mistake as you have to pass through a very rough area with beggars down and outs. A very nervous 10 minutes and our only worrying time in Vancouver. Although, there are people sleeping rough on the streets everywhere.

title: Granville Market
reviews: This place is truly a wonderful place to visit when in downtown Vancouver rain or shine. The parking was not to bad as we went through the week and there were lots of clean facilities. The location is kind of tricky to get to if you are new in town but the signage was helpful. It is located right on the water and you can do a water taxi from or to the market. This is a whole day adventure so go prepared as there is much to see and eat. Well worth the stop.

title: Interesting
reviews: There are so many interesting sites you can enjoy, if the weather is good you can have a great walking adventures.

title: There are many great cities in the world...
reviews: A beautiful city with some of the nicest laid back people you could ever wish to meet. Plenty of open space to balance out the high rise. Spectacular city skyline and mountain skyline. It's all there. Love it.

title: One of the great cities of the world
reviews: I was downtown on a business trip and couldn't believe how well the people were as far as communication and overall sense of peacefulness. Walked to the parks without fear of being mugged- totally enjoyed the people- the scenery and the city.

title: worth nothing more than a pass-through
reviews: If you're used to the downtown of other big cities (like Toronto, New York, or Seattle), downtown Vancouver will likely feel soulless and boring. I find the "soul" of the city is in smaller neighbourhoods. But, it's worth seeing all the same. I'd just concentrate on other areas (like Kits or Commercial) that are more interesting, but less urban. I feel like the main action of the city happens largely outside of downtown.

title: Vancouver Cities History Scenes
reviews: We love traveling to the Vancouver City downtown area and especially what is known as Gas Town near the North Side of the Pacific Ocean. Now the cultural shopping we feel is on Robinson St, which has high end clothing stores, restaurants. Well lit up shops and has the newest fashions for every one living in this city or for a tourist experience of great shopping and trying out all types of food restaurants and bars, some with outside decks. Area has other small and larger department stores within walking distance of Robinson St. and downtown core. Buses, taxi's are always going by and very reasonable. The other area we always enjoy is Gas Town street and area. See the Old Steam clock, very old decorated buildings from when Vancouver was discovered and people started their business, whether from fishing, logging or retailing and their restaurants and pubs. Old Spaghetti Factory restaurant, patio outside near side walk, Steam Boat Pub & Restaurant Brewery also our favorite and outdoor patio, lots of comfortable seating. Near Canada Place where you can relax, stay over night, catch a ferry or cruise boat and has fantastic views of the inner harbour with all the freighters of the world loading our coal, logs, ash and other minerals. Take a ride on a old river ferry in the inner harbour. See the view on top of Canada Place of Vancouver,s mountains, sky scrapers, revolving restaurant. You will see very old open taxi/tours bus carriers that take you all over the history places, and Stanley Park, Capilano Suspension Bridge, adventure experience for sure! This is a very easy walking area, but we prefer the daytime, warm weather and just taking our time. Softsand-13.

title: Clean modern seaport city
reviews: Vancouver is jewel on the west coast of Canada! However, caution is advised - it is a big city. Clean and generally friendly service from Tiffany's to Sushi stops!  It's all here from Stanley Park in the heart of the city to Lynn Canyon just across the bridge and up the hill!  Fabulous!  Sea Wall walk too!

title: nice vibe
reviews: Another addition to the best cities in North America list.  Lots of things going on and good weather to boot.

title: Wonderful city of Vancouver
reviews: A wonderful laid back city, the boat trip round the harbour is something that MUST be done, it's the perfect way to see the overall city in it's glory. When you alight at the waterfront walk to Gastown to sample the atmosphre and see the worlds only steam clock.

title: All At Hand
reviews: So much yet all close, Pacific Shopping Mall, Robson Street to name just a fraction! Gastown - always worth a visit! Lots of lovely Bars and restaurants too!

title: One of the best and most beautiful cities in North America.
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a safe and wonderful city to visit. You can spend several days shopping, people watch and take in the sites of the city. It has so many things to offer.One of the most famous streets is Robson Street where you can have it all, shops food, pubs, restaurants and souvenirs.The choice of restaurants in Vancouver is out of the world and in every price range. Try out Vij's for incredible East Indian food or Don Francesco Ristorante for some incredible Italian food.If you fly in to Vancouver air port you do not need a car if you are just spending time down town. We love taking the bus through town and the bus drivers are super friendly. Just bring lots of change for correct fare.

title: Nice place to walk around, but careful with the pan handlers
reviews: Vancouver has grown into a big city and with more restaurant and entertainment choices it also is home to the mentally ill, sick and poor who live in the streets.  Most pan handlers are fine, but some are very mean even if you give to them so just be aware.  After hockey games the streets can be very rowdy.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: We visited in September for four nights. It's a beautiful city and very easy to walk around. There's always the hop-on hop-off bus or the trolley bus too. Felt safe for the most time apart from walking between Chinatown and Gastown, where we encountered some very unsavoury characters. Very friendly people. We were asked a couple of times if we needed help when stopping to look at our map. Loved the 'new' feel to the city and didn't feel at all hemmed in by the skyscrapers. Vancouver Lookout is worth a visit too. The cathedral in Burrard Street is beautiful and, although not old by British standards, is the oldest building in Vancouver. Oh and enjoyed the breweries too! Would love to go back to Vancouver!

title: Pretty average...
reviews: Not masses going for it in my opinion. Granville island, south granville and kitsilano have more character with smaller, boutique units. Worth walking through though if you need to get to gastown or china town.

title: Fun Time
reviews: Fall is a great time to visit.  The cruise crowds are gone and the tree colors are aflame.  The chilly air makes it great to bundle up and walk around the city.

title: Compact, easily walkable
reviews: Absolutely loved Vancouver, really well laid out and compact, making it easily walkable to most of the attractions.  Never felt worried or uneasy not matter where we went.  Did notice a lot of homeless people on the streets especially for the size of the city, never had a problem with them though.

title: Nice place.
reviews: Visit this place in the afternoon when the sun is setting to get impressive reflections of skyscrapers on the window glasses of other skyscrapers and you will not regret.

title: Unparalleled!
reviews: One fantastic "city of glass".  Clean, friendly, great restaurants, fantastic architecture (for me anyway).  My wife and I were asked twice, as we were looking at our map, if a stranger could help us.  Very upscale city.  Never saw so many BMW's, Mercedes and Audi's together in one place.  My wife and I just loved it here.

title: Beautiful Architecture!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has a variety of attractions to see, and some incredible restaurants to enjoy.  The architecture of both the historical buildings mixed in with the new buildings is impressive.  If you are driving to Vancouver leave your car in your hotel's parking lot, and either walk or take the transit, that way you don't have to worry about parking your vehicle downtown.  It would be a good idea to plan out your schedule so you can take in as many venues as possible.  When we were walking around the Canada Place we stopped at one of the travel kiosks and picked up some brochures of the city, the staff were very friendly and helpful. We were only there for a day and a half, so we didn't have enough time to see everything we wanted.  We are looking forward to going back so we can enjoy more of Vancouver.

title: fab time
reviews: the people are so friendly plenty to see & do hop on hop off bus walk around spoilt for choice plenty beautiful bars restaurantswanted to stay longer but UK called for our sons wedding

title: a bit of LA and san francisco
reviews: downtown vancouver is like a city where you can walk around pretty much everywhere but once you want to travel a bit out you def need a car or take the bus ....but the overall feel is very much this laidback attitude that LA has but some of the west coast city that san fran has......def check out bronson street and davie and walk along the sea wall to englich bay and stanley park :)

title: Great area
reviews: Lots to do, see, eat and drink!We were here just before Halloween so there were lots of great displays and costumes, a great experience

title: Downtown
reviews: There is so much to see and adventure around either by  walking  or using the hop and hop off bus going in and out of shops also visiting Gastown, Chinatown, English Bay, all around the waterfront, churches, etc.

title: Great modern city
reviews: Thoroughly enjoyed our walks around Vancouver downtown - great buildings, fantastic skyline from the harbor and Stanley Park as well as interesting shops and many touristy things to do.

title: An Attractive City
reviews: Very scenic, easy to navigate and very friendly. Shopping is plentiful, nice balance between parks and urban settings. We hope to return soon and spend more time exploring.

title: So far the best downtown i visited
reviews: Best downtown i ever visited, lots of fun and places to see and eat. A place that is good for any occasion. Highly recommended.

title: not impressed
reviews: Had heard so much about Vancouver but was not impressed.  Dirty and would not like to go out alone in it.  The shops were mostly designer and expensive.  The food court was very poor.  Did not see many places I would like to eat fortunately only there 6 days.  Don't think I would ever go back again

title: Good Shopping and Restaurants Galore
reviews: This is a great place to see and be seen in Vancouver.  Name dropping seems to be a sport here and many of the rich and famous come here to shop and be seen.   This area, especially Robson St. are full of hotels and restaurants.  The side streets have many other name brand stores as well as off brands.  Make sure that you visit this area if you are on a cruise ship; it is just a little way from Canada Place or Gastown.

title: Very interesting
reviews: First visit.  The views around Canada Place are beautiful.  Take one of the city bus tours.  You can see and learn a lot.  Several options.  The convention center is an amazing building.  Close to dark we did not feel good about walking in Old Town near China Town but during daylight we were comfortable as well as at night around Convention Center.

title: Around the world in a day
reviews: Walking around downtown Vancouver is a very interesting journey. There are so many unique neighborhoods packed into a couple of square miles. Every few blocks you can sample the authentic foods of a different culture. On one street you can shop high-end retail favorites and on another you can shop for a bong. There are a few seedy areas, as with any cities downtown, but over all it feels safe. One of my favorite urban spots.

title: Great Shopping and Cuisine!
reviews: I love to shop downtown Vancouver! It's beautiful to walk around by the water. And our favorite restaurant is Kobe's!

title: Vancouver Shopping is Fun for Visitors
reviews: I spent several hours shopping and browsing in downtown Vancouver while my family was otherwise occupied.  There are lots of good stores within walking distance of each other.  I enjoyed spending time in The Bay and in Holt Renfrew.  We have these stores in Ottawa where I live but the Vancouver shops are much bigger and offer a better selection.  Many individual designer shops, Winners, and so on can be found.  When I needed directions, people were more than willing to help. I recommend allocating some of your visiting time to downtown shopping.

title: A few days in downtown Vancouver
reviews: Spent two short periods in downtown Vancouver before and after an Inside Passage cruise out of Canada Place Wharf. Stayed in the Renaissence Harbourside Hotel. Found the whole area to be very clean and friendly with good bars and restaurants. Close to many downtown locations, Stanley Park and Harbour Air float planes. Particularly enjoyed the Steamworks Brewery in Gastown.  One of my favorite places.

title: Easy walking with lots to do.
reviews: The downtown area has a lot to offer.  Shops and restaurants galore that will provide hours of entertainment.  Some of the shopping areas are a little hard to find since they are buried inside the office building, so get a brochure or some guide to tell you where they all are.  Some of the shops, especially in the  Gastown area, close early in the off peak times.  So shop early and take advantage of all the craft beer that the pubs have to offer.

title: Beautiful by the water
reviews: Unlike most large cities, the harbour and the waterfront was the highlight of downtown Vancouver. But please do not be fooled downtown Vancouver is still like every othermajor city downtown cores with huge buildings and lots of traffic. Worth seeing forsure. I would try public transit because you have to pay for parking everything

title: All types
reviews: You can visit many different neighborhoods and will see something special in all. The best part is that it is never frigid as I have experienced in Montreal. As a matter of fact, you can see palm trees in some areas just to make Torontonians jealous.

title: Very Cosmopolitan
reviews: Great fun shopping and eating!!  Parking can be a problem, as spaces are limited.  Plan for at least 3-4 hours (with food), as it has a lot to offer.

title: It is easy to walk around downtown Vancouver only wished the weather was better
reviews: It is real easy to get around in Vancouver and I especially enjoy the waterfront areas of Vancouver, it was just too bad that the 3 days in Vancouver I could never see the famous skyline with North Shore Mountains in the background as it was either cloudy, foggy, overcast, or raining.  But minus the weather complaints, Vancouver is pretty cool.  I also used the Trolley bus in order to get to know the layout of the city and it did not hurt that it stop in front of my hotel.

title: Bike Rentals Downtown Vancouver
reviews: For those staying at a downtown Vancouver hotel, Simon's Bike Shop's bike rentals are a convenient way to bike Stanley Park.  Downtown Vancouver is very bike friendly.  Rent a bike downtown, then ride the seawall bike path to and around Stanley Park.  Return via the English Bay seawall.  A detour across the Burrard Bridge (bike lane westbound, sidewalk back to downtown) for lunch on Granville Island.  Bike shop provides bike route map, helmet, lock, and back pack as inclusive of rental fee.  $25 per day but the Kingston Hotel gave us a 30% off card for M to F rentals.

title: Friendly and lovely city
reviews: Nice place to visit - stayed downtown and walked around - went to Lookout and then enjoyed the atmosphere of downtown - many nice restaurants and shops to choose from.

title: Vibrant, exciting city
reviews: We stayed in Granville in Vancouver for the weekend.   We used either public transportation or walked everywhere.  The public transportation is easy to use and abundant.  Our favorite stops included Granville Island, Gas Town and China Town.  Granville Street becomes one long block party on weekend evenings, with blocked streets and convenient taxi zones.

title: Vancouver is Beautiful!
reviews: We go to Vancouver every chance we get.  There are so many great restaurants and events.  Rent a bike and cruise around the seawall then ride to Granville Island.  Grab a picnic lunch, find a nice spot and people watch.  Endless opportunities  to have a good time

title: The Friendliest People.....
reviews: This is the friendliest downtown in ALL of North America! The Cleanest as well! Very Vibrant. Thank You Vancouver, I will see you soon!

title: Awesome...but crowded!
reviews: It was difficult not to give Vancouver an "excellent" but the only reason I did not was because of the congestion.  The City has a habit of over scheduling events and hotels and restaurants...though many...can become 'clogged'.....full and long waits.  So many things to do outside of the City and the varied population to be incorporated on your stay.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: This is a beautiful city but there are pretty much nothing to do except admiring the beauty of the mountains opposite the city. Things are extremely expensive in downtown vancouver so if you are on budget, perhaps stay away from downtown. There is an area that i think its pretty unique which is call East Hastings. The street is mainly inhabited by people who has drug addicts and homesless people but it is completely a safe place to visit. They dont really care about your existence. If you are worried of safety then i suggest not to visit. Downtown vancouver itself is pretty small, you only need about 3 days to complete the whole tour. I dont encoourage anyone to use the big bus tour because it is way too expensive. Its one of those cities that you won't miss out a lot even if you don't visit. Bathroom facilities: its quite easy to find if you visit the major shopping centre like pacific shopping centre or near the big departmental store Hudson Bay.

title: Wonderful downtown Vancouver!
reviews: I LOVE staying in the downtown area. There is so much to do. We especially enjoy browsing in Gastown and Chinatown, and it's fun and easy to hop on the Seabus for a trip across the water and back. You can go up in a tower to look over the whole city (sorry, the name escapes me!) and a visit to Stanley Park and the aquarium are a must. There is a hop on -hop off bus you can use to get to all the attractions (suggest you pay for the two days if you have the time; well worth it!). Don't forget Granville Island Market, and those sweet little Aqua Buses. We bought day passes which could be used for bus, sky train and Seabus for a day. Another good deal! That way you can visit the BIG Metrotown Mall! Enjoy my favourite city!

title: Beautiful City
reviews: The city is beautiful.  I wish I had more than a day there.  The people are real nice as well.  Olympic park was nice to see, it's on the way from airport to the center.

title: Excellent place to visit, so much to do and see in good weather
reviews: I stayed on Burrard street so was very central to downtown. There was so much to do and see. Huge high rise buildings, the mountains, Stanley park, the harbour, a very diverse mix of polite people, a fair few tramps and poverty let the beautiful city down. The Canada line and expo line was very easy to use. The bars, clubs and restaurants around Granville st / yaletown are great taxis are only easily accessible around downtown as you start to move out a bit it became near impossible to find a taxi so you have to phone to get picked up.

title: Walking and shopping in the city
reviews: Vancouver is an enjoyable city to walk around.  Particularly good are Gastown and Yale Town.  There are many restaurants and a good range of Hotels.  There are many promenades that go along the water's edge and lovely gardens throughout the city.  I also liked the treelined streets.

title: Wonderful Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Loved Downtown Vancouver - great mixture of old and new buildings and so much to see and do. Downtown is right on the waterfront with great views of the mountains; an amazing setting for such a big city. Lots of great shops, restaurants and different areas to visit such as Gastown, Granville Island, Chinatown etc and Canada Place is worth a visit so you can look across to North Van and watch the ships and the little planes taking off for the islands.

title: Rodeo Drive BC
reviews: (edit..mrbob67 again)  I'm not a shopper as rule but it was fun looking into all of the upscale stores.  Tiffany's, Coach, L'Octaine, just to name a few.  Bring your wallet with plenty of $$$$$$.  Enjoy.

title: Fantastic views
reviews: This is a beautiful city, with stunning views of the Harbour and North Shore mountains. It has a relaxed atmosphere with friendly locals. Definitely a place to visit. Can't wait to go back again.

title: Nice place to visit with some premier shops (and prices!)
reviews: The downtown area is a very nice city centre with a good range of mainly upmarket shops in a very clean and friendly city a short walk from seaplanes taking off and Gas Town with its more boutique shops mixed with tourist units. It would be fair to say that you can walk a little too far in one direction to end up in the poor and run-down area of the city - the underbelly that all cities have somewhere.

title: Fun Place
reviews: This is a great place to walk, bike, and stop at the many coffee shops for a cup of coffee. Also shopping! Quite high end but a great variety of stores to choose from.

title: Vitality in Vancouver
reviews: We spent 4 nights in Downtown Vancouver which wasn't enough for such a beautiful vibrant city.  Our hotel was centrally located to the great shopping in The Robson Street area, many buzzing restaurants and within walking distance to the open spaces of the waterfront at Coal Harbour.  Very much a user friendly city with trees, flowers spilling from hanging baskets and water features softening the entrance to high rise buildings.  The hop on, hop off Trolley buses a convenient and easy way to get around the city.  Would definitely go again.

title: A stay on Robson Street
reviews: We stayed at the Listel Hotel - comfortable and friendly hotel, the breakfast was very good in their restaurant Forage.  Plenty of restaurants nearby, lots of shops and an easy walk along Robson to Canada Place, Gas Town.  Earls is good to eat, casual, laid back and buzzing and the food is excellent at Joe Fortes for a special occasion.

title: Noisy, Dirty, Unfriendly
reviews: Not impressed, won't go back, spending my USDollars elsewhere.  Didn't feel safe, public transportation wasn't clean, people weren't friendly.

title: Charming city
reviews: We spent 4 days in this lovely city, and did a lot of walking to see the sights.   Please beware of the Mission which is just one block off of Gas town.  We apparently took a wrong turn off our map and wound up in front of the mission for the homeless.  It was frightening, being in a crazy world about a hundred or so of homeless and drug-related people.  Also, China town has moved out to Richmond area, even though it's right next to Gas town on the maps.  Do not go to China town expecting to find good Chinese restaurants and charming stores.

title: Very interesting
reviews: Definitely worth visiting the Downtown area - lots to see and browse around and plenty of places to eat and drink.

title: Nice city centre - on the waterfront, overlooking the mountains
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a nice city centre.  Interesting blend of old and new, which is compact and clean.  Felt very safe and relaxed.  Lots to see and do - easily walkable area as on the flat ... but  various buses, metro and taxis available and cheap if you want to go further afield.  Lots of shops, cafes, bars and hotels in city centre, but theatres, museums and galleries too.  But the big selling point for Downtown Vancouver is its spectacular location on the waterfront and overlooking the mountains.  Stanley Park is close by and worth a visit to see such amazing green space on your doorstep - you can walk, cycle or get the bus from Downtown.

title: Great city!
reviews: Very clean!  Great shops and restaurants.  There are so many people walking that you feel safe to explore the area.  Beautiful waterfront.

title: Old meets new
reviews: Where do you start, well very easy city to walk and discover, Chinatown a bit of a let down, Gastown great good restaurants and bars, shops good with friendly helpful staff, Canada Place also very good.

title: Great international city
reviews: I spent a day in Vancouver and I'd love to go back and have a few more days there. I had read somewhere that Vancouver is like Manhattan with mountains - well, I'd agree about the mountains, but maybe it would be more accurate to describe Vancouver as a mini Manhattan with mountains. Vancouver is a vibrant and lively place. I have read some reviews that mention homeless people on the streets, but I found this to be no worse, and in many cases better, that in other cities. Anyway, what do you expect when you visit a large city? There is certainly plenty to do, I particularly enjoyed Gastown, Granville Island and Stanley Park, plus the never ending views of the mountains from throughout the city. I look forward to returning.

title: It's pretty, but there are homeless people in the streets
reviews: I love walking when I visit a city, especially in the downtown √°rea.Across from my hotel there was a very nice shopping center with beautiful stores and Robson Street was just a few blocks away.There were all the famous brands and several elite brands as well. Lots of coffee shops and restaurants. There are beautiful buildings too.The only problem was that in the middle of any of those streets you could find outside an empty store or a corner some people living there with their beds and things, it was sad.

title: Lots to see
reviews: Spent hours wandering around - at Canada Place, Gastown and Chinatown. Some lovely old buildings mixed with modern glass offices. pleanty of places to shop and eat

title: Busy place, friendly people
reviews: Easy to reach with public transport. If unsure ask the bus driver, they are the friendliest in the world in my book!

title: LETDOWN
reviews: Stayed in downtown Vancouver and what a massive letdown. The streets are filthy, lots of beggars and generally shabby. Robson Street is certainly no Oxford Street..no Hard Rock Cafe, no Abercrombie and Fitch, no Levi store all in all lots of nothing... oh lots of greasy spoons. Gas town not too bad, Granville Island is better with a great food hall and nice selection of shops. Hop on hop off bus ok but stops running early. The buildings on the waterfront southside are all grey and very drab, in fact Vancouver is drab and I can't think of anything positive to say. Stanley park is nice but a park is a park and we have ones just as nice at home. I was very disappointed with Vancouver and I would tell people there are better places to visit than this dreary place.

title: very nice walk with kids but be careful where you go
reviews: We really liked Vancouver downtown, especially the gastown area with the steam clock that my 3 year old was crazy about ("a Thomas clock!...") but Chinatown (the area were we walked in) was scary, full of homeless people and drugs. I would highly recommend avoiding the Chinatown area when traveling with young kids.

title: Vancouver Translink (Transit System)
reviews: The city of Vancouver, located on a large island, has an Incredible transit system which enables visitors to traverse this beautiful city fast and fun.  A one day pass for adults is $9 ($7.50 for seniors), and provides access to a multi-faceted, well connected system that moves you above & below the traffic on SkyTrain and the West Coast Express at 3-4 times faster than a car/taxi as well as across the Fraser River via the SeaBus.  Purchase your ticket with a credit card at the first station & off you go.  Although the buses require you to scan your ticket, that's not the case for the SkyTrain or SeaBus so we assumed that it's an honor system.  Depending on your ability to tote your luggage, the system will quickly take you to any port, but for obvious reasons this is inadvisable during rush hour. Unfortunately, the system isn't connected to the airport so you're well advised to book a room at a hotel that provides free shuttle service to/from the airport (and, for the record, the 'airport' hotels are actually located downtown because the airport is sited on a small peninsula).

title: Bustling with day/nightlife
reviews: Busy both day and night, plenty of places to shop and eat.  Seems to have good transport options.Easy reach for Canada Place and the Waterfront.

title: One of my favourite places to go
reviews: I love Vancouver. The downtown core is so much fun to people watch, shop, meet friends for a coffee and enjoy the view of the mountains and ocean, which are breathtaking!

title: on the bus.
reviews: enjoyable but only viewed china town on the bus, gas town worth a visit, plenty of tourist shops, and restaurants. Visit the Steamwork brewery.

title: Mixed feelings
reviews: I have visited Vancouver before, from the UK and I had decided that if I needed to live in a city, it would be here.This time I brought friends and we stayed in the city for a few days.I now have mixed feelings. The city is vibrant and interesting. Parts of it are stunning for scenery and, for a city the friendliness is quite noticeable ,BUT, We were very upset and quite embarrassed to see the number of homeless people and the run-down areas and it was even worse to be approached every few steps by people begging for money etc.We have no answers and many cities are similar or much worse, but this is supposed to be one of the most go-ahead countries and cities in the world.It changes my outlook towards the city and future visits.We were not sure that Gastown was as much of an attraction as is advertised and it was certainly less of an attraction due to the number of approaches we received.Granville Island was great, the viewing tower was unbelievable at night, the harbour, ferry and the north shore market were certainly worth exploring and Chinatown was a great experience.

title: I know we see it everywhere
reviews: Hell we see it out of the Savoy in London.The dispossessed, the homeless. Easy to find in Vancouver Downtown.But they are either sleeping or awake and pleasant.Disconcerting though.I would have rather had an extra day in Victoria than the two days in Vancouver.Don't stay at the the Ho Jo, Go to the Sandman.

title: Clean Midtown
reviews: This is a very clean city downtown.  Robson, Georges and  Granville Streets are the heart of the shopping areas.  Area between China Town and Gas Town gets a bit seedy but its a bit off the beaten track.

title: Good spot to roam
reviews: Great shops, friendly service & an interesting place just to roam. There are malls & a good range of stand alone shops.

title: So beautiful in spring!
reviews: In the spring, the downtown area is bursting with blooms of tulips, daffodils and hyacinths.     Walk the downtown area or wander across one of the many bridges (Burrard, Granville, Cambie and Lions Gate) for great city views.  Downtown is clean, safe and very pretty!

title: A good place to see and shop(if you have more money).
reviews: .There are many business people and tourists at night shopping and having a good time at bars, cafes, restaurants. It is clean, safe and bustling. There are several tourist attractions near the heart of the city and public transport are generally excellent and plenty of taxis.

title: Incredible pleasant Downtown
reviews: Vancouver Downtown is one of the most pleasant Downtown in the world. It is so easy to reach from Robson Street the beautiful boardwalk in Coal Harbour or the Cruise Terminal, Convention Centre or  Gastown. There is so much green everywhere that you no longer see the high rise buildings and do not feel their pressure when you stroll the beautiful streets  of Downtown Vancouver.

title: Definitely my favourite Canadian city!
reviews: Very relaxing "downtown" atmosphere, no rush,no pressure and so many different types of places for every type of person to visit. Waterfront area is amazing. Sightseeing and shopping oppurtunities galore! If I were to live in Canada, this is where it would be, eh!!

title: One of the best in Canada
reviews: If you like lively and always slightly crowded downtowns, you'd like Vancouver downtown. Its not crazy busy except for weekdays 7-9 am and 4-6 pm, neither dead.

title: See it all, all of it.
reviews: Robson street shopping district, from water to tower, its a great walk.  Much like St. Catherine street montreal.  But nicer.

title: Where it all happens.
reviews: We are older independent travellers but enjoyed our walk through the downtown area, had a coffee and sat people watching.  The sun was shining and there were lots of shops and cafes to look at, there was a lovely chocolate shop mmmm can't remember the name but the things they were making were so unusual.  There are buses and electric buses around, also the Skytrain somewhere down here, also never far away is the water.

title: Vagrants Everywhere
reviews: What a shame, great city and such great tourist attractions, but it is ruined by Vagrants... virtually every 50 yards, begging for money on the road, outside bars, hotels on street corners, why dont the local Govt or Police move them ?

title: Walkable
reviews: Excellent walking, nice views, and amazingly tidy!  Not enough parking.  Great shops and many restaurants, lounges and dance clubs!

title: Harbourfront is the Best
reviews: The area around Canada Place was incredibly. Great atmosphere, saw a cruise ship docked nearby, and the harbourfront view to North Vancouver was the best skyline I've ever seen in my life. Ocean, town, forest, mountain, in the same shot.

title: Sea Bus a Secret Find
reviews: This is one of those fun things to do because a "local" told you about it and I'm talking about the Vancouver Sea Bus. In my opinion, one of the most fun things to do in Vancouver at a most reasonable cost. The Sea Bus runs from downtown Vancouver's waterfront to the lower Lonsdale area in North Vancouver. You'll see the most beautiful city in the world fro your own viewing area aboard this foot passenger Ferry (Sea Bus). You'll float across Coal Harbour to the North Shore where you'll disembark and enjoy Lonsdale Quay (shops, restaurants, fun stuff for kids). And if you are adventurous, walk of the Ferry and take the Bus to Grouse Mountain...all for the same fare. Check the Kiosks for Fares as the do vary but should be no more than $5.50 at peak travel times. While travelling on the Sea Bus, watch for the many harbour Freighters that are waiting to unload..it's a fantastic site. I promise the Sea Bus is one truly fun idea while visiting Vancouver, so enjoy!

title: A Very Nice and Friendly Place
reviews: Vancouver just gets better and better.  The downtown core has been cleaned up with plenty of new trees that have been planted.  The high rises actually have some character, unlike many of the 'square blocks' in other cities.  Granville Street is very impressive.  Gastown was a little disappointing.  It looks old and run down.  It looks the same as when we lived there 40 years ago.  Older but not smarter.

title: What is there NOT to like about Vancouver ?
reviews: We have visited Vancouver three times now, ------ and each time we have discovered more and more interesting things to see and to do. Gas Town, China town, a trip up to the top of the tower (by day and by night) It is an easy city to get around, either on foot, by bus, by Sky train, or by those wonderful ferries that take you across the harbor.  There are plenty of places to find a good meal, ----- from 'up-market' to very inexpensive. (I almost became ADDICTED to Tim Horton's coffee, ---- and even brought a tin of 'Timmies' home with me.)The shopping is excellent, with a wide range of goods to choose from.Canadians complain about the rain in Vancouver.  We experienced some rain there, ---- but it certainly didn't deter us from enjoying our visit.Downside, ------ the beggars everywhere, and each with their own hard luck story to tell.  We were not used to this and found it very disconcerting.  But they apparently gravitate to Vancouver from other parts of Canada because of the more temperate climate there.Vancouver is a BEAUTIFUL city, ----- we have enjoyed our visits there immensely.

title: Large City Centre
reviews: Large urban centre what you'd expect from a large city. Lots of different shops, restaurants, activities to do. Also has the advantage of a good seafront. Felt safe when walking around and transport was good.

title: Vancouver city
reviews: Plenty of great sights all within walking distance on CBD. Easy city to find your way around, just grab a map & wlk.  Shopping in Robson st is worth a day on its own.

title: A fun and safe downtown
reviews: Having just come from Victoria, across the sound, we were at first distress by a lot of debri on and sidewalks and the number of homeless. But as we got to know our way around we enjoyed the city more and more. Everyone was friendly. There are literally coffee shops on everyone corner and no end to good restaurants. The people watching is fantastic and there are many small interesting places. We particularly enjoyed the Gas district and Stanley Park. The Hudson Bay Company's department store was a great shopping spot. One of the first things to do is buy a ride on a city tour bus. We would recommend the Big Bus Company.

title: Loads to see and do
reviews: Plenty of good shops and restaurants in this area .Very busy ,but be very careful for beggars and vagrants on streets .they are everywhere asking for money for food .It made us very nervous walking round . The worst place seemed to be China town give it a miss nothing there ,just more beggars

title: 'Great vibes'
reviews: Lovely well designed and visually attractive city offering a wide range of eateries, bars, things to see and do. Relaxed feel about it, but also full of life and with a buzz about it that gets under your skin.  Has its share of beggers/hawkers particularly around Canada Place where people come and go to the cruise ships but not a huge number compared to other cities and they were never pestered or were intimidating. City feels safe and is well worth a visit.

title: Great vibe
reviews: We spent 3 days in downtown Vancouver.  Yes, there are many homeless beggars but skirting around them we enjoyed the international flare and the wide choice of restaurants.  It is an easily walkable city with a great range of activities and landmarks.  We especially loved the view of water surrounded by mountains and the friendly, helpful people.

title: Relaxed shopping in vancouver
reviews: Great relaxed shopping stores ESP Hudson Bay department store very classy. Very nice smaller boutiques and terriffic bars and small restaurants

title: Dirty
reviews: If You like HUNDREDS of destitute homeless people and lots of beggars mixed with tourists from cruise ships You'll love this place.Canadian socialism at work. We planed to stay 4 days and left after one.

title: Full of homeless vagrants
reviews: I'm sorry to say the amount of homeless and drug users on the streets mean I will not be going back or advising anyone else to do so. I felt intimidated from early morning when they loomed out of door ways to going back to the hotel after dinner

title: Love Vancouver Downtown
reviews: Excellent shopping, many different options of restaurants and cuisenes .Many different businesses to see and shop from.Great atmosphere.Lost of entertainment and a nice walk too!!

title: City in beautiful setting
reviews: We found Vancouver to be a great city for active people. We enjoyed our visit very much. We walked and biked quite a bit. Great restaurants! We participated in the last Salsa dance of the season at Robson Square. It was lots of fun!

title: Don't miss this bar on a Sunday night
reviews: We are staying at the Ramada Inn in Granville Street and decided to visit the little Irish bar downstairs for a snack. Little did we know what an an absolute treat lay ahead. Mic night is Sunday night, and out of the audience stepped the amazing Don Alder - Acoustic guitarist. Absolutley incredible sounds. Then, as though that wasn't enough in itself, we had the priviledge of hearing "Optimus Prime" himself - Gary Chalk - sing and play acoustic guitar. Probably the very best rendition of "Georgia" we've ever heard. Please treat yourself and visit on a Sunday evening. We were thrilled to have done so.

title: A lovely and beautiful city to explore
reviews: I loved exploring Vancouver by foot and seeing all the different landscapes that envelope the city around to Stanley Park. I found the city had everything shopping wise and felt really safe to explore the different parts of the city. People were really friendly and Canada Place was a good central hub for a tourist when they are in the city. Vancouver is a lively and social city that is easy for a tourist to share in and  easy to get around. Loved it.

title: Love the" International Flare"
reviews: We stayed three night and four days downtown Vancouver and thoroughly enjoyed the unique sights and sounds of a city that you might find in Europe. There were people of all nationalities and races, that was reflected in the multitude of ethnic restaurants( Denman Street). The city is clean and relatively safe. Its beauty surpasses any city that I have visited with mountain and sound views mixed with beaches, forests, and outdoor art. You must visit Vancouver.

title: Love Downtown
reviews: It's enjoyable just to wall around the seawall. The beggars asking for $ is a bit frustrating. There are many shops & cafe's. Access to many activities & the skytrain system. The clothing shops are a bit expensive.

title: One of the most beautiful cities in the world
reviews: Vancouver is awesome! Such a beautiful culturally diverse city! I love all the trees - you'd think that you were driving into suburbia not the heart of a big city. Once downtown, so many great shops & restaurants & activities within walking distance. Granville St in particular is a fascinating look at life in the big city.

title: Delightful
reviews: Vancouver is an awesome place to visit. More like Boston than NYC, easy to get around, lovely waterfront and good food abounds. Lots of great photos also!!!

title: Beautiful cosmopolitan city
reviews: I live just outside Seattle, and by comparison Vancouver seems enormous. Vancouver is a beautiful cosmopolitan city that offers everything imaginable. The city has an amazing city skyline ringed by mountains and water. The city offers everything -- distinct neighborhoods filled with a plethora of ethnic foods, shopping, cultural activities, and recreational activities. This is always a fun weekend destination we try to enjoy a couple times a year.

title: Skyscrapers galore!
reviews: We liked the views of skyscrapers all around, seemed so clean and busy.  Accessible shops and easy to understand crossings on roads.  Liked the city life, a vibrant city for sure!

title: Walked around Downtown core
reviews: Beautiful sunny day, a couple of cruise ships in port. You just can't beat Vancouver for scenery when its sunny!

title: Clean and fun palce
reviews: There are many a great restaurant in down town but you have to know the place as certain districts are full of homeless people and junkies who are shouting and cursing at passers by. Stay away from china town and gas town.

title: Vibrant upbeat city
reviews: The appearance of the city is dynamic and spectacular almost like San Francisco.  You can find anything you're looking for.  Plan at least three days.  Take in Fly Over Canada at the Convention Centre...it is moving.

title: Beautiful
reviews: Vancouver downtown is beautiful. Really reminded us of our hometown of Melbourne in Australia. Lots of shopping to do, and we found the city very clean and nicely planned out.

title: Hilly and sometimes sketchy
reviews: Wear your sneakers if you are staying at the waterfront. Some sections have a lot of homeless and panhandling, as well as a few sketchy areas around the Gaslight district.

title: Awesome
reviews: Out of all the places I went on my trip, this was the highlight for me. The city is just great, we went at night, parked the car (parking can be difficult to find) and had dinner. We than walked around the city and gas town. Was a lovely walk, make sure to check out the Olympic torch. Was lots of fun, great place to just hang out with your friends and have a good time :) Felt like this city was fairly safe compared to others, gets quieter as the night gets later (believe it or not). Also visited it in the day, so was good to see how it looks at different times, though I enjoyed the night vibe more so.

Once you've got in the right part of town it's fab. Gas town is lovely an other parts too. However on our first night we walked right into a dodgy part which all cities have. I'm not sure where we ended up but were on our way to china town when we stumbled into a bunch of peculiar people. We just turned and headed back. The next night we tried again to find china town and managed to find it but came across unpleasant sights so jumped in a taxi and headed back. If you defiantly want to go to china town I suggest taking a cab to the centre. No harm was done but make sure you know where you are going. Some parts are lovely, built up, posh, upmarket and generally have a nice feel to them so read up before going. All cities have rough areas so don't let this put you off making the visit! Definitely worth while...

title: Long walk on a hot day
reviews: We started our walk at the Scotia Bank building after having lunch in the underground food hall. We walked across to the Court House and Art Gallery but they were closed. I think maybe we were at the back of the gallery so maybe it had been open. We then walked down Georgia Street going into the Fairmont Hotel to get leaflets about attractions. We saw the Shangri La Hotel (the tallest building in Vancouver) which my Grandson found out has 61 floors. We walked down to Canada Place where there is a convention centre as well as the main area where cruise ships come in. We also watched the flying boats take off and land. It is quite hilly around here as we found on returning to the central area. On our first visit we walked along the coast past the Marinas full of wonderful boats and round to the edge of Stanley Park, before returning back up Georgia. We walked to the Harbour Centre to visit the Lookout Restaurant. As in most big cities there are many boutiques and well known stores. Everywhere is very well signposted and it is easy to work out where you are as the streets are on a grid pattern. On another day we walked to see the Cathedral and on down into Gastown to see the famous steam clock. As cities go Downtown is not a massive area and much of it can be seen on foot quite easily. If this is not your style there are several bus companies that tour the city where you can hop on and off using the same ticket if you want to see a particular place. There are plenty of places to see and things to do and the city is generally well cared for and the people friendly.

title: beautiful
reviews: While I was fortunate not to have an automobile, from the point of view of a bicyclist or pedestrian this is an incredible city. Streets are laid out on a grid, and easy to navigate. Most major roads have bike lanes, and in addition many dedicated bike paths parallel to roadways. Waterside architecture spectacular but crowded - who can blame the residents for wanting to be by the water. Many, many public parks and greenspaces.I wish I had known about Vancouver when I was younger and deciding where to to put down roots.

title: Vacation
reviews: An awesome city to visit especially downtown area with the stanley park closed by.  Transportation is good and when we are staying with friends in Coquitlam, we took skytrain everywhere we go.

title: Just like any other metropolitan downtown
reviews: Construction everywhere. Very crowded. And God help you if you need to go somewhere and have to cross downtown by car which is almost every time.

title: Downtown walking
reviews: Walking through downtown was a great treat. There are so many great art museums and historical buildings. There is every kind of restaurant you could want, but the ones in Yale are outstanding.

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: Great city, very cosmopolitan. Great to explore on foot. I was very fortunate when i was there it snowed in Vancouver City, Stanley Park and the Mountains to the north looked a picture. Very Clean and Friendly. Got to see the Canucks play two games WOW !! what a experience that is, sitting in the middle of all these locals cheering their team on. Plan to spend more time here on my return trip. Beautiful City.

title: Gastown
reviews: Gastown is really beautiful during crhistmas and it's a good place to buy suvenirs. You also can find there the steam clock to take great pictures.

title: Terrible
reviews: The parking is so atrocious - and expensive - walk it or take the Canada Line (subway) or walk it. The Orpheum and some rip off Cineplex new rip off theatres add to the negative ... some is good - but find a place to park .....it goes late at night ... Granville Mall can be a homeless dangerous type area - there are some positives ... I stay away .people compare Robson street to Bloor in Toronto or similar shopping streets - the piddly art gallery is hardly worth the time ... the shopping of Robinsstrasse (original) is a downfall of true Vancouver

title: Beautifully designed, walking, biking friendly city!
reviews: Our first trip to Vancouver and wish we could stay longer. Stayed in the west end and it was close to everything, walked a lot and everything was so well marked and easy to find. Clean and so friendly...

title: Easy to Navigate
reviews: So much to do and so easy to find your way around.  We were so impressed with the big city life right along side beautiful parks, playgrounds with children happily playing and flowers everywhere.  We were told by the locals we came on one of the best days of the year with plenty of sunshine and the mid-sixties outside.  Great Ale at one of the waterfront bars and excellent Sushi a short ride away that could have been walked too, but an entire day of walking this amazing downtown area of the city left of longing for a ride.

title: Clean and Quiet City Center
reviews: Lots of food and drink and people watching.  Very walkable from one waterfront to the other and also to Stanley Park.  Great Pride Parade in Aug.

title: Magnificient & Diverse
reviews: So many neighbourhood jewels to visit,Gastown, Robson st for shopping, waterfront to see Olympic cauldron,most of it walkable. It is a very alive city!!!

title: wonderful place
reviews: The city was one of the prettiest cities we've run into - very clean, vibrant, and the eateries were excellent.  Interesting place, wish we had had more time there

title: Dense Can Be Good
reviews: Walking about Downtown Van is do-able and enjoyable. And that is saying something from a city-phobe who hates crowds. The close proximity and tall scale seems to work somehow.  Maybe it's because of the geographically induced compact nature of Vancouver's neighbourhoods but it entertains and there is always something different and interesting just steps away.  Walking surfaces can obstruct however and it seems accessiblity is not an issue locals prioritise...lack of a necessity to adapt to winter snows might be one reason.  Blithe ignorance might another.  Being Dense can also be double-edged.

title: Great walking city
reviews: The downtown area is easily accessible by foot. You can shop until you drop, drink at tons of different pubs and bars and eat a huge variety of cuisine at restaurants all within close proximity.

title: VC Downtown
reviews: Vibrant, multi cultural, fun, compact. Easy to get around on foot or public transportation.Great inexpensive restaurants every where.

title: Beautiful city, very clean!
reviews: Out side the city, poor freeways, difficult to go to one point to an other. Maybe because I'm use-to the Los Angeles, urbanization  but I had hard times driving around.

title: I'm sorry, but I hate downtown Vancouver
reviews: I live in Vancouver now, but even when I didn't, I never liked downtown Vancouver. It is dirty, entirely too busy, lined with multiple identical businesses and restaurants serving the same sub-standard products, and embarrassing nightclubs where people mainly just embarrass themselves. The sole exceptions to this are Davie and Denman streets, and the seawall from the Vancouver convention centre to Stanley Park. Granville and Robson streets are completely avoidable 99% of the time. For parks, North Vancouver Lynn Valley and Grouse mountain are far superior, as is Queen Elizabeth Park in South Vancouver, and South Cambie street and Commercial have more affordable eats with a great variety. Save your time, money and sanity, and stay away from the downtown wherever possible.

title: Nice Vibe
reviews: Downtown has a nice feel, clean and plenty of people watching on the weekend and is right on the water.

title: Fly Over Canada
reviews: I am usually suspect to mainly tourist attractions, however, the "Fly Over Canada" video show was wonderful!  This multi-video sound experience is located within the downtown Canada Conference Center. Before you enter the "fly" zone, you stand in a room with a 360 degree video presentation--most impressive but the best was yet to come!  We were ushered into the "fly" zone and buckled in to our seats.  Then the fun and absolute awesome beauty began.  You actually feel that you are flying over the amazingly beautiful landscapes of Canada.  After the show ended, we all agreed that we wanted to go again.

title: Fabulous city!
reviews: Vancouver is totally a cosmopolitan city! the restaurants are great Loved Chin Chin and the Lift restaurant.The beauty is overwhelming with the mountains and ocean.A lot of water activity and hiking in the area.Beautiful hotels, great shopping and everyone is outdoors walking, hikingor bird watching.

title: Nice city
reviews: Overnight-ed in Vancouver after a visit to the Canadian Rockies. This is a very nice city.  We walked around in the evening for 2 hours. We felt safe and there were lots of people around. The waterfront area is amazing with bike paths and walking paths and park areas. There are plenty of restaurants and coffee shops and all kinds of retail stores

title: Beautiful City with Great Shopping and Restaurants!
reviews: No matter what your choice of cuisine, you will find it in downtown Vancouver.  We chose the Kegs Steakhouse and were very happy with the delicious meals we received.  Souvenir shopping was plentiful and prices reasonable.

title: You should see downtown, but be warned, BC stands for Bring Cash
reviews: Vancouver a downtown has a few historic sites but is mostly full of tourist trap trinket shops and over priced restaurants. Bang for your buck it is not... It is an experience though. My suggestion is to save your pennies, rent a bike to tour the downtown core, then bike down Main Street for lunch ;)

title: In one WORD! Spectacular!!!
reviews: Wonderful shopping, food, sights and you can walk all over! Stayed in the Yaletown area! Walked to the harbor, had brunch and took a water taxi over to Granville Island! Everyone is so friendly no matter where you go! Can hardly wait until Dec. we are going back for Christmas!!!

title: Upscale and fun shopping
reviews: We spent one whole day just shopping and walking around downtown.  There was upscale shopping, art galleries, small shops.  Plenty to do.  Lunch wasn't a probably either.  Lots of restaurants and vendors were available.

title: Love Vancouver
reviews: Our Alaskan cruise was leaving out of Vancouver. We decided to take a day to explore Vancouver, and I'm so glad that we did. What a great city. We took a HoHo bus to get a feel for where everything is, and to get us there easily. I highly recommend it. The city is easy to navigate. Every neighborhood was worth seeing. we were there in July, so the sun did not set until very late, giving us more time to walk and explore.

title: Beautiful British Columbia indeed!
reviews: Great city to visit in the summer!  I had a wonderful time visiting the shops and eating at the different restaurants in the downtown area. There are lots of different attraction near the city. Parking is a little expensive so make sure that you have enough change or have your credit card ready when you take your car.

title: Like NYC....but Busier!
reviews: Felt very much at home...traffic, bustling people, great shops. What made it different were the view of the mountains and the Skywall, although it reminded me of the Chelsea Pier at home. I enjoyed the walls of glass on the skyscrapers. Easy walking city...from Robson, to Gastown...or take a hop on/hop off bus and stop at points of interest...Stanley Park, Chinatown, Granville, etc. A great city.

title: first visit
reviews: The down town is crowded like in Toronto. Most of the buildings are old. The place is packed with tourists.

title: Frayed Collars, Crowded, and Busy
reviews: Vancouver downtown is not as pleasant as it was ten or twenty years ago.  There are way too many people and their stuff cluttering the streets and sidewalks, and store appearances seem to have gone downhill.

title: One of our favorite cities
reviews: Our favorite time of year to visit May-October. We stay near city center, where we can leave our car and walk the downtown area, Robson Street, West End and Gastown during the daytime (we are not night-life people). There are so many great museums, restaurants, coffee shops, neighborhoods. And people watching of course! There's such a great mix of ethnicities and tourists here. Note: I have not noticed any more homeless people living on the streets here than in other major west coast cities. The mild climate probably encourages them to migrate here.

title: Take the hop-on hop-off
reviews: Invest in a ticket for the hop-on hop-off bus for one or two (only a few $ more) to get to places you'll want to go back to. The drivers are fun. Granville Island was our favorite. Some very good restaurants, market with lots of good things to buy or snack on and artisans. We didn't get to Gastown or Chinatown, but they looked enticing. I booked a room at the Sheraton Wall. It's a dead zone--office buildings, a rather long walk to the harbour.

title: Vancouver
reviews: A beautiful city spoiled somewhat by the rainy days (they get a lot of sun but too but it is known for rain!). Canadians are very laid back and social people.  Granville Island, Museum of Anthropology were particular highlights.

title: Like that
reviews: Vancouver Downtown is way more clean then other cities I've seen. And I felt more safe then in other major cities. Its not THAT spectacularm but its a nice place and when you visit Vancouver you should have a look. Bring some money there are fance shops where you can shop ;)

title: Typical city
reviews: Walked to china town. Passed a street loaded with druggies and homeless . Made the experience a little scary. Once passed that street everything was fine. Wouldn't want to be there at night.

title: Great city
reviews: Went to Vancouver at last minute trip on long weekend. Border was manageable both ways and there was a street festival downtown so there were lots of people and activities all over downtown. Great visit as usual.

title: Interesting experiance on the other side of the world
reviews: Walking into Chinatown feels like I'm in an asian country but just a block away in Gastown you're in a totally different environment. A very happening place with lots and lots of restaurants and pubs around. Though a little concern as Gastown is near to a community area where homeless people roam.

title: Fabulous
