reviews: We stayed for a week in one of the high rise apart hotel blocks near the harbour and a stone's throw from Stanley Park.Wide range of etnic and traditional cuisines, we particularily liked a Malaysian restaurant. Bars galore, interesting features eg the steam clock, Gas town, China town. Really enjoyed evening walks along the harbour front and the odd drink or two and a meal along the way; watching the boat planes take off and land. People walking, cycling, picnicing, playing games, etc.

title: Loved it!
reviews: We stayed 3 days in Vancouver before boarding our Alaskan cruise.  Stayed in the heart of downtown.  Loved how easy it was to walk everywhere.  Impressed by how clean the city is and how gorgeous the architecture!  Easy to drive out of downtown to head to ferry and up to Whistler.Entire family wants to go back for a longer stay - didn't get a chance to enjoy all that Vancouver has to offer.

title: Hustle and Bustle
reviews: All the hustle and bustle of a international melting pot!  We enjoyed our walks through the downtown area immensely.  People watching at its best....  could have spent hours and hours going through all the shops and exploring, but time was limited.

title: A must visit city
reviews: Amazing city so much to do and see, people so helpful and friendly and a very easy place to get around

title: Wonderfull green historical town
reviews: To see all the attractions you don't need a car but you can do it by bicycle. Excellent and well done. There enough possibilities given by the touristic institutes. Good organized for everybody to use.

title: a trip to remember
reviews: packed with tours of the city rockie mountain train trip to banff helicpter ride bus to calgary flight back to vancouver then cruise from vancouver to sydney via los angelies hawaii with a submarean tour waikiki beach samoa figi venuatu new caladonia and numea in a month what a expeariance it was brings me to seeing 36 coutries i have seen in my life

title: good shopping
reviews: lots of designer shops and good prices. we went from us to canada and taxes were less. its  along street with shops on both sides and is very happening place

title: Nice
reviews: You may not like Yaletown so much but Gasoline Town is much more condusive to dancing and eating out.  Yaletown had allot of homeless people sleeping right straight on the street and many mentally ill and people high on drugs.

title: Great place to shop and eat
reviews: Make sure to stop by Robson Street, Gastown & Chinatown (during the day time is the safest) and Stanley Park.

title: Disappointed in Vancouver
reviews: We were not impressed with Vancouver.  Homeless people camped out on all the sidewalks, with all their belongings.  Panhandling all over.  The smell of marijuana permeating the air.  People drinking alcoholic bevages on the streets.  Drug deals being made right out in the open.  Not many police around to stop any of this.  I never felt afraid, just not a place where I wanted to spend my vacation or my money.

title: great walking city
reviews: we used the Hop on Hop off tours bus to get us around the city and was able to see quite a bit.  the weather cooperated.  we were in gas town, cool area to walk about.  we tried a few different restaurants and enjoyed each one.  short walk to transportation.  or taxis  Vancouver is a great city to visit but be aware of the price for food...   it was higher than any other city..

title: Nice City
reviews: It is a busy place with lots of traffic. But the people are lovely in Vancouver and is definitely a good place to visit if you like seeing different cities like me! There's lots of shopping and eateries, could easily spend the whole day just walking around.

title: Garbage, druggies and panhandlers
reviews: I stayed near Howe St and Drake St, and when I went for dinner around that area, I found the area run-down, strewn with garbage and there were panhandlers and druggies everywhere.  I had to cross the street just to avoid them.  I also went to Chinatown.  First thing someone told me was to put away my DSLR camera because I would be mugged.   Needless to say, I felt unsafe from that point on and was happy to leave Vancouver for Victoria

title: Shopping heaven
reviews: Great shops, excellent eating, sea views and people watching.  Amazing.  Spend a day, a week, a month, you'll love it.

title: Too many people everywhere
reviews: My husband were shocked by the traffic and crazy drivers . And so many people walking everywhere. Every street corner was crowded. Although I'm glad those people were walking instead of driving. But people would just dart out on to the street, so you had to really be watching out . I hadn't been to Vancouver for over 20years and was really surprised by how much it has grown. I think we will go back to Victoria on our next visit to B.C.

title: Clean and it feels safe at night
reviews: Walked down Granville, the street of youths, pubs and discos at midnight and felt safe and entertained......didn't go anywhere except down the street.!

title: Just another downtown
reviews: Lovely City with views to sea. Downtown area is pleasant. If you have been to San Fran or Sydney you won't rave about Vancouver. Expensive for UK visitors in August 2013 but then everywhere is until exchange rate improves.

title: Great Tour
reviews: On Thursday, August 22, 2013 we toured Vancouver BC on your 4 hour city tour.  The entire tour was top notch and we were picked up and delivered back to our hotel.  Andy and Rick were both above the bar in their knowledge and friendly manner.  My sister left her camera on the tour bus and it was found and returned to our hotel.  Many thanks for that.  I will definitely recommend your tours.  Thanks for your courtesies.  Jim and Judy Bosten and

title: Beautiful city if you are on the water
reviews: We stayed on the water and it was beautiful.  We loved walking up and down the seawall but once we ventured into town it was very crowded, dirty and not a fun place to be.

title: Everything and Not Just in Moderation
reviews: I work downtown.  I give it 5 stars because it is a vibrant living city centre. There is such a good mix of residential, retail and commercial that the city lives 24/7 unlike so many downtown cores.  This is where you want to visit, enjoy a foodcart or great restaurant meal, a walk on Robson, watch a protest or play a game of chess at the Art Gallery. Stroll through what I refer to as a secret garden at north end of the Court House.  A great place to live and work.

title: shops
reviews: we spent a full week in Vancouver downtown Granville street for shops along with robson street we spent many nights at Canada place dining at an Italians along with visits to bars and restaurants in yaletown and good we soveneir shops in gastown it was all very close at hand and the variety of shops and bars were excellent the walks along the front was equally pleasant allowing for the cyclists a great place to visit try the George ultra bar in yaletown they make excellent cocktails

title: Great City
reviews: Very diverse city, many sites, could have stayed there a week and not see everything.  Gastown very quaint and not far from Canada Place within walking distance.  The neighborhood block are short, so not much walking.

title: Shops and restaurants galore!
reviews: We ventured through Gastown, Robson Street shopping, Canada Place/Waterfront.  Felt very safe and it was quite vibrant both day and night.

title: A favorite downtown
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has everything going for it.  Ferries, convenient subways, shops, interesting restaurants, the waterfront, and Stanley Park just down the street.  A visit to the Vancouver Lookout, an observation deck, brings it all together.  It makes you question why you don't live here!

title: Scary scary scary
reviews: Not at all what I expected. We spent 5weeks in Canada. Vancouver was a good base for trips but not what we expected at all. It has many good qualities, great beaches, lovely mountains, Stanley park...However, it is a city RIDDLED with drugs. The nightlife is terrible as there isn't much of a drinking culture and you get offered drugs constantly which is so annoying and intimidating. The streets are filthy and the homelessness problem seriously needs to be addressed. East Hastings and Granville street are most notorious. Couldn't believe it I imagined a totally different city. Don't know how they hid this from the media especially during the 2010 Olympics. CLEAN UP YOUR STREETS VANCOUVER

title: Nice city
reviews: You will feel safe walk in this downtown, but I saw many homeless. So you must a little bit care. But shop close too early

title: Perfect
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has so much to offer.  We loved our time here exploring the city, enjoying the great restaurants, savouring wonderful seafood and taking in what makes a sea side city so special.  Especially loved Yaletown and the Vancouver Art Gallery!

title: User friendly downtown
reviews: Vancouver is a great destination. The downtown area has so much to do and see.The shopping ,scenery and general vibe is great!

title: have a gas in Gas Town
reviews: wide variety of places to eat, shop and drink....safe to walk there at all hours....It is close to the rest of downtown and only a mile from Stanley Park. There is alot to do downtown and for a change of pace take the ferry from downtown to North Vancouver just for fun

title: Under Construction
reviews: While a major construction project was underway, it was still a nice day in downtown Vac.  I enjoyed visiting Christ Church and the Vancouver Fairmont.  There was some concern about the number of street poor, but it made for a good mix of people in the city.

title: Great and beautiful city to spend some days
reviews: Super clean and friendly city. Easy to walk. nice views from every corner, the  stores and streets are well named, so it easy to walk. I feel very safe walking all around.  We will go back  as soon as possible We love it

title: Browsing and shopping and eating in a beautiful, friendly environment
reviews: The thing that strikes me first about Canada is how friendly and open everyone is.  You can always have a really interesting conversation with anyone serving in a shop, or bar or restaurant - they have time for you however busy they are.  Downtown Vancouver is beautiful - you are never far from glimpses of the sea or the mountains.  There are some quite interesting old buildings and curiosities like the steam clock in Gastown, which chimes tunes through its organ-like steam pipes every quarter hour.  Shops vary from the 'naff' souvenir outlets to much more interesting shops selling 'First Nation' indigenous artefacts, from jewelry and art to clothes and toys.  Worth visiting the Inuit Art Store/Museum off Cordova Street (but you will be investing, not just buying, if you purchase any of it!) The public bus services are excellent - $2.75 for any length of ride, one way only - but you need the right change ready in advance - or a season ticket.

title: Lovely city
reviews: Easy to see from the hop on hop off bus... A little expensive but worth doing, can buy a ticket for 2 days, not necessarily consecutive for about $45 each. There are some lovely parts to the city and some that are up and coming under revamp. Ignore the dropouts on the street...there are quite a lot of them but they are harmless. Gas Town was a favourite area. Robson Street good for shopping. Bellagio's by Canada Place great to eat.

title: vvvvvv DOWNTOWN
reviews: V V V V V V Two stars for Stanley park and five for White Spot? Oh brother! Also, the review of downtown is whacko. Pour yourself another drink and go back to Hicksville!

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: Over 700,000 people live in this city.  If you divide the city in half vertically, the people on the western half are worth over one million dollars and the people on the eastern half are worth less.  We were told by our hotel clerk not to venture out on the streets until after the rush-hour traffic (after 9:30 a.m.)  Plan on having megabucks to pay the parking meters:  $3.00/hour at Stanley Park aquarium and $1.75/half hour at the Museum of Anthropology for the parkade--that's in addition to the admission fees.  The informational signs are in English, French,  Chinese, and Squamish--no Spanish.  It was relatively easy to follow the flow of traffic on Hwy. 99 with good highway signs to find our way out of the city to cross the border into Washington  State.  According to a newspaper article I read while there this July, they were running out of room to build, and the only place to build now was "up."  The housing condition is crowded.  We were told the the mainland Chinese are coming here to buy property and inflating the cost of real estate.  A 1970 house with about 1,000 square feet was selling for $538,000; a half duplex was selling for $409,000.   The average cost of dinner for two meals ranged between $60 and $80 with no appetizer, beverage, or dessert, plus the added cost of parking.  The city is an old city and run down in certain locations.

title: Great walking city
reviews: We stayed downtown and to tell you the truth, we were able to walk most places. It is a great walking city, during our stay we did not encounter any rain so I am sure that helped our review. We loved Vancouver!

title: nice place to visit
reviews: you must have to go for great walking in the downtoun area,spacialy visit canada place and neerest streets and also the tower.

title: Vibrant and happy
reviews: This area is full of restaurants and shopping options. It is clean and vibrant. One of the most enjobable areas of Vancouver.

title: BEAUTIFUL CITY
reviews: We were in Vancouver and Richmond for 6 days and 5 nights. This review is more like Vancouver in general than just downtown vancouver.Maybe 6 days is small sample size. But Vancouver has to be the friendliest, healthiest, cleanest, greenest, safest, slimest, the most polite and courteous, the most bicycle friendly city that we have ever been to. We are from San Francisco and we were amazed to see how clean the streets are. I heard car honking maybe 5 times altogether. We did not see a single policeman the six days we were there. When I wanted to change lane, the other drivers always let me. Motorists always yield to pedestrians. Pedestrians rarely jaywalk. My wife only weighs 100 lbs but she said she felt fat seeing all those slim girls. The weather was so good that she didn't need to use any of the skin cream she brought on the trip.The city of Vancouver is truly spectacular and we will always have fond memories of the city.

title: Surprised at all the highrises!
reviews: Vancouver reminded me of Hong Kong. A lot of people live in tall places. Lots to see, China town was interesting.

title: Gas town is super cool, but unlike New York or San Francisco, stay the hell away from China town.
reviews: Chinatown should not be on any tourist map in it's present condition.  We felt very unsafe with the druggies, mental patients and homeless.

title: Very Neat City
reviews: We spent about two days here.  Very easy to walk and easy to navigate.  Very friendly city.  For a city of it's size, we found it to be a very clean city.

title: Walking All Over
reviews: I loved Vancouver downtown! I stayed on Robson Street and took long walks every day. What an energy! It was a holiday weekend and so many people were enjoying the beautiful sunny weather. I love this city!

title: Was fun to explore the night life but very sketchy.
reviews: Some areas are swarming with bums. Not a place for family's to stroll after dark with young ones. Great night life, Chinatown Market was a blast to visit!

title: Professional Bike Thieves
reviews: We learned the hard way about the thriving Vancouver business of stealing bikes. If you come with an expensive bike, no mater what kind of lock you have, do not leave your bike unattended, EVER. Professional thieves roam the city with vans and bolt cutters, happy to help themselves. We heard (who knows if it is true) that they wait at the border and follow cars with bikes, hoping to  score. In all that I read about Vancouver, this was never mentioned, even though North Vancouver and Whistler are MTB 4-star destinations. Learn from our experience; it's a truly horrible way to begin a vacation.

title: Vibrant Lovely City
reviews: I loved this City because there are so many things to do here. Great location most of them are in walking distance - shopping, dining and just people watching.

title: Thousands of things to do with blocks of each other
reviews: Vancouver Downtown is one of the world's jewels a fantastic place to be. It's clean, airy, and easy to get around. A walker's paradise with lots of restaurants and meeting places.  If you want a different view of the city scape just hop on the Seabus and cruise to the other side of the inlet to North Vancouver. Lonsdale Quay is a great way to see Vancouver from a different light.One negative note, although I felt safe I would recommend that you stay away from East Hastings especially between Carroll and Gore. As with all beauty their are flaws

title: Keep looking around
reviews: Loved the mix of old & new how it was retained, found it safe & very tidy generally - keep walking to discover hidden treasures and discover the authentic Chinese Gardens - one not to miss. Sadly missed seeing the Art Musuem as 3 floors closed  on my visit but lots of independent art galleries in downtown.  Gaslight district not to be missed.

title: Vancouver - a walkable city area especially if you use the option of the hop on hop off Big Bus.
reviews: we really enjoyed walking the city including China Town for a meal and the Sun Yat Sen garden. Also visited the steam clock and Gas Town with its tourist shops. Canada Place was another area to enjoy the views fro and to watch the seaplane s coming in to land. Lots of malls and places to eat if you want food.

title: Great walking and shopping
reviews: Something for everyone here. Take a stroll down Robson street to see the many shops or just go underground to Pacific centre for more shopping. A liesure stroll will take you to the waterfront and then off to Gastown to see the historic side of Vancouver

title: Urban Vancouver at its best!
reviews: Walkable, full of nice coffee shops, restaurants and great and diverse shopping.You also get to admire the tall condo buildings with its amazing architecture...

title: A little bit of everything
reviews: This is what great cities should be like- dense, bicycle friendly, clean, retail, restaurants, parks, housing and offices all sharing the space perfectly. Perhaps it's a little gritty on the outer edges (Vancouver east) but there's so much to love about this place. It evolves and changes just enough to surprise you every time you come back. Every other city in North America, please do take note.

title: Safe, fun and wonderful
reviews: If you have the time, take the get on and get off the bus circuit. Parking in Vancouver can be expensive, so this was the perfect option for us! Maybe avoid the trolley one as their customers seemed to be standing and waiting a LOT as we got on and off the bus. MAKE sure you purchase the tickets on line and save 40% off!!!

title: limited vehicle routes...
reviews: All routes into and about Vancouver are congested and slow. We enjoy visiting but are seniors with a vehicle...something Vancouver city planners seem to ignore.

title: Most Beautiful, Cleanest City Any Body Can Dream Of.
reviews: Needless to say I love this City. I live in this City. Everything in this City impresses me and people who come to experience and breathe the fresh air of this Superbly Beautiful City has to offer. Everything is beautiful. Everything is clean. Everything impressive. People are super sweet, nice, polite, and courteous. Aboriginal People have a spectacular display of culture and History that is our very foundation of our Pride. People from around the world who live here showcase our Diversity of Cultures, and Heritages that give Vancouver a very unique, vibrant place of Harmonies. Welcome to Vancouver, the most beautiful and cleanest City in North America. Enjoy your stay. Thank you for reading and God Bless,

title: Vancouver is a smaller city incl. downtown
reviews: Walk about at night? Pretty good bet in almost all areas. I' d avoid East Hastings area at night. Gas town is nearby but a different situation -aimed at tourists - good at night  other areas to walk downtown. English Bay, Davie St. , Robson St. , Denman St. Coal Harbour ( Seawall walk ), Yaletown ( Seawall and lots of entertainment ) . It's a walkable /bike able  downtown. Advisory - I live in Vancouver.

title: Choose where you want to go first
reviews: Vancouver downtown is accessable, beautiful  and fun but it is broken up into areas that can be a bit of a walk to and from if you do not plan first. Gastown is at the North end of downtown while Granville Island is at the south end. Robson Street and the Art Gallery are central, Denman Street West and North.

title: Restaurant and shops
reviews: It's a really beautiful city where you can walk safely eat in very nice restaurant and shopping whatever your budget. I was so lucky I had 2 very sunny days. I love Vancouver

title: Surprised! Big different life style
reviews: It's only 300 miles away from Seattle area, but their life style is totally different. This trip makes me shock. Need to understand their driving way, night life, public transportation, etc. Vancouver BC is under construction!!!

title: Wonderful city.
reviews: Great city.  Very clean and lots to see.  Take the hop off and on bus... great way to get around.  Lots of restaurants.  Vancouver Lookout ... great way to see the view of the city, etc.

title: Beautiful
reviews: A lovely and clean city that is exceptionally bike friendly!  We toured the entire city by bike and loved it.  Great fun to visit the olympic venues.

title: Cosmopolitan and vibrant
reviews: What a delightful city!  Many old streets and buildings to see with tons of shops and restaurants.  We loved Canada Place and the FlyOver screening was fabulous!  Great views from the top of the building.  You could spend days down here just looking around.  A ton of traffic and parking is tight, but what big city isn't?

title: Exciting place to hang out and walk around.
reviews: The downtown was not that big and there was so much to see. Just stop by a coffee shop and watch the people. Or cycle around the outside of the downtown. Take a sea plane.

title: Great town, very clean & everyone is very nice!
reviews: Good downtown, easy walking, a lot of diversity and everyone was so friendly... Take a walk and you will find out!

title: Reminds me a bit of NYC
reviews: Lots of interesting ethnic restaurants - we ate both nights at asian restaurants because Florida's are lousy!  Such a treat to eat good food like that.

title: Vancouver Tower
reviews: Went up Vancouver Tower . Not as high as Toronto . There were plenty of shops though things are pricey and remember to add the taxes on extra . Plenty of places to eat especially near CanadaPlace and you can sit and watch the seaplanes landing and taking off.

title: Granville Street
reviews: Our first day in Vancouver we walked down Granville Street from False Creek end about 10 am Not the greatest advertisement for the city of Vancouver with bodies asleep in doorways, hippies looking for a handout and generally an ambience of desolation. As we walked toward Robson Street there was a better feeling with busy tourist and local traffic.

title: My favorite city
reviews: Vancouver is a great city.  You can pretty much walk anywhere.  Other than one section a few streets over from gas town/rail town where it's pretty shady (drug types), the rest of the city is clean and safe.  Everyone is friendly and helpful.  Loved Gas Town.  Did a super wine tasting in Rail Town.  Was not impressed with shopping on Robson Street but that was because most of it you can find in the U.S. and not have to pay the huge taxes added in Canada.

title: What a beautiful City...
reviews: So much to see and do in downtown area. Close to Stanley park, great shopping at pacific center mall, robson street. Great dining options in downtown areas and yaletown, gastown and Chinatown near by

title: Pretty city
reviews: Easy to get around on public transportation or foot.  Pretty city with typical malls/shopping, restaurants, etc.  Be careful, lots of restaurants do not allow under 18yr olds.

title: Nice areas to walk.
reviews: A very walkable city. Shopping is pretty limited to expensive stores like Hudson Bay, etc. a few people asking for money, but not as bad as some other big cities.

title: Perfect for a stroll!
reviews: Wonderful way to spend a day, with water nearby, great coffee shops, nice little shops. Stop by the Canada trail, and see the large Cruise ships! You can walk for miles and not get bored!

title: Enjoyed outskirts more than downtown proper
reviews: I really liked Vancouver, but I didn't think downtown in and of itself was spectacular, although it was nice, clean and I did enjoy various aspects of it. I suppose living in Manhattan gives me a different perspective on city life. Downtown Vancouver certainly has more value than many other downtown areas of other cities, but it wasn't that engaging for me. Stanley Park, on the other hand, is gorgeous and I wish I would have spent more time there than in downtown. Perhaps I didn't get to see the most interesting parts of downtown. I would like to give it another chance on a future visit.I think if you don't live in a big thriving city, downtown Vancouver would probably be very interesting to experience.

title: Clean - but alot of Construction
reviews: I found most parts of the city clean,  still lots of construction of high rises.  You do need to know about which areas of the city to travel at night - not Hastings, but confirm with your hotel employees

title: Quaint downtown Vancouver
reviews: Downtown Vancouver looks quaint with its small shops and restaurants. Looks peaceful as well and not polluted unlike the big cities in the States.

title: Driving is crazy
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a beautiful site.  However, if you are driving in the area, it is a different story.  People cut you off, cyclists zoom in and out of traffic, pedestrians cross whether the light is green or not.  It was an interesting experience in that regard.  I highly recommend public transportation to get around.  It is however, clean and lots of great places to shop and eat.  Lots to see!

title: Fun
reviews: We stay on Robson Street which was great. Tons of shopping and restaurants. There were people out on the streets until late. At 11 pm the roads were full of people. I personally love that.

title: City life
reviews: Always lively with some if not all restaurants open till late mostly till 1am. Some areas can be noisy like Davie St.

title: What a great city!!
reviews: After being there four days, I started looking at real estate. It may be too pricey to live there (especially now a days) but it's still one of the best places I've been to yet. First, it offers too lifestyles, which is good for those who need a weekly change of pace. You have the city life and you have the outdoors-mountain & sea life. Downtown has a ton of restaurants, shops and plenty of parking. There are a few too many one-way roads for my taste. And  there is a really seedy area just adjacent to a great tourist attraction, Gastown, that had me locking my doors.Outside of the city, on the perimeter you can go for a swim, sunbathe, bike ride, walk, roller skate, picnic...it's all very relaxing. Cross the bridge to North Vancouver and there is suburbia, and more outdoor activities...hiking, skiing, kayaking, hang gliding, rock climbing..etc.The weather-I went during the summer. It rained lightly a few days, but the when the sun was out, so came the people. The city streets were filled with them. Traffic became much more congested. Bike riding seemed to be the best option at that point. I don't know how cold it gets in the winter, but we had a very nice 70-75 F degrees.I would love to go back again!!!!

title: Eeks! Very seedy!
reviews: Walking through downtown Vancouver with our 3 young kids, we had plenty of opportunities to show our kids why it was so important to never try drugs. There were many ... less fortunate people ... simply lying on the side walk. We couldn't wait to get out of there.

title: Nothing Special
reviews: I guess I am just not a big fan of Vancouver - an over crowded, noise filled, car honking, rude city.  Nothing special down town.  But, do venture out of downtown and you'll enjoy the parks and views.

title: Great city
reviews: Favorite thing we did here was take a walking tour (free) by The Tour Guys - took their Gastown Tour.  It started downtown & walked to Gastown (about 2 hours) full of fun & fascinating information about history, politics, architecture.  It was wonderful.  Leisurly pace with several opportunities to sit a bit as the guide spoke.  Loved it!

title: Not much for tourists
reviews: I was a bit disappointed with the lack of attractions downtown.  This looks like a nice city to live but not that interesting to visit.  We had just come from Seattle which has an abundance of good attractions so maybe we were a bit spoiled.  We enjoyed the Vancouver area but really didn't need to spend time downtown.

title: Nice downtown.
reviews: We like to walk at Coal Harbor. Look at the new Convention Centre.  Eat at different restaurants or hotel.Convenient also for taking the Canada Line (Waterfront terminal) which takes you to different places, including the airport.

title: Gas town!
reviews: I visited Gas Town and was thrilled that it has the same charm that it had 20 years ago when I was last there. The Old Spaghetti Factory sends out its inviting and tempting aromas, the Steam Clock still chirps and the OK Boot Corral is still there! The planting s on the side of the buildings and the containers are beautiful. It has managed to keep its charm. Where Robson Street has lost most of its boutique stores and replaced them with big name brand stuff, Gas Town still has its quirky little shops.

title: Nice place, but didn't knock my socks off
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is an interesting place, but I wouldn't consider it a destination. We went through coming and going on a bus trip of the Canadian Rockies. What is around Vancouver, is really more interesting than what is in Vancouver.

title: Easy To Get Around!
reviews: The Vancouver downtown area is clean, appears safe, and is easy to get around.  There is a nice inexpensive bus system (Must have exact change!) and also a free bus system that has limited stops.  It is also very walkable.  Great shopping and restaurant options!

title: lots to see and do and such a beautiful setting
reviews: Some of this is covered by separate reviews but as a general comment on the downtown area of Vancouver, what a great city to visit and such a spectacular location on the ocean and with the mountains across the Burrard Inlet.  A lively place with lots of young and old alike, plenty of things to see and do; lots of places to eat and such generally friendly and helpful people.We have relatives in Gtr Vancouver and hopefully we may get more frequent opportunities to come and see them.  Getting round is easy, walking, public transport or bikes - there are lots of dedicated routes and easy to get to some great beaches nearby - or even floatplanes to coastal locations.  Traditional culture is limited but not absent but there is certainly a vibrant arts and entertainment scene. A city I really enjoy visiting, for itself and as a staging post for other parts eg Vancouver Island, Whistler and the north, the interior and the Rockies; and over the border to Washington State etc.I would recommend Vancouver to anyone and for all ages and lifestyles.

title: Clean & Vibrant City
reviews: Great restaurants, great shopping, sidewalks crowed with friendly people. Pedestrian friendly. Robson is main drag for people watching and shopping. Easy walk to Canada Place, the waterfront and Stanley Park.Good bus connections, and cabs are both plentiful and not overpriced for shorter trips. Cab driver friendly, personable and helpful. Good place to stay for first time visitors.

title: Downtown
reviews: Lots to see and do in Vancouver. Downtown is bustling with tourists in July. We took the hop on hop off bus to get around. Best way to see the area and very reasonable day rates. We purchased our 2 day tickets at our hotel. Weather is mild even thought we were there in what they call a heat wave, Surprised to see Palm trees....

title: I never expected such beauty
reviews: What an amazing place.. Busy, clean, friendly and beautiful. We flew to Vancouver to take a Disney Cruise to Alaska and fell in love!!! Don't skip spending some time there if you go to meet a cruise ship. it is a fabulous area with nice, helpful people. Who knew we would love it so much?

title: Walkable City
reviews: We first took an around-the-city tour on the "Big Bus" then walked back to the places we wanted to visit.  We felt very safe throughout.  Museums, parks, architecture, shops, cafes and restaurants.. just doesn't get much better for a tourist.

title: Very business oriented
reviews: We stayed downtown for a convention and during the week it was a great place. There were lots of food trucks around and plenty of people to watch. Also at Canada Place there is an underground food court and some shops, and you can watch the sea planes take off and land. The convention center was really nice and huge and the area around downtown was very clean and cared for. There are restaurants and some shops but mostly catering to the business community. You'll be fine if you're there for a convention. It is easily walkable and there are plenty of places to eat and plenty of waterfront to peruse.

title: Hustle and Bustle
reviews: Robson street is very nice, but we waled down Denman street to English Bay. We really enjoyed our walk along Denman street. We also walked up Davie street and if you're in the mood for night life, check that out!

title: Excellent shopping
reviews: Good choice of shops, restaurants to fit all size of pockets.  It is a very friendly walking city although some of the beggars or panhandlers can be a bit annoying at times.  Take a Big Bus tour which you can hop on and off at your leisure and a great well to see the city.

title: Panhandler Capital of the World
reviews: Vancouver is a great cosmopolitan city. Art and scenery are amongst the best I've seen. But....Downtown is awash with beggars, sometimes called 'panhandlers.' They are a sad sight. I think they are a combination of drug abusers, drunks and the mentally ill. Large groups congregate in Gas Town, around Canada Place, and pretty much anywhere they see tourists.I've seen dozens of major cities over many years, and Vancouver has the worst panhandler problem I've ever seen. The Police and locals ignore them.Bear this in mind when considering a visit.

title: Beautiful city filled with beautiful people and just overall a stunning city!
reviews: About the only negative thing I can say is that the auto traffic is messy, lots of 1-way streets and overall pretty sucky traffic flow pattern. That's about the only "bad" thing I can say, so if you're on foot, no problem! As for the good: people watching, food trucks, lush and well kept parks [and plenty of those], LOTS of shops and restaurants and amazing people watching! Vancouver has been a lifetime favorite of mine and I'm very fortunate to have lived in the Pacific Northwest all my life so I've had the opportunity to enjoy and appreciate it. Now, if only Seattle would catch up...

title: Go, go, go
reviews: You get everything; the sights, the shops, the restaurants. If you've got just a little time in Vancouver, explore downtown. Just prowl, you, you'll find something worth visiting.

title: Beautiful city!
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful, easy city to get around in.  I walked (part of the Seawall path), took the Sky Train, and an aquabus.  All modes of transportation were easy, well-explained, and reasonably priced.  The people are friendly and extremely helpful!

title: Historic and modern combined, clean, easy to navigate
reviews: We stayed in downtown hotels for over a week without a vehicle.  We were able to walk to most places we wanted to go, and could easily find a wheelchair accessible taxi to get to the rest.  We ate at some great restaurants and some equally great food trucks.  The food, shopping, convention center, and of course the green spaces like Stanley Park all make for a great downtown.  We found it very clean and the people friendly. Thanks for hosting us Vancouver!

title: Chinese Garden not via downtown
reviews: On our last stay in Vancouver we stayed in downtown and decided to visit the Chinese garden in Chinatown. We took the bus from Granville street, big mistake you get off on Hastings St. and go through the most terrible area of heavy drug addicts and homeless and poverty.This was a scary experience.So avoid this area and come to Chinatwon from the back from the Waterfront.All together is the Chinese garden a lovely experience.

title: Super Town for walking
reviews: With the exception of a block or two in Gastown this is a grand place to walk. From Chinatown to the Waterfront and the downtown to Granville Island you will find clever shops, an abundance of galleries, cheap eats to fine dining and a very clean and appealing cityscape. Most importantly it is a very safe place to walk. The only down side is an inordinately large number of panhandlers.

title: Great vibe
reviews: Lots of eateries from gourmet to take away.  Loads of lovely shops to browse through. Most hotels in Downtown are convenient to all sights of the city.  Try the lookout tower which you can see the whole of Vancouver 360 degs and has a revolving restaurant

title: Excellent place in Canada to visit
reviews: I was with my wife to visit my son and daughter-in-law in Vancouver. They live in Burnby in a 26 story glass tower.Every morning I was watching the sky-train from the balcony and Amtrak Cascade from bedroom window. A magnificent view of the snow clad mountains with my binocularswas another added attraction. We visited many places in and around Vancouver. There are gardens,oceanfront,downtown,drive,trails,scenic beauty and many more things to enjoy. If you have not visited Vancouver you are really missing something. I have posted 400 pics on Picasa.

title: Crowd of young asian folks
reviews: Fine city, would be better if I fit 20-30yr old asian crowd.   They are having great fun, just would enjoy more varied and even a bit older group.

title: An exciting metropolis
reviews: Downtown Vancouver affords visitors the opportunity to take in a diverse array of places to visit. There are a number of cultural attractions in the heart of this modern metropolis including libraries, art galleries, and museums. There are a number of shopping plazas with a dizzying array of merchandise to satisfy the ardent shopper. And there is a wide variety of restaurants with food from around the globe to delight your palate.

title: lovely city
reviews: Now I realize why many people say that Vancouver is the best place for human to live. Ê∫´Âì•ËèØ‰æùÂ±±ÂÇçÊ∞¥ÔºåÂ§©Ê∞£ÂÆú‰∫∫ÔºåÊàëÁµÇÊñºÁêÜËß£‰Ωï‰ª•Ë®±Â§ö‰∫∫ÈÉΩË™™ÈÄôË£°ÊòØÊúÄÈÅ©ÂÆú‰∫∫È°ûÂ±Ö‰ΩèÁöÑÂú∞Êñπ„ÄÇÁÑ∂ËÄåÂ∏ÇÂçÄ‰πüÊúâÈÅäÊ∞ëÁöÑÂïèÈ°åÔºåÊàëÊÉ≥ÈÄôÊòØË®±Â§öÂüéÂ∏ÇÂÖ±ÂêåÂøÖÈ†àÈù¢Â∞çÁöÑÈÅ∫ÊÜæ„ÄÇ

title: cruising with the top down
reviews: we're familiar with downtown and enjoyed cruising the area- the waterfront by the cruise ships, we stopped in on some sort of Latin street festival which was fun.

title: Robson st and Granville island
reviews: 2 must sees while visiting British Columbia, Robson street is the rodeo drive of Vancouver and Granville island is the pikes place Seattle of Vancouver too

title: vancouver visit
reviews: City is nice, but living in greater Chicago area it's tough to beat the Chicago skyline and interesting attractions in Chicago.

title: Jogging the seawall in Vancouver
reviews: It was 6 miles and I swear it felt like half that! What a gorgeous run. If you are a jogger, this is can't miss stuff. Amazing!!

title: Busy City
reviews: Love that downtown is accessible to public transportation, bus and skytrain. Also can make a loop of downtown via Big Bus or Trolley. If you tale the bus you can have a free transfer within 90 minutes which can also be use in the skytrain. Busy city with a lot of great attractions, shopping and good restaurants.

title: Busy and bustling!
reviews: We walked up Robson st from English Bay. It was so nice to get a vibe of the city. Hustle and bustle and people we in a very good mood! We grabbed some ice cream and check out all the festivals that were happening.

title: Nice
reviews: It's a nice downtown, certainly clean and easy to get around in.  Has a good deal of shopping available.

title: Nice place
reviews: Great shopping with excellent serviceAlmost all types of shopping can be doneThere were few flea markets (at least I didn't see many)

title: A Great City!
reviews: The downtown core is large enough to give the 'big city' feel, yet small enough to be able to walk where ever you want to go. So many great walks. The back drop includes snow capped North Shore Mountains, lush vegetation, interesting architecture, all surrounded by bodies of water.  From Coal Harbour in the north to English Bay going south. Stanley Park in the west to China Town in the east. Waterfront walks starting at the Pan Pacific around Stanley Park passing English Bay to False Creek. Aquabus Ferries provide rides from various locations to Granville Island. Countless outdoor restaurants, bars, and coffee shops to stop and 'rest'. Our favourites include: True Confections on Denman, Provence on Marinaside, three Cactus Club locations, and of course B.C. Place/ Rogers Arena. Shopping locations everywhere. There are areas to avoid, especially at night too. These include any unlit alleys and Hastings just past Pigeon Square. Construction is happening everywhere, signs of a robust, growing city. There are many unique, safe, and interesting places to visit and see to list here....there is something for everybody.

title: Easy to walk to many things!
reviews: We were impressed with the cleanliness of this town.  There was a lot of construction on the sidewalks in some areas.  A week was easy to fill up with the local attractions.  Traffic is busy so we recommend the tour buses and not renting a car.  Parking in city is about $20/day according to signs.  We did not have a car so not sure how much hotels charge for parking.  The Hop On Hop Off Trolley allows you to get to many places.  Buying ticket on internet will get you one free day.   Like many big cities, there are street people that will approach you.  Don't walk in some areas downtown after dark!

title: Very beautiful city
reviews: I have been to well over a hundred cities and Vancouver is one of the best. The waterfront and neighbouring Stanley Park is beautiful. There is a reason why it is the most expensive city in North America.  I highly recommend visiting it - in the summer. If you do not like rain - this might not be the city for you.

title: Busy
reviews: Very busy in the pacific centre which we found a little difficult to navigate. People are generally friendly and helpful though

title: Really enjoyed our stay
reviews: This was our first visit to Vancouver and we liked the central location of Downtown.  We took the Skytrain in from the airport and walked or took short taxi rides all over the area from Stanley Park to Granville Island to Gastown to Yaletown.  All very safe and walkable.  Nice shopping, eating, coffee, bus service, people watching, etc. Clean area with friendly people.

title: Easy to get around and clean
reviews: If you like shopping then you will love downtown Vancouver.  There is tons of upper end shopping in a small area.  I was impressed with the cleanliness of the city.  I felt very comfortable walking around enjoying the day.

title: Vancouver
reviews: This is our third visit to beautiful Vancouver. So many things to see and do. Check out Gastown and the clock. Stanley Pk, The Convention Centre, Seawall Walk and so many other attractions.

title: Busy city streets - watch the 'pan handlers'
reviews: Downtown Vancouver buzzes like many North American cities. But the 'pan handlers' or 'street people' are a real pain. Many seem high on drugs and you can feel very uneasy or threatened at times by their behavior. The City authorities need to get a grip on this as it is spoiling a beautiful city. Keep out of their way and stick to the main tourist spots and harbour.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: "I Just Love this City" my words on leaving such a clean, green spacious streets.  The shopping both Hi End and bargains catered for every taste all within easy walking distance from our hotel. Cafes and Restaurants...take your pick...jump on the Sky Train as easy as ever..all close by.   Yes just love this City.

title: Vibrant Downtown with friendly people!
reviews: We stayed 4 nights in downtown Vancouver and really enjoyed it.  Some areas closer to Gastown and Chinatown have a lot of homeless and the area is a little gritty, but we never felt unsafe.  The West End and Yaletown were nicer areas with lots of shops, trees, and restaurants.  Stanley Park is a must see.  Most importantly, the people of Vancouver were incredibly friendly and hospitable!  They left us with a great impression of the city!

title: Hard to find good shops
reviews: Walked around and found plenty of restaurants but the centre of Vancouver seems to be mainly businesss and banks. There are a couple of streets with shops but nothing outstanding.

title: Great City
reviews: We spent 7 nights in Vancouver and we loved it. It's a beautiful, clean city with sooo much to do. You can be as active as you want. It's an easy city to walk in and we mostly walked everywhere. It is a pedestrian and very bicycle friendly city. Plenty of bike lanes throughout the downtown area.The public transportation throughout the city is also great. Every one we met in the different businesses and restaurants were very friendly and helpful. The way the downtown area was designed allows for al lot of natural light to come into the streets and side walks in spite of the tall buildings. It was planned that way. Find out about that while you're there as it is very interesting how much thought went into city planning.

title: Small area
reviews: Good transportation, fast driving, not crowded, a lot of options for fun and purchases.  Good eating and staying.

title: Lots to See
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has lots to see....like any major city, this place has it all...restaurants, shopping and other attractions.  Definitely swing by Gastown when in town!

title: Shops and Restaurants.
reviews: Lovely area for shopping and eating out. Easy to walk around the city centre. The Jazz Festival was on while we were there and it made for a lively buzz in the area

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Jazz festival was excellent. Stay out of China town since it is riddled with drug pushers. Numerouse high class stores for any type of shopping.

title: "Lots to See"
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has such a variety of sightseeing it would be difficult to see them all in a day. The Waterside area Gas Town take in the steam powered clock and China town are not to be missed.

title: Vancouver downtown
reviews: brilliant this was an amazing trip great people plenty to see and dowe stayed on both the waterfront and the Sheraton both were fabulousGreat little Irish pubs with good food drink and staff

title: Busy, bustling and vibrant downtown
reviews: Vancouver's downtown lends itself to walking. Robson Street is great for shopping, eating out or people watching. Just make sure that you are prepared for rainy weather(windbreaker, umbrella),and you'll enjoy yourself.

title: Love it
reviews: Great atmosphere, plenty of bars n restaurants, lovely Canada place watching the cruise ships and sea planes.  Great place to visit whilst in vancouver.

title: Its looking a lot different
reviews: I have been to Vancouver a lot and love the city, but have not been back in 10 year. It has changed a lot. The city is beautiful but its getting congested with traffic and a lot of people. What seemed to put me off was the large amount of drunks, bums and pan handlers. I don't remember that 10 years ago. Its worse than NYC.

title: Fun day
reviews: After Granville Market we went back onto the red bus to the Chinese Scholars' Garden.  We stumbled onto a guided tour and sort of wished we had not, as it was TMI.  The garden was lovely but if I had realized there was another Chinese Scholars' Garden 4x its size in Seattle I would have skipped the one in Vancouver.  We ate lunch in a dim sum place in China town recommended by the Garden staff.  It was okay but not spectacular.  We drove by the Steam Clock and then got off and walked toward Canada Place, stopping to mount the elevators to the outlook over the city.  Not worth the money and the signage did not seem accurate to what we were seeing.  Canada Place made for some nice photos and I loved the Canadian Mountie store, where I indulged in a frig mag and a cute Mountie to hang from my Xmas tree.  By the time we got back on the bus we were tired so we just observed Stanley Park from inside the bus.  It looked lovely.  We rested a little and had a glass of wine on the lovely roof deck of the Times Square Suites (see separate review) before heading toward our wonderful dinner at Adesso (also spearate rveview).  It was a nice day.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Huge number of glass towers and apartments.  I have seen a lot of "big" city skylines.  This was one of the most beautiful I have seen.  Over 100K people live in downtown and I can see why.  Almost every apartment in the towers would have fantastic views of the surrounding mountains and harbor.

title: Great Shopping and Restaurants
reviews: There is a boutique or several on every block and there are wonderful small restaurants and cafes with very reasonable prices.

title: Down Town Vancouver.
reviews: We stayed just across the road from 'The Two Parrots' Bar in Granville Street, Down Town Vancouver for three days.  The food was so good there, and cheap, that we went there every day for breakfast. My husband had the big breakfast every day but I tried something different each time. Oh Yum.! We went back for dinner one night and while the others had Fish and Chips, I had the ' Honey & Soy Parrot (chicken) Wings' they were to die for, double Yum ! !  We were served by a Chinese lady named Jenny, she was so nice and on the ball. We were served with a smile in no time at all, with a top up of coffee before you could run out. A great place to eat.

title: Bicycle friendly! World class City!
reviews: We didn't really want to visit Vancouver, but did- and were blown out of the water by what a fantastic City it is! It all started with a bicycle tour with City-Cycle Tours and it just kept getting better.  It is so easy to get around; great shopping downtown; Stanley Park is an incredible resource to the City, and Granville Island market was great fun.  I would definitely go back....and I don't really like travelling in Cities!

title: roadtrip Vancouver stop June 2013.
reviews: We went for a road trip, and had a blast. mom, dad and kids (8 yr old boy and 5 yr old girl) packed our van with luggage and groceries and went for a tri city tour, with the assistance of  GPS ,our beloved white Toyota Sienna we lovingly call Filmore, First Stop: Vancouver BCday 1 was arrived late, drove from Oregon, crossed to the USA to Canadian border. Checked in, walked around the city. What can I say, we had a blast, we stayed at Blue Horizon for 3 days (which is also a pick up spot for our hop on & off  tour bus) in Robson St, they had lots of restaurants options at that area, all the cuisine is available- such as italian, japanese, irish, chinese, fish and chips...etch.Blue Horizon is in the middle of everything. Robson is like their open mall, so if you wanted shopping district, stay here. We opted for the higher floor (25th floor) and facing the bay too. Our view was funtastic. Parking fee was about 16/per day. The room was modern chic with flatscreen tv. We liked our room. day 2: we did the bus tours and strolling around the Canada Place (it's the waterfront area) they have a food court on the basement area and little shopping. I bought our Japanese lunch there. It was made to order. I had Yakisoba's and kids had shrimp tempura. They have the Tim Horton's down in the food court, I got some  there, bought coffee and donuts. Chocolate donuts was so good. day 3: we drove to Lyn Canyon Park on the other side. It was free of charge !!  We did some trail hiking and, they have suspension bridge, falls, hiking area, lush trees. We had a great time. It was a learning experience for the kids, that we need to take care of the environment. day 3: We crossed over to Victoria :)

title: Welcoming city
reviews: The city was very clean and was easy to navigate without a map.  Even walking back to our hotel at night we felt completely safe.  The only slight negative was the difficulty in getting a taxi

title: Loved Vancouver!
reviews: Great city, beautiful views, lots to do in and around Vancouver. Did a lot of walking in the downtown area and enjoyed the city and the people. Everywhere we went shopping or eating we had excellent service - very friendly.

title: Nice walk along the seawall
reviews: Stanley park is a beautiful place. We drove and park near the sights. From the car park, it's usually a short walk from the sights. You can walk or cycle along the seawall. Prospector point provides a nice view of the harbour and the city skyline.

title: Very disappointed
reviews: Our overall experience in Vancouver was very disappointing.  Everything was very expensive and the merchants were very unfriendly.  These are the people that should be going out of their way to be friendly and helpful but instead acted as if they were doing you a favor by letting you shop in their stores or ride in their cabs.  When asking for recommendations of where to go or what to do they offered no help at all.  The exception to this was the hotel staff at the Comfort Inn in Downtown Vancouver.The private citizens on the other hand were very friendly and helpful, usually going out of their way to answer questions.  For example, we asked for directions to get to a walkway on a bridge and the person not only gave us great directions, she walked with us to show us exactly where to go.

title: Great way to see vancouver
reviews: We decided to take the trolly around downtown Vancouver. It was a great way to see and hear about the city. The driver had a lot of knowledge. Also a great way to get some lovely photos. You can get off when ever you like.

title: Get a tour
reviews: We went on a walking tour of downtown with tourguys.ca and would recommend that.  You get to see and learn about parts of the city you may have passed countless times.   It's a beautiful city with a rich history.

title: Love it!
reviews: My new favorite place.  Vancouver has now taken first place for anywhere I have traveled!It's clean, air is clean, public transportation is very easy to navigate although if you like to walk you can get around the whole city very easily.  The views are always fabulous no matter where you are. The people are friendly and food is great.  Try to find the food trucks!  They are fantastic!There is one aspect of Vancouver that is an issue: there are more homeless people than I have ever seen.  We saw very young girls on the streets who were beaten up, had track marks on them and other disconcerting signs of abuse.  That was very hard to see.  You tend to want to help them all.

title: versitile
reviews: Vancouver's downtown area is often starck in contrast. while you walz along Robson street to shop for fashion or a hot latte and have a gourmet burger from a food truck on corner of Howe St. only a few blocks over are shelters for homeless people with run-down buildings and yet another few blocks from there you will find the glass towers of millionaires in Yaletown. It is worth walking a day downtown to take in the different vibes and as it takes approx. 20min to walk across it is a great way to get to know the city.

title: Gastown & Chinatown
reviews: Some great restaurants. The only thing is the amount of homeless people begging and harassing you, and down and outs, scary! Would not go down at night unless there is a few people.Could be a great area with a bit more work.Chinatown very disappointed I love the gateway, however, other than Dr.Sun Yat Sen Garden and Park, boring. Not enough of an ethnic feel when we walk down the narrow sidewalks.I've been to several different Chinatown's in the States, so I had a certain expectation. This was my least favorite experience for sure.

title: cranes everywhere
reviews: lots of construction, lots of tower cranes. lots of tall buildings, people, traffic, great places to eat, people watch.  lots of stuff all around.  an interesting city to visit. worth the trip.

title: Lots to see
reviews: So much to see and take in. Lots of walking but worth it. We had lunch in the area and enjoyed the light rain.

title: Pan Pacific Coach (This is not an attraction but a form of transportation)
reviews: From Vancouver to Victoria via Pan Pacific Coach: We were on a cruise returning to Vancouver's Canada Place dock.  The coach picked us up right after the cruise, drove to the ferry; drove onto the ferry; passengers go upstairs for 90 min. sailing; reboard the ferry for drive into downtown Victoria.  Coach terminal directly behind the Empress Hotel.   Above route in reverse, except meeting at the Victoria station and going to Vancouver airport. We had no trouble booking on the phone with most helpful agent. 800-661-1725. I suggest getting your tickets far in advance as coaches do book full.  You must be at the terminal at least 30 min. before boarding.  The whole system is so well organized and agents there to help and guide you aboard. Highly recommend. Fare was $129.56 each RT. ($259.12) and tickets are emailed to you to print. Boarding passes & luggage tags are issed from the bus driver after presenting your tickets. Carry on items must be small and fit under your seat; Overhead bin very shallow, but any amt. can be put under bus in luggage storage.

title: Lovely City - but only in parts
reviews: We had a total of 4 days in Vancouver to top and tail an Alaska Cruise.  It is a bright, modern, cosmopolitan city with a lot of lovely places to visit.  We stayed centrally and loved the Downtown area and Gastown and visited Granville Island, Stanley Park and Grouse Mountain. So, what's not to love?  Walk one block in the wrong direction and the huge number of homeless people, panhandlers, junkies etc etc becomes a problem.  This beautiful City has a real problem!  Okay, our hotel information book did tell us that there were certain streets we should avoid, but taking a shortcut back to our fabulous hotel, we landed bang smack in the middle of it!  Not a nice place to be on a Saturday night - and the only evidence of the Vancouver PD was a cruiser  parked up (I think this may be an ill founded tactic to try to provide public reassurance as there was no sign of any police officers in the car or vicinity).Also, midday on Saturday, we came across people sleeping rough - not only in shop doorways, but on the edge of the sidewalk adjacent to the road!  Again - a police cruiser but no officers in the area.  I felt so strongly that I emailed the Mayor's office to give him a tourist's view of the city.  That was several days ago and, no surprise, no response to date.  I just hope he does something about the problem!   This is a lovely city with lots to offer the tourist - but they need to open their eyes - see the problem and do something about it!!

title: Nice downtown
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is very clean and easy to walk around. We were able to get from area to area with ease. Vancouver is a very beautiful city. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

title: Pleasant city
reviews: Loved downtown Vancouver - from the clean architecture on the waterfront, through the bus rides round town, the history of Gastown, the Jimi Hendrix shine and the interesting shops and restaurants of Chinatown.

title: A City of two halves
reviews: My wife and I visited Vancouver for the first time in late May/early June 2013.  We stayed for a total of 4 days and visited a lot of what Vancouver has to offer.It is indeed a great place to visit and we enjoyed our time in the City, however, there is a danger that the problem of homelessness (which is already significant) and in my view, excessive litter might begin to effect visitors perceptions of what is a great place.We saw many homeless people at all times of the day throughout the downtown area.  Indeed many were sleeping in the middle of the sidewalk (one at 1130am on a Sunday morning) with the general public having to pick their way around them.  As we walked the main downtown streets we would observe individuals and groups of homeless people hanging about in many of the lanes which ran off the main streets.  Our Hotel also made specific reference to a certain district within the downtown area which they recommended we avoid since it was a frequent gathering place for homeless people and drug addicts.Having observed the problem at first hand, my wife felt so strongly about the issue, that she emailed the Mayor via the City web site.  We await a response.On the positive side, we enjoyed the Gastown area and the waterfront area near to Canada Place.  The City is a place that we will visit again, however, there is a need for the Authorities to do more about homelessness before it effects tourism.

title: Lots of homeless
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city that's hip,trendy,upscale, except for the homeless problem that seems to be ok with the city.if you look like a tourist be prepared for lots of panhandling.

title: walking around
reviews: had an interesting walk down to the US C onsulate on W.Pender St.   lots of buildings to see --Robson St. to be investigated

title: Clean, pretty and scenic
reviews: Worth paying a bit extra to stay in downtown Vancouver which has as its backdrop the beautiful mountains that were topped in snow even in June. You can watch the Alaskan cruise ships depart and the ferries and water planes and go for a walk along the waterfront which has interesting  historical facts at regular intervals.Gas town has lovely historical buildings and visit the  Spaghetti Factory for amazing value with it's al inclusive meals and tram car inside the restaurant and beautiful Tiffany light shades- terrific value and ambience on a budget. The meals are great with everything prepared from scratch. Their sauces are delicious.If you like vintage clothes don't miss a great little shop called Community Thrift and Vintage at  311 Carrall Street. They had some great 50 s and 60s fashion that we couldn't resist.We were not impressd with the food at Belaggio at the Waterfront near the cruise ship terminal. Their pasta was dry, overcooked and awful. Their tea and coffee was fine though.

title: Active Lifestyle
reviews: Go to Downtown Vancouver if you like a variety of activities, you will find people doing everything from Running to Kitesurfing. Dontown is well known for its moderate climate, the only downside to this is in the winter months lots of homeless people flock to the area from other parts of Canada so it may be an intimidating place at first, but i never had any problems with anyone.Definately worth a visit!

title: Great Shops
reviews: Nice shops around the downtown area. Robson Street nice shops and restaurants.  Getting to be too many shops selling the same t-shirts etc. Quite expensive towards the cost of items in the UK though.,

title: Stay Downtown
reviews: What a great location to stay! Don't miss Granville Island, choose this for your fresh food shopping, amazing produce and some really good buskers. Great public transport all around (buses), pretty streets and lots of restaurants and shopping.

title: Clean city
reviews: Vancouver is a beautifully clean city and the locals are so friendly, willing to offer help if approached, the shopping was good, Gastown is well worth a troll around, although we did encounter a lot of homeless people sleeping on the streets so some areas are to be avoided and wouldn't risk walking around certain areas at night but I guess that could be said for most cities in the world.

title: Great for walking and people watching
reviews: Did a lot of walking in Vancouver. We stayed at Sutton Place one night after a cruise and wanted to see as much as we could. When we would start looking at a map, just walking down the street, someone came over and would ask us what we were looking for and pointed us in the right direction, super friendly people, loved that! Burrard & Robson are definitely more upscale, and Granville Street is more gritty with musicians and street performers. Awesome downtown area!

title: Modern and Cosmopolitan
reviews: A very modern and cosmopolitan city, full of beautiful buildings, shops and restaurants, that gently kisses the sea and offers a pleasant green area that is Stanley Park.

title: Good shopping
reviews: If you like shopping, then visit Downtown, however, make sure that you have the cash to pay the high prices.

title: Glitzy sparkly Vancouver
reviews: Vancouver downtown is probably one of the main reasons why this city is often dubbed as 'the most liveable city in the World'. Vancouver is incredibly clean, neat, sophisticated and easy to get around. You can walk to most places within downtown but if you want to go across town or don't feel like walking, there are buses and the lovely SkyTrain. My favourite things to do in downtown Vancouver include:- A sunday walk in Stanley Park, starting from the south side, cutting across the park through Beaver Lake and coming out on the north end with beautiful views of Lion Gate Bridge and then leave the park near Coal Harbour.- Late morning ride on the Aquabus from Hornby St pier to Granville Island and lunch in the Public Market. Do you like hats? Visit the Granville Hat Shop.- Cocktail hour? Head to the bar at the famous Fairmont Hotel Vancouver. Excellent service in an exquisite location.- Check out the exhibitions at the Vancouver Gallery and visit the gallery shop.- You need a decent cup of coffee and a huge slice of cheese cake and like to avoid the horrid cafe chains? Melriches Coffee Shop on Davie Street is your place. - Sick of big supermarket chains? They have their own independent supermarket in Davie St; owned and operated by the neighbourhood.- If you like burritos, Red Burrito on Davie St is a 'must'!- For shopping, head to Pacific Centre or Metrotown- And remember that you can take a 4-hr train ride from the amazing Pacific Central Train Station in downtown Vancouver to Seattle. This is the most scenic train ride you are likel to have as most of the train ride is along the north west pacific coast. In summary, Vancouver Downtown is how every civilised city should be. I am sure you will enjoy it.

title: shopping
reviews: I walked around downtown Vancouver fairly extensively.  Especially liked Gastown area.  Good shopping and eating.

title: A beautiful city overall
reviews: This is truly a beautiful city with plenty of shops, restaurants, cafes, bars, etc.  but the begging on the street is off-putting.

title: Great bike access
reviews: There are dedicated separate lanes for bikes along the main streets that made for an easy ride.  Not so easy was finding a vacant spot to lock the bike

title: A Great City to Visit
reviews: Our 3rd visit to Vancouver,  this time staying in Canada Place. A fantadtic and vibrant city with a lot of attractions and things to do. A great way to see the city is to take a hop on hop off city tour.There are lots of shops,  restaurants or just watch the world go byin the harbour.We thought Gas Town had deteriated since our last visit with more beggers than I recall.

title: A very strange mix
reviews: I really wanted to rate the downtown Vancouver area higher, but felt strongly about what my wife and I experienced on our recent trip.  Vancouver was a very pretty city with a strange mix of cultures and infrastructure.  For instance, 2 blocks from our hotel was a very posh, ritzy, area with plenty of monetary influences.  We stood at a cross-walk and watched no less than 5 Mercedes and two Ferrari's drive by.  But then we would venture another two blocks and be greeted by terrible smelling streets (imagine if portable toilets had overflown) and trash literally strewn about in every direction.  We were even warned by our hotel about certain parts of town to stay away from.When it came to strolling around town for some light shopping or dining, we were again greeted with a strange mix of choices.  It was either the ultra luxury retail stores, or some very old very worn souvenir shops.  No real middle ground existed.  The same was true of the dining experiences.  It was either very high end dining, or tiny cafe's (we did see a Carl's Junior).  And we were very disappointed in the Olympic Village area of Vancouver as well.  It was still listed as a "destination" on our map, and in our guide book, and when we got there the only thing we found was a housing development.  Granted the condo's looked nice, but nothing indicated that this was where the athlete's had lived.  If you didn't know the Olympics had been in Vancouver, you would have NEVER guessed based on actually being there now.  And the plaza of nations has been turned into a casino.  Again, we were very disappointed in what the city has done with its olympic buildings.We came to the conclusion that Vancouver might be best experienced as a 1 night or 1 day layover to somewhere else in Canada.  A lot of cruises take off from Vancouver, as do tours destined for Whistler and other parts of the Canadian frontier.  So come a day early for your cruise or tour, just don't stay much longer than that.

title: Sophisticated, historical and fun!
reviews: Beautiful modern city with great historical areas.  Lovely gardens especially along the waterfront.  Not inexpensive but lots to do for everyone.  Good bus service but better to walk the neighborhoods.  This enable you to see the details and talk with the locals who are very friendly and give visitors great information on what to see and do.

title: good variety
reviews: plenty to see and there were some nice clothing shops selling Canadian made clothing this I like to support

title: Disappointing
reviews: I was really looking forward to visiting Vancouver and I was very disappointed.  I have just travelled up from Seattle and found Seattle far more interesting and prettier.  Overall very disappointing.

title: Traffic Jams Galore!
reviews: The streets and traffic flow are getting progressivly worse, year by year. Potholes everywhere. Poor & conflicting signage, particularly trying to access & egress Granville Island. The street lanes were originally designed for 2 lanes. The city has turned them into 3 lanes, with dangerously narrow room for Buses & Trucks.

title: mostly clean and interesting
reviews: Gastown,Granville Island, central downtown has great shopping, night life and lots of great food places to get a bite.  ask the locals for the top joints,  especially Stephos Greek food

title: A Great City Experience
reviews: If you haven't been to Vancouver - you truly don't know what you are missing - this city reminds of San Francisco - for many reasons - but with a slightly more international/Pac Northwest Flavor. It is clean, easy to get around and very convenient. Everything you need while travelling - lodging, entertainment, food, shopping - it is all here and all within walking distance. Well planned and well executed this is great city experience!

title: Lots to see
reviews: There is much to see in and around downtown Vancouver including gas town and Chinatown all within reasonable waking distance. The areas indicated have iconic landmarks well signposted and is an interesting few hours walk. As we speak we are about to leave to visit the Chinese night market which we understand takes place on Fridays and weekends its opening night for the season tonight so expecting street entertainers etc

title: Beautiful downtown
reviews: We'd heard much about Vancouver before getting here. They said they just love Vancouver. What can be so special about a city, I thought. Now I know (a little, only been here 1,5 days). Vancouver downtown- is so green. There are trees along almost all streets. Wow!- small parks tucked in all over- the BIG Stanley Park, the green oasis is part of downtown- broad, good sidewalks, which makes  downtown walkable- surrounded (almost) by water- even the skyscrapers are beautiful; the same size all of them and full of windows- compact tourism. I mean all sights are walkable, quite close- full of shopping and eatingA good tip: you can hire a bike because there are bike lanes around the whole downtown, not only Stanley Park!

title: Vancouver is a great city to visit
reviews: We went to visit family & friends in Vancouver which is always a treat. We spent time in the downtown area and of course shopped some. There is so much to see Gastown is a neat place.Everywhere you look is like a painting, coast line, boats, mountains, people everywhere, hugh parks all lust and green. Some amazing old homes, and no end to new building going up everywhere.We took the ferry to the sunshine coast to Gibson. It is a lovely place to spend time. So many great places to eat I had the best wood oven pizza on the sunshine coast. I think it is worth the trip to go back on our next visit. The coast line is beautiful and the people on so friendly there it reminded me of home.We visit Vancouver often and I never get tired of finding more treasure in the second hand shops and clothes that fit me.I hope if you go you have time to see the beauty this city offers. Cheers Terry

title: Very Walkable City
reviews: Downtown is very walkable. I felt safe walking alone as a solo female traveler. There are plenty of people walking around. Lots of transit options should you wish to venture out of downtown. My favorites spots were the shops on Robson and the Vancouver Art Gallery.

title: Take a walk around Vancouver Downtown
reviews: When visiting Vancouver. . .don't forget to take a walk downtown.  If you get tired of shopping just stop and have something to eat in the many restaurants they have along the walk. . .or stop for a drink. . .don't forget to shop some more:)

title: Downtown
reviews: Plenty of shopping but if your looking for a bargain you will have to look hard Vancouver for clothes is so expensive not like New York or England .

title: Was expecting more
reviews: Felt that the place fell a bit between two sools. The Gastown district was nice enough but I'd thught is would be bigger. Meanwhile, the watefont was not as prominent in the city as I had envisaged. Given how horrible the weather is I would need more than was on offer to make it worth another visit.

title: Vancouver city bus drivers are special
reviews: At the airport when we arrived we were sold a book of tickets that were not for seniors, and were for 2 zones when we only needed 1 zone. Every time we got on a bus we explained it to the driver, and he made allowances to correct the overcharge. When we asked for help to navigate the city the response from every driver was exceeding friendly. With some drivers we actually engaged in entertaining exchanges. All this made our visit extra special. This will stand out in our memories of Vancouver.

title: Love the little nooks
reviews: Liked the little parks and sitting areas between buildings that you only see when walking.  People were relatively friendly, not many buskers.  Did not like seeing a hypodermic needle with empty cigarette package on a ledge in the CBC outside courtyard.

title: BORING What happened to Vancouver?
reviews: Wow. Clearly I do travel frequently. I spend more time overseas than I do closer to home. Looking in on Vancouver BC the now most expensive city anywhere in North America it has become lame, and boring. The streets have people sleeping all over them in some quarters. No shame. Most street corners have panhandlers. Deplorable. The excitement is gone. People are not friendly and avoid eye contact. Most are lost in their texting or PDA frenzy. Bicycle riders are rude, abusive, and do not adhere to the rules of the road. In general it is gray at street level. The stores are uninteresting and displays are classic fifties. Food places are very good and there are many to choose from. There just seems to be a lack of a heart beat downtown. Nightlife and quality entertainment does not exist other than drinking holes and third rate stage productions if any at times. A city this size with none quality jazz life, great night clubs/dinner clubs, etc. A town this expensive lacks anything depicting the old fashion pinache of money, glitz, and world class reflection. BORING. Oh well, good old Seattle is not far away and be it reasonably dull there is always the Pike Street Market that still out classes the Granville Island Market totally. Granville Island Market is a sense of contrived where Pike always feels human and natural.

title: Downtown - one of the best places to visit in vancouver
reviews: Downtown is one of the posh area of vancouver. There are several places to visit around downtown like canada place, vancouver lookout , steam watch. It looked like a combination of San francisco and Newyork. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to downtown and would surely recommend everyone to visit it if you head to vancouver.

title: Yaletown
reviews: A nice short walk from The Westin Grand or Sandman downtown.Eating outside near False Creek was lovely. You can walk around the waterfront or bike or rollerblade!

title: Clean and easy to get around
reviews: Spent two days before our cruise. Lots of walking in the downtown area. Very clean city and beautiful waterfront area for walking along the sea wall. Great photo opportunities at every turn. Good shopping, cafes, restaurants all through the downtown core. Gastown was pretty for ambling through stores. Love to visit this beautiful Canadian city when we can.

title: Lots to see and Do...
reviews: Shopping on 4th street or on Robson is a must.  Restaurants are all plentiful and delicious.  Bring an umbrella in Fall and Winter!

title: Nice place to visit.
reviews: The people are so polite you would think it is a small town not a city. In many ways similar to Boston. Great walking city but food in shops and restaurants is expensive.

title: It's ok, glass buildings, shops (on Robson), etc.
reviews: I like Vancouver downtown, but it still lacks a true, meaningful, characteristic and unique flavour. Other downtowns in North America, are just simply unforgettable because of their uniqueness. Vancouver's... not really.

title: Great City
reviews: I have been to all the "big" cities in the U.S. and Vancouver ranks up there in the top of my list of favorites.
