We picked the restaurant which is just across from the ‚ÄòSteam Clock‚Äô, at the intersection of Water Street and Cambie Street. We had no reservations but were lucky to get a table inside, with direct view of the famous Steam Clock. The Steam Clock is a big tourist attraction and it was interesting to watch other tourists stop at the Steam Clock to listen to the tunes the Clock plays on the quarter hour.We had good times at the Water St. Caf√©The food at The Water Street Cafe was excellent. Our friends had the New York steak sandwich, my wife had the Forno Roasted chicken salad and I had Linguine Pesto with chicken pasta. Both were prepared to perfection. Service was a little slow but they were really busy. Highly recommended restaurant on a perfect spot.After lunch we walked down the Water Street. We‚Äôre in tourist territory here ‚Äì right next to the steam clock ‚Äì so you‚Äôre not going to find any bargain prices. But what you do want is some friendly service from people who seem like they care, and some decent food. This is what you get! There is also a good atmosphere which you won‚Äôt always get in these sorts of locations. Noticed several homeless people laying on the sidewalks‚Ä¶ not a great picture especially for this touristy area!Best place to liveIt is impossible to see more that what we did in only two days. We used our time to the max and really like it. There are endless things to do in Vancouver. You can enjoy the beautiful scenery and nature or explore all that the city has to offer you. If you ever feel like you need a change of pace, you can always find something new to do.Vancouver scenic viewsWith its scenic views, mild climate, and friendly people, Vancouver is known around the world as one of the best places to live and is a popular tourist attraction. Vancouver is also one of the most ethnically and linguistically diverse cities in Canada with 52% of the population speaking a first language other than English.Vancouver has been host to many international conferences and events, including the 2010 Winter Olympics and 2010 Winter Paralympics.I would like to thank our hosts for their hospitality. In return I hope they enjoyed this two days tour of Vancouver with us as much as we did! I‚Äôm sure we‚Äôll be back to explore some more of this beautiful city!!

title: One of our favorite cities
reviews: Staying downtown and walking the miles of waterfront trails, great shopping and restaurants, Stanley Park, Pan Pacific Centre, Gastown, Yaletown, Chinatown, etc.  A world class destination you won't be bored or disappointed in.

title: My City
reviews: Safe, clean, and a great place to visit. Walk the sea wall, look up to the snow capped mountains, enjoy the vibrant city life. Restaurants offer you a choice of meals in all price ranges, and any nationality of food. This is a "foodies" city of choice.May, July, August and September are the best weather months.

title: Great Time
reviews: There's so much to do down here. Great Restaurants, nice shopping and nice parks. And somehow it still manages to stay relatively clean in the area.

title: Beautiful downtown
reviews: I enjoyed walking through the downtown, starting with Canada Place, Gas Town and China Town. Gas Town had a good set of shops, restaurants and a vibrant young crowd.  There were occasional pan handlers, closer to China Town.  But overall, I was comfortable walking around even at 9 PM

title: Great Shopping
reviews: Great shopping, but don't plan to park downtown, very expensive, and no spaces to park.  Walk there instead, and enjoy.

title: Vancouver
reviews: A visit to Vancouver is a must if you are visiting B.C. See the cruise ships in Canada place, the sea planes taking off to Vancouver island. The transport system is great you can go anywhere within the area, by sky train or bus or take the sea bus to the north shore, where you have the attractions of Lonsdale key and surrounding park. From here you can get the bus to grouse mountain, where summer or winter there is plenty to see and do. There are further attractions from downtown Vancouver. Take a walk round gas town or take a trip to Granville island, and a visit to Stanley park is a must.I have never known a cheapest way to get to an international airport. From the airport to the train station in downtown is about a fiver for two with minimum walking. My son lives on the north shore so maybe I am slightly biased, but it is definitely a place to visit.

title: too edgy for a family
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is "keeping it real". Much of it is on the shabby side of "bohemian". If I were 30 years younger without a teenage daughter with me, I'd think it was cool, but the homeless and the drug addicts hanging in the street do not seem to be well supported by social programs. I suspect that Vancouver can do better. However, the Gay Pride Parade was awsome and a lot of fun.

title: beautiful city! and surroundings
reviews: Vancouver is one of the most beautiful cities with gorgeous surrounding mountains and coastline.  The traffic in and out of the city is not so well marked, and heavy traffic with small roads going out of the city, but still worth a visit!

title: Very livable and walkable
reviews: If I were ever going to live in a city where it rained all the time, Vancouver would be it.  One of the most lived-in downtowns around.  shopping, restaurants, culture, and a world-class waterfront.  Old buildings in Gas Town, new highrises along water; really enjoyable.

title: Cities
reviews: This one of the most beautiful Cities, Full of beautifull trees and flowers, and the most friendly people. Getting about is very easy and very cheap, walking is a great way to see all. Great shopping and great Restaurants

title: Chinatown
reviews: If you decide to visit Chinatown in Vancouver, be sure to only do it in the daylight.  There are so many homeless people sleeping on the ground, it makes it a very uncomfortable place to journey in the dark.

title: lovely place to wander through
reviews: Lots to see, and experience here.  The area had good facilities and shops, restaurants etc.  We spent a good few hours just wandering around and enjoying the place.  No feeling of being rushed or over busy there.

title: downtown
reviews: Although very central for our shopping and site seeing, we found that downtown was very busy with 7/11's and market shops and a mass abundance of chinese restaurants. Nice shopping along Robson street was within walking distance though.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Clean, artistic, walking friendly.  Loved the tower, and enjoyed dining there above the harbor.  Visited the Cathedral.  Walked our legs off!  Views from hotel at night were awesome.

title: Such a clean and lovely place!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is very popular, plenty of shops, restaurants and bars, Will not be dissapointed and a real buzz going on all the time.

title: A short break in Vancouver on the way home
reviews: At the beginning of Oct we stopped in Vancouver on our way back from Hawaii.  We spent 2 nights at Times Square Suites (reviewed separately) and it was excellent.Day 1We arrived on a Monday morning, totally zombified by our overnight flight.We grabbed a simple but well-priced breakfast at The Spot restaurant opposite to Times Square Suites.  It's a simple snack bar type place but breakfast was good and reasonably priced.  Service was excellent. To stay awake until our room was ready we hopped the Sky train and rode around for a bit.  Some nice views, cheap and a good way to stay awake.After checking in we had a short nap and then walked around the Robson-Denman area for a bit.For dinner we went looking for a great restaurant my husband and I had eaten at on our last trip to Vancouver - Darya on Pender at Denman.  Sadly Darya is no more and has been replaced by Zeitoon - which I will review here since TA does not seem to "get" that a city may have 2 restaurants with the same name and keeps sending me to a Zeitoon restaurant in NORTH VancouverZeitoon - located on Pender st at DenmanFood type - Persian.Sadly Zeitoon is NOT a good replacement for Darya.  It is a bit more upscale than Darya (which was VERY casual). The food at Zeitoon was excellent but the service was frankly the absolute worst.  Food - I loved the lamb and my husband loved his chicken kebab.  The rice was good and the veggies were good.  The hummus was just OK.Service: We received our menus promptly but then everything went downhill.  The restaurant was almost empty when we arrived yet we were ignored while staff - swept the floor???, played with the cash register and basically dawdled about.  It took 20 minutes before anyone checked to see if we would like ANYTHING (like maybe some water) to drink and finally ask if we were ready to give our orders.  The food arrived and of course one order was completely wrong - even though I had repeated my choice to the waitress SEVERAL times.  My companions were nearly done their meals and I was starving by the time I got my correct order. Basically if you are prepared to deal with incompetant and indifferent service, the food is good.Day 2We had breakfast at De Dutch Pannekoek House - a bit overpriced BUT delicious and the service was excellent.  We liked  it so much that we ate our final breakfast before the airport there.  I gather it's a local chain specializing in Dutch style pancakes (thin almost like a crepe).  They also had other breakfasty stuff - like Eggs Benedict.  But personally I would order on of the pancake specialties which are really good (and a wide variety of possibilities),We had a great day basically being driven around by a local friend (which is the way to go IF you only have a short time available.  We saw Stanley Park, Spanish Banks and Jericho and spent a wonderful couple of hours at the Museum of Anthropolgy (which for me is a serious must-do for anyone in Vancouver).  For Lunch we just grabbed a quick bit at the Cafe at MOA - really good soup.For dinner that night we went to Horizons Restaurant on Burnaby mountain.  The view alone makes it worth it.  The food is pricey BUT the fish was excellent and the service was excellent.Basically - absolutely worth it for a special dinner.Next day off to the airport.  It was a good break in what otherwise would have been a long and tedious trip home.

title: A wonderful city
reviews: We stayed in Downtown Vancouver for five days and enjoyed every day, even though the first two rained. The shopping was fantastic, so much so, that we had to buy another suitcase. The restaurants and cafes were also good. There is plenty of public transport as well as the Vancouver Hop-on, Hop-off Trolley that will take you around the city to one of the many attractions to visit. The walking is easy as the city is quite flat. Would loved to of stayed longer and explore more.  Well worth visiting.

title: Great city, ordinary downtown
reviews: The best thing about Vancouver is the outdoors - it's a very walkable city with lots of great things to do outside like walk/bike along the seawall, beaches, Stanley Park etc.  It also has fabulous food options in all price ranges.It's a fairly new city, so if you're into historic architecture, Gastown is about all it's got.  The city doesn't have a lot of character per se, but what makes it great is the proximity to lots of activities, all within an hour of downtown.

title: Interesting city
reviews: Vancouver is an interesting city with lots of things to see and do. Can highly recommend it as a destination of choice. When the weather is great there is tons of outdoor stuff to do and if the weather is inclement there are inside attractions. Good restaurants and some excellent accommodation to be found here.

title: Not impressed.
reviews: It was really just another big, over priced city. Many areas we passed through seemed dirty. The parking in the trendy areas was difficult and traffic was a nightmare. I have driven in downtown Seattle, Los Angeles and San Francisco and nothing prepared me for how bad the Vancouver traffic was.

title: EASY CITY TO WALK AROUND.
reviews: wWe walked most of the city as it is quite compact and easy to navigate. Lots of shopping to be had and also sights to visit. Hop on and off is the way to go to explore Vancouver,

title: Wonderful, walkable city
reviews: City is well-planned for walkers and bicycle enthusiasts.  Various public transportation options available and very easy to use. City maps are posted at major street corners.

title: Most beautiful city on the Pacific
reviews: Style, people, wealth, nature surrounding rivals easily San Francisco. Travelling up North to Squamish or Whistler is very scenic too.

title: Alot different then where I am from more streets and people all over and lots of different place and things to see.
reviews: I liked the scenery but some of the people there can be ignorent . Alot of beautiful restaurants and Loved part of the scenery.I spent alot of time doing lots of walking and exlporing all different types of things and attrations.

title: Extraordinary
reviews: It is an extraordinary place full of shopping,bars,restaurants,malls etc. i was surprised to see a cycle track even on main roads.it is very safe place and we could see ladies walking alone even late nights. It is one of the best cities in the world.

title: Shopping on Robson
reviews: I loved the shopping on Robson as well as the Vancouver Art Gallery.  Robson Street is bussling with people, is clean and has a vibrancy unlike my smaller Alberta home city.

title: Great place to walk around
reviews: Very easy to get around and enough interesting places to keep you busy for a day.  Canada Place, Gastown, and Yaletown are all an easy walk - just plan your route before you start since some are in opposite directions.

title: Enjoyed it
reviews: We all liked the downtown core. We liked all the food you can buy. Although we had to wait for a city bus to take us out to the museum a little longer than expected, but then again we are on holidays.

title: great shops and stuff
reviews: we had a great time wandering around vancouver downtown...loved the shops and places of interest...spend quite a few days here

title: Great walking areas with ample shopping
reviews: Tons of shops on Robsen, Burrard, etc...catch your breath with a cup of coffee at Blendz or peruse a book at Chapters. Lovely and clean.

title: Such gorgeous town!
reviews: I love downtown Vancouver and everything about it. Yes it looks like your typical big city, but better! People here are friendly!

title: Shopping and food galore
reviews: For some big name brand shopping and touristy knick knacks, Take a stroll down robson street between jervis and granville in the late morning, pick up a nutella and strawberry crepe at cafe crepe or grab a bite from one of the any food trucks. It's great for people watching too.

title: A perfect little gem of a city,
reviews: Has it all - art, culture, events, parks, scenery, thriving young scene, exuberant adult and older scene, families more than welcome, pet friendly, it's spendy, but worth it.  REally, it's got everything a bigger city has with less hassles.  So glad I live here.

title: Better than most NA cities
reviews: The downtown area is clean, most parts safe looking and parts are senic.  The area beyond the steam clock towards china town should be avoided as it has a lots of bums.

title: Great strolls
reviews: Vancouver is small enough to experience it walking. Just ask locals/concierge for some tips. There are plenty of interesting areas, such as Chinatown, Gastown, etc.. It is an expensive city though, in particular foodwise. Also take the hop on, hop off buses, a must to see the rest of this city.

title: The Place Rocks!!
reviews: Great place to visit, buzzing with super eating places, very cosmopolitan,Yaletown Roundhouse worth seeing, its opposite a Skytrain station which links directly to the airport and many other parts of the City including Gastown and the Chinese quarter.......

title: Clean but boring
reviews: Streets are clean and very easy to navigate, but aesthetically boring‚Ä¶could definitely use some more interesting art and architecture!

title: Love this area!
reviews: There are just so many things to do from the walks and/or dining  overlooking the Harbour to having a glass of wine at the Top of Vancouver revolving restaurant taking in breathtaking views.  Gastown has a great vibe with a number of bars/clubs. You won't be able to squeeze everything into your trip, which is a sign of how many cool things there are to do in downtown Vancouver.

title: It's An Enigma
reviews: I live in the eastern part of the USA, and had never been to Vancouver before.  Watching the Olympics had a positive effect on me, so on a trip to the Pacific Northwest, I wanted to make a point of visiting and exploring the city.  It was an interesting experience.Vancouver is a beautiful city up close, but stand about 20 feet back.  Ok, I'll explain--   If you're fairly close to the buildings, most of them are beautiful from the sidewalk.  The average price of a dwelling/house in Vancouver as of 2012 was 1.5 million dollars, so you see a lot of buildings that are landscaped beautifully.  However, I was a bit surprised that the city was not quite as clean as I had expected.  The sidewalks weren't much better than those in New York City, and Seattle was really much cleaner.Still, don't back up much further than 20 feet.  I hate to say this, but the architecture in Vancouver is not attractive at all, and would make a citizen of Chicago or San Francisco weep.  Nearly all of the high-rise condos that make up the city skyline seem to be made of similarly styled, gray poured concrete with large windows of greenish class.  Such windows necessitate that many residents must use some kind of window blinds in some windows.  The overall effect when you view the skyline during the day reminded me of the History Channel series "Life After People."  The buildings look like their depiction of abandoned high rises after several decades of neglect.  They look like skeletons of buildings-- Honest!Most of all, Vancouver is very, very expensive.  Meals, activities, real estate... it's simply unbelievable.  I guess it's fortunate that (according to more than one tour guide) there are many millionaires and billionaires residing in Vancouver.  The disproportionate number of ultra-expensive luxury sports cars certainly proved that point well enough for me.  Doubtless those folks find the necessities affordable enough.Mass transit is not very convenient for a visitor who doesn't know the system.  The bus system is excellent, but like all bus systems, it's complex and must be studied and learned.  The SkyTrain doesn't service some major sections of downtown, plus it has some truly bizarre quirks when it comes to using it.Wait- this all sounds like sour grapes, I know.  There is wonderful shopping (I guess) at every corner, and there are fun areas like Gastown and Granville Island to visit.  There's also Davie Street which has a Greenwich Village feel to it, along with hundreds of restaurants of every possible ethnicity.  Oh, and the green spaces (like Stanley Park) are magnificent.  A day at Grouse Mountain is only a bus ticket and about $100 away.  It's beautiful up there!Something that really helped was the two days of Hop-on, Hop-off double-decker bus tour that we did when we first arrived.  It helped us explore and appreciate a lot of the downtown area.Ultimately, I'm really glad I went.  I came to appreciate the fascinating history of the area and the amazing variety of food in Vancouver.  I'd recommend that you go and decide for yourself.  Still, make sure you have your wallet and plenty of room on your credit cards if you want a good experience!

title: Nice Walkabout
reviews: We spent three days in Van, and walked pretty much everywhere for the most part. It's a beautiful city, with clean streets and pretty friendly people. Of course it has it's share of pan handlers and weird types- but that's par for the course in any city. Always felt safe and really can't get too lost. Waterfront is amazing... can't wait to go back!

title: Great and safe
reviews: Unlike alot of downtowns worldwide, Vancouver is safe and friendly. Nightlife is abundant and food of all price and variety is abundant. Vancouvers downtown core has everything you need. Visit Pan Pacifics area or head towards the Plaza of Nations you will always find stuff to do.

title: Fun!!!
reviews: We had a great time walking down town, there were several places to window shot and many many places to eat.  We really did have a wonderful time and would go again.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Lots to look at, with lovely water views. Felt safe here night and day, and great place to walk around, with excellent public transport system. Incredible amount of eating places catering to all tastes and budgets. 3 days in Vanc was not long enough

title: Big City Dirt
reviews: We took the Big Bus tour and was unable to hear the recorded tour and the driver did not know how to operate recording so at some stops we did not hear the entire spill. Very disappointed

title: we need some love
reviews: downtown vancouver needs some sprucing up, we need to beautify this wonderful city. clean it up, give it some lipstick and a new style.

title: Avoid Hastings Street at all costs
reviews: Vancouver has a real problem for visitors with what can only be described as no go area, make no bones about it we are very experienced traveelrs having visted citys all over the world and never have I been approached by 3 locals to, I quote leave the area immediately, very unsafe area and not for the faint hearted.

title: Smalltown charm with interesting shopping
reviews: Vancouver feels in my opinion a lot smallar than it really is. For me, that's not a bad thing.. A relaxed, kicked-back atmosphere, yet trendy and cool. We spent half the afternoon relaxing on the giant pillows that where placed on Robson street. Relaxing and "out of the box".

title: Stunning waterfront
reviews: We loved this area of Vancouver and spent many hours slowly meandering around the harbour and surrounding area.  Having an injured leg, it was fairly flat and made walking easier and there is plenty of seating to just watch the world go by.

title: Lovely City
reviews: Plenty of shopping, sightseeing, restaurants, and classy hotels.Downtown has a great waterfront, historic buildings, museums, skyscrapers, public art (loved the huge bean bag chairs),food trucks, and the Olympic Cauldron.

title: Looove Vancouver!
reviews: We fell in love with Vancouver from the get go. What a wonderful city. The downtown is clean with beautiful buildings, wide sidewalks, nice public areas at the entrance of the buildings and public art. For us it felt very chic and cosmopolite. Lots of fancy cars and high end stores. The water and the green peeking out in the background. We felt safe walking day and night. It is remarkable the vision for this city. They rejected having a highway bisecting their city so that is why there is none in the heart of the city. Also, early on they encouraged vertical development so the city stayed fairly compact and they did not eat up prized properties such as Stanley Park. Vancouver is an example of a city that should be more closely studied and emulated by many other cities including my hometown.

title: Cruise Ship Parking
reviews: We wanted to find a safe and secure place to park our car while taking a cruise to Alaska for our 20th Anniversary. We pre-booked Vinci Park Canada Place self park lot. They email you directions and check-in info.  WOW, we were very satisfied. You drive in and go directly to P1. We found a place to park close to the elevator for the Cruise Ship Terminal. Found a trolley; loaded it with our luggage, and down the elevator which brought us right to the Cruise Ship security area. A gentleman took our checked luggage and we proceeded directly through all the security checks and were on the ship in an hour. Coming back, we disembarked the ship, went through Customs and Immigration and onto the elevator and to our car. We were on our way out in less than half an hour. We felt our car was in a great location as we had heard other not so good stories about other locations.  Highly recommend parking here.

title: Trendy with great shopping and restaurants
reviews: We rented an apartment on West Cordova street and walked in the downtown area. Would stay away from Hastings Street but Gastown is trendy and fun. Watched a commercial filmed in Gastown, had some great dinners and enjoyed the shopping. Loved the steam clock! Has a Greenwich Village type atmosphere and a young crowd.

title: BEAUTIFUL DOWNTOWN
reviews: A walkers paridise.  Easy to get around and so much to see and do. The Art Gallery,Robson Square, hudsen Bay Company City Center. Great dining all around.

title: Lots to see in Downtown
reviews: Great visit. Had a 2 day hop-on hop-off bus tour which covered most of Downtown, including Gastown, Canada Place, English Beach, Stanley Park and lots of other attractions. The bus is a great way of seeing all the main sights.

title: Very walkable
reviews: Vancouver's downtown is compact, and very walkable.  And when distances are too far, public transit is excellent.

title: my pride and joy!!
reviews: this is my home and I never tire being a tour guide as i share and show off this beautiful city to All my guests,whether be family,friends or the international students that I host.

title: Watch out for panhandlers
reviews: City does very poor job of controlling panhandlers, it is getting out of control.  Homeless sleep everywhere, hit you up for handouts.  Don't go too far into Gas Town, stay close to harbor area.

title: A great city
reviews: I like everything about downtown Vancouver--even the traffic and one-way streets. It's a good city for walking and feeling safe (I spend a lot of time in Central America and appreciate that aspect). Good shopping, great restaurants, clean and beautiful,  especially when the flowering hanging baskets adorn the lamp standards.

title: Great shopping!
reviews: Robson Street is a great shopping area with both medium and high end shops.  In addition, there are many really good restaurants to entice you.

title: Beautiful, Scenic Waterfront
reviews: Beautiful walks around Harbor Front! Attractive gardens and interesting buildings and shops. Restaurants are pricey!

title: Busy and diverse!
reviews: From Chinatown to glamor, all is a walking distance. I highly recommend to get a hotel in this area, so you an enjoy great shopping and nightclub life!

title: Lively lovely downtown Vancouver.
reviews: We stayed at the Renaissance Harbourside Hotel, fab position.  Short walk to the waterfront and Stanley Park.  Also very near the sea plane center, we flew to Victoria on Vancouver Island.  Also good base for good eating by the harbour or Cloud Nine 42nd floor revolving resturant.

title: A long interesting walk - Vancouver Downtown
reviews: A beautiful clean city with great breweries and restaurants, shops, art galleries and interesting architecture!

title: Wonderful shopping, and eats!
reviews: I have been coming here for years.  The buildings are beautiful.  There are many places to eat and shop.  There can be huge crowds which can be overwhelming at times.  There are many street people asking for money.  The finer stores are on Robson.  Don't walk too far down West Hastings or Cordova; the atmosphere changes.   There are many wonderful restaurants and pubs, a cupcake shop for the little ones.   Much to see, do, and enjoy!

title: City by the sea
reviews: Loved the mix of modern and old architecture, the relaxed atmosphere of Vancouver, the friendly locals always ready to engage in conversation with a visitor, and the constant views of the bay and the mountains across the harbour.

title: Busy without stress
reviews: For downtown area it was surprisingly chilling. A busy big town without any stress or hectic. People are still helpful and friendly so you kind of feel comfortable at once. Nice buildings, architecture and skyline.

title: Bliss
reviews: I usually have probelms with major city CBDs. Vancouver's is so open, peaceful and easy to navigate, whether on foot or by public transport was a joy.

title: Tons of shopping!
reviews: A great place for back to school shopping.  There was a great variety of shops to choose from - everything from high end to bargain shopping!

title: Safe Place to Walk
reviews: Except for Gastown, I felt very safe in Vancouver and even there I felt okay. But there are a lot of homeless folks who look drugged and old.  At night it reminds one of New Orleans Bourbon St.

title: Loved Canada place and bay
reviews: This was our second time to Vancouver and we loved to go to Canada place which is downtown by the bay and watch boats and planes land. We loved gastown which is just down the road from Canada place.

title: Funcitysightseeing Bus Tour
reviews: I traveled to Vancouver to visit my husband while he was there for work. I decided to take the Fun CIty Sightseeing Bus tour and had a great time. Jeff, the tour guide and Gibby the bus driver were GREAT!!! They both had interesting things to share about the city and I had a wonderful introduction to the top sights of Vancouver. A terrific way to get acquainted with the area so I knew where to revisit on my own. They were very fun, informative and lighthearted for the whole trip. I stayed on the bus for one complete loop, then took a couple of hop offs and back ons until we reached Stanley Park again and I was able to walk back to my hotel from there. I highly recommend this tour.

title: A great Walk
reviews: Spent an afternoon with map in hand visiting all the historic areas of Vancouver.some fascinating areas including the gas  clock. Great city.

title: Do your research.
reviews: Places I enjoy:Robson Street for the crowds and places to get a bite. Davies Street for the great restaurants and very accepting homosexual culture which makes a straight guy like me and my wife feel relaxed.   Denman Street has a great dessert place - True Confections.Wear comfortable shoes as you can do a lot of walking.

title: Busy but you want to see it.
reviews: There are so my things to see and different cultural areas. Take the on/ off bus. You get to see everything then go back and get off to experience things. Well worth the money.Vancouver has to highway system through the city so traffic can and does get very heavy. Take the bus.

title: congested
reviews: great city --lots of people lots of stuff always going on --too much construction bad -- for getting around by car or transit --i guess that is the price you pay for living in a fantastic city

title: Bright, shining city
reviews: Something to savor in every direction.  Be savvy to the fact that few shops stay open past 1800 or 1900.  I went to Yaletown for supper at Blue Water Cafe (excellent) only to discover there were lots of great stores along the way that had already closed for the day.

title: Its a big city and lots of it!
reviews: What strikes you its that its a very modern city, its contemporary, its sophisticated... its generally very clean. Its easy to notice that Vancouver is a wealthy, affluent city and if you enjoy shopping all the big names and brands are here. On the other side of these great things, you can expect to spend a lot of money when you are here. If you are travelling on a budget, make sure its a healthy budget. Prices are high and the sales tax has a bite too.One aspect that I feel let this city down was when I was here on an evening. I wanted to enjoy a few beers with my friends, but without my passport no bars would allow me to enter (I'm 37). In addition, the city turned from sophistication to embarrassment. Flooded with police present, roads closed, rubbish strewn everywhere, young people drunk in the streets. I also felt a sense physical threat and unpleasantness.I do like Vancouver city, but its not a place I'd like to visit at night again - or little often.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Very vibrant with a lot of stores and things to see. Gaslight area was interesting with a steam clock and the Old Spaghetti factory for dining as well as a lot of shops. Transportation was a breeze with friendly bus drivers and transfer system.

title: Lots To Do and See
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is the place to be... Plenty of restaurants, hotels, and stores.  My wife and I walked throughout the downtown area including Canada Place, Gastown, Chinatow, and the shopping areas of Robston and Burrard Streets.  Everything is close and safe.  The people who worked in the strores and restaurants were very courteous, friendly, and efficient.  Very enjoyable experience especially if walking.

title: Vancouver is my second favorite city in the world
reviews: My first favorite city is New York and the second is Vancouver. (and I travel a lot -- my third favorite is London).   It is not a city where there is tons of sightseeing to run around and see.  Rather it is a fabulous place to hang out, relax, stroll around neighborhoods, settle in to coffee shops, have some great food and enjoy the friendly Canadians.  It is beautiful, with beautiful Stanley Park in the middle of the city.  It is small enough that everything is walkable -- although some a very long walk.  Depending upon how long you stay, there are some very good side trips--to Victoria (which looks like Disney Land) or Whisler.  This is my 4th trip to Vancouver--whenever I am the vicinity I try to tack on a trip -- this time a weekend after an Alaskan cruise.  Once I connected through Vancouver going to Thailand so that I could stay on the way out and in.    I am on the East Coast of the US so it sometimes takes some planning but it is worth it.

title: Busy but safe
reviews: Lots of shops, some expensive and some more affordable.  There is a Money exchange and several banks.  Streets were busy in the afternoon and evening but we felt completely safe.  Some homeless people begging but not offensive or aggressive like in California. Plenty of places to eat and a variety of food types. Easy to get a taxi but my 78 year old mother was fine to walk up and down the street.

title: Laid back and beautiful
reviews: Beautiful and user friendly.  Traffic not a problem.  Lots of great shopping, not necessarily cheap, but very good.  Granville island just a short boat ride away.  Get the all day pass for the little boats and hop from stop to stop.  One of the nicest cities I have ever visited.

title: Superb city
reviews: I love Vancouver as a city. It is very user-friendly. Great walks along the water, lovely buildings, great shopping.

title: Fun lively City
reviews: It's a fun destination and so different from Seattle.  A short and very laid back Amtrak ride from our area and a very pleasant downtown core for shopping, drinking and eating.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Very Diverse. Excellent restaurants. Good shopping. Excellent sites. Great hotels.Disliked the transients but that is too be expected in a large city.

title: One of the busiest downtowns
reviews: Even on a weekend, this downtown was choc a bloc with traffic, but well maintained, similar to any large city expect people all over the place., fantastic restaurants.

title: Walkable
reviews: Easily walk 3km around the city center; noticed less vehicle traffic going east-west.The Granville entertainment district was really hopping on the Saturday night we were there.  The police closed the street to vehicles for at least 8 blocks; great people watching, decent bar/club choices, and good police presence.

title: Lots to do, lots of shopping and food and surrounded by water
reviews: Lots to eat, lots of shopping, ever present views, and lots of people without be crowded. Definitely the place to stay if you don't have a car, it is the heart of the city. No need for a car here. You are never too far from the water, and parks and shopping and food, oh my!

title: Lots to See and Do in Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Enjoyed taking in the shopping, restaurants, and people watching (stylish, hip, and predominately young) as well as the Vancouver Art Gallery there. The architecture is beautiful and varied as well. On another day we went to Gastown, a distinct downtown neighborhood full of fun shops and bars with a historic twist. Truly the international city of the future!

title: Walking downtown Vancouver
reviews: Vancouver is a great city to walk. There are lots of shops and a variety of restaurants to choose from. It is a very clean city and friendly people.  We felt very safe. The port area is very nice to stroll or overlook the sea planes take off and land on the water. It's a nice city to visit especially pre or post cruise to Alaska.

title: Shopping, Dining, Walking
reviews: I'm kind of biased, this is my home town but Downtown Vancouver can't be beat. Shop on Robson and Pacific centre for some great finds. Then stroll down to coal harbour for a wonderful walk. Best caesars are at Marina Mill on the walk (smoked salmon caesar!). English bay is gorgeous for sunset  and get a spot early because it fills up.

title: Really enjoy Robson Street
reviews: Really enjoy Robson Street.  Great place to walk and explore.  Didn't do any shopping but it was great to look in the windows while walking along :)

title: Nice walk around
reviews: Nice to walk around, lots of restuarants.  One Greek one had a long line outside all the time.  Don't know if it was that good or that cheao.

title: Great City!
reviews: We walked to Gas Town, China Town and Yale Town as well as the main part of Downtown Vancouver. We enjoyed them all although there are areas you need to steer clear of and we came across a number of beggars on the streets (although we have the same in London). There are lots of glass high rise building, but you will find a few old colonial buildings dotted in between if you look. The Harbour Centre is worth a visit - the views from the viewing tower are fab!

title: Our Favourite City
reviews: I'm not sure how you can rate a city centre as a whole, but I did want to give Downtown Vancouver 5 stars because it's simply the nicest, friendliest city that we've ever been to. The people are wonderful, the service exemplary, it's clean, safe and you've got Stanley Park and the waterfront on the doorstep. Must go back soon!

title: Downtown
reviews: Vancouver downtown is filled with many shops, especially on Granville Street and Robson Street. There is also Robson Square and it's close to Gastown, Yaletown and the Waterfront area. Granville Street is light up at night and sort of looks like Broadway.

title: our birthdays
reviews: we both have the same birthday aug 2 nd so we stayed downtown at the landmark hotel we watched the fireworks from our 19 th floor with 20 friends on aug 1 st and the on the second we used the hop on hop of bus to tour the city and the dined at the revoving resuarant to celebate our birthdays my wife and i had a fantastict time the is so much to do in vancouver.

title: Lots of Sights
reviews: Lots of places to go. Lots of places to see. There are lots of panhandlers and some of those panhandlers are very aggressive. That can turn your day pretty negative if you let it.

title: Beauty dripping.........
reviews: Vancouver downtown holds it's own charm. Harbour walking trail is refreshing. Area around Canada Place is great.

title: Busy!
reviews: Stayed in a hotel in downtown and although the hotel was great downtown didn't really appeal to us.  It was very busy in the evenings with lots of neon but you were spoilt for choice for places to eat.  Some looked a little odd!  Other shopping was OK, nothing special.  A nice walk to Canada Place round the sea wall.

title: History and contemporary style together
reviews: In Downtown you find the perfect meeting between the historic Vancouver (East Pender St.) and the modern center (West Pender St.)... You must visit Gastown! Probably one of the best Downtown in the world, for sure the best Downtown I visited so far.

title: Vancouver, BC is a MUST see.
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful city.  It's clean, vibrant, and bustling.  There are many different cuisines to choose from; seems to be a melting pot.  I love it here!

title: Beautiful but boring
reviews: A great city looking for a heart. The makings are there and in fact many years ago it was a super city where the downtown brought together workers, co-workers, friends, visitors into a friendly interactive space. Today everyone seems more interested in themselves, their PDA's and tend to shun everyone around them. The city has turned cold even with collectively a very attractive surrounding with all ammenities.

title: Busy
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is very busy & cosmopolitan . Easy to get around & buses are easy to use. The shops are the same as all major cities with lots of places to eat on every street . Robeson Street is the major shopping street but nicer roads can be found by just coming off the main drag

title: Downtown is full of Activty
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is full of activity and multiculturalism. There is a lot of opportunity for eating great meals of different cultures, and allows you to also walk to a bunch of places. It is close to all of the amenities.

title: some many street people!
reviews: I was surprised at the number of homeless begging on the streets. They would come right up to you in the sidewalk cafes and ask for change. The number of young and old sleeping on the streets was rather upsetting at times.

title: Downtown walkable in one day
reviews: we had just a few days to visit vancouver.  i had reserved 2 half days for walking downtown.  The city is ery small -we were able to enjoy town in a few hours.  There are nice cafges and ice creamm shops all over town.  The water front is not so crowded as one could imagine.

title: loved it
reviews: down town  is a great place to visit when in Vancouver lots of food and entertainment options , or even grab a coffee and sit and people watch

title: Beautiful But Lacking in Personality
reviews: Alright.  I was in Vancouver for one week and walked 70 miles and covered every area recommended by the locals.  First let me say this:Vancouver is a very beautiful city with top tier everything (which is why it is the most expensive city in North America and rated as one of the best cities to live in, in the world).  The public transit is state of the art.  The urban planning and walkability is among the best in the world.  The architecture, while modern, is excellent.  The parks are beautiful with lots of outdoor activities available.  The city is safe and clean, and a very tolerant multicultural melting pot, very mixed everywhere(it's not segregated like other cities).  This is perhaps its greatest strength...but it is also perhaps its greatest weakness as well.I really wanted to love Vancouver but I couldn't.  The reason for this, is that despite having everything listed above, I felt it lacked a culture or ideas that are unique to Vancouver.  It did not even feel like a Canadian city to me (I have been to the other big two) and I felt that if someone blindfolded me and dropped me off in Vancouver, I would have no idea what city I am in.  It felt like a West Coast American City (except with the Canadian hospitality) or a large Asia Pacific City.When you go to Montreal, you get the feel for the French Canadians by language, architecture, poutine, Montreal smoked beef etc.When you go to Toronto, you feel like you are in Canada with buildings such as the Hockey Hall of Fame, CN Tower, CBC, Eaton Center, etc.  It feels Canadian.With Vancouver, there was not anything I could really point to that is a product of Vancouver and I think that is due to the lack of any one culture having a dominating influence, which is why I said its greatest strength is also its greatest weakness.With all that said, having been to many cities Vancouver is up there and would be a 5-star city if it had that identity I was looking for.A few cons: - Seems drug use is tolerated so you may get random whiffs of pot while walking- Some random whiffs of urine (more-so than other large cities I have visited or lived in)- Many bums/pan-handlers - more than Chicago which caught me by surprise

title: Everything is walking distance
reviews: The downtown area is very convenient and safe to walk around.  I would stay away from Granville street at night however if you are not used to homeless people.  I grew up in LA so I am used to seeing that.  Vancouver felt very safe to me but then again I am from a large city so your feelings on this matter may be different from mine.  I stayed at the Sheraton Wall Centre and I got to explore the streets.  The downtown area offers a lot of things to do for all ages and different interests.  I took in the Taiwanfest festival they had going on.  Enjoyed the free concerts and performances.  The food at the festival was hit and miss but good for what it is.  Stanley park and granville island were also great places to vist.  Thanks for reading!

title: Great Summer Walking
reviews: Hop on/off buses were handy to get a good overview of Vancouver.  Avoid Chinatown homeless area.  Other streets were fine for entertainers, restaurants of all variety.  Friendly locals and lots of tourists.

title: Just like any big city
reviews: Nothing too different compared to any other big city. The views near the water or Stanley Park are stunning, but if we consider the downtown *core*, walking around Rogers, Davies, W Georgia, it's not that different from anyother urban scenario.

title: beautiful
reviews: The city is the most environmentally conscious city with so many options of dining and historical tours.  It is expensive and crowded, but beautiful!   You  definitely should include walking or biking the sea wall with a tour guide to explain the beautiful areas!

title: A great place to visit
reviews: This a great place to visit.  It has everything: the hole in the wall restaurant, the beach, great people, awesome views, good shopping.  It can be crowded in the summer but I like the fact that after the sun goes down.. I can still walk down Robson street and find stores that are still open.  Particularly awesome for young, single people because there is a ton of bars, clubs and coffee shops to explore.

title: Love Vancouver!
reviews: We have visited a number of times and always love it. We recently spent 3 nights there following our Alaska Princess cruise. There is so much to do in this beautiful city. Wonderful restaurants, safe city, no problem walking at night. Lots to explore. Take the trolley or the Big bus, hop off and on and see the city at your leisure. The two day tickets are a better buy. It is truly a beautiful city.

title: vibrant
reviews: downtown Vancouver is amazing...always something to see and do...lots of great shopping and eating! The waterfront and Robson street are fun

title: Great except Robson Street
reviews: Time marches on and has clearly left Robson Street behind. The whole length of it felt so yesterday.

title: Great City
reviews: Wonderful people and eateries abound.  With a huge Asian and Indian influence, if you can't find anyting to eat, you are not looking hard enough.

title: Awesome restaurants and shopping - if you have deep pockets and stunning vistas, if you're up high enough.
reviews: Vancouver is one of the most beautiful (large) cities in North America; lots of great architecture, the art gallery, etc. -- it's one of the cleaner cities, for sure -- and how can you go wrong with views like that?!

title: Tons to do
reviews: Downtown has so many shops and places to eat, it was great.  Many sights beautiful sights.  A very clean city.  If you haven't been before be ready for sticker shock.

title: City
reviews: First visit to Vancouver and loved it.  It is very metropolitan.  Museum has some Matisse (sp?) paintings on loan that were lovely.  Did not have enough time there to do all that I wanted.  Must go back

title: renee1058
reviews: Our family wanted to try the public transit system in Vancouver.  Yes, we were confused several times and yet many different folks would be happy to give advice to which bus or train we should take to get to our destination.  I have not been to a downtown that revealed so many kind people who were willing to go out of their way to help us get where we needed to go.

title: Vancouver in summer!
reviews: Compact, vibrant, multinational with lots of bike lanes and great food. Just be mindful of the rainy season.

title: casual fun
reviews: It takes less than a day to view the sights and neighbourhoods of downtown. A pleasant way to spend the day.

title: Lots to see
reviews: So many stores, people, and things to see downtown. Did not matter what time was walking around always felt safe. Highlight was Granville Street on Saturday night when they shut down the streets for all the nightclub patrons.

title: Walk the Sea Wall and visit Stanley Park to English Bay...
reviews: Recently ranked one of the best walking cities in the world, and even better on bike...but do wear a helmet...

title: weekend in the city
reviews: I have lived in Vanc my whole life & gave my husband a night downtown for his birthday. We stayed @ The Metropolitan Hotel & spent 2 days enjoying my own city. So easy to walk around downtown (just like Manhattan, NY). We did the hop on hop off bus tour, spent 1/2 day in Gastown, dinner in Yaletown & walked part of the seawall & into Kitsalino.....beautiful cityscapes, easy travel & many good "left over" tourism benefits from Olympics, like ambassadors on every corner of high tourist areas to answer & direct visitors to the city. Very proud of our beautiful city!

title: So much to do!!
reviews: ~ Bella Gelateria, best gellato in the world (literally, they have been named it). Sooo yummy!!!!~ The Cupcake Store, actual store of tv's The Cupcake Girls! Delicious, affordable, yummy!!!!~The Sears Tower, affordable with phenominal views of Vancouver, Stanley Park & surrounding areas~ Stanley Park, a must do in Vancouver~ Canada Place, beautiful waterfront views of the mountains & Stanley Park.~ Sky Train will get you anywhere!

title: Shop and eat til you drop!
reviews: So many great places to eat and of course hopping on the trolleys to get about town. The best place to eat was Cloud 9 at the Landmark Empire Hotel. Way up in the "clouds" on the 42 nd floor and 360 degree views of Vancouver. Food and Wait staff superb!

title: Vibrant - Friendly
reviews: Vancouver's downtown offers much to do, see and experience. It clean and very picturesque. we couold have spent a day strolling there.

title: Just Fun!!
reviews: We stayed at the Ramada Ltd to be close to downtown.  We were not disappointed.  We walked the short 2-3 blocks to Gastown and enjoyed watching the Steam Clock blow smoke and make music. (goes every 15 minutes).  The restaurants, sidewalk cafes, shops and brick and cobble streets were very interesting.  In the Lamplighter they even had copper ceilings and excellent chicken wings!  Robson street offers great shopping and the local buses take you anywhere for an inexpensive $7 per day for the use of all public transit.  Granville is interesting and the markets offer great veggies and fun with people watching.  Yes, the ferry/shuttle is included in the public transit price, too.  Chinatown is marked with red lamp posts and offered many little shops and places to enjoy their food.  Canada Place is the spot to catch the free shuttles to Grouse Mountain (gondola to the top, loggers show, birds of prey, 2 bears and a ranger talk, zipline, ride to the top, and enjoy the great views.  Then the free shuttle back down the mountain and a stop at Capilano Bridge...a total must see!  What a city to enjoy...4 days not enough!!

title: One of the best Downtowns
reviews: Absolutely scenic and beautiful, Very safe, Friendly people wont leave you feel you are an outsider. One of the best downtowns I have ever seen.

title: Vibrant
reviews: Fabulous tourist area - lots to do and see, with loads of good places to eat or sit-and-watch-the-world-go-by!

title: Not impressed
reviews: We visited Vancouver with a family of 4 and were not impressed with the downtown part of it. Hard to explain, but it was not what we had been expecting at all. Definitely a lack of atmosphere and a lot of drunks and addicts who made us feel extremely uncomfortable. We have visited many European and American cities (Paris London, NYC, LA, San Francisco, Seattle) and I'm sorry to say, but Vancouver didn't even come close... However, the outskirts of the city are much nicer and definitely worth a visit.

title: Great place for a day
reviews: Large farmers type market, little shops and good place to eat. We took the city bus, good value for only $2.50 and only a short walk to the heart.

title: diverse and spread out
reviews: seems there's lots to do so plan well.  Transportation seems easy by bus or air trans.  Plenty of food and shopping opportunities depending on what you are looking for

title: Just a city
reviews: These days all metropolitans lost their identities...Global brands make up the cities, I guess.  Crosswalk signals were little to short for me...busy crossing streets.

title: Just more trendy shops ...
reviews: Very popular destination but similar to many others in just about any major tourist city. A mix of trendy and alternate shops that caters well for those who want to relax and walk around with the hassle of major roads, but Robson Street offers better shopping and other parts of Vancouver a better overall experience. A nice stop though as part of a bike around the seafront.

title: Lots to do!
reviews: We loved downtown Vancouver!  There is so much to see and do.  In addition to the wonderful urban vibe, the view of the mountains is gorgeous.   There are so many areas to explore.  You could spend days there and not see eveyrthing!

title: Great shopping
reviews: Lots of shopping for all sizes, like Fashion Fourteen Plus in the Scotia Plaza.  Also great shoe shopping.

title: shopping
reviews: lots of shopping, much to see. easy to get around by buying a full day public transit. Bus drivers were very helpful.

title: A world class city, enjoy walking it !
reviews: IF downtown, go down the convention center and walk the seawall.  Also, the high end stores downtown, or just walk to Stanley park and walk the seawall (about 2 hours to walk around leisurely).

title: Clean and friendly city
reviews: Nice harbor and clean city.  There is a lot to see and do with some excellent food options.   The "on and off " bus is a good way to get around and cover ground.  Get off at the market for lunch.

title: Downtown
reviews: The weather was wonderful which made everything shine. We have traveled the world and would rate downtown Vancouver as one of the best.

title: Very nice shopping and many restaurants
reviews: a lot of great shopping and a very easy walk from the hotel to all the various areas that afford a good experience. no problems anywhere for a big city. loved it

title: Wow!
reviews: The people in this town are very polite and friendly. I didn't hear one horn blow on any car. If it said don't turn left after 7:00 a.m. I didn't see any one turn left. I was there 5 days. People smiled.Don't miss it for a vacation spot

title: Like any other city
reviews: We found downtown Vancouver to be disappointing, nothing special. A few nice shopping areas but it was easy to wander into less desirable areas - lots of sex shops about which made for interesting conversations with our kids. On our way back to Gastown from visiting the Chinese gardens we had the misfortune to walk past East Hastings street. I have never seen so many homeless, drugged up people on one street. Thank goodness it was not at night. Not an experience I want to repeat.Apart from Gastown (which is effectively one street;Water street) the rest of downtown Vancouver was just so-so

title: Charming
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is easy to get around and there are many tour operators selling city shuttle services to show you the sights and tell the odd story about particular places in the town.  If you have plenty of time and are mobile I would suggest walking to take in the ambience of the town.

title: green, clean, futuristic
reviews: Vancouver will blow your socks off, downtown offers a lot to see, dont miss it? Liked most : Robson square with its different architectures. Disliked most : roads going up and down !

title: A destination with everything! Awesome in the summer.
reviews: If you're looking to visit Vancouver, downtown Vancouver has pretty much everything if you're looking for!Awesome food with lots of different types of cuisine (casual to find dining) along with the Seabus that can carry you over to North Vancouver. If you have a full day and want to check out the scenery in the city, you can start off at Coal Harbor (starting at Pan Pacific Hotel) to walk the sea wall, it has one of the best walks you can have with a water view. That will lead you to Stanley Park which is a must see! After you finish a complete round you'll reach English Bay beach which is the busiest beach (overall around the clock). And that's not all, if you keep walking, you'll hit False Creek which is newer area leading straight to Yaletown. This walk will most likely take up the the entire day if you stop and check out different spots.

title: Interesting
reviews: It was very busy and metropolitan like as expected. We walked down Robson but since we really aren't interested in shopping it really didn't do anything for us. We did enjoy walking on side streets justnoutsidenthe downtown area as there were many homes with beautiful gardens and fountains. That we enjoyed seeing.

title: Great city
reviews: Easy to navigate and great for shopping. Gas town is a must - lots of character and fab eateries. Stanley park offers a great place for a break from the hustle of the city - you can easily spend the day.

title: walk around
reviews: one of the few cities where downtown is alive after the work-day is done.  People actually live in the City!  So Robson, Davie, Denman, Granville - lots of great restos and bars - food from every corner of the world.  Just walk around and enjoy!(the bars do close kind of early tho...)

title: Early morning drive was pleasant
reviews: We toured downtown in the early morning on a Sunday in a top down convertible.  There was no traffic whatsoever and we were able to see Chinatown and Canada Place without the crowds.  At other times, traffic is snarled with cars, trucks, bicyclists and pedestrians.

title: THE GREATEST CITY ON EARTH
reviews: Yes I know, this is a big claim but I have lived in 11 countries and visited 76 countries.  Vancouver has a lot going for it.  It is a green city.  It has no nuclear reactors.  Cars are encouraged not to sit idle unless the engine is turned off.  Bicycles have their own lanes (about 9 km of it on the seawall in Stanley Park.  You can Zipline between mountains at speeds of 80 kilometers per hour on top of Grouse Mountain.  The city is BEAUTIFUL.  Go to West Vancouver and see the Stanley Park from the mountain.  This city has the nightlife and business life and everything going for it.  Vancouver rocks.

title: Fabulous Architecture
reviews: You'll be wowed by the diversity of architecture in the downtown area.  Such imagination and variety - it is fantastic!

title: A wonderful city to explore
reviews: We loved visiting the restaurants, shops and downtown area. Crowded enough to feel the energy but not too crazy.

title: Reminds me of D.C.
reviews: Lots packed into many square blocks. So much fun seeing all the little shops and eateries! And they have an H-Mart!

title: Fun and beautiful
reviews: Great place with beautiful scenery, surrounded by the ocean, and with great architecture and entertainment

title: Great city
reviews: Loved Vancouver for its cleanliness and ease of getting about. Liked the shops, but sorry to see Sears was closing down. Didn't like to see so many beggars on the streets and wish I'd had more than spare change to help them.

title: Gas Town Clock ( want one)
reviews: Liked this place lots. Very tousisty with lots of old charm. The clock draws loads of people every 1/4 hour with it's unique "chimes"Only draw back is the down and outs begging for money

title: It's the most vibrant part of town
reviews: Vancouver downtown has been growing and changing constantly. The shops are also changing on Robson street every year. It's a very competitive place to do business. More hotels are being built. Building are getting taller and taller. Designated bicycle lane for cyclists. Full array of restaurants to choose from. Bus and skytrain will easily take you to the heart of town.

title: A cosmppolitan city near Seattle
reviews: I'm originally from Manhattan (NYC) and was raised in an environment that was pretty cosmopolitan and where you could find just about anything.  Seattle is a great place to live but I, an now my wife, miss things that you can find in NYC but not in Seattle.  For example, you can hardly get a bad meal in NYC and in Seattle it's best to do a little research first.  Vancouver made me feel at home and like I was back on the East Coast.

title: See the Gastown steam clock.
reviews: We wandered about to see if we could do a little shopping. unfortunately, a cruise ship had just disembarked a crowd of looky-loos so we decided to call it a day.

title: Good walk around city
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has many areas from Chinatown, Seaport, Gastown, to walk around with great areas to see, food and for people watching. I would recommend one of the "on and off" buses to get a flavor of the city and all its areas, take the two day pass for only $ 5 more and then you can get around the city if you have the time. I would plan at least 2 or 3 nights in Vancouver to do it justice.

title: Best Cities
reviews: Clean, cosmopolitan, diverse, safe, great public transportation, easy to get around, bike city and environmentally dedicated people.  Then there is Stanley Park and the mountains and waters.  Easy to see why so many have chosen to move here in the recent years.  The Expo and Olympics woke up this city to be a choice place to visit or live.

title: Gastown is a great place for restaurants and shops
reviews: Gastown is a cobbled area with beautiful hanging baskets and old time gas lamps. There is also a steam clock that goes off every 15 minutes. Lots of restaurants and souvenir shops. We spent most evenings there. Only 10 mintues walk from most downtown hotels. A must place to visit.

title: This is the place to be!
reviews: Its all happening in downtown Vancouver. I loved the waterfront-just to have a meal overlooking the sea or cycling in Stanley Park or taking a flip on one of the sea planes. There is a vibe in downtown Vancouver and this area is best viewed at sinset from Stanley Park-with the sun casting a glow over all the glass buildings....quite a sight. No wonder they call it beautiful British Columbia!

title: Gastown Vancouver - charming renovated district
reviews: We spent a morning meandering around Gastown a renovated quarter of Vancouver and loved its winding streets.boutiques and above all The Gas Clock, which spurts steam all day long to the fascination of all.

title: Mixed feelings
reviews: Okay, there were parts fo the downtown that were great and parts not so great. Granville Street has some really seedy spots and an odd assortment of characters while the ritzier shopping streets (e.g. Robson) are okay. Way too much gum on the sidewalk and cigarette butts aplenty even though you not supposed to smoke within 10 metres of a doorway!

title: lots to do
reviews: robson street was a collection of shops you would find in most big cities (sears, boutiques, etc) but gastown was worth a visit to see the street vendors ( a few) and some of the art shops.  Canada place and a walk along the sea wall were beautiful views

title: A really beautiful city
reviews: I'm used to Toronto, so Vancouver was a breath of fresh air.  This city is beautiful, user friendly, and everything is close at hand.  You have to try a food truck or two!

title: visitor to own city
reviews: we love vancouver.  Although it's our home town, there is so much to see and restaurants to try.  We really enjoy being tourists in our own city.

title: One day in Vancouver
reviews: We had only one day in Vancouver, and had a great day exploring the city.  We started offg at the Vancouver Lookout, then drove through Chinatown & stopped at the Sun Yat Sen Classical Chinese Gardens.  We had to skip all the wonderful museums, because it was a beautiful day and we wanted to be outside, so we went to Stanley Park and walked along the seawall.  Then we stopped at Vera's Burger Shack for yummy hamburgers (voted the best burgers in Vancouver for many years) for lunch.  From there we drove to Burnaby Mountain to see a great view of the city and surrounding area. Checked out the Metro town & then  found some funky boutiques in Kitsilano &  stopped at the beach there. Great city, great views, need to come back and stay longer.

title: A nice big city.
reviews: We visited with our teenagers and it was nice.  There's shopping on Robson.  It reminded us of San Francisco.  It's like any other big city except it's cleaner and that's why I gave it 4 stars.  Dining options are limited when you have youngsters.  I'm not a city vacationer, I'd rather be in the mountains or on the beach.

title: Gastown
reviews: We enjoyed another stroll down through Gastown checking out the local stores and the micro-brewery at the Landing.  Best location for souvenirs (better than the Robson street shops for souvenirs).

title: Let's just say I'm poor now!
reviews: It's always worth having a wander through the streets to see what's available.  Recommend a Big Bus tour so you can get a feel for the area.  La Vie en Rose (lingerie) left me poor!

title: Small and big combined
reviews: The downtown core keeps getting bigger, it seems; every time we go there, there are new buildings, and things are stretching out. But it's still manageable and a nice, paced walk can get you from the waterfront to the museum without too much work. Lots of shops, with good shopping, and a great mix of restaurants. Impact of Asia is clear, making food selection more fun. It really is a walking kind of city, looking more like Hong Kong all the time.

title: Saturday night on Granville Street
reviews: The city closes Granville street off to auto traffic on weekends and opens it to a young crowd.  During the day there are interesting street performers.  Saturday night has a large crowd of mostly young partiers.  There are a lot of homeless in the area, but the police keep them off of Granville Street.

title: World class downtown, Vancouver, BC
reviews: First and foremost, this is a pedestrian's center. Colorful food trucks can be found providing tasty eclectic fast food and serve as points of congregation for downtown tourists and workers. The mix of businesses from book stores to churches to boutiques to eateries to drugstores, etc., is amazing and stimulating. The streets are safe, clean and inviting. They are very walkable in the best sense. This is a very densely populated area because people live here. Many businesses are open until late and there are people on the streets and shops until all hours. Finally there's a great downtown supermarket that is a tourist site in and of itself! I love St. Andrews' Jazz Vespers Sunday service. I hope to live here someday as an expat American.

title: Beautiful streets but too many starbucks
reviews: Beautiful leafy streets with trees lining the side walk and quaint street lights. In some places there are also beautiful views of the harbour. Everything is within walking distance and its very safe. One criticism-decent coffee incredibly hard to come by. Starbucks is everywhere, as well as the canadian copy-cats Beanz, Jay Jays, Tim Hortons etc who all seems to think adding ridiculous amounts of sugar is is an adequate substitute for drinkable coffee. Best to ask a local who has standards where to find real coffee.

title: See and be seen
reviews: Easy walking to many restaurants, pubs, shops. Great people watching from all over the world. Very easy to ride clean, helpful buses.

title: Great city
reviews: The city had many lively bars and resteraunts. Granville street was superb on the saturday night we were there - people were generally very friendly, the beggars that were about did not harass you, food and drink quite expensive but you are in a city. Gastown, Chinatown are both worth a visit, my wife loved the shops in all these areas.

title: Friendly and Vibrant
reviews: Paris, London, Montreal, Buenos Aires, Vancouver - Need I say more?  Canadians know how to build a city that feels like you belong there.  The food is awesome, the sights are spectacular and the people are the friendliest I have met anywhere.  Go and love it!!

title: Great atmosphere
reviews: Everything is so laid back, nice atmosphere, lots of shops, nightlife, but also fab library, impressive art gallery and on the Sunday we were there they had closed off a section of Granville street and had dancing in the streets! Plus free dance lessons near the art gallery, just watching it all puts a smile on your face!

title: Lots to do
reviews: Weather your a foodie, a shopper or just like to see amazing buildings, Downtown Vancouver has it all.

title: beautiful Canada
reviews: shopping and the politeness of the canadian people.we were in canada on canada day ive never seen so many people all enjoying themselves they love the Aussie accent which to us we didnt have one but they say we did , but we loved theirs as well, so very friendly had a wonderful 18 days around vancouver and Kelowna.

title: Enjoyed downtown Vancouver
reviews: I love Vancouver. It has a lot of excellent restaurants, great shopping wide clean streets and wonderful people

title: The shine is gone
reviews: We love Vancouver and have traveled there often over the years.  This trip was disappointing in that downtown has really lost its shine.  Robson street looks in need of face lift and the entire downtown area was dirty.  Vancouver is still one of the great cities of North American but this downtown needs at lift.

title: Busy downtown
reviews: We did a walking tour on Granville - the sidewalks were busy with people and the shops open.  Had a nice time.

title: Yeah!
reviews: A great city! Don't come to Vancouver for shopping but for great views, beaches, mountains, restaurants and very friendly people.

title: Cozy
reviews: The downtown area is very fun to walk there. There are many shops, both touristy and local, that one can walk into and enjoy. The people are very welcoming, and the steaming clock makes it an even better attraction!

title: Interesting people
reviews: I must say that we go right downtown where all the action takes place.  We love meeting the homeless, addicts, punks, street entertainers, and everything else it has to offer.  It's a highlight of our visit.  We stay right in the heart of it all.

title: Exciting and unique
reviews: Vibrant, exciting, alive and interesting city. Lots of culture, great restaurants, wonderful neighborhoods, art, sport, outdoors...

title: Easy to walk
reviews: Vancouver's a lovely city that's easy to get around both walking and driving.  Gastown is a wonderful area (just stay clear of East Hastings).  Very cool to see the Olympic torches beside Canada Place.  Plenty of places to eat....and I mean plenty!Couple of knocks.....it's an expensive city.  It also has more (way more) than it's share of beggers.

title: Great sights!
reviews: Beautiful town. Well manicured lawns with beautiful scenery.  We toured the town by bus and visited the castle.  Took numerous pictures.  Careful, they only give change in Canadian currency and not American.

title: Tons to do
reviews: Great city the people are so nice and helpful, very store you can imagine. Very clean city, able to walk everywhere.  Tons of coffee houses and restaurant carts, japadog and tocofina are must do's.  Many different areas and choices.  No car needed.

title: Shop -Shop
reviews: We were on the trolly and saw their Rodeo Drive. Lots of little interesting shops. Loads of stores to buy souvenirs in. Such a quaint little town.

title: Great Walking Town
reviews: Just grab a map and start walking.  Ask your waiter or waitress or stop in local businesses and ask what they recommend to see. You can't go wrong.  It's a small town and you can cover a lot of the downtown in one day.

title: Beautiful place
reviews: Vancouver's downtown is a great, compact place to spend a day walking around in. Even Gastown, which apparently has some seedy pockets, cleans up nicely.

title: A clean walkable city
reviews: We enjoyed walking and using the hop on, hop off bus to see most of the city in a day.  Many wonderful restaurants and shops to visit. Wish we had more time to spend Vancouver is worth the trip.

title: Typical North American City
reviews: OK got everything you need, but very typical of any other north american city, a bit cultureless and planned compared to European cites.   No bad as a city but the rest of canada really puts it to shame

title: vancouver
reviews: Beautiful city but railroad lines and tourist boats prevent pedestrian access to waterfront. Beyond city , vistas are spectacular. Visit Whistler area. If you drive, the vistas are great.

title: way too busy
reviews: I hated it down town with a large family of 6. I had 4 small children and did not feel safe. Honestly they could use police on foot on their streets not just in cars. I thought it was hard to park a really your only way to get around is by foot. I would not go back.

title: I can understand why it is ranked as the best city to live in...
reviews: i visited Vancouver many times, but i never really hang around in the downtown area.   In getting the SkyTrain ride experience, i sort of visited Vancouver downtown just for the sake of making a longer trip out of the SkyTrain visit.   I find that Vancouver city is no different from any North American city, but it is indeed one of the best urban planned city in the world.    the Robson street is a decent shopping street, but if you are hard core shoppers, you are better off visiting Toronto.    I dare to say that it would take at best 3-4 hours to check out the whole Vancouver downtown.  On the other hand, it is notable to indicate that i can understand why Vancouver is annually rated as one of the best city to live in because the downtown is not just a business town, but also a residential one.  Many people actually live in the condos in the downtown area.   I am much impressed by the urban planning however---there are not just bike lanes, but curbs and flower planters next to the bike lanes to separate the cars from the bikers.   it is a very avantgarde urban approach to encouraging more cycling and less driving.   I have to give Vancouver the credit for making their city cleverly green.

title: Visitor friendly
reviews: We found downtown to be clean, great to walk around, easy to get everywhere.  Pedestrian  and cyclist friendly.

title: Vancouver -- great city to visit
reviews: Very clean, green and superb urban design!  Easy to get around, the SkyTrain is great, and even though a big city, it doesn't have that congested, crowded feel.

title: Vancouver
reviews: Just back from a visit to this delightful city.There are many ways to get around this city from cycling ,walking to water taxis. It is a very vibrant city and has plenty to do .A visit to all the tourist hot spots is a must ,but if you get the chance there a many beautiful attractions out side the city .Vandusen Gardens and Queen Elizabeth gardens are just out side the city or a hour by bus will take you to Deep Cove.Public transport is reasonable and the city is well serviced. There is even a sky train service which is fast and effective.The city is full of restaurants which server food until late evening.There are also a large variety of cafe in the city .On the plus side this city is full of life and enjoyment and everyone feels happy and relaxed.On the minus side if is a little expensive and  tipping is a way of life.However all the pluses of this city out weigh the minuses .We had a delightful time in Vancouver and planning another visit.

title: Great for shopping, eating and drinking
reviews: Visit Grannville Island, Gas town, China town (but take a taxi) Granville Island is cool but the market is expensive. im from Scotland, and a Scotch pie costs about a quid. There it costs about a fiver!! and $9 for a pork pie!! The Keg is well worth a visit.

title: Shopping
reviews: Lots of shops, large and small.Leave plenty of time, as there is always one more to go into!!

title: Great City Planning
reviews: So much to do, so vibrant and just georgeous! Close to shops, art gallery, water and parks. Beautiful!

title: A glowing Cityscape
reviews: This is an amazing City of contrasts.........fantastic shops and a vast array of restaurants and galleries. Robson being the best but Granville comes a close second. It beats almost any other modern City I have seen and when the sun shines it has an amazing backdrop of mountains and ocean. Go see the Cruise ships departing at 6.00 pm in summer...a fabulous sight in an amazing setting.

title: Going Downtown
reviews: The city was really clean. We took public buses and walked around a lot. I spotted an usual statue of the Chinese zodiac which I found quite fascinating. We stopped in at the tourist office and found people helpful in recommending a tour since we only had one day in the City.Thus the On/Off bus.

title: Don't wander into the wrong area of downtown
reviews: We liked Gastown but we wandered a few streets out of the area and found ourselves in a very dodgy area with groups of drug dealers on street corners, felt quite unnerved, and we were guided out of the area by an undercover female police officer!   Stick to the tourist precinct area.

title: Busy and crowded
reviews: If you hate traffic but love to shop then downtown Vancouver is for you. There is something for everyone here. One day isn't enough to shop around this city, too much to see!

title: very busy with lots of people
reviews: great shopping and restaurants! felt safe great way to walk around and see so much

title: OK
reviews: Some streets and restaurants have a European character, but overall to a city hasn't much to offer for tourists...

title: Great
reviews: Lots of restuarants.  Nice walking path along the waterfront

title: Walking Distance and Great
reviews: Getting around down town Vancouver is easy as anything. It is very walkable, and very interesting and just about everything you could want to see or buy is there. Canada Place is brilliant, it is a wonderful space and clearly well-loved by Vancouverians. Gastown is a blast, it is the old area and full of fascinating and lovely things to see and do. great food is everywhere, street food is wonderful and restaurants/cafes are reasonable and high quality. the greenery around lends the whole area a calm and pleasant aspect, and makes it a pleasure to stroll.

title: Great city!
reviews: We stayed in Vancouver during the Jazz Festival, lots of concerts and great music.   Shopping is good too!    Vancouver feels very safe and is clean.    Watching the cruise ships cone and go is interesting.

title: Lots going on
