reviews: Visited the Art Gallery, which was very nice, and had lunch on the patio overlooking Robson square.

title: Loved it!
reviews: Vancouver has a gorgeous downtown.  It is easy to navigate and the shopping is amazing.  We loved just walking around and exploring what the city has to offer.

title: Trip to Canada
reviews: The water front is great if you want to watch the sun set. But with so many people smoking it smells like an ashtray. Also, garbage is everywhere. People do not pick up after themselves.

title: Vancouver town.
reviews: So much improvement and change in Vancouver over 30 years - check out Yale Town, South Granville and some of the other "community areas".   Still a great place with lovely areas views and a decent transit system, lots to do and lots of shopping.

title: Convenient
reviews: A convenient destination as there is plenty in walking distance

title: Cool
reviews: Vancouver downtown is really nice. They have many great things to see. At night watch out for those wanna be skin-heads but they are a bunch of cowards with no bark.

title: An enjoyable evening activity
reviews: One evening we took the bus from our hotel in Burnaby to downtown Vancouver.  We thought it would save us the hassle of finding and paying for parking.  It was a relaxing evening activity and we felt we could better experience the city by just walking around the downtown area.  The weather was cool but comfortable.  Vancouver is a beautiful city and best enjoyed by walking.

title: Clean, safe and very special
reviews: Downtown Vancouver shows why living stndards in this country is so high. An ethnic mix that works, 30% come from the orient and most workers seem to come from other cities in Canada.

title: Pretty cool
reviews: Chinatown and Gastown the best. Followed by Granville Island and Stanley Park

title: Robson Street, Chinatown, Gastown
reviews: A must see for everyone visiting this amazing city. Chinatown and parts of Gastown are not recommended after dark, but are fun.  Also, be sure to see the Chinese Gardens - beautiful!

title: study
reviews: study.I lived in Vancouver for more than one year.

title: Great city
reviews: Very walkable and well laid out. Loved the Gastown area for food and drinks.

title: Love Downtown
reviews: I love shopping downtown and dining in oen of the wonderful restaurants.  Recently ate at the Black Bull on Alberni Street.....terrific.

title: Very clean and pretty City
reviews: Vancouver is a beautiful City espacially the backdrop of the Mountains over the bay.

title: Beautiful, busy and crowded
reviews: Always alive Robson 'Strasse' is the center of it, variety of shops and restaurants, turists from everywhere in the world, bus and sky train access, etc. From Robson the best way to continue is Denman (to the West End), which will bring you to the English Bay, one of the most beautiful walking/resting area. The numerous palmtrees give the waterfront a tropical look; In all - one of the best sites in the world.

title: clean, busy, great archictecture, library and art museum
reviews: liked thearchicture, gastown and the vibe wa upbeat at this time. music in the street at gastown.

title: Clean, pleasant, walk anywhere/everywhere
reviews: Love Vancouver! Our second time there. You can walk to everything (actually you HAVE to walk because there's no parking) or take the transit. Start with Gastown, kind of touristy (caters to the cruise ships I imagine) but a very nice hour or so...get a beer at Steamworks. Walk down to the water. Hundreds of great restaurants within blocks, good art galleries, CLEAN! There seems to be more homeless begging than our last visit. The parks...so lovely and used by the residents. Watch out for all the bicyclers if you're driving.

title: City of Glass
reviews: Such a beautiful City. Sky scrappers of Glass but the City has not allowed itself to become a concrete jungle and has ensured that there are a lot of trees as part of its design

title: The best downtown ever been in
reviews: My gf and I are actually still here. We are staying at the Hyatt downtown which is in the center of everything. Vancouver downtown has everything to offer mall, stores, gift shops, and all kind of restaurant- you name it. Make sure you walk down Robson street. It has all the stores and restaurants. It's fun to sit in a restaurant and do lil people watching. Everything is here in downtown Vancouver. We always feel safe here and everything here is so pretty. Temperature is perfect in July! love it.

title: Pedestrian friendly, include Chinatown, Gastown, and new library in your walks.
reviews: Use a transport pass to get around (a great value for a great bus system).  Worth a day or two before your cruise or onward journey.

title: One of the nicest...
reviews: Where you can enjoy a green downtown with some heritage houses/buildings, parks, an ocean bay and view of the mountains where you can ski...

title: busy and buzzy
reviews: always felt safe, clean, very green (loads of trees etc).

title: Awesome
reviews: Great diversity.  I walked into a button shop that knocked my socks off, had a fantastic lunch in Gastown, took a "hop on, hop off" bus, drooled at the "public market", walked down Robson street and dined at a great Italian restaurant recommended by our bus driver. I also walked into a resale shop that catered to transvestites...a fun and unusual experience for me.

title: Nice city but expensive!
reviews: Very nice city, but you have to look hard to get anything here at a reasonable price. Supermarkets in the downtown area seem or are scarce if you're walking up from the walking up from the Waterfront end. There is good traffic control, and they have the utmost care for pedestrians and/or handicapped individuals. Make sure and walk around with a coat or umbrella, because the skies seem to burst open at a moments notice. Public transportation is pretty easy to get, but make sure you have coins if you're taking up the buses at the stops around the city. You can get a pass at the train station and a few many other places. Eats are great here, but expensive again. There are some bargain places though, you just have to look hard for them. Nice architectural buildings at the center of downtown (Fairmont Hotel).Will be back someday.

title: What a sight!
reviews: It took 2 hours to walk around the entire park.  Next time, I would not walk the entire park.  Our feet did not appreciate it since it was flat!

title: Local Artisans
reviews: A funky area with a large selection of shops featuring local artisans.  A nice place for lunch with views of the city

title: changes
reviews: Went to main terminus to get weekly bus pass, system changed.Had to get directions to Visitor Centre from security guard.Didn't like the persistent street hawkers selling tours.Once located VC was informative and v good.Steamworks great as always.Gastown delivered gift ideas.Chinatown delivered gift ideas.Visited free gardens, sad to see cost of admission to other one.Bus service great as always, drivers helpful even if not going our way.

title: Downtown Vancouver - Gastown
reviews: Trendy area for shopping and food. We ate at the Steamworks Brewery. Delicious food and lots of it. Hubby liked the beer. Walked around the shops in Gastown and looked at the steam clock.

title: Great medium city
reviews: This is a great pedestrian friendly city many small enclaves with distinctly different character

title: A great place
reviews: We could not believe how great the nightlife was. So much to see and do. Good food everywhere. It seems nobody goes to bed until 3 in the morning. Fantastic.

title: SUCH AN AMAZING CITY!!!
reviews: I want to move here. That sums it up. It's clean, friendly and full of international people. I'm sure it has its share of problems like any city, but I fell in love with Vancouver's downtown. Very cosmopolitan, multinational and youthful. I will be back very soon!

title: Typical
reviews: Typical shops and a lot of homeless harassing patrons in and near Gastown

title: City
reviews: Nice restaurants. Clean. Lots to do. Enjoyed Cin Cin.

title: A little bit of everything
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has some really nice areas for shopping and strolling and catching a bite to eat. Like any large city, though, there are also some areas that aren't so great. Just do your research before you visit, so you know which specific areas appeal to you and which ones don't, in order to make the most of your time in Vancouver. When you're ready for a break from the crowds, you can head down to Canada Place by the water and watch the boats and sea planes (and maybe even a cruise ship) come and go. The mountains and water create a beautiful backdrop for this interesting city.

title: waterfront walk
reviews: spectacular waterfront walking and biking paths 3 blocks from hotel

title: Basically a city...
reviews: easy walking, but basically  a city. People are VERY friendly and helpful.

title: Nice Scenic Area !
reviews: The streets are narrow but have large pavements for pedestrians to walk and enjoy the scenic beauty of the flower pots adorning the street lamp posts and do brisk shopping and satisfy the appetite at various restaurants around ! The skyscrapers reminded us the modern world as well !

title: Gastown is GREAT
reviews: Great shopping and fantastic restaurants! It is one of the cleanest cities I have ever been to.

title: One of the best Cities compared to US cities
reviews: I thought this city was better than most US cities.  The people were much more friendly,  you felt safe at all hours even with the hobos on the streets compared to US cities. I was worried about the homeless but they were respectfull and courteous when encountered.  There is so much culture and so many things to see.  Lots of nightlife We used the city transit system, Trolley and feet to tour the city.  It is light from about 5-6 in the morning to 9-10 at night.  The city is well laid out and streets spacious.  One bad thing about Vancouver is the price of everything.  If you are from the US be prepared to spend.

title: Beautiful
reviews: couple of streets in any downtown are always weird but overall very nice.china downtown seemed much better than the one at Fan Francisco!

title: Fab city
reviews: Had high expectations and was not disappointed. Very clean friendly and easy to walk everywhere. Good shopping.

title: Where rich and poor mix.
reviews: My wife's first trip to Vancouver and we noted that this is an expensive city to live in. The contrast between rich and poor is most evident in this part of the city and it seemed most ironic that the poor, begging, were in general far more polite than the rich with their designer outfits and super slim smart phones. It could have been, of course, the rich just didn't like tourists in their City? Regardless a great place to amble although it does not have the buzz of some of the larger American (US) cities.

title: nice city experience
reviews: Really enjoyed seeing the former site of the Olympic flame.Great shopping and restaurants.

title: I LIVE HERE!
reviews: I like alot of the city walks and trails, especially for riding my city cruiser bike. I don't like all the rain, all the time....I think we get 89 days without any percepitation a year, I heard on radio. Anyway, there are alot of coffee/tea houses to enjoy and wonderful multicultural food. Prices for touring venues are very expensive though.

title: downtown treat
reviews: the place to be but it was good plenty of space no one pushing and shuving like oxford street

title: Very ecclectic.
reviews: We felt very safe at all hours.  There are a couple of areas that are seedy, but like most places, politely, keep to yourself and its all good. The main street in gas town was quaint.  Granville street was alive.  There are lots of healthy choices for restaurants, pubs, ethnic food. The Stackhouse has great hamburgers!  Everything is easy here; transportation, dining, shopping.

title: Interesting and some decent shopping
reviews: I live here, so I am biased, but downtown is very interesting with a great Art Gallery, new library, two really lovely and venerable cathedrals, quite good shopping, and just a short cab or bus ride to Stanley Park

title: Very Nice Downtown
reviews: It is clean and everything is within walking distance.

title: Vancouver in June
reviews: Weather was variable, very sunny then rain.  Very easy to find our way around, very sociable friendly people.  There was a Jazz festival on during our stay so music in the streets.

title: Wonderfully beautiful!
reviews: Clean, and beautiful! Lovely view of ocean on all sides as well as north shore mountains.  Very clean, not too busy like most major metropolous areas. Canadians are very kind and helpful and the city is not too big so you can walk everywhere!  Lovely parks to walk in and the sea wall in stanley park is a must!

title: really great urban setting
reviews: Vancouver downtown is truly a beautiful city.  It has everything a city should offer in a mountainous setting. Absolutely worth strolling and exploring or doing a tour bus hop on-hop off.  They also have a China town, a large market, a fantastic harbor with water taxis that can help you cut down on travel time.

title: A Great and Safe Place to Walk
reviews: Any time that we are in Downtown Vancouver we make a point of walking through the bustling streets to enjoy the feeling of being in a busy city. Our favourite walk is a big square consisting of Robson St, Denman St, Davie St, and Burrard, St. Go in either direction and on either side of the street and you will get a great sense of downtown Vancouver. There are lots of shops, restaurants, boutique hotels, and a variety of old and new buildings. Lot to look at but the most enjoyable part is the people watching as you walk these 4 streets. And remember your presence adds to the ambience.

title: Concentrated ACTION.... clean green & walkabilly
reviews: Not your average B I G city...Vancouver has a small city centre as it's surrounded by water, so the CBD is easily walkable. 30-50 story buildings with little parks & one BIG mama park called STANLEY, named after Queen Victoria's favourite nephew apparently. (same one who's name adorns the HOCKEY trophy). Vancouver has plenty of small eateries & coffee culture is alive & well. Shopping is underground & above.. it's everywhere..watch for the ADDED 12% tax!..Transit in & out is good with buses & a toy train called 'Skytrain'..'toy' because it's a narrow guage track with little cars by big city standards. Safe streets make for great walkabilly experience...have a brolly handy coz rain is inevitable..if you can't see the Northshore mountains it's because it is.... if you CAN, it will rain SOON" say the locals.

title: Similar to San francisco. Just cleaner and greener
reviews: Everything is close by.  Easy walk.  There are things for families with any age, single or couples, etc...you can shop, you can be part of nature at Stanley park ( where can you find a park with part oceanic and part forestry), you can eat til you drop.  Friendly people who seem to appreciate tourists and recent them.  Vancouver is great, rain or shine.

title: A great walking city where everything is nearby
reviews: We enjoy visiting Vancouver because it's a compact city were everything is an easy walk to get to. Chinatown, Gastown, W. Georgia St., Robson St. are some of the interesting places to visit and and just walk around. We like going down to the harbor area at the end of Thurlow St and watching the float planes takeoff and land on the water. There are many good web sites to visit to get really good information and insight on places to visit and see in Vancouver.

title: The Flower Cart Lady
reviews: Vancouver has many flower carts located at various intersections in the downtown core.  One particular cart, is managed by Josie on the corner of Georgia and Granville.  She is there, rain or shine and I have bought bouquets many times from Josie.  She remembers the people she has sold to and does a great job!  The flowers are always fresh from the flower auction.  Prices are very reasonable!

title: Fell In Love
reviews: My Husband and I travelled to Vancouver for a week of vacation.  It was his year to pick the location for our trip and I have to admit that I was not sure if I wanted a cool climate vacation. This city has alot to offer and I am so glad that we had a chance to visit it.  We used the Canada Line to get to the downtown area from the airport and it was a breeze! We started our stay off with a trip to the Out Look and really enjoyed the 360 views.  You could see the areas of town that you planned on visiting and determine how far away they were.  You have access to the sea, mountains, beaches, parks, shopping, art and wonderful food. Most people experience Vancouver as a port to catch a cruise, but do yourself a favor and stay for awhile and it is truely a wonderful city.  The people that live in Vancouver seem to be really a happy lot and greet you warmly!

title: Tons to see and do in this beautiful city!
reviews: You'll never get bored in downtown Vancouver.  Check out Granville street for clubs and bars, Robson for shopping and Gastown for pubs.  English bay is a great place to watch the sunset.

title: Vancouver by the on and off tour bus
reviews: If you want a good look at the city.  Try the Hop on and off tour bus.  Picked it up outside our hotel.  $38 for about a 2 day pass.  DOwntown was active in all parts on a Monday.  Clean and friendly folks.  Chinatown was like San Francisco with the open air markets.  Plenty of fresh fish and plenty of the dried stuff as well.  Gastown was interesting to walk through. Stopped and had a beer at the Blarney Stone Pub just down the street from a street flea market on Sunday. Interesting group of merchants.  Didn't get to see Granville Island.  BC liquors for anyone in need of some spirits to take back home, but if you're flying, wait until you get to the duty free at the airport.  I could have saved about $15 on a bottle of scotch.  Beautiful city.

title: Vancouver BC The most beautiful City
reviews: Vancouver has everything to offer, beautiful ocean and mountain view. Everyone should take the Seabus and the Tour boats to appreciate the views. Close to Stanley Park where the Aquarium is located. Robson Street is a great place for those who want to spend a lot of money or for the young ones. There is a selection of restaurants. If you like Japanese food, there are many restaurants, also steak house restaurants, italian restaurants, just ask your hotel where to find them.

title: Great City
reviews: Seventh visit to Vancouver and never get tired of walking the Downtown area.  Great restraunts, beautiful views, clean.

title: The Good, The Bad and The Ugly
reviews: I saw it all here, but on the whole, I came away liking the city more than I thought I would. Canada Place, the waterfronts, Gastown, Chinatown were all quite enjoyable. On the flip side, I saw way too many hyperactive and loud strung-out drug addicts walking around, mostly but not only in the famous "downtown east side" although I can't say I ever felt threatened (was only out in daylight). It was an enjoyable and recommended trip.

title: lively place
reviews: Lively place on a night. Lots of good eating and drinking places to visit. Plenty of people around at the weekend and nightime. Good transport links to get around

title: Great Places to Eat and Shop
reviews: Fabulous shopping on Alberni and Burrard, Lots of places to eat or stop for a coffee and all close to the downtown hotels too

title: What every downtown ought to be.
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is fairly compact, but holds a wide variety of sights and points of interest.  It's also very transit and bike accessible.

title: Beautiful Urban Feel with trees
reviews: Vancouver has a unique blend of high rise buildings and gorgeous tall leafy trees. This is the sort of city you want to live in! And so many smart european cars wizzing by. It is clean and exudes a fast paced vibe however short distances take you into gorgeous havens very quickly like Granville Island and Stanley Park. Would love to go back...

title: full of energy and entertaiment
reviews: good shopping and a fun place to walk around and explore

title: Money saving tips
reviews: We loved downtown - we stayed right in the middle on Robson.  Vancouver can be expensive and one great money saver was the Entertainment book.  We used it for sightseeing and restaurants.  We easily saved a couple hundred dollars in a week.  We did not have a car and, at first, found the bus system a bit intimidating.  But we learned if we called the phone number on the bus sign they would route us wherever we needed to go!  This saved us a lot on car rental, taxis and parking.  We also signed up for Verizon's plus Canada plan.  You can sign up for a week, or however long you will be in Canada.  It costs about 50 cents a day ($15 for the month) and you remove it when you get back.  It really relieves the stress knowing you can call freely both within Canada and back to the US.  Also, friends and family can reach you.

title: What contrast!
reviews: This place is a start contrast to the east side of town that we left behind when we drove into Vancouver. The place is spotless, clean, beautiful women, and the bustling venues.There are tons of restaurants everywhere, and a great harbour front. There was a huge cruise liner docked there, forgot what it was called. There are tons of small stores that line the streets of downtown Vancouver, and the best part is, all of them are privately owned and operated. Same idea with the restaurants, more and more we walked and saw that this city was definitely up to par when it is considered as the best place to live on earth.However, it is a far cry from the east side of town, where we saw a lot of things that are hard to discuss here. We did have our Grand Caravan broken into and some stuff stolen as well, but I guess that is just bad luck! Nevertheless, this is one beautiful city.Will always love you Vancouver! :)

title: Robsonstrasse is overrated! Stores are leaving.
reviews: Check out Chinatown and Gastown instead.   Make sure you have lunch at the top of Vancouver - the old Sears tower (their seafood chowder is excellent!! and if you go up to the restaurant instead of just the viewing deck - the trip up is free as long as you buy lunch!  A bowl of soup is $12 but at least you get to see the view sitting down in comfort instead of paying a little more and just walking around the viewing area)  Downside: there is no plaques in the restaurant to point out the interesting buildings....oh well.

title: Good visit to Downtown
reviews: We walked around downtown in a pleasant and safe. Robson Avenue is very vibrant. We noticed homeless people asking for money, but not aggressive. We knew that because of winter they seek places like Vancouver to be less hard to survive the season

title: Love this place!
reviews: Great shopping & restaurants - everything to keep one satisfied.

title: Striking city with a relaxed pace of life
reviews: This is a great city with a relaxed vibe about it. There seems to be an abundance of sites to see and things to do with some fabulous eateries jotted around. I recommend the sushi!

title: Well manicured town
reviews: The town is very clean...During our tour, we learned that they close off a portion for all the younger crowd which frequent the bars until 4am!

title: Shop till you drop
reviews: Upmarket shops, quirky independent shops and native craft shops mingle with nice bars, cafes and restaurants. Many of which are not on Tripadvisor. However, note that this is one of the most expensive cities I have visited.

title: A great city to visit.
reviews: Vancouver is relaxing and the people are friendly. The atomosphere is always bright and it has excellent dinning restaurants.

title: a little boring
reviews: the weather did not help, but i did not think downtown was very charming. Thought the other side of the water (Granville and Kitsilano) were much nicer

title: Vibrant town
reviews: It reminded me of NYC but NYC is mainly concrete.  Vancouver is adorned in plants, flowers, and hanging baskets.  Gastown, China town are close to each other.  We enjoyed the city.You can go to  the Cipliano Suspension Bridge, but my husband was afraid of heights. Many places to eat.  Enljoy the town

title: Good shopping
reviews: A good array of shops and bars, although not cheap

title: nine neighborhood to walk
reviews: multitude shops (and coffee shops) around, nice to see many people on the street later at night

title: Get a map and go
reviews: Nice place to explore, I did not have time to go to most attractions but hit Stanley Park and downtown Vancouver. There is public transportation (buses, sky train, taxis) all around the city. Safe place to walk. It is expensive so bring money.

title: Good visits...
reviews: It has gotten a lot better than previous decade or so.  A lot of establishments have come and gone and new ones making a splash.  Puny downtown.  Not as exciting as England's downtown.

title: Worth seeing everything in Downtown
reviews: We stayed at the Bestwestern Downtown Plus 718 Drake (Great Hotel to stay in), and it is so conveniently located, that we walked all over Downtown Vancouver, even though the hotel has a one way shuttle. Must visit Christ Church Cathedral.

title: Lively and fun
reviews: Plenty of interesting areas to explore, a great blend of cultural experiences, shops, bars and restaurants.

title: Gas Town
reviews: Well worth a walk down through here!  Some great eateries and souvenir Shopsplus of course the Gas Clock

title: Nice walk
reviews: We walked a little too far and ended up in crack town, a little scary bt we just kept walking and arrived safe at our destination.

title: Vancouver
reviews: An amazingly diverse city - almost like being in New York City.  Lots to see and do - very beautiful city

title: shopping
reviews: great for shopping, entertainment, people watching and who doesn't admire those magnificent mountains!

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: We enjoyed the restaurants by the water. All the homeless people were a bit hard to get used to as you went towards gas town.

title: Too many drunks and homeless
reviews: Vancouver has a real problem with drunks and homeless congregating on E Hastings street downtown. Shops are closing down as people just don't want to go through there. It borders Gastown so they're beginning to spread there also. Didn't like being approached for money by beggars and some would feel unsafe/uncomfortable in this area.

title: So pretty; so diverse!
reviews: The diversity in population, architecture, and attitude is most attractive to me in this one-of-a-kind convergence of interest in one unique location: Vancouver. It has long been calling me to get to know it a bit better, so on this trip, we took 6 days to explore.....Wow; what a treat!

title: Great city
reviews: If you ever have the chance to visit British Columbia, make it a point to stop in Vancouver and head downtown. Vancouver is a beautiful city, lots of glass buildings, countless greens spaces scattered throughout the city...even on the rooftops! If you're into architecture, you'll see many old buildings that add charm and character of the city. Urbanists put a lot of thought in this one and it shows. We also found locals to be very friendly and polite. You can't help but feel like home in no time. Trivia:For all of you Smallville fans, many buildings in Vancouver have been used for exterior shots. The Marine Building (on Burrard street) is the famous Daily Planet tower. The building next to it (Government of Canada offices I believe) is Luthorcorp Plaza. A couple of blocks away you will find Oliver Queen's Clock Tower (Vancouver Block on Granville street) and a little north, the Sun tower (on Pender street) formally known as the Watchtower building in Smallville.

title: Great Place
reviews: So much to do and see in this area.  Many restaurants in "Yaletown" to choose from as well as bars.  Shopping at Pacific Center really good too.  Transit system of buses works great.

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: Met some very nice people.  Has interesting history.  Enjoyed the diversity of people and landscape, and even of weather(hail, downpour and shining sun all in a short period of time) I would definitely go back.  Stanley park alone is worth the trip.  Didn't like the Hong Kong like feel with all the tall skyscrapers. Expensive, although perhaps I just didn't know where to go for the good deals.  Met a larger than usual number of aggressive pan handlers, I may have been more sensitive than usual due to being with my elderly mother on this trip.  Nice place, but some drawbacks

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: Nothing not to like......great food, shopping, the people are so friendly, accommodating and helpful. Been many times and never tire of this city!

title: Great walking area
reviews: Relaxed and architecturally the most interesting city in North America.

title: Shops galore
reviews: Great place to do some shopping, but the extra government taxes added to the cost of almost everything !

title: Gastown is great
reviews: Lots of slightly wierd shops, coffee shops etc. well worh a visit.

title: Great Shopping
reviews: Great shopping, so many shops for the young & mature. Stores open until 9pm on Saturdays and lots of people shopping.

title: Very visitor friendly
reviews: This was our second visit to Vancouver and we do consider this city as one of the most beautiful in the world ( we have visited over 600 in 89 countries ) . It is not too big yet large enough to find anything you want in a city !  This time around , we did not have much time to wander around so we followed one of Frommer's walking tours that we downloaded from the Net and spent 3 hours on a beautiful Sunday afternoon visiting the chore of Vancouver ! We had seen the likes of Rio , Barcelona , Kyoto , Chicago and Seattle on the same trip and consider Vancouver on the same level  of urban attractiveness even though smaller , but having the advantage of Nature closeby

title: So Scenic!
reviews: We thoroughly enjoyed walking on the waterfront of this lovely city.

title: Caffeine on Every Corner
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a collection of high rises separated by coffee shops. You will never be more than 1 or 2 blocks from a Starbucks or a Blendz (Canada's version of Starbucks). While the downtown is clean and feels safe, there isn't much to do unless you go to Canada Place, Gas Town, or China Town. A word of caution, the pan handlers are numerous and extremely  aggressive in the area between Canada Place and Gas Town.

title: Bustling downtown Vancouver
reviews: Where everyone in the city seams to congregate and relax,bustling  and vibrant.A must see, the bronze giant sized laughing figures,which must be in every ones photo album great fun.

title: great stroll by the water
reviews: From Cardero Park to Port Side Park. What a great walk!  Great photo ops along the way.  And Vancouver is so clean!!

title: Diversified neighbourhoods and good shopping
reviews: Vancouver is a great walking city - its very walk-able and has many different neighbourhoods - each a little different and the views are spectacular - mountains and sea! Sites are accessible and there's good shopping and food!

title: Clean!
reviews: Vancouver was am amazing city! I would move there if I could! The city is extremely clean. The people are friendly and the views are spectacular everywhere you go. They have coffee on every corner and the buildings are breathtaking. There are great walking trails everywhere that take you to the seawalls and into the marina. Definitely visit Vancouver!

title: LEARN RUSH HOUR RULES
reviews: I loved Vancouver and the different sections of the city.It is a vibrant and alive city but you must be aware of the time restrcted rules dealing with rush hour traffic.It involves no left hand turns during peak times if you are not aware of this you will get frustrated if you are driving best suggestion is use the Hop on Hop off buses this gives you a chance to get a quick overview of the city and go back to more interesting place

title: Reminded me of Manhetten
reviews: We took a long walk thought downtown,tall , glassed buildings .Nice promenade near Vancouver port, Chinatown adjacent .

title: Gastown interesting to walk round
reviews: We enjoyed walking round Gas Town and seeing the Steam Clock. We ate at the SPaghetti House and found it good value. We also found the trip up the Vancouver lookout very interesting and it let you get a feel for the city. We made 2 trips up in the same day (day and evening) as the ticket was an all day one.

title: I'm not a 'city' person but LOVE Vancouver Downtown.
reviews: We recently visited Canada from Australia and used Vancouver as our base between driving through the Rockies, cruising up the Inside Passage and popping down to Seattle for a couple of days. All-in-all we stayed in Vancouver on 3 occasions.Each time we walked and/or got the bus into Downtown. I loved Downtown. It is pleasant, easy to get around...walking is a pleasure and public transport is regular and prolific.There are a number of areas that homeless and disadvantaged people tend to congregate in the city. We did not feel unsafe although,as a woman, I may not feel entirely safe wandering in those areas on my own at night. The one day travel pass is excellent value for $9 and was much easier than trying to find the correct fare in coins for single trips. On one occasion I had had enough walking for the day but as we did not have the correct fare I ended up having to walk back to our hotel anyway. Vancouver has converted me and I think that I could live here quite easily.

title: Variety, views, and lots of zip
reviews: Changes from block to block in architecture, store types, views of mountains and water, super mix of cultures,most  drivers pretty decent in treatment of pedestrians but keep an eye out for cyclists, some are "cowboys with bad attitudes", and transit service (bus and rail) is first-rate.

title: love it
reviews: Downtown Vancouver, love this place. Shopping at Pacific Mall or along Robson street, it's fun. There are places to you have dinner, hang out at night, bars, etc...you name it.

title: Downtown
reviews: Visited Gastown -cute shops, great restaurants! Terrific place to pick up souveniers.

title: Fun
reviews: Lots of walking! Tons to see and do. Easy to get around without getting lost.

title: Nice
reviews: organised and clean surrounded with beautiful nature

title: Shopping Shopping Shopping
reviews: Excellent selection. What more can I say? The Holt Renfrew is huge! The options are fantastic, Hermes, Tiffany, Coach etc.

title: Lovely City.....
reviews: Vancouver is a lovely city and easy to negotiate, as it uses the 'Grid System' like NY and Boston.  Interesting differences in the various areas, Gastown being the less salubrious but livlier area, more popular with young crowd.  There is no shortage of excellent and authentic restaurants (catering for every taste and preference), bars, night clubs, etc.  At the weekends, Downtown Vancouver becomes one big street party for the younger set.Lots of shops also - but Vancouver is an expensive City to live in or visit (second in the World only to Tokyo, I believe !).  They say that only the very rich and the homeless can afford to live there !!Public transport is so good that a car seems unnecessary - at least in Vancouver itself.  Vancouver is a coastal city, so it has beautiful beaches (including a beach just for dogs, as everybody seems to own one !) but it  also has easy access to mountains.  Seems they have the best of both worlds - skiing in the snowy Winters, followed by glorious sunny Summers.Add to the mix the extremely friendly and hospitable people and you have a Winner !!  I will definitely be back........

title: When Shopping Downtown Vancouver "Check-Out Millennium" Located at 1109 Granville St, This Place ROCKS!
reviews: Love Shopping on Granville st! Found the most Amazing Store there with Wicked Alternative Clothing & the most Friendly, Down to Earth, Helpful Staff Ever. This Store is Simply Irresistable and Same goes for the Staff, I actually Can't wait to go back not only to shop there but to visit the Awesome Ladies again.Millennium Vancouver Store YOU ROCK!, located at 1109 Granville St. Purchased my Entire Concert Outfit at this Store, plus More :)

title: Best city ever!
reviews: Cleanest large city I've ever visited.  The seawall and Stanley Park are must see attractions for a wonderful, scenic and relaxing stroll.

title: High light of our visit, you can't get enough of it
reviews: Very well located to allot of attractions nearby and just a great place to enjoy a morning coffee or afternoon tea anywhere in town.

title: An urban city centre that works
reviews: The combination of good restaurants, the Orpheum, the Art Galleryand interesting shops

title: So much to see!!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver was fantastic! They have tons of awesome stores and lots of fantastic restaurants!  We walked for days!!

title: Depends on where you go.
reviews: There are some amazing shopping places in downtown Vancouver, lots of restaurants, and interesting things to see and do.  However, be very careful where you walk.  We followed a map from Gastown to China town, and ended up in a very populated area of drug deals and homeless on the street.  I had tried to ask a policeman the best way to get between the two areas and he ignored me.  After that we stayed only in the "tourist" sections or took public transportation.  I live in a major urban area and have never encountered a section of town so dangerous in the middle of the day, so close to popular destinations.

title: A great place to walk about
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is truly "owned" by cars with bikes running a close second.  With an excellent transit system (at least downtown) it's easy to travel a little and then walk to your destination through neighbourhoods that have retained their tranquility.  Developers are constantly trying to build though and who knows how long the balance can be maintained.

title: Lots to see and you need to see it to believe it.
reviews: Lots of places to see, and if you have time take one are at a time, and beware of sales that are not really sales. Lovely city.

title: One of the great cities in the world
reviews: Just got back from a conference in Vancouver, and though I have visited many times, I was stunned by what the city has become.  Not just a "city of glass," though the post-modern glass architecture of the last 20 years provides a soaring, glittering urban feel not found in many older cities, but a city that has found itself: a place that celebrates its multiculturalism rather than chafe under it and subtly displays its stunning physical beauty in ever more extraordinary ways.  The sea walk around the new convention centre is just about done, and on a glorious (though admittedly somewhat rare) warm, sunny May weekend, there can be no more gorgeous an urban experience than walking or biking around Stanley Park. The city's priority on biking, walking and public transit (the new Canada Line to the airport and Richmond almost makes hosting the Olympics worth it), despite some  grumbling, has meant the downtown has become more and more vibrant and alive.  Rivals Portland for North American urban planning excellence.  It is somewhat true, as a friend said, with housing prices so high only the rich and homeless can afford to live there, but in fact many of the high rise condos are rented by young professionals (in some neigbourhoods rental rates rates are 75% of occupancy) who turn the streets into a party on weekends. Just a great city.

title: yeh, Downtown baby
reviews: I live in Vancouver downtown for 2 weeks, thats the only place where you'd find people after 8PM. Most happening on Fri, Sat after dark. Lots of restaurants and bars. Line of retail shops with of-course exorbitant prices. Its not worth hopping on a bus or getting into sky train, its very easily walkable around.Some areas of downtown smell of all sorts of grass and it could be a scary walk around there. Watch out!

title: busy city centre
reviews: easily walkable numerous car paring facilities in area also metro system close byplenty of shops including an underground shopping complex featuring a large selection of outlet shops plus a large food court

title: BC
reviews: great place and great people, the train services were excellent, traffic was moderate, and had lots of new and old buildings to see. stanley park was good to visit with all the harbour views ,gardens trees etc.

title: Downtown Vancouver
reviews: Beautiful and very clean. Wonderful city with lots to do.

title: Overwhelming
reviews: Lots to do and see downtown Vancouver.  If you like shopping and know what you want this is the place.

title: Shop till you drop
reviews: Love Robson St, sensational shops, although far to many homeless people which is sad.

title: Beautiful place, beautiful food, biased opinion though
reviews: I lived there for 20 years so I am definitely biased about Vancouver. It's still as shockingly beautiful as ever. Never a day went by that I didn't think 'I live in the most beautiful city in the world'. Food is second to none for choice, quality, and price. Japanese food is best Ive ever eaten, from upscale evening spots to tiny lunchtime takeaways, can't fault the quality of chinese food either, it's REAL chinese, china town is massive and not to be missed. Cultural diversity, scenery, outdoor activities, skiing, rollerblading, sailing (possibly all in one day) makes it a fantastic holiday destination. On a BA flight I once heard an announcement that said welcome to Vancouver, where you can eat three times a day in different restaurants for three years and never eat in the same place twice. This is true, I don't remember ever using my cooker, it was cheaper, easier and tastier to eat out. If you've never been it's well worth the journey, you'll love it.

title: Cool and Happening Place
reviews: Clean city, great shops particularly in Robson Street. If your after the best place to exchange currency the one located around the corner on Burrard St just off Robson St was the best rate I found after 7 places, $1 AUD = .99 CAD ~8th May 2012 everywhere else = ~.92-.95 CAD.

title: A vibrant downtown
reviews: It's not big but it is full of energy and the presence of people from different corners of the world. I used to walk all the way down Robson Street and was never bored.

title: great atmosphere
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has a great vibe, the shops and restaurants are great it is clean and safe.

title: Vancouver is SO WALKABLE!
reviews: You can do a complete water view walk or bike ride around English Bay, Stanley Park and along the inner harbour. Or, you can spend hours walking down Robson, along Denman and back up Davie, popping into the massive variety of stores and restaurants. You will marvel at the architecture and flowers. There is no way you could possibly be bored! Stay in the West End. Leave your car at home.

title: Downtown
reviews: Easy to get around walking. Very busy, so many stores!Only thing I disliked was the urine smell in some areas and the high amount of panhandling.

title: very upset at all the street beggars
reviews: Too many street people,beggers,realy upset me.DID'NT FEEL SAFE.No shop as no vat refund.I loved canadian diamonds,but will buy elswere,were they don't fleece tourists,refusing vat refund is ridiculous

title: Was fun
reviews: liked near 2 main streets and close to somethings I liked disliked hotel rooms were nice but..walls you could tell were kinda thin and its right next to a s catchy hotel.

title: Most beautiful city in the world!
reviews: Born and raised in Vancouver.  If you havn't seen it, toss it in your bucket with the rest of the list.  It has everything, and is clean, fantastic people, food, sights, accomodations, 200 nationalities, and all getting along.  She's North America's Potpourri of people and their individual foods.

title: Amazing energy!
reviews: We love downtown Vancouver. There's no shortage of shopping, great food, and amazing sights. Lots of movies and TV shows are filmed in downtown Vancouver too, so you might get to see some of this action when you visit.

title: Loved the location
reviews: First visit to Vancouver, wanted a central location, downtown was perfect. Lots of things in walking distance, close to the waterfront, which is a must sea ( : ) ), and completely safe. Surprisingly there is a large amount of green spaces even in downtown which is a pleasant surprise and great for visitors who want access to outdoor rec areas close by.

title: Fun neighbourhoods...great food
reviews: Explore Denman, Davie and English Bay one day, Yaletown and Gastown the next. Everything is close or reachable by the fabulous transit system

title: A clean, vibrant city
reviews: Vancouver is among the top places in the world to live. It reeks of money, and that itself is a problem- it just costs SO much to rent or own in Van.As well, it has the poorest ghetto in the country, disaffectionately known as the DTES (downtown east side)All that apart, there are great restaurants, stellar parks and seawalls for walking/biking/rollerblading.  The contemporary land use is exemplary- with live/work/play all in the same place as design goals. The transit system, for the size of city, is excellent, though there are complaints about night services, and holes in the network. The Skytrain to the airport means it is STUPID! to even consider renting a car or even taking the cab if going downtown.Chinatown, Gastown,Stanley Park, Granville Island (rent a kayak) are all big attractions- to which I would add the Anthropolgy museum at UBC, the Skyride up Grouse Mountain at night, and a visit to Lynn Valley and its suspension bridge. Free as opposed to expensive, as is the Capilano River counterpart. Also, Van Dusen Gardens, Queen Elizabeth Park, and the UBC horticultural gardens (especially rhododendron season) are high quality. Eat sushi, go to dive Chinese restaurants, and just walk down Commercial or visit 'Little India' to round out your experience

title: Nice & walkable
reviews: I like downtown vancouver. It's a lovely city, with many trees and fountains and sculptures. It was clean & very walkable. It's very cycle friendly too. Certain areas are nicer than others. I liked gastown and the coal harbour the best.

title: Shops and so much more
reviews: There are plenty of shopping areas with lots of food courts but so much besides; museums, galleries, public art, architecture and then Gas town at the end. Remember the harbour views too!

title: Walked from sunset inn & suites
reviews: Walking distance from motel and did the hop on hop off bus

title: What an unblievable city centre!
reviews: Safe clean and bustling with activity, this city is like a cross between SF, Stockholm and Honk Kong, what a place.there is great food, the people are very polite.

title: Big city options with a small town feel
reviews: Public transit is fantastic, with the ability to get anywhere easily and inexpensively.  There is so much to see and do that it would take a week to just visit all the downtown sites!

title: great place to visit
reviews: Robson St was my home base and was walking distance to most things such as Chinatown and gastown and Stanley Park.  There are plenty of shopping and dining options to keep everyone happy!

title: Downtown Vancouver is very clean
reviews: Surprised at how clean downtown Vancouver is and how many good stores there are to shop.  I was impressed and are looking forward to returning to Vancouver.

title: Plenty to do regardless of your interest.
reviews: Another "Don't Miss It" if you're visiting Vancouver.

title: Beautiful city
reviews: Lots to see and do.  Panoramic skyline building is great as well as suspension bridge.

title: Awesome City!
reviews: Clean, friendly, beautiful people!  Upbeat, fun, stylish and very friendly citizens.  We felt safe and welcomed our entire trip!  E. Hastings and Chinatown are dumps!  Stay away, human feces, drug addicts and bums every 10 feet.  The trolley is a fun and inexpensive way to see the whole city; get the two day pass for $45. Gas Town was cool and has a lot of places to eat, drink and shop.  You'll see and smell a lot of marijuana on West Hastings and everyone we encountered was nice; stop in to the New Amsterdam Cafe and say "hi" to the two stoned cats that lay around the place.  Buy a shirt and have a look around.  Go across the street to the New Rock Shop, an 80's Heavy Metal store.  The Granville Island Shops are a must-see.

title: I love this city!
reviews: A Clean, Friendly,  Safe place to spend the day. We walked all over downtown popping in and out of quaint little shops we discovered.

title: Great atmosphere!
reviews: We loved that everything is in walking distance of centrally located hotels. There are downtown "ambassadors" walking around to help you with directions etc. It was very clean and friendly!

title: Just what you'd expect from downtown
reviews: Very busy, lots of traffic, parking hard to find.  But, once on the street, there are lots of shops and lots of variety.  I didn't find the street people as intrusive as in the past, and was pleased to purchase a magazine from a clean-cut well-spoken young man who is part of a self-reliance program.  As city's go, Vancouver downtown is clean, and almost everything in easy walking distance.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: The downtown area is beautifully maintained, with lots of greenery and wonderful landscaping. It is a very green city. The buses are electric, as are most of the cabs (Priuses). Great restaurants, great shopping, all very accessible. Lots of people walking.

title: Great city, clean air and nice people.
reviews: It is very clean, transportation users are very disciplined and polite.

title: Beautiful buildings. Don't forget the towers.
reviews: One can visit the towers that have restaurants and a beautiful view of the city.

title: Vancouver is the Best!
reviews: Big city, Big heart and lots of friendliness! First trip but definately not our last! You can walk or bike everywhere inside the city. The only difficult decisions you will make is how to spend your mornings, afternoons and evenings! Don't let the rain discourage you the transit is superb and so many places to run into for an app & cocktail - let Mother Nature rule!

title: Cleanest, Friendliest City
reviews: Wow...downtown Vancouver has so much to offer and it is the cleanest and friendliest large city we have ever visited. Lots of cafes and restaurants, and every type of store you could want to shop in. Take a Hop On -Hop Off bus to get a great overall feel of downtown Vancouver, as well as other areas of Vancouver.

title: Vibrant and convenient
reviews: Indoor mall connects to post office (inside drug store) with some high-end shops like Stuart Weitzman and Michael Kors, with food court and many other stores.  Also connects to Sky Train.  Vancouver Art Gallery is across the street.  Several excellent restaurants in the area, including the outstanding Market (Jean-Georges Vongerichten)

title: Got around easy
reviews: The drives there are very agressive, but polite.  Infact every one at Vancouver were gems, everyone was so very friendly.

title: Glass city
reviews: Beautiful places for a walk-Stanley Park (one of the nicest in North America)-Yaletown (Roundhouse and restaurants)-Granville street & Granville Island (shopping)-Robson Square (vitality & animation) during winter season bring your skate.Avoid (especially with kids)-Downtown Eastside's Hasting street near the Carnegie Community Center (lots of druggies and  homeless people)

title: Easy to get around
reviews: So much to see, so much to do, just grab an umbrella and walk, start on Davies street and continue up, great shops!

title: Love Downtown Vancouver!
reviews: From Gastown's cobble stones to walk around Canada Place area, to specialty shops and let's  not forget Stanley Park and the Lookout... everything you need is there.  Just park your car on street or in many parkades, or take the sky train or bus to get there and then you are free to walk arounf to your heart's content.  Enjoy!

title: Must see, must do!
reviews: Everything is within easy ealking distance or a very short taxi ride and fare.  Love the city.

title: Driving around downtown
reviews: Very interestingA lot to look atLooking forward to a longer visit next time where we actually do some walking aroundDifficult to navigate

title: dash Liverpool
reviews: very busy. lots of shops. many places to eat.we took the big red bus tour excellent value over 2 days

title: Stay to nice areas
reviews: Canada Place, Pacific Centre Mall, Sea bus are some of the best places. A visit to the Art Gallery is pleasant but pre-plan as there are often protests and even on a slow day the vagrants hanging around can be a little disturbing.

title: Very Nice City
reviews: Loved the downtown. Very walkable and easy to get places with out a cab.

title: Underwhelmed...
reviews: Well, San Francisco or Seattle it is not.  The buildings lack character (appear to have all gone up at the same time (86 Expo and Olympics).  Parking rates are just like other cities, but the signs concerning car theft make one uneasy about walking away from your vehicle.  Rampant homelessness...this city is the worst I've ever seen in North America.  Canada Place walk is nice (watching sea planes come in is enjoyable) but the view is quite industrial (largest pile of sulfur I've ever seen!).  Some nice hotels and good restaurants.  Overall, just a jumping off place for other destinations.

title: shopping
reviews: Lots of stores to choose from.But things are not cheap with the 12% tax.

title: Beautiful city - beautiful people
reviews: Absolutely loved the place - go eat at Moxies on Robson or Davie, fantastic meals, not cheap but good value.... loved everything about Vancouver, can't wait to go back

title: A big city feel
reviews: Easy to walk to major attractions. Lots to do. Great shopping.

title: Downtoawn is a blast!
reviews: Lots to do and see. From shopping to sightseeing to dining to walks in Stanley Park or Gastown. Vancouver is a vibrant city with an excellent downtown core

title: Lots to Do!
reviews: The buildings are beautiful and new, there are plenty of things to do, like seeing the beehives in the convention center and walking, hiking, or biking the parks, Chinatown, Gastown, or Granville. But there are also quite a bit of shopping options. Malls, stores, shops, and a whole world more underground.

title: Safe city
reviews: A really safe city to wander around. Good transport using the SkyTrain and buses etc, but most of the urban places are within walking distance. Love the atmosphere when the tourists are here. :P

title: Love my city =)
reviews: I can't say enough good things about my amazing hometown Vancouver. Besides being blessed with an amazing array of restaurants that offer anything your heart desires, we also have the largest urban park in North America located right off the business district of our downtown core. Stanley park is definitely a must see. If you like shoping, Granville street is great for funky shops and Robson street is a lovely shopping strip, perfect for fashionistas =)

title: Very walkable city
reviews: Very walkable city, though I did find it odd that there were so many inclines and declines for an island. Though every street I came across was easily navigable and had no fear of getting lost. Be weary of Chinatown for a block away in the wrong direction will bring you into an uninviting area full of prostitutes and homeless.

title: Public Transportation makes this even better
reviews: Take the buses and trains and water taxis, the public transit system makes this city so much fun to discover!  Find the Olympic flame cauldron, and wait for the 9pm Cannon!

title: So many things to see.
reviews: Loved it!  Clean, beautiful and with many shops and eating places.  We wandered for hours!

title: Beautiful city
reviews: What's not to love?  This is a beautiful city with a stunning backdrop of the mountains. Everything you could ever want is within easy reach & the transit system puts most large cities to shame. A unique blend of cultures seamlessly come together in beautiful surroundings.

title: Downtown fun
reviews: Very vibrant Downtown scene. Lots of young people and fun things to do. Restaurants, bars, sports....all there.

title: Always amazing!
reviews: We love Vancouver!     Miss living there....   The Wall Center is a great location for experiencing the city... Able to walk just about anywhere in the downtown core or if not the taxi fare is minimal to get you there!

title: Close to everything
reviews: The heartbeat of the city is downtown and its uniqueness is the fact that it is also close to many major tourist attractions.  So if you stay downtown, not only can you shop, you can also walk to Stanley Park, walk to the seabus that goes to Lonsdale Quay, walk to the foot ferry that goes to Granville Island, and walk to the sky train which will take you all over the city.  The list goes on and on.  Plus there are fountains, flowers and green spaces all over.  So beautiful, so easy to get around.  Love it!

title: Walked about
reviews: We walked around looking for something small to buy.  We ended up purchasing rings off a vendor on the street by the Art Gallery.

title: Vancouver Downtown April 2012
reviews: I recently took a trip to Vancouver and spent the majority of my time downtown. I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Vancouver which I highly recommend due to its location. The hotel is a 2 minute walk to Robson street where there is a ton of higher end shopping and great restaurants. Downtown Vancouver is extremely clean and has great public transportation options so its fairly easy to get around to the major sights. You can easily walk to Stanley Park along the Harbor.

title: It's a gorgeous city...
reviews: What I love most about Vancouver is the combination of incredible physical beauty and walkability.  It's a fabulous city to visit - skiing, hiking, biking, animals, action packed days!

title: A lil something for everyone
reviews: Great shopping down town and some good places for a quick bite or site down meals.

title: Vibrant heart of a great city
reviews: Downtown vancouver is vibrant, safe (just avoid the east side - you will know where it is). There are countless attractions. The night life district of granville street, China town, Robson street, Stanley Park, Canada Place to name a few. Take a camera along and your walking shoes :)! must go.

title: Many changes....
reviews: This really has become a walker's ideal city.  Much of the grunge of years ago has gone and yet still small neighbourhoods if you explore.

title: Love it!
reviews: Vancouver is such an awesome city. Great shopping, great people, clean beautiful place.

title: Robson shopping
reviews: Nice.  We got a break from the rain and the sun was actually out!!  Nice stores.

title: Neat to walk around, bring umbrella
reviews: It is neat to walk around the different neighborhoods in Vancouver and get their unique flavor.

title: Noisy, bustling and alive
reviews: Almost sounds like a night out and trust me it is, day and night downtown is alive with the tastes and smells of a million things going on all at once, a pure cornucopia of delights

title: Scenic Vancouver
reviews: IT is a city with lots of concrete and glass but has it"s own special views and attractions eg. Terry Fox "

title: Every great city has some shady areas
reviews: Vancouver was fantastic to be in on business.  There is plenty to do, both downtown and in the suburbs!  If you are staying downtown, there is plenty to do with the harbour right there, eating establishments are aplenty with a wide range of choices and prices you are willing to spend.  Granville Island, albeit crowded at times, has some great places to go see.  Just beware of a very small area on the Northeast side of downtown Vancouver that was very hard to drive through with unfortunate individuals looking for meals, many of which are dealing with drug addictions.  My heart goes out to them!  Next time I am in Vancouver, I want to figure out a way to help them conquer this problem!!  Overall great stay in Vancouver, with great people to boot!

title: A crazy Balance!
reviews: Vancouver downtown has ALL THE SHOPPING YOU COULD DESIRE, but also restaurants from the most expensive down to the local vendors on the street, selling amazing grilled sandwiches, hotdogs, or Jappa Dogs{Japanese Hotdogs) but also the wide sweeping streets with the beautiful mountain views make it very pleasant.The streets are very clean, a local community garden is in the area so, there may be a few homeless, from time to time. Caused us no trouble though!!!!

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: Loads to do with shopping & resturants in abundance...If you love to do both than spend a day downtown.

title: stayed here
reviews: So much to see and do - Canada Place, Gastown - the city is very safe and doesn't feel like a city because of the snow capped mountains

title: Gastown
reviews: Neat place to visit. Went to the Spaghetti Factory, always good food and prices. Had a wonderful server from Britain.

title: good city centre
reviews: This is where we were based for our 2 day stay lots of little suberbs from here, good to visit all of them as they differ quite a bit between them, people always helpful.

title: downtown vancouver
reviews: The architecture was not historic - more modern.  Found ourselves in what appeared to be a homeless market and it was kind of creepy.

title: A great clean, green city!
reviews: This is my home.I have lived in the lower mainland my whole life.I travel extensively.I love our city.It is clean, green, close to oceans and mountains.The people are very open and forward.Multiculturalism thrives here - we are a very huge mix of races, cultures, religions, and orientations - and it all works well together.Sure we have our issues too, but after many years of travel, I feel that this is one of the best cities in the world.Though we are note affected much by winter like the majority of Canada due to the mountains and ocean moderating us here, we do get more than our share of rain.I garden and hike so I like it, but if you have a hate for rain, better plan on visiting May~September - this is when we gett the least amount (though it is still a roll of the dice)I LOVE spring here - the cherry blossoms downtown, and everything waking up from winter - it is beautiful.When summer comes, the downtown comes alive with all out health oriented locals hiking, sunning, cycling, and jogging.

title: Great location
reviews: Lovely shops and lots do see and do. I was expecting a boring city center but downtown Is very charming with beautiful large avenues and mountain views everywhere!

title: One of the most walkable downtowns
reviews: What I like most about Downtown Vancouver is how easily walkable it is. You can cirumnavigate the entire downtown core on a seawall footpath or easily criss cross on foot. One of my favourite things to do in Vancouver is to walk from Granville Island towards ScienceWorld then towards the Aquatic Centre to English Bay, around Stanley Park and then end up downtown for a nice refreshing pint of beer at the Alibi Room (great beer), Steamworks (great view and good beer) or Mahoneys at the Convention Centre (great view). That is a good day out!

title: Typical North American Big City Center
reviews: If you are into shopping it is ok.  I am not much of a shopper.  The Art Gallery is interesting and has a great cafeteria with outdoor dining.  Often has good exhibits.  Some of Vancouver's great restaurants are here.  The center is walkable but entirely uninteresting with its highrise office buildings and condos.  For touring, the edges of the city are more interesting.  It is however clean.

title: Beautiful/ugly
reviews: Showcases the best and the worst all within easy walking distance.

title: Just loved walking around the city
reviews: Liked that from the hotel we could jump on the bus and get off anywhere. but there were alot of places that we could walk to.

title: Interesting culture
reviews: So many great shopping experiences in downtown Vancouver.  Many great restaurants.

title: Clean and safe
reviews: Love walking the streets at night to & from wonderful restaurants. Running in the mornings was a pleasure

title: Nice!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is an excellent place to shop, eat, and party! The diverse stores and restaurants range in price from budget to lifestyles of the rich and famous. They have bars and dance clubs that are sure to fit your music genre and theme.  There are Irish pubs, Hip Hop, Rock, Top 40, and Country themed clubs.  As for the restaurants, there are restaurants or practically every culture from Asian to Middle Eastern and everything in between.  For those with kids who won't eat anything other than burgers, they also have McDonald's and Burger King :)

title: Beautiful
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has everything you will ever need. There are great places to shop and great places to eat. The ocean is just a short walk away from the middle of downtown.

title: Try Vancouver by bike
reviews: Riding a bike in Vancouver has become easier ans safer. The bike route network is great to commute or just for an afternoon ride.

title: Concrete and a tid bit of jungle
reviews: Sine I live in New York City, and there are not that many trees, flowers, bushes, etc surrounding the buildings, it was a real pleasure walking through downtown Vancouver. Every building had tons of trees, bushes, flowers, what-have-you mixed in with the architecture of the buildings. From what I understand, the architects are encouraged and often asked to make sure that there is greenery intertwined in the production of the buildings so you get a nice balance of city and greenery. In addition, downtown was spotless. I could not find trash or debris even if I tried. Just a forewarning that if you drive through downtown, people drive a little on the crazy side and you will be hard pressed to find a left turn signal so you will get stuck in a bit of traffic. Save yourself the headache and leave the car where you are staying and take the SkyTrain or public transportation. For the buses remember to always have cash on you. For a lunch bite, you have to find this food truck, Feastro Bistro, they are usually located on Thurlow & Cordova. by the water with ample sitting space to enjoy your lunch. They were featured on Eat St. which airs on the Cooking Channel. When we planned this road trip, we had several food trucks in the different cities that we were going to hunt down. Feastro Bistro bar none has some of the best bistro food we have ever had. Please if you get anything, get the seafood chowder. I believe it is on limited availability. This truck only uses the freshest seafood, all free range organic chicken, beef and pork. All of their containers, etc, are biodegradable.

title: Beautiful Downtown
reviews: This infact is a beautiful and safe downtown. The city is clean, lively and very friendly people.

title: Beautiful city especially when it is not raining
reviews: Great place to go shopping and it is very clean. There is a wonderful library.

title: Best City in Canada hands down!
reviews: We were driven in a bus downtown to the Vancouver Aquarium ( I call it VanAqua) by Mrs. Claus, that's right, Santa's wife. !!

title: Robson Street shopping was great
reviews: I like the variety of shops and also the choice in restaurants.  I found the staff at the shops and restaurants to be helpful not only in their knowledge of product and service but also on advice on what to see in the city

title: AMAZING
reviews: Mirror, mirror on the wall we are the fairest of them all.  What a beautiful city.

title: Everything you need
reviews: I stayed in Downtown and it had everything we needed from shopping, eating out and enjoying a great game of ice hockey at rogers stadium. Everything is within walking distance which is great for a tourist like me!

title: Cosmopolitan City
reviews: You will find everything in down Vancouver...food, culture, shopping.  Don't miss Granville Island marketplace - take the aquabus across False Creek.

title: Experience
reviews: Walking through downtown Vancouver is a cultural experience. So diverse with the shops and restaurants you will encounter. Extremely clean city with quite a bit of characters around every corner.

title: Great for families and young people
reviews: Eastern part of downtown is old Gastown (interesting steam clock and lots of tourist stores).  China town is not far from there and good for day time adventure....especially if you like dried fish!West side of town is a nicer area for summer evenings.  Plenty of shopping and cool stores.  Lots of coffee shops and great place for young folk to wander safely on a summer evening along Robson Street and Denman.  Stanley Park great for families during the summer with kids train, small water park, and also close by are bicyles for hire.  English Bay side of Stanley Park has outdoor pool.  Nice sea wall walk all around the water side of Stanley Park.Centre of downtown Vancouver has Pacific Centre Mall, mostly underground.Downtown at Waterfront area (near Exhibition centre) is a regular fare sea bus over to the Quay in North Vancouver.  Great for a day trip and indoor market there has a kids ballroom and food court.

title: Goes on getting better
reviews: New architecture and well maintained areas continue to provide stunning combinations with the  mountains to provide wonderful photo opportunities

title: Beautiful Downtown Vancouver!
reviews: I enjoy downtown for so many reasons...so much to do from movies to plays to galleries to long lingering walks along the seaside...and so much more! Excellent restaurants featuring food from all over the world...and a wide variety of shopping experiences...high end to bargains galore! A great way to spend the day!

title: too much construction and changes right now.
reviews: tired of all the construction and bicycle lane changes narrowing some of the much needed roads in downtown vancouver....the parking meters have sky rocketed since the olympics...better to take a bus or walk!  I hate parking downtown on the streets now.  Terrible for overprice meters and parking ticket men are on it believe me!!!

title: safe, easy to walk
reviews: It is easily laid out, on a nice day you can walk around and get wherever you need to go.. Just beware of shops/restaurants, they can get a bit pricey.

title: Thrilling
reviews: Comming from small town Abbotsford, Vancouver is always a thrill for my girls and I. We always find something new to do or see. Never a dull moment

title: Must see
reviews: Always a great stroll through the city on a nice day. No shortage of shops and restaurants or great cafes. A city we can be proud of that did the Olympics proud!

title: "Only on a sunny day"
reviews: Vancouver downtown,packed with people walking to their destinations.Mostly for shopping or just people watching. Nothing spectacular,one can go to any major mall and still would find stores that's in Robson St. I went on a sunny Sunday afternoon and spent $6 on parking. Nothing bought except for a large cup of coffee. Yes,downtown is rather boring and mediocre,so the weather is vital for the visit.

title: Lots to see and do
reviews: One fantastic restaurant I would not miss is Coast.  The seafood was phenomenal although a little pricey.  A great place for brunch was The Elbow Room - good food, great humour, HUGE portions.

title: Great City
reviews: Clean, upbeat, lots to do, you can walk just about everywhere, what is not to like?  Ok maybe the parking is expensive but it is a big city so we expected that. Robson st and Burrard shopping is great.  The seawall walk is amazing with the mt views, seaplanes landing and taking off and city lights.

title: rainy day favourite
reviews: You can explore the west coast on a marine style walk way, talk to a porpoise, watch otters lounge on their backs, be splashed by a Beluga, hear eagles and seagulls and watch seals swimming.  Then go inside and get warm in the rainforest and capture beautiful pictures of birds, a sloth, turtles, marmots and much more Educational and fun for everyone.

title: Walking in Vancouver
reviews: Robson Street was fabulous, all the shops.  Down by the water near Seabus terminal was fantastic.  Skytrain was fun!

title: great
reviews: very nice atmosphere, very modern ,high buildings ,nice to walk along the streets

title: Bright and Modern
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a great place some wonderful shops, including the Bay, lots to do and see in the area

title: Food, shopping and entertainment
reviews: Food, shopping and entertainment. A great area to shop, eat and be entertained.

title: Pedestrian friendly city
reviews: My only complaint would be the large number of smokers.  But, hey, at least the stores/restaurants are smoke-free.

title: A favourite city.
reviews: 1.	Steamworks - DowntownBig fans of this place.  Wall to wall screens if you want to watch ice hockey and a menu that we regretted not having more time to explore.  That said, over a couple of days we enjoyed the best ever fish (halibut) and chips; top sirloin shrimp and 3 mushroom sauce; stunning baked mushrooms and according to ‚Äòsweet tooth,‚Äô the best ever caramel apple pie.  You also have to make room though for Empress India Pale Ale and the real favourite, Lionsgate Lager ‚Äì all brewed on site.2.	Brewhouse ‚Äì YaletownNagila Pale Ale to wash down a really fine BBQ Beef pizza ‚Äì perfect way to spend a lunchtime.3.	The KegAfter disappointment with the Keg at Whistler, the finest Sirloin and slick service restored our fondness for the Keg.4.	The FringeTo be able to watch a favourite show being filmed before your eyes, is quite special.  Thanks to Twitter and @OLV we managed to watch the alternative universe being shot at Gore & Cordova

title: Great downtown
reviews: Vancouver has everything anyone would need, Great night life and snow skiing less than 45 mins away. Wonderful city, my favorite in North America.

title: Nice waterfront area
reviews: My favorite part of the waterfront was the Olympic torch.  However besides a nice place for a walk there wasn't much to do.

title: GIANT wonderful town
reviews: We had a great time. The size of Chicago. Could get lost, but lots to do and see and eat. For all ages! Took a train from Seattle. Great way to get there.

title: We had a lot of fun walking around window shopping
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is a great place to spend the day walking around window shopping and eating! It felt very safe and was an easy walk.

title: Nice downtown, with homeless problem.
reviews: Homelessness is a huge problem if Canada, but it is especially visible in Vancouver. Otherwise it was a nice experience.

title: A walk about
reviews: Lots of interesting architecture to with and people too see.

title: One of the most beautiful cities in the world
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has a great location.  You can see the mountain and the sea and the sky.  Stanley Park is within walking / cycling distance.  I think this is the only downtown city that has such incredible view of both the mountain and the sea.

title: Downtown blues
reviews: We were very disappointed with Vancouver as a city.There doesn't seem to be a real heart of town, with a few street around Robson, Granville and Burrard dedicated to pretty run of the mill high-street shops, a large depressing Sears and tourist-tat filled Gastown which soon descends into a no-go area as soon as you turn the corner onto Hastings.We were horrified by the number of homeless people and beggars on the streets, even in the more salubrious areas, and finding ourselves in the wrong area of China town, a little scared at times.We are very well travelled and have lived in big cities in Europe and Asia, but have never seen ghettoization to this extent anywhere else.For the rest of the city, it's relatively dreary with little nightlife, even the much lauded Yaledown was a disappointment - think Manchester's Northern Quarter or London's Soho with no decent bars clubs or boutiques.....

title: Big city with casual atmosphere.
reviews: Lots to see in a compact area. The best part of the city is walking the sea wall. Ocean access is incredible. Most of any city I have been to. Lots of good places to eat and the scenery is incredible. Still a safe place to go on foot just about anywhere, and the addition of the bike lanes has made it more cycle friendly. People may find the parking expensive, but compared to other cities it's a deal.

title: City Walk
reviews: We were suprised at the number of beggars on all street corners and tourist spots asking for money, from experience some were very aggressive and offputting.That said still enjoyed the City and surrounding areas.

title: Beautiful clean citly center
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is one of my favorite places to take visitors when they come to town.  Its a blend of old world Vancouver mixed with the new.  An easy city to wonder through, from water front and Gastown fill with great venders and shops, up to Granville and Robson, the heart of the city filled with shopping centers, theatre district, night clubs and bars then down to Yaletown the new Urban and entertainment district.  Trendy bars, upscale resteraunts, high end condos....A good glimpse at what living in Vancouver is all about.Safe, friendly, clean and easy to navigate.

title: Classy and First Class
reviews: Enjoyed the downtown core of the City with it's combination of shopping, dining and closeness to Stanley Park. What a great place to live with everything so close. Could see Grouse Mountain in the distance....what a playground. Yes I am jealous and envious....and glad to have spent time there.

title: So much to love about Vancouver
reviews: Amazing city and excellent shopping. I will definately be back!

title: nice place for shopping
reviews: great shops and restaurants just make sure you have a map or someone who knows their way arround

title: Wonderful
reviews: What a wonderful city. English Bay, Coal Harbour, Spanish Banks, Kits, the ocean, the mountains, etc.

title: Easy to find you way around
reviews: Coming from a small country town a big city can be imposing.  I found Vancouver very easy to find my way around both walking and driving.

title: City of Glass
reviews: Island of glass!  One of the most beautiful  in the world.

title: beautiful city
reviews: what can say one of the if not nicest cities in the world.do yourself a favour and go visiti can promise you will love it like i do

title: beautiful city between snow mountains and sea
reviews: I love staying in Vancouver downtown esp when walking in Burrard street. But some part of the area like Granville street was a little bit dirty, I saw more garbage and beggars, overall Tokyo and Singapore are cleaner than Vancouver

title: Beautiful skyline, great energy
reviews: It would be great to have the entire core cleaned up, but the atmosphere and scenery has the potential to be worldclass.

title: wonderful city
