reviews: This was truly a wonderful city. We had stayed in Toronto but this was totally different.  We stayed in the Sheraton Hotel and this was a great place. We could walk to all the places and the trains and the buses were so handy. The underground walk to all the shops was brilliant.  Wish we had something like that here.

title: Absolutely gorgeous city!
reviews: Multicultural, vibrant city.  Endless variety of shopping and ethnic cuisine.

title: Robsonstrasse is boring
reviews: Robson St. isn't very interesting, mostly the big chains you see everywhere.  West 4th and also Broadway are far more interesting if you like to walk and browse neat shops.  Also, Granville St. across the bridge has expensive but lovely shops and some great art galleries.

title: Beautiful city!
reviews: Travelled quite a bit and I have to say that Vancouver is the most beautiful, clean and friendly city I have been too. Where else can you leave work at 5 and be at the beach at 5:15. It is an incredibly clean city and people are super nice. Wouldn't want to live anywhere else.

title: A tiny downtown for a "world class" city
reviews: It's amazing how small the downtown is in Vancouver!  However, it does have a nice small art gallery (rarely blockbuster shows, unfortunately). There are many lovely places to eat and shop.  Eating especially, since locals are fond of all different types of "ethnic" cuisine.  I love the Japanese restaurants like Gyoza King or Taku Guu best.    My favourite thing in the city is the seawall walk that can take you all around the city from Fairview/False Creek (which faces downtown), around Yaletown, the West End and Coal Harbour.  I think few North American cities are blessed wtih this really precious attribute.  People jog, walk, cycle and push babies in their prams on this amazing route!  I've never walked the whole thing and neither should you!  You won't have the time if you're visiting.  But you should walk the area near Yaletown at least!

title: Like the Rain?
reviews: WIthout question Vancouver's downtown has the best to offer in dinning and shopping, a truly world class city. Vancouver is a Temperate Rain Forrest so don't come in the Autumn or Winter without a rain jacket and an umbrella.

title: Just Love this place!
reviews: The city centre is so clean and the buildings are beautiful.  There are stores to suit everyone's desire and the transportation is excellent.  Lots of food courts to stop off at for a bite to eat and the walk along the water is beautiful, not to mention the mountains on the North Shore.  What a sight.  Lots to see and enjoy as well as Water Street with the Steam clock, Science World, the library, etc, etc.

title: Walkable!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is very accessible. Due to the population density and smart urban planning (commercial/retail on seem to be occupying the ground level in every building), it's easy to walk to any service / store you might need.

title: Shopping
reviews: A wonderful selection of shopping including great restaurants, boutiques and department stores

title: Great
reviews: We stayed in Downtown best part as there is shopping all around and the shopping is great, and so are the restaurants.

title: Fantastic City
reviews: Fantastic city with great people.  Lots to do during the day and night. Beautiful views.

title: Not a place to be in January
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is easy to move around in, but the weather was rainy, windy and cold. It was drab looking. It is probably very nice in summer. I do not like all the street people asking for change and would feel very uncomfortable if I was alone. I will go back again in summer.

title: Diverse selection of things to do
reviews: Easily accessible via public transport, downtown is full of shops from shopping centers with the usual suspects to designer to niche to unusual. Plenty of places to eat too and don't just stick around the shopping malls as many individual eateries are out there as well as pubs that often serve sandwiches with chips or soup or salad so can be very good value.  Marine building is truly fab with the Sinclair centre a close second. For a quick and cheap coffee then you have to try Tim Hortons.

title: safe downtown area with lots to see & do
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is safe, friendly and very easy to walk.  Shop in the Pacific Center Mall, stroll along Robson Streetor visit the Vancouver Art Gallery.  Stop at one of the many street vendors for a great lunch.  Take a look at the map for more information.http://www.tourismvancouver.com/pdf/2009_vancouver_map.pdf

title: Fun
reviews: There is so much to see and do in the Downtown area of Vancouver, that its hard to know where to start. With so many shops, bars, restaurants and attractions it is definitly worth staying for a few days to try and take as much in as possible.

title: Scotia bank towers
reviews: Loved the life at downtown! The locals are very friendly and approachable...be ready for a long walk and wear comfortable shoes. I liked the Virgin store to shop for music and all old antique store which keeps war memorabilia. Lots to shop ... Also have singers presenting their music on the street which is a great experience.... Very safe for a single girl

title: architecture
reviews: If you make it your business to explore, downtown has a lot to look at. It's safe, and the juxtaposition of the sea, mountains and architecture make for a visual feast.

title: Beautiful and clean city!
reviews: Lots to do and see.  Many things within walking distance.

title: Great city!!!!
reviews: I loved Vancouver!  It was supposed to be a short visit before our skiing trip to Whistler.  And I really felt we could have spent many more days there.  We loved the fact there is water everywhere, and the skycrappers with the mountains in the background looked awsome!!!   There is plenty of good dining venues in the city.

title: Very walkable, lots to see
reviews: DT Vancouver has a very come as you are vibe.  Lots of great eateries and cool architecture such as the Marine Building.

title: Shopping and restaurants and sights, oh my!
reviews: You can find just about anything in Downtown Vancouver. The streets are full of great shops and restaurants, and depending on the area, you will get an amazing view of Grouse Mountain that is picture perfect!

title: Beautiful and Safe downtown
reviews: Blessed by nature beautified by human. Very friendly people. No flashings signs for businesses so you have to slow down and look for them. Well maintained city.

title: Lots to see and do.
reviews: The city is for ever changing and there's lots of shopping, great restaurants with internation food.  Street food carts are safe to eat.  The downtown is all very walkable.

title: Vancouver Downtown lots to do in this city
reviews: Besides shopping, lots of Theatres, and Venues for concerts. There is also a sky-train to access for travel to and from work.

title: Get ready for shop
reviews: Every major city has that one place where all the best and most expensive stores are. Go to Robson Street and you'll find it.But don't just shop... take your time on the fine dinning experiences, coffee houses and museums. You'll fall in love for sure.

title: Friendly people and warm weather
reviews: Although this is a large city with all the benefits that entails, i.e. good shopping, restaurants, cultural attractions, it is surrounded by beautiful nature - ocean and mountains.  People are friendly and laid back.  We always felt safe.  Downside - sad to see so many homeless people.

title: very busy & lively!
reviews: we stayed at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver which was within easy walking distance to the Art Gallery & the ocean.  Although busy, the streets were clean, safe & it was nice just looking around.  we especially enjoyed the various gourmet food trucks that tend to be in the area.

title: Our city centre
reviews: Downtown city centre may seem small compared to same in other major cities but there is a lot to see and do.

title: Truely amazing city.
reviews: We loved downtown Vancouver.  The shops it seems are always open.  The grocery stores amazing.  We always stopped downtown on the way to from our excursions.  Grabbed a snack or meal, always good, did some souvenir shopping.  Just walking the streets all lit up for Christmas was pretty special.  Loved it.

title: World Class
reviews: It's all been said - beautiful, scenic unique. You can skip Gastown unless you like trinkets or are interested in Vancouver's origins. Don't miss Stanley Park, and try the SeaBus for a unique view and mini-cruise.

title: Fun
reviews: Can't bet downtown Vancouver on a summer's day.  Lots to see and do.  Good shopping and restaurants!

title: Vancouver Downtown
reviews: I knew I was gong to remain in Vancouver when I walked up Burrard Street from the CP trains station (now the Seabus & Skytrain stations) and looked back at the mountains and the ocean.  WOW!!!

title: Ordinary
reviews: Vancouver is nothing spectacular as a city as SFO or SEA or SAN or LAX, but it becomes extraordinary when you consider the outdoor activities that abound such as short trip to Grouse Mountain to ski, walk through nature in Capilano Suspension Bridge Park or drive to Whistler.

title: A cool, clean, friendly city
reviews: Vancouver has to be the cleanest city I have ever visited.  We walked and biked all over.   It was easy to get around.  The views around the city are great too.  On top of that, the people were so friendly.  A bit pricey compared to many North American cities, but we had a great time.

title: Beautiful City
reviews: Vancouver is one of the most beautiful cities I have ever seen. It is clean and the There are many things to do and see in the downtown core, from the library to the Granville Street and the art gallery, there's usually something interesting going on.

title: Downtown...
reviews: Restaurants, bars, hotels, shopping, people watching, walk to the beach, mountain and ocean views, very clean, expensive....

title: Shopping, Dining, Entertainment Central
reviews: This is no NYC, London, Hong Kong or Tokyo, but Vancouver downtown has its own charm.  Tonnes of shops for the shopaholics, fancy restaurants for food lovers, and bars/clubs for the nighthawks.  Visitors can easily access the English Bay (gorgeous view & great for people watching/sunbathing in the summer), Stanley Park, Yaletown (tonnes of chic restaurants) the Gastown. Parking, however, can be expensive, especially on weekdays.

title: Breath taking
reviews: LOVED the town. China Town was a bit dirty and scary for a woman and her child, but Yale Town is a MUST visit!! The restuarants and people in that section of town are top notch! They made us feel so welcome and I would go back to that part of town any day!

title: Shopping better on granville
reviews: Robson shopping not so good anymore, the atmosphere downtown is so good. The parking is better to, lower rates and even free parking available. Totally recommend  north granville street for food, shopping and entertainment

title: An Attractive City to Explore
reviews: We enjoyed walking around the streets of Vancouver and seeing all the attractions which are in reasonably close proximity. We did find, however, that after a couple of days we were struggling to find things to do. This was probably due to the fact that we had already been on an extensive city tour and had already seen the main attractions on this. However, we found it easy to find our way around and the city is clean and safe on the whole.

title: In love with Vancouver
reviews: Beautiful place, friendly people, great shops, amazing restaurants, everything easy to get to on buses, ferried or trains

title: The Best City to live in, in the World
reviews: There is a reason Vancouver is constantly rated as the best place to live. Great restaurants, mountains that run right down to the sea, very walkable and very safe. Ethnic neighbourhoods and trendy areas run into each other and the downtown has all the shopping, culture and great food for all budgets.In late May you can ski in the morning and swim in the ocean on the same day. Ride the gondola up Grouse mountain and enjoy the amazing views then head down to the beach to walk the seawall in West Van or go across the Golden Gate Bridge and walk the Stanley Park seawall and then enjoy a lunch at many of the small bistros in the West End. It rains but that just keeps the air and the city clean. Best weather is May to October, come and enjoy!!

title: how much?
reviews: The aquarium has cool exhibits, but is very expensive & crowded.

title: Lots of different distinct areas to explore.
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has various different areas to explore which all have a different feel.  There's the usual shopping strip with all the posh stores, there's a famous beach area, there's the hip Gastown area and various other locations to explore.  As with any other downtown core in a large city, it has all the restaurants, bars, clubs and businesses you could possibly want.  Unfortunately, there isn't really one must see attraction in downtown Vancouver like in some other large cities, but the city is yours to explore.

title: pokiegellong
reviews: wow i love vancouver...the shops the coffee places...the people...two starbucks on one intersection!!!then there is the waterfront...visit Gas Town for the shopping and food...

title: Easy to get around
reviews: Downtown Vancouver has some great shops along Robson Street as well as the underground shopping mall.  It's easy to shop on a rainy winter night in the underground mall.  The main shopping district is within a few blocks so it's easy to get around and see it all.

title: Beautiful
reviews: Lots of shopping and interesting things to see and do Downtown. Downtown Vancouver is big and bustling but is laid back and relaxed at the same time. You can even see the gorgeous mountains as you walk along the clean streets of downtown Vancouver. I enjoy every time I visit

title: Beautiful Vancouver
reviews: Clean, Easy to get around, many eating places for various tastes.  Robson Street is a great walking street.Lots of great shopping.  Many Coffee shops.  Lots to see.  Some people compare Vancouver to San Francisco or Cape Town.

title: OK - a bit touristy
reviews: Enjoyable but a bit on the tousity side.  Parking is expensive.  On teh plus side, there are some great eateries and art galleries; as well as some selling more of the craft tems.

title: Vancouver Rocks
reviews: Vancouver is a wonderful city with fabulous views and a full diversity of action, clubs, diners, cafes and shops for all ethnic groups.

title: XMAS WITH ALL THE TRIMMINGS
reviews: Decided to take a winter holiday and walk the streets of Vancouver at night, during Xmas.  This was a fantastic idea, and because it is dark here by 4 pm you don't have to be on the streets late at night to enjoy all the Xmas lighting.  It was crowded but very enjoyable.  We always take an umbrella when we are in Vancouver in winter but this year didn't use it - a Bonus

title: A BOTANICAL GARDEN PAR EXCELLENCE
reviews: A wide variety of plants from around the world, excellent cafe and, during the run up to Christmas when I was there, the most beautiful lights.   Well worth a visit at any time of year.    Easy to get to by public transport.

title: Clean and Safe
reviews: Much nicer and safer to walk around downtown than Seattle, There isn't really any special architecture or anything interesting really, just a nice place to walk around.

title: Vibrant, eclectic, alive
reviews: I always get a buzz when I'm downtown in Vancouver.  The streets are alive from morning to well into the wee hours with an eclectic mix of people- all ages, all stations and socio-economic standing.  The mix of shops, restaurants, residences, and offices makes for this exciting mix.  You can get any kind of food, any kind of shopping.  Bike friendly and pedestrian friendly but if you can't don't bring your car.  Although there is lots of parking, moving about in a car can be frustrating.

title: Very clean and modern city.
reviews: For a large I did not see a homeless person or anyone panhandling. The city is amazing clean. Modern and Old World combined to make this city a top 10 city. Lost's of charm and warmth. Walking distance to shopping area's, historic sites, great little tucked away cafe's. I was in Vancouver for 8 days and I did not see a single police car or hear sirens from police or other safety departments. I was lucky with the weather, the day I arrived it rained and after that it was sunny for the rest of my stay. I want to come back and visit in the summer, I can not wait!!!

title: Very walkable!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is one of the best downtowns in any city in North America. Unlike other cities, where everybody goes home after 5pm - over 150,000 people call downtown Vancouver home. This means that there are tons of restaurants, cafes, nightspots, shops and other interesting things to explore. The downtown core is located on a peninsula, and from the middle of downtown - it's about a 20-25 minute walk to the outer reaches of the peninsula. Also, you can walk the entire perimeter of downtown, from Canada Place to Science World - along the seawall!!

title: Traffic is terrible
reviews: The parking is extortionate and the shops ho hum. Some good restaurants, check out the art gallery

title: Lovely place for shopping!!!!
reviews: 1000000000 likes!!!!!!!! best place for shopping. a huge variety of shops, restaurants!!! Robson Street is the main shopping street.... enjoyed it. would go back again!!!!

title: Loved it!
reviews: Downtown Vancouver is so alive! We stayed in a hotel downtown (the Hyatt) and every night as we ventured out to find dinner and entertainment we were amazed at how many people were out and about. There is also a ton to do and everything is so close! Bring a good pair of walking shoes and you will almost never have to take a cab.

title: Easy to Get around
reviews: If you are like us, and come from NYC - you will find Vancouver a breeze to get around. The city is very nice and super clean. Just an overall great experience.

title: Pretty darn good
reviews: lost of stuff to do, there were fountains and cool innovative decorations all over.  The only downer was there seemed to be a lot of homeless people.  Other than that great downtown area

title: Great shopping
reviews: Easy to get to with good transit service. Sales are everywhere but go early as the crowds tend to get big

title: Even on Sunday
reviews: Downtowns are generally not  a good choice for a traveler. Not the case in Vancouver. It is beautiful. Even on Sundays when they are generally desert and even dangerous. Downtown Vancouver is great. Not to miss.

title: Shopping, Shopping and more shopping!
reviews: Make sure to hit Robson St. for great shopping and dinning.

title: Alittle disappointed
reviews: Thought there would be more boutique-type shopping.

title: This is the heart of the city
reviews: Stroll up and down Robsen street for several miles from the Bay, past the restaurants, pubs, shops and multitude of coffee shops,  trendy stores, restaurants with food from every nation,  Nice cars drive up and down and this is a great area to peole watch, shop and enjoy the best and biggest selection of coffee houses in a three mile radius.

title: Thoroughly modern
reviews: Vancouver is such a beautiful city nestled among the mountains, English Bay and the Burrard inlet. The downtown is very modern, with lovely restaurants, major retail shopping as well as small entrepeneurial establishments. Public transit including very clean electric buses, taxis and rental cars are available, Vancouver has a major financial district. Don't forget to visit the downtown Vancouver yacht club beside Marinaside Cres., and make arrangements for tickets to see the Vancouver canucks NHL team play at GM Place or the B.C. Lions play football at the B.C. Place Stadium.

title: So much to see
reviews: You can spend a few days just walking around downtown. Robson, Granville, Denman, Broadway, are some of the more popular streets for shopping and restaurants.

title: Festive and lots of good deals to be had
reviews: We were lucky enough to get to some of the big stores and the sales were great.  They had their Christmas decorations up so it added to the experience.

title: The jay walkers all got cars
reviews: Vancouver used to be the jay-walk capitol of the world, but not any more. Unfortunately, the jay-walking idiots have been replaced by idiots that drive in this logging town like from they are in NJ or LA. Cars are a pain anyway, and with all the smoke-free areas its much easier sometimes to just walk or hop the skytrain subway system. The skytrain connects all kinds of places, and my favorites are the stops heading into Vancouver beginning with Chinatown to the end of the line at Waterfront. There are nice shopping malls there connected to the skytrain stations, making for effortless transportation (minus the week day, mid-day flakes that is). From waterfront you can catch the Sea Bus ferry to North Vancouver, which is great because the shopping there us fun, too. You can also walk the waterfront itself through smoke-free parks all the way to Stanley park.

title: Average
reviews: Your typical downtown.  If you like walking and amazing views - canada place and waterfront area are just a short walk.

title: One of the most beautiful cities of the world!
reviews: Vancouver, Cape Town and Rio are my favorites cities! But Vancouver is the safest one! Although the ethnicity of the people has changed during the past few years it still have the North American-British heritage and flavor. Excellent shopping (look for good bargains as prices change from shop to shop) Incredible variety of excellent and reasonably priced Restaurants (not a good city if you are in a diet!) ocean, mountains, great views and very friendly people. It is  considered one of the best cities to live in, and it is! Very clean, and you, as a visitor should keep it that way and very safe. Down town is lots of fun at all times although after 2 AM it gets a bit noisy as bars come to a close. Best to start heading home around midnight....ots of attractions in an already attractive place! Respect and Enjoy!

title: So much to see
reviews: Such an interesting City! Did a hop on hop off bus tour (buy one day ticket get next day free) which meant you didn't have to rush and try to see everything in one day.  The views are stunning from many places especially from Canada Place and Prospect point, if you like heights go up to the top of the Revolving Tower, you will not be disappointed! There are shopping malls, many restaurants, Chinatown is so colourful and vibrant, Gastown with the steam clock, everyone is helpful, patient and friendly and you never feel hurried or rushed as you travel from place to place.

title: So Simple!
reviews: We stayed at the Coast Coal harbour hotel, and the downtown area extremely easy to get around.  I especially noticed the lights seem to be synced with my walking pace.  Almost impossible to get lost as the island is only so big!  Nicer when its not raining!

title: great shopping
reviews: Loved the ease of travel ,lots of shops on Busy Robson street, loads to take in and see ,so many things around town to find ,jump on a tourism bus and everything is pointed out in detail as well as lots of candid humor along the way.

title: Nice hotel - Parking fees too high
reviews: Great shopping options, theatres, churches and the waterfront.

title: Wow
reviews: Young, vibrant, busy, interesting, stimulating.  The place to stay in Vancouver for the "stop over" traveller.  Everything easily at hand.  Good eating, shops, water front, Stanley park, Granville Market. Coionections for Vancouver uisland and the Rocky Mountaineer.

title: Always fun.
reviews: Always fun to walk about downtown Vancouver. Go see the Olympic cauldron up close.

title: Wonderful city
reviews: Vancouver is a wonderful city full of diversity not only in its people, but also in their abundance of restaurants!  The shopping is great and it's a wonderful city to walk and see the sights.

title: great downtown
reviews: Very nice views of the olympic torch and the harbour. The convention center is beautiful at night  there is alot of stuff to do I recommend the Vapor Lounge on West Hastings Street very friendly people in there it was a blast

title: Cosmo
reviews: Very international feeling, and very urban.  Nothing compares on the west coast other than SF.  So many cultures and accents, well thought out high-density living, a true pleasure to live, shop and enjoy.

title: plenty of shops
reviews: Lots and lots of excellent shopping. Blenz hot chocolate is just the best. Lots of walking to be done and take a brolly!

title: Get city spirit as Vancouver long-time residents ..
reviews: Get city spirit as Vancouver long-time residents ..We can get surprised by unknown beautiful streets , facades and great restaurants , just avoid go at nigth can be dangerus

title: what a beautiful city
reviews: My daughter and I took one day and walked all over Vancouver. We started at the Look out, lunched at Steamworks brewery, shopped in Gastown and visited China town. It is physically beautiful, easy to get around but the people begging are quite aggressive. I understand that drugs have become a real problem there. I had one beggar not just ask for money but demand it, twice hours apart and on two different streets. We did not stay after dark because we were uncomfortable.

title: Yale Hotel
reviews: We found the Yale Hotel before we left Australia.  It is the home to R & B and other music in Vancouver.  We walked from our Hotel for a great night of music which happened to be a Bob Marley tribute night.  Amazing seeing we were all the way from Aus and Bob Marley was the music we danced to when we met 32 years ago!

title: The action of the city
reviews: great place to come to have fun for the day... you will never get bored.. Also the trees and nature is a sure thing u cant beat!!

title: A pleasant city
reviews: Vancouver has a lot to offer any visitor with its numerous attractions, good shopping and restaurants.  The fact that so many things are within walking distance of each other add to the enjoyment of being a visitor.

title: Beautiful Urb
reviews: One of the most beautiful downtowns I,ve been to. No smog or less smog, Clean and safe streets and surrounded by water, very Green and scenic too. People are very friendly and helpfull.

title: Weekend Run
reviews: We always enjoy our visit into the west end on the weekends to walk on the seawall and stop in for dinner. There's something for everyone whether it's an attraction, food, or just walking around and window shopping.

title: I like it
reviews: Very nice downtown...organized and clean...you will see more than 160 Starbucks in downtown...keep away from hasting street specially when it is dark.

title: Center of Vancouver with a lot of attractions
reviews: It seems like as a centre  with a cross roads there are another big shopping and fast food area under ground with Skytrain. /There are two big shop Hudson Bay and Sears that you can buy everything.  For weekends Granville street closes for vehicles and lots of attraction starts Friday afternoon (like as Street concert, Tango nights, Salsa or any kind of musical entertaiments on this street). Robson Street is famous with shops, Alberni Street with nice luxuorius restaurants. You should watch youtube videos from downtown attractions

title: Nice
reviews: Nice and new town. Yaletown is a must go area!!! Good restaurants there too!

title: Must visit
reviews: Good to see the old place and take in the history of Vancouver. The old Steam clock is magic and the cobbled streets lend an air of old Englishness to the area. The Spaghetti House restaurant is brilliant and great value for money . We went twice and the old train carriage inside is a great  dining expereince..

title: SkyTrain ticket
reviews: The city is compact and you can more or less walk all over and use buses/skytrain  as well. The skytrain ticket is valid for 90minutes and can be used on all buses as well.

title: china town
reviews: wandered china town, had dim sum for lunch.  ended up walking gastown then robson street before heading back to our car and going home.  wonderful day !

title: A shoppers delight.
reviews: You will find all of the international stores. Do'nt miss "The Bay".It is the Hudson Bay store and their prices and quality are excellent. Try their restaurant on the top floor, you will get a nice suprise.

title: Good to look around
reviews: Be careful of the time you choose to visit. Avoid early mornings, rush hours and late nights. Best time is between 3 - 6 pm. Visit Granville island and take the ferry to downtown. Walk from Howe to Pender, meandering across. The fun is between Pender and Georgia. Shop at the Pacific center mall...good deals.

title: A delightful, fascinating area well worth exploring
reviews: A strangly satisfying mixture of old-fashioned cobbled streets and modern skyscrapers, this is a good shopping area of speciality shops, fashion stores, eateries and tourist malls. Dominated by the impressive Pacific Centre on the Waterfont and by The Bay store, the famous but small Steam Clock in Water Street attracts more than its fair share of tourists.People-watching can be good fun in this busy cosmopolitan area.

title: Gem of the Pacific Northwest
reviews: I have picked up Canada as part of my geographic responsibility at work. I have only been to Vancouver for business, but thought it interesting enough to have my wife fly up and meet me for a weekend getaway.Wow! Downtown Vancouver is spectacular! I do NOT like to shop, but my wife does. That said, I truly had a blast walking up and down the streets of downtown. It's a bit touristy, but feels cleaner than Seattle or San Fran. Fun and laid back. Lots of great bars, pubs, restaurants. From Gas Town, China Town, Yale Town, there is more to see and do than a weekend will allow. Add Stanley Park, Sea to Sky Highway, and Victoria Island, and one could easily spend a weeks vacation here and not get bored or see the same thing twice. We will be back, with the kids, soon!

title: A shopping paradise
reviews: In downtown Vancouver, almost everything is within a walking distance. Or if you don't like to walk, it is worth to talk the Big bus. There is plenty of stores and restaurants of every kind.

title: Wonderful Walking City
reviews: If it is not raining, Vancouver is a great walkers‚Äô city, and I love taking the time to look around me and, most importantly, up at the varying modern urban architecture. The whole city centre is walkable, and I wandered the streets at length, all the way down to Stanley Park. There, I rented a bike and cycled counter clockwise around Stanley Park. In the other direction, I wandered into Gastown then Chinatown and eventually into the most dubious part of town, along Hastings Street where hundreds of homeless people congregate. In the city centre, there are literally hundreds of eating possibilities, and some excellent sushi cafes. Lunch specials can be a real bargain, especially in more upmarket places. At no point did I feel in danger, though. For venturing further afield, the bus and underground rail system is surprisingly European-like, and user-friendly. The best way is to buy a book of 10 tickets, which gives a significant discount.

title: Check out Gastown downtown - both charming and beautiful
reviews: I really enjoyed my stay in downtown Vancouver. We stayed in a hotel right in the heart of downtown, which gave us the perfect opportunity to walk to Stanley Park as well as visit the different locations in the city. Gastown was my favorite! The cobblestone streets and historic buildings made it my favorite place in downtown Vancouver. Steamworks Brewing Co. was the perfect place to enjoy a cold beer after spending the day on our feet.

title: walkers dream but wear a raincoat
reviews: You can walk everywhere in D/T vanouver.  It is generally flat and the street run in an easy grid formation.  Start on Denman, make your way East into Chinatown.  Shopping is all over, not just on Robson and Granville and often there are little pockets of stores built into old character homes.  Get off of the main drags and wander.  There are no seriously unsafe places, you may feel uncomferatble but even on Main and Hastings you are as safe as Granville and Robson.  Some of the neatest stores are in the "rougher" areas, don't be scared off, they aren't really that rough at all.   Keep your head up and just keep walking if someone bothers you.  Make sure that you have a rain jacket though, the weather can turn on a dime and the only sure way to tell a tourist is if they have an umbrella.  The locals opt for gortex and a hood!

title: your ads for canadian tourism are baffling
reviews: The ads for canadian tourism are both baffling, because one doesn't know what you are trying to say. Also they seem a little juvenile. Perhaps a little more substance would be in order. Margaret Kemp
